By 2030 , senior citizens will comprise about 19% of the Singapore population .
In view of this , the Singapore government has been actively engaged in formulating elderly-friendly policies .
It is even more vital for a small city-state like Singapore , to deal with its ageing society because the consequences of not taking into account the ageing population could bring several adverse implications on the country .
For instance , the demand for welfare benefits and healthcare subsidies will rise as the population ages .
The problems that come with the ageing process can be resolved by implementing targeted policies for the elderly .
Hence , to prevent the ageing process from becoming a burden on the country , it will require policy treatments to cushion the adverse impact of the demands of an ageing population .
With an effective government leading the way , Singapore has made much headway dealing with an ageing population .
Singapore's HDB has been making our public housing estates more elderly-friendly through initiatives like the Lift Upgrading Programme and Home Ownership Scheme .
The Home Ownership Policy ensures that Singaporeans have something set aside for their old age .
First , HDB has introduced studio apartments with a shorter lease of 30 years .
Elderly homeowners can sell their flats and move into a more affordable studio apartment .
Secondly , it has also introduced a Lease Buyback Scheme .
Under this scheme , HDB will buy back the tail end of the lease on the flat and leave the elderly homeowner with a short lease of 30 years on the same flat .
This means that the elderly can continue to stay in their flat without having to move out .
Additionally , they will receive a lump-sum payout as well as a monthly payment in the form of a lifelong annuity .
The schemes offered by HDB have certainly helped to ensure that the elderly in Singapore can continue to provide for themselves in their old age .
In the area of healthcare , Singapore has maintained a high level of quality and accessibility for every Singaporean .
In addition to granting government subsidies , individuals are also expected to shoulder a portion of their own healthcare costs .
They have put in place the highly effective 3Ms framework - which refers to Medisave , Medishield and Medifund - which is Singapore's healthcare financing approach .
Over the years , various policy changes have further been made to improve the existing system .
The changes have also included the extension of Medisave to cover more outpatient treatments and the enhancement of Medishield to improve the payout for larger hospital bills .
These healthcare policies will ensure that the elderly will be adequately self-sufficient in their golden years .
Even in the face of success , it is important to periodically review the economic and social impact of housing and healthcare policies .
Our public housing policies will have to adapt and respond to the changing needs and aspirations of Singaporeans .
With the rising standard of living , the housing needs in Singapore will change as well .
Pressures to spend on healthcare will also rise with an ageing population .
Public request for subsidies to cover the latest medical treatments , the improvement of service quality , and the reduction of fees for subsidized specialist consultants are becoming more common .
With such pressures , the need to prevent healthcare costs from escalating remains a key challenge .
All in all , Singapore has been largely successful in accommodating the rising proportion of elderly in its society .
By providing support in the areas of housing and healthcare , the country has prepared well for the ageing process .
In the area of healthcare , Singapore has maintained a high level of quality and accessibility for every Singaporean .
In addition to granting government subsidies , individuals are also expected to shoulder a portion of their own healthcare costs .
They have put in place the highly effective 3Ms framework - which refers to Medisave , Medishield and Medifund - which is Singapore's healthcare financing approach .
Over the years , various policy changes have further been made to improve the existing system .
This has shown that the government is committed to address the needs of an ageing population in its policies .
The changes have also included the extension of Medisave to cover more outpatient treatments and the enhancement of Medishield to improve the payout for larger hospital bills .
Even though the policy frameworks to contain rising costs and to raise effectiveness are already in place , future policy amendments will still be needed as the society evolves .
These healthcare policies will ensure that the elderly will be adequately self-sufficient in their golden years .
Even in the face of success , it is important to periodically review the economic and social impact of housing and healthcare policies , as they will remain the key concerns in Singaporeans' lives .
Our public housing policies will have to adapt and respond to the changing needs and aspirations of Singaporeans .
With the rising standard of living , the housing needs in Singapore will change as well .
HDB will also have to do rigorous planning on its housing policies .
As Singapore has limited land constraints , it will have to think of ways to increase land usability and rejuvenate the old estates .
Pressures to spend on healthcare will also rise with an ageing population .
Public request for subsidies to cover the latest medical treatments , the improvement of service quality , and the reduction of fees for subsidized specialist consultants are becoming more common .
With such pressures , the need to prevent healthcare costs from escalating remains a key challenge .
Policy makers will have to ensure that the best feasible outcome is achieved .
All in all , Singapore has been largely successful in accommodating the rising proportion of elderly in its society .
By providing support in the areas of housing and healthcare , the country has prepared well for the ageing process .
To conclude , Singapore has constantly adapted and adopted policy reforms to ease the impact of its growing number of senior citizens .
More importantly , the country has also ensured the well-being of its citizens .

By 2030 , senior citizens will comprise about 19% of the Singapore population .
As a result of that , the Singapore government has been actively engaged in formulating elderly-friendly policies .
It is important that the needs of the elderly are factored into policy formulation as the demand for welfare benefits and healthcare subsidies will rise as the population ages .

"To a large extent , current research and development or policies have helped to ease the aging process ."
I strongly agree with this agreement .
Nowadays , lots of researchers and developments have been carried out and many policies have been implemented in order to ease the aging process .
The three main policies that I will be discussing are filial obligation , later retirement and government subsidies .
Firstly , the main problem of aging population is that the children do not want to take care of their parents when they are old , because they think that parents are troubles for them , since they are old and unable to contribute .
One of the methods to resolve this problem may be through legislation .
For example , the Singapore government has implemented the Maintenance of Parents Act since 1996 , and a Tribunal for the Maintenance of Parents has been established .
Under this act , parents who are above age of 60 and are unable to support themselves can claim maintenance from children .
Children who are failed to do so may be fined up to $5000 or jailed up to 6 months .
According to the statistics made by a government organization , in the first 3 years that this act was implemented , 400 parents sought for aid under this act .
Some may argue that filial obligation should be by their own will and shall not restricted by law .
But , if the children are still failed to do so after much education , legislation will be a must in solving this problem .
If children are bounded by such filial obligation , they will then take care of their own parents , and hence , the elderly dependency on government subsidies or the public may be reduced .
Secondly , some of the senior citizen who do not have any children will have no support at all .
Thus , it is crucial that they have their own jobs , own income , in order to support themselves .
As a result , later retirement is encouraged by government from many countries .
After retirement , elderly always stay at home and have less activities .
Eventually , they will become weaker , more forgetful , slower in reaction and less agile .
Not only that , the biggest problem is they will have no income to support themselves .
Hence , later retirement will be a good option for them .
The reason is , with a job , the aged can keep themselves busy and do more thinking in order to complete their work .
So , it keeps them healthy .
At the same time , they may have stable income to support themselves .
For example , the Singapore government has extended the retirement age of Singaporeans from 60 to 62 , and at the same time , provides them with trainings and courses , such as the Ling Kwang Home and Seniors@eCitizen , in order to meet the requirements of the employers .
Some may argue that later retirement is too burdening for elderly , but it is actually optional for them , depending on their own abilities and desire .
In short , later retirement can help the elderly to accumulate more wealth to support themselves , maintain healthy bodies and find new purpose of life so that they are less dependent on the others .
Lastly , it is undeniable that , some of the elderly have no children , and they are unable to work , especially those who are too old or uneducated .
Hence , the government and the public will play an important role in order to curb this problem .
For example , the Singapore government has implemented lots of policies and provided much subsidies to help those elderly .
One of the subsidies will be Home Medical and Home Nursing Subsidy provided by the Ministry of Health  .
MOH targets to fund 50% of the elderly population requiring home care services .
With the subsidy , the elderly can stay in their own houses as they do not have to stay in hospitals .
As a result , the lonely elderly can also stay healthy in a community .

Old age has been always been associated with poor health and loneliness as people reached the final journey of their life .
The aging process is exacerbate when children abandoned their parents as they feel that the old ones are a burden to them .
This is evident by the increasingly number of old people being send to old folks home every year .
In the past , such cases were lesser as abandoning of parents is seen as a social stigma , an unfilial act .
Despite this , current research , development and policies have helped to ease the aging process to a great extent .
Unprecedented advances in technology resulted from extensive research and implementation of different creative policies have make the process of aging more pleasurable .
This could be in the form of less illness associated with old age and more activities available for older ones to participate in .
Firstly , in the medical arena , huge amounts of money has been poured in for research and development .
This is without waste , as much cures have been found .
Previously incurable diseases such as tubercolosis can be eradicated and this leads to an increase in life span and higher quality of life .
People in old age can receive better medical attention .
With a healthier body , the aged can enjoy their later years .
Secondly government policies reforms have impact the lives of the aged positively .
One of them is the introduction of subsidies .
Old people tend to have little or no savings .
Hence to be entitled to subsidies greatly increase their welfare .
Furthermore more and more countries are compelled by the law to set aside certain amount of money for their old age .
In Singapore , a certain portion of working population income is set aside in their Central Provident Fund in which the money can only be taken out at aged 55 or later .
With more savings the old ones can provide for themselves and have more to spend for themselves instead of relying on the small sums pay out by the government .
Another government policy that comes to mind that benefits the aged is the increment of the retirement age .
This is to encourage more people to work longer and reduce the dependency of old people on the government .
Other than the economic benefits , old people can involve themselves in their work and research have shown that working do reduce of risk of getting illness associated with old age such as Alzheimer's disease .
Thirdly , developments in infrastructure have resulted in more communities centre built .
There are many activities ongoing in these communities centre which is open to anyone interested .
Old people are encourage to participate in these activites as it not only allow them to fill their time with activities they are passionate about but also expose them to opportunities to mix with a variety of people .
Such activities could include singing competition , karaoke , dancing and mind games .
These activities makes the aging process more fulfilling and engaging .
As countries get more developed , its citizens are more affluent and trends and culture changes .
More and more people are forsaking their parents in old folks homes as they could afford to .
Old people in old folks homes may have to deal with loneliness and the harsh fact that their own children whom they have brought up , have abandoned them .
The 'loss' of the company of their loved ones may be difficult for them to accept and they may end up not enjoying the rest of their life .
To conclude , advancement in technology , breakthroughs in medical research and various government policies have contributed to the aging process where the aged can have better , quality and pleasurable time completing their last journey of their life .
However to a small extent in certain cases where development has causes a weakness in the extended family .
'Aging' is a natural process of human life-cycle , whereby one grows older and gains his wisdom to the fullest before he departs from Earth .
However , with the increase in this group of 'intellectual' people , our world is turning grayer than before .
According to Gavrilov and Heuveline  , population aging is expected to be among the most prominent global demographic trends of the 21st century .
It is characterized by the decline of the fertility rates as well as the rise of life expectancies worldwide .
As such , this intensifying phenomenon creates a huge economic impact on numerous countries across the globe , which presents challenges on the allocation of fiscal budget to mitigate rising healthcare costs as well as other areas .
Therefore , given the budget constraint of each country , it is crucial for the government to maximize its resources effectively to have a well-balanced development of other areas .
With the growth of aging population , public spending on healthcare costs will be exorbitant .
Each working individual will have to contribute more taxes due to the decline of economically-productive people .
Nevertheless , it is important for the government to implement feasible policies to assist the aging population .
Measures to ease the aging process include architecture upgrades and restructuring of healthcare system .
The first measure consists of building innovative features like small bumps on the ground to lead the visually-impaired .
In addition to escalators , lifts are constructed at train stations to allow the wheelchair-bound to traverse between different levels .
The latter consists of building more community hospitals for the elderly as well as extending the services of community hospitals to homes to save costs  .
However , government should also ascertain the limit of healthcare finances based on individual's capability .
On the other hand , cutting of elderly welfare finances may increase the financial burden of the family members .
Therefore , it is essential for the government to focus its resources on developing various areas , especially on those that are important to the sovereign interests like defense , education and economy .
A nation military spending always takes up a substantial proportion of its fiscal budget due to the importance of having a strong defense force to defend itself against aggressors should diplomatic negotiations failed .
For example , the proliferation of nuclear weapons by North Korea has sparked off a regional arm race , causing neighboring countries like South Korea to purchase more sophisticated weaponry from America .
In addition , since the '911' incident , the world has came to see the threat of terrorism as very real .
Terrorists are able to conduct their operations anywhere around the globe due to their extensive network of terror cells worldwide .
Given the rapid technological advancement today , conflicts between countries can also exist in 'virtual' form like hacking into sensitive websites to disrupt the country's economic activities .
Therefore , it is inevitable for countries to increase more of their military budget to upgrade their defensive capabilities against various sophisticated forms of external threats .
Education is the key to sustain economic livelihood .
A proper educational structure will nurture more knowledgeable and capable people in the future to run the country .
Educated people will also be more inclined to be independent and make financial planning for themselves during their economically-active years .
They will also have better quality of life when they grow older due to their healthy lifestyles .
Therefore , this would incur lesser healthcare costs as they remain fit and productive in their golden years .
A nation's economy is the main source of country's income as it is an indicator of a country's wealth .
People living in well-developed countries have high standard of living due to their affluence brought about by the stable economy .
As a result , they remain fit and robust despite the rise in their life expectancies .
This also means that lesser healthcare spending is required to sustain these affluence groups of elderly .
The lower-income group will also benefit from a well-developed economy as higher economic growth enables government to provide more healthcare finances to support the elderly .
This would thus reduce the financial burden of these group of people based on their income ceilings .
Despite the volatility of the country's economy due to the global market , it is imperative for government to implement feasible economic policies to facilitate trade and growth .
Therefore , having a sturdy economy will also incur lesser financial costs on elderly welfare .
In retrospect , countries around the world face challenges with global aging .
Governments need to strike a delicate balance in allocating scarce resources to develop other crucial areas as they are indirectly related to healthcare costs incurred by the aged .
Likewise , they need to forecast future demographic trends and be flexible in changing and implementing new fiscal measures to deal with the graying population .
Aging is no doubt , one of the most pressing issues that many developed countries are facing today .
Japan and Singapore have been battling the aging society for many years where the birth rates are at depressing levels and better healthcare facilities are available .
Because of this aging process , there is a need for research and development to come out with ideas to counteract it .
Thus , to a large extent , I agree that current research and development is the solution to this aging process .
The process can be eased through economical , social and architectural means .
Firstly , through economical means , elderly people are becoming increasingly part of the working community , working past retirement age .
Singapore for example has a minimum retirement age of 62 years .
Elderly people can continuously upgrade themselves through job retraining to acquire relevant skills required for the job .
There are subsidies from government to employers to send workers aged 40 and above to upgrade their skills .
An example is SDF course fee subsidy of up to 90% for workers aged above 40 with 'A' levels and below qualifications .
However , critics may argue that employers may hire younger workers due to their lower wages and higher working efficiency as compared to the older workers .
This is not always the case as companies are less likely to waste time and effort to train the newcomers over a period and may not have the satisfied results at the end of the training .
Instead , they may want to retain the more experienced and skilled older workers to maintain a consistent working standard .
As for wages , people aged above 50 will contribute lesser to their CPF accounts and this includes the employer's CPF contribution .
This will in turn lighten the cost of employing older workers and the company would prefer to hire the more experienced older workers over the less experienced younger workers .
Thus , economically , elderly people will be able to work longer and be more independent by supporting themselves for their retirement .

Secondly , through social policy , there are increasing entertainment activities to keep the elderly personnel occupied .
To cope with the increasing loneliness in elderly people , there are activities that can bond the elders together and engage them in fun-learning and enriching activities according to their interests .
Take for example , the Wellness Programme in Singapore provides companionship with the other seniors through activities like brisk walking , dancing , gardening or cycling .
However , not all elderly people are willing to participate in such events .
Although there are a lot of activities set up for elderly people , it is optimally up to them to decide whether or not to join the activities .
We cannot force but encourage them to take up the relevant activities that may interest them .
They should also make an effort to keep a healthy lifestyle .
Take for example , in China , it is common to see many elderly people practising Taiji in the morning in public parks and dancing along the streets at night .
It is thus important to maintain a healthy , yet entertaining lifestyle especially at an old age .
Last but not least , through architectural means , there are many infrastructure and facilities put in place for the convenience of the elderly .
For the safety of the elderly , ramps and slip resistant footpaths are being set up in residential estates .
An example would be at Macpherson Gardens in Singapore where such features are being put in place , creating an elderly-friendly estate .
The flats built in the past in Singapore were not accessible at every floor as the lifts are built in a way where they stop only at specific levels .
Today , to improve the convenience of the residents , especially the elderly , upgrading works are being carried out at various locations , ensuring that lifts will stop at every level .
All these upgrading works are carried out to ensure that the place is made suitable for the elderly to live in .
In conclusion , as many developed countries are facing a fast aging population , proper research and development have to be carried out in order to ease the aging process .
Through economical , social and architectural means , we are thinking ahead for the future and creating an elderly- friendly environment for the elderly people to live in .

Nowadays , our society is highly concern about the impact of aging process on our lives .
In order to be a valid candidate for an explanation of the aging process , the changes proposed by the theory must meet the following criteria: they will commonly occur in all or most humans as an individual ages , these changes will become more pronounced and the changes will lead to cellular or organ dysfunction that ultimately cause failure of the organ or system  .
Although aging process has arisen many problems in our lives , current science research and social policies have helped to solve these problems .
As the lifecycle of human beings is irreversible , human life expectancy is heavily depends on the rate of aging .
However , lots of money and efforts have been put in by governments , some companies and scientists worldwide to do the research in aging in order to slow down the aging process and also help to resolve some health problems that are caused by aging .
For example , there are scientists who have created fruit flies that are able to live of their normal life spans and thus have made old human cells behave like youth human cells again .
This research is possible to let us living in a longer time and leading to a healthier life in our old age .
As a result , degenerative diseases of old age such as arthritis , diabetes and hypertension can be solved and thus help to ease the aging process .
Back in the old days , human longevity is comparably shorter than today's .
It is because that the invention of medicine has helped human beings to sustain a longer life .
As we know , human cells tend to become unable to regenerate when we reach our old age and this will lead to the failure of organs such as kidneys , livers and hearts .
The only way to cure these diseases is undergoing transplantation .
As the growing aging population has increased the need of organs , it is hard to get enough needed organs for the transplantation .
In this case , artificial organs can help to bridge the time to transplantation and thus improve the survival of patients while they are waiting for transplantation .
Therefore , we should appreciate the hard work of scientists in the lab and medical center since it has improved our old age lives in many aspects .
Other than the medical breakthroughs , social policies for the elderly are also playing important roles to ease the aging process .
For instance , there are social policies such as introducing advanced insurance scheme that encourages young people start saving more to be financially secure in their old age .
Many countries have made individual retirement fund mandatory and hence successfully increase the number of nations who are able to support themselves in their old age .
Besides , some social welfare programs especially those which help to resolve the aging problems , including provide financially help to needed elderly are under way .
These programs protect those underprivileged elderly from starving for food or homeless .
At the same time , some social societies have organized lots of activities for elderly to enjoy their lives and help them refrain from getting mental illness such as depression as they will feel they are worthless and also some of them may lose their partners .
These activities have provided a place for them to socialize with other , get friends , and do exercise as well .
So , these social policies have brought a happy , healthy , safe and comfortable life to the elderly .
In conclusion , our society should pay high attention to the aging problems and come out with solutions .
We are unable to reverse the time but in average we can live in a healthier lifestyle and longer time compare with our ancestors since current research and policies are practical in solving some of aging problems .
Apart from that , there are also many studies in different aspect such as architecture and psychology that are helpful to the elderly .
As the time passed , everybody will eventually become older and so we should prepare for it from now on .

For the past few years , the issue of aging population has been debated widely across the globe as it took our world by storm .
As our economy develops , the sign of aging population worsen .
Facts of such can be seen in developed countries like Germany and Japan , where the median age of citizen in the country is pushing towards 53 and 54 respectively  .
As an older population will directly result in lower productivity and higher social and welfare cost in a nation , many sociologist of today are attending and bringing forth strategies , hoping that the issue of elder dependency will be taken care of without threatening a nation's economy .
While majority of the solutions were revolving around increasing public spending on the aged , many think that such proposal is not viable and well balanced , as the economic aspect of a country has not been taken into account .
People at this opposing end , on the other hand , believe that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development , indirectly solving the aging matter effectively .
In the midst of such controversy , I personally agree that the problem of elder dependency will be better taken care of if a nation limits its spending on the elderly .
For the first reason of my standpoint , it is believed that the root of the elder dependency problem can only be solved if the country invests in other specific areas that would indirectly relief the situation .
By spending directly on the aged , the government is only trying to deal with the consequences and not the source of the problem .
On the other hand , if the country invests in other specific areas like education , the burden of responsibility in taking care the elderly will literately shift from the government to the younger generation .
This is due to the better inculcation and cultivation of morale values among the youth as a result of better education system , thus increasing their responsibility in taking care of their immediate elderly family members .
A country could also focus its spending on developing its financial economy , as the result of such action would be that the working population would be financially better off to take care their immediate elderly family members , reducing the burden on government spending .
Given my above two reasons , one may argue that the ideology of such approach in dealing with aging population is too long-term oriented .
As such , it is impractical and it lacks of ability to deal with the problem in the short run .
As the benefit of the approach can only be seen in the long run , reducing and limiting the public funding amount immediately will result in shortage of funds to deal with current demand .
This will then result in a sudden vulnerable position , where many elder needy will not get the medical and financial attention that they need .
In my opinion , such an opposing view is incorrect .
By reducing the public funding , the government seeks to be more stringent in their subsidization criteria .
This will ensure that those who really need help will still get the attention needed , while those who can still afford to look after themselves will receive lesser in contrast .
Instead of ignoring those who demand help , this approach simply re-evaluates the subsidizing criteria , enforcing the practice of self responsibility for those who can and asking the public to play a fair share in taking care of themselves or their immediate family members .
All in all , in order to tackle the root of the elder dependency problem , corresponding nation should not focus on dealing with the current tangible problems .
Instead , more attention should be placed on the intangible source .
This will eventually result in a smoothen path in securing the aging process , and lessen the burden of the nation's economy .
"To a large extend , current research and development or policies have helped to ease the aging process ."
I agree with the statement .
Recent years , many Asian countries such as Japan , South Korea , Hong Kong and Singapore are tackling with a long term issue - burgeoning ageing population , which is the repercussion from rapid economy development , with high quality of health care but relatively low fertility rate .
An aging population has caused an increase in public spending and declination in Gross Domestic Product  , owing to a decrease in the people who are highly productive .
In conjunction with this issue , The Council for Third Age has been established in Singapore with the aim of promoting active aging .
In fact , the wellness of seniors is very vital .
Survey showed that many elder prone to suicide because they could not bear the overwhelming effect of ill health and the feeling of loneliness .
Fortunately , plenty researches and policies have helped in buffering the aging process .
Prime Minister of Singapore , Lee Hsien Loong said , "We are crafting new policies , improving our infrastructure and developing effective programs to enable older citizens to lead full and happy lives ."
An important policy the government had adopted is "Supporting Lifelong Employability" .
According to this strategy , government legislates to require employers to offer re-employment to workers for another three years after their official retirement age , not necessarily in the same job or at the same pay .
Government is going to retrain the older and enhance their skills so that they are ready to contribute themselves .
For example , on July 2007 , C3M and local university , Uni SIM offered courses to senior citizens so as to enable them to earn credits through courses and pursue a degree in future .
However , there is discriminations argues that the older are inefficient , conservative and out-dated .
They are a burden rather than an asset in working area .
Nonetheless , most of the older workers are independent , mature and deliberate .
They possess valuable experiences to impart and mentor the younger that are more productive and innovative , but lack of experience .
The strategy makes senior citizens keep engage and contribute in working field , more self-reliance in finance , boost the economic development of Singapore , with the combining power between the older and the younger , and thus , slow down the aging process .
Besides , the introduction of Central Provident Fund  , a mandatory saving scheme , is also a policy carried out by government to ease the aging process .
Under the CPF scheme , employees have to pay into their individual employee accounts during working years and the savings can be drawn when a person retire to afford his medical expenses or long- term care .
The policy is quite useful in grappling aging issue from economic view point as it encourages financial planning of the elder during their economically active years and lower the rising social issue such as their burden hinder younger generation's development in terms of their daily living consumption .
Government can also reduce the incentive allocated to the elderly and the public spending can be used in an economical way in the development of country in other areas .
Maybe from the younger's perspective , the policy doesn't make sense as it not only incurs less payout every month , it is also still long to plan the spending for their old age .
However , it is a worthwhile practice for citizens to plan for their income and expenditure and yet their future .
In addition , the implementation of "Wellness Program" and policies to create age-friendly environment also help in buffering the aging process .
Wellness Program is a social program designed to encourage active and healthy lifestyles among seniors .
It includes 3 parts- health screening , regular exercise programmes and social activities like brisk walking , dancing , cycling and so on .
Recently , we realise that the housing estate and public transport have made strides or free from element  .There are also lifts access to all floors of The Housing and Development Board  .
All these create a safety and accessible environment to the older .
In effect , the policies sound because the welfare of the elder is greatly taken care and they will not be neglected by the community .
Despite this social policy consumes a lot of money , it is crucial because senior citizens are part of our societies and as a responsible man , it is our duty to take care of their wellness when they are physically unable .
In conclusion , aging process is complicated and multifarious , it affects every one of us .
We may not able to prevent aging process from happening but we can try to slow down the process as far as we can .
Current research and development indeed , help a lot in slowing down the process .
Aging issues is disastrous it may slow down the economic growth in a country and create long-term stagnation .
Therefore , we must contribute and support the policies available so as to achieve a successful aging in long term .

The speed of aging process around the world is being hastened due to the high life expectancy and low fertility rate .
Most countries have poured a great deal of resources into this increasing population .
However , if this trend of spending has been continuing in the future time , it will be destructive to a country's financial structure .
Therefore , spending on the aged should be limited in order to transfer valuable resources to other sectors which also require the country's attention .
Besides focusing all her resources on education and economy , Singapore should also be spending some of her resources on the aged .
There is an immediate problem here and we cannot ignore that these 50 to 60 years old elders as they did contribute to the success of Singapore in many ways .
Even if Singapore successfully brings Singapore education and economy to greater heights , there will still be people who fall through the cracks .
These people will need even more help in this highly competitive society .
Beyond that , solutions like nursing those elderly in other countries like Malaysia where expenses will be lower are not well received by the elders .
Therefore , we still need to spend on maintaining the welfare of these people .

By investing in education and economy , Singaporean will be able to generate more disposable income and hence , less reliance on the government funding when they grow old .

We should still be a responsible country which will take care of its citizens .
Public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
Being a firm believer of 'Prevention is better than cure' , I agree to a certain extent .

Singapore can limit public spending on the aged , using the savings and indirectly alleviate or even reduce the total expenditure catered on the aged in terms of healthcare and accommodation .

"To a large extent , current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process ."
It is true to say that as it states with different improvements from different field , we can face the challenge and solve the problems of arising aging population .
As we know , if this problem is not solved , the median age on many first-world countries will reach 51 by 2050 .
During aging process , the elderly will face financial problems and be abandoned by their children .
Although this problem is unlikely to be solved in the short run , many ways were carried out to ease the aging process , particularly in social policy and science research .
Singapore government improves returns on CPF Savings to help the retirees .
Some of the people claimed that it was everyone's responsibility to plan financially for old-age to reduce dependency on children However , for those who are physically disabled and suffering from sicknesses , they do not have the ability to work and look after themselves .
Improving returns on CPF savings will ensure the savings can last for the lifetime of CPF members .
Older CPF members who volunteer to defer the draw-down of their savings to the age of 65 will receive a Voluntary Deferment Bonus .
This policy is used to encourage them to accumulate more wealth to support themselves during the old age .
The government is considering implementing a longevity insurance scheme that provides basic and affordable plans to ensure long-life income .
Hence , with the effort of Singapore government to improve returns on CPF Savings has buffered the impact of aging problem .
Besides Singapore , countries around the world also put in efforts to ease the aging process .
Silver jobs fair , established to find jobs for people aged 60 and over , is part of a government effort in South Korea to assist a rapidly growing population of older Koreans .
This jobs fair has mushroomed across South Korea in the past year .
In the past , it was a tradition that adult children should take primary responsibility for the good care of their aging parents .
However , the phenomenon we notice today is that the elderly are dismayed to find themselves dependent on children .
Children often expect their parents to contribute to household chores when they move in not because of the responsibility to look after them .
Therefore , most of them need to work themselves and master new technologies in order to earn their living after retirement .
Though some said that the elderly are not well performed , this group of people can actually bring improvement to the sectors they involved by contributing their own experiences .
This silver jobs fair has helped many older and unprepared Koreans to enter the last stages of their lives more easily in a culture transformed by longer life .
Viewing from healthcare prospective , researchers have taken a big step toward discovering that human hearts can grow new cells .
This is a significant research to help to ease the aging process as we know heart diseases are common among the elderly .
There are some people who claim that this breakthrough is only in the realm of basic science research but it is a good start for future use .
It was previously thought that human heart was unable to grow new cells after birth .
However there is a study can disprove it .
The scientists announced the evidence that new heart cells are made through one person's life .
This study could help doctors to design treatments for the damage caused by heart attacks , which was previously thought to be irreversible .
Now , it is possible to say that we can regenerate heart muscle after having heart attack .
Therefore , it is a new hope for the elderly who are suffering from heart diseases .
In conclusion , aging problem is concerned all over the world .
The older population is growing at a considerably faster rate than the world's population .
It is a complex issue but not insurmountable .
It is important to understand the problems faced by the elderly before taking further actions so that leaders can implement practical measures to cope with this problem .
With the current policies and development in science study , aging process will be solved in a long run .
Challenge for the future is to ensure people with different ages can continue to participate in the societies as citizens with full human rights .
Hence , I hope that the relationship between the generations can be nurtured and the children will take the responsibility to take care of their parents .

To the large extent , current researches , developments and policies have help easing the aging process ?
Fast growing number of aged population has been occurring all over the world .
As people aged , their income drops but their medical expenses are actually increasing .
Hence , every research , development and policy that will help them to reduce their burden is a gospel to them .
To the large extent , current researches , developments and policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Medical expenses are most likely to be the burden of aged population .
As human aged , metabolism rate and immunity will start to drop , limbs and body organ such as kidneys , livers , hearts , and other organ will start to fail due to long years of usage .
That is when all the medical expenses start to rise as a result of health problems .
To ensure that the aged population is able to pay large amount of medical expenses which could arise due to their old age , the government has set up a few policies to assist them .
Take for examples , Medisave helps people to save money for their future medical expenses during their younger age , Medishield allows more people to be able buy an affordable insurance since the premium of the Medishield can be deducted from their Medisave accounts , while Central Provident Funds allows people to be less worried about their silver age expenses , include medical expenses .
These policies have helped to ensure that people will be more able to pay for their future medical expenses .
Although some people might think that the government forces them to contribute part of their income as CPF is against their will , they fail to realize that this 'forcing save' can be good as it prevent them from squandering it on other less important merchandise .
Therefore , when they aged , they will not be so dependent on the government thus the government can divert the fund to other important development plan .
Other than the expenses , the science and medical discovery is one of most important factor that will help easing the aging process .
Since the risen of consciousness of balance diet , people have been consuming less salt , sugar or high fat food , and , it thus reduced the chances of suffer from chronic diseases like hypertension , diabetes , or cardiovascular diseases .
Although statistics have shown that people have become more vulnerable to these kinds of diseases , their chance of survival has been increasing as medical technology become more advance .
In additional , medicines that use to counter hypertension , diabetes have been popularized .
Thus , it enables hypertension sufferer and diabetic to work and live as normal after taken the medicine .
What will happen if older people need these medicines but these medicines is not affordable to them ?
The medisave and medishield they bought will help them pay for their expenses , although not fully pay , it would still reduce significantly .
Besides those , architectural improvement has helped aged people both with and without disability to be able to travel by themselves .
For instances , SMRT company has installed lift at every MRT station and provide bus services that is able to carry wheelchair users .
With those little extra efforts provided by the company , it would be more convenient for those aged people to ride MRT or public bus .
A decade ago , most Singapore HDB apartment lifts are not accessible on every floor , thus it was very inconvenient for older people as they still have to take the stairs which may imposed more danger to them .
Seeing this problem , the government decided to upgrade the lift systems , so we can see most HDB apartment lift is accessible on every floor now .
These cost of architectural improvement required a large amount of fund , but what driven SMRT , SBS Transit and the government to spend so much money on those upgrades even though those upgrades may not affect their profits or themselves much ?
It was because they had seen a future benefits from the upgrades as the improvements will not only benefit aged or disabled people , they will also reduce people travel time thus increase their productivity .
Hence , we can find government policies has help people to be more able to meet their medical expenses , the science discovery has help improving aged people health condition , and architectural improvement has made aged people life easier .
Combined all points mentioned above , we can conclude that current researched , developments and policies has not only been easing the aging process but also brought a lot of other benefits as well .
By the year 2030 , one in five people in Singapore will aged 65 and above .
If there is a limit to the budget , the quality of life that the government provides for the elderly will be affected .
Lacks of family support , unemployment due to lower education level , social and political impact on the country are some of the factors why public spending on the aged should not be limited .
It should instead be increasing gradually over the years .
Traditionally , the family has been the main source of support for the elderly but over the years , due to the effects of massive migration of young adults and higher cost of living in Singapore , more elderly are being deprived of such support .
Many of the young adults are leaving Singapore because of the stifling atmosphere of the country and the political and intellectual lock step enforced by the government .
Some are also attracted by the job offers overseas .
With them leaving the country , elderly are the ones who suffer because they are being left alone and most of the time , their children do not have the intention of coming back .
Tribunal cases of elderly demanding financial assistance from their children in Singapore has increased over the years .
Although the government is studying the best way to use the Maintenance of Parents Act to get such children to do their filial duty , they should also set aside more budgets each year so as to act as a cushion in case the children themselves have difficulty financing their own family .
Most of the elderly do not have proper education that is needed in today's society in order to meet ends needs .
With age catching up with time , their productivity is decreasing and eventually companies will hire new employee to replace them .
If the government were to limit our spending on them , they will face lots of potential problems such as unemployment or retrenchment , which will have a spillover effect on their children supporting them financially .
However some companies do retain their older workers because of loyalty but if there is a crisis , they will still be the first one to get laid off .
The government has done well by providing handouts to the elderly but this could only satisfy a percentage of the elderly population .
There are still many families who need the government's aid in order to meet their needs .
Our population is aging and by spending more on the aged , people can be assured that when they aged , the government will be there to support them .
With this in mind , they will be spurred to work harder and contribute more to society .
On the other hand , if there is a limit spending on the aged , people will tend towards individualism .
This will over time causes them to be more focus on their individual interests without taking the interests of society into consideration .
This will greatly affect Singapore since we are a multi racial society and working together towards a common goal is important for us .
Besides social impact to the country , political impact will be another factor to take into consideration .
By not limiting the budget for the aged , the government can be assured of support from the elderly during a political election which may be critical for winning since Singapore is turning into an aging population .
According to Singapore statistics the percentage of elderly in Singapore is 8 .7% of the entire population and this number is increasing slowly every year .
It may not be the bulk of the population but it might be a significant percentage of votes .
Singapore has done well over the years by implementing projects helping the poor and it had gained the trust and support of the citizens .
It is therefore crucial to maintain or improve its image of doing so .
In summary , having a limit to the budget will eventually have long-term implications to the country's process and growth .
The government should increase the limit gradually every year in pace with economic growth .
Instead of treating the elderly in society as an expense , the government can think of ways to harness the knowledge and experience from them so that they can contribute back more into society .

In the recent years , along with the decline in birth rate , the proportion of the aged in our population has also increased .
This leads us to a major problem of our time , known as ageing population .
Governments around the world have been actively seeking measures to cope with the problem , one of which is to increase the public spending on the aged .
Even though public spending on the elderly is essential for a country to deal with an ageing population , it should be limited because of the underlying negative implications .
Instead , more of the expenditure should go towards other forms of development .
Though some may agree that public spending on the aged largely aids the society in coping with the needs of an ageing population , however , it may hinders the development in other sectors .
This is because , as the world becomes more globalised , what follows is the surge in the cost of living .
Services for the aged will become more expensive .
Hence , this implies that public spending on the elderly will have to increase simultaneously as well .
With greater expenditure into helping the aged , the country will possess fewer funds for development in other areas such as infrastructure .
Therefore , with an inadequate input into these areas , the development of the latter will be neglected .
As such areas are the key pillars to a country's development , any slowdown in these areas will affect the country's regional competitiveness .
EU for instance , has been dealing with an ageing population .
It has been predicted that the growth rate will be reduced by half in the near future as a result of over public spending on the aged .
Hence , negative impact has been imposed on the progress on the economy , which is detrimental to the country's development .
Therefore , since expenditure on the aged puts the country's growth at risk , the former should be limited .
Though many may claim that the bulk of the amount needed to support the aged should come from the government who has the greatest financial power in supporting them , however , this public spending should be limited .
The reason is , the government is not the only form of support for the aged .
The elderly's children are also another form of support .
If large expenditure were to be dedicated in helping the elderly , the children may in turn over rely on the government to support their aged family members instead of both parties playing a part in sharing the burden of supporting them .
In Singapore for instance , the government is not the sole party that is responsible in supporting the ageing population .
The government only contributes through the distribution of subsidies to help the aged while their children carry the responsibility in supporting them .
Therefore , to prevent over dependence on the government by the children , public spending should be limited and be diverted to other areas for better use .
Alternatively , limited public spending may not be ideal .
In the event that the government's expenditure on the aged is restricted while the number of elderly is surging , the needs of the elderly may not be completely attended .
Such a circumstance will affect a country's development .
This is because since the aged's basic needs are not attended , they have to work in order to fulfill them .
With the presence of the aged in the workforce , the latter will not be competitive .
Hence , since the workforce is the main sector that drives the economy , an ageing workforce which is inefficient will slow down economic growth and hinders the country's progress .
However , this usually assumes that there are no measures which prepare the people for old age .
Currently , many governments have implemented measures which enforce compulsory savings for old age , such as the Singapore government which implemented Medisave .
Hence , even though if public expenditure on the aged were to be limited , people have these savings in which when combined with the government aid , are more than sufficient to attend to their needs .
Hence , limitation of public expenditure is still feasible and should be encouraged so that money can be diverted into other areas of the country's development .
In conclusion , it is inevitable for countries to deal with an ageing population .
However , apart from coping with the latter , a country must not neglect other parts of developments which are crucial to the country as well .
Therefore , it is advisable for public expenditure on the aged to be limited so that , no other sectors are being sacrificed at the expense of dealing with the aged .

We can see it from many evidences that present , such as the currency of Indonesian rupiah which is very weak compared to other currencies .

For example , the government makes a policy which says that only 2% from Nett National Product should be spent on older people .
If Nett National product of Indonesia is about 10 billion Rupiah per month , it means that 200 million Rupiah should be allocated to be spent on the aged .
Then , the government uses the rest of Nett National Product to improve Indonesia's economy .
After one year , due to economical improvement , Indonesia's Nett National Product raises up to 20 billion per month .
Then Indonesia should allocate 400 million Rupiah to fund the elderly .
This example reflects that spending on the aged will be raised together with the raising of Nett National Product which is earned from the improvement of the economic sector in Indonesia .
To sum up , government of Indonesia should limit its spending on the aged and improve other areas of the country , especially economic area .
In fact , limitation on it does not always mean bad .
We can us percentage system for the policy on it which means that the amount of spending for the aged will raise altogether with the improvement of economy sector .
Now , the challenge for the government is to look for the best way to improve the economic situation in Indonesia .
As the proportion of the world's population in the older ages continues to increase , many observers are concerned that an ageing population will accelerate growth in health care spending as individuals tend to use more healthcare facilities when they age .
In the case of Australia , government spending on health rose by $6 .1 billion or $267 per person in 2003 to 2004 .
Increased health care spending results in a smaller ratio of the government's spending on other areas like infrastructure and defend , leading to economical impacts .
I do not agree that public spending on the aged should be limited because spending money on the aged such as facilities and equipment is something that is definitely necessary for a society to be able to advance with no one left behind .
Rather than it being limited , public spending on the aged should be referred to as being controlled .
As long as needs are fulfilled , spending within a budget allows sufficient funds to be disturbed to other areas as well .
Society might find it difficult to advance if the aged population is being left behind as the mindsets , cultures and values of these different age groups would not be able to shift together with time .
This will result in the clashes of opinions and thinking , especially during the process of implementation of policies .
These clashes will slow down the progress of administrative work , causing possible long term impacts to be felt by the economy .
In conclusion , public spending on the aged should not be limited because the impacts caused by the limited spending will lead to long run negative impacts on the country's economy .

Therefore , by encouraging the older workforce to go for retraining , it will increase the productivity of these workers and hence their employability .
This will reduce the burden on the government as the government is no longer required to look after the basic necessities of the aged if they were able to be independent and self-reliant in meeting the needs of their daily lives .

There always have been numerous on-going researches , development or policies to help the easing of the process of aging .
How exactly do we define "easing of the aging process" ?
In the simplest terms , it refers to helping the elderly to age with convenience , to age with ease , and to age with grace .
Personally , I agree to a large extent that current research , development or policies in the architecture , economics and medical fields have help to ease the aging process .
There will be three reasons to be elaborated in the following paragraphs .
Firstly , the mobility for the elderly has been improved .
In Singapore , the Building & Construction Authority has been implementing a "Barrier- Free" blueprint known as the Code on Barrier-Free Accessibility in Buildings 1990  .
In this code , they drew up restrictions and regulations which engineers and architects have to comply to make the built environment accessible-friendly for the elderly .
For examples , the authority ensures the installation of lift at every storey of Housing Development Board flats and Mass Rapid Transportation stations , as well as building of ramps at all entrances of buildings .
However , people pointed out that the plan is not fully-developed and there are still several shortcomings .
They had commented on one shortcoming that there are still a large number of buildings which are still not full-accessible .
With regards to this , the BCA has already stepped up with the plan by applying another 5-year plan , known as the Barrier-Free Accessibility Upgrading Program to make sure that all buildings will be equipped with barrier-free improvements .
Furthermore , BCA has also set-up a $40 million Accessibility Funds for private buildings to be transformed into barrier-free buildings .
Therefore , one cannot possibly comment that privatized buildings are not accessible-friendly for the elderly .
In addition , lifts and ramps are currently built at those older MRT stations such as Queenstown MRT station in view of helping the elderly to travel from ground level to ticket gantries easier .
With all these concurrent efforts by BCA , mobility has improved vastly for the elderly .
As such , they can age with more convenience and hence improving their connectivity with others .
Secondly , the Singapore government has employed initiatives to help elderly to extend their working lives .
This is to achieve reduced financial and emotional dependency on the younger generation by the elderly .
This is especially important for any aging population just like Singapore .
The news articles also have been reportedly quoting that the government hopes to reduce the impacts of an aging population by extending working lives .
As such , they came up with initiatives like Skills Program for Upgrading and Resilience  , for the elderly who wish to work longer .
This program will enable the elderly to upscale their skills so that they can be retained in employability by their employers  .
Another initiative is the Lifelong Income For the Elderly under the Central Provident Funds Scheme  , whereby there is a fixed amount of income for elderly who is aged 65 years old and above .
This will then ensure financial protection for the elderly when they reach the age  .
On the contrary , people often question the effectiveness of these initiatives .
They may have doubts about is the fund enough to achieve a high percentage of elderly to work longer or can the companies cope with re-employment of older workers ?
With regards to this , the Prime Minister of Singapore , Mr . Lee Hsien Loong had reassured the public that the government will continue to revise the initiatives to make sure that the elderly can work longer with ease .
With regards to the ability of the companies to cope with re-employment of older workers , the government has introduced another program know as the ADVANTAGE !
Scheme which offer grants up to $400 ,000 to companies who are interested to re- employ older workers  .
This is to help them to deal with changes in areas such as wage restructuring and the cost to re-train the older workers .
As such , with these initiatives , the public should be rest assured that the minimum of initiatives will be carried out to guarantee that the elderly can extend their working lives with least problems .
In this way , they can then work to occupy themselves and age with ease that they can at least contribute to the economy .
In conclusion , current research and development have indeed helped the elderly in their aging process in the ways as mentioned above .
Despite the fact that we do not know the exact measurements of how well these developments have helped the elderly , it is for sure these developments are done to make sure our aging population can be well taken care of .
Furthermore , the most important thing here is that we can see everyone to age with ease , grace and happiness so that there will be lesser aging issues to be addressed .
Expenditure by government , health , education , infrastructure , industrial and socials are examples of government public spending .
Today , government emphasizes more on the aged and spends a high sum of money to assist them .
Quoted from the NHS Community Care Statistics in year 2009 , 1221000 older people are receiving some local authority supported care services which use  5 .9 billion .
This amount of money can be use for further development .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should be reduced so that more spending can be diverted to other sector of the country's development .
Furthermore , infrastructure development requires a higher percentage of spending compare to spending on aged because infrastructure plays an important role in ameliorating the standard of living of a country .
Transportation is very important in Singapore because almost all will need to travel .
Singapore transportation consist Mass Rapid Transit  , Singapore Changi Airport and others .
Government should spend more on transportation by providing more facilities for the disable and poor .
Other than that , improvement in waste management is required as pollution is a big issue till today .
More recycle bin or "Saving the Earth" event should be carried out by the government .
On the other hand , renewable energy usage such as solar energy , wind energy and water energy should be used more frequently in order to reduce the usage of nonrenewable resources .
For example , wind power generation has a significant share in total electricity generation in Denmark  , Spain and Germany  .
Hence , government should pay more attention into saving natural resources .
Another significant reason is to concern more on industrialization .
Industrialization can be a core of a country as it is the second widest sector in most country .
Industrial agriculture requires a lot of funds to improve their harvesting and planting .
The Wikipedia claims that intensive farming is an{agricultural}production system characterized by the high{inputs}of{capital} ,labor , or heavy usage of technologies such as{pesticides}and chemical{fertilizers}relative to land area .
Agriculture requires high spending to enhance their skills .
Moreover , manufacturing industry also needed attention from the government since manufacturing is satisfying the citizens .
Manufacturing factory creates many products and sells it to the consumer due to their demand in the market .
In addition , construction industry is momentous as it will determine how a country will be developed .
As we can see today , there are constructions everywhere in Singapore and this prove that Singapore is advancing in a quick pace .
Singapore's building and construction industry accounts for about 4% ofgross domestic product and S$27 and S$32 billion construction demand estimated for the sector in 2008 , according to John Keung , CEO of the Building and Construction Authority of Singapore .
Each and every sector of a country is undeniably important to make the country a better place .
However , each sector should have priority depends on the level of importance .
Government should think wisely and choose the sector which has more privileges .
In conclusion , government must pay more attention to other important sectors because every sector plays an important role for the sake of the country .
Therefore , government should not focus too much of their spending on the aged .
Public spending is the government's expenditure on various sectors , which includes funding for the aged , defence , education and health .
Public expenditure is usually funded by taxing the working class .
In most countries , the government funds the elderly population .
Public spending should be limited , as it cannot be used as a long-term solution to help the aged .
Funds should be diverted to other areas of the country's development which are equally , if not more important .
It is the government's responsibility to take care of the people's welfare and support them financially .
Hence , it is only right that there are funds allocated to helping the aged .
Many countries have allocated part of the country's annual budget to helping the older generation .
Take for example in Singapore , the Ministry of Community Development , Youth and Sports , often works closely with voluntary welfare organisations to provide community-based programmes and residential care for the aged .
This includes elderly homes and activity centres .
However , public spending on the aged should be limited as the people should be self-reliant .
Compulsory savings implemented in certain countries such as Britain , Australia and Singapore help ensure that the people have enough savings to meet their retirement needs .
Britain has introduced a compulsory pension scheme in 2006 where the employees have to contribute 4 percent of their monthly pay while their employers have to contribute 3 percent .
Australia's compulsory superannuation system also prepares the people for their old age .
These saving schemes in different countries would help ensure that the people have a minimum amount of savings after they have retired .
Hence they would most likely be more self-sufficient and public spending on the aged should be limited .
Public spending on the aged is the expenditure by the government covering on health , infrastructure and projects aimed at improving the lives of the elderly .
A large amount of the expenditure used is contributed by government taxation on the working citizens .
The other areas of a country's development include investing in education , military , economic and infrastructure .
Funding for the aged is necessary as there is a growing trend in the ageing population but more importantly resources should be allocated away from just the aged itself to other country's development that will indirectly aid the ageing population .
Furthermore , the money that is spent on the aged ultimately comes from the pocket of the working population .
Hence , more time and effort should be placed on the other areas of the country's development which will in turn reduce the negative effects of an ageing population .
Secondly , it is important for the government to spend on education .
Education should be provided for every person since young because one will become more knowledgeable about the things around him or her .
Better education leads to more job opportunities and increases one's ability to earn more money and think critically .
By having a good education system , more jobs will be created and this in turn leads to development in a country .
Thirdly , we must note that public spending on the aged turns out to be the healthy and the working population who are forking out the money .
If the working population were to pay entirely for the healthcare of the aged , then individuals will not take responsibility to keep themselves self-sufficient and healthy during their old age .
This would not be a fair arrangement .
The individual must be made to be accountable for his or her own health and not relying totally on the public spending by the government .
However , we must note that certain public spending on the aged cannot be compromised and must be put in place by the government in order for the aged to stay healthy and not be a burden to the society .
Instead of spending money on treating the illnesses of the elderly , money should be allocated to promote healthy lifestyle in the elderly .
For example , lessons in gymnasia and fitness centres can be conducted specially for the aged to encourage them to exercise and keep a healthy lifestyle .
In Singapore , we have the Wellness Programme to encourage healthy living through medical check-ups , regular exercise and social networking .
In the matter of medical care , the government should also take responsibility to ensure that doctors remain professionally competent , and that hospitals and polyclinics have the best available facilities .
In addition , the costs for medical care should be subsidised as some treatments can really be expensive and most of the people will not be able to afford .
Therefore public spending on healthcare and activities to promote healthy lifestyle are still necessary .
All in all , public spending on the aged should be limited because putting more effort and money into other sectors of development will turn out to be a better solution to help ease the negative effects of an ageing population .
However , public spending on certain areas of the aged cannot be compromised because they are necessary to maintain a healthy ageing population .
Therefore it is important to strike a balance on the allocation of public spending in order for the country to develop favourably .
Singapore is facing a fast growth of aging population .
Without immediate actions from both the government and the society , it might create problems for the country and elderly themselves in the future .
Singapore's economy might be in danger due to lack of productivity , and the elderly might find difficulties in coping with the aging process .
Realizing this impending danger , the government has been taking some new policies in economy and social policy .To a large extent , current research and policies have helped to ease aging process .
In economy  , the government has helped older workers to be economically productive by encouraging employers to hire , re-hire , and retain more mature workers .
The older workers themselves are encouraged to grow and develop their skills to meet the companies' standards .
The government also lengthened the retirement age to be 65 years-old instead of 62 years-old .
All procedures of this program are arranged under the new law , Re-employment law , which will come into effect in January 2012 .
It is hoped that the longer the workers work , the more money they can save for their life after retirement .However , some people think that the policy is ineffective .
The Re-employment Law will take into effect in 2012 .
Meanwhile there is an urgent need to protect older workers nowadays since many employers still have the mindset that mature workers have outlived their productivity .
As a result , many older workers are not guarranted to secure their job after 62 years-old at this moment .
Realizing this challenge , the government has encouraged companies which are willing to apply the new policy before 2012 by giving grants to companies and prepared the older worker to be more productive by giving workshops and courses .
In social policy , the government has tried to improve the awareness of young generation to care more about the elderly .
The Ministry of Community Development , Youth , and Sports held a Young- Old Forum in Singapore Polytechnics recently .
In this forum , the young generation is expected to spend more time and be more understanding towards the elderly .The government also encourage the elderly to run a healhty lifesyle , such as not smoking , consuming a healthy diet , and exercising regularly .
Healthy body is important because when the eldery is healthy , they will not feel useless or abandoned .
In addition , the governement has also increased its subsidies for day care , nursing home , and hospital to give the elderly a better quality of servies .
Nontheless , some people are concerned about the government's spending on providing various subsidies for the elderly .
Since everything provided by the government is considered as a right of people , the more subsidies for the elderly , the more demand will be created .
Hence , there is a worry that the government will neglect the subsidies to other important sectors , such as education and defence .However , People should not worry about this because increasing subsidies for elderly can increase the new opportunity for the young generation .
There will be more people hired in hospital , daycare , and nursing home .
It will also stimulate young generation to create new products to ease the aging process .
In other words , it creates new business opportunity .
The more business in the country , the richer the country since its economy will grow .
Therefore , the government can increase its tax base and the other fields , such as eduacation and defence , will not be neglected .
Needless to say , the current research and policies are not perfect yet .
However , to a large extent , they have helped the elderly to ease the aging process .
The existence of the new policies for helping the elderly in many fields , such as economy , social , and technology , shows that both the government and society cares about the elderly .
This will benefit both the country and the elderly .
In the long run , Singapore still can keep its global competitiveness level eventhough it has a big portion of aging population .
The golden generation itself will be happier since they will not feel to be useless or abandoned .
