It is well known that our society is aging .
Our Government has played a huge role in implementing and improving our policies to maximize the aid for the elderly .
However , there will always be persisting problems that the government will face such as National budget and economies coming under pressure , rising cost in the medical field and providing safety aids and measures in public areas .
Thus , current research and development in these areas are required to further ease the problems .
National budget and the economy have come under pressure as government provides heavy subsidies to the elderly in medical , transportation and even social activities .
Some might think that rather having to research and develop better economic policies , the government should just allocate this money for elderly benefits .
However , we should not just blindly put these money into subsidies , instead , we can use it to research for better policies or systems that will maximize the utility of the budget .
Having better policies , the government will be able to increase the productivity of the work force .
When productivity increases , economic growth will also follow .
There will be more money generated and fewer people in need .
One example would be that the government implemented the "Foreign Talent Policy" , which opened our market to foreign talents and thus increasing the productivity of the workforce .
Besides having greater productivity , the government introduced a scheme that allows people to provide in advance for their old age dependency .
They are encouraged to save a portion of their salary into a special account when they are most active in the workforce .
In Singapore , this particular self-funded retirement scheme is called "CPF Contributions" .
This is where the employer and employee have to provide monetary contributions for that particular employee's CPF account .
Apart from this , there are additional or related schemes such as Medisave and Medishield .
Britain , Australia , Chile have also moved towards this kind of funded retirement schemes .
Therefore , current research in development and policies in the economy sector do help in easing the aging process .
In the medical aspect , it may be objected that no medicine in the world can cure aging illnesses such as Dementia and Arthritis .
Even though that is a fact , advancement in the medical field has proven to pro-long and even cure some old age diseases like Cataracts .
Constant research in this field has better prepared the elderly in terms of knowledge , treatments and physical conditions in relation to these diseases .
With prior knowledge , people will be mentally prepared for the aging process .
In addition , they can seek treatments in the early stages to prevent worsening of the conditions or even get cured .
This will also in turn save huge amount of money for the people , as later treatments will require one to pay a higher price .
Knowing the symptoms of a disease does help too .
One example is that when an elderly is having doubled or blurred vision , sensitivity to light and glare , he or she might be having cataract .
Thus they can seek treatment or go for a cataract surgery if needed .
Research and developments have also seen implementation of the latest technologies being used in hospitals , clinics and some even at home .
New age technologies like these have helped doctors to react within precious seconds in saving a person's life .
They can also assess the their patient's condition in a shorter and more accurate time frame .
For example , elderly with high blood pressure can check their blood pressure anytime and anywhere with just a push of the button on a compact , portable blood pressure monitor .
Thus , all these research in medical field has aided the aging process tremendously .
In conclusion , all the research and developments and policies the government has invested in have made aging a more joyous and less terrifying journey .
Thus , current research , development and policies in the economy , medical sector and architectural sector have helped to ease the aging process to a large extent .
One of the biggest issues the world is facing now is the problem of an aging population .
Thus , there are an increasing number of concerns as to how to solve the problems of an aging population .
One of the most direct ways of dealing with the problems is to divert more government spending to the aged .
However , the amount of government funds available is limited .
By directing more funds to the aged , there will be lesser funds for other areas of the country's development .
Therefore , public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
Critics argue that by limiting the government spending on the aged , it would increase the consequences of an aging population .
When lesser amount of government spending is given to the aged , the individuals and families will end up paying more .
Their financial burden will increase with financial related social problems following behind .
However , without limiting the government spending on the aged , the people may become too reliable on the government .
They may not take the initiative to save their money for future uses .
This could create serious problems for the government as it will cause additional pressure on the national budget and the economy .
The children may even end up not supporting their parents at all .
An example would be the increasing number of elderly suing their children for not supporting them in Singapore .
From August 2008 to July 2009 , Popatal found that there were 172 people who filed applications at the Tribunal for Maintenance of Parents .
This was much higher than the average of 100 in previous years .
The elderly are being forced to get help from the government as their children are not willing to support them .
By limiting the government spending on the aged , the children will not push all the responsibilities of taking care of their aged parents to the government .
They will not create a habit of relying too much on the government .
Another reason why public spending should be limited is because a country does not only consist of the aged .
There are other sectors that needed the government's help .
If the government spending on the aged is not limited , the other sectors will be neglected .
The education sector will be an example .
The education sector is very important to a country as it nurtures the young and turns them into useful adults .
The government helps them by issuing bursaries scholarships to encourage students to study hard and help those who are poor but are eager to go to school .
Without setting a limit on the government funds spent on the aged , all these will not be possible .
There will be lesser amount of skilful adults in the workforce and this may in turn slow down the economy .
Without economic growth , the government may face a deficit .
Taxes may have to increase and takes a bigger toil on the people .
Hence , it is important to limit the public spending on the aged so as to divert it to other areas in the country's development .
In conclusion , it is important to limit the spending on the aged so that people will not be too reliable on the government .
They should also be aware that the elderly are now healthier and so are capable of supporting themselves .
A country does not only consist of the aged and spending too much government funds on the aged will cause a negative impact on the economy and is unnecessary .
Population in the world is aging rapidly and the number of persons aged 60 or over is expected almost to triple , increasing from 737 million in 2009 to 2 billion by 2050 globally .
This signals the need to deal with this pressing issue Aging Population .
Fortunately , many countries have recognized this need and have come up with different strategies to tackle the aging issues .
Many countries' current strategies have been formulated with the elderly in mind and hence they are able to address the needs of the elderly , thereby easing their aging process .
"Aging" is defined as the process of becoming old .
Hence , easing the aging process would mean making the course towards old age an enjoyable and less tedious one for the elderly .
In Singapore context , she has many different approaches in place and the few main ones include the implementation of Central Provident Fund  , development and improvement made to the existing healthcare system and elder-friendly infrastructure and the implementation of Tax Relief Scheme .
All these have indeed helped to alleviate the aging process and allow the elderly to enjoy their sunset years to the fullest .
CPF in Singapore has played a crucial role in helping to reduce the fiscal cost of elder dependency as it compels citizens to save in advance for their old age .
Critics of this plan have debated that it is unsuitable as high costs of living makes it difficult for people to save more of their earnings for their pensions .
Thus it is incapable in helping to relieve the financial burden of the elderly .
However , this may not be true as with judicious planning on their spending , it is not impossible for them to save more while they are still active in the work force and be financial independence in old age .
Also , other social issues associated with aging population like declining birth rate and people living longer have indicated that there will be fewer working adults available to contribute to the society and to support the aged .
Therefore , this has increased the significance of CPF as it compels people to save in advance lest they are unable or have no one to support them during their old age .
Furthermore , CPF has helped to rule out the possibilities of younger generations neglecting about the importance of saving for their old age and preparing inadequately for their pensions .
Hence , CPF has indeed helped to ease the aging process and the financial burden of the elderly as it requires people to save in advance and also informs citizens on how much they should save in order to be self- sufficient for their old age .
This instils people with a sense of security in the sunset years as they are now more able to enjoy without much financial burden .
Apart from CPF , development and improvement made to the existing healthcare system and elder-friendly infrastructure have also eased the problem of disabilities and old-age illnesses .
It may be objected that these actions are superficial and inadequate as they do not directly deal with the problems related to old age therefore are unable to ease the aging process .
However , this may not be the case as with improved healthcare system , it does help to benefit the elderly and their healthcare needs will be better taken care of .
An example will be the introduction of more community hospitals to provide better and affordable healthcare services to the elderly .
Besides , with the development of more elder-friendly infrastructure within the community , this implies that the community will become barrier-free , safer and more conducive for the elderly .
One of such project is the lift upgrading programme .
The improved lifts will stop on every floor and this will be able to better cater to the needs of the elderly .
Additionally , to allow the aged to move about conveniently , many places including public transportations have been made wheel-chair accessible .
Hence , with a safer environment and with the provision of elder-friendly infrastructure and unhindered access to the public facilities , these have allowed the elderly to move about freely and enjoy their old age , thereby easing the aging process .
Implementation of Tax Relief Scheme such as Aged Parent Relief is also an important step to improve the retirement security as they encourage children to take care of their parents , thereby easing the aging process .
At this point , one may take advantage of this scheme to claim the tax reliefs for own use as it is nearly impossible for the government to keep track of where the money is spend on .
Thus the elderly parents may not be at the receiving end .
While this may indeed happen , the government has taken a further step to discourage this from happening .
For instance , the government has passed the Maintenance of Parents Act to allow elderly parents to file lawsuit against their children who have failed to carry out filial obligations .
Hence , this act has helped to deter the children from making use of the tax relief scheme inappropriately and has also sustained the main objective of the scheme promote filial piety .
Thus , with the potential "loophole" being dealt with , the tax relief scheme will be able to help in lessening the financial burden that the children have to take on from looking after their parents .
All these helped to encourage children to look after their parents and at the same time , ensure that the elderly parents will be at the receiving end .
Hence , these approaches have increased the seniors' confidence and security towards their sunset years .
Overall , the different strategies such as the introduction of CPF , the development and improvement of the elder-friendly infrastructure and healthcare system and the implementation of tax relief scheme have indeed helped to ease the aging process to a large extent .
These strategies have helped to ensure that the elderly are self-sufficient during their old age and also allow them to live in a more conducive and barrier-free environment .
Although there is still room for improvement , current strategies have already done a pretty great job in ensuring that the individuals have saved enough for their old age and thereby increasing their sense of retirement security .
All these have indeed made the process towards aging a more enjoyable and fulfilling one and it allowed the aged to truly enjoy their well-prepared sunset years .
Expenditure on the elderly is taking up more of the government budget due to the aging population .
Money that can be otherwise spent on the country's development has to be used on settling the problem of nations on the long list of greying nations in the world .
These countries are spending more and more money on health care , infrastructure and transportation especially accustomed to the needs of the elderly .
Due to this , the country's development in other areas has to take a step back , thus resulting in the inability to attain her potential .
In the following essay , I shall discuss the problems that are brought about by the increase in public spending on the aged and the areas that could have been benefited if the fund is used on them instead .
When a country like the United Sates' elderly population increased eleven-fold between 1900 and 1994 and it is evident that this will bring about an increase in personal assistance for the aged .
This will translate into the rising funding so as to provide care for this group of people .
On top of the money put aside into health care especially for the aged , barrier-free access like wheel-chair friendly roads and transportation system have to be set to accommodate to them .
To deal with these global aging problems , governments around the world have to reserve a large proportion of the already limited public spending for elderly .
This result in reduction of the government budget for the country's development in both economically and socially .
The fund used on the elderly could otherwise be spent on allowing the country to have better economic growth by building better infrastructure for the commerce , industries and an improved education system .
In this way , the general population will be able to benefit from the increased in income as a result of the economic growth .
On the other hand , it is not morally right to leave the aged to fend for themselves especially they had contributed in one way or the other to the country's development in their younger days , so they should rightfully enjoy the fruits of their labour .
It is true that the government should reward the aged for their contributions , but in order for the country to continue enjoying sustained growth , the public spending have to be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
In addition , the responsibility of supporting the elderly does not only lay on the shoulders of the government , the elder themselves should plan for their retirement when they are still economic active .
This is done by implementing policies like the Medisave system , where Singaporeans have to put aside a certain percentage of their income into the Medisave account .
This system is to ensure that the senior citizen will be able to live on their own savings in the Medisave account .
Not only that , the children should also be show filial piety for their aged parents .
In cases , where the elderly are childless or physically ill due to aging , then it will be the government's duty to take care of them .
However , in contrary to what common perspective of the elderly is , Pat Thane argued that , they are not inevitably unhealthy .
As the living conditions improve and technology advances , people are able to lead a healthier lifestyle and live longer as compared to the past .
Thane also cited that "evidence that many tasks can be performed as well by people in their seventies as by younger people , even when they involve quite heavy physical or intellectual demands ."
As a result of the above mentioned arguments by Pat Thane , the Senior lecturer in Social Science and Administration at Goldsmiths College , London , and old age might not necessarily translate to being a burden to the society .
The elderly , especially the "young elderly" , can surely be able to earn a living on their own if they do not have the luxury of their children supporting them .
Therefore , an aging population might not posing problems as feared .
In summary , public spending on the aged should be limited because the fact that the elderly should have planned for their old age when they were young and they might still be able to support them if the need arises .
Concluding this , the country will be able to progress if their citizen do their part in planning for their retirement and , or their children supporting them .
Many countries are currently experiencing aging population which leads to a series of related economic and social problems .
For instance , workforce gets smaller as elder workers retire and working class have to pay more taxes due to the slower economic growth and the need to provide more healthcare services for the aged .
Even though the world is facing aging population , public spending should not only be spent on the aged as there are many other factors that need to be taken care of in the country's future development .
Aging population is already an inevitable problem in many countries such as Japan and Singapore .
Therefore , public spending had been reviewed to address this problem and it helps to reduce the negative impact of aging problems to the society .
However , due to the practical reasons , a country has its limitations on supporting the aged .
Hence , countries should assess other important areas that public spending should be focused on as well .
On the other hand , if public spending on the aged were reduced , many social problems would arise in the country .
As the aged are used to receiving allowances and subsidies , the lack of government aids might affect their well-being .
They would be unable to support themselves especially with the increasing level of healthcare costs .
According to the Singapore Department of Statistics , the Consumer Price Index for healthcare had an increase of 3 .6% from February 2008 to February 2009 .
This would translate to higher costs of living for the aged .
Therefore , in this case , moral issues need to be considered as well .
Children of the aged should do their part in taking care of their parents after their retirement .
In conservative countries such as Singapore , children are expected to take care of their parents by providing them with allowance to meet their daily needs .
Children should remember how their parents have taken care of them when they are young and hence , should do their part in demonstrating the value of filial piety and take care of their aged parents , instead of relying on the country to help .
In order to ensure that the aged are properly taken care of by their children , government could introduce policies and enforce it on all .
This would help to enforce the emphasis government places on moral values and also directly reduce public spending , which could be diverted to other areas of development .
Other areas of development included addressing social issues such as the decrease in the birthrate and the increase in child abuse cases .
In Singapore , the Marriage and Parenthood package with the extension of the Baby Bonus only attained marginal success in increasing the birthrate of Singaporeans .
Median age of citizen mothers at first birth had increased over the years from 28 .6 in 1998 to 29 .4 in 2008 , thus causing the fertility rate for the prime childbearing age group of 20 to 34 to decline .
Hence , public spending could be used to introduce more programs and subsidies to encourage having larger families instead .
With increased birthrate , Singapore would be able to resolve the problem of aging population in the near future .
Besides aging population , other social issues such as child abuse are also crucial problems that need to be addressed .
According Social Statistics 2009 conducted by Ministry of Community Development , Youth and Sports , the number of child abuse cases investigated in Singapore had increased from 154 in 2007 to 176 in 2008 .
This significant increase indicates that attention should be diverted to address this problem .
Public spending could be used to ensure that there are ways to reach out to the abused victims in the society .
In addition , it is essential to increase public awareness through campaigns and seminars to allow public to have a better understanding on child abuse .
With this , the society could play a part in creating a safer environment for children and hence , enhancing the social development in Singapore .
Even though many countries are facing aging population , there is a still a limit on what can be done .
Thus , countries should not be overwhelmed by the problems of aging population and overlook other potential problems .
In conclusion , public spending should be used on the aged but also not neglecting other problems arising which hinders the country's development .
Too much of the nation's budget is spent on aiding the elderly and the government should limit and channel these funds to other more important areas for country's development .
For most countries , part of their national budget will be spent on funding the aged each year .
For example , $121million is set aside as Senior Citizen Bonus in Singapore this year  .
The elderly receive subsidies in various areas such as housing and medical subsidies .
As the elderly today are able to survive without subsidies from the government , these funds should be put to better use and be directed to support the country's development .
The society has stressed on the importance of filial piety which requires children to take care of their parents .
Children are obliged to take care of their parents and this will lessen the burden on the society to take responsibility for the well-being of the elderly .
Thus , less funds are needed to help these elderly .
Excess funds should then be channeled to other areas for country's development .
Many may think that with the obligation to support their parents , the working family members will bear a heavier burden to provide for their parents .
However , providing for the parents is not an additional burden for the children as benefits are reaped when they take care of their parents .
For example , tax relief for adults who live with aged parents has been increased to $5000 and CPF Housing Grant Scheme to encourage young couples to stay near their parents  .
Therefore , it is not true to say that the working adults bear a heavier burden from supporting their parents when government incentives are provided .
Hence , the government should limit the amount used to aid the elderly as their financial needs are taken care of by their own family members .
Elderly nowadays are able to support themselves .
Chan showed that elderly respondents with CPF accounts are significantly less likely to rely on children as their main source of financial support , evidence suggests that as CPF coverage widens , reliance on children will probably decrease .
The government has implemented policies to help citizens prepare for their retired life .
Policies such as compulsory CPF and Medisave savings both require citizens to set aside part of their salary to meet their future retired needs .
Even if the elderly can support themselves , some may argue that they pay taxes and should be allowed to use these funds set aside for them .
Funds directed to other areas for the country's development will also benefit the society .
For example , the construction of handicapped-friendly ramps and upgrading of HDB flats' lift to serve at all levels .
The taxes that they pay may be channeled to support these upgrading works and benefit everyone .
With these policies implemented by the government , the elderly do not need so much financial assistance to meet their needs .
Everyone should be responsible for their well-being .
The aged should still continue to work even beyond their retirement age when they are still capable of supporting themselves .
In recent years , the government have been promoting elder employment and raising the eligibility age for employment .
Hence , the elderly should have no problem finding jobs to financially support themselves .
Others may think that the elderly have already contributed their share to the society and should now retire .
However , instead of letting them idle at home , the retired should be allowed back in the workforce and continue contributing to the economy .
Their contributions not only benefit themselves financially , they are also able to share their precious experiences with the apprentice .
With elderly returning to the workforce , they are less dependent on the government subsidies and thus , less funds should be set aside for the elderly .
Elderly will be supported in their retired days through various methods such as support by their working family members and support from government policies  .
There is no need to worry about the large sum of financial aid required by the aged .
All in all , funds should be limited and directed to other more important areas for country's development so that the country will be able to remain competitive in the economy and achieve sustained economic growth .
Infrastructure is another area where public spending should be set aside for as it benefits everyone in the long run .
Enhancing and upgrading of common places such as sport facilities , schools , public housing estates , roads and parks are to satisfy the needs and convenience of the public .
It can also be seen as an evidence of public spending .
In 2009 , Singapore Senior Minister of State for National Development announced that the government plans to spend between S$18 and S$20 billion on infrastructure projects and another S$15 to S$17 billion in 2010 and 2011 respectively .
Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong noted on the National Day Rally Speech 2009 that new general hospitals would be built in response to the healthcare needs in Singapore , on top of that , there is also a need to build step-down care .
Twinning the current general hospitals with the community hospitals , which are run by charitable organizations , will make healthcare affordable for all , especially the aged .
For example , a bridge would be built to link Tan Tock Seng General Hospital to Ren Ci Community Hospital that enables the patient from Tan Tock Seng General Hospital who is stabilized to be moved to Ren Ci Community Hospital for recovery and pay lesser for the cost of healthcare .
The 2008 yearly report from the World Health Organization on global health statistics stated that Singapore utilizes 3 .7 percent of its GDP on healthcare , which is generally low as compared to the United States' 15 .4 percent .
Singapore uses only one-fourth of its taxes , which is about only $381 per capita on health and individuals pay for the rest .
This shows the importance of tackling the roots of the high cost of healthcare instead of using the public spending directly on the aged .
Aging issues are very complicated but not indomitable .
For all nations , wise planning on public spending and wise policy planning are very crucial as they influence one's future .
Creating welfare dependency on the government only solves the issues temporarily .
In order to prevent this , public spending on the aged should be limited .
Instead , it should be used on other areas of development to tackle the roots of the issues and improve the quality of life .
Public spending means expenditure by government , covering the military , health , education , infrastructure , development projects , and the cost of servicing overseas borrowing .
Aging problem likely causes a substantial increase in public expenditure on health .
But the stable development of society as a whole needs the balance of public spending on all aspects .
Thus the government should be cautious in expanding spending in the aging population , taking into account the impact on economic growth .
Above all , many recent reports from developed countries have found that ageing will have only a small effect on the healthcare expenditure in future , thus spending on the aged can be limited within a certain small scope of the proportion of GDP .
For example , reports from the United Statesthe United Kingdom and Australia have reached similar conclusions .
There are two reasons why researchers have reached this conclusion .
Firstly , the older population is not spending a large proportion of the country's GDP , and the fact is not simply that the relatively greater proportion of older people there is , the more spending is as a percentage of GDP .
For example , the Sweden and the Australia have similar health outcomes , as measured by life expectancy .
But in 2000 , 17 .3% of the Swedish population was aged 65 years or older it spent only 8 .6% of its GDP on health .
This is less than the 9 .3% spent by Australia in 2001-02 , when only 12 .7% of the population was 65 years or older .
Secondly , many countries have adopt effective strategies to make the effect of population ageing on health expenditure to be small and manageable , Here is some of the strategies: stratify the old by age and sex give the limited coverage of the public pension system , new means-tested benefit for the elderly to reducing poverty increase transparency about self-employed income to ensure fairness in the financing of social insurance systems , including the new long-term care insurance .
But , the aging problem may be exaggerated , due to a variety of reasons .
Here I just give three of them .
Second , some group of people may , as the reasons for their positions or interests , require a significant increase in public spending on the aging population .
One group is the old .
Compared to long-term economic development they may more concern about their own welfare .
Another is the government .
Because of an increasing number of elderly voters , in order to win majority support , politicians may provide excessive benefits to the elderly .
The other is private medical institution .
If the government finds that aging is a heavy burden , it is bound to decrease the necessary public expenditure , thereby forcing more people to use private health institutions .
Many countries including Singapore are facing the issue of the aging population .
There are many implications to this issue and one of such implication is that the spending by the government on the aged has increased in order to deal with this issue .
This affects the amount of available funds to spend on other areas of the country's development such as the economy , education and infrastructure .
Thus , in today's society , much has been debated on whether public spending should be limited so more money can be diverted to other areas for the country's development .
In my own opinion , I agree to a large extent that public spending on the aged should be limited .
One of the reasons to limit public spending on the aged is that there is a greater need to spend money on education than on the aged .
For countries such as Singapore where labor is vital and is the only resource , spending on education is important for the future growth of the country .
Furthermore , in Singapore where it is currently experiencing low birth rate , developing education aspect for the young is crucial to ensure there will be sufficient of local talents in the future .
This is to ensure that Singapore will be able to stay competitive with other countries in the future .
Therefore , in the long run , spending on education will generate economic benefits for the country .
On the other hand , if this same amount of money is to be spent on the aged , there will be no economic benefits generated by them for the country .
Hence , if the government does not limit the spending on the aged , smaller budget will be left for developing education .
This may affects the country in long run .
It can also be argued that there is a greater need to spend on infrastructure development as it is an important area for a country development .
Limit spending on the aged means that there will be a larger amount of funds available to spend on infrastructure development .
This fund allows the country to develop proper infrastructure such as roads , electricity and even water supply to attract more foreign investors in setting up firms in the country .
Superior infrastructure attracts foreign investors in setting up business in the country as it reduces production cost and also increases accessibility for their business .
Attracting foreign investors is important as foreign investments contribute to the country economic development .
Therefore , if government spending on the aged does not limit but increases due to aging population issue , the budget on infrastructure development will be lesser and this may affect the country's economic development negatively .
Another reason to limit public spending on the aged is that there is a need to set aside larger amount of money for economic area especially currently when there is global economic downturn .
As economy is a key area of a country development , government should spend more money on economic development in order to sustain a healthy economic growth .
In addition , a prosperous economy will leads to the increase of affluences .
This means that the burden of supporting the aged by the society will be lessen .
Thus , spending in the economy will bring beneficial for both the country and the aged in long run .
On the flip side , spending on the aged is as equally as important in spending on any other area for country development .
Limit spending on the aged does not mean that government should not spend on them .
As they are part of the country's population , there is a social responsibility to take care of the aged .
Moreover , this group of elderly had work hard for years when they were young and had contributed to the economy and society .
From this essay , I conclude that there is a need to limit public spending on the aged as there are other areas that require money for the country's development .
After all , the aged is not the only area that we should look into when deciding on the allocation of public spending .
There is a need for government to take a wider perspective of the different areas that need money as much as the aged when deciding on how much money to spend in each area .
Thorough the entire world , the national leaders of developed countries are anguishing about the crisis of aging population .
A country budget would be spent in a few key areas such as defense , healthcare , environment , transport , research and development , education .
Public spending on the aged is necessary but should be limited in order for money to be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
If majority of spending is focus on the aged , it would limit the growth of the country which consequently lowers that standard of living for all .
Secondly , a key area which requires funding is the research and development programs of a country .
With strong support on research , new breakthrough can be discovered to cure chronic illness or age related diseases .
The cost of health care could be lowered with advancement in science , medication which is more effective and lower the drug's side effects .
Effective medication would translate into a shorter time spent in hospital .
Therefore it lower elderly burden on healthcare and improve or stabilizing the health of frail elderly .
Healthier elderly are able to return to the workforce and contribute to the country's development .
It may be objected that the amount invested in research does not produce equal rewards .
However , without continuous trials and error then new innovation could not be made .
It is due to the persistent effort from researchers that many of today technology had been discovered .
Research and development on the defense of the country is also essential .
A country would be considered extremely vulnerable to menacing country with its graying population and lack of improvements on weaponry .
Thus with adequate funding on the research and development , it will in turn place the country in a better position .

Goulding , Margie R . 2005 "Trends In Prescribed Medicine Use And Spending By Older Americans , 1992 2001" Retrieved September 11 , 2009
Limiting elderly spending does not confine only within the present .
It is about coming out with a permanent solution which would curb the spending in the long run .
In Australia , the mean-testing pensions have helped to cut down a significant amount of aging population costs .
However , statistics have shown that the nation's health care spending will still nearly double from 6 .4% of its GDP in 2002 to 11 .5% in 2025 due to the larger proportion of elderly in relative to its population .
Therefore , the fiscal outcome may not turn out to be ideal , other expenses such as education and national defence will end up being squeezed .
So it can be deduced that limiting elderly spending in the present does not equate to paying off in the future .
Freidland and Summer suggest the importance of increased productivity of future workers , regardless of age , for better economic growth .
However , in the future , bulk of the working population will have to come from the retiring baby boomers .
There are several limitations to the extent of how the productivity can be increased among these workers .
Firstly , for the more well-offs elderly , they are less willing to work as they want to enjoy their retirement .
Secondly , more health issues will surface if the elderly are to work more or longer , especially for the less well-offs as most of them have difficulty in paying for their medical expenses .
Hence , in order to have a better economic growth , the process should be viewed with a more comprehensive perspective .
Government should provide a wider protection net for the elderly , such as implementing health insurances , promoting health campaigns , better welfare programs so as to reduce the mental and financial burden on the aged .
And this means spending on the elderly is required .
Although economic growth is important in providing care for the elderly , the limit standards on the elderly spending should be set carefully , so that they would not create any adverse effects on the economy .
As elderly will likely to form the core of the population in the future , they are becoming the major source of the economic growth .
Thus , their welfare and healthcare should be well taken care of .
When this condition is satisfied , economic growth then can be sustained to cater for other areas of country's development .
The government has a duty in taking care of the aging population .
However , they should limit the public spending on the aged .
The responsibility to look after the aged should be shared between the children as well .
In addition , the aged could prepare themselves for the old reducing the burden of others .
Limiting the public spending on the age reduces dependency of them on the government .
Also , more money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
Ageing population is a pervasive phenomenon affecting countries worldwide .
Governments have been working on strategies to deal with this problem .
One of the strategies is to increase the birth rate of the country .
For example , Singapore has implemented the baby bonus scheme to lighten the financial costs of raising children .
However , the government not only has to deal with reducing ageing population but to attend to the needs of the aged as well .
There is a need to subsidize the aged for their healthcare , transport , facilities and in other areas .
More public spending has to be channeled to cater to the needs of the aged .
One may argue that public spending on the aged could be spent on country's development .
The development of the country is important but public spending on the aged should never be limited under all circumstances .
Whether the country develops or not , public spending on the aged should not be limited .
The aged still deserves to receive the best welfare given by the country .
It is known that they had contributed to the country for during the prime time of their life .
Their contribution should be recognized .
A practical way of recognizing their contribution is to provide them with subsidies and growth packages .
By limiting public spending on the aged , it may signify that the government perceives that the country's development more important than the welfare of the people .
Due to this , some of people would resent the government for regarding development more important than its people .
In the extreme cases , some of them would hold protests to vent their anger towards the government .
There could be a social backlash if the government were to limit the public spending on the aged .
The people may view that the government sees the old aged as a burden , not wanting to taking care of them .
This could cause the people to be skeptical about their welfare for their old age in the future .
The morale of the local workforce could be affected .
Some people may seek to migrate to countries that will look after the welfare of the aged .
And the migration of the workforce would lead shortage of workers in the country .
Shortage of labour would impede the growth of the country .
Therefore , this causes economic development of the country to be reduced rather than growth .
On the other hand , limiting the amount of public spending spent on the aged could help the country to develop more effectively during crisis .
If the country is facing an economic downturn , its revenue is reduced .
This calls for a need for the government to spend on areas which could boost the economy .
Money should be spent more wisely on helping the country to get out of the economic downturn .
With the reduced revenue , the government should be more flexible by limiting the public spending on the aged .
By limiting the spending on the aged , it helps the government to have more funds available for getting the country out of the economic downturn .
More public spending could be allocated to skill upgrading for workers , education and building projects .
Despite the economic downturn , the government could use money from their reserve fund instead .
This could be a morale boost for the people because the spending on the aged by the government is not reduced despite the economic downturn .
The limit of public spending on the aged is important because it indirectly controls the funds which would be channeled into other areas of a country's development .
This accounts for the dilemma in the amount of spending to be diverted towards the ageing society as many believe that money directed to boosting a country's economic growth is more practical than spending it on an ageing population which offers no economic returns .
Hence , a country should decide on the level of limit of spending they want to commit on the ageing population as different levels would lead to different results .
For a country which places low limit on the public spending of the aged , the amount of investment being channeled into other areas of the country's development would be lower than another with a higher limit on the public spending .
For example , Britain spends more on their ageing population as compared to America and their level of investment in research and development is lower than that of America .
However , this is not to say that the public spending on the aged is the sole factor for the cause of lower investments in other areas of a country's development , it is only one of the many factors .
Nevertheless , it still affects the level of fund being diverted to a country's development .
A low limitation limits the funds being diverted to other areas of the country's development such as education , technology and economic investments .
This may result in a slowdown in the progress of a country because the progress of a country is dependent on its ability to keep up with the competitive global economy .
With less funds being pumped into areas such as technology and infrastructures , investments may flow out when other nations offer better incentives .
This would then lead to an overall fall in the revenue of a country which will translates to a drop in the public spending on the aged  .
Thus , it can be seen that negative results are being achieved with neither the aging population nor the country's economy benefitting from it .

Fast-aging population remains a precarious global challenge in today's world .
This unprecedented demographical shift with the number of dependent adults surpass the number dependent children envisage serious negative impacts , from declining of work forces and real GDP to sharp increasing of elderly fiscal cost , that will impoverish and subsequently impede developmental growth .
Among all , the astronomical healthcare-cost issues generate most controversial arguments as more chronic degenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's or arthritis are perceived as an inevitable component which tend to manifest in the later life .
Nonetheless , current research and development as well as policy have preeminently help to alleviate the dire consequences of aging process towards society .

Public spending on the aged should be limited as money should be spent in other areas such as defense and public infrastructure as they play a more important role in a country's future development .
Currently , most developed nations such as Japan , Singapore and Australia are facing problems of their societies turning grey as numbers working to support the old are dwindling .
This causes social security problems which concern the ability of the young to support a larger number of people .
An aging society causes a smaller working force which results to lesser tax players which might cause in a decline in government fund .
It is not feasible for a country to spend more the elderly when funds have a possibility of decreasing in future years .

Funds should be used more on developing talents instead .
The problem that the aging population is facing right now is the lack of human resource to provide for the total population .
We should now invest in creating and attracting talents , both local and foreigners to reduce the impact of the dwindling working force .
Taking Japan for example , by year 2050 , one in three Japanese will be past their retirement age as average birth rate is reported at 1 .23 babies per woman .
One of the solutions is to do a "replacement migration" where the foreign talents are attracted to replace the lack of human resource in certain countries .
A country can secure these talents by setting aside funds for education , giving bursaries and scholarships to attract foreign students whom will in turn stay and work .
Either than talents , providing high level of security is essential .
There are currently growing fears of terrorism after the September 11 attacks on the twin towers .
Funds should be casted aside for security purposes , such as military technology to protect their people from external threats .
Only by living in a safe country then can one enjoy the benefits of living in a ripe old age .
Moreover , a dwindling population signifies lesser people to defend the country .
Therefore , technology is highly needed to replace the lost of manpower .
However , not all elderly are well supported by their children .
Especially during the wallstreet meltdown in 2008 , many have lost their jobs .
With huge families facing financial crisis , the government will have to stand him to provide for the elderly in need .
Not only that , single elderly that was being abandoned or do not have kids are in a disadvantage as there are no one to support them in anything happens in the future .
Therefore , retirement age should be extended and people should be educated to work longer and save more for their future livelihood .
Elderly should be more independent instead .

237-251 Healthcare System to be restructured to cater to aging population .
Channel NewsAsia
This year , our government intends to spend $42 .1 million on community- based and residential programmes for the elderly and the disabled .
Let us just think about the money that is going to be spent on the elderly .
Now , the problem some may question is whether such expenditure is too much .
Why not use the money in other areas so that these areas can improve ?
However , we need to realize that the older population we are talking about here refers to people who are not only old they also do face certain difficulties in supporting themselves and require the help to get on better .
Thus , I do not think that we should limit the amount of money to be spent on the elderly .
As mentioned earlier , one reason why we should not limit the spending is that it may not be fair to the elderly when the public spending is limited as among the elderly , there may be people who are really in great need of the support from the government .
We do know that the older population has a higher chance of facing illness and inconvenience in their physical movements .
Furthermore , based on the Census 2000 data , in Singapore , we have 14 percent of the elderly who only live with their spouse and 12 percent of the elderly do not live with their immediate family .
These elderly are facing problems in their lives .
In this case , they may not have the financial ability to take care of themselves without the help from the government .
Hence , it is the government's duty to come in and render the help to them instead of limiting the help they can receive .
Then again , there is always the opposite side to the issue .
Some people may critique that if we do not limit the amount we are spending on the elderly now , this amount will increase proportionately with the increasing number of the elderly in the future .
This will cause the proportion of the amount that will be left for developments in other areas to reduce in the future as well .
In an article in the Reuters , it is indeed believed that as the United States faces growing number of the older people , pension and healthcare services will be pushed up and thus , compelling major increases in public expenditure . 
However , I see the argument in the other way .
That is , the amount of money that the government can use for developments of other areas may not increase even after limiting the spending on elderly .
This is because in actual fact , the burden is shared by the families of the elderly as well as the government .
The government does not pay the full cost .
If we limit the amount the government pays , the additional cost falls on the shoulders of the family members which will then be shifted back to the government by family in other means .
Since no difference is expected , be it limiting the amount or not , we should try to reduce the pressure that will be felt by majorities in the future-having to pay for high expenses for the elderly at home .
After looking at both sides , we can see that the older population is not a small group of people and the number will continue to increase in number in the future .
Thus , to cater to the needs of the older population , which may also be the largest group of people within the country in the future , it is best not to limit the amount .
Instead , keeping it flexible , to be increased in times of great need will be a better choice .
Our society is aging .
Madrid International Plan of Action on Ageing suggested , "since year 1950 , the average life expectancy has increased by 20 years and is expected to extend a further 10 years by 2050" .
This increase in life expectancy has been said to be the result of better public health care and advances in medical care .
Governments , realizing that there will be profound consequences followed by this global demographic transformation , have now come out with different strategies and policies to ease the aging process .
Nevertheless , the effectiveness of current research and policies in helping to ease the aging process are doubted by the public .
In fact , it calls into the question whether the elderly really benefits from the policy implemented in the aspect of financial security , employment and living arrangements for elderly .
In terms of economics , old age financial support is the government's main concern and therefore mechanism that provides citizens with financial security in old age has been introduced .
For instance , Central Provident Fund  , a comprehensive financial savings plan for the workers has been implemented in Singapore .
Although CPF was aimed to secure the retired elderly by providing income to support their basic need in old age , nonetheless , it has been accused for its deficiency .
Shantakumar 1999 , Asher 1996 and 1998 , Lee 1999 and 2001a , have pointed out the lack of universal coverage and the lack of adequacy of funds for retirement security in this CPF scheme , especially for the low-income elderly  .
Along with the criticism , recent National Survey of Senior Citizens 2005 showed that only 41 .3 per cent of the elderly aged 55 and above had CPF savings and , of these , 61 .6 per cent felt that their CPF savings were inadequate .
Meanwhile , in a study of Asia Times Online  , it showed a recent survey found out less than 5% of the current elderly population rely on CPF disbursements for their livelihood .
All of these prove the failure of CPF scheme in providing a secure future life for most of the elderly .
Report of the Second World Assembly on Ageing: Madrid Political Declaration and International Plan of Action 2002 .  .
Retrieved September 14 , 2009 , from {http://daccessdds .un .org/doc/UNDOC/GEN/N02/397/51/PDF/N0239751 .pdf ?OpenElement}
Singapore to raise retirement age to 65 by 2012 .  .
Retrieved September 14 , 2009 , from {http://business .inquirer .net/money/breakingnews/view/20070819-83520/Singapore-to-raise-retirement-age-to-65-by-2012}
Apart from that , government's initiative in raising the retirement age is also blamed to be not effective .
In Singapore , the retirement age for its citizens will be raised from 62 to 65 by 2012 and eventually to 67 along with the higher life expectancy of its ageing population  .
It is undeniable that by increasing the retirement age , the elderly will be able to accumulate wealth and eventually the strain on finances in their drought years will be ease .
However , people should take note that the problem now is not about the mandatory retirement age of the elderly , but indeed the employability problem faced by the senior citizens .
Most of the elderly claimed that they could not find a job even though they have the willingness to extend their retirement age .
National Survey of Senior Citizens 2005 showed that among the current generation of elderly , only 28 .2% of them are employed .
This data shows the seriousness of the employability problem among the senior citizens .
Therefore , unless the employability problem has been resolved , the increasing in the retirement age might worth-nothing to most of the elderly that are now staying unemployed .
Besides that , attractive financial incentives for promoting co-residence with the parents introduced by the Singapore government have also been argued .
Inevitably , after the financial incentives such as tax reliefs and priority housing has been instituted , there are more adult children who live with , or nearby , their elderly parents .
However , increase in the co-residence with the parents does not imply increase in the willingness of the children in taking care of their parents .
No one can guarantee that children who live nearby their parents will eventually take good care of their parents .
There may have children who live nearby their parents just because of the attractive incentives .
As suggested in the Channel NewsAsia  , there are more elderly citizens apply for the Tribunal for Maintenance of Parents over the last 12 months .
"From August 2008 to July this year , 172 people filed applications , much higher than the average of 100 in previous years" .
This figure shows that by the time the rate of co-residence increase , there is an increase in the parents' abuse cases also .
Therefore , it is sensible for people to remain dubious about the effectiveness of promoting co-residence in improving the quality of care of the elderly by the adult children .

Singapore faces a 'silver tsunami' .
Asia Times Online .

''Public spending on aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
''I am fully agreed with this statement .
Nowadays , a lot of countries are having aging problem especially advanced counties like Japan , Sweden , Germany , Singapore and United State of America .
This global aging is also starting to intrude some developing nations such as Malaysia and Thailand .
According to the journals 'A Graying World' and 'Doomsday Predications about Population Aging Are Exaggerated' , population aged 65 and older is anticipated to more than double by year 2030 and furthermore median age in many first-world countries will reach between 52 to 54 by 2050 .If the fertility rates do not rise again , the problem will worsen the society .
Demographic changes due to growing aging population will have a serious consequence on health issues .
Governments are forced to spend more money to overcome it .
For instance , Singapore needs to restructure the whole health care system due to the aging population as Singapore Prime Minister mentioned .
However , the funds have to be restricted wisely and diverted to other fields of the country's development .
Firstly , governments have to continue push up the pension age in line with rising life expectancies .
Elder is encouraged to work longer to accumulate more wealth which could be used to support themselves .
Moreover , a tardy or zero fertility rates has increased the importance of elderly workforce in the market .
They could help to boost up economic growth by involving in different kind of sectors .
For some countries with little economic growth , society faces few choices on how to care for those who are least able to care for themselves .
On the other hand , with sufficient economic growth there are more choices and fewer persons in need  .The more elderly workforce in the market , the least governments spending on medical expenditures as well as lower down their pressures on aging problem .
Secondly , money can be diverted to education field in order to educate people or youngsters .
Well educated people tend to have higher incomes and better health generally .
These people are not only helping government to cut down expenditures on health care , but also helping countries to generate more income as well as stabilize economic stability .
That is why a lot of countries are spending in a large portion in education .
To illustrate , education expenditures always occupy in a larger segment in fiscal budget in Singapore and Malaysia .
Besides , public policies that encourage and facilitate education , basic research , and the application of promising technologies can enhance the well-being of current and future generations of older people  .In other words , elites are able to invent more advanced technology in term of accelerate nation development .
In a nut shell , every country needs to consider wisely about public spending on the aged .
Other fields of the country development are important too .
Therefore , governments may have to choose the most sustainable and efficient way to estimate their national budgets .
Growing older is often associated with deteriorating health , economic declination and emotional problems .
Singapore has made legal amendments to improve state provisions which include social programmes for old age and sickness  .
These changes demonstrated how seriously the government has assumed its responsibility in managing its ageing population .
With population ageing being prioritised as a top national agenda , the aging process would certainly be eased substantially .
The Survey of Senior Citizens showed that although the health status among respondents aged 60 and older was generally good , more than 30 per cent received treatment for some chronic illness .
The majority of respondents had little or no formal education .
About 25 per cent males and 69 per cent females either never married , were widowed or divorced .
Collectively , these findings suggest that the elderly must rely on others for financial and social support .

To provide a wide safety net , the government has implemented several national-level health insurance schemes such as Eldershield , which is targeted at the long-term care needs of individuals aged 40 and over  .
It provides cash benefits to the insured who cannot perform certain unaided activities .
In 2007 , the government announced a new potential Eldershield payout of $28 ,000 , instead of $18 ,000 for up to six years  .
This money is meant to be used to pay for care-giving needs , such as nursing home care .
General practitioners and dentists also provide care to low-income elderly in their neighbourhood at subsidized rates , thus enabling eligible elderly to have access to care near their homes .
These private practitioners are reimbursed by the Ministry of Health .
With these measures in place , the elderly can be assured that they would be cared for and that health care would remain affordable .
Another policy is to ensure Singaporeans are financially secure after retirement .
The Central Provident Fund has been the state institution to provide economic support to older Singaporeans .
Currently , Singapore's CPF has the highest coverage of any retirement plan in Asia  .
In 2007 , Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong announced that the age at which individuals can withdraw their minimum sums will be increased from 62 to 65 .
This move will increase the period of time that individual savings can last during retirement .
CPF LIFE was launched this month to provide Singaporeans a lifelong income into old age .
Members will receive a monthly income depending on the cash savings they have in their Retirement Account for as long as they live  .
In addition , for individuals 62 and above , the Housing Development Board will buy back the lease of their apartment and provide a shorter lease of 30 years for the same flat .
There would be two payouts a lump sum up front and monthly installments for the rest of the individual's life .
All these schemes ensure adults have at least a source of cash income available to them during old age .
However , the main source of financial and emotional support for older persons in Singapore still rests with the family .
Approximately 60 per cent of older adults live in households where other family members pay for all the expenses .
One-fifth of older adults are self sufficient and there is almost no dependence on welfare  .
Additionally , co-residence or living in close proximity to children remains the norm in Singapore .
Only 9 .3 per cent of the 60-plus lived alone or in other arrangements , and 5 .8 per cent lived only with their spouses .
The majority received financial or in-kind support from their children , if these were present  .
Existing policies would be rendered inadequate without the family being responsible for the care of its older members .
Nevertheless , filial obligation should be stressed .
The Government has introduced schemes to encourage Singaporeans to maintain their parents such as the legislation on filial piety , known as the Maintenance of Parents Act  .
Under this scheme , elderly parents who have no other support can claim financial aid from their children .
Taxpayers who maintain their parents or grandparents in Singapore are also given income tax relief .
These social policies should be credited in helping the current generation of older adults cope with the emotional and behavourial challenges of the aging process .
At present , the Singapore government has taken a very proactive role in dealing with population ageing and various policies to enhance the quality of life of older people have been put in place .
However these remain works-in-progress and will continue to be developed in the years ahead .
The effectiveness and relevance of these policies should be evaluated regularly to provide an even better understanding of changing requirements and needs of the elderly .

An aging population has been much talked about in recent years .
Goh stated that countries like Singapore and Japan who face a fast aging population are expected to have a projected median age of 54 and 55 respectively .
Hauner , Leigh , and Skaarup believed that countries with a high and rising old-age dependency ratio will expect their age-related spending to escalate by 4 percentage point of GPD over the next 45 years .
As a result , governments and policy makers around the world are ready to set aside a larger portion of their countries' budget to cater for age-related spending , with healthcare for elderly as most of their top priority .
However , to avoid compromising the development of other sectors , it is essential for policy makers to limit this perpetually increasing spending on the elderly by looking into viable alternatives .
Prime Minister Lee suggested that although it is the government's duty to look after the elderly , children should do their filial duty by taking care of their own parents .
However , some might argue that the burden of their own families and the high cost of living in Singapore make it hard for them to provide for their parents' living expenses .
While this may be true , it is still possible if these working adults can make adjustments to their lifestyles by cutting down on unnecessary expenses like the purchasing of luxury items .
This way , they are able to provide for their parents instead of abandoning them in a home or hospital .
Even though the government can look after the aged , Prime Minister Lee has pointed out that it is ultimately the warmth and love from the families that they need .
Majority of the elderly are not concerned with how much their children give them instead they are satisfied as long as their children are able to spend time with and show their love and concern for them .
By taking care of their own parents , these working adults can be positive examples for their children .
Under the influence of their parents , these children will be more likely to follow in their footsteps and will voluntarily take care of them when they are old .
Therefore , it is highly encouraged that children should fulfil their filial duty by looking after and caring for their own parents .

Government Spending on the Elderly: Social Security and Medicare .

Chow proposed that mandatory medical savings scheme should be implemented in order to tackle the challenges of an aging population and the rising medical costs in Hong Kong .
Critics of this proposal have pointed out that the money set aside for this scheme will go to waste if they pass away even before they can utilize them .
However , governments of many countries have urged that such savings scheme offers protection as health can be unpredictable .
By implementing a mandatory medical savings scheme , its contributors will have a ready sum of money to deal with any hefty medical cost which they may incur when they get older .
This way , it minimizes the chances of them not being able to afford their medical bills , and at the same time reduces the heavy burden on government subsidies .
The scheme does not only provide protection for its contributors .
In addition , a substantial payout from the medical insurance will be awarded if he or she is to encounter any mishap which results in death or any form of disability rendering the contributor unable to work .
This ensures that the family is still able to sustain themselves financially in the event that the contributor is unable to provide for the family .
Hence , implementing a mandatory savings scheme is essential to its contributors , their families and the government .
Lee proposed the plan to limit social welfare spending of South Korea in order to invest in programs that will increase the country's economic growth .
At this point , one might wonder if this move will compromise the welfare of the society with the elderly in particular .
While this may be a problem , a potential growth in the country's economy will allow for even more funds to be made available for the area of social welfare in the future .
With a limited social welfare fund , people will rely lesser on the government and more on themselves .
Hence , it encourages them to work harder and save more in order to be better prepared for old age .
Furthermore , the limited spending on social welfare releases funds which can be diverted to other key sectors .
For example , these funds can be used in the research and development of the cures for terminal illnesses like cancer .
So , limiting spending on social welfare might just prove to be a feasible strategy which benefits the country in various aspects .
Countries with a fast aging population face an ongoing battle against the ever increasing welfare and health care costs .
It is therefore crucial that the governments and policy makers do not recklessly sink huge portion of their countries' spending on these areas .
Instead , they should be looking at viable solutions that do not compromise the development of the other sectors .
Therefore , a boundary to the spending on elderly should be set in order to avoid increasing the burden on future generations and upsetting of the development of other key sectors as mentioned earlier .

"Until recently , the ills of old age interested only poets and philosophers .
However , this has changed because governments and policy makers in the developed world are now confronted with the unprecedented problem of a fast aging population" claims Peter G . Peterson  .
The aging population has become a major issue in many developed countries including the United States , Japan and Singapore .
Increasing population of the aged created many implications on the society .
Clearly , both governments and the public are becoming more aware of this issue .
Governments in various countries have come up with different policies to address the problem of an increasingly aging population .
As the problem of the aging population worsens , governments have been spending increasing amounts of money to counter the problem , at the expense of other areas of the country's development .
It is important that governments take note of this and control their spending so as not to neglect these other more important areas such as the education and the economy .
According to the text , governments are stressing filial obligation and increasing the willingness of tomorrow's grown children to support their own elderly parents .
However , such practices are not well performed .
It is crucial for the government to spend money on the aged as not doing so will lead to social problems .
Already , we are seeing a breakdown in extended families .
The young no longer see filial piety as important .
Elderly who are unable to support themselves and are abandoned by their children will have nowhere to turn to if the government turns its back on them .
This will lead to increased crime rates , begging and vagrancy in the country , which is harmful for society .
However , this is not the only area where government spending is required .
As countries spend more money on public spending on the aged , other important sectors such as defense and education may get neglected and become under budgeted .
These sectors are as important as , if not more important than , spending on dealing with an aging population .
For example , facing an ever increasingly challenging global economy , it becomes increasingly important for countries to focus on education to maintain a skilled workforce .
An educated workforce increases productivity , which drives the economy leading to increased wealth .
By increasing public spending on an aging population , governments risk overlooking important areas of the country's development at the expense of the country's overall well being .
Moreover , healthcare cost has been increasing .
The introduction of new technologies and treatments for the aged are relatively expensive .
Governments have been spending too much money on the subsidies to help the aging population .
People may take advantage of government subsidies to pay for the expensive new technologies which are not necessary .
Governments should specify the types of treatments that it considers essential and subsidise these treatment , while leaving non-essential treatment cost to be borne by the consumer .
Limitation of the public spending will make sure government does not overspend on treatment that is not essential so that the money can be diverted to other areas .
It is important that governments plan their finances well to benefit different sectors of the country .
With the growing population of the aged , public spending is increasing so rapidly that governments are losing control of their spending .
Governments should forecast from a wider perspective to ascertain whether the spending is necessary or should the money be diverted to other areas .
Public spending should be controlled to establish a balanced outcome for both the young and the aged .
If the usage of public funds is not well balanced , it will not only affect the country's development , it could put the country's future into jeopardy .
On the other hand , there are also researches done on sickness which most commonly affect the old aged .
Researches on healthcare are being done to help maintain or improve the health of the elderly .
Better solutions are hoped to be found in order to help the elderly on their health issues .
For instant , in the United Kingdom , researches on dementia are being done to find a better solution to cure the patients who are mostly the old aged .
According to Rebecca Wood , the Chief Executive of the Alzheimer's Research Trust , the population living with dementia is forecast to double within a generation .
To help ensure less elderly from suffering dementia in the future , researches are now being done by the UK .
Much investment had been put into this research to defeat this sickness which is currently and will continue to haunt the old aged .
Some may argue that these researches do not help to ease the aging process because most of the time money is wasted as the proper solutions is never found although much investment had been dumped to help the researchers .
Although such may argue this way but it is better to try rather than to leave the devastating sickness continue to haunt out older generations .
Besides researches and developments on the field of medicine , social policy also plays a main role in helping to ease the aging process .
Many countries had taken this step to enforced policy and scheme to everyone so that the burden of the elderly can be lighten .
In Japan , the government has imposed the "National Pension Scheme" to all the citizens of the country .
In this scheme , a basic old aged pension is provided to all citizens who are above 65 years of age and have contributed for 25 years or more to the country .
This scheme is helpful to ease the burden of the elderly as it secure the financial need of the elderly .
The old aged can then be independent and they do not need to rely on their children for money .
The old aged can live a comfortable life without worrying or without seeking for financial aid around .
But on the other hand , with these schemes , children need not do their duty to take care of their parents .
This may end up with social problem in a country .
Much younger generation will not be filial to their parents and will not bear the burden to take care of the older generation and will tend to push the burden on the government .
Although such thoughts may arise , but there are not other better ways to guarantee the better life of the old aged .
Clearly , all these researches , developments and policies had helped the aging population to get a better live .
This effort should be continued without fail as this would guarantee the living standard of the old aged .
Thus , having the living standard for the elderly guaranteed , the social problems can also be avoided in a country .
In conclusion , the issue on the "graying world" can be solved and well taken care of if necessary steps are taken to prevent it .
