Throughout history , we , mankind had always sought to improve the quality of our lives .
We have consistently created solutions to suit our needs and wants .
We have progressed much since the Stone Age .
Nowadays , electricity has become a key ingredient in our life .
Electricity is a form of energy that is generated mainly from burning fossil fuels .
However , fossil fuels are running out !
Singapore has no other natural resources , hence , our most urgent need will be to find a reliable source of sustainable energy .
According to Khandani  , the design process consists of five main parts: Defining the problem , gathering required information , generating multiple solutions , selecting a solution and testining of the solution .
The problem is obvious .
Crude oil , a fossil fuel , might run out in fifty years .
There are a few alternate energy sources apart from fossil fuels .
A simple search yields the following sources: Solar energy , hydroelectricity and wind energy .
Solar energy is harnessed through photovoltaic process when the sunlight hits solar panels .
This process generates electricity .
Hydroelectricity uses moving water to spin turbines , creating energy .
A hydroelectric dam will need to be built to harness this form of energy .
Wind energy utilizes the kinetic energy of moving winds to spin blades .
These blades are connected to a generator which will generate electricity when the blades are spun .
These three sources are the most commonly found alternate energy sources .
Solar energy will be the best alternate energy source for Singapore .
Hydroelectricity and wind energy will not be feasible in this island state .
Hydroelectricity requires a large body of water which is not available in Singapore .
Wind energy requires a vast open area to place the windmills , Singapore does not have such space to spare .
Solar energy , on the other hand , is easier to harness .
The infrastructure required is much simpler , only the solar panels and necessary wirings are needed .
The panels come in many sizes which gives flexibility in positioning them .
Solar panels do not contain moving parts , unlike the turbines in the windmills or hydroelectric dams .
Hence solar energy is the best choice as the equipments are easier to maintain and safer to use .
The most effective method to harness solar power in Singapore will be to install solar panels on the roofs of all HDB flats .
The majority of housing in Singapore are HDB flats , these flats add up to form a considerable amount of land area .
As all HDB flats are under the jurisdiction of a government board , there is no need to seek approval from individual owners to implement this plan .
In conclusion , the most feasible sustainable energy source for Singapore will be solar energy .
This scheme is highly probably because the government has control over a large number of HDB flats , which constitutes to a large land area .
We will need to put this into motion as soon as possible .
Since 19 century , the environment has been polluted because of the fast development of industries and economics .
Nowadays , the pollution is very severe and has threatened living condition of human beings .
To have environmentally-friendly product is a human need that has to be given priority , so that the products people use won't be harmful to neither the environment nor health of people .
In the following paragraphs , how engineer design processes can help to achieve the purpose will be discussed .
Then is time to generate multiple solutions for the problems .
Now there are a lot of researches done on environmentally-friendly energy and materials , so learning to make use of these research results can help to solve our problem a lot .
At the same time , the creative idea of design to make the product more effective is important for the solution too .
The next step is to analyze and select a solution .
To analysis those design solutions , a lot of factors need to be considered .
Functional analysis , ergonomics and product safety and liability are all important elements to evaluate those solutions .
And all these are for making the decision .
To compare one solution with another , ranking according to the attributes for the solution is necessary for us to see with one the best , in our case , environmentally-friendly should be the major criteria .
Then , analyze each solution against the criteria we have , and rate each solution , in our case .
At last , choose the most scored one for the next process .
To sum up , the design processes can help to solve the problem we have effectively , since in each step we do our job based on the problem we want to solve and the efficiency .
New and clever technologies are constantly being realised by people all around the world to tackle problems that they face .
However , the creation of these technologies can be attributed to research or chance .
One example of researching resulting in an invention is a type of wall-mounted bed that can be folded onto the wall when not in use .
It was called the murphy bed and was invented by William L . Murphy to solve space constraints that he faced while living in a small apatment .
An example of an invention attributed to chance discovery is the Telfon .
This is a type of substance discovered by Dr . Roy J Plunkett while he was working on gases being used as refrigerants .
These two type of technology share many similarities and differences .
One of them is that they both exist to address problems that people are facing at that time of creation , but differ in process it takes to develope the product .
Another is that both type of technology requires people to ultilise a certain amount of creativity and good peception to develope them completely but differ when it comes to the type of people it usually involves .
Technology , no matter how it is developed , will be used to address problems that people face .
Teflon for example , is being used in a variety of products as anti-stick or anti-stain coatings .
Cooking utensils coated with Teflon are now easier to clean up since the burnt food no longer stick to it .
Clothes coated in a variety of Telfon became stain resistant which means less chance of it becoming damaged permanently by tough stains , and an easier time washing the dirt off the clothes .
Another example , the murphy bed , also addressed a problem that some people faced .
This problem is the space constraint due to a small living space .
By being foldable , space could be made available for use where the bed would havve been .
Ultimately , both type of technologies are beneficial to the human population .
The two ways of developing technologies have different processes .
The development murphy bed , for example , is driven largely by the problem it was trying to solve .
This result in a process where identifying the problem comes first , after which time and effort are put in to solve that one problem .
However , Telfon has seen itself being used as coatings to cloths , coating on cookware , insulations and even in medicine as stenotic arties .
One reason for this versatility is that the brainstorming is now focused on the various problems where Telfon could be used to great effect .
With a large pool of possible uses for Telfon gathered , the next step would be to modify this new technology so that it may be used for as many of the problems as possible .
Ultimately , while the murphy bed and Telfon originated from two differing processes , they still do share some similarities .
By observing this , it could be possible that people would combine some of the key aspects of the process to create a better model for developing new technology .
When the human first learnt to use energy - the fire , the progress of civilization witnessed a fantastic leap .
Today , we can even say that energy plays the most important role in our daily life and also in supporting our huge society .
Therefore , as we human are running out of energy we could make use of , providing sustainable , green and reliable energy has been crucial for the survival of the whole human society .
So this is indeed the need of people today that should be given priority and engineers are especially expected to take their responsibility and play a key role in powering up our world again .
Fortunately , after decades of painstaking efforts we have already come up with many possible solutions .
Many of them fall in two categories: searching for new energy sources and implementing energy-saving methods .
For instance , the solar cell as a source of energy for satellites , industries as well as households has proved to be a promising method , while refining the ignition inside the cylinder in order to extract the most from every drop of gasoline is what many people are doing in laboratories now .
I have a Nokia N79 and surprisingly I found that when I un-plug the charger cable from the phone , a message saying , "Un-plug the charger from the socket to save energy" will appear on the screen , which is really an innovative way to publicize energy saving .
However , when it comes to analysing most of the solutions , considerable problems may arise .
Some may be highly constrained by geographical or climatic factors .
Such solutions contain hydro and solar energy generating .
Some may be too risky or expensive , like the nuclear power .
There are also solutions that are innovative but may not be of so much use that we cannot rely on them to save us from the coming energy famine .
The warm-hearted message of my Nokia may well belong to this category .
So selecting the right solutions must be a very complicated task because we must take everything into consideration and assess all the solutions in the presence of the various factors .
Here , in my opinion , safety , sustainability and the harm done to the environment should be given significant priorities .
Testing and implementing the solutions are always combinations of excitement and disappointment .
Your new device may end up saving half the electricity or prove to be in vain .
But whatever the result might be , we must apply scientific methods in every stage , from building a prototype to conducting concurrent engineering , from the very first planning to the later maintenance .
Every step deserves our full efforts .
To sum up , solving the current energy crisis is a very complicated and systematic issue and engineers should act as pioneers in solving it .
By and only by applying the correct energy design process can they make more breakthroughs and bring us more good news .
Technologies have been developed since long ago , however , not all of them are planned .
There are many pathways that lead to a technology being created , mainly by serendipitous discovery or through research .
In our everyday life , we stumble across things that are out of the norm .
While most of the events appeared to be non-significant , there are some where people actually get ideas from it .
This is what we call serendipitous discovery , when people make discoveries that they are not seeking .
One of the example technology discovered from research is development in automobile safety and better design of roads in the United States while an example of technology resulted from serendipitous discovery is the Post-it pads .
Technology created via research has significant difference in comparison with technology resulted from serendipitous discovery in several aspects .
One of the major difference is whether there is a need for the technology .
Technologies developed through research are ussually to address a problem that have been identified .
In this case , the development in automobile safety and better design of roads in U .S . is to reduce the massive casualties from road accidents where the annual vehicle death rate reached 50 ,000 in the early 1960s .
The generation of innovations .
In Diffusion of innovations pp .136-
158) .
New York: Free Press) .
On the contrary , technologies developed through serendipitous discovery are not born from a need for them .
For instance , Post-it pads were developed out of mere coincidence .
Decades ago , the 3M researchers found a new bonding agent during their research but it is not what they wanted to achieve as the bonding agent did not stick paper very tightly to the surface .
Therefore , it can be said that technologies created from research are due to a need for them while technologies from serendipitous discovery do not originate from a need .
Another difference is the final usage of the technologies .
Technologies developed through research are use for their intended purpose .
For example , in U .S , the development in automobile safety includes safer cars that come with padded dashboards and stronger bumpers while safer roads are achieved by placing impact attenuators in front of viaduct pillars .
These technologies were developed for their intended purpose , which is to reduce casualties from road accidents .
Whereas , technologies developed from serendipitous discovery are not use for their intended purpose .
For instance , the researchers of 3M found a new bonding agent during their research .
The bonding agent was initially thought as a failure as it does not meet the expectation of the researchers ,which is to stick tightly to the surface of paper .
However , it is later converted into a successful product when it is use to create "Post-its ," the little stick- on squares of colored paper that can be used to attach a note to a letter or other document which is not the intended purpose of this technology .
In a nutshell , technologies created from research will be use for their intended aim while technologies developed from serendipitous discovery might not serve its intended purpose .
Lastly , the difference between the 2 is the background research .
Technologies created from research undeniably have lots of background research .
This is proven just by looking at the amount of research needed before measures taken to developed a safer automobile as well as better design of highways .
The research span can be years ,decades or even longer before the technology can be successfully developed .
However , this is different for technologies originated from serendipitous discovery .
There are no background research for these technologies , as they are created out of pure coincidence .
With reference to Post-it pads , they are created without any background research .
The researchers simply found a way to utilize the bonding agent years later which led to the product Post- it pads .
Hence , there it can be said that there is background research for technologies originated from research while there might not be any background research for technologies created from serendipitous discovery .
Despite the differences between the ways the technologies are created , they help to improve the life of mankind be it through convenience or any other means .
In conclusion , there are significant differences between technologies developed from research and serendipitous discovery , however , it does not change the fact that they are key to the future for mankind .
The development and advancement in science and technology has brought much convenience to human's society today .
With a click of the mouse , one can communicate with another person half a globe away , strike a business deal with foreign entrepreneurs and catch up with the latest happenings all around the world .
Technology is something which is created to help solving the problems we face in our daily life and at the same time , improving the quality of our life .
Generally , most of the technological innovations are created through basic research , followed by applied research and finally leading to development .
The generation of innovations , para .
However , there are also some technological inventions which are designed from a serendipitous discovery .
According to Roger , serendipity is the accidental discovery of a new idea .
The differences between these two types of technological inventions can be perceived in terms of their research backgrounds , cost of the invention of the technology , and time consumptions .
Technology developed via research and technology which resulted from a serendipitous discovery have different research backgrounds .
Technology based on scientific research requires a wide range of knowledge about the research .
Special skills are also needed to carry out certain experiments and to record the result and data of the experiments .
Many researches also have to be carried out to identify and rectify the problems encountered throughout the experiments .
For example , to create a miniaturized medical submarine which can be injected into human bodies to destroy the blood clot that threatens a human life , there are many technical problems to overcome , such as how to make , power and steer them .
Voyage of the micro robots , paraOn the other hand , technology created by serendipitous discovery does not require any knowledge and special skills .
It is an invention by chance while a very different invention is undergoing research and analysis .
For example , DDT is created out of a substance used for protecting wool clothes against moth .
The generation of innovations , para .
11)Obviously , more research and analysis are needed for technology based on research as compared to technology created by serendipitous discovery .
Both the technology based on research and technology created by serendipitous discovery require different amount of cost to be carried out .
For technology based on research , a large amount of money is needed to purchase materials that are essential for the research and investigations to be instigated .
Moreover , specific apparatus , for instances , machines and robots , which are usually expensive , are also needed in order to carry out certain experiments .
However , for technology created from serendipitous discovery , it actually requires a few cents or even not a single cent as it is a useful "side product" from a different research .
Less cost is required for this technology because it is an unplanned technology discovery .
Apart from that , time consumption of both the technology based on research is much different from the technology created by serendipitous discovery .
In order to carry out many research and analysis , much time has to be spent for the technology to be successfully invented .
For instance , Thomas Edison had spent his whole life to invent a light bulb with almost ten thousands of failures before he succeeded .
For technology created from serendipitous discovery , less time required as it comes out unexpectedly .
One popular example is penicillin , where it turned out to be the first antibiotic because of its property of killing biological materials when it was left in Petri dishes containing biological organisms .
The generation of innovations , para .11)
To sum up the salient point , technology created via research requires more researches and investigations than technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery .
Besides , cost of creating a technology created via research is much higher as compared to that of technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery .
Technology based on scientific research consumes more time than technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery as there are many research and experiment need to be carried out .
Although all technology serves a common purpose , there are many differences between inventions that resulted from research and serendipitous discoveries .
Looking at an example of invention that resulted from research which is the laptop and an example of serendipitous discovery which is the implantable pacemaker , a few distinct differences such as the cause leading to the research , final usage of the technology and the research procedures can be spotted between them .
Firstly , the most distinct difference between an implantable pacemaker and a laptop is the intentions which led to the discovery of them .
In the case of the laptop , the inventors of the laptop started with the intention of creating a "DynaBook" which is a concept thought up in 1968 .
The "DynaBook" concept is to make a "personal computer for children of all ages" .
The implantable pacemaker , on the other hand , was initially an attempt to build an oscillator to record the sound of heartbeats .
However , when Wilson Greatbatch , inventor of the implantable pacemaker , inserted a wrong resistor and discovered a different reaction , it led to the invention of the first implantable pacemaker .
Therefore , it is obvious that the cause which led to the invention is very different where in the case of the laptop which , it was already intended since before its creation whereas in the case of the implantable pacemaker , its creation was never intended .
Another difference is the final usage of the inventions .
In the case of the laptop , the final usages is what it is intended for since before its creation during the time of conceptualisation of it .
However , in the case of the pacemaker , the final usage was not what it was intended to be .
It was intended to be a machine to record the sound of the heartbeats which was mentioned above but end up as a device to stimulate the heart to serve as a cure for certain heart problems .
As shown above , in the case of most serendipity discoveries , they will normally not be used for the initial purpose of the experiment that led to its discovery whereas in the case of invention through research , it will be the used for its intended purposes .
Lastly , the pace of advancement that led to the invention of the laptop and the pacemaker is different too .
Normally in the case of a serendipitous discovery , there is a sudden advancement in the progress of the research as it is an accidental discovery during the experimental process .
The experiment that discovered the implantable pace maker was done in 1958 and within months of its discovery the first implantable pacemaker was being used on a human being .
However , for the laptop , the concept of it was thought up in 1968 and the first "laptop" only came into existence in 1975 .
On the other hand , there are undeniably some similarities between serendipitous discoveries and discoveries made through conventional research method .
In both example , regardless of its method of discoveries , both are beneficial to mankind and help to improve the quality of life .
The laptop simplified human work whereas the pacemaker help prolong life of some stricken with life threatening diseases .
In conclusion , though there are many differences between the discovery of the laptop and pacemaker shown above , they both help to propel the human race forward into the future .
Today , the change in climate is being labeled as one of the main threats that are affecting the existence of humankind .
For example , global warming has caused the temperature throughout the world to rise , which results in the melting of the icebergs in the North Pole .
Concurrently , the sea level would rise and cause serious floods that would dangerously threaten the survival of our human race .
Thus , we should rank preserving our environment as the main priority among our other needs .
By applying the engineering design process , we could design a product that is environmental friendly .
The first step in the engineering design process is to identify the problem that our product will face .
Firstly , during the manufacturing of the product , we should be environmentally friendly by reducing the amount of wastes produced and ensure that the wastes produced are properly disposed too .
Secondly , we should also use used materials as the main material for our product and ensure our product is recyclable .
The next step is to gather relevant information that would help make our product a success .
The most convenient way to collect the appropriate information is through the use of internet , as there are always search engine available to help get our sources more accurately and quickly .
There are also traditional ways such as using the library and looking through bookstores to gather more detailed information .
The third step is to generate multiple solutions to solve the problems that are stated in the second paragraph .
For example , we could use filters in gas pipes to reduce air pollution from the factories manufacturing the product .
We could also come out with a standard procedure on how to dispose the waste products so that there would be no chemical leakages that are harmful to the environment .
Through more brainstorming within our group , we would arrive with more solutions .
The fourth step is to analyze and to select the best solution .
The best solution would be chosen from the few ideas that we have thought of during the" generating multiple problem" process .
There will be many criteria that we need to fulfill in order to choose the best solution .
The most important criteria are which solution proves to be the most environmental friendly and whether the product will be able to function properly by using mathematical calculation and scientific theory .
The subsequent criteria will be whether it is safe to implement and if it is cost effective to produce .
The last stage in the engineering design process is to test and implement the solution .
We should come out with a series of tests to prove whether the products work in real life environment .
We should also develop a suitable design for our product that would be warmly welcomed by the public .
Even if one of the tests fails , we could apply the engineering design process to solve the problems that developed in the process of the testing .
In conclusion , the engineering design process would be able to help us develop an environmentally friendly product to help preserve the environment .
Therefore , it proves to be a good method to solve most of our needs .
Technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery
Human beings have gone through 21 centuries .
In this long time period , technology developed together with human society .
There is one obvious point that technology developed via different ways .
Two main ways are research and serendipitous discovery .
Both research and serendipitous discovery are very important in technology development .
Technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery differ in some aspects and share similarities in some other aspects .
In terms of development process , technology developed via research and technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery are different .
For technology via research , scientists have a clear plan before they start their research .
They know what they want to get or to achieve at the very beginning .
Then they just do what they should do step by step according to their plan .
Finally , they achieve their goal .
The process of the development of technology developed via research is very systematic with very clear target .
Technology resulted from a serendipitous discovery is different .
Scientists discover a very useful technology unexpectedly .
That means they themselves even do not know they will discover it until they really do .
They do not have the target but they finally get to dig out some new technology .
These two kinds of technology also differ from each other in development input .
As an old saying goes , one cannot make bricks without straw .
Technology research is also the same .
From the moment that scientists decide to work on a new technology , scientists have to put in a lot in order to discover a new technology .
These inputs include time , effort , found , and so on .
Unlike technologies developed via research , technologies resulted from serendipitous need almost zero input .
This kind of technology is just like a gift from god .
It is for free .
What is needed is just luck .
Scientists need such luck to get this god's gift .
So , these two kinds of technology need different input .
Consumer domain is another difference between technology resulted from research and technology resulted from serendipitous discovery .
In most circumstances , scientists are clearly aware of consumers of their technology before they start their research .
They develop certain technology which satisfies certain consumer domains in comparison , scientists usually do not know the use and the specific consumer domains when they first accidently discover a technology .
In spite of these differences , these two kinds of technology share several important similarities .
Both of them are very useful to the development of our society .
They help make our life easier and more comfortable , thus improve our living standard .
If adapted into industry production , both kinds of technology can bring economic benefit .
To conclude , technology developed via research and technology resulted from serendipitous discovery not only have differences but also share similarities .
Even though these two kinds of technology develop from different ways , they both can benefit society and our daily life .
Over the past century , the technological boom has brought about much comfort and convenience through different inventions .
These luxury items , although they bring about a lot of convenience to our lives , are major culprits of destroying our environment .
As such , one of the main human needs would be to restore balance and lengthen the lifetime of our environment .
The process of creating new inventions , also labelled as engineering design process , is able to address this issue .
This can be done by taking into consideration the factor of inventions being environmentally friendly as one of its major factors in the five steps of engineering design process , which are as follows: Defining the problem , gathering information , generating solutions , analysing and selecting a solution and implementing the solution . 
The step of defining the problem is very important .
It points the whole purpose of the process in the right direction .
Thus , for new problems defined , the factor of it being environmentally friendly can be factored in .
For example , eco-friendly gym equipments today are able harness the energy generated during its use to power the machine itself .
This innovation eliminates the need for external power for the gym equipment .
Moreover , new inventions should not be the only products with a "green" factor as old inventions can be revised in order to cohere to the "green" status .
One such example would be the invention of hybrid cars which are recognised as environmentally friendly automobiles .
The next step is to gather information and generate solutions .
Information gathering is a step which allows the designer to be equipped with background information of the problem before tackling it .
At this step , researching on the various methods in order for the product to be more environmentally friendly should be one of the main concerns .
It also allows them to consider existing solutions , if any , and consider various factors which will determine the success of the product such as the economical factors of the product and its effectiveness .
Thus , solutions generated from these ideas should be able to resolve the problems indentified as well as conforming to the requirements of society .
The solutions should be environmentally friendly such as being able to bypass or convert the by-products which are harmful to the environment , such as greenhouse gases or toxic waste .
Moreover , not only should the product solve the initial problem , it should also meet society's demand in terms of usability , ergonomics and economical concerns .
Thereafter , the next step would be the process of selecting the solution for implementation .
This process selects a solution generated in the previous step that best meets the requirements of the problem .
Each problem is different and unique , thus , they would have different factors to consider for analysis .
Every design is rated based on the consideration of various factors such as functionality , ergonomics , mechanical , manufacturability , safety , economical and for regulations and compliance .
The solutions would then be rated according to different criteria corresponding to the analysis and the best would be then selected .
Since the need for an environmentally friendly product is the emphasis for the invention , its functionality would naturally be a priority for consideration .
After which , safety is another area of concern .
Finally , the solution will only be implemented after going through a series of rigorous tests and improvements .
In conclusion , engineering design process is a general process which ideas can be generated to resolve current issues .
One of the main human needs of the current millennium would be to have a sustainable environment in view of the rapid progression of our technology .
Engineering design process is able to address this issue by encompassing and focusing on being environmentally friendly for every invention .
Technological developments are divided into two different categories: the conventional method of developing technology through researching or through serendipitous discovery .
The two technological innovation discussed would be the Laptop Computer and Sildenafil  .
Though they are on opposite spectrum in terms of the field of technology , both have similarities in their own way .
One difference , aside from their uses , is in the manner which they were developed .
The development of the laptop in Toshiba took on a systematic and direct approach towards an apparent goal: to reduce the size of a personal computer so it will be compact enough and portable .
On the other hand , Sildenafil , the compound in Viagra , was synthesised and studied initially for usage in treating hypertension and angina pectoris  .
However , clinical trials showed that it did not treat angina but instead , stimulate significant penile erection .
The company , Pfizer , thus decided to manufacture the compound into pills and market it as a drug to treat erectile dysfunction .
Another difference between the two technological developments was approvals from the inventor's company leaders .
In the case of Viagra , the inventors Peter Dunn and Albert Wood had the blessings of their company to carry out their research and were given research facilities and funding .
Tetsuya Mizoguchi , on the contrary , had to go "underground" with the laptop research project in the company's other factory , diverting funds and shifting engineers from military projects to design the laptop , despite being denied development funds and an experienced team of engineers  .
Ironically , after the success , Tetsuya was promoted to Toshiba's board of directors while the inventors of Viagra were denied recognitions for their invention .
Yet , aside from being products of different fields , both technologies were able to commercialise into products successfully .
Pfizer managed to patent the newly synthesised Sildenafil  , incorporate it into pill form before marketing it as an oral treatment for erectile dysfunction .
In 2000 , Viagra sales accounted for 92 percent of the global market for prescribed erectile dysfunction pills .
The laptop was a radically different innovation then , nevertheless , it was marketed furiously and soon had majority market shares in Europe , United States and Japan  .
Another similarity between both technologies was that they had competitors .
Global shares of Viagra dropped to 50 percent due to other erectile dysfunction pill manufacturers like Cialis , Levitra and several counterfeits and clones .
Toshiba , similarly , has seen its fair share of competition with leading names like Dell , Apple and Fujitsu .
Finally , both innovations have helped enrich the lives of people by addressing a need or a problem .
Offices in Japan are crowded and homes are small with no space to install a desktop gave rise to a need for smaller personal computers .
The problem of male erectile dysfunction was solved by the innovative development of Viagra , though it was a 'coincidence' the compound Sildenafil causes penile erection .
In conclusion , though the development of Viagra was serendipitous and would seem unfair to the arduous task of development via research in the case of Tetsuya's laptop project , both worked towards a common goal of enriching lives , which I feel is first and foremost the basis of technological advancement .
Also , let us not forget that chemists , Peter Dunn and Albert Wood , were also working systematically towards creating a compound to treat hypertension and angina .
Transportation is a necessity that humans cannot live without .
The number of car on the road keep on increasing year by year and so do the pollution that arises from it .
Therefore engineers need to come up with better design of environmentally friendly hybrid cars that run on green energy fuel to replace the current diesel engine cars .
The first step in engineering better hybrid cars is to define the problems of current hybrid cars and to gather information about them .
Current hybrid cars available in the market are not practical and do not appeal to the mass market .
Some of the factors include the lack of recharging stations and the high cost of producing it .
This deters consumers from switching their old diesel powered cars to the more environmentally friendly hybrid cars .
We also need to make a complete market survey on the reasons why hybrid cars are not getting the attention of consumers .
As stated by Khandani in "Engineering Design Process , 2005" , consumers are the one that ultimately establish the need for a product .
Thus , understanding this need of environmentally friendly hybrid cars is of importance before proceeding to the next step of the design solution .
Next , engineers need to generate multiple solutions for the hybrid cars .
This includes brainstorming sessions to find new alternative fuels and designing a new engine that can run on it .
Engineers also need to make comparison on the latest hybrid cars such as electric cars , hydrogen fuel cell cars and solar powered cars to see which one is more efficient and suitable .
Willingness to take risks and experiment with new alternative fuels are also important so that more creative ideas can be generated .
Then , we proceed to the next stage of analyzing the various solutions and selecting the best one .
As highlighted by Khandani , there are some factors that may need to be considered in the analysis such as the product safety , functional analysis , market analysis and mechanical analysis .
The hybrid cars should be tested for its safety and functionality .
For instance , solar powered hybrid cars need to be ensured that it has enough energy to function well in the night .
Hydrogen fuel cell cars must have a practical way of emitting water as its waste .
We also need to analyze the safety of the designs .
If it is below par , we can add adequate safety features or a thorough instruction manual to it .
Lastly , after going through rigorous analyzing and selecting the final design , we need to make a prototype of the hybrid car and test its overall function in real world situations .
This will reveal the weaknesses in the design , hence the engineers can improve on it .
We also need to test and check various criteria so that the hybrid car meets the needs of the consumers .
Documentation and patent on the overall design should be done at this stage .
Then , we need to execute extensive marketing and awareness campaign to get consumers to buy the hybrid car .
To conclude , engineering a new design of environmentally friendly hybrid car helps to reduce pollution by using green fuels such as electric and solar power .
Creative engineering design can produce a paradigm shift for people to start using environmentally friendly cars due to all its positive advantages .
What is the best alternative of fossil fuel ?
The answer is widely believed to be one of the renewable energies , which include solar energy , wind power and so on .
However , in the process of looking for new energy source to take place of coals and oils , a more urgent problem of the energy system has been neglected -- the storage of the energy .
If the coal , oil and sunshine can be regarded as the primary energy carriers , the battery , whose energy can be consumed effectively and cleanly , is the secondary energy carrier , which relates to our daily life more closely .
Ironically , comparing with the primary energy carriers , the battery is far less popular and only used in some specific fields .
How can the engineering design make it widely used by innovating ?
The process can be divided into three parts , defining the problems of battery , finding the solutions and selling the new products .
Although battery is not widely used today , it is possible to change the situation by innovating .
To enhance the capacity of the battery , keep trying new materials is important .
Since the new battery is designed to use in the big machines to replace engines , the capacity will have the priority .
The engineers can try some heavy materials without worrying about the weight and volume .
Additionally , the engineers can also redesign the energy system of the big machines to cooperate with the battery to get a best efficiency .
To shorten the charge time , the technicians can get some ideas from the design of small batteries , which can be fully charged in fifteen minutes .
The last part of the process is to sell the products .
The popularization of battery is not isolated as an energy carrier , it should be together with the innovation of the electrical cars and other engineering products to form an industry chain .
The chain will also include the battery charge station , which will replace the refueling station as the popularization of battery .
To sum up , the engineering design process can be a good way to innovate new generation of battery .
A process that includes defining , solving and selling will build a whole industry chain of new battery , and finally meet the energy carrier need of the society .
Nowadays , there will always be an engineer designed product wherever we go to or whatever we do .
They are the results of engineer designs to meet our needs .
In order for us to progress faster , more money needs to be pumped to the research sector so that discoveries like cures for illnesses , could be discovered faster .
Therefore , engineers should design products or systems that could improve the economy .
Engineer designs that save energy , cut costs and save manpower are the key to improving the economy so that more money can be used for more research .
New form of or improved transportation could help to reduce costs and save time .
Teleportation is the ideal form of transportation in most of our dreams .
Although it is indeed unrealistic and impossible , we can never know if it can be realised .
No one thought that mobile phones were possible hundreds years ago too .
However , realistically , we could improve our transportation through better public transport design systems .
One example would be replacing drivers with automated computerized transports .
By replacing drivers with automated computerizations , manpower could be saved and public transports would be less costly .
With cheaper transports , people would have more money to spend , improving the economy .
In cities around the world , large amount of energy are consumed by electrical appliances every day .
By designing better electrical appliances that could perform the same function with lesser energy used , we could save a large amount of energy .
One example would be designing a fridge that uses less power to run .
With lesser energy used , costs of living are reduced and the economy would improve with more people having more money to spend .
Another way to improve the economy would be through the designing of new form of energy sources .
As the natural resources are depleting , price of using it as source of energy is becoming increasingly costly .
One such example would be the price of petrol .
Therefore , through discovery of new form of convenient and renewable energy , the price of energy could be more stable .
With a more stable price , it reduces the chance of a big change that could lead to economy problems .
Given the current shaky economy , another big upset would have an adverse effect on our lives .
Therefore , a stable economy is essential for us to progress in technology and having a more reliable source of energy is the key to it .
With a population of 1 .15 billion , a total area of 3 .2 million square kilometers , twenty eight states  , seven union territories , diversity in culture and around a hundred different languages  , India , has certain significant problems in the hampering of engineering design processes for innovations .
Though engineering design is considerably well established in the country , some practical problems , play spoil sport .
Despite having the manpower , she is still not technologically advanced in comparison to the other developing countries like China , Brazil and Egypt .
The two main causes for this problem are population outburst and corruption .
The population of India is rapidly multiplying , increasing from 1 .147 billion in 2008 to 1 .15 billion in 2009 , in a course of just one year .
This makes it difficult to implement innovations , especially in relation to engineering design .
Having a literacy rate of 61 percent , it is quite difficult to introduce new technological innovations , as not all the people in the country would understand and know how to utilize the product well .
Another problem is 'Brain Drain' or "human capital flight" which began taking away India's brain power at a rapid rate .
This is because the job opportunities are better in foreign countries in comparison with the state of unemployment in India .
"This concept of taking education in a country but earning for another is known as brain drain ."
The western countries open up more job opportunities as they acquire cheap and hardworking labour .
Problems such as second highest population , vast size , low literacy rate and 'Brain Drain' have made it difficult for India to take a step towards technological innovations in the field of engineering design .
Currently , corruption is wide-spread in India .
"India is ranked 85 out of a 179 countries in {Transparency International}'s{Corruption Perceptions Index} , although its score has improved consistently from 2 .7 in 2002 to 3 .4 in 2008 ."
The revenue involved in this widespread mishap is very high , thereby affecting all the facets of the country .
Even the poverty stricken section of the society is forced to bribe the officials for their living .
Right from education every other field in India is flooded with corrupt officials who primarily work with a self centered mindset to misappropriate and amass huge amount of money .
These individuals are indifferent to the fact that majority of India's population is below the poverty line .
While the rich get richer , the poor keep getting poorer .
The 'black' money does not get released into the economy for the fear of law and hence hampers the economy , widening the bridge between the 'haves and have nots' , pulling more people under the poverty line .
This multi faceted economic problem poses as the main hindrance to India's technological development and is the mother of all other social and political problems that India faces .
Despite having morbid and influential problems , population and corruption , India is still a fore runner in the economic scenario and has a steady development rate .
The reason for this is its integrity .
Furthermore the young generation is well informed and is taking several initiatives to rectify the previously committed mistakes , thus causing the country to accelerate in a path of new economic revelations .
How do we invent products or systems ?
Do we simply just think of an idea and create a product to try and solve a problem ?
As engineers , most of us will use a process identified as the engineering design process .
The design process is a 5 stage process which includes defining the problem , gathering useful information , finding multiple solutions , narrowing down the solution and testing and implementing the solution .
The 5 stages are sequential which means that an interruption in any of the 5 steps can hamper the engineering design process .
In Malaysia , engineering design processes for innovation have not been evolving as much as the government would like .
The problems that contribute to it is that there are not many quality engineers left in Malaysia and the local society's mindset .
The first problem is the lack of quality engineers left in Malaysia .
Most engineers leave for financial reasons .
The value of the ringgit is rather low so engineers tend to favor working overseas as the salary is higher and the working environment is much better .
For example , Malaysians who studied in Singapore are required to sign a bond which ties them to work in Singapore for a few years .
After working in Singapore , most of them will not return to work in Malaysia as the pay is almost double compared to working locally .
The engineers produces in local universities are not able to fill the gap left by the engineers who leave the country .
The second problem is the society's mindset .
Malaysians have a very conservative way of thinking .
They are not willing to take new risks in terms of design innovations .
Malaysians are contented easily and refuse to improve on existing innovations and technologies .
Malaysian societies are also uncooperative in their work .
They are not willing to seek help from foreign countries and source most of the work to unqualified local companies .
Apart from that , it is well known how corrupted the country is .
Corruption can lead to unmotivated work ethics .
The problems listed above can have an impact on all or one of the 5 stages of engineering design process .
First and foremost , the conventional thinking of Malaysians can affect the first stage of the process that is defining the problem .
Their traditional thinking will not be able to identify what the needs of the country are .
The uncooperative nature of the country can influence the design process in terms of generating multiple solutions .
We need to work together with other nations to tackle a problem because other countries may have different views to a problem solution .
Most significantly , because of the insufficient amount of engineers in the country , we are just not able to source enough manpower to accomplish the design process .
In conclusion , the progress of engineering designed is being disrupted by local society and the lack of engineers .
As the rest of the world continue to improve technologically , we advance at a slower pace .
There is a need to have an attitude change in both the government and society .
Engineers should remain in the country and not just leave for personal benefits .
They should consider helping improve the level of design innovation in the country so that we can compete globally .
Incredible as it seems in such a resource-rich earth , the energy crisis has become one makeable problem .
But the fact is that the shortage of energy has affected the whole human society and our further development .
As Tennessee Valley Authority disclosed that the normal 60-day store of coal now can only supply ten to twelve days  .
This means that our resources cannot fulfill our increasing demand .
The most pressing issue is finding a replacement for fossil resources .
One of the most suitable replacements is nuclear power .
However , there are some concerns about it , such as security , costs and performance , which have limited the popularization of this promising substitute approach .
In order to resolve these problems , a new generation of nuclear energy system which is called the Fourth Generation reactors is under test .
One of the six approaches that named as supercritical-water-cooled reactor can give us a way for our future energy with further researches .
Supercritical-water-cooled reactors share the benefits of Generation IV and some further benefits compared with other kinds of reactors , SCWR may also resolve some concerns about safety and cost with some further development .
SCWR as one of the six reactor concepts for Generation IV nuclear fuel , share the same advantage with all other reactors and some further predominance compared with other reactors .
Generating electricity in a sustainable , economically viable , safe and reliable manner is the basic goals of Generation IV .
Sustainable means that the system should generate power by some natural fuel , at the same time , minimize the environmental impact .
Economically viable means that the generating cost should be competitive with other energy resources , meanwhile the capital investment should also be low enough to allow access to a large number of countries .
Safe and reliable mainly emphasize that the future reactors should perform better or at least as well in terms of the safety and reliability as current ones .
The focus is to decrease the emission of radiation and insure the safety of civilians once accident happen .
Compared with other reactors , SCWR is advanced as its higher thermal efficiency and simple plant .
The SCWR is effective because only one cycle is involved .
Furthermore , the SCWR does not require steam separator plates , heat exchangers nor turbines compared with BWR .
All the simple design reduced the construction cost of nuclear electrical station .
Also the coolant of SCWR is water which is cheaper compared with other kinds of reactors .
Not only does design entail magnificent facade or a weird opinion of a maverick , but it also involves pragmatism , cost and efficiency .
All these requirements are fully passed just by those who are well educated .
Quite the opposite , while there is a highly increasing demand in engineers with acuity of design , even in the education system of my own country , there are two major setbacks for engineering students getting adequate design skills: the lack of practice in school and the insufficiency of co-curricular activities .
Firstly , students in high schools do not have enough useful practice time in their schedule .
Although the curriculum has recently been continually improved to gradually reduce the conventional teaching method , the reality is still a void in students' lab skills .
The reason is that the equipping of new device needed for experiments is not in tandem with the changing of textbooks .
Only in the urban areas can students have opportunities to get access to the required equipments .
Regarding students in other places , they can merely see the teacher do a sample experiment in the lecture but cannot try by themselves .
Even worse in some remote areas , students can only listen to the description of the experiment by the teacher .
According the Labor Newspaper , Hung Yen , a south province of Viet Nam , there are thousands of students are studying without sufficient lab equipments due to the delay in project of purchasing new equipments and corruption .
In these regions , another factor that breaks the camel's back is the exodus of young lab teachers to cities where they can have a conducive environment to develop their own job and earn a better living .
The residue of this migration is an old generation teachers who do not much familiar with modern device in labs .
Consequently , students do not have chance to learn the priceless pragmatic experience of how to design in work .
Secondly , students do not attend enough efficient co-curricular activities in school .
This can be accounted for the fact there are few organizations in almost all schools .
There was , in fact , one organization , namely the Youth Union , in my secondary school .
When I went to high school , luckily we had three organizations: the Youth Union , Harmonica club and PTNK Soccer league .
Though activities held by the above organizations ranged from learning history , stance to acquiring leadership , not many students were benefited from them .
That is due to the fact that the number of attendants for one activity just covered a small portion of the whole students in school .
Moreover , since co-curricular is not compulsory in our country , and the studying in other learning centers takes up almost all time of students , they tends to drop co-curricular activities in school .
The Youth Newspaper recorded a New Zealand professor that Vietnamese students spent so much time to study academic knowledge that co-curricular activities became something "luxurious" .
The two aforementioned issues leave engineering students to be detrimental effects on their design process for innovation .
For one thing , students who are not used to doing lab , research usually have just a vague image of what should be done .
For them , the first step of design process seems to be far away as they cannot define the problems completely since "people have a natural tendency to attack the current solution to a problem rather than the problem itself"  .
As a result , all the rest of process can be ruined because of the first steps , for example , if the problem statement is not broad enough , the statement will preclude the new thoughts on the issue .
Thus , it is arduous to undo the whole process , otherwise these novice engineers have to accept low-quality products and , consistently , low profit .
Another thing is that without experiments in co-curricular activities , fledgling engineers cannot fulfill the second and the third steps: collecting pertinent information , generate multiple solutions .
This is because they will lack of confident in communication with other colleagues to gather information as well as learning experience , so they hardly can find out the most effective information , let alone their inaptitude in information-searching method .
Co-curricular activities also give engineering students necessary creativity and imagination to come up with many answers for a single question .
If students do not actively join various activities , they will be apt to apply solely rules and theory in school to work .
However , "creativity is much more than just a systematic application of rules and theory to solve a technical problem" .
Losing creativity and imagination means that they are losing their advantage in the knife edge market .
As a result , the difficulty in dealing with the first three steps is a veritable hindrance for the whole project .
In brief , what impedes engineering process design for innovation in my country's education system is the lack of practice and co-curricular skills .
However , with efforts to reform education , I optimistically believe that we can overcome these obstacles to be competitive engineers in global market .
First , it is the lack of creativity .
Every individual has a different mindset some are born lazy , while some are not .
In Singapore , a number of us are the lazy type , which means we are lazy to design .
Also there are some that are shy to speak up about their ideas .
Another problem would be individuals with fixed mindsets , thinking that designing are not a good path to take .
For example , from Marcelo Ang's talk , he mentioned that it is always the mental block of an individual that makes everyone thought of not to go for designing .
Hence the need to remove that mental block , so that the individuals will have the opportunity to design and invent what they desire for .
As a result , this may cause the market to lose out good designers , which could potentially help boost the market .
This will impact the market because there will be an unavailability of new products .
Without people designing new products and stuffs , there will be no new products in the market .
This in turn will cause the market to suffer , in the article Designing engineers to change the world , Chan mentioned that market users always demand for new products , which they are fascinated with .
Moreover , when there are no new products , these potential customers are lost .
Hence , causing the market to suffer .
Second , it is due to the time taken to create a full design product .
A design process is not a one-night outcome .
It might take days and months to perfect the design so as to ensure that the end product is good .
Thereafter , more problems may arise such as finding and building of the parts and materials that are not readily available in Singapore .
For example , a lot of stress tests had to be done during the process of making NEWater  .
This includes tests on human to confirm that it is fit for drinking before it is produced for public consumption .
Those tests were not done in a day or month .
It took more than a year to complete .
This leads to other effects and impacts the market .
People will tend to go for simpler designs , because of the long time required to create a proper full design .
Reason being , it will be much easier to design and time required would be much lesser .
This will result to poor designs produced in the market .
Hence market users will not be tempted to buy the product , which would cause the sales and market to be low .
Additionally , this will also lead to loss income to the designer as they might not earn their production cost back .
Eventually potential designers will have second thoughts and step out of designing .
In conclusion , the lack of creativity and the time to create a design could cause impacts to the market in Singapore .
These problems that may hamper the engineering design would impact the market causing the unavailability of new products , designers taking shortcuts in design and changing mindsets about design .
In addition , this would lead to market downturn .
I personally feel that the most common problem originates from every individual's mindset , when they have already made up their mind .
It's hard to change once it's fixed .
I believe that if an individual takes up the courage to change , and design a proper design , it would resolve the problems that are hampering the design process for innovations .
In your home country some problems significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
Describe two of these problems and explain their impacts on effects on certain stages of the process .
We humans always dream .
We have never been satisfied with what we want .
We are always out there looking for something better .
It might seem that we are greedy  , but the fact that I am writing this essay sitting comfortably in an air conditioned room is fact enough to validate our greed and curiosity .
If we weren't greedy for more always just imagine how different the world would have been .
Just an hour without the majestic invention of electricity just drives everyone crazy .
The boom of innovation and technology in the past few decades has just been tremendous .
Every country wants to be technologically forward and pumps in enormous amounts of money and resources into leading innovations and research developments .
However the standard of research and innovations being administered in every country varies to a great deal .
This is influenced by the different social and economic atmospheres prevalent .
Now I am going to talk about the various issues that hamper engineering design and innovations in my own country , India .
The first thing that jumps right into your mind when you read about India is its vast size and a whooping population of over 1 .1 billion  .With such a vast population the onus on the government to ensure the welfare of the people is tremendous .
With a large part of the population depending on the government for subsidies and food  , most of the annual budget is spent in ensuring that the people are well fed .
With India being a democratic country the major revenue for the government is taxes paid by the people .
With the standard of living not being quite high the revenue earned by the government is also quite less .
Therefore the amount of money the government can afford to spend on the research projects is quite less comparatively .
India spends only 450 million USD per year on research  .
One of the major responsibilities of the government of any country is providing quality education to the children .
This has always been quite a problem for India .
With its vast size and population a lot of the rural areas still lack proper schools .
Fifty percent of the children living in these rural areas leave school before completing their fifth grade  .
These children then resort to manual labour .
This is quality human resource lost .
These children may one day turn into great thinkers and scientists  ,but due to lack of proper facilities they drop out of school .
It is no wonder that India lags in technological innovations and research .
However in the cities the quality of education is world class .
The people educated in the cities are now exposed to the entire world .
They are quite well learned .
Some of them tend to leave the country in search of better prospects in the developed countries .
The chance of earning huge sums of money and a quality lifestyle just makes them leave their country as though they are leaving their house to take a leisurely stroll .
With the government spending huge sums of money on them and these people not even repaying the government by working here and paying taxes here  , it is a huge blow for the government .
More than 300 ,000 Indians migrate to the United States and over 75 percent of these people have had tertiary education  .
With such highly educated individuals leaving the country the scope for leading research becomes quite limited ,scarce .
Another factor is that a lot of the developed countries attract foreign talent in addition to their own population .
India is not able to do that .
With the standard of living and environment not meeting that of the developed countries we are unable to attract brilliant individuals from different parts of the world .
With all these factors playing a role  , the engineering design and innovation is hampered quite a lot .
Steps have been taken to minimise the effects of these factors  , but there is still a long way to go to see all these factors vanishing all together .
Several private organisations have started helping the people in what little way they can .
Innovation engineering has been a commonly recurrent phrase among the industries in the recent years .
However , exactly how many engineers fully understand the full meaning and implications behind the simple phrase ?
Furthermore , how many understand the long and exhausting process required for innovative engineering operations to be executed and optimized ?
The process of concept generation , product testing and product implementation requires lots of resources .
These resources come in the form of time , which translates to financial terms , and experience in the process .
In the Singapore society where it is relatively result orientated , people tend to be afraid to try out new ideas as they are afraid they will lose out to the intense competition they face from the others .
Hence , engineers will rather stick to tried and proven methods that are seen to be effective , instead of explore for more alternative methods .
However , these engineers fail to realise that failures are the key to innovation .
Without having gone through failures , new and better processes would not be developed properly , and thus failing to achieve optimisation .
The environment makes it hard for companies to allocate resources for innovation , and at the same time , keep the company's competitive edge in the market .
Due to this problem , fresh ideas would not even have a chance to be developed , least to say , move towards the implementation of the idea .
This gradually develops into an inflexible culture , whereby our workers choose to stick to current beliefs rather than try out new ideas .
Generating new concepts do not just require a single day of effort , as what people believe , but instead require a longer thought process which may take days or even months .
The culture in Singapore does not even allow our workers to make time for this crucial concept generation process .
Another problem we face in Singapore is the lack of experience our country has in the innovative engineering field .
Compared to developed countries , which have years of experience in the field , our nation has just begun to prosper .
Previously , public policies have guided our nation towards the manufacturing arena .
This has brought rise to various government bodies efficient in international operating and manufacturing standards .
However , it has only been in recent years that our government has moved towards research and development .
Therefore , it would take quite some time to gear local engineers towards an innovative mindset .
Engineering processes not only rely on theories , but a lot on the engineer's experience .
Chief engineers who have been in the field for a period of time would be valuable resources .
However , it would take years for a new generation of engineers to be trained in innovative engineering .
Innovative engineering requires the engineer to venture into areas which have yet to be explored , which makes the experience even more vital , as it would allow problems to be identified even before they occur .
These problems would most probably yet to be explored by current engineers .
In conclusion , Singapore should open up to accept more challenges and failures especially for the younger generations of engineers .
The younger engineers should be more daring and dare to venture into the innovative world to discover new ideas .
As the third biggest country with the largest population in the world , there are still some unavoidable problems of engineering design processes for innovations in a developing country , China .
Two major problems among these are: the low acceptance of engineering design and the complex verification before licensing procedures for engineering projects .
The problems all above are related to people's attitudes towards engineering design and the political situation for engineering innovations , implying the heavy going improvement of engineering design .
Even though , it is a journey of hardships for Chinese innovations in the field of engineering design , which really suffers quite a lot at the moment , the future for Chinese engineering innovations is still bright with the government striving to achieve the goal for a healthy environment of engineering supervision .
In today's world , the significance of nuclear energy cannot be ignored .
In some countries , nuclear energy plays an important role in power in power production .
Currently , "nuclear energy supplies about 80% and 30% of the electricity in France and Japan respectively ." .
More prominently , countries are using nuclear energy to make powerful weapons for military purposes .
We know how Iran and North Korea have been using their nuclear 'power' to negotiate with the US .
However , these powerful weapons were not were not within scientists' imagination of how nuclear energy would be utilised .
Scientists probably had intended to use nuclear energy for peaceful purposes like using it as an alternative source of energy production .
Hence , we shall examine how nuclear energy grew and how it is important to the world now and in the near future .
Nuclear energy was discovered in the early 1990s  .
Scientists discovered that a huge amount of energy could be produced from the nuclear fission of the element uranium .
We shall not go down to the details of that process but it was a major scientific discovery as it leads to another form of energy production .
Unfortunately , nuclear energy's first real useful application was on Japan's cities where two nuclear bombs landed and caused massive destruction .
While this historical event marked the end of WWII , it presented nuclear energy to the rest of the world .
Soon , countries like Russia and China became nuclear 'powers' as well .
Their governments funded nuclear research and the setting up of more nuclear reactors .
Naturally , nuclear weapons became increasingly sophisticated as nuclear countries reinvent these weapons and vie to be the most powerful nuclear state .
Now , nuclear weapons , from what we know , can be flown to a faraway place to cause massive destruction .
However , the use of nuclear weapons on another country has been non-existent since WWII as countries realize the chaos it could cause .
Moreover , the primary purpose of nuclear energy is to generate electricity .
Unlike energy produced by burning carbon , nuclear energy is clean as no greenhouse gases is produced from nuclear plants , where nuclear energy is made .
Using more nuclear energy and less carbon-generated energy to produce electrical energy could mean a significant decrease in greenhouse gases and a cleaner earth to live in .
Countries like France rely on nuclear power as much as other countries that rely on carbon to generate electricity .
Hence , nuclear energy might become essential in the near future as the world seeks to solve the problems due to global warming .
At the same time , just like any other forms that could be used to generate electricity , nuclear power is not a perfect source of energy too .
The danger of radioactivity is always imminent as critics often refer to the nuclear accident in Chernobyl that resulted in many deaths and serious repercussions such as unnatural births many years after the accident .
In addition , even if nuclear accidents do not occur , spent nuclear fuel would remain radioactive for decades .
As a result , land space has to be sacrificed to accommodate waste storage .
In conclusion , nuclear energy would probably play an important as the Earth's carbon resources are used up .
However , nuclear countries should only encourage research on nuclear energy production for peaceful purposes .
They should not use it as a weopon in war as this could spell the end of the world .
The creation NEWater , a technology where used water is treated to become potable , is one of the few examples of success in the research of technology in Singapore .
Prior to this achievement , PUB faced many obstacles and that includes the lack of engineering technology which made the cost of implementation unrealistic .
As a result , this plan was shelved in the 1980s .
Similarly , Singapore is currently facing problems that hamper its ambition of coming up with great innovations .
One of these problems is the rigid education system that is restricting the growth of the minds of young Singaporeans , mainly the teenagers .
At the same time , the comfortable state of living in Singapore has posed the challenge on provoking the minds of its people to improve their current state of living .
All these may then lead to the slowdown of the technological advancement in Singapore .
The Ministry of Education in Singapore adopts an academic based education system , where excellent examination results are prioritized over the creativity of one's mind .
Parents and teachers emphasized a lot in obtaining 'A' grades and hence students have a misconception towards education .
They have the impression that doing well in examinations equates to success in their future endeavours .
Moreover , academy promotion mainly requires students to reproduce the knowledge conservatively without much consideration .
As such , lesser time is made for attending brain teasing courses and for almost all cases , they are made optional to students and their importance is not highlighted .
Hence , 'students from Singapore tops result in Mathematics and Science among their peers from other 41 countries but when it comes to designing , Singaporeans are way behind their foreign peers'  .
It is then evident that Singaporean students are proficient in examination questions yet failing in creativity .
In view of the restrictions set on one's creativity , there is no doubt why designing novel engineering processes is beginning to be seen as outstanding talent in our society .
The other problem Singapore faces is , ironically , its high standard of living .
More importantly , the efficient system of governance in Singapore lives up to most of the promises made to its people during general elections .
Given their comfortable lifestyle they are enjoying , the idea of bringing about a change is not of their priority .
For instance , they have upgraded the facilities in housing estates , such as the implementation of the Lift Upgrading Scheme , and this brings about the 'tardiness' in Singaporeans to think about further improvements to their life .
Their focus , instead , is directed at their routine occupational job and their own family matters and therefore , the element of creative is not part of their daily life .
The result that consequently led by these problems is the failure to generate creative ideas as a solution or improvement to their surroundings .
The scope of their thoughts is relatively narrow and hence they usually fail to come up with innovations that are beyond their imagination .
Surprisingly , what Singaporeans have in mind as the ideal solution may not be in tandem with other fellow foreigners .
Eventually , without a niche in designing , they will then lose out to the 'brains' from other countries when it comes to employment for 'a designer is a planner with an aesthetic sense' .
Not only do we need to be knowledgeable , originality , too , plays an important role when it comes to being a great innovator .
In conclusion , Singapore has to move away from its current mindset and practices in order to succeed in coming up with engineering design processes for innovations .
For example , Singapore needs to , and have already begun to , deviate from its regimental approach of learning .
MOE has been 'moving in recent years towards nurturing young Singaporeans who ask questions , and who are willing to think of new ways to solve new problems ,' in an attempt to inculcate the positive mindset of learning at a tender age .
In the meantime , Singapore has also declared that it will increase its investment in research and development to 3% of its GDP by 2010 .
The bold decision to invest billion of dollars into R&D will make people realize the importance of innovations to the sustainability of Singapore and no doubt open up more avenues for new discovery to be made .
All in all , both measures that Singapore's government is taking clearly reflect on its intention to drive Singapore to become one of the leading countries in terms of technology .
