"Think outside the box" .
It is the sentence that we all heard many times before when it comes to innovation .
Singapore , as a young nation with no natural resources , depends heavily on its human resources to survive .
To be able to capture the consumers in the market , we have to be innovative in product designs .
However , I think problems like the fixed mindset of the person and the lacking of resources may hamper with engineering design process for innovations .
Firstly , many people have a fixed mindset .
They tend to worry what other might think and are afraid of criticism by others .
Self-criticism is also another issue that hinders creativity .
Most people believe themselves to be lacking in creativity and think that others will not like their ideas .
Hence during the presentation of ideas , they will present it with little or no confidence because they are afraid of making fools of themselves .
Therefore , others will take it that there is a lack of enthusiasm in the idea .
Also if someone has received a negative response , there is a high chance that they will not pursue any innovative attempts anymore .
Sometimes , people have the tendency to make products too complex and too focused on factors like usability that it results in a design barrier .
Not everyone encourage new ideas .
Often their reaction to new things is negative .
These will also further hinder creativity .
Secondly , since Singapore is small , it is limited in resources .
We often have to import materials from other countries .
As a result , the cost of production will be expensive and people rather choose to design a simple product and not to invest in the product innovation and research .
Also we have a small talent pool of people with innovative ideas .
Hence , most people do not possess the skills that are able to design any innovative products .
As a result of the problems that hamper with engineering design process for innovation , many fail to identify those unmet needs of the market , causing the market to suffer .
Instead of having new type of products in the market to capture the attention of the consumers , the market ended up with many different products having similar features and functions .
As mentioned by Chan in his lecture , many people are also willingly to pay more for design as well as for new products that they think are simple , practical and useful .
For instance , Apple iPhones were in high demand in the market during its launch because of it design , simplicity and reliability although the features of the iPhones are generally the same as many other smartphones in the market .
In conclusion , it is possible to avoid all aspects which will hamper with engineering design process for innovations by changing the mindset of the people as well as to find alternative ways to solve the problem of lacking of resources .
We should attempt to make changes to our way of life in order to begin a larger change in our lives be more innovative .
Engineering design process plays an important role in innovation and creativity .
Since the resources in the world are limited and decreasing , many countries are making efforts to develop the designing process to use the resources more efficiently and improving the standard of life .
However , in my country there are still some problems that hamper the creativity and design , especially the lack of resource and the behavior of customers .
In this essay , I will discuss about these obstacles and how they affect the design process .
First of all , one of the biggest obstacles that hamper the engineering design process in my country is the lack of resources which includes both factors: the human resources and natural resources .
Human resources , in this case , can be known as the labor force needed for design with skillful abilities and knowledge .
Without knowledge , an engineer cannot start his designing process because he does not know where to begin and what to create .
As a result , the lack of human resource affects the design process at the very first stages .
Another factor that also deteriorates the creativity is natural resources , as known as the space , time , materials  . . . for designing .
For example , in my country , many projects had to be postponed because there are not enough materials to make the products .
When waiting for importing the resources from other countries , these projects were still on the paper .
Therefore , natural resources are important at the stages of implement the ideas to create the products .
Secondly , the behaviors of the users also cause many problems when providing the products to the market .
Customers are usually afraid of changing the current product to new ones when they think the old one is satisfactory .
Once they are used to with the current product , it is hard to persuade them to switch to the new one because they have to learn how to use the new device .
This may not be a big matter of the young but with the old people , the problem is much more greater .
For example , my mother just want to use the traditional line-phone than the cell-phone because making a call with the hand-phone is quite complex than just picking the line-phone and dialing .
Consequently , a new product , although has been well and functionally designed , could be easily refused if it was not friendly to them .
In this situation , the behaviors of the customers are the key factors which directly determine the successful of the product in the last stages of the engineering design process-making the product and bring it to the market .
In conclusion , the two factors : lack of resources and behaviors of the customers cause great problems to the engineering design process in my country .
They affects most stages of the design process as they can postpone the process or even though stop it .
Unfortunately , these problems cannot be solved in a short-run , it needs much efforts to bring back the knowledge and materials into my country .

Believe it or not , it is reported that there are over 100 vending machines in this university alone .
Vending machine is almost available at everywhere .
We can see them in hospital , parks or even jungles !
It is no doubt that this invention has influenced our modern life in a great extent .
However , this technology has only come to major scene at early 1880s , where back until 10-70Ad , the first vending machine was invented by a Greek engineer named Hero of Alexandria CITATION Eri06 \l 1033  .
Various factors have contributed to allow such invention to be widely adopted in today's world .

Ever since the first vending machine appeared , many companies adopted this idea as the public welcomed such invention .
Convenience it brought has definitely played a big part in its success .
In the consumer's view , cumbersome long queue can be avoided when we only need to have a can of drink .
Furthermore , the simple manipulation of vending machine and hygienic storage is widely accepted by masses .
On the contrary , the vendor viewed it as favourable because they allowed selling of stocks that have very long shelf life .
Frequent updates can be avoided and the reliability of these vending machines is guaranteed .
Practically , it can be placed at any places , whether it is rural location .
This introduction of vending machines has improved and revolutionized the conventional way of merchandising .
In countries like Japan and Singapore , where there is a lack of space , the need for a condensed merchandiser which allowed space efficiency is furthermore amplified .
As time gradually goes by , the population density of many countries increased .
A device that free out more available spaces is gaining more recognition .
In Japan , the available vending items range from instant noodles to cars !

In conclusion , the rising wage costs , demand of a more convenient way of vending process and lack of space have shaped this technological innovation .
In addition , the advancement of vending machine has never come to a halt as it continues to accommodate more human needs .
In years to come , more improved version of vending machine will be introduce to the society and bring more benefits to human kinds .

Commercial nuclear power industry had witnessed the worst nuclear power plant accident in its history: Chernobyl .
Reports pointed out that the disaster killed 56 people and caused about 336 ,000 people in contaminated areas in Russia , Belarus and Ukraine to evacuate and resettle  .
The accident raised the question about the safety of the nuclear power plant and the ways that people can avoid such case .
From an article by Bernhard Wilpert from Technical University of Berlin , Germany we can see that if we apply psychology in design process of the nuclear reactors , the disaster might not happen .
After the accident , people tried to figure out what are the reasons that caused the malfunction of the power plant .
Several theories had been provided , but mostly concentrated on two issues: the mistakes of the reactor crew and the deficiency in the design of the RBMK ) reactor  .
These two factors- one belongs to human and one belongs to machine-can be eliminated by carefully using psychology in design process .
Firstly , the human reasons for the accident come from various factors: the lack of knowledge of the reactor manager , the subjective points of view while performing unusual activities with the reactor and the weak communications between the workers in the power plant .
Since a nuclear reactor is described as a "complex high hazard systems"  , the adequate and clear cognition are very important not only for the individuals but also for the whole workers in the manufacture , where the collaboration between them plays the key role in the work of the plant .
If the Chernobyl reactor crew had had enough information about the dangerous caused by the reactor when working in low power settings , they would have never performed the test to determine how long turbines would spin and supply power following a loss of main electrical power supply .
Unfortunately , such tests were still carried out despite the unstable of the plant under risky circumstances .
If we had applied psychology in the nuclear power plant , the workers had been trained well and they would have had right responds with the accidental problems while running the plant .
However , the operators had broken many important rules of safety just to complete the test quickly: they had diminished the flow of coolant water , disabled the automatic shutdown mechanisms , released the control rods from the machine over the acceptable limit .
These actions resulted in increasing the amount of the energy produced to an uncontrollable level in a very short moment and caused the explosions of the reactor .
Once again , the communications between the human-human and human-machine were not guaranteed .
Without proper knowledge and problem-solving skills from psychology design , they could not know exactly the situation and behaved in a wrong way when problems appeared .
Secondly , the other reason that is also widely supported is the flaws in the design of the RBMK reactor , especially the control rods .
Initially , the control rods were designed to slow down the reaction of the nuclear plant .
However , the engineer who had created the rods had not expected the chemical structure inside the rod actually increase the reactions between radiation atoms at the first moment when being put into the reactor .
In this case , the minimum requirements in testing the rods were not relevant .
Thus , the point is that the designer had just made the rods for working in stable conditions , not for such tests like this .
If the designer had applied psychological in their design process , they would have thought carefully and predicted the unexpected problems which might happen with the rods when using them .
In contrast , they neglected the standard criteria just to make them simpler , cheaper but , unfortunately , more dangerous .
In addition , when the disaster happened , another serious mistakes when building the nuclear power plant reflected the weak cognition in the importance of psychology design is that the wall around the reactor is not tough .
As a result , the wall was broken out and radioactivity was released freely into the atmosphere , which is extremely dangerous for human and wildlife in a large area around the plant .
An absolute evident that proves the necessary of psychological design is the similar accident with the Three Miles Island nuclear reactor in the US .
In this case , the wall of the reactor which had been built with Europe's high standards of safety had prevented the radiation from spreading into the air and no one had to die because of it  .
These examples show that even the machine errors can be eliminated by carefully design and applying psychology in the design process to predict all the cases that may happen in the future .
Since the horrible accident of Chernobyl , such old technologies used to build the Chernobyl reactor have never been used again .
In addition , people have been doing research to improve the efficiency , the feasibility and the most important: the safety of the power plants as such disaster will never happen again .
It is said that "Psychological methods , theories , and findings are becoming increasingly important to design"  .
With the more and more collaboration between psychology and design , the engineers have been using their results for the design process to make more reliable and stable products .
Therefore , we can minimize the damages caused by accidents or even avoid them and increase the efficiency of works .
According to the news report by Rita Zahara  , "Singapore is only rank 15 in the world for its innovative capabilities .
Singapore firms still lag greatly behind their counterparts in the US , Finland , Israel and Korea ."
Despite having high GDP and a pool of savvy engineers , there are still quite a number of problems in Singapore that are hampering its engineering design for processes for innovation .
There are many social and economical factors in Singapore that are hampering the country's engineering design processes for innovation .
Comparing to other countries , although Singapore do not have much technological constraints , there are still a lot of factors hampering inventions and innovations in Singapore .
Two main problems are Singapore's small economic market and its population holding a resistance to change attitude .
Firstly , a small economic market can greatly hinder a country's engineering design process for innovation .
Due to the small geographical size of Singapore , its population is only less then six million people .
As a result , Singapore's economic market is not large .
Most inventions , be it new or improved from previous inventions , takes a vast amount of time and money before it might become an innovation .
Most engineers or designers are reluctant to even try inventing or making innovative products as they know that their inventions will most likely not make much profit , or even worse , a loss .
Secondly , Singaporeans' refusal to take risk and their contentment with their current lifestyles are also causes for the hampering of engineering design processes for innovation in Singapore .
The mindset of resistances to change in Singaporeans greatly prevents good innovative ideas and the acceptance of such ideas .
Most Singaporeans are resistant to changes as they are too used to their current lifestyles .
They do not want any changes to what they already had .
Therefore , this will cause them not to expect for anything more or better and thus , not thinking of new ideas on how to improve what they already had .
Furthermore , Singaporeans have strong refusal to tolerate risk .
Most Singaporeans do not dare to try new ideas as they fear of failing , in which most probably results in time and money loss .
Singapore's small economic market and its population holding a resistance to change attitude will have some bearing on the engineering design processes for innovation .
According to the book by Ullman , David G .  , there are ten building stages in the engineering design processes .
Namely "Identifying a need , Defining the problem , Conducting research , Narrowing the research , Analyzing set criteria , Finding alternative solutions , Analyzing possible solutions , Making a decision , Presenting the product , Communicating and selling the product" .
Singaporeans' refusal to leave their comfort zone will greatly affect the very first stage of the engineering design process , "Identifying a need" .
It will be very hard for Singapore to discover what it still needs when its people are content with what they already had .
On the other hand , Singapore's small economic market is affecting the second and third building stages in the engineering design processes , "Defining the problem and Conducting research" .
A small economic market is preventing engineers and designers from defining problems and conducting research as they fear it will most likely be non-profitable or at a loss .
According to the Maslow's hierarchy of needs pyramid , physiological need is the most basic tier of the pyramid .
It was viewed as the most important need among others .
Therefore , I think human health need or medical needs are the one which I should give priority on .
Engineers are very important role on designing new medical product to suit these human needs .
There are many different medical research is where engineers could lay their hand on and design products according the requirement .
The most recently leading research on medical area is medical imaging , tissue engineering , pharmaceutical engineering , stem cell engineering and genetic engineering .
In my opinion , medical imaging is the most important area where we need to spend time and effort .
Medical imaging technology refers to the method or process used to obtain graphic images of the human body structure or organs .
It helps the doctor to diagnose diseases or illness of a patient at an earlier stage .
Throughout the years , various types of medical imaging technologies were invented .
There are two main type of classification on medical imaging , invasive and non-invasive .
Invasive imaging includes nuclear medical imaging and X-ray imaging .
Invasive imaging method require radioactive means to produce medical scanning which would have a possibility on causing harm to the patient body but could be used on majority human body parts .
On the other hand , non-invasive imaging techniques like MRI and Ultra imaging would do the same job without causing any side effect on the patient .
The only set-back of such techniques is the high operation cost and constraints on the type of human body parts which they can be used on .
Engineering design process could be used on the invention of a new imaging technology .
This new imaging technology must have both the advantages of the non-invasive and invasive imaging .
Furthermore it had to tackle the operation cost problem and the type of human body parts where the imaging device could penetrate to .
Another major concern in the engineering design process of the new imaging technology would be providing higher resolution 3D/2D clinical image .
This will help the doctors to analysis a potential ill patient with improved detailed image .
Since modern computers continually increase on processing speed and volume of memory , it will provide a huge support on designing better resolution image devices .
The only portion which engineers would need to figure out is how to lower the operation cost of such imaging device .
In my opinion , materials of the films and the simplicity of the devices would be important
With the presence of the new resolved imaging technology , more humans were being able to make use of such technology since it will be cost- reduced .
Better clinical image will also be provided to the doctors , as a result doctor will be able to have a clearer diagnose of the diseases/illness on the patient .
Eventually , the average lifespan of a human will be prolonged with such benefits since early detection of illness prone to be easier for treatment and cure .
Lastly , Engineering should view medical imaging area as their priority since it could resolve a lot of medical problem exist in the modern world .
Good health is still the most crucial area where everyone would wish to achieve after all .

Ever wondered how many cars are there in the whole world ?
According to the article , "World's Most Congested Cities"  , there are about 750 million vehicles in the world , and at least 50 million cars are being manufactured in the world each year .
And out of the 750 million vehicles , 240 million come from The United States of America  , and 850 thousand come from Singapore  .
From the above figures , the ratios of human beings to vehicles are approximately 5 .4 , 1 .3 and 8 .8 respectively .
And all these figures are crucial in pointing out that vehicles , gasoline-powered vehicles to be more specific , are important and have blended into our lives .
Although this technology is important , many do not know its history and the development of the gasoline-powered vehicle was actually heavily influenced by political , economical and social factors .
The second set of factors were the political factors , and one of the main factors was the convenience the gasoline-powered vehicle brought about in World War I .
During World War I , the military realised that gasoline- powered vehicles were more convenient to use as compared to the electric- powered vehicle because it was difficult to charge the battery of the electric-powered vehicle right in the midst of a battle where there was no electrical source .
This convenience was the fact that gasoline was portable and could be brought around on vehicles which allowed vehicles to be re- fueled at any time and place and that it could be done very quickly .
Apart from the influence by the military , the government had a part to play as well , because the government implemented biased policies that involved building more gas stations and roads to cater to the gasoline-powered vehicles .
These implementations brought more convenience to users of gasoline-powered vehicles because gasoline was made more available , and places once inaccessible became accessible .
On the contrary , there was no "charging" station and roads were not very ideal for electric-powered vehicles to move on basically , there was nothing done to cater to the electric-powered vehicles which made it difficult for people to utilise the electric-powered vehicles without having any worries .
As a result , the electric-powered vehicle continued to lose its support , and gasoline- powered vehicles took another point home .
The next set of factors that further developed the gasoline-powered vehicles were the social factors .
And the presence of this social factors actually determined the fate of the electric-powered vehicles .
However , these social factors , which were partly caused by the overpowering economical and political factors , "pushed" people to choose the gasoline- powered vehicles .
The people were made to believe that the gasoline-powered vehicle was the "byproduct of market competition and engineering advancement , not a product of compromise and negotiation"  , which , in actual fact , was not .
Due to meritocracy and freedom , people "chose" the gasoline-powered vehicles eventually , and brought electric-powered vehicles to eternal rest .
The above factors gave gasoline-powered vehicles its place , even though electric-powered vehicles were better in terms of the technical aspects .
For instance , electric-powered vehicles were cleaner because it did not produce any harmful byproducts from combustion , were quieter , more luxurious and safer because it did not deal with any forms of combustion or heat .
Furthermore , electricity was easily available compared to high octane gasoline  .
Even though electric-powered vehicles were relatively more superior in the technicalities , due to the factors mentioned above , the technicalities were marginal and people were not affected by the potential problems they might face if they choose the gasoline-powered vehicles .
In conclusion , the development of an innovation does not solely depend on how technically superior it is , it also depends on many other factors , as we can see from the above example of the gasoline-powered vehicle .
These factors may vary in terms of the degree of impact , but there will always be an array of factors that will determine if an innovation succeeds .
The more important and valuable an innovation is to the society , the more impactful are the contributing factors , and the more elaborated the impacts will be .
Just imagine if vehicles were not as important , and we do not depend on them to such a large extent World War I would not have such a drastic effect on the extinction of the electric-powered vehicle and banks might not have approved the implementation of the insurances and loans .
And who knows ?
All our cars might be plugged in and getting charged now .
"Engineering is a creative process of turning abstract ideas into physical representations" , says Khandani .
This means , engineers need creativity to make new beneficial things , and this is exactly what engineers in Indonesia lack , along with sense of innovation .
The two main causes are Indonesia's education system which limits the student's creativity and the lack of structured government programmes regarding research and technology .
The first problem , the education system does not allow students to express themselves freely , causing students to be less curious and therefore not creative .
Teachers in school are also not supportive .
Some even too conservative that everything must be done exactly like what he or she has done .
On top of that , the questions given in school are usually too straight forward as the questions themselves do not test the deeper understanding of the concepts by the students .
For example , the questions in the national examination are all multiple choices .
Therefore , to be able to pass the exam , students do not need to really understand as they just need to memorize and use the correct formula or even try their luck .
This kind of rote learning makes defining problems , which is the very first step of engineering design process , hard for Indonesian students .
Furthermore , this forms a habit among the students that they also apply in real life which makes them ignorant on how things work and concern only about how to use those things .
Instead of discovering and solving problems around them , they tend to avoid them and wait for someone to solve it .
With this kind of attitude it is quite impossible for someone to innovate .
To make matter worse , even when someone survived that kind of education and has bright ideas , the government will not give them the opportunities to innovate , such as providing enough budgets for Research and Development in Science and Technology , or easiness of taking loans for new businesses in these areas .
This is because most developing countries' governments , like Indonesia's , still do not yet realize that a good innovative culture in the country can actually solve other problems like poverty and basic education opportunity .
The minuscule R&D expenditure of less than 0 .2% , in 2001 , of the GDP clearly shows this lack of priority  , especially when compared to Singapore's 2 .19% , in 2002 , expenditure  .
Therefore as they do not have structured programmes regarding research and technology , there are only few job opportunities in this science and technology sector , further discouraging engineers to innovate .
Instead , they prefer to have secure jobs in other more profitable sectors such as finance and banking .
This leads to no improvement in engineering in Indonesia .
Among these two main problems , the latter is actually more important .
Despite the poor education system , there are still a lot of innovative and creative people in Indonesia who wants to become real engineers .
However , without a supportive government , they cannot do anything .
Most of them choose to go to other countries which respect their ideas more .
This make Indonesia loses many of its best people .
Therefore , if only Indonesia's government can realize that research and technology is a really important factor , it is still possible for Indonesia to rapidly improve in terms of innovation .

"Build a better mousetrap , and the world will beat a path to your door" , said by Ralph Waldo Emerson .
The quote can be used to express the significance of the engineering design processes to generate innovations in making a useful product for society and industry .
Among the developing countries , Vietnam is one of the fastest growing economies in which engineering design processes for innovations is now playing a more and more important role .
There are certain problems which are still obstructing those processes , two of them are the weak law protection of patent registration and the lack of entrepreneurship skills .
Nowadays , it is not difficult to look for a fashionable "Adidas" or "Nike" T-shirt on a street in Ho Chi Minh City , the biggest city of Vietnam .
The reason is not because Vietnam is attracting worldwide fashion brands due to its fast growing economy , but because it is not ever easier to make and sell fake T-shirts in Vietnam .
The issue of patent violation has been raised critically in recent years by Government and the society .
There are several problems in the governmental administrative level have been listed as the kernel of the issue .
Firstly , the National Inspection Organ has lacked of skills and human resource in investigating and tracing patent violation incidents .
Secondly , even when the violators are caught , the fines for their serious guilt are sometimes much lower than their unrighteous benefits this leads to the fact that the offenders would rather pay the fines than give up their business .
Moreover , the critical contraband good problem has affected not only foreign companies but also the local companies with low quality products with lower prices .
This whole bunch of weak supports from the Government policy and law has lead to serious hampers in the local creativity of engineering design .
The effort for researching new social needs turns into the effort for importing foreign products .
These obstacles could make Vietnam become a technology dependent country in the area .
For recent decades , entrepreneur concepts have started budding those first steps in Vietnam for .
However , low skills in entrepreneurship are still making a main issue in training business mindset for young generation .
For instance , the e-commerce breaking out in recent years has made a large number of start-up companies in IT and media communication .
Most of the company- starter had been technicians before deciding to start their business with lacked and weak entrepreneurial skills .
Therefore , the approach of social and economical factors in the entire system of engineering design was omitted .
As a result , a lot of companies have had to resize or change their business .
In fact , the lack of entrepreneurship skills has caused missing stages in the process of engineering design for innovations .
In conclusion , certain problems are temporarily blocking the development of innovations in Vietnam .
However , from what can be observed in these recent years , especially after Vietnam joined World Trade Organization  , strong actions have been taken in reforming the law system as well as promoting the entrepreneurship in universities .
With a positive view , Vietnam is trying to shorten the gap between itself with the area and the world .
Eleven years ago , Singapore welcomes its first Newater plant , which is a turning point in Singapore's technology development history .
Newater represents the technology that purifies the used water to make it clean and drinkable again  .
During the last decade , the number of Newater plants increases to four .
Meanwhile , a new one is under construction .
What is more , in the near future , 30% of the demand of water will come from Newater .
During Newater's history , government , resources and the development of other technology show a significant influence on the development of Newater .
Besides the support of Singapore government , a lack of water supply pushes the development of Newater .
The shortage of potable water has become a global problem over the years .
What is more , about 40 percent of the population around the world and more than 80 counties are dealing with the problem of lacking of water  .
In consideration of Singapore , shortage of water results from several reasons such as geographic position , climate and increasing population .
Consequently , Singapore needs to import water from neighboring countries such as Malaysia to meet its needs  .
These reasons contribute to the development of Newater .
With the pressure of water shortage , having its own water supply system becomes more and more necessary .
That is how the resource shortage leads to the development of Newater .
Futuremore , the telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876 and "by 1884 , long distance connections were made between Boston , Massachusetts and New York City ."
Bell was very interested in helping deaf people which leaded him to invent the telephone .
Also , "the telephone came as a direct result of his attempts to improve the telegraph ."
The invention of telephone is not a coincidence , but a lone-term research result .
In nowadays , telephone plays a very important role in our life , we can hardly live with them .
To conclusion , both Penicillin and telephone help people a lot and both of them are the product of hard working and long-term consummation .
The difference between them is whether the inventor has the clear purpose or not , which Bell had and Fleming had not .
But this difference does not decrease the value of either of these two technologies .
Human needs are always unsatisfied .
Centuries ago , providing sufficient food was the most urgent need .
At the same time health problems also created great needs for advanced medical technologies and facilities .
As years go by , industrialization emerged in many countries to meet various people's needs , like job opportunities and economic growth .
However , the big success of industrialization has created a problem for our modern peoplehow to save our fast degrading environment ?
Thus , designing technologies in environmental friendly manner is one of the greatest human needs to protect our living environment and to ensure a sustainable economic development .
After the problem has been defined , which is the first step of engineering design engineers need to gather pertinent information about the problem .
For example , engineering who focusing on design environmental friendly transportation tools , must have the basic knowledge about the products of different types of fuel combustion and how they affect the environment .
They should also be updated about any latest methods to generate energy in environmental friendly ways , such as solar energy , tidal energy or wind energy , and their respective advantages and drawbacks .
Engineers will move on to next step once they are equipped with necessary knowledge .
The second step of the design process is generating different solutions to the problems .
For example , engineers basically come up with two main ways to make machineries and transportation tools less polluted .
First way is changing the way energy is generated , such as changing petrol engines which produce carbon dioxide and hydrocarbons to fuel cell which only produce water and oxygen .
This solution can be further divided by considering different types of method to generate energy in less polluting ways .
The other solution is dealing with the polluting products generated along the way .
For example , catalyst convertors are installed on cars to convert toxic gas carbon monoxide and hydrocarbons produced from non-fully combustion to non-toxic gas carbon dioxide and water .
Although different ways of solutions have been found out , not all are practical , so engineers also need to analyze and select a suitable solution .
For example , both of the two solutions we discussed before are theoretically correct , but today we only see convertor has been installed .
It is because changing the ways generating energy is very costly and the safety is unpredictable .
For example , fuel cells are very expensive , thus the cost of production will be so high that they will be unmarketable .
Another example , Hydro-powered cars , which actually have been produced but not used widely due to hydrogen is flammable , there are still big concerns of consumers' safety .
In this step , engineers will also look at other factors like economic , social factor to filter the solutions .
Finally , engineers will test their solutions and make continuous changes to their product .
Although it is difficult to have a perfect solution , engineers are still trying hard to meet our needs to save the environment .
When we look around , we can see the efforts put in by engineers , the power saved light bulb , solar water heater , car catalytic converters and etc .
These products are produced only after long and complicated designing process .
We should really be grateful to engineers who work dedicative to satisfy our needs .
Roger explained the difference between technological determinism and social determinism or the social construction of technology .
Technology is not something that is independent of values .
Otherwise , technology is a product of society and obviously is influenced by norms and values of the social system .
On the other hand , technological determinism is the belief that technology causes changes in society and this implies technology is somehow autonomous .
Roger did not agree with the latter belief .
Technology never stands in itself it always carries something in it .
Let us take a look at one example of a great human work in the late centuries: nuclear .
We are going to view the definition and some factors that make nuclear become a nuclear .
First of all , let us see the definition first .
According to Wikipedia ,"A nuclear weapon is an explosive device that derives its destructive force from nuclear reactions , either fission or a combination of fission and fusion ."
Let us recall the Nagasaki and Hiroshima tragedies , both cities were destroyed completely because of this thing .
That was the first nuclear bomb executed on earth .
From that time , nuclear production was getting more popular all the time .
Nowadays , not only western countries , but also Asian countries have nuclear power .
One thing to notice is that this stuff is very expensive .
In "50 Facts About U .S . Nuclear Weapon" , it is stated that the cost of the Manhattan Project is 20 ,000 ,000 ,000 USD .
That is just the cost of one project in one country .
You can imagine now how much money we have spent to develop this 'nice' technology .
Although it costs great amount of money , but those nuclear countries are still improving their nuclear capabilities .
We must be wondering why people want to spend so much money on such things .
Basically I think the first reason is because humans hate to lose .
Usually when you are creating nuclear power , the main purpose is to make other countries respect and fear you .
This is very useful in military aspect .
My former history teacher one day said that "To create peace , we need big power ."
This means that if I have enough power to knock you , your friends and your family down , then it is very logical that you want to have a peace with me because you know that I am capable of doing awful things to you .
That is why people want to be strong so that they are trying to develop something .
To conclude , I just want to emphasize that technology depends on social factors .
It is just like a knife you can use it for good or for bad  .
This nuclear case is just one of the examples .
The military aspect has contributed a lot to technology improvements .
And there are still a lot of aspects that contribute to technology as well .
Before the 1950s , most of electricity was created by burning fossil fuel , and no one was aware of other energy .
After the second world war , the whole world was busy recovering economics and industry .
So the need of fossil energy became more and more serious .
At this moment , a few countries found that only relying on fossil energy is not enough and there should be another efficient energy to be created .
After a few years in U .S . , the world's first nuclear power plant was set up .
However , when fossil fuel prices fall can any country resist the temptation ?
The answer is no .
During 1970s and 1980s , influenced by excessive industry development , the world's economic cost reached to a high point but at that time , fossil fuel prices were decreasing .
This mad those nuclear power plant which were under construction less attractive .
They just were set aside .
Almost as the same reason in 1973 , France and Japan suffered oil crisis .
Their governments could not pay for such high oil debts and these two countries decided to depend on nuclear technology .
In other words , France and Japan were forced to invest nuclear technology .
What is surprising that today 80% of the electricity in France is supplied by nuclear energy .
In Japan the percentage is also as high as 30%  .
But not all the countries can afford the cost to build up a nuclear power plant .
Take the U .S as an example .
The U .S . is the country having most nuclear power plants , and is well known by their technology in this area .
However in the U .S . , to build up an ordinary nuclear power plant will cost as much as $6~10 billion .
And this does not include the expense of repair and maintenance in the future .
So far , only big countries have their own nuclear power plants .
But it is sure that in the future , nuclear energy will give a strong support to the whole world industry economics .
When all the countries are aware this point , it is only a matter of time to make nuclear energy all over the world .
As nuclear technology becomes so important , it is necessary to have an international organization to supervise the process of every country's development .
Then the WANO was set up .
With the WANO's beginning to discharge its duties , the world's nuclear development goes on the right way .
Now , although not all countries are using electricity supplied by nuclear energy , many parts of the world are benefiting from it .
In 2007 , 14% of the world's electricity came from nuclear power and , it can be seen after a few years the nuclear energy will benefit the whole world .
As many big cities in the world are facing the water crisis , as acid rains becomes increasingly frequent , as the number of lung cancer patients keeps going up , environment protection has become one of the most vital need of human .
To satisfy human's need and make contribution to protecting environment , engineers are to design and invent products in an environmental friendly way .
Through engineering design process , we can see how engineer satisfy that need .
According to Khandani .S  , there are five steps in solving designing problems .
In the steps to get pertinent information and to analyze and select a solution , engineers can make their product more environment-friendly .
To design and produce something more environment friendly , engineers should pay more attention on environment-related information when searching for pertinent information .
For example , suppose an engineer is looking for a material for meal boxes of taken-away food .
Apart from information about cost , weight , water resistant ability , etc , he needs to pay extra attention on some environmental information like whether the material can be biodegraded or recycled .
Taking this environment-related information into consideration helps make more environment friendly decision .
The other step is to analyze and select a solution .
Usually , engineers will come up with more than one plan along the way they design a product .
They need to analyze and evaluate them and give a final plan .
In the Engineering Design Process , Khandani .S shows us how an engineer evaluates different plans .
Firstly , they need to analyse criteria or factors to evaluate design plans .
They need to perform several types of analysis on each design .
These types of analysis are the factors on evaluating plans .
Next they value each factor by its importance , and give a mark representing how important it is .
In this way , they set criteria for evaluating plans .
After that , they evaluate each factor against the corresponding criterion .
Based on how well that plan fit the criterion , they give a mark .
Last , calculate points and compare .
Let the mark of each factor multiplies the number representing the importance of this factor and add up all the total mark .
By comparing the total mark of different plans , they decide the final plan .
For example , suppose an engineer is designing a process of producing a kind of detergent .
There are some factors , such as efficiency of the product and cost , to be taken into consideration for deciding the final plan .
If he can increase the importance of the factors related to environment protection , he may use substitute of phosphorus , or cleanse the waste water before discharge it .
Then the process and product would be more environmental friendly .
If engineers can think more about environment when designing , the product will become very environment-friendly .
Then our earth will become cleaner and more sustainable .
We will have a more comfortable and healthier environment to live in .
Government Regulations and Public Opinions in the Development of Electric Bicycle in China
One typical image remembered by the world about China is about its astounding amount of bicycles on the roads: swarms of people riding bicycles filling the roads which are not really narrow .
While since the year of 2000 , another phenomenon occurs on the roads of cities in China: electric bicycles .
A cording to data on reliable Chinese websites , in 2004 alone , 6750000 electric bicycles were produced by more than 1000 factories all over China and these numbers were expected to increase by times by the end of 2010 .
With the maturing of the technologies on electric motors and long-life battery , multiple types of electric vehicle could have been created .
Previous existing government regulations and public opinions on road safety act important roles in shaping electric bicycle in China into what it is today .
The previously existing government regulations have a tremendous effect on the development of electric bicycles when it comes to the size and speed of electric bicycles .
Before the e-bike which is light and slower we see now , there are also a number of other kinds of electric vehicle in developing .
They are more like electric motorbike which is much more powerful and , of course , heavier .
But because of the government regulations on city transportation under which all means of transportation on road are grouped to either motor or non-motor and nothing in between , the prototype of the heavy electric bicycles was nipped in the bud as it can be counted to either of the two criteria because of its variety of performance .
The later electric bicycle was then designed to be more like a normal bicycle and was only allowed to ride on non-motor roads , light but moving automatically .
People can even ride it just like riding a bike when it runs out of power .
Apart from government regulations , public opinions also have prominent effect on the development of e-bike .
After the e-bike was placed on the market , safety issues related to the e-bike were brought up .
Data on road traffic accidents were counted .
In Hangzhou , the capital city of Zhejiang province , the cases of accidents caused by e-bike has been increasing for three years .
Though the number was relatively small compared with those caused by cars and motorbikes , people were becoming more and more concerned with the safety issues with e-bike and a series of public hearings were then carried out to discuss how to make e-bike a safe vehicle on the roads .
Finally , the speed limit was set at 20km/h which is quite at the lower end of what the technology allows to do .
Then all the e-bike industries begun to improve other performance of e-bike like battery life and noise rather than speed and loading ability .
In order to meet the requirement of government regulations and public opinions , the development of e-bike has gone through several changes therefore it was shaped to the e-bike we see now .
Hopefully , the next typical image left by China to the world will be e-bike .
In 1936 , the first public video telephone had been developed .
At that time , people had to simultaneously go to special post office video telephone booths to use this service .
Until 1980s , with the development of chip , transmission technology , digital communication , video codec technology and integrated circuit technology , videophone became truly usable .
Then many predicted that videophone would be very popular someday and it would be loved by the public .
However , in recent decades , there was almost no market for the videophone and videophone has not emerged in our lives .
One of the reasons why videophone could not become popular is that there were technical problems .
Because the communication quality was not that good , users could not get clear and coherent images .
But apart from the technical factor , the development of videophone mainly limited by some social and economic factors .
Second reason is due to the privacy issues .
People sometimes do not want the other side to see their tired face .
When they are talking , they want to be relaxed and feel free .
Videophone users also commonly look at the video screen and not at the video camera , causing the eyes to take on an unnatural awkward glance , as the camera is usually just positioned away from the screen  .
Third , there was no unified standard .
For a long time , although there were some companies producing videophones , different kinds of videophone from different companies could not communicate with each other because they did not share a standard .
Another reason may be that people actually desire less fidelity in their communication , as evidenced by the popularity of written conversation  .
Nowadays , with the fast development of the internet , more and more people accept to video chat through some internet chatting software .
The necessity of using videophone is becoming lower and lower .
According to E .M .Rogers , the pioneer of diffusion of innovations theory , there are basically six stages in the innovation development process: needs/problems , research , development , commercialization , diffusion & adoption , consequences .
Specifically , in the development stage , there are two categories of organizations to generate innovation: conventional R&D organizations and skunk works .
Conventional R&D organizations are "bureaucracies , structured to provide stability and continuity to nurture innovation"  .
On the other hand , skunk works are "small and often subversive units within a larger organization that are created in order to pioneer the development of a technological innovation"  .
Technologies generated in either organization require the dedication of researchers' hard work and basic capital support from the company .
There are some differences , however , between the technologies generated in these two organizations , in terms of time of accomplishing innovation , cost of generation , the maturity of products , etc .
One big difference between the technologies in the two organizations is time of accomplishing innovation .
Normally skunk works generate innovations more quickly than the conventional R&D organizations , for workers in skunk works work "on a crash basis to create an innovation" .
The well-known example is the development of Macintosh .
In the early 1980s , Steve Jobs , president of Apple Computer , established a particular skunk works .
Only after four years did the revolutionary new computer be displayed at Apple's annual stockholders' meeting  .
On the other hand , conventional generated technology probably takes a longer time for example , another revolutionary invention , light bulb , was first generated in the 1800s .
Until the 1850s , after Thomas Alva Edison and other engineers' improvement , light bulbs became prevalent  .
In recent years , skunk works are mostly generated due to commercial or marketing competition .
Workers in the skunk works have stronger motives than those in the conventional organization .
The result is that researchers in the skunk works generate innovation faster .
To generate innovation in a comparable short time as mentioned previously , normally skunk works assemble more outstanding personnel and more capital as opposed to conventional R&D organizations .
Therefore , people highly selected can accomplish the task without much trouble in capital .
One example is the Xerox Corporation , then the world's leading document copier manufacturer , which founded its skunk works Xerox PARC with the investment of $150 million , which generated the mouse and other important personal computing technologies due to its brilliant personnel  .
Although Xerox failed to transfer those technologies to the marketplace due to its poor commercial strategies , it is significantly meaningful that in a short time , Xerox PARC attained so many technological breakthroughs that were adopted later .
Besides the differences of time and cost , nevertheless , when coming to the commercialization stage , products transferred from technology in skunk works are sometimes not so mature as those transferred from conventional R&D organization due to the time limitation .
Actually , the Macintosh was announced before 1984 , but then postponed several times for immaturity in technology  .
On the contrary , Conventional R&D organizations have more time to make their innovation more customer-friendly and more mature in technology .
In a nutshell , on average , skunk works generate technological innovations more effectively and efficiently .
However , it has higher requirements for the personnel and capital , which are difficult for some companies that are in shortage of capital .
Nevertheless , conventional R&D organizations can generate innovations stably and continuously , which is still essential to the development of the company .
The technologies generated in both organizations help build a better world .
Prior to the Industrial Revolution in the 19th century , the needs of people are just basic-food , clothing , air and last but not least , shelter .
Now , the needs have just expanded from the basic four needs to other needs such as entertainment , communication , and transportation .
However , the question is which need requires more attention than the others in this modern era ?
The answer would be transportation .
Well , in order to have a better transportation , design processes are needed to fulfill the need .
Transportation which is cheap and safe , environmentally friendly and uses alternative source of energy has the utmost importance in the need of transportation .
One of the imminent problems faced by the modern transportation is to depend less on fossil fuels .
At the rate of usage of fossil fuels -at three billion barrels per year-now , it will not take long before the fuels deplete .
According to a presentation made by Osman Chughtai and David Shannon , fossil fuels will mostly run out in 17 years minimum or a maximum of 50 to 70 years .
Nevertheless , other transportation problems like producing too much pollutant such as nitrogen oxides .
Pollutants produced have been proved to have an enormous effect on the Earth ozone layer , corroding the ozone layers and exposing humans to the deadly ultraviolet ray .
To add to the problems stated above , the world currently needs a better transport , in terms of safety and functionalities as well as its cost .
As an example , cars produced must be durable , meaning that the cars must be able to withstand great momentum struck on them .
Besides that , weather must not be an obstacle for good cars .
In addition , cars must be low in cost despite having all the functionalities .
Therefore , in order to counter all the problems , engineers need to go through design processes .
First of all , engineering processes provides the foundation for researches to get a new state-of-the-art design .
Engineers have to identify the problems such as producing a transport that does not run on fossil fuel .
Then , they can brainstorm to come up with a new design that meets all the criteria for a better car .
Recently there was this groundbreaking news stating that engineers found a technology called H2CAR process , a process for producing fuels from plants or what they call the process-biomass . 
Besides researches , development processes enable engineers to produce designs that will be tested on real ground .
Effectiveness , durability and functionalities of the designs will be tested .
In this case , transportations like cars must be able to withstand extreme weathers and must be aerodynamically shaped for maneuverability .
Car safety must be included in the blueprint of the car as well .
Previously , engineers managed to come up with a design called catalytic converter with a function to reduce the pollutants released due to combustion .
In a nutshell , design processes are the main essence for a better future transportation , in terms of fuel type , environmentally friendly , functionalities as well as its cost .
This need must be taken seriously in order to secure a brighter future- a future people do not need to travel on bicycle or on foot .

Some of set up a company just want to cheat , all the actions that the companies make are all want to cheating for money from consumers or other companies .
For the staffs , if they were corrupt , they would not focus on their jobs any more .

This is because the development of engineering design could bring many advantages to country's economy and also in social aspect .
Actually , the scientists may perceive a future problem and launch some researches to overcome it .
If we observe our surrounding , we could see many inventions of technological creativity such as computer , automobile and other electrical appliances .
Nevertheless , there are some problems which significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations in my home country , Malaysia and cause the impacts on certain stages of the process of engineering design .
Firstly , financial problem is one of the factors which constrains engineering design processes for innovations .
As we all know , if we want to improve our engineering design  , we need to launch many researches .
Therefore , Research and Development plays a very important part in engineering design processes for innovations .
Subsequently , a lump sum of money need to be used to launch all these researches , but our government is not able to invest so much money on all these researches .
So , the financial problem arises and constrains the engineering design processes for innovations .
For your information , Malaysia is a country which is still developing and not as wealthy as other western developed countries such as United State , France and Germany .
Hence , we lack of money to improve our facilities of research such as well-equipped laboratories and other highly technological instruments .
In fact , this will causes the engineering design process to pause in the half way because of the lack of the highly technological instruments .
For instance , if we want to design a race car , we need some highly technology instruments to do researches on the car engine and other parts of car .
Although we have already found the important information about the research , we cannot continue to an analysis of design solution because of the lack of highly technology instruments to investigate .
Other than financial problem , we are also facing the problem of lack of professionals in certain engineering fields such as mechanical engineering , chemical engineering and electrical engineering .
Many of the researches of engineering design which were carried out in the modern countries had been done successfully .
This is because there are many professionals in their countries .
In fact , the lack of professionals in engineering field results the failure of many researches .
For instance , some of the automobile researches have been failed due to the lack of the professionals .
The stage of analysis of design solution has been constrained because of the limited knowledge and lack of professionals .
Hence , some forums of the engineering design should be held between our country and other modern countries such as United State , United Kingdom and Germany .
For instance , the forum on how to manufacture an eco-car can be held in order to help us exchange our opinions with the professionals from modern countries .
In a nutshell , financial problem and lack of professionals in my home country should be solved as soon as possible , so as to improve our engineering design processes innovations .
Hence , private sector , the government and also citizens should work hand in hand in order to get more investment for engineering design researches and produce more professionals in the field of engineering design in the future .
Indonesia , a country hosting more than two hundred and thirty million citizens , is South East Asia's largest country and economy to date .
Yet Indonesia still trails behind its neighboring countries such as Malaysia , Thailand , and even The Little Red Dot: Singapore , in terms of advancement in design based technology .
It is commonly believed that the slow rate of technological growth in Indonesia is caused by two major problems , which may hamper the innovative engineering design process .
Firstly , Indonesia lacks culture of innovation .
According to the statistics published by UNICEF in 2007 , only fifty percent of Indonesian citizens are urbanized , which means the other half live in rural areas with little exposure to modern world and technology .
People living in traditional villages live very simple life .
They stick to their ancestors' traditions , and sometimes prefer traditional way of doing things to labor saving modern devices for example: some farmers prefer buffalo driven ploughs to tractors .
Moreover , the farmers still rely on the government supplies and subsidies , which encounters a lot of logistics problems , instead of innovating their own way of solving problems .
Besides , most universities in Indonesia are more teaching based , less research intensive than those in Japan or The States that makes Indonesian university students less creative and innovative in problem solving .
As a result , Indonesian engineers usually provide less possibility of solutions in tackling a problem compared to those who are trained abroad .
In conclusion , Indonesia still faces several challenges in developing its design-based technology .
To tackle them , Indonesian government has to work hard in developing innovative culture in the society , and decreasing the people's dependability on the government .
According to Khandani's statement "What distinguishes engineers from painters , poets , or sculptors is that engineers apply their creative energies to producing products or systems that meet human needs" , all engineering designs aim to meet human demand to become successful products .
Now , when the society becomes widely and continuingly developed , people are looking for new designs to satisfy their comfortable lives .
Those new designs may be the demands of entertainment , education or even something beyond our imagination .
However , in my opinion , one of the main concerns in our society is finding a new energy supply to alter the old ones , which become exhausted due to the overexploitation of human .
In order to solve this urgent demand , engineering plays an important role in finding the other alternatives such as nuclear energy , solar energy and geothermal energy .
Evidently , energy becomes vital and indispensable in our life , relating to most of everything we are working .
Because of the influence of energy , the natural resources have invisibly caused wars and conflicts between many countries over years and years .
The recent war between United States and Iraq in 2000 might be considered to be a typical example .
Although U .S . has been saying that this war was for the anti-terrorism , or more importantly for keeping the peacefulness of the world , it is clear that one of the reasons why American troopers stay in Iraq is the benefits of petroleum .
This is a typical example of showing how important energy is since it exerts a grave impact on our daily life .
Due to the non-renewability of the natural "fossil" resources , the more demands the society needs , the more exhausted they become .
According to the online newspaper Financial Times and USA today news  , the oil reserves in Trinidad and Tobago will run out in the next 20 years and the world oil reserves will become exhausted just in 40 years .
These figures partly show the urgent necessity to find a feasible alternative energy source which will never become exhausted .
The process of finding a new alternative energy source , which is not only renewable but also environmental-friendly , has been conducted for a long time and regarded as an ultimate goal for engineering .
Another solution is the perpetual resources as known as solar , geothermal energy and etc . . .The solar energy is drawn from sunlight's energy by many solar panels which are designed to fit the house proof .
This energy will be converted into electric or thermal energy to serve our life .
Geothermal power takes the thermal calorie in the entrails in the earth and translates into other energies which contribute an important role to operate turbines and machines .
There are three basic types of geothermal energy plants  .
Geothermal energy is considered as the most potential alternative for the nonrenewable energy resource in the future .
Though the perpetual resources are always there for us , their use may be constrained by the lack of technology for control and delivery , and also by investment and willingness to pay .
Also , those resources may not be applied and used everywhere on earth due to the geographic differences .
In conclusion , I content that energy problem should be classified on the first priority in human must-solves not only because of many huge benefits it provides for people but also because of the critical shortage of energy resources .
In this context , engineering design process meets these urgent needs by finding many feasible solutions such as nuclear energy , solar energy and geothermal energy sources .
Although this process has just gotten initial achievements , it promises a fully potential energy source in the future which may permanently serve human kind .

On the contrary , solar energy will not lead to such pollution .

Engineers are indispensable .
Their achievements are influencing the developments of every industry .
As the application of engineering spreads , few can tell the exact range of engineers' work .
But one task of all the engineers is common: to meet people's needs .
People's need is so various that one prime need must be given priority to avoid distractions .
In today's world , this need should be people's demand of fresh water .
As is known , water is a resource that human cannot live without .
Its uses range from climate regulating , industry application to food processing and daily drinking .
Water is even the sign of life .
Scientists often use it as the first criteria to judge whether there is life on a new landed planet .
This means that water is probably the first thing creatures need to maintain life .
Therefore , water is also one essential need for people to survive .
Back to a hundred years ago , water was never a concern .
While , today it is different .
It's now commonly recognized that fresh water will be the scarcest resource in the follow century .
Some people even assume that the next world war will be fought for the limited fresh water on the earth .
In order to ensure human's survival and the peace of world , engineers should respect the human's need for water most when designing products .
One aspect engineer should work on to meet people's need of water is to reduce the pollution in engineering process .
Pollution is one main reason for water scarcity .
To be exact , there is never a lack of water on the earth , but pollution damaged most of the available water sources , such as rivers and lacks .
Pollution in water is often caused by waste emission generated in industry processes .
To solve this problem , the best way is to emphasis environmental friendliness when engineers design machines or develop new procedures for industry use .
This can stop pollution to water more thoroughly than government's fine on water pollution .
In addition , engineers can design device that can save water .
People are using water everywhere in life other than in industry .
Therefore , if device can avoid wasting water in daily life of each person , it will surely save considerably large amount of water .
Small device like taps , water coolers , washing machines , can all be the targets of engineers .
Engineers should attach importance to water-efficiency together with other efficiencies regarding designing device , so that enough water can be conserved to meet people's need .
To sum up , engineering should give priority to people's need for water first , as water is necessary for human's survival .
In order to highlight this need , engineers should emphasis on environmental friendliness and water saving in designing .
For the next 10 years or more , Singapore would have a high percentage of population consisting of the elderly .
There are a few factors leading to ageing population , where some of them are low birth rates and increase in the cost of standard living .
With the increase number of elderly , there would be a need in safety areas , thus products or services should be designed to meet this need .
For example , one of the current market products is called "MEMSwear" which is produced by National University of Singapore engineers .
This product is a smart suit that is equipped with array of microsensors which are able to detect falls suffered by the wearers and to send alerts to their caregivers .
Besides these functions , the engineers have also included an "impact-reduction" system to reduce the damage does to the wearer when he or she falls .
For the product , we have seen that the engineers have make use of the engineering design processes to meet the need .
Firstly , they have defined the problem , which is the ageing population and they have seen the need to invent a product which could gives extra safety protection to the elderly .
Secondly , they have brainstormed on the preliminary criteria for a better design for the product ) .
For example , for the first version of the product , they have not included the "impact-induction" system .
Without this feature , the wearer might suffer a serious accident if he or she falls .
Thus , through the use of engineering design processes , they have come out with a better design of the product .
Next , this is another product which works alike as the previous product .
But other than the features that the "MEMSwear" has , this product has additional functions ) .
One of the functions is that upon receiving an alert when the user has a serious fall , it would dial for ambulance immediately .
This would greatly reduce the consequences of the fall if actions are taken within a shorter time .
Another additional function is the implementation of a temperature sensor .
For instance , in the case of a fire , the temperature sensor will be alerted and sends warning alerts to their caregivers or call for Civil Defense Force immediately .
Furthermore , when considering the design of the product , there is a need to make special considerations that are suitable for the elderly use .
Those factors that might need to take into consideration when designing the product are inflexible movements and slow response time .
Engineering would have to use the engineering design processes to list out multiple solutions the designing of product ) .
For each solution , they would have to analyze and select one of the best solutions that suits most of the criteria listed .
In order to make sure the product works well , engineers have to test it before they launched the product .
In conclusion , we have seen that the problems of ageing population could get more serious for the next few years , thus there is a need to design a product that could help to reduce the risks and impacts faced by the ageing population .
By the example of these two products , we could see that both of them have make use of the engineering design processes to meet the need .
And thus , it proved that it is really important to follow through the engineering design processes when inventing a new product .
Humans' activities on Earth have always been depleting Earth's valuable yet limited amount of natural resources and at the same time damaging Earth's environment .
This will cause Earth's natural resources to be depleted and modifying Earth's environment so much that it is no longer suitable for human life .
Therefore humans have to give priorities to conserving Earth's natural resources and protecting its environment .
This can be achieved by completely abolishing already available engineering processes , modifying and improving these old processes , or correctly identifying the reasons for the rise of that need .
Secondly , instead of removing available engineering processes , they can also be modified so that its original function is still available but at the same time satisfying the need to reserve natural resources and protecting the environment .
For example , transportation systems like cars require fuels like fossil fuels which is processed from a depleting natural resource , fossil fuels .
Furthermore , greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide are produced from these cars which will contribute to the notorious greenhouse effect .
To solve this problem , engineering processes like the designing of the car's engine can be changed .
For instance , the introduction of electricity cars by General Motors , uses electricity to power the car's engine instead of fossil fuels .
This satisfy the need as electricity can be generated from renewable sources of energies like solar and wind energy .
Furthermore , greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide will not be emitted also .
Thus , we can observe how modifying available engineering processes can satisfy the need .
Thirdly , the need can be fulfilled by correctly identifying and analyzing the reason for the rise of that need , so that the correct decisions can be made in engineering processes to fulfill the need .
For example , CFC gases in the past is a by-product of many of our industries .
These gases causes the destruction of the Earth's ozone layer in the atmosphere which causes more harmful ultraviolet , UV rays to penetrate the atmosphere , causing health problems like skin cancer to humans due to these UV rays .
Therefore a worldwide policy was implemented to ban the emission of CFC gases into the atmosphere by industries .
Thus , we can see how making the correct decisions to prevent pollution to the environment can fulfill the need .
In conclusion , to ensure a sufficient supply of natural resources and a healthy environment for us and our future generations to live in , engineering processes can meet our need by removing and introducing or modifying available engineering processes and making the correct decisions in engineering processes can fulfill that need .
According to Khandani  , engineers design products or systems that meet human needs .
Out of all the human needs in the world , to have clean water should be given priority compared with others .
Despite the fact that the amount of water on earth is quite large , nevertheless , we can only drink a very small part of it .
It is because most of the water in the world is sea water , which is not potable at all .
In addition , due to the global warming , the sea level rises .
Therefore , some precious sources of drinking water , like underground water is polluted and not drinkable any more , which makes the situation even worse .
In some regions in the world , such as the Middle East and Africa , the shortage of clean drinking water is very serious , which even causes wars sometimes .
To solve this problem , there are two ways in which engineers can contribute .
The first way is to design a system to recycle used water .
Water we daily use can be divided into two categories , which are respectively for drinking and not for drinking .
For example , water we use to flush toilet , to irrigate farmland and to wash cars is not necessary to reach the same hygienic level as the drinking water .
Hence , we may use recycled water to do these jobs so that we can save more clean drinking water for people to drink .
Actually , this idea has already been adopted by many countries to relieve the pressure caused by the shortage of water .
Moreover , some developed countries , such as Singapore , have mastered this technology so well that recycled water can be drunk directly , which really helps a lot to solve the problem of shortage of water .
However , this method may not suitable for those developing and undeveloped countries because it costs a lot of money , and the technology required is also very high .
The other way to get drinking water is the desalination of sea water .
As mentioned before , the amount of sea water is truly vast therefore , humans can certainly take sea water as another source of drinking water .
However , the process of desalination of sea water is very difficult .
It requires highly advanced science and technology , and of course , it is very costly .
Another limitation of this method is that it can only be applied in seaside countries , like Singapore , which means that it is not the first choice to many inland countries .
But since it also has its advantage , like the huge and widespread source , it is still worth trying .
According to Khandani  , the net result or purpose of most engineering designs is to produce a product that generates a profit for the company .
Therefore , since the two methods mentioned above are both costly and difficult to apply , they can be restricted by the economic and market and thus , they may be not able to solve the shortage of water in a short period .
But what is important is that , at least , these two methods give us hope .
It is this kind of hope that motivates humans to develop , to improve , to pursue our dream , and finally to have such a beautiful world today .
Hope is the most significant contribution which engineers have ever made to the world .
Environment-friendly car is a current humans' need which should be given priority .
