In addition , some company has created solar technology advancement on military weapon and working greatly with the governments .
These technologies are for military demand and don't bring any improvement to life .
Instead , it is used to destroy human and bring misery to certain people .
Technology is the product of negotiation and compromise .
Social and political decisions play a part in determining the technology .
Most of the technology failure is not because of technical problems , but because it is not accepted by the consumers .
In the context of technology , most innovations and inventions are shaped without aiming at addressing a specific or general social issue .
However , there are exceptions .
One of the best known socially shaped inventions is Trevor Baylis's wind-up radio , which was initially designed for communicating information about AIDS to people in Africa .
Apart from the major social issue , there were several other factors including economical problem and technical problem , which also contributed to the final prototype of the mass production on the assembly line .
The wind-up radio was intended to halt the spread of the mortal epidemic AIDS by education and information sent by broadcasts .
AIDS is the most horrible disease that spreads across the continent of Africa , affecting millions of people , most of who are undereducated and still struggling below poverty line .
After a series of surveys and researches , abstinence , fidelity , promotion of condom use and risk perception were identified as the most significant issues concerning the prevention of AIDS .
One step further , BBC , later with other African local radio companies , launched many HIV and AIDS public service announcements in English , French and other African native languages to educate people about AIDS .
At that point , Trevor Baylis came up with the idea of wind-up radio , making idea of broadcasting education possible .
Putting aside the original social objective and economical constraints , designing the wind-up radio also required to solve several practical technical problems .
First , the charging up process should be stable enough to avoid damage to the components of the radio .
Second , the output current must be very stable and enduring for avoiding distortion of the signals .
Last but not least , the charging-up process should be efficient .
Unless the charging-up process can be done within seconds , the annoying process of charging up would finally hinder users from frequent use .
In Singapore , there are actually many issues to consider for an engineer in the engineering design processes for innovations .
The two issues I feel are the most important are in terms of economic and technical challenges .
Economic challenges will affect the process of engineering design because we need to consider the financial status for the majority of the people .
The products being made must not be too expensive .
As a result , people will tend to think twice before they decide to purchase the products .
The economy downturn also prevents consumers from buying things that they think are not essential .
Manufacturing industry suffers the most from this recession .
Due to the financial constraint , consumers will go towards buying pirated products instead of purchasing the original .
This causes a decrease in demand for it .
They do not mind the products for not being able to perform as good as the original .
To them , it is worth it since it is cheaper .
Even if consumers do not go for pirated products , they will still go for second hand products .
This is because the products are still usable despite some minor wear and tear .
The budget given by the company may cause engineers to think of ways to cut down costs in the production so as to gain extra profits for the company .
As a result , the products may not last long enough and have to change it quite regularly .
Technical challenges will need to consider the demands of the consumers .
It must be useful to the majority of the consumers .
We must also cater the needs to the different age group .
It must also provide comfort and convenience to the people .
For example , hand phones , computers , mp3 and cameras have make communication between people in a distant more easily simply just by a click or a press in the button .
Information and data can be transmitted easily by the use of internet .
This was definitely not possible in the past .
Engineers also need to consider whether the consumers will be able to accept the products being designed .
We also need to consider the commercialization of the products .
This is because the way of commercializing will affect the sales of it .
As a result , engineers will be forced to come up the modification of the products in a short period of time .
This will cause the products to be less effective because there is a lack of testing .
Although the gadgets have included more functions , it is less durable .
For example , hand phones nowadays are prone to defect when it is accidentally drop on the floor .
In conclusion , Engineers need to understand the issues that are not related to engineering profession directly but will affect them in the production process .
That is why engineers need to think beyond their job scope .
"{Great innovators and original thinkers and artists attract the wrath of mediocrities as lightning} ."
Nowadays , the ability of engineering designing not only determines one's own future but also a nation's power , wealth , and influence .
However , in my home country , China , engineering design process for innovations are always stifled by political , social , and economic reasons .
Firstly , in China , the designing and innovating process are always hampered by some political factors .
And these factors always result in some management problems .
In China , nearly all the research institutes and universities are state-owned and controlled by the ruling communist party .
Therefore , academic institutions are difficult to escape from acting like a government department .
For instance , the head of research groups and the presidents of universities are all assigned by their superiors in the party .
So when selection processing , the academic achievement of candidate is not the priority to be considered but their loyalty to the party .
Therefore , in some institutes , the head tends to know nothing or have little knowledge upon the field which he is in charge of , which will certainly misguide the research directions and disturb the atmosphere of researching and studying .
Further , the rules of regulating institutes are mandated in a dogmatic and quantized way .
All the boffins are required to attain some academic objections per year .
For example , they need to apply and get a project of how much money per year , or how many essays they should publish in public scientific journals , and so on .
If they cannot meet the requirements , they will not get promoted or get enough salary they are supposed to get .
However , in such a short term , there seems to be impossible to discover significant results .
Hence , many researcher have to 'make up' essays on their own sake , or simply plagiarize other's works .
In addition , in most of institutes , the funds of science are given by seniority .
As for some young but creative engineers or scientists , it may be very hard for them to get financial support to carry on their own researches , which will stifle their creativity and make them have no place to fulfill their potentials .
Secondly , some social reasons also exert detrimental influence upon the designing and innovating process in China .
To start with , it seems to have become a consensus that China does little on the protection of intellectual properties and patents .
What is worse , in china , nearly all the people have formed a habit of buying pirated discs and illegal downloading from the Internet .
From a research by BSA , about 93% software used in china are prated , which costs 3 .6billion dollars loss every year .
And according to Microsoft , about 29% of computers in China are illegally installed with windows system in 2008 especially 5% are computers for government use .
Moreover , the protection is also inadequacy in terms of patent .
According to the statistical figures , about 30 percent of patents are illegally used without authorized .
But it is very hard for the victim to prosecute the infringers .
According to China's law , it will take about 3 years to finish the lawsuit and it will consume more time and money to execute the verdict after they win the case , especially for most of trespassers , who are usually in small business or manufacture their illegal stuffs in a family workshop , it is even harder to trace and penalize them .
Lastly , the designing and the process of innovation are sometimes detrimentally affected by economic mode in China .
On sake of the High GDP index , the government sometimes only cares about how many investments they can attract from overseas and other places And Most of enterprises in china only focus on manufacturing , processing , and exporting goods .
What they need do is just transferring the raw materials to finished goods .
So it is no need for them to invest a multitude of money to establish research and development groups to design or invent new technologies and sciences .
At the same time , they also assert that designs and innovations are not their business but things cared by some leading firms in US or other countries instead of China whose enterprise not only lack of funds but also core technology .
And now most of the enterprises are quite satisfied with this economic increasing mode and think that it is no necessary to change the industrial structures .
So when some original designs and innovations come out in China , it is more likely for them to be ignored and discarded .
So in this way , the impulsion for designing and processing innovations has been greatly encumbered .
To conclude , there are many problems which obstruct the process of engineering design and innovating in my home country , China .
And China still has a long way to improve its regime and the value of whole society towards designing and innovating .
However , I am still optimistic about the engineering design processes for innovations in China and I believe it will be made better when the globalization becomes more prevalent and China becomes more open .
The innovation of laptop from desktop pushed Toshiba , a small company unknown to most , to the focus of IT world and helped it make a lot of money British , being driven by the inventions of steam engine and railway , became the most powerful country in the world .
Engineering design progresses are so important that they determine the rise and decline of companies and even nations .
As the biggest developing country , China has shown the world its power as well as shortcomings .
Among the shortcomings , the lack of engineering design progresses for innovation is serious and the two significant obstacles are the bad environment for reach and the brain drain problem .
The environment for research is bad in China is because at first , there is not enough capital given to do researches .
According to China Research Environment Report , Science Observation  , the average funds for national researchers are less than 100 ,000 RMB a year , to say nothing of other researchers .
Without enough capital , how can researchers buy the necessary equipments and do the necessary experiments to make science and engineering progresses !
Another fact is that the talent in China waste a lot of time doing things that irrelevant to research .
One significant phenomenon is that the doctors , masters and graduate students in university call their tutors 'boss' , which is because instead of teaching them new knowledge or doing researches , tutors often ask students do tasks from companies to make money .
Furthermore , many administration jobs in universities and science institutes are done by scientists and engineers who are not good in administration in deed .
Because of the good treatment of administration jobs , a lot of talented scientists and engineers waste time competing to get them , leaving the research jobs behind .
To move the distractions , it needs to apply certain regulars to retain the talent in their positions and also , improve the treatment of research jobs .
According to an essay in Sina .com  , China has sent 1060 ,000 students to study overseas but only 275 ,000 of them have come back and contribute to their motherland .
The rate of brain drain is near 70% .
It is astonishing .
As known to all , students who manage to get the chances of studying overseas are usually the top students .
They are the ones who can make great contribution to engineering design progresses and other kinds of innovations .
Losing these top students means losing engines that can promote the country to a new height .
To solve the problem , again we should create a good environment for study , research , work and living to attract the talent overseas to come back .
The road for China to become strong in innovations of engineering design is still very long .
We Chinese should work hard together to make China strong and we would grad to see that one day , the logo of 'make in China' can change to 'create in China' .
I believe the current human need that should be given priority is the need to reduce traffic congestion as it has always been a problem left unresolved for many decades .
With the help of engineering design process , many of such problems that we face in this present world can be minimized and resolved .
Engineering design process flows through these stages of defining the problem , gathering information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution and finally testing and implementing of solution .
Firstly , on defining the problem of traffic congestion and also gathering vital information on this human need .
The problem of traffic congestion is constantly happening throughout the world everyday and it is affecting the way we carry out our daily routines .
This problem leads to the lost of precious time that could be put to good use and it also affects the progression of work and major projects .
With this lost of precious time , we often have to make use of extra time to make up for the time lost in traffic congestion .
Thus it will also create an impact in the financial losses and holding back economic growth throughout the world .
Secondly is the generating of multiple relating solutions , analyzing and selecting of a suitable solution .
One of the solutions that I came up with is to have a signboard attached to all traffic lights this will indicate to all the drivers whether they should avoid travelling on certain roads that may have traffic congestion .
Although there are radio stations to report on traffic congestion , however some drivers may not tune into radio stations or may not know of other alternative ways to redirect their paths .
This results in accumulating the length of traffic congestions as the numbers of cars keeps piling up after it occurs .
This solution of indication can prove to be very useful , when an accident or traffic congestion occur .
The sign board will have the three arrows mainly representing , left , straight and right directions .
For example in an event of traffic congestion , the central transport system will be notified in the shortest possible time .
Signboards that are in area of traffic congestion and other possible affected areas would be updated and give suggestion to the drivers to redirect them away from the traffic congestion .
This central transport system would also provide an update for the traffic police so that they may go down to rectify the situation .
Lastly is the testing and implementing of solution .
With this idea of solution , I would build a 3D replica of this system to test on the effectiveness of the reducing traffic congestion .
I would continue to improve on the design with more stringent tests and experiments which will give me the most suitable configuration for a specific area on the island .
In conclusion , I see the need to improve on the transportation system around the world .
Using engineering design process , we could design a specific solution to allow the transportation system to have a faster and smoother flow of traffic .
As we advanced into dramatic change of technology , the world has made a breakthrough in science and achieved a milestone of success .
It is veracity that engineers are those who are playing crucial role in the society while the world is expanding unremittingly .
This is because engineers are quintessential in designing products that meet human needs .
They utilize their knowledge to come out with new innovations which will give a fresh impetus to enhance the development .
In my opinion , current human need that should be given priority is having electric vehicles that operated entirely on battery power .
As we all know , petrol is non renewable natural resources and hence changes of its price has a big influence to the world economic as all main transportations are using it as fuel .
Therefore , it is necessary to design vehicles that move by low cost electricity .
Electric vehicles can receive their power from a number of renewable sources that then transmitted into the vehicle through the use of electrical cable and stored in battery .
Through this , the dependence on the crude oil can be minimized gradually .
In addition , air pollution is deteriorating nowadays .
By using environmental friendly electric vehicles , the pollution problem can be alleviated by decreasing the smog level .
Furthermore , electric vehicles typically have less{noise pollution} .
According to Seyyed Khandani , Ph .D . , there are 5 steps for solving design problems so that the process meets the need .
Firstly , engineers must recognize the need and define the designing problems such as how far the driving range of a fully charged electric vehicle is and etcetera by gathering enough information , running experiments and perform computation .
After that , engineers should start gathering pertinent information to reveal fact facts about the problem .
This step is quintessential as it make sure that their efforts and time of are not wasted at the wrong place .
Then , engineer will use creativity to generate ideas that solve the problem by starting with existing solutions then try figure out and improve the weakness in those solutions .
Later on , engineers will combine their new ideas and tools into the existing solutions and finally unique solutions will be formed .
At this stage , engineers might have multiple solutions .
Hence , they have to analyzing their solutions and select the solution which is best suited for implementation .
The last step is test and implements the solution that involves testing , construction and manufacturing of the solution to the design problem .
If the car passes all the tests , a new electric car is finally formed and will definitely meet the need .
Besides , engineers need to consider about the electric car's safety , cost and effects to the environment so that this engineering design meet the need .
For instance , since electric car design's cost is over budget , engineer might rather design combination electric-gasoline vehicles to cut down the cost .
In addition , safety of the car should be given priority in order the design process meet that need .
Thus , engineers have to confirm that the car is safe to be driven by running few tests before the cars are supplied in the market place .
Engineers also have to run experiment on the emission from electric car so to make sure the car is environmental friendly .
To drive home the point , the engineering design processes will definitely meet that need if engineers preserve stoically whenever they meet failures during the process .
Engineers have a constant need to upgrade current technologies to keep up with the ever-evolving world .
Being a problem solver had only meant that they will constantly face a slew of problems that abound in the world .
Changes in the climate in recent times show that the Earth is embroiled in what is called global warming .
The need for more sophisticated technologies to reverse this damage caused to our environment has set engineers racing against the clock .
The war on terror never ceases as well .
The need for state-of-the-art weaponry and stealth vehicles has posed a tough problem to engineers as well .
However one human need that is most prevalent and disconcerting is widespread hunger .
The need for engineers to come up with food technologies that may fill the bellies of hungry children is overwhelming .
Indeed , we have to solve this pressing problem before it becomes too late .
Another way to increase food production is to engineer grains and seeds so they produce more within a shorter timeframe .
They are genetically modified with desirable qualities to meet the needs and conditions of the place they are grown .
Crops are more robust and can withstand harsher conditions like strong winds , while carrying more grains atop their stem .
By genetically engineering many of our foods , we can actually increase food yield from the same plot of land in a shorter amount of time .
However , Khandani mentions that the solution isn't perfect and we should keep revising and "going back to the drawing board" .
Our solutions are not one off .
We need to constantly modify them even as they bring about more problems .
In short , man will always find ways to solve our daily problems through engineering .
When people around the world are dying from hunger , engineers can be called to present possible solutions and find the best and most efficient way to deal with them .
Global warming is an exceptionally severe problem facing the world today .
It is a process whereby the Earth's temperature increases which are attributable to the use of fossil fuels , and industrial or agricultural processes .
Man-made emissions release great amount of carbon dioxide which causes a large buildup of "greenhouse gases" .
One factor which contributes to the buildup is from power plants or factories .
Another major factor will be the carbon dioxide emitted from cars .
Though it may only contribute a small percentage to the buildup in the gases , but as time goes by , the increase in the utility of cars will become a big threat to global warming .
Thus a group of students from NUS came out with an idea of creating an eco-friendly urban concept car with zero carbon emission .
This group consists of students from the School of Design and Environment and also the school of Engineering .
This car was built from scratch with its body designed and manufactured by the students themselves .
It runs on a hydrogen fuel cell that drives the electric wheel hub motor .
In this way , it will achieve twice the energy efficiency compared to the burning of gasoline in the internal-combustion engines .
In addition , with the design of the eco-car , mechanics will have easier access to the components for trouble-shooting .
With such attractive advantages installed in the eco-car , it might slowly be introduced to the society as a form of transport so as to solve the problem of global warming .
Because the eco-car runs on hydrogen gas , this will lead to the reduction in the usage of petroleum and thus saving the natural resources for better usage .
However , there will also be disadvantages with regards to the creation of the eco-car .
Though the eco-car may seem to be the perfect solution to solve the problem of gasoline combustion cars , it will cause conflicts with many car manufacturers such as Toyota or Nissan .
With this invention , the governments will strongly recommend civilians to replace their current vehicle to the eco-car .
As a result , there will be a negative impact on the sales for the current car manufacturers .
When all of these happen , it will also affect the economy and also the jobs of the sales personnel .
Another disadvantage of the eco-car will be the resources that it uses .
Take gasoline combustion cars as an example , when it is running low of fuels , the driver can easily top up his vehicle at any petrol stations nearby .
But as for the eco-car , the resources it uses may not be readily available , so it will not be very convenient .
Although the eco-car may be a great invention to remedy the problem of global warming , we should not solely depend on it .
Instead we should put more focus on the other factors which have greater impact on global warming
Most of the products today are created using a conventionally generated technology but there are a few products were invented in a skunkworks environment .
For example , the first laptop computer was produced in a skunkworks environment because Toshiba , a Japanese electronics company , have taken huge losses with its failure in the desktop computers' market in the 1980s .
So , the company refused to invest in the research and development of the laptop computer  .
Even though conventionally generated technology is more popular nowadays , both ways of production have its own advantages and disadvantages .
Both ways of production are similar in its motive .
The intention of the teams is to research and develop their product hoping to come out with new invention or make the existing products better .
For example , a research and development team with financial support from the company research on the company's product and try to improve the existing products and create new products for the company .
It is almost the same for the team working in skunkworks environment .
They believed that the products they are working on will be a success even though they are not supported by company .
However , there are differences between the two of them .
Firstly , they differ in financial aspect which is the main aspect .
Productions using conventionally generated technology have full financial support from the company .
With the financial support from company , the research and development team can have comfortable and productive workspace .
On the other hand , there are no or very few financial support for the team working in skunkworks environment .
Therefore , skunkworks environment usually are not comfortable to work in .
Besides mentioned above , the team using conventionally generated technology can afford state of the art devices which will increase the efficiency of research .
In contrast , the team working in skunkworks environment not only do not have those devices , but they have to bring their own equipment to work .
The second difference between productions using a conventionally generated technology with those from skunkworks environment is the creativity of the team members .
The main problem of the team in skunkworks environment is the financial problem as mentioned earlier .
The lack of money causes them to consider other options when inventing a product .
For example , they might look for used items to be use as inputs for its production .
In contrary , the team with full financial support do not really need to consider the cost of research therefore they most probably could not come up with products which are more cost efficient .
Finally , after comparing both the ways of production , we will realize that both also have their pros and cons but in my perspective , production in the skunkworks environment is better mainly because of the freedom in inventing new things .
Without the supervision and control from the sponsor company , team members are able to explore new ideas that might not be parallel to the company's main objective .
That is why there is a significant number of people are willing to work in the skunkworks environment despite the problems they faced .
This is because these people believed that their inventions will benefit mankind .
Helen Keller made her miraculous breakthrough as she spelled W-A-T-E-R when water ran over her hand .
The importance of water lies where it comprises 70% of a person .
Without food , one can still live for a few days .
However , without water , life will be shortened to one day .
No doubt water is the basis of life in this planet .
In the Maslow's Hierarchy of needs , water , together with breathing , food , sex , sleep , homeostasis and excretion are the ground basic of human needs .
Therefore it should be given priority as a current human need .
However , in real life , a problem may not be solved as expected by implementing a standardized model .
For example , for an idea of water conservation to be developed further , scientists need the financial support from government/corporations .
Self-funded projects are usually carried out in skunkworks environment where researchers have to bear the consequence of failure .
Further more , the whole process in the model which Khandani has proposed may take many years to be completed , making self-funded projects less viable if there is still no support along the way .
Another kink in the process is the selection of solutions .
Corporate bodies tend to look for solutions with maximum profitable returns .
Government entities also need to justify themselves if they opt for more expensive solutions which may/may not generate returns .
For example , comparing to the water transfer project from another location with more abundant water supply , distillation of sea water will be a more expensive solution though it has the potential of solving the problem in the long run .
In conclusion , water is the urgent need for human .
To solve water scarcity with the engineering design processes is viable , but limited in its actual application .
Many things that surrounds us today makes our lives a lot easier .
From kitchen appliances like refrigerator to home entertainment systems , these are things which we often take them for granted .
They also did not appear at our homes overnight like Christmas presents .
All the many inventions at our homes are developed by engineers which took a long time to develop .
It started from identifying the needs of people , followed by coming up with various solutions and then implementing it .
This is called Design Process in which engineers use to approach problems .
According to Khandani , there are five basic steps used in a design process .
This five basic steps can also be applied to problem solving .
The first step is to identify the problem , which usually involves the process of knowing what the customer wants and what problems are they encountering with existing products .
Secondly we need to gather more information , like previous failed attempts of solving similar problems , whether a need for a new solution is needed or not and the problem with existing solutions .
Thirdly coming up with many solutions , fourth after analyzing all the solutions , one is chosen .
Lastly testing and implementation is done on the solution .
All the steps are important as safety , reliability and economic factors are included and may have a huge impact on many peoples' lives .
Currently , there are many engineers in our society today .
They solve solutions to needs of people , for example an army general wanting a better and a faster tank for his army .
But more priority should be given to things like health care .
In the past , people who wants to see a doctor have to wait in long ques .
More often than not , those people who are waiting in the line were in urgent need for medical attention .
Time is often wasted in the administrative part of the process .
Nurses in a clinic have to flip through archives for a patient's information manually .
Therefore a more efficient way of allowing people to see doctors are needed .
Engineering process can be applied to meet the needs of people and solve the problem .
After the problem is being identified , more information needs to be gathered .
Khandani said that inexperience designers will skip this step and proceed to finding solutions , but efforts spent in gathering information will pay out later in the design process .
Engineers found out that in clinics , human errors of the nurse is present , resulting in longer ques .
So solutions like computerizing all administrative work and the processing of patient's medication is being implemented .
In this way , human error is eliminated and people can see the doctor and get their medication in a faster way .
There are many problems than can be solved systemically using the five design process that Khandani mentioned .
Health care is only one of the many pressing needs for engineers to solve .
Many useful feed back is needed in order for more problems to be identified .
In the 21st century , with the development of the world's economy , people's living standard keeps advancing .
However , because of overeating high protein food , being lack of exercise and many other relevant reasons , various kinds of disease is threatening us human beings , especially the heart disease .
Till now , heart attack has become the top one killer among all the disease which threatens the human's health .
According to a research conducted at 2000 , the number of people dying from heart attack accounts for almost one-third of the total number of deaths around the world , and even worse the percentage is expected to be greatly enhanced by 2020 .
As a result , WHO says heart attack as the 21st century's plague and calls for more attention on the heart disease .
Fortunately , the appearance of a kind of engineering design product helps huge amount of patients who suffer a lot from heart attack .
That is heart pacemaker .
What is a heart pacemaker ?
Basically , it is a medical device which uses electrical impulses , delivered by electrodes contacting the heart muscles , to regulate the beating of the heart .
With the help of pacemaker , patients whose heart rate is too high or too low can maintain an adequate heart rate .
According to classification , Heart pacemaker belongs to ergonomics which is a study of how people interact with machines .
As an ergonomical design , the primary requirement is safety .
Because the heart pacemaker should be implanted into patient's body before it can work well , it asks for higher safety requirement .
The material used to make a pacemaker is silicon , titanium steel and special artificial plastic , both of them is quite friendly to patients' internal environment and will not cause injury or other diseases to humans .
What's more , nowadays , the heart pacemaker is quite small with thickness only 10mm and weight only 40 grams .
Such kind of little size ensures a low possibility of hurting the human organs .
All in all , proper material and suitable size make the pacemaker much safer to use .
Overview , the coming out of the heart pacemaker makes a tremendous contribution to the patients who suffer from the heart attack .
We have to say it is really a commendable achievement among all the engineering designs .
Let's expect the prospective heart pacemaker can be more convenience and more powerful features at lower price .
I'm sure it will be fantastic news for the whole human beings .
Technical innovations are essential to the development of a nation .
However , making innovations is not just as simple as thinking about new ideas and carrying them out , but something requiring complex engineering design processes .
According to Khandani , the process of solving design problems can be generalized to five steps: "define the problem , gather pertinent information , generate multiple solutions , analyze and select a solution , and test and implement the solution" .
In most cases , it is not easy to go through all these steps successfully due to the hindrances from various facets .
In this essay , I will talk about two problems which have been greatly hindering such engineering design processes in China .
One is the brain drain problem and the other is the capital problem .
Since China adopted the reform and opening-up policy in 1978 , uncounted promising students have gone abroad for further study .
China has spent a lot of resources to educate them and expects them to reward the society after further education .
Unfortunately , lots of these talents are unwilling to return to their motherland because of the much more superior conditions in developed countries , which causes the brain drain problem .
As we can see , the five steps of engineering design processes for innovations given above all involve qualified well-educated people .
Such a brain drain makes China fall into a severe shortage of talents whom are necessary for the implementation of any stages of the process .
Since there are not enough people for engineering design processes , China is not capable of making enough innovations for higher living standards in a short time .
Then more educated people will go abroad , which deteriorates the brain drain problem in turn and exerts a greater negative effect on the process .
Secondly , China is still struggling to meet its people's basic living needs as a developing country .
Every year China has to spend most of its revenue on fundamental infrastructure and national defense , etc .
Therefore , unlike US and European developed countries , not much capital can be spared for engineering design processes for innovations , which arises the capital problem .
As we all know , it is often costly to gather sufficient valuable information in this information age and carry out a new policy in today's materialistic society .
Thus in the course of engineering design , one usually needs lots of money for getting pertinent information and testing and implementing the solution .
Without enough useful information , people cannot come up with best solutions .
Even if they have made it , testing and implementing it is still impossible without sufficient capital .
Besides , when people are aware that not much capital is available , they may not choose the most efficient but more costly solution in the course of 'analyzing and selecting a solution' , which may bring about bad effects in the long run .
Therefore , the capital problem hampers engineering design processes to a very great extent .
Actually , the brain drain problem and capital problem have been restricting China's engineering design processes greatly these years .
But the government has done much to relieve these two and other similar problems .
I have the confidence that China will overcome these hindrances one day .
At that time engineering design products or systems will boom to meet people' needs .
Einstein once noted that"the god doesn't play dice ."
From his perspective , since every natural event happens as a result of a cause or collective causes , I'm not sure if it is proper to refer the discovery of LSD , short term of Lysergic acid diethylamide , as an accident .
At least it is not an intentional consequence like the discovery of risperidone , a medicine for mentally disordered people .
In the following paragraphs , I shall touch on the similarities and differences of their pharmaceutical effects , controllabilities and consuming groups .
Firstly , despite the fact that they focus on different aspects pharmaceutically , LSD and risperidone actually share some similarities on medical effects .
They both have strong corrective influence on mental disorder .
In 1993 , by the United States Food and Drug Administration , risperidone was approved for the treatment of schizophrenia , and bipolar disorder in 2007 .
Especially for pupils with age 13-18 , risperidone is the only approved drug agent in America .
On another hand , LSD was once widely used for treatments of mental disorder as well before it was approved with devastating side effects , which would be illustrated in the second paragraph .
However , LSD affects people in alcoholism in a positive way which unachievable for risperidone .
Secondly , the controllability of the both of short term and long effects of LSD and risperidone varies greatly .
Risperidone always gives a constant performance .
Beside its expected medical effects , the side-effects are also predictable .
The most common side effects include severe anxiety , akathisia , sedation , dysphoria , insomnia , sexual dysfunction , low blood pressure , muscle stiffness , muscle pain , tremors , increased salivation , and stuffy nose .
But for LSD , the physical and psychological effect varies greatly from one to another , and is highly depend on the amount of dosage , consumer's personality , mood , the surrounding environment and other variable factors .
Most importantly , the social issues aroused by consumption of LSD are unexpected .
The typical physical effects are dilated pupils , higher body temperature , increased heart rate and blood pressure , sweating , loss of appetite , sleeplessness , dry mouth , and tremors .
Rather than physical and psychological effects , LSD also triggers intense spiritual experience which leads consumers to illusory images and feelings .
There is a great number of people believe that LSD serve as divine vehicle which transport the consumers to the outer-space where the god lives .
Several suicides were conducted before the United States government banned LSD in 1966 .
Lastly , the consuming groups of LSD and risperidone consist of different people with different purpose , resulting in different social problems .
Normally , the consumers of risperidone are psychological patients who are seeking effective treatment .
However for LSD , it was mainly regarded as a mean to get high by the American hippies .
Even the poets , painters and musicians tried to seek inspiration by consuming the LSD .
As a result , the consuming group of LSD is rather complicated than that of risperidone .
According to above , even though riperidone and LSD share some similarities in their pharmaceutical effects to certain extend , they are different from each other in terms of controllabliities of side effects and their consuming groups .
The sport is one of the most important things in human beings life .
But , unfortunately , it is inevitable to get injured when we do sports .
Knee injury is a common injury in many sports , for example , basketball , soccer , skiing and etc .
And also , it is difficult to recover because of the complexity of the knee .
Among the various knee injuries , the anterior cruciate ligament injury happened in most cases .
If the sick do not recover completely , it is likely for him to get injured again at the same place .
Even worse it could affect his daily life .
So  ,the treatment of the ACL injury is considered as a very important problem in sports medicine .
To make the artificial ligament meet the need , scientists considered it in many aspects .
First , the artificial ligaments should not cause rejection reaction  .Second , it should be very strong  ,flexible and anti abrasive  ,so that it can ensure that the patient can play sports in the normal level .
Third  ,it should have the ability to grow and combine with the reptured ligament .
After a few years research , an artificial one called LARS ligaments came out .
The LARS ligament is made of industrial strength polyester fibers .
The polyester fibers and the original design of the knit have been tested for rupture , stretching and wear .
The result has showed that the LARS ligament is extremely resistant to flexion , traction , torsion , and residual stretching .
Also , the design has biocompatible properties to human beings tissues , because the intra-articular longitudinal fibers allow for tissue in growth .
Compared with the human ligaments , the LARS ligament is much more tensile .
Futhermore , if we use LARS ligaments in the reconstruction of cruciate ligament , the time of recovery can be reduce a lot .
The professional player who uses LARS ligaments can return to the court in 3 or 4 months after the surgery while the classic method will cost 6 to 12 months to recover .
This technology shows its advantages with the classic method .
And the invention of it gives the players and sports enthusiasts a better choice when they suffer the injury .
At the same time , there is also a pitfall about the artificial ligaments .
Because it appeared less than 20 years and we can not predict what could happen after 30 or 40 years , which artificial ligaments have been used for .
I think as it improves a lot in the future , it can take possession of the classic method finally .
STS , Science and technology studies , is the interaction of scientific research and social , political , cultural values .
Having taken shape in the 1960s , STS provides us another view of the innovation-development process in terms of social construction of technology .
Among thousands of technologies , laptop , one of the most important innovations in twentieth century , is a good example of socially determined technology .
The laptop , firstly manufactured by Toshiba in 1985 , ten years after the birth of the desktop computer , has again brought about a tremendous revolution in our lives .
The idea of making a laptop was inspired by mainly three social factors: demand of customers , support of technical stuff , and source of funding .
Secondly , the man power that provides technological support plays an essential rule to the innovation of laptop .
The idea of designing laptop was first not approved by Toshiba  , while Mizoguchi , the chief designer of laptop did not give up .
He organized a group of talented engineers who were selected from the military projects with strong professional skills and knowledge and started the research secretly .
After 24 months of hard work and thousands of times of practice , the first laptop was born .
The support of technical stuff brought a successful step towards the final goal of promoting and producing laptops .
Lastly , but not the least , the source of funding made the production and sales of laptops possible .
Though the research team has made the idea of laptop came true , the laptop would not be finally put into production without a large amount of money .
To the disappointment , the plan of producing the laptops had again been rejected due to the small potential market estimated by the company .
A new obstacle was in the way of Mizoguchi's laptop plan .
Fortunately , the potential of this innovation drew the attention of Nishida , an expert at marketing .
With his cooperation , the sales of laptop had been guaranteed and the production was finally executed .
To sum up , the innovation of laptop cannot be separated with the three main factors .
The demand of customers inspired the designers , the support of technical stuff put the idea into practice , and finally , the source of funding ensure the sales .
Without any of these three factors , the dream of owning a laptop will be still a dream now .
Rogers , E .M .  .
The birth of the laptop computer at Toshiba .

In Diffusion of innovations  .
New York: Free Press .
Have you tried to live with fire as your light source and use fire to cook or heat food ?
It must be terrible .
Fortunately , Thomas Edison created lightbulb in 1879 and Percy LeBaron Spencer discovered microwave energy after World War two .
It is amazing that Edison picked up a fifty-year-old idea and made it come true , while Percy brought microwave oven to light by an accident , indeed .
These two wonderful discoveries have lots of similarities and difference .
In the first place , the two inventors discovered lightbulb and microwave oven in totally different ways .
Moreover , the idea of microwave oven was totally new , while someone had worked on lightbulb before Edison .
Finally , the inventions and innovations of lightbulb and microwave oven are really great creations for human beings .
First of all , Edison and Percy made the two considerable discoveries in two completely different ways .
Edison achieved this unbelievable task by thousands of various experiments .
To choose the suitable filament for the lightbulb , Edison tried more than 1600 kinds of materials with different heat-resisting .
The result showed that platinum was the best material to be used as filaments , which was not satisfying due to its high price .
After many setbacks , Edison decided to use carbon to make filament .
Nevertheless , Percy lighted on microwave energy by pure coincidence .
When he did some experiment focusing on radar waves , the melt of a candy bar in his pocket excite the surprise of him .
After deeper research , Percy concluded that microwave heating could raise the internal temperature of many foods far more rapidly than a conventional oven .
Last but not least , lightbulb helps us say goodbye to darkness and microwave oven provides us a pretty convenient way to heat food .
Both of these two remarkable inventions help us to lead a much better life now .
Because of lightbulb , the big world becomes brighter and more colorful .
Also , we can read , write and do lots of things in the night .
Lightbulb has brought us easier and more convenient life .
In the same manner , microwave oven has become one of the many modern conveniences nowadays .
It provides us a better way to heat food .
Not only can it save time but also can be operated in a safer manner .
15th August , known as "Victory in the Pacific Day" , is celebrated by people all around the world to memorize the surrender of Japan in 1945 .
What we need to emphasize here is that the atomic bomb explosion in Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 6th and 9th August respectively definitely speed the surrender of Japan .
In the history of warfare , these are the only two nuclear weapons used for attacking .
Nowadays , more than sixty years passed by , nuclear weapons are still the most destructive weapons invented by human beings .
Surprisingly , when the nuclear technology is firstly discovered by scientists , it was seemed as a method to satisfy human's needs of energy .
If there was no E=mc2 or World War Two , nuclear weapons may never be invented .
But everything also seems very natural and has its inevitability .
This is history .
Maybe for the nuclear technology itself , utilizing it to make weapons is unfair , but we must agree that it is the social needs , or specifically the military demands , and government priorities at that time that decide the direction of this innovation .
Just like every year people celebrate the "Victory in the Pacific Day" , there should be some others memorizing the nuclear weapons .
There are two different perspectives for the development of technologies: technological and sociological point of view .
When viewed from the technological point of view , it can be seen that the technology , consisting of hardware and software , is shaped according to how technology has improved .
However , that is not true as it can be seen that considerations like market and cost are not taken into account .
Therefore the sociological factors like affordability and user-friendliness are used to determine the development of technologies .
An example of such technology is the Global Positioning System  .
The technology consists of numerous satellites that orbit around the Earth that provide its users with various functions ranging from navigation to prediction of weather , thus , widely used in transportation industries .
The military also use GPS in various methods from missile guidance to enemy tracking .
Besides that , the public has also benefited from this technology as it can be used for search and rescue purposes and also as a navigation aid .
Numerous factors have brought about the development of the GPS mainly the government , military and public demands .
First , the government had a great part to play in the development of the GPS .
In 1983 , the U .S . President Ronald Reagan decided that the GPS will be made available to civilian uses after the Soviet Union shot down a commercial airliner which had navigational difficulty , bringing about the death of more than 200 passengers .
Since then , the government realised that the GPS is the key to providing a dependable way of navigation and thus , pushed for its development .
Currently , the GPS is widely used in the aviation and maritime industry so that similar incidents can be avoided .
Second , the military brought about revolution in the usage of GPS by integrating missiles and other artilleries with GPS which improved the accuracy and efficiency of the weapons .
Besides that , it allowed the soldiers to do scouting and accomplish their tasks at night through GPS- receivers that coordinated their movements with command posts .
When the GPS is paired together with satellite cameras , enemy tracking and identifying targets are made convenient .
Next , the public demands have pushed the benefits of the GPS greater when gadgets are integrated with GPS to provide constant relative motion and time coordinating .
Using such products , users are capable of navigating in any part of the world .
At such , even the user's estimated time of arrival can be calculated .
Such products have saved lives when rescuers tracked the GPS signals from their gadgets to locate the victim's whereabouts , bringing the success rate of search and rescue mission to a higher level .
Today , the GPS is a widely used technology in not just the transport industry , but also in military and civilian purposes .
It has also since developed into a cost saving technology as it saves not just petrol and gasoline , but also time and effort .
Besides that , many victims owe their life to GPS when rescued from disasters and accidents .
It has been published that the GPS will fail in the year 2010 , however , with its wide range of purposes and benefits , efforts are being put in place by various governments around the world to not just keep it functional , but also to improve its capabilities .
Therefore , we can expect to see more GPS-related technology in future .
The development of technology has benefited human beings in both scientific researches and daily life of human beings .
With the invention of microscope , scientists are able to observe molecules which form all matters .
Besides scientific researches , inventions and new technologies have indeed brought convenience to human beings .
With mobile phones and Internet around , individuals are connected to the whole world with a simple click .
As Rogers stated in his book , development of technologies is stimulated either by scientific research or by social reasons .
One important technology which was socially determined is the invention of laptop in Toshiba , a Japanese electronics company .
The invention of laptop was originally designed to fit crowded offices and small homes which were typical in Japan .
At that time , dozens of workers shares one desk and desktop computers were too large in size .
Laptop was then invented by an engineer in Toshiba Company called Mizoguchi , whose braveness and wisdom has been recognized in the process of inventing laptop .
However , because of lacking resources and unpromising market , the innovation of laptop in Toshiba was nearly aborted .
Fortunately , the designers of laptop were strong-minded so people nowadays are able to access internet anywhere with laptops that were first invented by them .
In the process of inventing a laptop , the design team was lack of human resource and money .
At first , the idea of designing laptop was disapproved by the Toshiba Company , which at that time has just suffered from huge loss in the business of personal computers .
Corporate leaders of the company then were no longer interested in computer-related businesses and thus refused to provide fund and experts to the designing team .
Although the team survived due to the insistence of Mizogushi and finally came up with the first laptop in the world , lack of resources has had an impact on the design team , which made the team 'stressful' in the designing process .
After the laptop was invented , it was forbidden to be sold in Japan since the company was not optimistic about the market of its new product .
Thus , the designers decided to present their production in Europe first , where they had a great success .
After that , laptops were introduced to all parts of the world and had brought convenience to people .
To wrap up , the invention of laptop was affected by the lack of resources and unpromising market which ultimately came from opinion of the authority in Toshiba Company which turned out to be incorrect .
However , the result is that laptops were eventually invented and brought convenience to human beings .
It is true that sometimes technology innovation may be affected by some factors , but hopes are that determined engineers such as Mizogushi will eventually come up with inventions that can improve our quality of life .
Serendipitous scientific discoveries often refer to those unexpected surprises scientists came across fully by chance in the area of science and technology .
These unplanned serendipitous "accidents" often turned out to be good results .
Actually a lot of major discoveries made by excellent scientists are unexpected gifts from good luck .
Some of them did change the course of history and still have a significant influence on the entire human race today , even the whole environment where we settled in .
For instance , the discovery of cosmic background radiation , the invention of the first microwave oven and the discovery of electromagnetism are all serendipitous .
In particular , pharmacology perhaps the most common fields where serendipity occurs .
The discovery of penicillin--a fairly common antibiotic in drug stores--is one of the most famous .
After the discovery of the new substance , he came to the problem of how to cultivating the mould and how to isolate and purify the antibiotic agent .
Both of them seemed to be quite difficult .
Fleming continued his research and trial for a long period of time with his assistant , but to no avail .
During World War II , the work was taken over by two other scientists and they soon found a technique to purify penicillin and started the mass production .
It saved a lot of soldiers' life in the war .
Of course Fleming's contribution was never forgotten .
He shared the Nobel Prize for physiology/medicine with the two scientists .
It is quite interesting that penicillin was once discovered by a scientist serendipitously .
However , what would have happened if Fleming had never been concerned about the search for the cure or he had had no interest in this area at all ?
What would have happened if Fleming had ignored the contamination and just dropped it into the cleaning mixture ?
The whole world would have waited for more decades to see the discovery of penicillin .
It is just because Fleming was intrigued by his research that he could notice the mould contamination on the bacteria culture and stretch out further reflection on it , while others couldn't .
Hard work finally pays off .
Serendipity only favours those with high aspirations and determination who whole-heartedly dedicated themselves to their beloved career .
Century after century the engineering design processes for innovations speed up all-round social progress and create the civilisation we have today .
As far as I am concerned , the so-called engineering design processes for innovations actually means that the whole industry depends on the creative and passionate engineers to design new products or systems which can perfectly meet the society's demand .
In this way , the society is pushed forward .
That is why we say that scientific and technological process and innovation is the basic motive to promote productivity development .
However nowadays , we may find that these processes seem not so significant .
Perhaps some people will say that it is reasonable that the society is now in a relatively stationary stage since the modern scene was marked by tremendously and ever-accelerating change in the past few years .
But it is not the main reason in my opinion .
Just take my home country for an example .
The most serious problem which hampers the innovation process is that the technological base is relatively lower than the developed world .
Since industry innovation is a process with very high risk .
In other words , it runs a high risk of failure .
From the research report given by the government we can see that more than eighty percent of the companies involved in the research have some experience of breaking off or failure .
Because of the low technological base , the possibility of coming across with some bottlenecks in the innovation process is higher .
In this way , companies may dare not to pump money into the development of new products .
As we all know , enough funds are the basic guarantee for innovation .
Once the process is lack of funds , there is little hope for the process to continue .
Thus , the money we have already pumped in just becomes sunk cost , which means the company losses .
Then , this becomes a vicious circle .
High risk means less money pumped in .
Less money leads to higher risk of failure .
Finally , fewer and fewer companies will be willing to go for the innovation process .
Another very important factor in my opinion is about the lack of researchers .
As is known to all , the key to technological innovation is talents , especially those high-quality compound talents .
But the fact is that the lack of researchers has become the 'bottleneck' restrictions for most of the companies in China .
Statistics suggest that the R&D teams in companies tend to reduce .
What is worse , there are many companies which even do not get a R&D team yet .
Besides , the not so high salary can hardly attract high-quality talents to join the research team , which is also due to the lack of funds which I have mentioned before .
All these make it even more difficult for the innovation to born the fruit .
Anyway , we are living in such a world where everyone is down-to-earth .
People are always tending to do things that will benefit .
As a consequence , R&D may become the last choice for some talents .
All in all , it is the low level of technological base and the lack of excellent researchers that significantly hamper the whole process for innovation .
To improve the present situation , it is better for the companies to pump in more money to the process and attract more talents to contribute to the technology progress .
Additionally , companies should import the advanced ideas and skills from the developed world to improve the technological skill of themselves .
Only in this way can we expect a better environment for innovation and more significant scientific and technological progress .
Recently , along with the rapid and sound development of China's economy , China has made world-acknowledged achievements in technological area .
However , some obstacles still hamper the process of technological innovation of China , as the technological development is in its infancy .
In my opinion , there are mainly two big problems for us to overcome in the next few years , which are the decentralization and shortage of sources and the lagging of technology transfer .
Source refers to human capital and financial support .
Actually , decentralization of human capital and delayed financial support hamper the stage of research and development to a quite large extent .
Compared to other developing countries , China does not have a standard innovation centre where a lot of talented scientists and engineers can discuss and develop a creative project .
Take Silicon Valley as an example , a lot of new technological products are developed and promising companies are founded there every year , which is a result of the cooperation of many talents .
But China does not have such a base for technology development .
Chinese talents are spreading all over the world .
How to call up them and work out some big projects is a tough task for our government .
Lack of financial support is another problem faced by some existing research departments .
Every year , China raises a large quantity of money to support technology development .
However , if the financial support is divided into small parts , these departments will not get enough money to do a large scale research .
What's more , some research projects must wait several months for financial support , during which time scientists may lose heart and give up .
As a result , research and development , which are the first steps of innovation , becomes more and more difficult .
China should try hard to solve the problem of source .
Another problem is the lagging of technology transfer , which is a headache for a lot of research departments .
As we all know , technology was born to meet human's needs .
Therefore , transforming technology into human lives is significant for an innovation .
Some new technologies may be born as well as die in laboratories as a result of lagging of technology transfer .
Take computer as an example: it is said that the development speed of the computer is quite fast .
Maybe it takes about a few years to generate a new generation .
But can most of us change our computers every few years ?
Impossible !
What's more , as China does not have a system to link these new techniques with manufacturing departments , I think most manufacturing factories cannot make full use of these innovations .
Therefore , we'd better to build a sound system to do the technology transfer .
As far as I am concerned , the two problems are crucial as one refers to the beginning of innovation and the other determines the destiny of this innovation .
I think there are some ways to solve these problems .
Firstly , we'd better develop some technical centre to bring talents together and do research .
Secondly , we must develop a complete system for technology transformation .
If we can overcome these problem , I believe the design process of innovation in China will develop farther more .
Nowadays , innovative engineering design plays a significant role in technology development .
A smart design , sometimes only involving a little change , can improve the work efficiency by several times , which can produce a much more attractive profit .
Obviously , cultivating engineers' innovative abilities is very important .
However , in my home country , many problems exist as huge barriers for engineers to apply their innovative ideas into practice .
The improper education model and the unsatisfying experimental conditions stand out among many reasons .
After all the above , we can see the improper model and the unsatisfying social conditions really act as obstacles to innovative engineering designs .
This may be a reason that China's technology is still behind many countries in certain fields .
However , we must also see things are changing .
As China is carrying out education reform in a large scale and putting more emphasis on technology innovations , we can predict China's technology has a good perspective .
In the old days , taking photos was a complicated process which was almost performed solely by professional technicians .
A photographer had to not only adjust all the settings manually , but also print the films with chemicals called film developer in a darkroom .
However , the recent two decades witnessed astonishing innovation in photographythe development of digital cameras which has made taking photos accessible to non-specialists .
This development came as a result of people's demand for more convenient photo-taking techniques .
Consumers' desire for more convenient usage and better photo quality shapes the development of DC technology .
Consumers' pursuit of better photo quality also drives the innovation of advanced DC technology .
The quality of a photo is mainly determined by the resolution of a camera .
To improve resolution , a company needs to conduct a considerable amount of research , including generation of new ideas , technology breakthroughs and repetitive experiments .
The process is hard , but companies are still willing to sacrifice their time and labor for the development , since the better the resolution , the more customers will be attracted , and the more profit the companies will make .
Original digital cameras had a very low resolution .
For example , the first commercial DC , Dycam Model 1 , provided only 90 ,000 pixels  .
After half a decade , the number changed to 1 ,000 ,000 .
The most advanced DCs today support more than 12 million pixels , which is over 100 times that of the original ones .
Such remarkable improvement shows the strong impact of consumers' requirement on pushing forward the DC technology .
After telephone was invented in the late 1800s , people were thinking about ways to improve such communication technology to extend the range of social network .
The original idea of mobile phone came from combining telecommunication with radio technology which was considerably improved during the World War 2 period CITATION Spe90 \l 2052  .
However , since radio telephone at that time was too heavy and expensive , the number of mobile phone users was limited .
Until the 1980s , due to the cellular idea , the portability and the quality of communication of mobile phone were improved and mobile telephony started to play a part in mass market CITATION Tom07 \l 2052  .
And with the advance in internet technology , the third generation mobiles phones are digitized nowadays CITATION Wei05 \l 2052  .
This essay will examine three major factors in the development of mobile telecommunication in different stages .
Secondly , the development of mobile telecommunication was inspired by achievements in other fields .
Donald H . Ring came up with the idea of cellular network in 1947 CITATION Tom07 \l 2052  .
However , the idea was not applied to mobile phones because of the lack of computing power at that time .
With the advance in computing technology in 1980s , a cellular network on mobile phones called Groupe Special Mobile was developed and this made mobile communication start to boom CITATION Tom07 \l 2052  .
Similarly , the development of necessary technologies such as semi-conductors , transistors and microelectronic chips also contributed to the development of mobile telecommunications .
Therefore , progress in other fields can promote the innovations of mobile technology .
Last but not the least , the increasing number of mobile users requires digitized mobile phones with special features .
After the born of GSM , mobile phones started to more attract private users .
Unlike the business usage , private users demand a user-friendly environment to communicate with friends and family as well as some additional entertainment features .
Such demands by the public encouraged mobile developers to create new functions for cell phones such as delivering ring tones , SMS and voice mail CITATION Wei05 \l 2052  .
Besides , mobile phones became digitized at the beginning of this century , which brought a revolution of mobile telecommunication .
Mobile phone today is no longer a phone that was mobile it can be a MP3 player , a game player and even a personal computer .
Thus , consumers' demands motivate the development of mobile telecommunication in the digital age .
The technology of nanorobotics is a modern invention that deals with the making of robots at an atomic level .
The development of nanobots came from the advancement in nanotechnology , and the idea of nanotechnology was proposed by physicist Richard Feynman in a speech in 1959 .
Nanobots are programmed to do specific tasks , and they are small enough to enter a human body .
These tasks are increasingly needed to improve the level of technology in medical treatments today .
Research in nanobots is intensively carried out in this area .
Hence , development in the technology of nanobots today is largely shaped by the demands of patients with illnesses that require better treatments .
The development of nanobots today is largely affected by the increasing medical needs in cancer treatment .
There are many injuries and illnesses that originate from nano-scale processes .
For instance , cancer cells damage the cells within the human body , and they cannot be treated effectively with the conventional treatment like chemotherapy .
Today , drugs for treating cancer are delivered to specific tissues by nano-particles within the body .
According to a journal by Amir Gur  , "small-sized robots are already involved in spinal surgeries , and the use of nanobots allows minimising damage to the tissue in the procedure ."
The introduction of nanobots in medicine and biomedical research creates possible solutions to treat illnesses that macro-scale techniques would be impossible to achieve .
Vincent , D .  .
The invisible revolution .
Nature , 451 , 770-771 . doi:10 .1038/451770a .
Furthermore , the early boom of nanobots was largely dependent on the policies of the government .
Research on nanobots requires huge funding .
Without the help from the government , the advancement would be slow .
According to a journal article by Vincent Dusastre , "the lobbies convinced the Clinton administration to launch the National Nanotechnology Initiative in 1999 ."
This was the catalyst that accelerated the development in nanotechnology .
For fear of losing to other nations , the government increases the funding to private and public sectors in the R&D of nanotechnology , and this in turn brings to the global development and innovation of nanobots .
Another important factor that is changing the landscape of nanobots is economy .
Our economy is greatly dependent on energy and raw materials .
Nanobots would be helpful in making materials that is efficient in storing energy and converting energy sources .
There are many benefits in developing nanobots .
They can be used to create a system that is affordable , fast , and compacted .
Nanotechnology has ventured even further recently .
It is described as a new and important way of solving the problem of storage system and energy crisis .
According to an article , $20 million was granted to Stanford - one of 46 Energy Frontier Research Centres - to help the engineers to find energy down at the nano-scale .
In Conclusion , the technology of nanobots is a modern innovation that allows human to process task that is beyond our bear-eye can see .
This technology is largely applied in the field of medical treatment today .
With the continuous development , nanobots would improve the lives of millions in the near future .
