In Singapore , there are many creative ideas to solve the problems that are encountered in daily lives .
However , only limited number of the creative ideas have successfully completed their engineering design processes and hence launched in the market .
A large number of the creative ideas have failed in their engineering design processes because there are some problems in Singapore which may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
The main problem , however , is time constraint and this problem can be seen to significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations in companies such as Creative Technology .
In Creative Technology , time constraint has significantly hampered its engineering design processes for innovations .
This time constraint is caused by competition from other companies which sell similar products and they may also be in the middle of designing similar new products as Creative Technology .
Therefore , Creative Technology has to work against time to complete its engineering design processes for innovations so that it can launch its new products earlier than the other competitors and hence , earn the rights to claim that the innovations belong to it .
Mr Sim Wong Hoo , chairman and CEO of Creative Technology , commented that having awarded the ZEN Patent to Creative Technology , it had helped to protect its invention and recognized its innovation in portable media players .
He then further commented that in order to be awarded the ZEN Patent , it had taken a major investment of time and effort by a group of its research and development engineers .
It can be seen that because of time constraint , the research and development engineers from Creative Technology had to sacrifice most of their time just to focus on the engineering design processes for their new product , ZEN , so that it can be completed as soon as possible .
Furthermore , because of time constraints , certain processes in the engineering design processes may be compromised so that the ZEN can be completed earlier to beat the rest of the competitors .
Therefore , time constraint is the main problem that may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
Another problem is that the designing process must be able to keep up with the rapid developments in technology , otherwise by the time it is completed , it may already been rendered as obsolete .
Such case can be seen in St . James Press that Creative Technology began manufacturing its own CD-ROM drives when it could not keep up with the rapid developments in drive technology , however , it was forced to abandon the effort , dumping its inventory and taking a loss of more than $30 million in 1995 .
From here , we can see that the Engineering design processes must be constantly be updated , otherwise more problems may occur and this has caused many engineering design process to be abandoned halfway and hence , it is a problem that may significantly hamper engineering design process for innovations .
In conclusion , the two problems discussed earlier are just the few of the many problems that may significantly hamper engineering design processes for innovations .
That is the reason why it is never simple to have many innovations in Singapore .
However , still , there are many people who stood up to the difficulty and successfully completed the engineering design processes for innovations and I hope more people can learn from their experiences .
Since the 1970's , communication technology has made great advances , offering capabilities that were unthinkable a decade earlier .
The last decade of the 20th century saw a flood of new communication technologies entering the market , office and home according to the Central Statistical office .
This was the result of a better of a better understanding of people's needs and what technology they really want to use .
One such technology was the mobile phone .
In the past , communication was slow and unreliable as it was done over a distance by physical transportation such as the use of pigeons , boats and messengers .
In the most unfortunate cases , the information would not even reach the desired destination .
As a result , people wanted a form of communication which was fast and reliable .
This all changed dramatically with the introduction of the telephone .
Firstly , it took away the necessity of a transport medium which made it more reliable .
Secondly , the telephone used electricity which was literally accessible to every household and this provided messages to be passed around more quickly .
However , this was still not enough .
People then saw the need to be able to communicate on the go .
The society wanted to be able to communicate anywhere and anytime and to anyone they wished .
This resulted in the invention of wireless telephony , commonly referred to as the mobile phone .
The introduction of the mobile phone allowed people in the society to have the ability to pass messages to one another quickly and accurately whenever they wished .
This meant that office workers were able to speed up communication and circulate information faster to allow new ideas to be conceived quickly .
Having to do this would result a great benefit to an individual's company and finally , it would have a positive impact on the economy .
Furthermore , even the military benefited from this wireless telephony .
Through the use of wireless communication , soldiers were able to communicate with each other swiftly and with 100% accuracy when information was passed around .
Due to the convenience of having a mobile phone , the number of mobile phone users increased drastically over the years .
By 2002 , Japan had 55 million mobile phone users  , China had over 200 million mobile phone users and about 90% of Finland's population had a mobile phone according to BBC in 2003 .
The mobile underwent further developments to enhance its features to suit its consumers .
As a result , by 2003 , the mobile phone was presented more than just a tool for calling someone .
By integrating a variety of functions in a single handset , the mobile phone became a multimedia information processor fitted with an array of conveniences .
In 2003 , Nokia had a vision that the mobile phone will become a life management tool for business , work and leisure .
It will also take on roles and an anchor point , a digital navigator and a lifestyle accessory that will help individuals control and enrich their lives  .
Looking back at the evolution of communication , the mobile phone is one that was shaped by social factors .
Constant demands from the society caused mobile phone companies to continue developing newer phones that would satisfy their consumers and allow them to bridge space and time to such an extent that people can communicate more efficiently .
The health ministers of various countries have shaped the development of the new vaccine .
The virus is very contagious thus leading to a rampant spread in the society .
Thus there is a large demand for the vaccine by the various government bodies .
This could be seen in the following , whereby the governments of France , Belgium and Finland intended to purchase 50 million , 12 .6 million and 5 .3 million doses , respectively  .
Another reason the government bodies is concerned about the development of the new vaccine is the fear for mutation .
As experts have predicted that many more is going to contact the diseases , there is a higher the chance that the diseases will mutate into a stronger virus .
The health ministers around the world are influencing the development of the vaccine so as to cure the diseases before it spreads too widely or mutates .
The public and the H1N1 patients are the other group that shaped the development of the vaccine for H1N1 .
Although figures of the WHO have shown that out of the 160 ,000 cases only 1 .200 have died , this could not contain the fear in people .
This is due t0 the previous outbreak of another flu virus which took many lives .
Due to the fear there is a high demand for the vaccine , as such the pharmaceutical companies are trying to seize this rare business opportunity .
Thus they became very concerned with the development of the vaccine .
Besides , the large demand , any new development would also bring about a rise in the respective pharmaceutical companies share price .
For example , in April 30 2009 when Lipoxen announced positive preclinical results for the delivery of an enhanced influenza vaccine , adding that the technology should also work against the new swine flu strain , Lipoxen's share price when up from  6 .62 to  21 .75  .
Nowadays , most mobile phone can take pictures .
Many people have already got used to use cell phone to take pictures and transfer to their friends , so that they think that the camera phones are born like this .
However , camera phone changed a lot after coming out at 2000  , compared with the first camera phone , camera phones nowadays are quite different .
During the nine-year development of camera phone technology , we can see that the great market demand , customer requirement , and government regulations of different countries have once affected this technology a lot .
Hawk-eye is a computer system used in cricket , tennis and other sports to visually track the path of the ball and display a record of its actual path as graphic image .
In tennis and cricket , Hawk-eye system has become an important reference for judgment and even the decision maker when dispute come on the scene .
When the Hawk-eye system was invented , it got prizes including Science and Technology Innovation Award presented by The Royal Television Society .
However , even for now , the popularization has not become widespread .
Hawk-eye's development is limited due to its high cost , some errors it made and some opposing ideas from the public .
In addition , not all the Sportsmen value Hawk-eye system very much .
Even in tennis , one of the sports that Hawk-eye is the most widely used , some of the world's most popular players still cannot accept Hawk-eye system .
Roger Federer and Lindsay Davenport think that Hawk-eye system forgets the true meaning of tennis and makes tennis disinteresting .
As is widely known , those world-famous players have a great influence on the development of the sport .
If those players do not accept Hawk-eye system , it may be very difficult for Hawk-eye system to develop and spread out further .
In conclusion , the reasons why Hawk-eye system does not spread out and develop further are the high cost , the weakness of Hawk-eye system itself and the social opposing ideas from some influential world-famous players .

Both the military and civil demand for precise navigation promote the development of Global Positioning System
Nowadays , almost everybody knows GPS which has made a significant difference in our daily life in ways ranging from guiding family hiking to airline navigation .
However , a lot of people may do not know that it is such a seemingly very new advanced technology that actually already have existed for more than forty years .
It is the military and civil demand for precise navigation stimulates the GPS technology advancing to what we know it as today .
Military demand for precise navigation is the original cause for the invitation of GPS .
After the WW , the US military realized the weakness of navigating by the stars and the radio signals and started to seek for a more precise positioning system to guide their fighters and warships globally .
In late nineteen fifties , the scientists in USA realized the possibility of accurate positioning by satellites and finally in 1960 , a satellite navigation system called Transit is tested in USA navy to meet their intense requirement for precise navigation to avoid unnecessary shipwreck .
Since then , in order to grasp the precise position information of its army all over the world , United States Department of Defense allotted millions of dollars in the GPS R&D which eventually resulted in a complete Global Positioning System with the operation of two dozen of polar orbiting satellites . 
The idea of GPS is firstly put forward in the nineteen forties .
Afterwards , both the military and public demand for precise navigation promote the further development of GPS and make it like what we see today -a precise dual-use global positioning system for both civilian and military .
Similarities and differences between technologies developed via research and via serendipitous discovery
Technology is the practical application of knowledge especially in a specific area .
Many technologies were developed via research or the interplay between scientific investigations and practical problems while some were serendipitously invented .
This essay will compare and contrast the discovery of penicillin and the development of embryonic stem cells these two technologies , in terms of impetus to the invention , researchers involved in the innovation development and the effects on society .
There are similarities and differences between technologies developed via research and via serendipitous discovery in the aspect of impetus to the invention , researchers involved in the innovation development and the effects on society .
In the future , more and more useful technologies will be developed and they can give us a lot of benefits .
One of the many innovations that how made our lives convenient is "Refrigeration" .
This was a technology that had been shaped by the society in the past who were desperate to preserve their food .
They used blocks of ice as cooling aids to preserve their food .
Ice from mountains or snowy areas were transported to warmer regions where it was wrapped in cloth and placed in cellas .
Soon ice box , which was made up of a metal linked box insulated with cork or snow dust with one compartment to put the ice and another to store the perishables .
However , this system was not very efficient and was inadequate .
The civil ware in US interrupted the ice trade .
Successive warm winter for a period of time created severe ice shortages leading to an unprecedented demand for new methods .
The desperate need for a way to preserve food as well as the idea of cooling to prevent the food from spoiling helped to shape the technological innovation of refrigeration .
The idea of refrigeration was built based on the principle that when a liquid changes to a gas , it absorbs heat as it expands in a self contained cycle , the air or other fluid surrounding the device can be reduced in temperature .
With this principle , soon the gas refrigerator and the electric refrigerator was built to carry out the ideas of regrigeration .
The length of tank's history is almost one hundred year since 1916 when the first time tank was used as a secret weapon of British .
If we trace back further , we can find that Leonardo de Vinci already drew a similar picture of tank in 15th century .
Although we are not sure what kind of materials and technologies Vinci was trying to use when constructing his "tank" , we are still astonished by his ingenious imagination .
However , tank is not a usual vehicle for the majority .
Most people never have a chance to drive a tank , but it seems that many people are very familiar with and interested in it .
Tank is tightly related to war since the first day it was born .
Inevitably , government and military demand play vital important roles in its developing history .
In World War I  , when the Triple Entente and the Triple Alliance were fighting against each other bloodily , they both got into trouble with the trench warfare .
Every trial of attack means losing hundreds of lives .
The British government was very worried about this condition .
They needed a weapon that can pass through the trench and wire entanglement , as well as protect the soldiers from bullets .
In 1915 , E .D .
Swinton suggested the British government to integrate tractor and other ready-made weapons .
After a while , British government not only took his advice but also organized a professional group to design and produce the tank .
In 1916 , this secret weapon was first used in the Battle of Somme .
In conclusion , tank is a great engineering-design product which government , global politics and military industry shape it together .
It is a "weapon of mass destruction" but still ingenious .
Its quick development and adaptability in battle field is incomparable .
It is the main role in land battle in modern war .
The success of a technology not only depends on how well it resolves the targeted need but also the social considerations it incurs when introduced to the consumer market .
Based on "The network of power" , a book by Thomas Hughes , it addresses one pertinent problem on the way we view technology .
The associated issue is that we tend to be blinded by the benefits of a technology and oversee the importance of understanding it as an entire system .
By looking at the development of automobiles , from electric vehicles to gasoline-powered cars , we are able to understand how economic factors influence oil magnates , car manufacturers and the government who ultimately shaped this technological innovation .
To sum up , oil companies , car manufacturers and the government considered issues from the economic view and realised that the consequences of making electric car a success are too drastic .
The oil and auto industry are too lucrative and at the same time crucial to the overall economy such that issues regarding pollution and environment are secondary to it .
Hence , the automobile technology is ultimately shaped by oil magnates , car companies and the government who are largely influenced by economic factors .
In Singapore , there are problems which could hamper the local engineering design process for innovations .
The two problems are attitude and funding which have severe impact on the local engineering process for innovations .
The engineering design process for innovations can be broken down into 3 stages , firstly creativity , secondly process and lastly materialization .
The two problems will be elaborated on how it impacts the engineering process for innovations .
The first problem that will hamper the local engineering process is attitude .
According to "Singapore's innovation journey" an article by Patrick Lambe , Singaporeans cannot innovate because they are conditioned to be followers rather than creative idea generators .
This could be made due to personal and the society's attitude .
We shall begin with the individual attitude and how it hampers the local engineering process for innovations .
Singaporeans tends to have an asian mentality which is prudence and stability .
Being prudent , Singaporeans tends to be less adventurous compared to their western counterparts .
One common scenario would be , parents who advice their children especially those with tertiary education to get a decent job and contribute to the family's expenditure .
If their children , wants to go into the research and development profession example being a researcher in a university or students joining their local science competition that will not add to distinctions in the exams they will be advice against .
This will cause children who later grow into adults not to utilize their creativity the first step to engineering design process .
The second problem that could hamper the local engineering design process is funding .
Often , inventors who use their engineering talents to come up with innovative products fail to secure funding .
A good example is the formula racing car of National University Of Singapore  , the initial stages required the professors and his students to each come up with three hundred dollars to purchase the necessary parts .
It was only with success did the formula racing car received funding from sponsors .
However not all inventors had the luck of achieving initial success and thus receive funding .
Funding affects all the three stages of engineering process for innovations .
Failure to secure funding will turn away inventors with engineering flare from even brainstorming for ideas affect creativity , in the process of coming up with innovations no funding seeks to terminate the inventors progress and with no funding its not possible to publicize about an engineering innovation .
In conclusion , the two problems that could hamper the local engineering process for innovations are attitude and funding .
They will have a severe impact on the three stages which make up the local engineering process for innovations .
Innovations can come about through serendipity or research .
, Serendipity is the accidental discovery of a new idea , and the 3M post-it pad is one example .
On 4 July 2009 The Straits Times reported the development of a new product , the Haptic Chair , by researchers from the National University of Singapore to help the deaf experience sound .
For serendipity and research , the resources invested and how they are considered to be successful are different , but technologies of both nature bring benefit to the lives of people .
A case of serendipity occurred a few decades back when researchers from 3M laboratories discovered a new bonding agent .
The bonding agent did not stick paper very tightly to another surface , and the researchers decided that it was "worthless" .
This "worthless" substance was then used by a 3M researcher to create a temporary "post-it" stick-on note .
Soon he found the note useful as it was able to be attached to other documents without leaving any adhesive marks .
Next , he distributed pads of the post-it notes to 3M's president executive secretary , who also found them useful .
Eventually , the post-it pads were further distributed to different companies , leading up to its big marketing success today . 
The difference between a serendipitous discovery and a researched technology are the resources invested in the development , and how the technology is gauged to be a success .
A serendipitous discovery happens by chance , and has no pre-allocated funds or project timeframe to be adhered to .
The post-it pads came about because the 3M researcher happened to have non-permanent adhesive , and he decided to come out with the new product on his own .
Before he gave the post-it pads to others , no funds or expertise were assigned to him for the post-its development .
In the case of The Haptic Chair , a team of researchers worked together with Suranga Nanayakkara , who also had the support of several working staff from the University .
A lot of time and effort has been put in by the team before they could actually come out with the product .
How we consider each of the mentioned technology to be successful is different .
The post-it pads were only found to be successful after it was given to the 3M president's executive secretary who found them useful and mass-distributed it to various companies .
It required the general public to see the item as something useful before it was deemed to be successful .
In the case of the Haptic Chair , the invention was intended specifically for the deaf and the partially deaf .
Therefore , as long as the invention serves the needs of its targeted consumer , it will be considered a successful technology .
In The Straits Times article , it was reported that partially deaf musicians like teen piano prodigy Azariah Tan found various aspects of the invention intriguing . 
Research technology and serendipitous discoveries , despite being different , share certain similarities .
Both are by-products of people being able to recognize human needs .
For the 3M researcher , he identified the need to stick notes on paper without leaving adhesive stains to damage original documents for the NUS student , he identified the need to create a product to aid those with hearing problems .
Both technologies benefit the lives of people , and have potential for profit .
In conclusion , we have come to learn that new technologies can come not just by research , but by serendipitous discoveries as well .
What we do need to bear in mind is this: technologies of both natures serve different groups of people in different scales , but they ultimately bring benefit to the lives of people .
Innovation starts when there is a need or when someone faces a problem and motivates people to find a way to solve it by generating new ideas .
Technology is very much related with innovation .
As we need an equipment to solve problems .
Many technological innovations were formed by scientific research or by the interaction of scientific investigations and applied on practical needs and problems .
A new idea is created through results from rigorous process of research .
Others were serendipitously invented .
Serendipity means unexpected discovery of new ideas when finding something which is unrelated or in the process of researching in new inventions .
These findings are often unpredictable and uncertain .
Serendipitous discovery can happen to anyone as well as in many fields .
In conclusion , innovation occurs anywhere and anytime .
The exchange of ideas and information plays a very crucial part in the process of generating new ideas .
Through constant exchange of information about the problems , human needs and wants , we can come up with better ideas to solve problems and make our world a better place to live in .
Technology has made our life easier .
Rogers defines that technology as a design for instrumental action that reduces the uncertainty in the cause-effect relationships involved in achieving a desired outcome .
Most of the inventions were developed by application of scientific research on practical problems or needs .
However , some unpredicted technologies were invented by accident or serendipity .
For instance , the stove was invented via research and the microwave oven was serendipitously discovered .
The stove and microwave oven both are similarly used to cook our daily meal at home but they were discovered in two different ways .
Recognizing a problem or needs , basic and applied research and development are the 3 stages of the innovation-development processes , and we will use these stages to compare and contrast the two different technologies .
Recognizing a problem or need is the very first stage of the process .
In the past , people started to use fire , coal , or heat from the sun to cook .
Stove was invented because people need to cook , which applied heat to prepare the food .
In contrast , the microwave oven that we are using today was a side product of the microwave radio signal in radar for military purpose .
Dr . Percy Spencer discovered the microwave technology by serendipity when he found out that his candy bar in his pouch was melted when he was experimenting with his new magnetron .
The history of the stove and microwave shows that serendipity and researched technology came from a very different beginning .
Serendipity came from a branch of a problem or need , while research technology came straight from the problem or needs .
Next , when the basic and application research of the technology has established , the development of the product will begin .
The first known stove was built on the ground with sticks foaming a tripod to hold the cooking pot above the heat source .
After years of innovations and experiments , the stove nowadays is safer to use and more convenient .
Likewise , the very first microwave oven was very big and bulky .
Today , it has become very compact and light , and features like the automatic functions to allow user to cook with just pressing a button .
Therefore we can see that both the technologies share the similar development path .
One similarity between both categories is achieving the aim of improving quality of life for the people .
For Bionic eyes , it is developed as engineers are thinking of ways to improve visual displays in various fields such as gaming and in the aviation industry .
They hope to develop lenses such that they will allow players to be entirely immersed in the game allowing them to move without any constraints .
For the aviation industry , it is hope that through the new technology , pilots are able to know the speed of the plane almost immediately .
As for 3M's Post-its , it comes in very handy when people want to remind themselves of events or when commenting on essays without having the need to write in the essay itself .
It is convenient to use as it can stick to almost any surfaces and also easy to peel off without leaving any marks .
However , there are also differences between the two categories .
One of the differences was how this technology came about .
For Bionic eyes , it was done via research after seeing it in a movie called 'Terminator' , where a woman is able to zoom on places that are far away .
This gave the engineers the idea of whether what they see in the movie is able to become a reality .
So , they worked towards this goal and developed Bionic eyes .
As for Post-its , it was discovered accidentally by researches who were trying to find bonding agents that can be used to bind papers firmly to a surface .
It was a by-product of what they are trying to achieve .
It was once deemed as "worthless" until people found uses for it and it become one of the most commonly used product in our daily life and one of the products that makes the most revenue for 3M .
In conclusion , both technologies , be it developed via research or resulted from a serendipitous discovery , it has achieved the aim of improving the lives of people .
Though initial acceptance to the two technologies was different and it all depends on the mindset of the public whether the technology being discovered is worth marketing or not as seen from the case of 3M Post-its .
One of the earliest inventions brought about by mankind was the wheel , ever since then we have never looked-back .
We continued to push for technological advances in different aspects of our lives so as to enjoy a better standard of living .
Over the past half decade , a new term "skunkworks" has surfaced .
This term describes the environment where small groups of researchers are not bound by corporate rules and politics .
Whereas conventionally generated technologies tend to require ensuring the survivability of the head company .
There are several similarities and differences between the technologies generated by the "skunkworks" environment as compared to conventionally generated technologies .
Products generated by each environment may appear similar but actually differ in many ways and the environment plays an important part in shaping its distinctive features .
The second similarity is that in both environments , generally large amount of money and support has to be put in by the head company .
This is simply because in order to produce cutting-edge technology , large amount of research has to be done .
Hence long hours are required before any results are visible .
A few examples include , GM developing the first electric car named IMPACT , Apple developing their first Macintosh computer and Xerox's attempt at developing the world's first personal computer .
It is thus evident that huge amount of financing and support is generally required in both environments .
The second difference between the two environments is the working environment presented to the engineers and researchers .
This has resulted in very different products developed by each environment .
The "skunkworks" environment has been able to provide the developers the flexibility and freedom required to break traditional barriers and develop cutting-edge technologies .
Furthermore , "skunkworks" environment is very stressful as compared to the traditional corporate environment due to the lack of financing and hence room for error becomes much smaller .
The last and perhaps the most significant difference in the environments have to be the difference in the features of technologies developed by each environment .
The "skunkworks" environment has generally been able to develop technologies which are well received by the public and continue to bring success to the head company .
An example of such a difference is again present between the IMPACT car and the Toshiba laptop .
Under the stressful skunkworks environment , the researchers from Toshiba are able to think critically and design the product to fit the needs of the society .
On the other hand , the researchers from GM have failed to realize that the public and society was not ready for their invention .
The limitation of their product also meant that it was only open to a small market .
In conclusion , it is clear that the technology churned out by a "skunkworks" environment differ greatly to that of a conventionally generated technology .
The features and characteristics of the "skunkworks" technology set them apart from conventionally generated technology .
An innovation may come from different ways .
The idea of such an innovation can emerge though some research or it may be from some serendipitous discovery .
That is to say , the common viewpoint is not totally true .
On one hand , one technology may be developed and polished through numerous research and experiment with a lot of effort .
On the other hand , some technology may be discovered purely by chance .
Two typical representatives are the electric cars and the Warfarin .
The electric car is invented by some hardworking engineers , while Warfarin is discovered serendipitously .
Although they are initialized differently , there are several similar stages of developing process .
Innovations developed via research and from serendipitous discovery are in no way similarly initialized .
Generally , one technology that is developed through research often begins with the need for practical uses or recognition of a social problem .
The electrical car is not an exception .
As the situation of the earth environment becomes worse , and the energy resources are exhausting , the need for inventing nonpolluting and energy- saving cars is urgent .
Some government encourages automobile companies to produce environmentally friendly cars .
Engineers' motivation to design electric cars is obvious .
However , the discovery of Warfarin is totally different .
It is discovered by chance .
Nobody knew that the chemical in spoiled sweet clover key that led to cattle hemorrhage could actually be used as rat poison until the scientist Link accidentally found it .
He did not do it on purpose at all .
Even he himself was surprised when he found this chemical was highly lethal to rats .
In fact , the general belief that all technologies are initialized with a lot of effort is not quite true .
The solution to a completely irrelevant problem may hide behind the undergoing research , and eventually some great discovery is accidentally made .
To sum up , technologies developed via research and from serendipitous discovery are quite differently initialized .
However , they are similar in the sense that they have to undergo the same process of experiments and research , and both can be very successful and bring benefit to the whole society .
During the process of developing innovations , regarding every little detail seriously and never letting go any chance discovery are most important .
Hopefully , successful technologies are produced by both means .
There are numerous problems faced by the world today .
Governments of different countries may have different agenda list , however aging population is definitely an issue present in the list .
Singapore makes it her top priority to create a safer environment for the elderly to live in .
Engineers play a huge role in assisting the government in achieving the aim of creating a better and safer environment for the elderly to live in .
With a safer environment , the welfare of the elderly will be improved and less social problems will be resulted .
Examples of such engineering design are the building of ramps at the main entrance of the flats , building handrails at the side of the stairs and also the wheelchair bound bus .
The pressing issue is to build a conducive environment for the old .
For example , the Housing Development Board had implemented several designs to improve the convenience of the elderly , such as installing lifts on every storey and build wider internal corridors and hallways .
The designs had been proven useful by the flat holders who lived in the flat with all these facilities when the HDB first implemented them .
Thus , the government had implemented the Lift Upgrading Programme in 2001 , so that the owners have direct access to the lift at every floor .
According to Khandani  , after each solution is generated , it must be tested and implement to see the effects brought by the solution .
In this case , there is positive effects associated to the engineering designs made to the HDB flats , thus the government had implemented the solution throughout Singapore .
Generally , the engineering design process consists mainly of the five procedures mentioned by Khandani which includes defining the problem , gathering the relevant information , think of solutions to the problem , analyze and select one solution , and test it out by implementing it .
Although all the steps mentioned by Khandani is crucial for designing a good engineering product , the most important step is to test out the solution and see how is the public response to it .
This is because every engineering product is designed to serve the people so as to bring a greater convenience to their life .
As a conclusion , engineering design is a never ending process , and it is the duty of the engineers to keep on coming up with solution to solve the pressing issue of creating better product for the aging population .
Increasing number of death rate due to traffic accidents have become a major problem in many countries .
The World Health Organisation states that traffic accidents are in the ninth position among the reasons which leads to death .
When considering European Union , 1 .3 million road traffic accidents occur each year , resulting in 1 .7 million injuries and over 40000 death annually .
Another alarming fact is that , even Singapore which implements strong traffic laws and regulations is also affected by this traffic accident problem .
The accident rate per 10 ,000 vehicles has increased from 2 .34 in 2006 to 2 .60 in 2007 in Singapore  .
So , to reduce and solve the problem of traffic accidents , a new traffic system should be formed and it should be the current human need that should be given priority .
The engineering design process will be able to meet the need to form a new traffic system .
The most important three features in the engineering design process will cater to the need to form a new traffic system .
Secondly , the second important feature is the idea generation process .
This is a very important process as it is the point where we will be able to come out with solutions to the problems .
In the process , we will be able to analyse the statistics/surveys we have obtained and generate new ideas to solve the problem .
These solutions may include device to identify those speeding at turns and install sensors to make sure that there is sufficient spacing between vehicles .
Netherland was the first country to implement such road safety devices and it proves that these solutions really help as their road accident rates dropped by 25% in 2000 when compared with accident rates in 1985 .
Gordon Walls states that the purpose of traffic planning is to provide a safe , convenient and economic movement of vehicles .
From this we can understand that it is essential to come out with a system which is useful in various ways .
So it is important to come out with ideas which will be a useful and economic solution to the problem .
Thirdly , analysing and selecting the solutions will be the next step .
It is the point where we will be selecting the solution which best suits the current situation and perfectly fits to the road of the country .
The solution is then implemented and continuously reviewed .
In the field of information technology , there is a clear boundary between conventionally generated and skunkwork developed technologies .
Specifically , in the operating system market , there are two well-known examples , the Mac OS developed by Apple and the free open-source Linux OS .
These two OS reflect the obvious difference between the two ways of developing technology in their hardware platform , interface and price .
The first main difference is their hardware platform .
While the Linux OS is simply no more than a software and runs on PC platform machines , the Mac OS is exclusively designed for the Mac platform manufactured by Apple .
Since Apple designs the hardware for Mac , it makes the operating system perfectly compatible with the machine .
That is one of the reasons why Mac OS has always been praised by art designers for its smooth performance and high definition graphics .
Meanwhile , Linux , coded in the skunkwork environment , does not have that much funds and ability to compare with Mac at that perspective .
However , Linux has its own advantage .
The second difference between Mac and Linux lies in their structure .
As an open source operating system , Linux' users are free to explore and modify the systems .
Mac users , on the other hand , are restricted from the entering system files .
This makes the Linux OS more preferable among computer programmers and others who work in the field of information technology .
According to Forbes , Linux is currently the most popular operating system for supercomputers .
It is agreed by programmers from largest IT corporations such as IBM and Sun Microsystems that Linux is so far the most suitable environment for high-performance computing .
Finally , there is the problem of security .
This is what Mac and Linux have in common .
Despite their different structures and platform , the two operating systems are quite secured .
By not allowing modification of system files , a third party cannot hack into a Mac .
As for Linux , open-source only means users can read its source file .
With its secured configuration , it is still extremely hard to penetrate a Linux server .
On the other hand , the sociology aspect has to be considered as well .
Being a skunkwork project , Linux sure has the advantage of price .
It is actually the only free operating system available .
However , this does not guarantee its popularity .
Its high requirement of computing knowledge makes Linux not popular among average computer users .
Mac , on the opposite , was designed for an entertainment and easy-to-use purpose .
Apple is also very efficient at advertising their product worldwide , so even when Mac and its software are much more expensive than for a normal OS , it is still one of the most wanted .
Furthermore , with the forth coming price drop , Mac is expected to be the operating system of choice for education and business .
It is not possible to define whether the conventionally generated OS or the skunkwork developed one is better .
However , each technology has its own pros and cons .
Therefore , the choice should be made based on the user's needs .
If it is a computer for an IT engineer , the choice would be Linux .
Oppositely , if the purpose is mainly for entertainment or paperwork , Mac would be the option .
Berman defines a hybrid car as one that encompasses an electric motor together with a conventional gasoline engine , with a computer controlling the interaction between the two .
They use fuel cells that convert hydrogen to electricity , which is then stored in batteries and is used to assist in the power surge required when climbing a slope or overtaking .
But why do we need hybrid cars when we have cars that run just as well on gasoline ?
Gasoline cars are already an integral part of our economy and lifestyle , providing us with mobility and personal freedom .
However , research shows that the world is fast approaches two billion cars  , and this poses a problem in the form of environmental pollution as well as causing adverse effects of our economy .
Environmental problems surrounding car production and usage are becoming an increasing threat to our world today .
According to Nieuwenhuis and Wells  , "In the early 1900s , when gasoline cars starting gaining popularity , resources like gasoline and steel could still be found in abundance"  .
An increase in the number of cars on the road will mean an increase in the amount of oil burned , which in turn contributes to more air pollution .
Globally , transportation produces a quarter of all emissions of carbon dioxide  , the primary green house gas , with some 10000 billion cubic metres of exhaust fumes being released annually  .
Every time a car is driven on the road , it is actually draining the world's conventional petroleum resources , and contributes more to global warming .
Materials like iron , steel , plastic , and glass , are mined from the Earth and are used in the construction of cars  .
At the end of the car's lifespan , those materials that cannot be reused are then thrown in a scrap pile , contributing to land pollution .
Hybrid cars solve part of these problems by using more reusable material like plastic , as well as making them lighter and rely more on electricity to reduce fuel consumption and carbon emissions  .
While the damage done by our continued reliance on cars and gasoline is severe , it is still not too late to do anything about it .
In order to prevent more serious economic and environmental damage , dramatic reductions in oil use and carbon emissions have to be made within the next decade .
Policy makers and carmakers need to change the vehicles they design and the energy and transport systems they are embedded in .
Relying on hybrid cars might just be one of the most feasible solutions we can look at to save our planet .
When a new virus or bacteria is introduced and the human population has no immunity , a pandemic will occur , causing widespread mortality .
In each century , influenza pandemics have occurred around 3 times , when a new strain of the influenza virus caused simultaneous deaths worldwide  .
Therefore , it is crucial to come up with solutions to prevent the spread of diseases .
For example , Penicillin , which was discovered serendipitously , helps to prevent one from getting bacterial diseases .
Furthermore , during the recent outbreak of the Swine flu , Tamiflu has been developed to treat it .
Comparing Tamiflu with Penicillin , although they work differently on different micro-organisms , both of them do benefit to the human population .
Most species of bacteria have a rigid cell wall , which prevents them from bursting when they are placed in solutions of low salt concentration as compared to the cell .
Penicillin inhibits the formation of cell wall , which is essential for the survival of bacteria , and thus kills them off .
However , the viruses do not have cell walls and thus Penicillin has no effect on them .
In contrast , Tamiflu works well on the influenza viruses .
An influenza virus is able to infect a host cell due to the presence of neuraminidase .
With Tamiflu , which is also known as neuraminidase inhibitors , neuraminidase is inhibited and thus the virus is unable to exit the host cell and dies  .
Moreover , the virus is also unable to spread and infect other cells in the body .
Due to the distinct difference in the structures of virus and bacteria , Tamiflu and Penicillin perform differently on them .
Ever since the introduction of Penicillin , deaths from infectious diseases are very rare .
Nowadays , majority of the people die from circulatory diseases and respiratory diseases  .
Penicillin benefits greatly as it has the ability to cure people suffering from once-fatal bacterial diseases .
Similarly , Tamiflu is also proven to be effective in the treatment and for the prevention of influenza in adults and in children .
Roche announced that two new observational studies had shown that influenza patients treated with Tamiflu had significantly higher survival rates than untreated patients and the analyzed outcomes targeted on two different groups -adults and children diagnosed with the highly pathogenic A avian influenza and adults hospitalized with seasonal influenza  .
The human population has indeed benefited from both Penicillin and Tamiflu as the survival rates from bacterial diseases and influenza viruses have increased ever since they are introduced .
Regardless of whether the technology is developed via research or discovered serendipitously , they have significant contributions to mankind .
New discoveries and creations are essential for the progress of mankind .
For instance , there is always a need for new and better anti-flu drugs as virus gets mutated very easily and will soon acquire resistance to Tamiflu .
Resistance to Tamiflu has been detected in a patient in Singapore who was down with the pandemic Influenza A bug and similar cases have also emerged in Hong Kong , China , Japan , Canada , the United States and Denmark  .
Who knows , may be in a few years time , the real cure for influenza virus will be discovered serendipitously and till that day , influenza virus will no longer be a threat to us .
A skunkworks is an especially enriched environment that is intended to help a small group of individuals design a new idea by escaping routine organizational procedures  .
The 5th most influential man of this century and president of Apple Computer , Steve Jobs , created one of the most famous and successful skunkworks .
The fruit of this skunkworks is the popular Macintosh computer , which is in great demand worldwide till date .
According to Macworld , the iMac , i .e .
desktop version of the Macintosh computer , has become the biggest-selling personal computer of all time within three years of its launch  .
In fact , Apple is the number one computer company in both Australia and Japan .
Obviously , there must be a reason behind the popularity of the Macintosh computer as compared to a conventionally generated innovation such as the Sony personal computer .
It would be most appropriate to explain this phenomenon from comparing the key features of the two different types .
Also , the next key feature would be the working conditions of a skunkworks as compared to a conventional environment .
About fifty highly dedicated young computer designers worked day and night at a secret lab that was located behind the Good Earth Restaurant in Cupertino  .
The young computer designers did not require any permission or papers to go ahead with the procedures .
All of them were committed and goal-orientated .
With the leadership skills from Steve Jobs and resources provided to the skunkworks , the Macintosh computer was introduced in 1984 .
It only took 4 years for the skunkworks project to be completed .
Therefore , the skunkworks was hugely credited for its success .
However , in a conventional environment , there were restrictions and standard procedures to follow closely .
This will cause distractions and time wastage during the course of production .
On the whole , a skunkworks generated product would have a higher chance for consumers to adopt and accept as compared to a conventionally generated product due to the unique features of a skunkworks .
In addition , there could be an increase in the number of companies that opt for a skunkworks .
The serendipitously discovered technology is the smog-eating cement while the technology found via research is the carbon-dioxide eating cement .
The two technologies vary in many aspects .
One such aspect is the support that these technologies receive among people .
In the case of the smog eating cement , the technology received some negative feedback due to its serendipitous background .
Thomas Cahill who is an atmospheric scientist at the University Of California , Davis , criticized that the final outcome of this discovery is uncertain .
He also said that the advantages of this technology are only applicable in some situations  .
This shows that people question the validity of the serendipitously discovered technologies .
This is because these technologies are invented accidentally , in other words , by luck .
Majority of people look at serendipitous discovery with distrust as the technology was not invented via research .
Technology discovered through research is the norm and serendipitous discovery deviate from the norm .
Most people think that serendipitous discovery was not well analyzed and hence the inventors might not know the side effects that the technology might cause in future .
However , the case is different for the carbon-dioxide eating cement .
It was positively accepted by most people .
In fact , this technology was accepted by cement industries and environmentalists CITATION Alo09 \l 1033  .This clearly illustrates that a well researched technology gathers more support as it is perceived that a technology that has solid proof have lesser unexpected outcomes in future , compared to a serendipitously discovered invention .
However , there are similarities between the two technologies .
Both the technology aims to improve the quality of air .
Basically , both try to reduce air pollution .
Furthermore , Howard Liljestrand mentioned that the "cost-efficiency" of both the technologies lies on how the technologies work in the future  .
Hence , both technologies aim to improve air quality and have their own limitations on their performance in future .
To sum it all , a well researched technology receives a lot more support among people than a serendipitously discovered technology .
Furthermore , it also has a wider range of funding partners than the serendipitous discovery .
Although they differ in some aspects , they are similar in their goal: To improve the air quality .
In my opinion , serendipitously discovered technology faces problem when it comes to gathering support and marketing while a well researched technology faces problem during the research and development stage .
Therefore , technologies discovered in both ways face problems in different areas .
There is no advantage whatsoever for either technologies .

Societal structure plays an important role in determining the evolution of a new innovation .
Norms and values from a social system will often heavily influence the technological design process .
This part of the development process is crucial to ensure that the innovation will be readily accepted by society .
The online video sharing website , Youtube , for example managed to grasp this concept and gained immense popularity within six months , hitting a peak 4000 from 200 daily page views per million in May .
Youtube founders targeted the problems that most people faced difficulty in sharing videos online and came out with many innovative solutions .
This resulted in a platform that enables web surfers to upload and play their videos online easily .
Being community-oriented , quickly catapults it to become the most popular video sharing site on the net .
In this present age , prevalent use of internet in many societies gave rise to a new "N-generation" .
Society's fast paced environmental and working conditions constantly mould the N-generation .
As such its behavioural pattern is one that expects fast efficiency and convenience as a norm .
One important feature of Youtube pertains to this idea and also contributes greatly to jumpstart its success .
The website is developed to integrate Macromedia flash player software tool that enable internet users to view youtube videos from their web browsers directly , without having to download it to their computers and view it with secondary video playing programs such as window media player  .
Thus , the time and computer hardware space needed to view a video is effectively being shortened to provide greater convenience .
This convenience and ease of use , appeals to many internet users whom do not have very fast and stable internet connections by allowing them to watch their videos online as it downloads .
Also to incorporate efficiency into their design further , Youtube uses a standard video format that delivers reasonable video quality while minimizing download data size so that users will not experience choppy video pauses during video streaming .
Many N-generation web users also regard entertainment quality and media accessibility highly .
They access many other internet websites and are adept at using a wide variety of internet media devices .
This prompts Youtube to improve their content accessibility by designing its website to synchronise and be able to be viewed on other web surfing platforms such as the iphone , Apple TV  , PS3 and , Nintendo Wii game consoles  .
Besides that , Youtube also implemented a function to embed their video in social networking websites such as facebook and blogs to allow for better accessibility to their media  .
Furthermore , Youtube offers "high definition" video playback in which videos are shown at a higher resolution and superior sound to cater to high entertainment quality demands where enjoyment takes priority . .
Greater accessibility unfortunately , also has a downside to it .
Since anyone can upload any video on to Youtube and allow anyone on Youtube to view it , many uploaded videos containing inappropriate content were easily accessible to minors .
For many societies , this is especially intolerable since it will violate their moral standing , conservative culture , religion and law .
Consequently , Youtube was faced with much criticism from the web community but it dealt with this problem promptly via introducing its content censorship policy .
Firstly , its terms of service forbid the uploading of offensive materials .
Secondly , adult web users are required to log in to verify their identity to view content classified as inappropriate for minors .
Lastly , it also relies on users to flag videos containing inappropriate content online which will activate a 24 hour review team to deal with it  .
The three prong approach effectively clams down any users that try to violate the rules .
There is also another problem which stems from importance of copyright in society .
The exclusive right granted to its original author to be credited for his work is valued to the extend it became a law in many society .
However , A huge amount of videos posted online consisting of television shows , music videos , movies and animes that were without the permission of their creators .
This entangled Youtube in a series of pressing legal lawsuits from major media companies such as Viacom , Mediaset and EPL in an effort to protect their copyright material  .
Subsequently , this forced Youtube to introduce its "Video ID" system which will check uploaded videos with a database of copyrighted material and denial any uploading if it finds a match  .
In summary , Youtube has managed to attain its dominant position on the net due to its ability to conform to the taste of its mainstream community web users while at the same time adhering to legal regulations .
It is also intensively consumer focused and very flexible , able to adapting to the needs and demands of internet users quickly .
In addition , regular novel upgrades to its website continue to entice more webs surfers as well as generating more internet traffic to their website .
More advertising sponsors will be attracted to employ their services , and hence , sustain YouTube's continual success .
Youtube has grown so much that it became part of many people's media entertainment and web surfing experience .
With its huge influence on the cyber community , it might even become a platform which in turn will help shape our society in the future .
With this two sub-factors plus the slow acceptance of Bluetooth headset compared to other Bluetooth devices , potential manufacturers of bike bug is deterred as it is not economic practical to mass produce bike bug .
It is therefore shown that for bike bug to be successfully launch into society , much is needed to raise bike bug popularity among the public .

Conventionally generated technology and technology created in a skunkworks environment are methods of technology development which lead to the invention of innovations .
However , the processes that are taken through for developing an invention are different .
There will be two illustrations provided to compare on their development differences .
One would be on Compaq laptop computer another would be on Toshiba laptop computer .
One difference is on the problems the invention was being considered the past .
In 1982 , Compaq was trying to model the IBM's BIOS System as it was the most popular system in the past  .
Being one of the manufacturers who wanted to outwit IBM , the inventors of Compaq pondered how to develop laptops computers that were faster , being superior in qualities , and offered additional features to please consumers .
For this case , Compaq was in the mainstream of developing portable computers , but exceeding what IBM had for offering to consumers with just an awesome BIOS System .
In contrast , the problems of inventing the Toshiba laptop computer were not just about excelling in the laptop computer market .
When Tetsuya Mizoguchi , the inventor of Toshiba laptop computer envisioned developing a product which was compatible to an IBM system , he was obstructed by the fact that corporate leaders at Toshiba deemed the development of such a product were difficult  .
Moreover , the company back then suffered huge losses in marketing their personal computers .
With strong disagreement from the company , Mizoguchi could not realize his dreams of making laptop computers .
In spite of these differences , both Compaq and Toshiba flourished in the laptop computer market with innovations that were laboriously created .
In 1983 , more than 53 ,000 units of Compaq laptop computers were sold  .
In 1986 , Toshiba made tremendous sales of ten thousand units within fourteen months  . .
Though Compaq and Toshiba took different approaches in developing laptop computers , they had the same motive of creating great laptop computers and took part of the big pie in the market .
We are living in the flourishing era of telecommunication with hundreds of mobile phone brands all over the world .
However , Research In Motion Limited , or RIM - a Canadian wireless device company founded in 1984 - , with its smartphones BlackBerry , is still one of the most successful brands in the market with the revenue of US$ 11 .065 billion in Fiscal 2009  .
The achievement of BlackBerry is an example of how social construction has led to the triumph of a technology .
Initially , BlackBerry smartphones were introduced for occupied executive , politicians and lawyers  .
Therefore , the emphasized function of the smartphones at that time was to receive and send emails .
Consequently , BlackBerry Enterprise Server was also released to help the businessmen keep track of their works and keep in touch with their employees .
As the demand of so-called normal users increased , RIM had to evolve .
In fact , according to Dabrowski , the majority of subscribers in the three months ended February 29th was "non-enterprise" users  .
BlackBerry smartphones were made to become more accessible to the users by increasing the memory and embedding entertaining features such as music player , integrated camera , and 65 ,000-color display instead of monochrome display .
The remarkable launch of Apple's iPhone in 2007 was predicted to outdo the success of BlackBerry smartphones in the market .
Nevertheless , "despite the popularity of Apple's best-selling device , RIM still tops the league of smart phone sales"  .
Each group of users had different purposes of using the mobile phones .
The majority of iPhone users were young adults who were fascinated by the appealing appearance and entertaining features of iPhone .
On the contrary , BlackBerry users were into the phone for its outstanding support for working environment together with acceptable features for relaxation .
However , the launch of iPhone "was a boon for RIM as the touchscreen handset raised the public's awareness"  .
In 2008 , RIM introduced Storm , its first touchscreen device instead of a physical keyboard .
The release of Storm marked a milestone of RIM when it gave up its well-known QWERTY keyboard to give way for a new trend .
Sarcastically , BlackBerry Storm did not yield the expected outcome .
Its SurePress touchscreen was a hindrance to fast typing .
It seemed that RIM realized its failure in providing the users with a convenient experience using the touchscreen device .
The latter BlackBerry smartphones were equipped with fully-support QWERTY keyboard , a preferable feature by BlackBerry users .
"Perhaps RIM's success continues to be a surprise because it appears to defy the prevailing model for which companies thrive and which companies fail in personal technology" , "but RIM is an example of how smart engineering and a keen understanding of customers can allow a small company to survive in the shadow of better-financed giants"  .
In other words , RIM has defied all odds and survived due to its understanding of the needs of its users , the risks from its enemies , and other social factors that could shape the success of an innovation .
Firstly in the case of SwRI , the main objective of the development is to produce enhanced exterior coating for electronic components that has to withstand high level of wear and tear .
Some examples on the form of deterioration can be caused by over exposure to strong sunlight , corrosion by polluted vapour and severe collision with firm particles .
Therefore SwRI wants to develop a technology that can fabricate extremely robust , impermeable and durable coatings .
On the other hand , CWRU wants to develop a packaging technology to maintain the freshness of consumable product .
In order to do so , there is a need to boost the exterior packaging of a material so that the material is able to prevent destructive gases from passing through it and at the same time minimize the use of the material during production .
Next on methodology , SwRI adapts their PEMS technology to produce an exceptionally strong and solid nanocomposite covering for the components .
This technology uses global plasma to eliminate unwanted deposits before performing the coating process .
In addition the use of high ion flux allows the layer of covering to be held onto the material more firmly .
Combining this technology with nitride-based nanocomposite coating , SwRI is able to produce an even tougher coating than by a single-phase coating .
In contrast , CWRU discovered its technology by means of serendipitous finding , the group realized that polyethylene oxide crystallizes as a single layer is able to produce extraordinarily gigantic and impermeable single crystals .
This discovery allows the group to minimize the amount of raw material used tremendously and at the same time reduce the passing of particles by more than 100 times ,  .
On the whole , it is not important whether a technology is discovered via research or by serendipity discovery and given a similar technology it is not necessary for them to have similar objectives , applications and methodologies .
This is because the most important issue is that both the technologies are able to improvise the outer layer of materials , making them more durable and long lasting .
For example like the wings of the airplane , with the help of the new discovery they are now more resistible to the air pressure and strong air resistances .
Hence both the developments can be considered big contributions to the world technology .
Robotics technology plays a significant role in the military forces of modern era .
Many nations , especially the United States , are increasingly focusing their research on the field of robotics today for military purposes during war time .
Their research focus is attributable to the change in today's war strategy and tactics where the enemy is no longer easily noticeable in the open as easy targets , as Randall Steeb , senior scientist at Rand Corporation , points out  .
As a result , an important technology called the Battlefield Extraction-Assist Robot was invented in 2006 and the invention was caused by a growing demand for robots to perform more perilous tasks in place of the soldiers , particularly in the areas of search-and-rescue and hazardous materials handling  .
First , search-and-rescue is a crucial mission that is better performed by robots than the combat medics during times of war .
One of the reasons is the way military robots are built and configured .
For example , robots such as BEAR are built to be more robust than a human being to carry wounded soldiers over long distances and are configured to be capable of overcoming obstacles such as stairs or rough bumpy grounds during the rescue  .
Another reason is that it reduces the risk of losing a human's life .
For instance , in situations where robots are not used , wounded soldiers will have to depend on their medics to search for them .
During the search , the movement of the medics might draw the enemy's attention and trigger them to attack .
On the other hand , if the robots are used and they are attacked by the enemy , the military team can just simply deploy new robots at strategic locations where the robots can avoid any chance of encountering the enemy .
Another impetus for the innovation is the ability of the robots to handle hazardous materials .
Due to the unpredictable environment of the battlefield , dangerous materials such as hidden explosives can be planted at any point by the enemy .
As such , the robots are needed by the military to help detect and locate the positions of the hidden explosive devices and then defuse them before they explode .
Robots of such configuration like BEAR have also become a part of the U .S . military operations .
Over the recent years , for example , robots with such capabilities have been greatly used by the United States to disable numerous bombs in the battlefield in Iraq and Afghanistan  .
And as a result of their successes , there is an increase in the demand of bomb-defusing robots .
On the whole , changing demands of war strategy today has led to the increase in the research and development of more advanced and sophisticated technological innovations such as BEAR to perform search-and-rescue in place of the combat medics and to handle and remove dangerous explosives and other hazardous materials hidden on the battlefield .
In the years to come , the world can expect to see the use of the advanced military robots to be an integral part of every nation's military force .

The usage of miniature UAVs in the military are common today with the Lockheed Martin and Aerovironment being the two main competitors .
The Lockheed Martin has been proactive with skunkwork invention ever since WWII pioneered by L .Kelly Johnson .
On the other hand , the Aerovironment adopt conventional process for invention .
Recent years have shown that the Desert Hawk created under the skunkwork environment has not been performing as well as the Raven made by the Aerovironment .
Lockheed Martin and Aerovironment both built the UAV based on the similar roles and functions for military use .
The primary role is to provide day and night low altitude reconnaissance to provide early warning for any potential threat  .
The secondary role of the UAV is to provide target acquisition for the manned aircraft to minimise the chance of any danger to the pilot .
The UAV are designed to be easily operated and lightweight for the ease of operating it from almost all terrains and conditions .
* Staff Sgt .
C . Todd Lopez  .
Desert Hawk gives security forces an eye in sky .

Apart from the similar roles , the Aerovironment is able to stand out with their functions .
As the UAV are to operate on all terrain , conventional landing method was not used .
However , both UAV has adopted two different ways to land .
The Desert Hawk was design for crush landing  .
This was not very popular among the user as it will affect the durability of the machines .
On contrast , the Raven make use of the advance programming to aid landing by making the UAV to experience deep stalling mode to greatly reduce speed and impact for landing .
This function helps the user to reduce cost on maintenance .
With the rich history of the Lockheed Martin's skunkwork environment , everyone would expect them to be above or at least on par with their competitors .
In this example , it was proved that the conventional process of innovation won the competition .
With all the improvement and continuous development , it make the future generation of UAV to be better than what we have today .
