Technology has been evolving fast throughout last 50 years .
New products are invented every day .
In fact , these technologies may be categorized into two typesconventional and skunkworks .
One example would be Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop .
Mac laptop was created by Apple in a conventional way whereas Toshiba laptop , the first laptop in the world , was produced in a skunkworks environment .
We may evaluate both of them by investigating their designs , durability , and portability .
As laptop is created for the convenience of the customers , both Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop are similar in their portability .
Being the first laptop producer , Toshiba was successful in turning the idea of portable computer into reality .
The smallest laptop it produced , Toshiba's Libretto U100-S213 , has only the size of 21 .0 x 3 .33 x16 .51 cm and weight of 2 .2 pounds .
Obviously , it is much more portable than many of the other laptops .
On the other hand , Apple has also release its highly portable laptop called Macbook Pro which is the thinnest 17-inch laptop in the world .
Since it has the smallest thickness , its weight is also very small .
Hence , we can see that both Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop are similar in their portability .
However , in spite of being highly portable , Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop have significant differences in their designs and durability .
Apple aimed to make Mac its own unique laptop .
As a result , the corporation spent a lot of time in designing Mac laptop .
Mac laptop is designed to be beautiful in its appearance and advanced in its operating system and software .
Its fashioned design has brought it many customers , especially the young people .
According to a Student Monitor survey conducted in US in 2009 , 43 percent of the university undergraduates in US preferred to buy Mac laptops .
While Apple works hard to ensure that Mac laptop has the most gorgeous design , Toshiba focuses more on the performance instead of the design of the laptop .
Despite the change in size , Toshiba put little effort in changing the appearance of the laptop .
There is no dramatic change in the design of Toshiba laptop over the last 20 years .
Besides , the two brands of laptop also differ in their durability .
Since the lifespan of the laptop might be difficult to measure , we investigate the durability of their batteries .
The battery is the most significant device of a laptop .
Computer engineers always endeavor to enhance the quality of the laptop batteries in order to enable the laptop to work longer without plugging in A/C supplier .
The latest Macbook Pro has achieved the maximum working time of 8 hours on a single charge .
In order to achieve this , Mac has adopted two innovations , which are bigger battery pack of lithium-ion cells as well as adaptive charging .
The battery pack in Macbook Pro occupies the space of the removable battery and obtains a 40 percent more capacitance .
In addition , adaptive charging reduces the wear and tear on the battery and gives it a much longer lifespan .
In contrast , although Toshiba also adopted lithium-ion cell battery pack in its laptop , the longest battery life was measured to be 5 .1 hours , which is much shorter than Macbook Pro .
Therefore , in terms of design and battery durability , Mac laptop has a better performance than Toshiba laptop .
On the whole , there are quite a number of similarities and differences between a conventional technology and a skunkworks technology , just like Mac laptop and Toshiba laptop .
Although Mac laptop seems to have a bigger market , Toshiba never stops innovating new type of laptop .
In addition , without Toshiba , we may not see Mac laptop today .
It is hard to conclude which technology is betterconventional or skunkworks .
They both have their advantages and disadvantages .
As long as the importance of the innovation is highlighted , the development of the technology would be bright .
Before the first laptop was developed , Japanese computer users find it hard to work .
This is mainly due to the lack of space for a desktop computer .
Furthermore , most of the Japanese do not have a computer at home .
These factors clearly show that there are favorable market conditions for the development of a portable computer in Japan .
Hence , this has driven Tetsuya Mizoguchi to develop a portable computer , despite being rejected by his company , Toshiba  .
He recognized the market potential of the portable computer and continued to develop a portable computer without his company's knowledge .
The laptop could have being developed much earlier , if Toshiba took the risk to develop the portable computer .
During that time , Toshiba has just suffered huge losses with the failure of their latest personal computer  .
Therefore , they are unwilling to take risks , and stick to known methods that work .
If the leaders in Toshiba are willing to take the risk to believe in Mizoguchi's idea , the laptop would have been developed much earlier and will not take 2 years to be developed .
The quality of the laptop would also be much better , as they will have more funds and more talented people to develop the laptop .
After the first laptop was successfully developed , Toshiba still refuses to market the laptop .
Fortunately , the idea of the laptop was not discarded , as it was later marketed aggressively by Toshiba Europe , who felt that the portable computer has great market value  .
It proved the Toshiba Company wrong , as the laptop proved to be a great marketing success , with 10000 units sold in just slightly over one year .
This has resulted in the birth of the laptop , as it started gaining popularity .
The laptop's rising popularity led to the continuation of the laptop , as it was a great marketing success .
This has also led other companies to develop their own laptop so as to gain a portion of the market share .
With more competition , each company is constantly trying to outdo each other by constantly developing and promoting their latest product .
This trend has stayed on even till today , where we can see many different brands of laptops competing with each other .
The case of the birth of the laptop shows us that a good and feasible idea could be discarded and not be used , if they were not given the opportunity to be developed .
In the case of the laptop , we may not be able to see a laptop today if Mizoguchi did not aggressively pushed on his idea .
This shows that an idea , even if it is workable and has obvious benefits , will not be developed properly without the support required .
Therefore , an innovation will only become a product , if factors such as economic , government support and usability of the product supports the development of the innovation .
In Singapore , there are two problems that many Singapore engineers may face when designing and innovating .
The first problem might be the lack of key qualities like creativity and an open mindset caused by the kind of education system we have and the environment we grew up in , while the second problem might be the aging population in our country , Singapore .
These might well be the two factors hindering local engineers from potentially producing creative innovations .
Firstly , Singapore engineers lack the creativity and it might be due to the kind of education system in Singapore .
The lack of creativity will definitely lead to problems faced by engineers when it comes to innovating new products .
Singapore's education system is more curriculum-based or in other words more book-based .
Even though there are "Art" lessons and "Design & Technical" subjects in secondary schools , it is still not enough to allow students to explore and nurture their creativity and designing abilities .
Modules and Subjects that explore a student's designing talent and abilities are only made available during the later years of their studies .
For example , students can only study these modules during their Polytechnic or University years .
Therefore we can see those students are only encouraged to greater explore and express their creativity during their tertiary years of studies .
I feel that a short 3 to 4 years of tertiary studies is not enough to properly allow students to fully develop their creativity .
This will therefore affect them when they enter the working society as professional engineers .
Without enough creativity , local engineers are bound to face problems in their course of work , which is mainly innovating .
In addition , local engineers are also more "traditional" in terms of their mindset , in other words "kiasi" and kiasu" .
Many local engineers possess this kind of mindset and it is probably because of the environment they grew up in and accustomed to .
We Singaporeans are very well protected and taken care off in our country thus it is only natural that the "kiasi" and "kiasu" characteristics manifest in us .
Due to this mindset problem , local engineers are often not willing to take risks as they are afraid of failures .
Local engineers might be able to think out of the box but they usually dare not venture out of it and apply their ideas to their innovations .
Thus this might affect them in a way that by not trying out new and refreshing ideas , the end product of their innovations would definitely be lackluster and unappealing .
Therefore , with this problem local engineers are bound to face problem while innovating .
Secondly , the aging population in Singapore might have contributed to the problems faced by Singapore engineers .
As we know that the aged in Singapore might not be as tech savvy as the youngsters .
With an aging population , it means that older citizens form a relatively huge percentage of the total population in Singapore thus it also applies to the consumer market .
Many older citizens are unable to keep up with the pace of changes taking place in the current society and are usually slower when it comes to learning and adapting to new technologies and innovations .
Therefore , with this problem in mind , local engineers often face challenges that require them to come up with innovations and create products that not only appeal to the younger generation of Singaporeans but also to cater to the aging population .
In all , the problems mentioned above may potentially hamper local engineers from coming up with good ideas and innovations .
Therefore we might need to first look into the causes of the problems such as the Singaporean's "Kiasi" and "Kiasu" mindset caused by the kind of environment we live in and probably the education system for the younger generations in Singapore .
As is known to all , nowadays  ,science and technology are playing a more and more important part in social society .
We can even say that science and technology have been treasured so much that they are almost treated as a symbol of a country' strength .
Design , therefore , as an important source of more advanced science and technology , is being valued more and more by people and even countries .
As the saying goes , knowledge is wealth , knowledge is power .
In spite of such facts , however , there are still some problems appearing in our country which hamper engineering design processes for innovation .
As a result , in the long run , the problems will make a bad effect on the development of science and technology .
The first problem that hampers engineering design is the old education style .
In China , we attend classes just to remember useful knowledge which can be applied in the exam .
We are always adapting such a teaching pattern that teachers teach and students memorize .
That is to say , teachers never value the importance of training students' thinking ability .
Besides , in the examination , we only solve problems with methods that teachers taught us and almost never think about other methods .
In other words , faced with a problem , we cannot solve it using our own methods .
What is more , teachers also do not pay much attention to practical activities , such as social research and experiment class .
In fact , they just think It a waste of time .
To be a designer or inventor , the most important and also the basic quality is creativity .
Only when scientists have rich experience and various methods can they succeed in their work .
Also , before they can begin to design , they must know about their objectives first .
That is to say , before they design and innovate , they must know what to create first .
During the process , they must know how to design .
But due to the current teaching style , students do not have any aim and ability to create and invent .
The second problem is rules in the protection of inventions .
Since China has been built for less than one decade , it is certain that there are some problems in the laws and rules .
As a matter of fact , China does not realize the importance of laws in protection of invention in stimulating development of science and technology .
As a result of the defect in invention law , the production invented by scientists cannot be protected very well .
Therefore , many scientists may make an invention , only to find that it was stolen by others and their works made no effect .
In such conditions , scientists will be discouraged from inventing to some extend .
Due to the above two problems , Chinese Engineering design was harmed seriously .
To help China make great improvement in science and technology , we must pay attention to design .
In other words , we should create a good environment for design and solve problems that hamper the design process .
It is time for governments to take measures to make improvement in education and laws .
In Singapore there are many constraints which hamper the engineering process for innovations .
As of such , engineers have to resort to new means and ideas when they design a system .
The two main problems are the ageing population and the mindset of Singaporeans .
In the National Day Rally Speech 09 , Prime Minister Lee Hsein Loog mentioned about the rapidly increasing ageing population .
This fact is very true and real .
The birth rate in Singapore is not able to support the uprising ageing population .
The impact of it can be very problematic if not dealt with prudently .
Firstly , the majority of the elderly population are often outdated with the newer technologies , most of them are unable to handle modern gadgets .
As of such , they often resort to using more simplified means such as the telephone .
Secondly , they are resistant to change .
If given the choice to send a letter , they would rather manually write the letter and send it via mail then to send an email .
Because they are technologically impaired , they would prefer to use more traditional methods .
Lastly , an ageing population would mean the special care needs to be directed in order to cater to the needs of them .
Devices must be easy to operate and their welfare must be taken into account .
Following that , the mindset of Singaporeans also plays a big role .
Singaporeans are very money minded .
This is due the kind of society we are brought up in .
Electric Road Pricing , Certificate of Entitlement and housing cost all cultivates us to be money conscious .
In fact Singapore is one of the most expensive place to live in .
Hence Singaporeans are more unwilling to take risks as the cost of failure would be very tough to recover from .
We are reluctant to invest in research and explore new frontiers .
In addition , there is a lack of creativity nowadays .
New products in the market are similar to already existing products .
Take Apple's iTouch for example .
Ever since its release , all the major phone companies such as Nokia , Samung and Sony Ericsson have released their own versions of a touch screen device .
This lack of creativity does not only relates to Singaporeans but it is a global phenomenon .
As of such , these two problems can really hinder the growth of engineers in Singapore .
Engineers have to take into account the feebleness of the elderly and their technological constraints .
Extra care and efforts must be provided to consider the safety and wellbeing of the elderly .
Moreover due to the trend , products must be centered on them rather then youths .
Engineers would also need to open up to more ideas and research .
Although getting their financial support might be a challenge , it is something they have to overcome in order to progress .
Our government does in fact provides some kind of incentives to researchers .
In short , although the ageing population and the mindset of Singaporeans may prove to be a challenge to engineers , it is possible to overcome them .
Engineers must be open to new ideas , adept to their target consumers and be willing to take risks .
The movie star , Paul Newman said , "I never learnt as much in the classroom as I did staring out a window and imagining things ."
Generally , design is a process of an imagination being produced by a human .
How creative or attractive the product is which will depend on the imagination of a designer , regardless of which area a designer focuses on .
However , by producing an innovative product on the market , it is not an easy task to achieve .
Most of the time , it is often hindered by multiple realistic problems .
There are two major problems which hamper engineering design processes for innovation .
The first problem is due to government related issues while the second is related to the environmental issues .
First of all , the government related issues will affect the engineering design process .
This is because an engineering design involves a series of complicated steps such as drafting outline , analysis and problem-solving as well as product implementation and the final testing of the product before being shipped to the market .
Furthermore , the designing process is a long term investment as it may require engineers to spend a lot of time and money in order to come out with an innovative product .
Therefore , the support of the government will lead to a different outcome .
A good government will come out with a clear policy to help its people along the way such that financially support the engineers and to provide sponsor for other organizations to assist in the work of an engineer .
On the other hand , a bad government such as a corrupted government will make the design process come to a standstill .
As a result , it may end up in failure eventually .
However , even if the engineers have received a financial support from the government or other organization , the funding may be limited sometimes due to long term processes which involve problem solving methodology and testing for the innovative design to be carried out .
At the same time , the government and the companies will doubt this engineering design is workable or not if it takes too long to progress .
Therefore , the engineers will come across problems due to insufficient funding and eventually it leads to a standstill .
The second problem that hinders the engineering design is the environmental issues .
Frankly speaking , there are engineers who only care about the profit they are going to make regardless about the effects bring to our environment .
Therefore , they may come out with ideas for their own interest and benefit .
For instance , in Taiwan , the most popular transport is motorbike .
Everyone owns one , especially in Taipei .
In order to meet the demand in the market and to attract more people to buy , different designs for the motorbike are also invented .
However , due to the increase in demand for motorbike , the use of motorbike results in environmental problems such as air pollution and resource depletion of fossil fuel .
Therefore , the fossil-fueled motorbikes are forbidden in some countries .
In conclusion , I do think that a government policy and environmental issues will hinder the engineering design for innovation .
A good government has to come out with a clear policy to benefit for its people together with the concern towards the environment .
Otherwise , most of the engineering design for innovation could be a failure without any success .
There are many different types of engineering discipline in Singapore .
Basically , according to Jonathan Dunder  , there are eight different types of engineering .
There are the architectural , biomedical , civil , computer , electrical , industrial , mechanical and software engineering .
Each serves different engineering industries .
For architectural , it is more related to designing of buildings for commercial , residential and industrial purpose .
As for biomedical , it is the design of devices intended to be used in medicine .
Civil engineering is the focus of structuring design for infrastructure such as bridges and roads .
Electrical engineering is the designing of electronics , software engineering is the designing of software applications that relates to operating system whereas computer engineering is the combination of software and electronic engineering which focuses on both the engineering design .
Industrial engineering is the designing of multiple manufacturing products while lastly is mechanical engineering , which is the oldest of the engineering field , is the designing of the mechanical systems .
There are so many engineering fields .
So what is engineering actually ?
According to Jonathan Dunder  , engineering is the designing , troubleshooting and testing of products that science , mathematics , physics and the technology .
Designing of engineering innovation may takes up to several years of process to see the ideal final output product coming to reality .
Innovation involves three different stages of journey .
There is the creativity , when idea comes to mind , follow by the process where idea is slowly turning to reality by the organization .
Finally is the entrepreneurship process where innovations are punch into the new market .
During these stages of innovation , different problems are faced by the engineers , some problems are significant enough that may lead to the closing of innovation .
Problems do occur in Singapore during each and every innovating design by the engineers .
Here , two of the major problems faced shall be discussed .
Engineers are needed in the entire process of every innovation to plan , troubleshoot , build and install the equipments in order to make the innovation a successful one .
Experienced engineers are needed in the organization to speed up with the innovation process .
So here , in Singapore , the first major problem faced in the innovation designing process is the high salaries by the senior , experienced engineers and the freshly graduate engineers from the ITEs , Polytechnics as well as the Universities .
According to jobstreet .com , a statistics report done by 3 .5 million members in terms of the numbers of years working experiences in the engineering world shows that the longer the experiences , the higher the qualification , the higher will be the monthly wages .
As the ageing-population in Singapore over the couples of decades will increase tremendously , as well as only 40-45% of graduates in ITEs , Polytechnics and Universities are trained in some form of engineering ) , organizations in Singapore , in order to proceed with their innovations , they have no choice but to turn their way to the more senior and experienced engineers .
This will in fact slow down the process of innovation as the organizations in Singapore have to think of ways to increase their innovation budgets to pay the engineers .
In conclusion , it is not an easy process for an innovation to be out in the market .
Not only is Singapore , organizations in other countries too met with many significant difficulties during their innovation designing process .
But there too are a couple of successful innovations being done by organizations in Singapore such as Creative Technology .
Now the credit cards are very popular in the world .
For example the circulation of credit cards in China jumps from 3 million in 2003 through 50 million in 2006 to 122 million in 2008  .
We can see the increasing speed is very fast .
However , before 1920s none knew what the credit card was .
How is the magical card created ?
Which factors lead to its production ?
I think there are three factors which contribute to the production of credit card .
Firstly , from the technical perspective , the invention of magnetic stripe card technology makes it possible that credit card itself can record data of receipts and disbursements .
Moreover , computer technology and network technology broaden the range of credit card's service and make a strong link between the card and our daily life .
Secondly , from an economical perspective , it can be summarized in two points: one is the consumption concept implied in the credit card that consumption before payment .
The most important character of credit card is overdraft .
It means even though one does not have money at hand , he still possesses the ability of payment .
So the credit card can solve the instant shortage of money .
Also it to some extent increases the value of goods .
For example , one has to spend twenty days on saving money and then before he affords to buy a nice coat .
But if one has a credit card , everything remains same except that he gets the nice coat twenty days earlier .
So one earns the extra twenty-day usage of the coat thanks to the credit card .
This function of the credit card stimulates people's consumption desire .
So many countries encourage releasing credit cards to stimulate domestic demand and promote economic development .
The other point is that the credit card saves a lot of manpower and material resources .
With globalization going on , more people travel around the world and money circulates more quickly .
The credit card adopts the electronic fund transfer , which reduces banks transferring a large amount of cash from one place to another .
It does save a lot of work .
Thirdly , from a social perspective , credit card brings a lot of convenience to our life .
There are several simple methods of payment by using credit card such as punching the card on POS machine and RFID machine , network payment and telephone payment .
No matter when and where it is , one can get money by credit card instead of carrying a lot of cash .
This character of credit card makes it adapt to the pace of modern life .

On her way to be more modern , one of the key points is to improve engineering design ability .
However , in china , there are still some problems humping the developing of engineering designs .

These people may never think about inventing new techniques .

This concept have negative influences , on one hand people do not want to do new engineering designs and discourage others to do so .
On the other hand , even though there are new techniques which can make a difference , people do not want to use it .
As a result seldom designs can be applied into practice .
Inventors become less and less .
The two problems mentioned above are serious in China .
They have bad effects on the developing of engineering techniques in China .
However , as the world becomes more competitive and "smaller" , government and public have realized the importance of sane policy and innovation .
I believe in the near future we can do much better .
From the research , the World Health Organization assumes that about 80% of all disabled people worldwide live in developing countries .
It is also estimated that there are 600 million disabled people in the worldwide , which is about 10% of the world population .
Among these disabled people , 1987 data from the World Health Organization estimate that 27-35 million people are blind in the world , of which about 20% in Africa and 65% live in Asia .
Moreover , 14-17 million people have serious visual damage .
The amount of blind is rising , first because of rapid increase in population size in developing countries and second despite of increased longevity , as ageing is concerned with visual loss from cataract , glaucoma and macular degeneration .
That is why it is hard to make prediction in future numbers of blind because of unknown quantity in population growth .
Hence , the first solution is to invent and innovate equipments that help combat with blindness .
Building eyes treatment center is another way to reduce blindness .
The last thing that cannot be left out is giving proper jobs and appropriate training for blind people .
Secondly , building eyes treatment center where patients can get treatment and buy the optical equipment .
Additionally , an attempt will be made to work with private initiators in order to build treatment center which is run only by people who are blind and have visually damage .
Since , having the special treatment for blind and visually damage people is a once- only expense , but it is very expensive .
So to finance these expenses , we have to set up community services activities such as fund raising .
In conclusion , blind people should also have same opportunities as everyone else which means to get a freedom from extreme limitation , to accomplish and to be able to having confidence .
So that other people must give respect to them .
Moreover , their passions are same as others .
They too have same dreams and assurance that they can reach their target .
If blind people get the same chance as sighted people , they surely can achieve the same quality of life .

According to AutoCar Magazine in China , there are about 2600 new gasoline cars on the road everyday in Beijing , Shanghai , Tianjin and Guangzhou .
The rapid increase of number of cars exhausts more carbon dioxide which is actually worsening the Green House effect .
People really need some innovation to solve this problem and save our earth .
Although countries like the US have already spent more than 10 years to do research and development on electric cars  , however , there are still two main problems that significantly affect its growth in the market of china .
The government support is one of the main difficulty that prohibiting the development of electric cars .
First of all , the running duration of the electric cars is what the government concerns .
By using the most advanced batteries , a fully charged electric car can run about 160km  .
However , comparing to the gasoline cars which can last for 500 to 600 km , the distance travelled by the electric cars is still considered as too limited .
The government worries that the electric cars will restrict the development and expansion of those big cities due to its short running duration .
Second , the cost for building the infrastructure of the electric cars is really a big amount of money .
There are about 600 cities in China , imaging how much it costs if the battery charging facilities are built in every car park .
Besides that , the development of the electric car industry will definitely affect traditional gasoline car industry .
The Thousands of petrol stations will have to close for no business petrol related service industries will also be severely affected .
As a result , many people work in these areas will lose their jobs .
The government is reluctant to see such kind of bad influence to the economy .
In conclusion , the government will not support the development of the electric car .
Another main problem is that building of electric cars may affect our environment .
Many people suggest building electric cars as those are eco friendly .
However , the major source of electricity comes from coal power generation in China .
Although there are wasted gas treatment process in those factories , carbon dioxide emission is still unavoidable .
The only advantage is that the factories have high efficiency of resources using with less pollution .
Besides that , making use of batteries will also have negative influence to the earth .
Normally , batteries are not biodegradable and there are toxic substances , such as mercury , inside the batteries  .
If people do not treat them properly , the toxic substances may flow into soil and rivers and affect our environment .
In conclusion , government support and bad influence of the environment are two main reasons that restrict the development of electric cars .
For making use of the electric cars in our daily life , the engineers still have a long way to go .

Obviously , they need help from the government .

Malaysia intermediate past prime minister , Datuk Seri Abdullah Badawi once stated , "The way I see it , the malaise affecting Malaysia that may well jeopardize our way forward is a case of having first world infrastructure and third world mentality ."
This has somehow proven that most of the Malaysians are not improving by all means .

Hence , designing and innovation would be a difficult task for them in this moment .

Moreover , Malaysians with these kinds of qualities and attitudes also act as an obstacle in the innovation process .
They will just blindly follow the trend .
It is hard to have a new idea pops out from their minds as they will not think out of the box .
In conclusion , the engineering design processes for innovations in Malaysia is still in the very first phase .
Malaysia government should be more concern about these two major problems and solve them adequately .
In my opinion , the problems can be solved if the government thinks of changing the education system .
Besides that , Malaysian should also start to work hard in order to make Malaysia a developed country instead of developing country .
Hence , creating a new gadget in Malaysia would not be a dream it is just a matter of time and effort .
As we can see very commonly in MRTs and buses , the needs of elderly in public transport are not taken care of .
A few years back , the Land Transport Authority introduced the 'Priority Seating' scheme which is meant to help the elderly , parents with kids , pregnant ladies or handicaps .
However , the scheme did not achieve its aim as people continue to occupy the 'Priority Seats' and did not give them up to those who needs it more .
Just a few months back , the LTA decided to make some changes to it .
"The LTA , SBS Transit and SMRT , have standardised the signs for priority seating in MRT trains .
The new signs are in blue and white , aligned with the colour code for the International Symbol of Access , and state 'Reserved Seating' instead of 'Priority Seating' to make the call-for-action to give up the seats more authoritative and forceful"  .
In addition to the 'Reserved Seating' scheme , the Public Transport Council launched "a public education program titled 'A Happy Journey Starts Like That !'
to promote graciousness on public transport" in the recent months .
One of the aims of this program is to promote the idea of giving up the reserved seats to those who needs it more .
As we can see from the above examples , the LTA has been putting in a lot of effort in trying to make the 'Reserved Seating' scheme more effective .
The scheme might have improved the situation to a certain extent however , it is evident that the problem has not been solved .
There have been a lot of topics on forums on the internet regarding the issue of 'Reserved Seating' .
"Sad to say , no impact and people are still sitting at these seats and worst still , even when there was older folks standing around"  .
This was a comment by someone after what he saw in the MRT .
Here , we can clearly see that the problem has not been solved .
To tackle the problem , I have generated three solutions .
Firstly , instead of having a 'Reserved Seat' , changed it to 'Reserved Carriage' - A whole carriage specially for the elderly and others who are entitled to it .
After giving it some thought , I believe the 'Reserved Carriage' should be the center carriage of the train .
This will not only provide convenience for the elderly  , it will also be good to standardise this throughout all the MRT stations .
The 'Reserved Carriage' will be blocked off and to gain access to the 'Reserved Carriage' , one must tap his/her EZ-Link card .
This concept is similar to the method of entering the MRT station but of course , no money will be deducted .
As senior citizens already have special EZ-Link cards , this can be used to gain access to the 'Reserved Carriage' .
As for the others who are also entitled to the 'Reserve Carriage' , they can apply for a special EZ-Link card which will allow access to the carriage too .
Secondly , we will use back the idea of the 'Reserved Seat' .
However , each seat is 'locked' by a bar across the seat .
Similarly , to gain access to the seat , one must tap his/her EZ-Link card .
Upon tapping of the EZ-Link card , the seat will be 'unlocked' and people who are entitled to the 'Reserved Seat' are now able to sit .
The same idea can be used towards the wheelchair bound area .
Lastly , I have read a couple of comments online , saying that those who are not entitled to the 'Reserved Seat' but are actually sitting on it are to be fined .
This is indeed a very good idea as the best method to deter Singaporeans from doing something is to implement a fine .
However , much has been said about Singapore being a 'Fine' city .
By doing so , it might be cost efficient but we are acknowledging to the world that we are indeed a 'Fine' city , to the extent of fining people for not giving up 'Reserved Seats' .
Therefore , I would not agree with this method .
As the third option of implementing a fine has already been taken out of my choice , I would like to compare between the first option and the second option .
There are four points of comparisons I would like to discuss .
Option 1 is definitely less costly than option 2 .
In the first option , it requires only 2 - 4 systems in each train station while in the second option , it requires a system in every train carriages for each 'Reserved Seat' .
However , option 1 is less flexible as compared to option 2 .
In the first option , those travelling together with the elderly are not able to enter the same carriage while in the second option , the elderly can be accompanied by their children or grandchildren .
This lack of flexibility leads to the third comparison of safety issues .
As other people are not able to accompany the elderly or those entitled to the 'Reserved Carriage' , they are not taken care of in the carriage .
In case of emergency , there will be a lot of safety issues arising from it .
In the second option , however , the elderly are taken care of by the other commuters even in case of emergency .
The last comparison is the usage of the space .
In option 1 , there will be a lot of standing space wasted in the 'Reserved Carriage' , while in option 2 , it makes full use of the space and no space will be wasted .
As we can see from the above comparisons , option 2 is much better than option 1 except for the costs .
It is more flexible , makes full use of the space around and most importantly , it is safe .
I believe that if the LTA really hope to solve this problem , the cost would not be an issue .
Therefore , option 2 will be a more feasible solution .
In conclusion , whatever schemes or ideas that might be implemented in the future , there will definitely be a lot of discussions and debates regarding it going on .
Forums on the internet will continue talking about it and so will the media .
This issue will never be solved completely unless Singaporeans learn from the culture of Taiwan or Korea for example .
"I saw documentary on CNA and they were showing that the reserved seats in their train remains empty despite the fact that the train was crowded yet no one occupy these seats .
It was mentioned that the Koreans has much respect for the old and also they are more gracious"  .
Singaporeans need to learn how to be more courteous and gracious and care more for the elderly and needy .
The bottom-line is that no matter how many new innovations engineers can invent , they can only reduce such problems but not eliminate them completely .
If you ask me , the one and only way to eliminate this problem depends on us !
In the eastern part of the globe there exists a place called India , renowned for its wide heritage and tourist spots the country is also famous for one other thing - corruption .
In a country where most of the rural population is below the poverty line , it's not a surprise that corruption exists , however its mere existence has hampered the design process of innovation .
Corruption is everywhere and its not limited to the government alone , but has spread to the greedy private sector as well .
Corruption in India is on a totally different scale , people here don't take money just to do things out of their way but to do their jobs as well !
For example , let us consider a government officer in the housing board development sector , his job is to attest any stamp paper that may come his way for approval , if it were an ideal country he would do his job but this being India , you would probably pay him a handsome amount to just do his job !
As shocking as this might sound , this is nothing but the truth .
Since corruption spreads like wildfire , this practice has ended up in almost every other sector of the government thereby affecting the overall development of the country and its resources .
When a new technology emerges , it first has to go through the government's "tests" .
Basically , it means you have to "satisfy" the higher government officials before your technology can be made available to the public .
Not all can "satisfy" the government , thus some technologies are never made available to the general public , which essentially means it has no chance of becoming an innovation !
These malpractices are one of the reasons for the greedy nature of the private sector as well .
For example , the government demanded a lot of money from the private mobile phone service providers for spectrum allocation during the auction for 3G frequencies .
This hefty price tag has delayed the rolling out of the 3G service in India whilst other countries are moving on to 4G .
Just when you thought corruption is not enough to bring India down , there is another big problem yet to be eradicated - poverty .
About 42% of the population lives below the International poverty line !
This indirectly affects the design process because most new technologies require a lot of takers in the initial stages for it to become a success .
For example , broadband costs in India are still one of the highest in the world , simply because not a lot of people are aware about it and thus not a lot of them want to take it , this forces the ISP to raise increase the profit margin per person .
Is this because of the lack of IT literacy in India ?
Well , first , the literacy rate needs to improve before we can even start thinking about IT literacy .
The government education system at the primary and secondary level is a total flop , the syllabus is outdated and the curriculum is something of a joke .
India has a long way to go in terms of primary and secondary education although university level education is on par with the international standards .
All in all , poverty and corruption are the weeds in the endless fields of possibilities called India .
Only about five years ago , when people acquired information , they went to libraries or read newspapers .
However , within this short five-year period , there is an utter change in people's response .
The instinct of most people now , when they encountered any problems , is to seek help on Internet .
The first step is always going to any search engine such as "Google" to type in what they want .
According to the survey conducted by Nielsen : 256 million people visited a search engine in December 2006 81% of the global Internet population .
The use of search engines is so ubiquitous today that people often forget the fact that it was commercialized only in recent few years .
This is certainly attributed to the fast advancement of Information Technologies .
Nevertheless , there are some socially determining factors that should not be neglected .
First of all , internet search engine is the kind of tool which requires least cost , to both viewers and advertisers .
With the wide scope of internet coverage and common usage of laptops , it is economically advisable to use search engines for information gathering .
Comparing with going to bookstores or libraries and watching TV , which cost people time and money , it is cost effective to search information through search engines .
For advertisers , the cost of search marketing is much lower than that of the advertisements in other forms like on TV programs .
In this world where profit means so much , more and more advertisers are exploring the new field of search engine advertising .
The economic factor really contributes to the growth and development of search engines .
Secondly , search engine is a relatively easier tool that everyone can accept .
For example , the homepage of Google is very clean and simple .
Without much distractions from fancy designs and display of every piece of information , users can access to what they want to find directly .
Moreover , the sophistication of the search engines enables users to accurately describe the information they want and view them in an assorted manner .
In addition , search engines are mostly globalized .
For example , "Google" has many versions in different languages .
Singapore also has its own "Yahoo !"
search engines .
This helps to expose their people to the outside world by browsing other countries' WebPages through search engines .
Thus the above mentioned features have encouraged more people to use search engines .
The last but not the least , search engines lead people into a realm of information .
It is so resourceful that people basically can find anything they want by typing some words in it .
It really links up the real and the virtual world as people gain knowledge from internet and apply it to the everyday life .
It does no only have a vast database , but also possess advanced functions which classify and sort these information into different categories .
For instance , the "Google" scholar function allows users to search specifically scholastic articles .
Furthermore , as most search engines use "spider" protocol , the information presented is least biased because they are listed out based on their relevance to the user's input .
Without many advertisements to disguise the truth , users can process the information more conveniently .
As a result , the problem of too much irrelevant information present in books and TV can be alleviated .
The development of search engines is thus undeniable and spontaneous .
In conclusion , the emergence of search engines in our daily life is due to the economical , practical and information coverage factors .
It definitely started a new age of information gathering .
Through making the gathering process easier and more reliable , it saves the time , effort and resources of people .
Therefore , it is no wonder that it has remained popular in these years and still dominates the international search landscape .
According to recent statistics , every 1 in 8 people in Singapore aged between 15 to 64 is an elderly citizen .
, this is an astonishing figure .
Singapore has already been facing this imminent problem for decades , and many policies have already been put in place to control these statistics but to no avail .
With the advent of modern technology and sciences , living to a ripe old age was nothing too spectacular .
With an aging population , the ratio of people to proportion being able to work gradually reduces .
This reduction will no doubt cripple on the country's economy , as funds will have to be used to cater to the needs of the older majority .
It is therefore , required of the community to be able to design products to convenient them .
Hence , it is one need of Singapore as a whole country that should be given priority as it is an impending crisis and must not be neglected .
However , if these needs and concerns of the elderly are not taken care of , it may result in dire consequences .
In some areas of expertise , these "veterans" are still an indispensable source of knowledge .
Their guidance can have a great impact upon decisions made , even politically .
Our Minister Mentor , Mr . Lee Kwan Yew , is one such example of a person who provides valued experiences and guidance to the ministers .
Hence , we cannot simply turn a blind eye to the needs of the elderly .
We should do what is within our means so that they will be able to enjoy the rest of their lives .
As there is a significant majority of elderly people in Singapore to date , catering to their needs should also be part of our consideration , as a community .
Through our engineering processes , we can ensure that we can provide tools and devices for the elderly .
Firstly , our engineering processes are structured in such a way that all factors are taken into consideration .
The rigorous nature of the various steps will guarantee that a solution that is most favorable .
Cost effectiveness , efficiency and safety are held in high regard in most cases , making certain that the products designed will not take a toll on the pockets and be a hazard when they use it .
Secondly , even before a certain product design is selected , there will be multiple blueprints that are presented to the 'panel' of engineers and designers .
This is crucial because the design of the product will be diversified , less the innovations and possibilities be constrained and disregarding other important aspects such as safety .
Lastly , the survey that will be included will make sure that the product that is about to be designed will be suitable to the majority .
The information gathered from such surveys will be used in the processing and the decision of the final product out of the many initial designs will be largely based on these statistics .
These are just some examples of how the engineering process can be substantial in meeting the needs of a targeted group , which in this case , is the elderly in Singapore .
All in all , we should not only design products that will cater to the majority of the population and be nonchalant about the needs of the elderly .
A healthy balance of the two should be maintained .
Everyone ages eventually , wouldn't you want the community spare a thought for your convenience when you age ?

Engineering design process is usually a cyclic process where decisions making are required .
Often , engineering sciences , basic sciences and mathematics are applied to convert the information available optimally to achieve the desired deeds .
Basically , this process can be divided into a various steps including identifying objective , defining problems , conducting researches , analyzing solutions , making decisions , presenting the products and finally , selling the products .
These are the universal steps in the process which followed by most of the engineers .
Nonetheless , there are problems that significantly hamper the engineering design process for innovation .
In Malaysia , the corruption in the politic system has leads to slow development in design process .
Besides , the education system introduced leads to lack of creativity and innovation on engineers .
In addition , lack of creativity and innovations have been identified to be the main problems in hampering engineering design process , which might due to the current education system in Malaysia .
Most of the students now were so used to be spoon fed .
They were usually spoon fed with dictated notes , and they expect that every solution will be provided .
They were overindulged by teachers as knowledge or information was provided to them in an oversimplified way , causing students to be too relying on teachers .
Students were treated in a way that discouraging independent thought and learning process , thus indirectly hindered their abilities to analyze and interpret problems due to lack of creativity .
In conclusion , corruption in politic system and lack of creativity on engineers , indisputable , significantly hampers engineering design process .
As said by the ex Prime Minister of Malaysia , Dato' Seri Doctor Mahathir Muhammad , "the use of money in politics gain could destroy a country" .
Therefore , action should be taken to prevent further corruption in politic system so that engineering design process would not be hinder .
Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day , teach a man to fish and he will eat for the rest of his life .
Hence , government should encourage independent learning so that students will be more creative and innovative to facilitate engineering design process .
Before 1870 , people could communicate with one another in a distance away only by the mean of writing .
It was very inconvenient as urgent information could not be delivered immediately .
But on 1876 , Alexander Graham Bell invented a device that changed the world .
He invented telephone - a device that allows two remotely located users to communicate by voice between each other  .
Today , his invention has become a necessity in our life to fulfill our need to communicate without meeting up .
Similarly , Konrad Zuse has invented the first computer , which satisfies our need for a systematic and efficient method of data management  .
Who are these brilliant people who invented these incredible devices which we cannot live without in this modern world ?
Engineers !
From the past till present , engineers have designed products or systems that meet human needs  .
Therefore , they play a crucial role in the society that never fails to improve our standard of living .
Today , one of the main concerns about human need is the innovation of a more environmental-friendly vehicle .
Current vehicles are producing too much carbon dioxide - the main substance that causes global warming .
About 33% of U .S carbon dioxide emission comes from the burning of gasoline in internal-combustion engines of cars and light trucks  .
Many signs of worldwide climate change have been identified .
If we do not react quickly , the increase in temperature could lead to large-scale food and water shortage and have disastrous effects on wildlife .
Moreover , the rise in sea level could flood many islands  .
With the Earth at its critical state , a "greener" car is of the essence , and engineering design processes can guide us to our goal .
Seyyed Khandani Ph .D .  .
Engineering Design Processes .
Singapore .
Engineering design processes consist of five steps .
Firstly , we have to define the design problem .
In the process of defining the problem , we have to identify and establish the need .
Then , a problem statement is developed , which in this case is innovation of an eco-friendly car .
After that , we have to establish the criteria for success for instance , a car that minimizes the emission of carbon dioxide to the environment .
With the problem defined clearly , we carry on to the second step , gathering pertinent information .
The third step in engineering design processes is generating multiple solutions .
We can start by examining the weaknesses of the existing solution and try to improve them , while combining new ideas to create a unique solution to the problem  .
Once alternative solutions to the design problem have been conceived , we proceed to analyze those solutions and select the best solution for implementation , the fourth step in the engineering design processes .
In the process of analyzing the solutions , product safety and liability will also be considered .
Finally , the last step will be testing and implementing the solution to the design problem .
We must also consider the means of implementation such as prototyping and concurrent engineering , nevertheless the distinct activities during implementation , like documentation of design solution and application for patents  .
In conclusion , the human need for the innovation of an environmental-friendly car must be given priority to reduce the effect of worldwide climate change and the engineering design processes is a systematic method to accomplish this objective systematically .
Immediate action is necessary as the Earth is getting weaker and weaker .
Never let our children suffer for our mistake !

In the contemporary world , preventing heart diseases is inarguably one of the most pressing needs of mankind , which is rated as the top priority for engineering design and innovation .
As years of researches conducted by the WHO have repeatedly shown , heart malfunctioning is the most killing threat among all health-related problems to our lives .
Given such a life and death situation , engineers have responded and there have been many great inventions , of which the implanted pacemaker might be one of the most significant engineering products in preventing heart diseases .
This essay will explain in detail the working of modern implanted pacemakers and therefore how they have met the need in maintaining a smoothly beating heart .
An implanted pacemaker , in a nutshell , is a tiny computerized medical machine inserted in human bodies , which monitors the rhythms of human heart beats , analyze and rectify them if abnormalities occur .
A pacemaker consists of a battery , a program-based generator and electrical wires attached to the atriums and ventricles , the chambers in our hearts .
The battery , which is a mercury cell , supplies the power needed for the pacemaker to function .
The generator , which works as a computer , has programs written in it and is responsible in sending out electrical pulses in crucial moments .
The first step is to have a pacemaker implanted into the human body .
After having numbed the patient's collarbone area and a small incision made , electrical leads are inserted into the heart chamber with the guidance of x-ray .
The other end of the leads is connected to the generator and a battery that lasts for a few years .
Next , the doctor will transmit a program tailored to the needs of the patient's heart into the pacemaker across the patient's skin .
Now the pacemaker is ready to work .
Under normal circumstances , it keeps the heart beating in a normal rhythm according to the program .
When an abnormality happens , such as a block in the coronary artery or a sudden stop of heart beat , the pacemaker detects it and sends out electrical pulses to the affected location .
The pulses will then stimulate contractions in the heart muscles , which will allow the blood to flow smoothly again or to start beating again , preventing a possible sudden death of the patient .
Besides the serious occasions of heart malfunctioning , pacemaker can also help regulate the heart beat when the patient is performing certain activities , such as exercising and sleeping .
Moreover , the pacemaker records the rhythms of the patient's heart beat in different situations and hence helps the doctor to write programs that suit the patient better .
The reasons why implanted pacemakers have gone through generations of development and enlisted as one of the top 50 inventions in the past 50 years are that they are portable , which means they can effectively prevent sudden heart attacks , and dependable as they run on computer programs which are constantly renewed by having more suitable ones stored in the patients' bodies .
This invention is certainly a masterpiece of engineering design due to its contribution in the enhancement of health through maintaining a functional heart , without which the whole foundation of mankind shall collapse .
In the 21st century , human beings face a lot of serious problems , such as global warming , environment pollution , weather change , and frequent natural disasters .
Among them , the shortage of energy resources is the most urgent one to be resolved .
Our prosperous society is built on automatic mass production which requires a large amount of energy .
As a result , starting a war , destroying natural balance and polluting the environment , they are just the side effects of disputing energy resources .
Since energy resource shortage is the root of so many problems , finding its solution is the priority for engineers .
In general , three aspects can be innovated: they are improving the effectiveness of energy use and production , designing methods to store and accumulate small portions of energy , and finding cleaner and renewable energy resources .
First of all , the most practical part of solution is to make full use of energy .
The phenomena of energy wasting can be found everywhere in daily life .
Even the industrial design cannot avoid it .
For instance , most vehicles' engines can only transfer about 30% of fuel's chemical energy into mechanical energy , while the other 70% becoming heat and polluters .
Another example comes from the solar panel .
Although solar energy has been regarded as the most promising energy form , solar panel is also well known for its low energy exchange rate-less than 16% .
However , if the effectiveness of both energy use and production can be improved , enormous amount of energy could be saved .
The following efforts should be put into storing and accumulating small portions of energy .
As the major energy resources are running out , more and more energy comes from those resources which can only generate a little energy at a time .
Although their power is small , the sum is considerable if they can be accumulated properly .
The best example is the wind power generator .
A single generator produces the power of several hundred watts , even less than a family's need .
But once all energy generated by thousands of generators can be stored and transmitted with little loss , the huge industrial energy need is also able to be satisfied .
From 1840 to 1949 , Chinese people were suffering from World War II and Chinese civil war .
After these battles and wars , Chinese people finally stepped in to a new era , a peaceful but impoverished era .
Chinese people did not have time to develop their economy and technology .
Therefore , Chinese economy and technology was far behind those developed country .
However , Chinese people did not give up Chinese leaders put forward a series of policies .
Moreover , every Chinese people want to contribute to establishing a new China .
That is why Chinese economic situation was much better than before .
For technology aspect , a group of Chinese scientists and engineers scarified their holiday and worked every day and night in order to improve the technology of China .
Therefore , many excellent and designed technological outcomes appeared in that period of time .
But now , there are two factors hamper the design process for innovation .
One is the students are lack of the innovative thinking system .
Other one there is no co-operation between scientists and engineers .
From a technological point of view , the way to the future from where we are today is either by creating something new or modifying current technology so that it performs better than the way it previously did .
This is where engineering design process comes into play .
In order to come up with groundbreaking innovations to improve the way we live , engineers need to have a design-oriented mind .
However , coming up with a new ideas and innovations are more often than not , easier said than done .
As a matter in fact , statistically speaking , the number of failed attempts at innovation far exceed the ones which made it into the books .
Nevertheless , the process of learning through failures have significant importance in the engineering design process .
One of the main obstacles in the engineering design process has to be financial constraints .
Many great engineering design ideas were halted cold in their tracks just because the cost to realize them outweighs the benefits that they carry .
For instance , the proposed plan to use nuclear energy in Malaysia never came to be due to the enormous funds that is required to carry out research in the technology and even if the necessary funds are secured , there is always the uncertainty if the research will yield any significant results .
On top of that , researchers and investors have all come to terms with the fact that running and maintaining a practical nuclear reactor in Malaysia will take too long for the technology to break even financially .
It is just not worth the effort .
Apart from that , new engineering design innovations need to be benchmarked against their environmental effects .
Engineers need to be sensitive towards this issue and thus , ensure that the impact of their ideas are minimal towards mother nature .
In the case of a nuclear power plant in Malaysia , the idea is not viable as the country has an abundance of forest reserves which needs to be kept untarnished and preserved the way they are .
Constant exposure to radioactive substances may alter the natural ecosystem of these reserves , causing irreversible damage .
Even in Singapore , all engineering projects have to abide by the Environmental Pollution Control Act before being carried out .
Besides that , in the innovations that engineers have come up with has to be safe for the public to use .
In this case , safety measures need to be put in place before an innovation is unveiled to the public .
This cannot be compromised .
As for the Malaysian power plant , The plant , due to the inadequacy of safe uranium containment as well as the skilled labour to handle them , the project is unable to be carried out .
The incident at Chernobyl , Ukraine serves as a good reminder as to why safety is of utmost importance .
In order to cut production cost , several safety precautions have been removed from the initial blueprint .
On the fateful day of April 26 , 1986 , one of the reactors exploded , consequently causing the area to be inhabitable till this day and instantly claiming 4 lives in the process .
In a nutshell , engineers may have great ideas and innovations .
Unfortunately , not all of them can be realized .
In fact , many of them will not .
However , all is not lost .
With small but useful engineering design ideas being introduced daily , serving as a basis for many bigger innovations , it's only a matter of time before the many obstacles which are holding engineers back collapse .

It can be programmed to kill any cell that causes the disease  .

The world's technology is developing at a fast pace .
Among these new technologies , some of them are developed by research while others are discovered serendipitously , which means they are found by chance instead of studying on purpose .
Take the aspect of electric devices as an example , refrigerator was studied for a long time in the laboratory after people had the desire of reserving things in a cold temperature longer .
On the other hand , the theory of microwave oven was discovered by Percy Spencer by chance .
He noticed that candy in his pocket melted while he was doing another experiment and by using this technology microwave oven was invented .
Comparing these two ways of finding new technology , they have similarities as well as differences .
However , despite of the similarities , they also have differences , which mainly fall in two aspects .
Firstly , refrigerator has a strong purpose in real life before it is invented .
The idea of keeping things frozen to keep them fresh has existed for a long time , so people worked towards this purpose and after trying many times , the technology of refrigerator came out .
As a result , the product will sell well because the aim of the technology is a common desire and meet the demand of the public .
Microwave oven , on the contrary , its function is not known before the theory is discovered and the equipment invented .
Thus , sometimes there will be a risk to produce a large amount of equipment applying the serendipitously discovered technology because the market of this field might not be large since before it is invented , other ways of the similar aim may have already existed .
Secondly , developing the technology of refrigerator in the laboratory needs a long time of work .
Since the idea is brought up , generations of people used various methods to improve the machine and make the technology perfect .
However , the process of finding the technology of microwave oven was by chance and took a very short time , and it might even be ignored if people did not pay attention to the phenomena .
Therefore , developing a technology by research may require more work and developing a technology serendipitously will need more attention to details in daily life .
In conclusion , though differences exist during the processes they are developed , in the aspects of their use and in the marketing potential when the equipment comes out , both kinds of technologies contribute to the development of the society .
In fact , no matter in which way the technology is discovered , as long as it is beneficial to the society , we should appreciate it and enjoy the convenience it brings us .
Do you know that the global worldwide energy consumption was 500 exajoules which is an astounding 5 1020 J ?
Do you also know that 80 to 90 percent of that is obtained from the combustion of fossil fuels ?
As globalization takes place , coupled with an increasing world population , more electrical energy has to be supplied to homes and factories so as to meet the increasing demand .
However , fossil fuels such as coal and crude oil , which is used to produce electricity , will eventually be depleted as they are non-renewable resources .
According to Wikipedia , "Assuming that our rate of usage in 2005 remains constant , we will run out of conventional oil in 40 years and coal in 154 yrs  ."
Hence , the current human need for energy is one need that we must prioritize .
Engineers have therefore started to work on new technologies , such as photovoltaic systems that can convert solar power to electrical energy so as to ease the need .
By definition , solar energy refers to the radiant light and heat from the Sun .
Every year , the Earth absorbs approximately 3 ,850 ,000 exajoules of solar energy .
This amount of energy is almost twice the total amount of energy that can ever be obtained from non-renewable sources .
As a result , many countries in the world are now tapping into this new source of energy .

The process of converting the solar energy to electrical energy is also known as the photovoltaic effect .
First , when sunlight is shone onto the surface of the photovoltaic panels , sunlight in the form of photons will be absorbed by the silicon .
Next , the electrons with higher energy level in the panels will be separated from their atoms and allowed to flow in a single direction due to the special composition of the cells .
Complimentary positive charges that are produced will flow in the opposite direction of the electrons .
Finally , when both positive charges and electrons flow through the silicon photovoltaic cells , electricity is produced . 
To sum up , the most current human need that has to be prioritized is the need for energy .
In the next few decades , the demand for energy will definitely increase exponentially as the world population continues to grow .
Therefore , solar energy being a clean and renewable source of energy will definitely build up its popularity as an uprising source that can be used to produce electricity .
Hence in order to ease current as well as future needs for energy , solar power is one viable source to consider .

Since there are life on the earth ,all the things living depend on the sun .Photosynthesis is the process that green plant turn carbon dioxide and water into carbohydrate .The energy we human need is directly or indirectly come from the photosynthesis .
The petroleum ,coal and gas are the outcome of photosynthesis that the nature gives to us .
Because of the rapid develop of the world ,the energy that nature leave over to us are less and less .This even makes countries begin an energy war .Energy plays a more and more important role .what we desperately need is a kind of resource that can give out high energy and does not do harm to the nature .
Hydrogen energy is this kind of energy .There is only water after it burns and hydrogen contains a lot of heat .So we try hard to invent a machine to make hydrogen energy .
As we know that hydrogen can be made by electrolysing water ,so we need electrical energy .We first convert solar energy into electrical energy .
To achieve this we use plates that are made of semiconductor which can absorb the sun lights .The semiconductor can emit electron after the sun light's stimulate .The whole plates form a battery .So the solar energy have been successfully converted into electrical energy .
After doing this , we will artificial simulate the process of photosynthesis .In this step ,we need to find a highly efficient catalyst to speed up the electrolyzation and make the process to be complete .we let the water into a container and add the catalyst into it ,then take two metal plates into the water and transmit electricity we get before into the water .Finally , we can get the hydrogen gas .

After the two steps ,the hydrogen will replace oil ,coal and gas ,to be the most useful and important energy in our life .
