In the process of developing a new idea into a product , all kinds of expected or unforeseeable troubles will occur , making the path fill with struggles and disappointments .
Although the knowledge and technological breakthroughs we accumulated through ages have premised human a solid foundation for putting our ideas into practice , there still existing many inevitable factors due to the advancing capitalization which deter the process of innovation .
Among all those socially determined resistance on the way of innovation , one fatally significant phenomenon is the unfair competition between monopolies and other less competent companies .
On one hand , monopolies that have sufficient capital to back them up can easily invest large sum of money in fields of designing and testing to increase the capacity and ensure the reliability of their products for more demanding tasks .
Meanwhile the dominancy in market share also allows them to popularize and convert their products to revenue in a short time .
It can be perceived as good in the sense of market selection , but on the other hand , such type of rivalship can easily be abused and transformed into one-sided violation if monopolies use these advantages as weapons against their opponents instead of rising the standard of living for mankind .
One vivid example is Microsoft forced Netscape going into bankruptcy by packing its inferior web browser IE with its dominant windows system for free .
It is also common for monopolies to lower the price in a large scale to annihilate their opponents and rise it up latter .
Ironically , being the ultimate form in organizing capital , monopolies seem to be the major obstruction on the road of innovation , and hundreds of 'Netscapes' have been sacrificed over the years because of their pursuit of greater profit .
Innovation still has a long way to go before it can stand up to these giants .
With so many things to consider about , those managers do have reasons to hesitate before they risk the future of a company for the unguaranteed profit .
They will not start simply because they cannot afford to lose the race .
To sum it up , the rules of this society determine that the process of innovation will depend much more on engineers' creativity .
But as the society changes with time , hopefully we can create a harmonic atmosphere for innovation and provide mankind a higher living standard .
In an age of accelerated obsolescence of information and technology , lots of new inventions and design concepts come out from human's mind every second .
Meantime , the demands rising from the endless pursuing for high-standard breakthroughs have boosted and inspired the human's brain to deepen their potential .
During this new innovation-development revolution in science and technology , engineers no doubt play a vital role to beautify and simplify the whole world .
Just like Roger said: in the context of the innovation-development process , the development of technologies may be viewed from either a technologically determinist perspective or a socially determinist view , also referred to as the social construction of technology .
In addition , numerous breakthroughs are deriving from the audacious imagination .
Reflecting this two innovation technologies , both of it are shaped by a set of factors including the audacious idea and the climate influence etc .
In fact , as a whole , the key factor is still the government policy .
Without Dubai's specific economy transition , there will not be such a mount of fund input .
In conclusion , a new innovation technology is always combined with numerous factors .
In order to make a better life in the future , innovation-development is playing a very important role in our highly developing society .
With the promotion of lives' quality , people require higher and higher criterions .
How to build more convenient and safer facilities ?
How to make less pollution and friendlier environment ?
How to offer better medical treatment and prolong people's lives ?
All these problems are waiting for engineers to solve .
However , due to many factors , there are two types , convention and skunkworks , existing in the process of innovation-development .
The reason why this situation is can be seen from the need of market , the process of research & development , and the product features .
As the first step of innovation-development , the need of market is significantly considered in both two types .
Usually , the determinists of the need of market are defined as technologically determinist and socially determinist .
Although both of them exist in convention and skunkworks , socially determinist takes more than technologically determinist in skunkworks .
This is because that skunkworks is born to solve those very real and urgent problems nevertheless in scarcity of capital .
In contrast , enough capital and technology support are the factors which lead the process of convention .
So convention is more technologically determinist and skunkworks is more socially determinist .
At last , the products of the two , convention and skunkworks , will face to different kinds of consumers .
The products of skunkworks are more practical , and people are in need of those product .
For example , the invention of laptop helped Japanese employee had more space to work .
But for convention , its products are often regarded as the milestone of technology or other purposes .
Like General Motors dedicated $2 billion to designing , manufacturing , and marketing electric vehicles to reposition GM as an innovative company in people's minds , but the ability of those vehicles were much poor  .
In summary , Convention usually has enough capital and technology , large scale and good environment .
These make it operate stably .
By contrast , skunkworks is more efficient and its products are more practical than that of convention .
But it shares higher risk of no outcome due to the shortage of capital and shabby environment .
However , by taking every point into consideration , both of them can work well in innovation-development , depending on different situation .
Engineers are trained to solve problem and design products to fulfill human needs .
Overcoming a problem requires time and repeating trial to make sure that the product is safe to use and works efficiently .
Products that are designed should be able to suit daily usage .
As turning ideas into virtual products takes an engineer a lot of effort , an engineer should carefully define the problem that occurs in human life and thereafter starts to generate the problem and solve it .
One of the current human needs is to find an environmental friendly vehicle as a substitute for the gasoline vehicle .
Air pollution nowadays has become a serious issue all around the world .
Some countries which are severely affected by air pollution could not even have a clear vision during day time .
According to Gulfnews .com eq \o\ac , more than 75 per cent of air pollution is emitted from vehicles .
Exhaust fumes are bad for human health and will contribute to air pollution .
Thus , an environmental friendly vehicle needs to be created and should be given priority for this creation to save our earth from pollution and to lessen the impact of the air pollution .
Electric generated vehicle can be designed to overcome the air pollution problem .
Electric generated vehicle will not exhaust gases when it is being driven .
On the other hand , it also does not need gasoline as generating material .
This means that mining process for gasoline might also be lesser and therefore the air pollution problem will be less serious .
It is because mining and refining processes of the petroleum will emit fumes that will pollute the air .
To build an electric generated vehicle that can have longer lasting battery power and powerful pickup , it should have a special battery , light weight material and well designed shape .
The battery of the vehicle must be able to recharge within short hours .
It should also be able to store higher amount of energy in order to last for longer period of time .
On the other hand , building the vehicle with light weight material , such as aluminium can conserve energy .
Furthermore , having an aerodynamically styled shape , the vehicle can move faster and has a powerful pickup .
The electric generated vehicle should be fully tested and examined .
It is an important process to make sure that the product is safe to be used .
Test drive for the successful electric generated vehicle can open to public and ask for feedback from them and make improvements for it .
After that the electric generated vehicle can be introduced to the market throughout the world .
In conclusion , the creation of electric generated vehicle can reduce air pollution problem that is becoming more and more serious nowadays .
It has to be created to fulfil the world's need nowadays so that our future generation has a healthier earth to live in .

Picture a scenario in mind: a man sitting in front of a computer is busy using email , eBay , online banking , and teleconferencing .
This is ecommerce , which consists of the buying and selling of products or services over electronic systems such as the Internet and other computer networks .
CITATION wik09 \l 2052 Thanks to this burgeoning technology , people can almost fulfil all their needs without moving a step .
With the initial to achieve a more convenient human life , ecommerce is considered to be socially determined rather than technologically determined .
To specify , the formation and development of this technology is mainly contributed by three factors: public's needs , economic consideration , and government regulation .
Basically , the origin of ecommerce is due to public's desire to facilitate their life and work .
Tracing back to the late 1970s , Electronic Data Interchange and Electronic Funds Transfer first emerged in the US to satisfy people's needs for simple business communication .
CITATION Ken08 \l 2052 These were the very first types of ecommerce .
Later on , as the rapid spread of internet , the utility of this technology quickly varied and extended to global scope .
The most popular usage is online shopping .
Because of the increasingly heavy workload , people are sick of stepping out of home and shopping .
This concern soon results in the appearance of online store .
In 1995 , both eBay and Amazon launched and quickly grew to become the biggest online retailers .
CITATION Jul08 \l 2052 Till now , people can nearly do whatever they want simply by clicking the web browser .
During the speedy development of ecommerce , corporations realize the potential to gain huge interest and participate to shape the direction of ecommerce's growth .
Comparing with the traditional selling styles , ecommerce manages to broaden the market as well as obtain a cheaper but more efficient publicity .
For example , originally the retail stores most probably sell products only within the city since they can hardly afford to publicize in a larger area .
Thanks to the technology of ecommerce , these shops can now do publicity to a much larger target group .
By the same time , the online banking system also facilitates the procedure to make deals .
Besides these two factors , government regulation also contributes to shaping this technology .
In the 1990s , as a result of the rising development of ecommerce , the usage of this technology gradually became out of control .
The public's privacy and security was seriously threatened .
In order to solve these problems , Federal Trade Commission established FTC Act in the US .
Similarly , the related governmental agency in other countries also established such rules to maintain the situation .
Directed by public's requirement , enterprises' intention , and government regulation , ecommerce is now still developing .
Undoubtedly , this is not the end of its growth .
If continuing the efforts of these three aspects , we have confidence this technology will sooner or later develop to a certain stage which satisfies the whole society .
Engineering design , also known as innovations , are created by people to make the world a better place to live in .
However , innovations do not come easy .
It has to go through a five step process before coming out with the final product .
The steps named in order are identifying the problem , gathering of information pertaining to the problem , generating of solutions , analyzing and testing the solutions and implementing of the solution .
In Singapore , there are some problems which hamper certain stages of the design process .
First , the attitude of Singaporeans makes them reluctant to change .
Singaporeans live in the comfort of their own homes believing that all the things that can be invented are already made .
Everyone is just waiting for someone to discover new things .
With attitudes like that , it is not possible for Singaporeans to innovate .
Moreover , Singaporeans accept things too easily .
They lack the motivation to create new things .
Such frame of mind hinders the progression of innovation .
Singaporeans are afraid to try out new things and they are also afraid of failure .
Innovation requires perseverance , the ability to accept failure and motivation .
These are a few traits that are hardly seen in the Singaporeans .
On top of this , the education system in Singapore does not emphasise on creativity .
Students are always 'spoon-fed' by the teachers .
As a consequence , they are instilled with a 'sit back and wait' state of mind from young .
Clearly , the lack of creativity and the passive attitude of Singaporeans have hindered the first stage of the engineering design process .
Second , the social systems in Singapore are also affecting the generation of solutions in the design process .
As Singapore is a country based on meritocracy , companies are more concerned about their profits , and hence are reluctant to risk on innovation .
In addition , the society is unable to accept new things which are out of the norm consequently , inventions which are different will not be accepted by the public .
Besides , there are so many areas to consider during the design process .
For example , a new product not only has to be aesthetically pleasing to the public , it also has to be safe for usage and most importantly being able to make profits for the company .
Thus , issues will arise at the stage of generating solutions .
Doing one thing may improve on an aspect but at the same time , it may also compromise the quality of another area .
As a result , it is very difficult to attain a balance among all the areas .
Unless a balance among the areas could be achieved , the design process will not be able to continue , as possible solutions could not be created .
Indeed , the social systems in Singapore have significantly affected the third stage of the design process .
In conclusion , the design process is demanding and tedious .
There are certain stages of the process to complete before being able to come up with a feasible solution .
However , there are problems faced during the process .
The two major problems in Singapore are the attitude and the social systems .
The passive attitude results in people being unable to identify existing problems , which is the very first phase of the design process .
Furthermore , the social systems set strict standards for new products .
This significantly affects the third stage of design process which is the generation of solutions .
Therefore , only by overcoming the two major problems , Singaporeans will then be able to create and innovate .
The year is 1969 .
Man has finally conquered the Moon .
Television screens all over the world showed replays after replays of this history making moment .
No longer was planned space exploration an unreachable frontier possible only in the restricted realms of science fiction .
Fast-forward forty years after Neil Armstrong has become the first man to land on the Moon , the question remains: Can a nation like Singapore pursue a grand dream such as space exploration ?
There lie two major hurdles , the small population size and the lack of natural resources , to engineering design process in Singapore .
Singapore is a minute city-state situated in the tropics of South East Asia .
The republic today is a thriving metropolis where slightly less than five million people call home .
This estimate , taken from Singapore's government population survey reports in 2008 , placed the republic modestly as the one hundred and fifteenth most populous nation globally .
Besides small population size , Singapore also does not have any natural resources to boast about .
The republic's physical landmass of approximated seven hundred and five kilometres squared is ranked one hundred and eighty- seventh internationally .
Unsurprisingly , the scarce land does not yield precious metals nor is it a treasure trove containing prized fossil fuel .
The above-mentioned problems will have severe ramifications on the engineering design process .
Singapore's small population size affects the initial two stages as well as the final testing stage of the engineering design process .
Firstly , a small population would mean that most problems encountered by small groups in Singapore would often be overlooked .
For a similar situation overseas , the problems are likely to draw more attention .
This is due to the fact that for a seemingly insignificant proportion of people who require specifically designed solutions , it is quite a sizeable amount in absolute terms in countries with larger human concentration .
This situation would be problematic during the definition of problem stage of engineering design process .
In addition , even if there were potential solutions , it would be a tough task to carry out experimentation or trials , either as a mean to gather data or to implement a solution , simply because a local test group might not exists .
This was illustrated in the report "A chair that's music to deaf ears" where a research team was unable to find a test group for a chair for the deaf they designed and had to look overseas .
The non-existence of natural resources is another concern .
Specifically , resources can be divided into raw materials , land , wealth and labour of which the first two , a nation like Singapore clearly lacks .
This deficient in raw materials and useable land as well as to a lesser extent , wealth and labour , limits the magnitude on the engineering solutions to be pursued .
The space race cost the United States an estimated twenty-five billion dollars in ninety-sixties terms .
Such an enormous amount would be several annum of Singapore's gross domestic product in the current economic climate .
The scarce land space further adds to the problem .
In conclusion , Singapore's unique size and state of available resource are obstacles in the engineering design process .
The ability to work with such constraints will greatly influence the outcome of future engineering endeavours .
Title : Two Problems that Significantly Hamper Engineering Design Processes For Innovations and Their Effects .
Who are the designers of all the inventions in this world ?
Well , obviously they are engineers .
"Scientists dream about doing great things .
Engineers do them ."
This is a famous quote by James A . Michener .
Engineers are people who investigate problems and try to solve them .
Gadgets and machines were invented to solve our daily problems .
However , some obstacles may obstruct the innovative engineering design processes .
Identifying these obstacles and their effects may help to prevent rejection of inventions in the future .
The educational system in Malaysia is exam orientated .
The educational system is based more towards theory and not practical .
Students spend most of their time in the classroom learning theory .
The amount of time spent in lab for practical is minimal .
The system is giving emphasis on memory skills , not analytical skills .
Furthermore , school teachers merely teach students to pass their exams , but not for the students to learn .
Primary and secondary school students are spoon fed with information rather than letting them learning independently .
Students are taught and train to score in public examinations such as Penilaian Menengah Rendah and Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia  .
Eventually , students with good memory will be able to pass with flying colours as they are able to memorise all the facts and spit them all out during the exams .
These excellent students will face problems as they further their studies to be engineers .
They lack of analytical skills , creativity and innovation .
These are the two factors that will cease engineers from being able to solve real life problems .
It is human's nature to response to incentives .
Incentives could be in the form of money or moral support .
Society does not show an encouraging attitude towards innovation .
Society is afraid to accept new invention .
This causes engineers to be demotivated .
In conjunction to this , companies are not willing to take risks to fund the research and development of engineers .
For example , Tetsuya Mizoguchi , a brilliant engineer who envisioned and invented the laptop .
He idea was rejected by Toshiba fearing that it will not be successful  .
This scenario is common and it is preventing engineers from doing research and development for a given problem .
Research and development is almost impossible without funding .
Thus , engineers are not capable to come up with solution to problems although they have brilliant ideas .
In conclusion , our current educational system is too rigid .
It should focus more on practical applications rather than theory .
Students must be exposed to new problems related to current issues and be able to propose solutions to the problem .
In addition , the solutions must be practical and appropriate to be accepted by society .
Nevertheless , society should be open to fresh ideas .
Positive feedback from society will stimulate passion and desire for engineers to contribute with what they do best , inventing .

Since the birth of car at the end of last century , its development has gone through ups and downs over the last one hundred years .
The first car invented by Carl .
Zaochu Benz at that time only had a speed of 18Km per hour , but now , a sport car can accelerate from zero speed to 100Km per hour within 3 seconds .
We can see that the speed of development of cars is very amazing .
But what actually made the car industry develop so fast ?
The car industry' development cannot be separated from the adoption of car by the people .
Only the customers' demand can stimulate the enhancement of the car industry .
So again , what is the factors influence the adoption of car ?
In conclusion , the adoption of car and this technological innovation was not only technological determined , but also shaped by economic factors , military demands , and government policies and priorities .
Two problems hamper engineering design processes for innovations in China and their effects .
An engineering design process , which includes mainly five stages-defining the problem , gathering pertinent information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting a solution and testing and implementing the solution , plays a very important role in improving the quality of people's life .
In our daily life , we can easily identify automobiles , laptops , handphones and microwaves as engineering innovations around us .
Take China for instance , the culture for innovation in engineering design is severely lacked .
One factor would be China's rigid education system that produces only a small number of innovative engineers .
It does not help either that the Chinese government is giving very little incentives for innovations in engineering .
As a result , engineers have little motivation to innovate .
Even they have the motivation , their ideas are unlike to come true due to lack of funding from the government .
One of the problems that hampers innovations in engineering may be China's rigid education system which discourages students from being creative .
In China , most teachers spoon-feed their students , and students are instructed to follow standard answers given by the teachers .
When a student finds out an alternative method of solving a problem , there is usually no reward for him and he still has to answer the question in the standard way to avoid losing marks in examinations .
Thus innovation among students is discouraged .
Moreover , students have very little hands-on practice of what they have learnt in class .
Instead , most of their time is spent on solving sample examination problems .
As a result , China's education system produces engineers that are generally weak in doing research and development , which will adversely affect the stage of generating multiple solutions in the engineering design process .
Another problem that poses obstacles to innovation in engineering in China may be the lack of funds from the government for research and development  , thus engineers are hardly attracted to R&D industry and they lack of funds to implement their new ideas .
Furthermore , the government gives very little reward to engineers who have done innovative work .
Mr . Yuan Long Ping , who is known as the "Father of Hybrid Rice" , had contributed to tremendous increase in the level of world's rice output through cultivating species of hybrid rice during 1970s .
His innovation has saved millions of people from hunger all over the world .
However , the Chinese government only awarded him the State Preeminent Science and Technology Award of China in 2000 which valued merely 5 million yuan .
This was very little if it was meant to reward him for his more than twenty years' hard work .
This lack of government support means , engineers will not able to get resources , raw materials , precise equipment for research during engineering design process .
Thus the stage of testing and implementing solutions during engineering design is greatly hampered
In conclusion , rigid education system and government's very little incentives to innovations limit the number of innovative engineers and hinder the realization of innovative ideas if any .
They are hence the two prominent obstacles that hamper the engineering design processes for innovations in China .

In many companies , brilliant and capable engineers were often denied the opportunity to express their ideas through innovation .
Engineers in the past were innovative and a vast amount of creative ideas were generated to improve the technology .
However , many of these ideas were rejected by the corporate leaders of various companies .
The leaders were not risk-takers and reflected the ideas to be non-profitable to the company .
Passionate engineers ventured 'in the dark' and started a skunk works project as they were unable to gain their superiors supports .
There are many defining features of a conventionally generated technology with those of a comparable innovation that was created in a skunk works environment .
Skunk works projects do not have access to the full resources of the company , have their own rules and have to maintain confidential about their projects .
Skunk works projects have their limitations in terms of resources .
The project is helmed by the project managers and all problems , including technical and administrative , will be handled by them .
The research funds and human resources were not made available to them .
Therefore the project managers will have to find their own financial support to fund their projects .
The construction of the team will not be easy as the choices are limited .
The more capable engineers were already involved with other projects and there can be no way to transfer out without the knowledge of the superiors .
On the other hand , conventional projects have a huge backing from the corporate level .
All administrative issues will be settled in a much shorter time to allow the project to begin earlier .
Also , capable engineers will be assigned to the new project , depending on its priority .
Skunk works projects aim is to develop the innovation .
Hence the rules of the company need not to be enforced in their secret working environment .
Project managers will set the rules for those personnel involved .
There had been extreme examples of rules set by project managers where both emerged successful in their innovations .
In contrast , conventional project personnel have to follow the strict rules of the company .
An image has to be maintained .
Smart dress codes are to be adhered to at all times and working hours should be fully utilized in the company's interest .
The engineers often follow a monotonous lifestyle .
Skunk works projects are secret projects not to be revealed to anyone .
Personnel will have to maintain double life for this project .
No discussions on the project are to be made .
Personnel often have to stay back late after office hours to work on their secret projects and no claim of overtime are allowed .
Since they are involved in a secret project , no rewards will be guaranteed .
On the contrary , conventional projects engineers take pride in their work .
Special privileges were often granted to those involved in high-profiled projects .
There will also be media coverage and time to time update on their projects .
Engineers working for conventional projects are more at ease with their jobs .
However they faced equal stress on their projects .
They will have to follow their company rules while their leaders support them financially .
Skunk work projects do not have the backing of their leaders , resulting in secrecy and extra work .
Engineers must be highly motivated and passionate to achieve results .
Therefore conventional projects and skunk works projects are different in nature .
However an engineer can be successful as long as he is highly motivated , passionate and diligent .
Two problems that may hamper engineering design processes for innovations in my home country .
In the real world , there are countless problems waiting and engineers are often the ones to take up this challenge as they strive towards finding the best solution through innovating new products .
An engineer tackles problems by first detecting the problem before carrying out the necessary research .
After which , engineers would then start developing their products and subsequently proceed to commercialize it .
It is necessary to recognize that the entire process is fraught with numerous difficulties which could impede an engineer's creativity .
These problems should be identified and rectified in order to prevent the emergence of additional problems .
As mentioned , the development of an intended product is part of the engineering design processes .
For these two processes , an engineer needs to be able to think out of the box .
One possible factor that might hamper such creativity is our educational system .
Singapore's education system has been structured in such a way that it is rigid and text based and does not teach students to apply what is taught .
There is so much to learn in the syllabus and yet so little time .
Hence , we see chunks of lessons squeezed into packed timetables .
The time needed to fully understand the concepts are usually not enough .
Therefore , many students eventually end up merely memorizing and going through the motion instead of thinking of different ways to apply the knowledge learnt to the real world .
Furthermore , the choice of subjects is very limited and the subjects are mostly of the same nature .
For creativity to be induced , it is important to be exposed to knowledge from various different aspects .
Another portion of the design processes involve commercialization .
For a new product or technology to be successful , it is required to be accepted by the public .
Therefore , the society is a big deciding factor for the success or failure of the product launched .
Sadly , society as a whole are generally not that receptive of new ideas and innovative products .
This is a potential problem which would hamper engineering design processes .
Humans in general , like to stay within their comfort zone and is often unwilling to accept new ideas or changes in their lifestyle .
The new product needs to be widely accepted so that it will be profitable .
Hence , an unreceptive society is not going to generate enough profits to enable the product to be sustainable .
Without profits , engineers will not be able or motivated to continue research and development necessary to improve the products as it is simply not worth it to do so anymore .
An example would be the case of the refrigerator .
Refrigerators currently common in the market are electric refrigerators , which generally produce a "humming" sound .
A soundless refrigerator was in fact produced in 1930 .
However , during that time , large investments went channeled into the research and development of electric refrigerators .
Furthermore , electric refrigerators were more aggressively advertised for .
All these factors led to the downfall of the soundless refrigerator .
In sum , a society which is less receptive of new ideas and innovative products could lead to the hampering of engineering processes for innovation .
In conclusion , there are several factors that play a part in the success of innovative engineering processes .
It is necessary for engineers to exhibit a high level of creativeness .
Moreover , for a new product to succeed in the market , it has to be accepted by the society as they are the ones purchasing the products and making them profitable .
Two problems are identified which might hamper creativeness in engineers .
Although measures that tackle these problems might have already been introduced , we have yet to witness the effectiveness of these measures .

Rogers , E . M .  .
The generation of innovations .
In Diffusion of innovations  .
New York: Free Press .
Despite of the poor environment , tough stress , and high risk , skunkworks indeed value more than conventional technology .
To some extent , conventionally generated technology usually improves our life , but innovation in skunkworks often changes our life .
Skunkworks , defined to pioneer the development of a technological innovation , normally has a tougher working conditions .
Usually skunkworks cannot get enough support to create a satisfied working environment .
Due to the uncertainty , R&D group in skunkworks often cannot find enough people to conduct the innovation .
Without initial capital and sufficient crew , the developing process has no way to start .
In addition , it is a fairly stressful job because of the limitation of time and the finance .
Just like the team of design Macintosh , they were working day and night under the aggressive leadership of Steven Jobs .
By contrast , conventional technologies have well organized systems that can ensure the progress of work .
Seldom do they have a stressful workload .
The starting points of innovation in skunkworks and conventional technology are different .
Innovation in skunkworks is made for solving the potential problems or needs of life .
However , Conventional is made for solving the existed problems or needs .
When NOKIA upgraded its N series hand phone annually , iPhone of the Apple company surprise the world , because it give a different definition of touching the phone .
The success of innovation is generally much more considerable than conventional technology .
To sum up , skunkworks usually has a tough environment and a stressful workload .
Furthermore , it is often at a high risk for investing in skunkworks .
However , for the desire of changing the way of how people live , and also for the considerable benefits for companies and human life , innovation in skunkworks plays a more vital role than the conventionally generated technology .
Compressed Natural Gas vehicle is an alternative fuel vehicle .
Instead of using fossil fuels such as gasoline or diesel , it uses compressed natural gas which consists of mainly methane as the fuel of a vehicle .
By 2008 , there are roughly 7 millions of CNG vehicles on the roads worldwide .
The development of CNG vehicle can be viewed as a socially determined technology , because of the influences of environmental , economic factors and government regulations on its development .
Firstly , the development of CNG vehicle is determined by the environmental factor .
Unlike the normal gasoline vehicle which emits greenhouse and harmful gases , the power of CNG vehicle can emit 70% lesser CO2 and little harmful gas .
Therefore CNG vehicle is more environmental friendly than gasoline vehicle .
In the context of global warming becoming more and more serious , the development of such environmental friendly vehicles becomes a must .
Many automobile manufacturers conducted a lot of research , development and innovations for a number of years using CNG as a fuel source for vehicles .
CNG equipment manufacturers have invested in research and development to improve this technology and make it convenient and available for consumers globally  .
Apart from reducing the air pollution , Natural gas vehicle also produces lower noise levels than gasoline vehicle .
This is another positive feature of CNG vehicle .
The greater use of CNG vehicles for public transportation will result in a quieter urban environment , which will be a plus for our living environment .
Thus , it is the environmental factor that spurred the development of CNG vehicle .
In recent years , with its growing prosper and affluence , China is investing more on science and technology development .
However , the lack of research funding and an inflexible education system , in my opinion , has significantly hampered engineering design process in China .
First of all , lack of research funding has significantly hindered the development of many engineering design projects in China .
In China , innovation in science and technology is mostly driven by the state , rather than by the grass roots .
In contrast with some developed countries , the spending in R&D in China is obviously not as abundant .
Statistics shows that R&D spending takes up 3 .2 percent of GDP in US and 2 .9 percent in Singapore .
However , it is only 1 .4 percent in China .
Also , a large proportion of the R&D funding goes to the state-owned military and defense technology cooperation , leaving even less for the rest of the R&D programmes .
The lack of funding gives rise to dissatisfactory research conditions and also implies that many of the engineering design projects may meet either construction or operating budget crunches long before any productive work can be done .
Thus insufficient funding is a prominent factor that hampers engineering design process in China .
On top of that , an inflexible education system in China has also hampered its engineering design process .
In order to come out with a new product , the engineers must be able to think out of the box and possess practical skills .
However , the education system in China does not train the student to think creatively and provide few chances for the students to put what they learn into practice .
The education in China is very much exam-oriented .
The students study hard in order to excel in exams .
The only aim of the students seems to be doing well in the university entrance examination and being enrolled into renowned universities .
In the so-called cramming method of teaching , teachers paid particular attention to memorization , even at the cost of comprehension .
During the examination , the students were not evaluated by how much they memorize , but not on how they think .
Such a rigid education system has significantly hindered students' creativity and poorly equipped them to apply knowledge in the real world .
In conclusion , the lack of research funding and exam-oriented education system is the two most significant factors which have hampered engineering design process in China .
However , in its eleventh Five-Year Plan , the Chinese government has promised to increase the R&D spending to 2 .5 percent of GDP by the end of 2010 .
Also , the education system in well developed cities such as Beijing and Shanghai is under restructure to better prepare the younger generation to compete in the globalized world .
Thus , the condition of engineering design in China may have a more positive outlook in the future .
Nowadays , we have entered an age of technology .
It seems that technology is everywhere around us , and it has a great impact on our lives .
Therefore , it is beneficial for us to learn more about innovation and technology .
In general , technology can be divided into two types .
One kind of technology is conducted via research .
For example , in 1970s , a new tomato variety was launched by a research team in California .
This tomato variety could be harvested by machine , which was a big success .
The other one is discovered by serenity , and an example of it is the discovery of Warfarin , the effective rat killer .
These two examples both have their own features , since they belong to either type of technology respectively .
In my opinion , the innovation of mechanized tomato and Warfarin technology differ in their start , process and key to success .
The hard tomato program and the discovery of Warfarin started differently .
The program of hard tomato varieties began with an idea .
A California agriculture professor foresaw a future labor shortage in California and came up with a rough idea of tomatoes that could be picked by machine .
Then , he proposed this idea to his institution and got the research started .
However , the discovery of Warfarin happened during another research .
Prof Link , the discoverer of Warfarin , was involved in a research of sweet clove disease at that time .
After about ten years' research , he discovered Warfarin one day in an unrelated experiment , which turned out to be the most impressive progress in the whole research .
The big profit made by the patent was used to support other research projects of Madison professors , provide financial aid to doctoral students and cover other research expenses .
Moreover , the progresses of the two technologies are not alike .
The hard tomato program followed a whole procedure of research works .
A group of scientists were gathered together in an institution .
They were supposed to use the scientific approach to solve various unexpected problems occurring in the research .
In the process , development was extremely important .
Not only should the scientists figure out how to breed the variety , but also they needed to do other non-research works in order to successfully put the variety into practice .
They also cared about the commercialization part .
All of these included building a prototype of the machine used to pick the tomatoes , contacting producers who were willing to sell their products , making their research results known to the local farmers and collecting their feedbacks to improve .
Finally , they came up with their research results after many years' research , in due time according to their plan .
In contrast , in the case of Warfarin , the process was a reversed one .
The product came out first accidentally , followed up with some research to get a better understanding of the discovery .
Warfarin was put into practice directly after it , because its use was totally known when discovering it .
The whole process was highly effective and by chance .
No one expected it before head .
Besides , although both these two technology were successful , the keys to their success are different .
As the hard tomato program was a research project conducted by a group of people , I think the success was mainly due to teamwork and cooperation of the whole group .
On the contrary , the key to success in Warfarin lies on Prof Link , who discovered the chemical .
In conclusion , the mechanized tomato program has different start , process and key to success from the discovery of Warfarin .
Technology is progressing every day , and different products are created following these new technologies .
Our life become more convenient with these technological products and companies can benefit from producing these products .
However , not all the technological products can bring profit to their companies .
Before manufacturing a product , companies have to evaluate its profitability and denied those products with an uncertain future .
Engineers who are enthusiastic with these "no future" products form a group to work out the products , and this kind of groups are called "Skunk works" .
Conventionally generated technologies and technologies in "Skunk works" are of great difference while they still have features in common .
Technology in "Skunk works" is like a double-side sword , which not only can become a great success but also can be a super failure in future .
Working in a "Skunk works" environment is much tougher than in a conventional way , engineers working in "Skunk works" would not be rewarded unless their work turn out to be a success .
Nevertheless , both of "Skunk works" technology and conventional technology make contribution to technology development .
Comparing to conventional generated technology , "Skunk works" has a great possibility to become a big failure , while it also has a potential to be successful .
It is comfortable for engineers to make technology work and to optimize a design under given condition .
Whereas , a well optimized design is worthless if it cannot meet the desires , or at least needs , of the customers .
Therefore , on one hand , without sufficient market research , "Skunk works" is faced with a high potential to be a failure .
On the other hand , a talent "Skunk works" can also be a success in market .
Like E .M . Rogers mentioned in his article -"the Birth of the Laptop Computer at Toshiba" , laptop is a good example of successful "Skunk works" .
On the contrary , conventional generated technology is much safer than "Skunk works" , it can bring steady profit to its company , but , to most companies , playing safe is not enough to compete with their competitors .
"Skunk works" and conventional projects are different , but both of them are making contribution to the development of technology .
Conventional generated technologies are closely connected to our life .
By doing sufficient market research , technologies are controlled to provide things that can fulfill our desires , and these technologies make our life become more and more convenient .
"Skunk works" care more about technology itself , and its aim is to produce the most advanced and optimized designs .
Therefore , "Skunk works" can promote the innovation of technology , and it also provides a big platform for creative engineers .
With the largest population and adequate natural resources , China has developed quite well .
However , nowadays new technology is playing a more and more important role in the whole society and replacing the importance of resources .
However , there are two significant problems in China restricting the development of the technology .
One of them is that the intellectual property rights in China are not protected well there are many illegal copy phenomena in China .
The other problem is that the normal employees in many companies are not valued much by the employers .
Normal employees are not inspirited also limits the innovation in technology .
There is no doubt that China has developed fast and well since the foundation of the country .
However , when we change our focus on the enterprises in China , we will find that most of the huge enterprises are public and relied on resources and monopoly .
Huge enterprises which relied on high technology are very few .
One of the reasons is that normal employees are not inspirited to take part in the innovation .
In many companies , only some certain research staffs take part in the innovation of technology while normal employees just do their routine work .
Compared to professional research staffs , normal employees have more experience about certain productions .
As the employers do not show much respect to normal employees , few employees will try their best to provide their experience to research staffs .
Without practical experience , research and innovation are difficult to achieve .
We probably know that IBM employers value every employee in the company .
Many employees have a chance to put up a suggestion to the company .
With the large amounts of outcomes of experience and observation , research staffs can achieve new production relatively more easily .
Therefore , that normal employees are not inspirited restricts the innovation of technology in China .
As the pace of society quickens , people around the world are faced with an increasing number of problems .
These problems could be man-made or naturally occurring .
Regardless of the cause , people have realized there is a need to find a way to solve these problems and improve their way of life .
This is where engineering design process plays an important role .
This process involves the identifying of the problem , gathering relevant information , generating multiple solutions , analyzing and selecting the most appropriate and feasible solution and finally , testing and implementing the solution in the real world .
However , not everything is smooth sailing , and there are problems that may hamper the engineering design process .
In Singapore , one of the problems that engineers might face during the engineering design process is that Singapore's education system is rigid .
Due to the inflexibility of the education system , Singaporeans have grown up getting used to rote learning .
This means they memorise formulae and information from the texts without really understanding , questioning and analyzing what they are studying .
This leads them to not being able to think out of the box and thinking of creative or alternative solutions other than those provided by the teaching system in Singapore .
Firstly , they would have trouble identifying problems in the real world .
The education system in Singapore works in such a way that the boundaries of problems are defined clearly .
There is usually a fixed method as to how a question is answered .
However , in reality , problems are not clearly seen and observation skills are needed to identify causes and sources of problems .
Engineers might also find it difficult to think of various approaches to tackle the problem , and also to use analytical skills to decide on the best method to solve the problem .
Secondly , as the information needed to solve questions and problems in school is already provided in textbooks and notes , engineers have not honed their skills of doing research for relevant information .
Thus , they might encounter trouble in gathering relevant information needed to solve the problem they may face .
Another major problem that engineers might face in Singapore is that people are less receptive to innovations and ideas as compared to the Western countries .
The older generation is especially resistant to change , and would rather use products that they are used to .
Thus , despite the presence of new innovations that would greatly improve their way of life , they might not be so accepting of these new products .
This would affect the testing and implementation of the solution during the process .
When surveying the feasibility of the solution , results would not be accurate as the target group of an older age would generally be less supportive towards the new idea .
If the customer base for the new innovation is too small , investors will be less willing to provide funds to fund research and development of new innovations and products , therefore affecting the whole design process .
In conclusion , it is inevitable that there will be problems that might affect the various stages of the design process .
However , measures have definitely been taken to tackle these problems .
For example , the education system now has definitely improved in terms of its rigidity .
Since 2005 , Ministry of Education has introduced Project Work to junior colleges in order to improve communicative skills of students , as well as to encourage building of teamwork among students .
Hopefully in the near future , more effort will be put in to encourage society to be more accepting of new innovations that would greatly change their way of life for the better , and also to implement in not just aspiring engineers but students in general , skills that they are able to use and apply in handling problems in the real world .

Rapid industrialization is one of the main economic boosters that characterize today's society .
Singapore is a good example of such a society .
Since the 1960s , there was a paradigm shift from the low end industrialization to a high end industrialization thus resulting in a rapid depletion of the already scarce resources .
Land scarcity is one of the pressing human needs that may require immediate attention .
Engineering design processes are therefore created to meet the above mentioned human need .
One of the final processes is to analyse and select a solution .
According to Khandani , Ergonomics is crucial in the designing process because production of final products must not result in disaster .
For example , the construction of Nicole Highway initially resulted in injuries but after detailed analysis made by relevant experts , the final product is on its way to completion without casualty .
Construction of sky scrapers is relatively safe despite its height due to deep analytical insights in the construction of these buildings .
As a result , the final products serve its purpose without imposing damage to the surroundings .
In conclusion , engineering design processes are generic as they can cater to all possible problems and help to benefit mankind greatly .
Land scarcity is a good example of the applications of all these processes .
The naissance of all the greatest technologies and discoveries always have two different scenarios .
One is via research and the other is the result from some serendipitous discovery .
But history shows us sometimes the fates of the two kinds of technologies birthed in different ways are also not the same .
The "designs" are thought highly by people at the beginning , though the importance of the "accidents" is realized much later .
Actually the major cases of engineering inventions coincide with the "design" way .
Many great technologies can be successfully designed should owning to people persistent effect , countless experiment plenty of precise analysis and a mass of sources .
Though it's may just a matter of few second's time for the final success of a new technology development , the process from its infancy to maturity can be very long and tough .
With the coming out of a technology people will , of course , show their high concern on it , because it already cost a lot .
Take the atomic weapon test as an example , decades years ago the military of USA intent to make use of the power of atomic , they employed a lot human and non-human sources to complete numerous experiment and test , plenty of money was spent to invite talented scientists and engineers to come to help them make the most powerful weapon all through the human's history .
According to the information from Wikipedia "The Manhattan Project cost 2 billion dollar , this includes the cost of the two bombs used as well as the test bomb .
This would be about 23 billion US dollars today .
The development and production of the delivery device cost more than the Manhattan Project ."
Then US treated this new technology as their most precious weapon , of course it was deserved .
Compared to the development of atomic bomb , the discovery of gunpowder is just an accident or something unexpectable that no one plans to make it realize before it really happen .
In my opinion , this must be very crucial to explain why nobody attaches importance to this new technology at first .
That's to say , though , technologies like that may somehow change the world , it is not in people's contemplation , time is needed for people to realize the existence of them and learn more about them .

Meanwhile , the up-going oil price also indicates an undoubting truth that we are facing a tough challenge , energy crisis .
According to oxford English dictionary  , engineering is defined as the "science , discipline , art and profession of acquiring and applying technical , scientific and mathematical knowledge to design and implement materials , structures , machines , devices , systems , and {processes} that safely realize a desired objective or inventions ."
Overwhelmed by the demand of energy , to increase the energy efficiency should be viewed as the priority of the desired objective or inventions of engineering design .
Toshiba's laptop and Microsoft's operating systems are two technologies that are created under different conditions and environment .
Toshiba's laptop is often known as a skunk work innovation whereas Microsoft's , as a conventionally created product .
The key difference in these two products is the support they received during the creation process .
However , both are known to be successful creations .
The first difference is the lack of support for the creation of Toshiba's laptop as compared to Microsoft's operating system .
According to Rogers , due to the fact that Toshiba's laptop creator Tetsuya Mizoguchi failed to convince his superiors in Toshiba to support his laptop project , he was not able to receive any research and development funds .
The funds would have been useful to help him cover the cost of production .
Furthermore , his superiors refused to assign experienced engineers to aid him . 
* {http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/United_States_Microsoft_antitrust_case}
In comparison , although Bill Gates himself is the boss of Microsoft , he received much external support .
In January 1975 , the president of Micro Instrumentation and Telemetry Systems agreed to let Gates and his partner to develop a program for MITS new microcomputer .
It would be useless if there is no hardware for Gates' program to work on .
With this , he went on to create new programs with the support of his entire team at Microsoft . 
The vision of these two innovators also differs .
Bill Gates' way of running the business is largely monopolistic .
According the article  , Gates actually wrote to computer hobbyist demanding that they pay for the usage of his program so as to allow him to continue to write quality programs .
In May 1998 , Microsoft is accused of abusing its monopoly power to keep rivals out of the market .
Its operating system is believed to favour Microsoft's web browser and not other competing browsers like the Netscape Navigator and Opera . 
On the other hand , Mizoguchi idea was to create a laptop that is compatible with IBM's platform despite the fact that they were competing for the same market share .
He recognised that IBM is dominant at the time and it would be fair to the consumers to allow them to use IBM compatible peripheral Toshiba's laptop .
If Mizoguchi had done otherwise , we would probably have to buy only Toshiba's laptop for its convenience .
Despite the difference in both technologies , there is actually one similarity between them .
That is , both are largely successful .
Mizoguchi , with his perseverance and determination , finally sold the highly demanded laptops in Europe .
By 1988 , Toshiba commanded almost half the market share in Japan , despite the fact that there were many competitors . 
Similarly for Microsoft , Gates rode on the success of IBM's personal computer by becoming the full owner for a program that was written especially for IBM's personal computer .
The program was then sold to IBM , without the copyright .
This had allowed them to be a monopoly in the industry .
In conclusion , despite the fact that both skunk work and conventionally created technologies differ in environment where they are being produced , they will still be successful if their creators have the determination and are full of ideas .
* The Birth of the Laptop Computer at Toshiba by E .M . Rogers
* {http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Bill_Gates}
The birth of new technologies and inventions came about in different forms and through different processes .
Although the innovations maybe comparably similar , the conditions where they were created maybe totally different .
An example would be in the case of conventionally invented electric cars by General Motors and the first laptop that was invented in a skunk works environment by an engineer from Toshiba .
There are certain differences and similarities between these two .
Differences like , risks involved , working environments , marketing strategies while similarities like the visions and goals of both innovations .
The first difference between the two types of innovations is risks involvement and work stress .
For conventionally generated technology , companies would select a team or department and assign tasks to them .
Then , they would set out to complete their tasks , without having to calculate the risks involved because these are what they are supposed to do .
For skunk works environment's created technology , the person who suggested the innovation has to take very big risks because it is a project of his own , he was not supported by companies , only his own team .
As said in Rogers' article on the 'Birth of laptops' , Tetstiya Mizoguchi , a Japanese technologist , disobeyed orders and risked his career for the sake of innovation-development which in the end , he succeed .
Therefore , risk taking is unavoidable in skunk works .
Secondly , the processes in which the new technology are designed and carried out between the two types of innovations are totally different .
The electric car was researched and built by the R&D department from General Motors .
The team had full funding from the company to support their costs in researching and designing electric motor cars .
On the other hand , Tetstiya Mizoguchi who led the invention of the first laptop , had no team initially and was not funded by his company because his proposal of creating a laptop , was rejected by his company .
Therefore , people who are working under skunk works environment have to gather their own team and a substantial amount of money before they can actually start on their project .
As such , because of limited funds the team or individual have in skunk works , they possessed larger stress because they could not afford to fail .
Because of disapprovals from companies , the working space for skunk works innovation is usually smaller and limited as compared to those who worked under companies to create new technology .
As said in Rogers' article  , Tetstiya Mizoguchi and his team went 'underground' and work at a factory which was far away from the headquarters of Toshiba .
Therefore , for skunk works innovations , people have to find their own team , funding , and workspace to carry out their project .
The third difference is the limitations of marketing .
For conventional innovations headed by big companies , they have their own marketing department to advertise and test their products .
They have the ability to make their products appealing to the public and attract them to test their prototypes .
In the case of the creation of electric motor cars by General Motors written by Rogers , General Motors had gone to the extent of putting advertisements on the newspaper and came out with marketing campaigns to publicise their new product .
On the contrary , products or technology created from skunk works environment do have the capabilities to roll out massive campaigns to advertise due to the lack of funds .
They had to depend on their own network to publicise their product and introduce their prototypes to the public .
Comparing the two articles written by Rogers , the target group for skunk works prototypes testing usually started small , and then eventually became bigger as more people accept the product whereas in the case of conventionally created products , the target group is very large in the beginning due to large scale marketing campaigns .
The similarity between the innovations created under different environments is that both had wanted to come out with solutions to solve problems that were present .
In the case of Toshiba first laptop invention , Tetstiya Mizoguchi wanted to solve the problem which most Japanese companies faced , the crowded offices which prevented the usage of more desktops due to the lack of space while , electric motor cars were created to lessen pollution .
In conclusion , for innovations by conventions or skunk works environment , there are various differences and similarities between them , but at the end of the day , both produced products that helped to solve problems and bring benefits to the people in the world .
In 1943 , Abraham Maslow published a theory on what he believes is the hierarchy of needs of people .
In his study , he defined five stages of needs they are , in descending order of importance , physiological , safety , love and belonging , esteem and finally self-actualization .1 In view of the world today , we engineers should tackle the most important human need that needs the most urgent attention .
This is of course one of our basic physiological needs , water , which is imperative in sustaining lives , especially in harsh environments .
The five stage engineering design process , as proposed by Khandani , will guide us in making solutions that solve this problem .
2
Potable water , the source of life , has become the largest demand in third world countries .
Drinking water that has not been treated clean can lead to life threatening diseases .
According to the World Health Organization report in the year 2000 , Africa , home to a population of 784 million people , faces dire shortages of clean and disease free , drinking water .
3 Furthermore , it is the continent with the least supply of potable water .
Nearly 48% of its human population has no immediate access to water supplies .
This is clearly a problem that needs to be addressed as soon as possible .
4 Lifestraw by Torben Vestergaard-Frandsen .
{http://www .vestergaard-frandsen .com/lifestraw .htm}
5BBC News , "New straw to kill disease as you drink" , May 2006 , {http://news .bbc .co .uk/2/hi/africa/4967452 .stm}
According to Khandani , the first step is to define the problem of the water shortage in Africa .
It is important that engineer realize the true need of the problem , so as to waste resources on a solution that does not work .
For instance , one may think of solving the water shortage by building desalination plants throughout the coast of Africa , but only to realize that he or she did not address the problem it at all .
Because the water shortage may not lie in the quantity of water , but rather , lies in the ease of access to potable water in Africa .
Hence , the first stage of the engineering design process has to be thought out carefully .
The second step is to research on the shortage of potable water .
Engineers have to understand why current technology has failed to solve the water shortage , and the oversights engineers of the previous technology .
For example , a company has produced "LifeStraw" , a portable device that processes safe drinkable water to by removing microscopic bacteria through its filters .
4 Something like this may seem like a godsend to the people of Africa , but quickly follows its downfall is its cost and the problem of transportation of filtered water .
5 Therefore , a thorough understanding of the limitations of technology can guide engineers to invent a product that fulfills all criteria of the need .
Lastly , the fifth step is to make and test the developed technology .
This allows engineers to troubleshoot problems in the device and make changes prior to production .
This ensures the product meets expectations of the problem .
In a nutshell , we can see how the five stages of engineering design introduced by Khandani can help engineers plan and develop solutions to solving the water shortage in Africa , thereby saving countless lives in dire need of safe drinking water .

Date back to 1943 , one of the team engineers in Lockheed Martin Corporation , Irv Curler answered a call by saying "Skonk Works , inside man Culver speaking" when the secret project of P-80 Shooting Star jet fighter was being carried out .
The name was soon adopted for usage in engineering , business and technical field to describe small group of people with working on secret projects .
Skunkworks have been a huge contributor for our invention for many decades .
Therefore , skunkworks drive comparable innovation to conventionally generated technology .
3 .
Facebook , History http://en .wikipedia .org/wiki/Facebook
As mentioned , skunkworks are always lack of resources , which funding ranked first out of others .
As a start-up , Facebook didn't have the funding which its competitor  , Myspace has .
As the history suggests , Myspace has everything in control when they first launched , including funding .
The site was designed by the experienced eUniverse engineers .
Unlike Facebook , Myspace used its resources to push its program to the masses .
Thus , they get instant popularity in the beginning .
However , Facebook trounced Myspace recently , setting its user number to a record high .
Clearly can be seen , skunkworks are no loser to conventional technology despite funding problems .
While conventionally generated technology are opened to public , skunkworks undertake secret project .
Before Facebook was created , Mark hacked into Harvard School system to get the information of all the students while others are sleeping soundly .
He posted the information up on a site called Facemash which paired photos of undergraduates with the visitors .
Soon Harvard yanked Mark's connection .
Nevertheless , Mark didn't stop right there .
Instead , he scarified his sleeping time to program another program to replace Facemash , which is Facebook we all are using today .
He started off the program alone without opening it to public before it was launced .
While Myspace took a different approach to show the public what they were doing .
The reason lies beneath could be the confidence Myspace had over their program because of the size of their resources which Facebook didn't have .
Although there are many differences between skunkworks and conventional technology , both of them drive innovation in the same way as the other .
Despite the fact that the approaches they take are obviously different , they share the same goal , which is to innovate the future products .
Either Facebook or Myspace , we can use them to share information without borders .
They are competing between each other by introducing new features .
Thereby , the healthy competition between both parties should improve one another .
In conclusion , innovation that was created in a skunkworks environment is comparable to conventionally generated technology .
