One of the few positive impacts arose by Iraq war is that governments as well as individuals came into awareness of how our dependence on oil , gas and other petrol products can trap us into serious situation once the supply of petrol is limited .
Moreover , the importance of finding new , sustainable and eco-friendly energy sources is now aware by people .
For solving this problem , no one else is more suitable than engineers .
Indeed , the utmost purpose for the existence of engineers is to improve the living standard and satisfy the higher requirements of human beings by creating or improving the products used in daily life .
In daily life , energy supply is so important because almost all the human activities , like cooking , working , heating and even water supply cannot work normally without electricity , and the emerging energy shortage is impossible to solve without the development of new energy source .
Thus , government should give priority to the research of economy , environmental-friendly and sustainable energy .
The basic steps for engineers to find new energy is shown as below .
The energy crisis appears to be increasingly serious as human beings' consumption keep increasing while the increase in energy supply is slow .
Since engineers are the most important in discovering new energy sources and the aim of their work is to meet people's needs , they should give priority to the development of new energy .
Since 2000 , our government has been driving Singapore towards a Knowledge-based Economy .
On one hand , much effort and fund has been put into our education system to prepare our people for the Knowledge-based Economy .
On the other hand , Singapore has always been encouraging companies , regardless of their size , to do more in Research and Development  .
The reason for doing these is our government has realised the importance of R&D in our progress as a nation .
Although much effort and fund has been spent on R&D , some problems still exist to significantly hinder engineering design processes for innovations .
In conclusion , some problems may significantly hinder engineering design processes for innovations , but Singapore is trying its best to solve these problems .
In addition , in this imperfect world , engineers are always solving the arising problems to make a better world .
A problem will not last infinitely , it will be solved eventually .
Over the last couples of years , with the developing of China , all industries , especially manufacturing industry , are developing into a large scale .
However , it is strange that not so much big companies like Lenovo and Haier exist with such a large-scale industry and such a large home market .
Instead , millions of small companies are operating their small business everywhere , and large transnational corporations are enjoying their profit in Chinese market .
How come ?
I think it is because of lacking innovations in engineering designs .
Many companies , especially the small ones , are following others' steps to design and manufacture their products , expecting some profits in the market are still there , left for them .
Then , another question rise: what hamper innovations in engineering design ?
I think there are two primary reasons , high costs in engineering design with relatively low rewards and unsatisfying engineering education system .
Firstly , many companies lack money to support innovations in their product design .
As I mentioned , many manufacturing companies in China are running their business in a small-scale .
What they manage to do is making their designs slight different from other similar ones , which make their products quite elastic in the market .
These companies have to take the price from the market , which indicates a meagre profit .
And that is why they do not have enough money .
For most case , the circle continues until they shut down .
Moreover , even if companies have enough money to support innovative design , they may not do so .
In Chinese emerging market , not all invests in innovation are rewarding .
Instead , just following others is proved to be more profitable sometimes .
Another group of companies are manufacturing products for large transnational corporations , which do not care about design .
Secondly , the engineering education is not focusing so much on innovation but memorizing .
This limits engineers' ideas when they are designing products .
Thus , engineers are more likely to use the similar module that they learn in school or university instead of bothering to consider another , perhaps a better , way .
According to Dr . Seyyed Khandani , five steps for solving engineering problems are:
* Define the problem
3 .
Generate multiple solutions
4 .
Analyze and select a solution
5 .
Test and implement the solution
However , many engineers educated in universities usually focus more on how to get a solution using formulas and laws .
Other steps are neglected unfortunately .
Behind prosperity of the products "made in China" during the last few years , it is lack of innovations in products of Chinese local manufacture companies .
And the main reasons why we lack innovation are high costs and low rewards of innovation in China and unsatisfying engineering education system .
I hope things are starting to change now .
The common challenges faced by every developed and developing countries are the daily demands for improvement in various areas , be it economy , infrastructure or even society .
Nation building is never easy hence governments worldwide engage specialists , engineers in particular , for assistance .
Engineers plying their trades in Singapore , however , will face two major problems amidst the common obstacles , in which they are potentially critical in the future development of the city-state .
Singapore , besides being famous for its airport and topping many surveys for the best , most recently named as the best place for business by the World Bank , it is also famous because of its size despite being termed as a "developed country" .
Hence , local engineers encounter their first major test in their quest: limited land spaces .
With just 647 square kilometres of land area , it has always been an essential as well as historical issue for the country's development .
Land limitation greatly reduces the range of technological advances local engineers can create in our country .
For example , lack of wide drainage areas force us to adapt building waste water reclamation plants instead , which admittedly drew ridicule from our neighbouring countries .
Despite plans ongoing to build a third plant , we are still rather reliant on Malaysia for the sale of water .
Reclamation of land from the ocean was also limited due to sensitivity border issues , thus hindering any designs that require huge spaces .
Burning of waste materials hence provide our major source of energy instead of bulky power plants .
Past engineering miracles in housing now require an upgrade in innovation and design due to the cultural shift in our society , as the younger generation now demands quality unlike the past , when the more crucial task is providing a roof for every citizen .
There is another common global issue , especially worst in Japan , and that is the ageing population crisis in Singapore .
The entry into the 21st century provides the world with a whole new set of problems: pandemic flu , terrorism and the emergence of a group of senior citizens .
Singapore has no chance of avoiding it as it also experienced a post war 'baby boom' period during the 1960s .
A new research report revealed that Singapore is set to be the world's third- fastest ageing nation , as the proportion of those aged 65 and above will double to 20 per cent in 2020 .
Adding on to this problem Singapore , being a small country , has always faced a talent crisis .
Low birth rates coupled with the outflow of local talents force the government to resort to adopting a foreign talent scheme in order to increase the talent pool in the city .
An ageing population creates a new dilemma to engineers working on their designs , because they have to rebuild or edit all their past creations so as to be 'elderly-friendly' , a phenomenon unheard of during the early days of nation building .
This will be a somewhat testing task as they cannot rely on any past references in Singapore , so any designs will be a risk taken by them .
Nowadays we are living in a fast developing world which provides not only abundant goods but also convenient and functional productions .
People's increasing desire for higher living qualities push our engineers to work on designing new things .
While , things does not get on as it seems to be .
Many negative factors exert on the processes for innovations that significantly hamper the design .
Now focus on the things in my home country , China , there are two main factors: the overflow of copying and lack of money .
Since USSR's Obninsk Nuclear Power Plant was established on June 27th 1954 , nuclear power has becoming one of the most important energy resources in the world .
By 2007 , an estimated of 14% of the global electricity come from nuclear reactions according to the International Atomic Energy Agency .
And due to the ever increasing consumption of oil and its limited reserves , it is predicted that there would be a further surge for nuclear energy .
Nuclear power was first discovered scientist in 19th century .
They realized that heavy nuclei , which were unstable , would undergo fission if collided with highly energetic particles to gain stability .
In this process , a certain amount of energy would be released because of the decrease in the total mass of the products and reactants .
Since the equation governing this change is E=mc^2 , an enormous amount of energy could be released even if there is an only a tiny amount of change in the mass .
In addition , no byproducts will be produced .
As a result , it is perceived as an alternative of liable energy resources .
However , the development of nuclear power is greatly affected by non-technical issues , namely military , political and economical factors .
Recently , Iran and North Korea are facing sanctions from various countries and continent because of their nuclear development .
Both countries are accused of possessing nuclear weapons which would present a great threat to the world .
In this case , it clearly presented how political factors structured the advancement of important technology like nuclear power .
In North Korea's case , they started the development of nuclear technology because of the raise of tension with South Korea .
Hence , they regarded nuclear development as a way to sort out the disputes over policies .
At the same time , Iran makes use of nuclear power to resist American policies and its influence in the region as well .
For nations like Iran and North Korea , the development of nuclear power is mainly determined by the political forces .
It is employed as a means to achieve certain political goals whereas the technical aspects are inferior .
Despite the political impact on the nuclear technologies in the less developed world , military forces are likely to exert a similar impact on development of nuclear power in those more developed countries .
For instance , the US military force considers nuclear power as viable source to provide energy for the military uses .
Due to logistic reason combined with the unstoppable depletion rate , scientists in the United State is diverting most of their funding into research of how to make nuclear power as a readily mobile and less dangerous energy source for military uses .
In conclusion , the recent innovation and development have showed the impact of political , military and other social factors .
Moreover , they are likely to exert a greater influence in the future .
As the development of technology , the abilities of innovation have becoming more and more important all over the world .
In order to survive and develop in the competitive world , it is crucial for not only many countries but also the individuals to fully develop the process for innovations .
According to Rogers  , there are six main stages of this process , namely the needs and problems , research , development , commercialization , diffusion and adoption and the stage of consequences .
However , in some countries there are still many problems which restrict the development of these stages .
Take China as example there are two main problems in hampering the development of innovation .
First of all , the education system has great effects on the process of recognizing the problems or needs which is the fundamental stage of innovation-development process .
It is true that the Chinese special education system has excellent achievements in laying the solid foundations of knowledge and skills which are also very important in doing the deeper researches and studies , but the lack of flexibility and creativeness of Chinese education-system is still a big problem .
As a result , many students get used to accepting the information in the references without thinking and investigating by themselves .
Consequently , it becomes quite difficult for them to discover the potential problems even when they try to to do it .
However , Innovation requires students to develop the ability of discovering problems instead of easily satisfying with the current situations or just following the rules .
In fact , most of the famous inventions or significant scientific discoveries are based on the ability of questioning .
If Watt did not realize the shortcomings of the traditional streamer , the age of stream may be cannot come so fast .
If Galileo did not challenge and simply accepted the statements presented by Aristotle thousands years ago , people may still not realize the nature of free fall motion for a long time .
Without the awareness of recognizing or discovering the problems , the innovation process cannot proceed smoothly .
In addition to the education problems , the economic development is also one of the important limitations for China .
General speaking , the success of innovation needs a lot of premises .
Not only the human resources , but also the financial resources have impacts on the development of innovation .
The implementation of many big projects or innovations requires large amounts of economic foundation .
Indeed , the economy of China is accelerating at high speed recently .
However , it is really hard to meet all the needs of the rapid innovation-development in the past .
Comparing with some developed countries , China still cannot provide large amounts of financial aids in encouraging and supporting scientists and engineers in doing the process of research and putting these innovations into practice .
In a nutshell , for the importance of developing the processes for innovation , it is quite necessary to solve these existing problems nowadays .
Only if China try to minimize these potential limitations , will the innovation-development processes success and flourish .
Penicillin is a type of antibiotic that is used against bacterial infections .
It is a serendipitous discovery made by Alexander Fleming from a petri-dish with bacteria left behind from his experiments when he went for a holiday .
In-vitro fertilization is the process of making fertilization of eggs with sperms outside the womb of the mother and the technique is invented through researches .
Many may think that serendipitous discoveries are just by luck , but through the comparison of penicillin and in-vitro fertilization , we will realize that serendipitous discoveries are just as complex and impactful as technologies created through research .
However , despite the difference in the expected results of the experiments leading to the discovery of penicillin and in-vitro fertilization , the environments in which both technologies were developed and the processes taken are similar .
Fleming did his experiments in his laboratory as he was a professor in a hospital .
Likewise , Carl Wood and various other scientists did their experiments on the in-vitro fertilization techniques on egg cells in laboratories too .
After the discovery of anti-bacteria substance , Fleming did his researches to improve on the results just like what the researchers for In-vitro fertilization did .
Both the technologies have to go through laboratory testing and many other processes before the final formula is derived .
Hence , both the technologies are developed in a laboratory environment with sufficient equipments for their testing and both requires extra steps even after discovering the correct method of making the technology .
In addition , both the technologies are developed not only by the person who founded the technology .
Penicillin was actually extracted successfully from the fungus by Ernst Chain .
Also , in-vitro fertilization would not be successful if not for other researchers such as John Rock , Patrick Steptoe and Robert Edwards besides Carl Wood . 
In conclusion , even though penicillin's discovery was accidental , we can see from the comparison of the two technologies that the invention is actually comparable to those developed by researches .
The developments of both technologies are similar in terms of the complexity of the processes and the impacts of the technologies are equivalent .
Many countries are stepping into the Greying Societies .
As the elder population grows larger and larger , the burden on the younger generation and government becomes greater and greater .
Some people say that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
I think the government can carry out positive policies to limit the money spent on the elderly indirectly .
Encouraging the later retirement and giving out subsidies based on the financial need are efficient ways to lessen the amount of money spent on the growing population of the aged .
Government has to limit the money given to the elderly for the reason that the expanded population of the elderly can lead to serious problems in economy , society and productivity .
Spending increase for the aged will surely reduce the country's total deposits and thus reduce the general social investment , imposing a negative impact on the sustainable , coordinated , steady and fast development of the nation's economy .
Encouraging the later retirement is a effective method to solve this problem .
First of all , it is good for employers .
As the aging population becomes larger , more people retire than the usual .
It can be predicted that more people will leave their work and fewer people can enter .
If people can retire at a later time , the company can keep a balance of the work force .
Furthermore , longer work lives can certainly increase the productivity of the nation .
On one hand , the elderly can feed themselves without the pension from the government .
On the other hand , the amount of the tax will go up as the productivity increases .
Therefore , the government can give out more benefits .
This method is used by the countries which are confronted with the aging problem , for example , China , Canada .
Now it is accepted and used by more countries .
Giving out subsidies based on the financial need is another policy that government can make to reduce the pressure and burden .
Not all the elderly people need the help from the government .
For some people , they save enough money when they are young or they can still make their livings as they are old or they are supported by their children .
They are able to ensure their quality of life for the rest of their lives .
These people do not need the pension from the government .
However , some people cannot live without the pension from the government .
Usually these people do not have a good education or they have some disabilities .
The government has the duty to take care of them .
If the government can give out the pensions according to the financial need , the amount of money spent on the elderly will not climb rapidly even if the aging population increases at an incredible speed .
Australia has already taken this policy and more countries are taking this policy into consideration .
Some people may say that the government should treat every citizen equally .
Hence , it is unreasonable to choose people to give out the subsidies .
Although every citizen has the same right , the government must ensure the living condition of its people first .
Giving everyone pension means that some people's living standard will be influenced but giving out money based on the fanatical need means everyone can live in a good condition .
The pension is not important to the people who are able to live a good life in their late life .
However , the subsidy is essential to the people who are not capable of feeding themselves .
Thus , the government should choose people to give out pension .
Although more and more countries are faced with the aging problem , the government can make some policies like encouraging later retirement and giving out money based on the fiscal need .
These policies can both limit the money spent on the elderly and ensure the living standard of its people .

Everyone will grow old one day it is just another phase in life .
With every phase in life , comes its own set of problems .
Throughout the process of aging , people will face certain problems relating to health , finance , and social and so on and many of these problems are usually interrelated .
Just like every set of lock comes with a set of keys , every set of problems comes with their own set of solutions .
Now , with the help of technological advancements and the reforms of government policies , the aging process has certainly been made easier to a large extent .
Extensive research and development has been done in the medical field to make our lives easier .
Through research and development , new technologies are being created .
With the help of these technologies , many possibilities are formed .
Diseases that were thought to be incurable in the past are now curable .
Many diseases can be detected earlier and thus prevented .
Also , many age-related problems can be cured , either fully or to a large extent , using these new technologies .
All these have helped to make the process of aging easier whereby the aged can lead better lives with fewer health problems .
Also through research and development , many lifestyle guides that help create healthy lifestyle , becomes available .
It is known that by having a healthy lifestyle , one will have fewer health problems and thus , spending less on healthcare .
By saving more on healthcare , the financial stress on the aged will be relieved .
Therefore , through the help of research and development , the aged live better lives , and have fewer health problems .
However , as healthcare technologies improve , the costs of healthcare also increase .
As these new technologies involve the usage of newer , and more advanced equipments , the costs of using such technologies tend to be higher than the past .
There is a small percentage of the elderly who are not financially secure .
For them , using such new technologies is either impossible , or it will create further financial problems .
Also , another side effect of improved healthcare technologies is that people tend to have a longer lifespan .
With prolonged life , the aged might face certain issues .
There are diseases which are incurable , but the life of the victim can be prolonged using these new technologies .
However , these technologies are expensive .
By prolonging the life of the victim , it can be financially draining on the family , and cause financial and social tension within the family .
This becomes the case where solving one problem creates another .
However , with the help of government policies , this problem can be solved .
Financial aids can be made available to these families and help relieve the financial stress .
Recently , government policies have also undergone several reforms to better cater to the aged in the society .
These reforms in policies are aimed to help the aged cope better with aging .
These policies encourage the elderly to retire later .
Also , they lower barriers to elder employment .
With these , the aged can have longer working life , and thus accumulating more wealth to support themselves through their old age .
Also , the government helps relieved financial stress by subsidizing healthcare costs , and providing financial aids to the elderly needy .
These healthcare costs include hospital and caretaker fees .
Healthcare system is also restructured to cater to the aged .
An example is by building more community hospitals , nursing homes , and home care .
These will provide competent and appropriate care for the elderly patients .
Through the reforms of the government policies , the aged has been well taken care of .
In conclusion , current research and development , and policies have certainly helped to ease the aging process to a large extent .
New technologies have been created to help eliminate many of the age-related health problems .
Government policies and the restructuring of the healthcare system have helped the aged cope better with life .
However , not every elderly in the society can get to enjoy these perks , especially those who are bounded by financial problems .
Therefore through current research and development and policies , the aging process has been made easier , but it is only to a large extent .
Until recently , the problems of aging population have become a major concern among all the nations throughout the world .
Governments of many countries have come up with policies and solutions to decrease elder dependency and slowing down the process of a fast aging population .
Aging statistics taken from the United States of America administration of aging shows people above the age of 65 represented 12 .4% of the population in the year 2000 but are expected to grow to be 20% of the population by 2030 .
The statistics have shown that in time to come , the problems of a fast aging population will be too overwhelming for the society to handle , therefore we have to slow down the aging process .
A fast aging population will have serious detrimental effects in developed countries .
Caring for health of the aging population will pose a problem for the government .
The country's economy will also suffer as a small amount of young working population will have to support a bigger umbrella of elder generation .
This will tax and stress heavily on the small working population .
A lot of resources will also have to be spend on the elderly people .
However , policies have helped to reduce the effects of an aging population .
I have to agree that current developments and policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Singapore has encouraged people to retire at an older age and companies to keep their employees for a longer time .
Legislative changes were made in Singapore in 1993 to put the retirement age at 60 , and then to move it up again from 60 to 62 years in 1999 .
This will help the working people to save more money and be more financially independent when they are old and have no income .
In this way , the working population will not be stressed on too much by the elderly population .
The government also has encouraged and provided incentives for companies to employ elderly workers .
This will help the elderly to be more in touch with the society and keep their physical health in good shape which will in turn reduce diseases .
Singapore has also help working adults to save money when they are working so that when they retire , they will still have money for living expenses .
Singapore introduced the Central Provident Fund in 1995 as a compulsory saving scheme to help workers to benefit in their retirement .
Employees will contribute twenty percent of their salary while employers will contribute thirteen percent towards this saving scheme for workers .
The purpose of this saving scheme is to emphasize on self reliance .
To meet healthcare needs , Medisave was introduced to allow CPF members to use their CPF savings for hospitalization .
In this way , most problems of the aging population is taken care of .
Singapore has also emphasize and instill filial piety to the children of the aging population and to support their parents through meeting their financial needs and emotional needs .
The children of the future should provide for their parents as much they can even though their financial status looks bleak so that the aging population will not have to rely too much on government help .
Children also should arrange for their parents to live under the same roof so as not to only provide for them financially but also to show care and concern to their aging parents .
For example , children of the aging parents are able to bring their parents to consult a doctor if any minor medical conditions arise , thus preventing serious illnesses from developing .
Singapore has encouraged people to buy a HDB flat near their parent by subsidizing a substantial amount of money .
By living together , the children can also provide a listening ear to their parents and even warn them against making wrong decisions .
This will definitely reduced the fiscal cost of elder dependency .
However , some critics might disagree with this strategy .
No matter how much we encourage young people to care for their parents , it's still their personal choice , the society or the government cannot force them to do their part .
However , if the government does a good job in educating the young people and introducing policies to encourage young people to be more caring towards their aging parents , this would be a very effective strategy .
This is because what the aging population needs are their children providence and their care and concern .
In conclusion , I think that many developments and policies have helped to reduce the aging process and also solving the problem of a fast aging population .
Although this problem cannot be solved in a short period of time , theses policies and development will help to curb the problems of an aging population .
Nowadays , against a changing technology background , many of the social problems that have troubled people for centuries are being eased .
Among them is the aging problem , which leads to a restructuring of the social composition .
Many pessimistic predicts were made by people about this problem .
However , with the assist of Information and Communication technology  , the situation could be fundamentally shifted through mainly three ways .
Firstly , the development of ICT can reduce the aged people's difficulties by changing the workspace .
Instead of being forced to travel from and to the office every day , now they can simply stay at home and finish their work through the internet .
This change effectively eliminates their disadvantages in lack of mobility compared to the young people .
Coming along with the workspace shift , the job itself will also change .
Nowadays , fewer and fewer jobs are requiring certain level of performance .
Those repetitive and tedious jobs are now performed by machine and jobs become more of management people and resources , especially with Information Technology as the medium .
This change of job nature makes a huge difference to the aged people's captivity for their body conditions are no longer their employer's top concern .
Besides by changing the workspace , ICT also brings good news to the aged by changing employment relationships .
It is well known that for the aged people , jobs are really hard to find .
9 out of 10 employers would be reluctant to hire an old people because they are in fear that they can not work as efficiently  .
However , with the introduction of ICT , many more new jobs are created , large percentage of which are self-employed jobs .
So for the elderly , a new choice is offered to them: after their retirement , instead of heading into the job market and compete with people probably half their age for a post , they can start up their own business .
There are plenty of opportunities out there on the internet .
What matters is their smell , not their age .
The opponent may probably argue that ICT is a privilege that only benefits the young people .
However , the truth cannot be farther than that .
Although young people have an advantage for they are exposed to the technology from early ages , the aged people still stand a high chance to succeed , as long as they can adapt to new features quickly .
After all , the internet is a common property which every one can enjoy a share .
Current research and development in the field of ICT has largely shapes the society .
It makes aged people remain productive by changing the workspace , reforming the employment relationship and offering easy access to re- education .
Technologies like this promise to offer us even more new dimensions to deal with existing social problems in the years to come .
Nowadays , the life expectancy of people has increased thanks to the healthcare technology which keeps getting better .
This should be a very good thing to hear .
But , there are consequences to this .
Since people have longer life expectancy , the number of elders increased .
This caused the event that we called the aging population .
The aging population caused a lot of disadvantages , since a lot of money will be used to support the elderly .
Wikipedia stated that "As of July 2007 , medical costs for a typical inmate in the USA might run an agency around US$33 per day , while costs for an ageing inmate could run upwards of US$100 .
Most State DOCs report spending more than 10 percent of the annual budget on elderly care .
That is expected to rise over the next 10-20 years" .
This money could be used for the development of other areas .
So , we have a question here .
Should public spending on the aged be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development ?
In this essay , I will tell you why public spending on the aged should not be limited .
Firstly , limiting the public spending is not efficient .
We have to calculate the limit carefully so that it will be enough for the elderly .
Even if it has been done correctly , since the public spending of each person is different , a trouble will still be there .
Consider if there is an elderly has been sick for a long time and his/her spending has already reached the limit are we going to tell him to die because we will not provide him with anymore money ?
There are a lot of alternative methods that we can use to cope with the aging population .
Peterson in his review "A Graying World" suggests six ways to cope with the aging population .
We could use any of these six ways to cope with the aging population , without having to limit the public spending on the elderly .
It should also be noted that , limiting aging spending in healthcare will not bring much impact since "the annual growth in national health spending is not mainly due to increasing demand from ageing populations , but rather has been driven by rising incomes , costly new medical technology , a shortage of health care workers and informational asymmetries between providers and patients"  .
Secondly , the elderly has the right to be protected because they have worked for the country before .
We should not forget that the younger generations are raised by the previous generation .
So , the younger generations should repay them by providing their needs during the old age .
We , younger generations , must realize that someday we will grow old as well .
When we grow old , how would we like to be treated ?
Would we like to be treated as a burden and given a lot of limitations ?
It is really selfish if we treated the elderly badly but still want to be treated nicely when we grow old .
It may be objected that elderly might misuse this service and fully rely on the public funding rather than trying to cope on their own .
However , we must not forget that a lot of people have no choice but to rely on the government .
"The most significant aspect of the growing percentage of elderly people in the population is the marked increase in those aged 85 and over .
Among this group is a large number of elderly people who are severely impaired physically and/or mentally"  .
These people have no other choice but to rely on others for their funding .
Would we forget them because of the small group of people that use this service to become lazy ?
Therefore , we can conclude that we should not limit the public spending on the elderly .
There are a lot of people that could only rely on this service to survive .
We should remember their deeds and we should also remember that we will be an elderly one day .
Limiting the public spending on the elderly is also not an efficient way to cope with an aging population .
So , the government should use a more efficient method to cope with the aging population instead of limiting the public spending on the elderly .

"The critical challenge of an aging society is not so much how to accommodate the older population , but how to ensure the productivity of future workers , regardless of age"  .
Major increases in public spending for pension fund and health care costs for the elderly will slow economic growth in most countries , even in developed countries .
Therefore , the government should focus more on how they can reduce this spending , so that the economy will not be damaged .
This can be done by improving workers productivity and increasing labor force participation .
In other words , the government will spend more on creating jobs and educating the population .
People with higher education are expected to get more salaries and accumulate wealth when they are still young , so that they will not be too dependent in their old age .
Thus , public spending on the aged should be diverted to other more important aspects .
Some people may argue that there will be insufficient protection for the elderly if the government shifts this fund to some other areas of the country's development .
For example , people say that old single women , whose incomes are mainly not high , are vulnerable and need special care .
It might be true to some extent , but we should also consider that the government will only limit the public spending on the elderly , and they will not eliminate it .
This means special policies will be made for those with special needs .
Government will still take care of those who cannot take care of themselves .
Furthermore , we should also realize that today's group of older people is different from the past's .
Friedland and Summer stated that the meaning of "retirement" and "old age" nowadays is different from what it is in the past , as future groups of older people are likely to be even better off .
They are wealthier , healthier , and they have better education .
In addition to implementing special policies , the government could allocate more funds for educating young people .
Education is very important because employers tend to hire workers or employees with high education and experience in their fields .
Low education in a country may result in increases in the number of the unemployed , which eventually hamper the economic growth because people who are jobless are very dependent as they do not earn money for living .
Furthermore , the country will also lack of trained labor force .
For instance , Indonesia , the world's 4th most populous country , has 109 ,900 ,900 labor force , but the rate of the unemployed is very high in 2008  , due to low education participation rates .
The lack of education is the priority problem in Indonesia , mainly caused by the great number of people who still live in poverty .
The current situation is concerning as when this generation ages , the government will need to provide a certain care for them .
In other words , the new policy to cut off public expenditure on the aged cannot be implemented in this condition .
Hence , it is again the government's role to subsidy the education so that everybody at least could get the standard level of education .
Education alone is not enough because even if the society is better-educated but there are not adequate jobs available , it will give the same problem of unemployment .
The government plays the role to create and maintain new jobs .
Therefore , they will need to create a supplementary budget for job creation .
In fact , some countries , such as Korea , have begun to implement this policy .
Korea has planned to spend 3 ,500 billion won in 2009 to help maintain and create jobs , and through this , 552 ,000 new jobs are expected to be created  .
This policy aims to boost the economic growth potential as there will be less tough competition to get a job .
Besides increasing the number of new jobs , the government can try to invent a new type of job , which can be done by people regardless their age , including the elderly .
For instance , telecommuting part-time jobs , which do not require the workers to be in the workplace , is good to be implemented nowadays , by means of our advanced technology .
Clearly , there are many ways to limit and to divert the public spending for the elderly people without slowing the economic growth .
By providing good education and good jobs , our life will be guaranteed until our old age .
Governments and policy makers will take the main role to invent the best policies to deal with the long-term economic and social challenge of global aging , so that we are fully prepared to face this concerning issue .

Aging is becoming a hotter problem when the percentage of the elderly in the society is continuously increasing .
Certainly , when the number of aged people raises , public spending on this group will have to be raised as well to take care of this group .
However , I think there should be a limit on how much shall be spent for the elderly , because government needs to emphasize the money more on country development .
First of all , spending money on development is the most effective way to address the aging population issue .
Actually , the problem of more population getting aged does not lie in the demographic change , but in the fact that the productivity of the nation will get declined .
When the government try to spend more and more for the aged , it will leads to a lack in money for development , then a slower economic growth , which finally leave the government with less choice to spend for the elderly people .
In contrast , when focusing on country development , particularly economic growth , the country can earn more money .
With this extra money , the government can have more to spend for the whole society , and the money for the aged will be increased as well .
In fact , "if real economic growth averages about 2 percent per year between now and 2050" , Robert B . Friedland and Laura Summer claim , "government expenditures as a proportion of the economy in 2050 might not be substantially larger than what it is today"  .
Secondly , imposing a limit on public spending for the aged can make people spending money more responsibly .
For most people , bearing in mind that they will have to take care more for themselves when they are old will force them to save money for the future .
They therefore will have to think more when spending money , and reducing wasting extra money on unimportant things .
Moreover , nowadays , with better living condition for the whole life of a person , attributing old people with bad health seems to be not so true for many cases .
Hence , extra care such as extra health diagnostic may not be necessary for many elderly people .
With less money received , social organizations which host these activities will have to choose people to serve more carefully and this can also save much money .
From the opposing view , many people argue that the aged are the most vulnerable group in the society and thus needing more and more attention .
However , to help these people become less vulnerable , it is not so good to do so when they are already aged .
"Prevention is better than cure" .
Thus , focusing on social development as a whole , and improving living condition throughout the life of people is actually better way to help people gain a better health and become less vulnerable when they are aged .
Moreover , when more money is spent for people when they are younger , it could raise a better workforce for the nation .
The productivity of the country will therefore be increased , and again , with more wealth earned , public spending in general , and on the aged , in particulars , will be increased as a certain result .
In conclusion , although the population of the earth in general is getting aged , which could lead to certain consequence , the government should not be panic to address that problem in a short term way by increase public spending for the aged as high as possible .
Rather , the government should focusing on develop the nation as a whole , especially maintaining the economic growth , because this is the long term and most effective way to solve aging problem .
Have present studies , development and policies helped to relieve the aging process ?
This is the question many people grapple with and the core of the debate lies in the impact they bring on the aging process .
In my opinion , I agree to a large extent that current research , development and policies have helped eased the aging process .
In the course of my essay , I will first show how economics , medicine , architectural , technological inventions and social policies have helped eased the aging process while financial constraint can limit the effectiveness of easing the aging process .
Firstly , economics have helped eased the aging process .
Due to the growth in the awareness of the different financial needs over an individual's life cycle , financial institutions have designed and introduced a wide range of products to meet these needs .
For example , a person will need health insurance to protect oneself from the high cost of medical treatment .
Also , with the insurance coverage , an individual can seek adequate medical treatment to recover from any sickness .
The various products available helped to minimize the impact of unforeseen events so that an individual can save resources to meet aging needs .
In addition , as education opportunities increase , economies around the world has transformed from labour intensive to knowledge-based .
This has extended the working life of the labour force .
With longer working life , people will be able to accumulate more wealth which they can use to support themselves in their old age .
Therefore , people will have saved enough money by the time when they are old to maintain a certain standard of living .
Secondly , architecture has also helped eased the aging process .
With the growing advocate for obstruction free building design , the mobility of the senior population is significantly increased .
For example , buildings are fitted with lifts , ramps and more railings to allow people who are physically challenged to access .
With mobility , the elder generation can have the same mobility options as they were young and continue to live their lives on their own .
The reduced dependency on others will ease the pain of aging .
Thirdly , the modern state of technology has significantly eased the process of aging .
Many tasks in life are made easy with technology .
For example , robotic vacuum cleaners have made housekeeping very much effortless .
The safety features in household appliances has enabled the elderly to take care of their own needs safely .
Overall , technology allowed the elderly to reduce their dependency on others , and improves the quality of their lives .
Fourthly , advancements in medicine have significantly increased the life expectancy of mankind .
Many diseases that have plagued mankind in the past are now curable or can be vaccinated .
Long term illness such as diabetes is more effectively controlled , and the treatment process has become less painful .
As one ages , they need not suffer the torment of illness as the previous generations did , and are able to spend more time on other meaningful activities .
Fifthly , various social policies have been introduced to ease the aging process .
For example , filial obligation is stressed through informal and formal channels to increase the willingness of the next generation to support their own elderly parents .
With their children supporting them , the elderly will no doubt be happier and enjoy their golden age .
Furthermore , in some countries such as Britain and Singapore , people are required to provide for their own old age dependency .
They are compelled by law to save and invest more of their income earned while they are active in the work force .
In this way , the elderly will have a sum of money available to support themselves in their golden age when they retired .
However , many of these advances discussed require financial resources to achieve .
For example , the wide range of financial and technological products comes at a cost .
For those who are not able to afford them , they will not be able to enjoy the benefits .
Social policies also require funding in order to put the plan into action .
Therefore , the ability of recent advancements to ease the aging process can be greatly limited by financial constraints .
In conclusion , economics , medicine , architecture , technological inventions and social policies have helped to ease the aging process but they required financial resources to achieve .
Therefore , the elderly and their children supporting them must have sufficient financial resources in order to take advantage of the benefits of modern day advancements to ease the aging process .
In recent years , there is an increasing number of countries faced with an ageing population .
The problems of an ageing population have led to these countries coming up with measures to counter effect the problems .
One of which is to increase public spending so as to ensure that the aged are taken care .
Yet , at the same time , this money could be spent on other areas of the country's development .
Therefore , some may argue that public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country's development .
However , I do not support this argument as increasing public spending on the aged is a necessary step for the government to take in order to prepare the country to face an ageing population .
Firstly , improving on current facilities to better suit the aged is compulsory .
We have to prepare more healthcare teams to specialize in treating illness related to the old as it is commonly known that the old are more prone to illness .
Thus , by increasing the amount of healthcare workers focusing on treating elderly illness prevent the situation of the lack of healthcare workers for the elderly in the near future .
Also , we have to create an environment which is elderly-friendly so that the elders are able to take care of themselves without the help of others .
Being able to take care of themselves is very important as this greatly decreases their dependence on others and hence reduces their burden on their children and the elderly will not feel that they are useless by not being independent .
Therefore , this public spending on improving facilities should not be comprised for the welfare of the elderly .
Similarly , the government has to provide elderly benefits as most of the elderly are no longer in the workforce and thus have no regular income .
The elderly depend on their savings or their children to support themselves through the old age .
Even though so , some of the elderly may not have saved enough to last them till death or their children are not willing to take care of them .
They are faced with the problems of living a proper life .
A proper life refers to having home , three meals and adequate healthcare .
Therefore , it is important for the government to step in to provide help for these poor elderly so that they could have a proper life .
If not , these elderly may die because of hunger or the lack of proper healthcare due to poverty .
However , an argument against this is that most people feel that old age is not the responsibility of the government and the government is not obliged to take care of the elderly .
The elderly ought to be independent .
Nevertheless , if the government leaves elderly who are fighting old age alone without care , it would be too cruel of the government .
In other words , the government should not leave those elderly in lurch to struggle on their own for survival .
In addition , the elderly may encounter biasness against them .
This is a social problem where the government has to step in to solve it .
Ageism may be present in the working or social life of an elderly .
These unfair treatments that the elderly faced may be pose a psychological problem to them .
For example , the old aged face discrimination when finding jobs as compared to the young and also , the old age may receive less all-rounded treatment in healthcare sector based on the stereotype that they are in the natural process of aging and that they are less likely to recover .
The government then has to interfere to educate the public to be less prejudiced against the old aged .
This will take up part of the public spending which should not be limited .
On the other hand , public spending on the aged should be limited so that money could be diverted to other areas of the country's development such as the economic sector .
If the economic improves , people would earn more money and thus the burden on the children taking care of their old-aged parents would be relatively less as they could better afford the costs of taking care of elderly .
On the contrary , this is only applicable to filial children who are willing to take care of their parents .
Those elderly who are unfortunate or those without kids may face problems as they would have no one to take care of them and would be worse off without any help from the government .
As a result , public spending on the aged should not be limited as it is needed to help these elderly .
To sum up , the government has to assume responsibilities in taking care of the elderly and to ensure that the country is adequately prepared to accept an ageing population , public spending on the aged should not be limited and money should not be diverted into other areas of the country's development .
Statistics from the World Health Organization stated that:
From 2000 until 2050 , the world's population aged 60 and over will more than triple from 600 million to 2 billion .
Most of this increase is occurring in developing countries - where the number of older people will rise from 400 million in 2000 to 1 .7 billion by 2050 .
The baby-boom generation has created a need to improve and provide care and services to the aging population .
I agree to a large extend that current research and development/policies have helped to ease the aging process .
Technology plays a significant role in providing aid and improving the lives of the elderly .
Current technologies have provided aids and support to the elderly in the fields of personal health technologies by reducing the cost and time of medical appointments and increasing the effectiveness of health record tracking .
It is also important that ageing related problems are highlighted into the national development and policies for example introduction of the pension system and encouragement of late retirement to reduce elder dependency .
Firstly , the goal of personal health technologies will be to change from a centralized model where the elderly would go to the hospital where healthcare is provided , to a distributed model where by healthcare involves the places where the elderly lives .
Information technology applications have enabled elderly to initiate communication , keep track of their personal health record and also make follow-up appointments which can be conducted through Telemedicine .
Telemedicine was introduced to provide care for the patient from any location with the help of transferring electronic information through various technology applications and equipments such as the web camera .
This technology delivered care directly to the homes of the elderly at an affordable rate and provide right information at the right time which benefits decision making of the medical officers involved .
It involves elderly to be more active in taking care of themselves at the comfort of their own home .
It may be objected that telemedicine might not be as effective as contact monitoring and hands on attention .
Nevertheless , such applications have helped to reduce the time spent in hospitals and cost of medical , improve record tracking practices and speed of communication .
Next , national developments and policies such as pension systems are arranged to provide the retired elders income .
The fund may be set up by a corporation , the government , or any other organization to pay the benefits of retired workers .
In the context of Singapore , the Central Provident Fund is set up to provide Singaporeans with a retirement plan .
The benefits of the CPF scheme are classified into , retirement , healthcare , home ownership , family protection and asset enhancement .
Critics of this position pointed out that the cost of providing pensions leads the increased taxes on the workforce .
However with the help of pension system , it has provided the elderly with a retired fund , thus reducing the elder dependency on the children of the elderly .
Last but not least , in light of the challenges of ageing population , many countries have changed their policies with respect to early retirement .
By encouraging later retirement it will help to reduce elder dependency .
Opponents of this position argue that there would be an increase in the wage base with a lower retirement age , because people will save less as they need less wealth and lower savings , thus by increasing the retirement age .
However working longer also means providing sufficient savings for old age it will also help increase the economic growth and instill a sense of belonging and self value to the elderly .
Moreover , lifelong learning empowers elderly to lead a better lifestyle through social interaction and contribution to the community .
In conclusion , technology and the national development and policies have helped ease the aging process .
Technology applications such as Telemedicine which aids the tracking and handling of medical reports and appointments which in return , encourages elderly to keep track of their personal health through a cost and time effective system .
In addition , pension schemes and later retirement help to reduce elder dependency through providing a retirement plan and increasing the economic growth .
