Public opposition regarding the issue of nuclear technology has been evident ever since the Chernobyl and Three Mile accident .
People were mostly concerned about public health and safety caused by radioactive exposures .
In the case of Shoreham , the nuclear plant faced strong opposition from both the people and the government .
Although Shoreham had a license for nuclear power testing , the plant was fully decommissioned in the end in 1998 .
Light Water Reactors make up the majority of nuclear plants in the United States .
Uranium is the primary fuel source in these nuclear plants .
Unfortunately , incomplete combustion of uranium fuel comprises high up to 99% .
In addition , nuclear wastes repositories require geological isolation over in areas like Yucca Mountain .
On the other hand , the concept of fourth generation nuclear power addresses the issue of involving complete combustion in uranium fuel .
They are capable of combusting nuclear waste that leaves a minimal volume of waste with insignificant half-lives , thus addressing the nuclear waste problem .
The Molten Salt Reactor is a type of fourth generation nuclear reactor .
The coolant comprises of a molten salt .
The concepts of MSR involve nuclear fuel dissolved in the molten fluoride salt as uranium tetra fluoride .
As such , the fluid would be able to rely on fuel that is dispersed in a graphite matrix with the molten salt providing low pressure and high temperature cooling , unlike in today's LWR's .
Thus , MSR have the ability to work at high temperatures , low-pressure operation and at high power density .
At higher temperatures , most of the reactor heat is then able to transformed into electricity because it ensures complete combustion of the uranium fuel .
Operating at lower pressures reduces accident risk unlike with the current LWR and fission products have better retention in the event of an accident .
The MSR is able to be air-cooled , making it capable of using waste heat for water desalination .
The turbines have also excellent thermodynamic efficiency due to the relatively high temperature .
Secondly , unlike traditional LWRs , refueling of the MSR can be done while the system is still in operation .
Fission products are removed and new fuel is added to portions of the fuel at a time , drastically reducing the cost of operation of the MSR .
The Obama campaign initially opposed to the idea of the Yucca Mountain nuclear repository .
The amount of money needed to build a nuclear repository isolated away from civilization , cost up to $25billion .
There are better methods of using this sum of money collected from taxes from its people to solve waste disposal problem .
The government should exploit the funds available to develop MSRs .
These reactors are capable of consuming existing nuclear waste in the production of electricity , and prevent nuclear waste from accumulating .
Accelerated development of MSRs will result in the US to successfully tackle nuclear waste problem and revolutionize an entire new level of carbon-free energy that can last longer than just centuries .
Furthermore , MSRs are up to 300 times more fuel-efficient compared to the LWRs .
It actually provides a bit more than what most scientists expect from fusion as an MSR can be built in small 1 .2MW electric units .
A 7 .4 MW thermal reactor was built in the 1960s and operated for years , proving the concept .
MSRs is also much more efficient than a helium-cooled Very High Temperature Reactor operating at similar conditions , in terms of electricity conversion .
Apart from that , MSRs are capable of operating for several centuries with only uranium that is already present .
Thus , the claim of nuclear fuel mining using up fossil fuels and adding to the greenhouse effect is unjustified .
However , the high temperature and corrosive operating conditions of the MSR require materials that exceed the limitations of current nuclear reactors .
Materials used for these reactors require high dimensional stability and most importantly corrosion-resistant , due to the molten salt of MSRs being corrosive itself .
Some materials that fit the bill include nickel-base super alloys , silicon carbide , specific grades of graphite and refractory alloys , are expensive in nature .
Hence , the cost of operation will not be price-friendly as claimed .
Nevertheless , introduction of MSRs still deserve strong support as they prove to be the best solution for improving energy efficiency and developing renewable energies .
Prompt development of MSRs is especially required for rising countries such as China and India .
These countries are unable to satisfy their energy needs with solely just based on the available avenues for energy sources currently .
In conclusion , fourth generation nuclear energy is the best substitution for coal and natural gas .
Current emissions of carbon dioxide from automobiles and industries are furiously contributing to global warming .
We have already crossed the thresh hold of acceptable greenhouse gases emission levels .
Thus , preventing accelerated climate change beyond human control is of greatest priority .
According to a study done by the Sunssex Energy Group based in the University of Sussex , the world's fossil fuel supply is currently dwindling and will be running out within the next 20 years  .
Moreover , the increasing emission of carbon dioxide from the burning of fossil fuel was proven to be one of the factors in causing climate change  .
These two major issues will lead to more people accepting the use of nuclear energy .
However , there remains doubt on the safety of nuclear reactors' operation and hence , public might not fully accept the concept of nuclear reactor .
In order to make the nuclear reactor safer , cleaner and cheaper , the Generation IV International Forum was established in mid 2001 for further research on the III generation nuclear reactor .
In the late of 2002 GIF announced the six best reactor technologies which they believe that will become the futures nuclear reactors .
The six technologies are very high Temperature Reactor  , Super-Critical Water-Cooled  , Molten Salt Reactor  , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor  , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor  , and Lead- Cooled Fast Reactor  .
The below few paragraphs are explained why you should support further research and development on the super-critical water-cooled reactor in term of safety , security and performance .
Butler , D .  .
Nuclear power's new dawn .
Nature , 429 , 238-240 .
Secondly , are the security issues or known as proliferation .
Nuclear power leads to potential security risk , plutonium have to be separated out during reprocessing cycle of nuclear .
Plutonium is a key ingredient of advance nuclear weapons .
Although U .S .A was decided to dump all the plutonium waste to the Yucca Mountain , they never mention the level of safety that can be achieved .
Consequently , public claims that nuclear power wastes create a high degree of proliferation risks and until today there is no solution on it .
Among the six technologies in the IV generation of nuclear power only SCWR and VTHR no required waste recycling .
In the super-critical water-cooled reactor system the waste recycling was optional , which means that SCWR can operate without having to depend on the contentious reprocessing of plutonium waste  .
In conclusion , this technology was independent with the proliferation risks .
Last but not least is the performance of the super-critical water-cooled reactor  .
SCWR consider one of the most promising future nuclear reactors because of the high thermal efficiency .
The use of multi-pass flows system in the SCWR allows the production of process heat on demand and improves the thermal efficiency .
The thermal efficiency of SCWR is about 45% , which is much higher than the generation III light water reactor of 33% of thermal efficiency ) .
Moreover , the distributed fuel channels in the SCWR allow the system optimized fuel bundles into each channel .
Thus , an appropriate fuel cycle , flow , cladding temperature and power distributes independently can be achieved , this ensures the stability and predictable performance of the reactors .
In conclusion , super-critical water-cooled reactor was proven that it is cleaner , safer and having higher performance as compare with the generation III nuclear reactor .
On the other hand , to reduce the emission of carbon dioxide during the burning fossil fuel we should now support super-critical water reactor for further research and development .
Super- critical water-cooled reactor is the best future reactor to generate sufficient energy to fulfill the need of energy from public .

Nuclear power is an energy produced from controlled nuclear chemical reactions .
Commercial plants in use today use nuclear fission reactions , which is a result of a large molecule breaking into its smaller fragments .
Nuclear fusion reactions are believed to be much safer than fission and appear potentially viable , though technically it is difficult to take place .
Fusion power has been under intense theoretical and experimental investigation for many years .
The atomic bombs dropped on the island of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in Japan during the Second World War and Chernobyl Nuclear plant that caused two explosions in 1986 have raised eyebrows about the devastating effects of nuclear energy .
The Chernobyl disaster , especially , exposed millions of people to radioactive chemicals and has been linked to many forms of cancer in Eastern Europe and Russia , as well as destroying animals and plants .
These two incidents have highlighted the power of nuclear energy , which has caused so much controversy as to whether it has become a liability or a source of energy to the world .
Electric utility reactors heat water to produce steam , which is then used to generate electric energy .
In 2007 , 14% of the world's electricity came from nuclear power , despite concerns about safety and radioactive waste management .
More than 150 of such plants were built .
In this way , nuclear power has become an independent source of energy to meet the rising demand of a country and an increasingly growing global population .
These reactors can also be used to split hydrogen from water thermochemically .
Many countries around the world that largely depend on oil and fossil fuels for their energy needs are betting on hydrogen as the fuel of the future , using fuel cells to convert the gas into electricity for cars and homes .
Research has been done by many countries to improve on generations of reactors , some of which are in operation now .
The latest theoretical nuclear reactor design has been drafted up by a consortium of ten nations that are planning the nuclear reactors of tomorrow .
The Generation IV reactors are expected to be available by 2030 .
These new plants would operate at high temperatures to improve their efficiency and they would include simplified safety features that rely on non sophisticated back up systems to eradicate any problems .
One such reactor that we could see in the near future is the Very-High-Temperature-Reactor  , which allows for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity , up to more than half of what could be produced previously .
The problem of high operating temperatures is eliminated by using coolants that use inert helium .
Another important point to consider is that nuclear energy is not a source of carbon dioxide emission , unlike the burning of fossil fuels .
With the "greenhouse" effect and the environmental issue of global warming , nuclear energy has come at the right time to slow down the melting of the ice caps and stop the rise of sea levels .
As much as there are many positive reasons to use nuclear power , many people still have their doubts about this source of energy , mainly due to the fact that they remembered the infamous Chernobyl incident and the atomic bombs of World War Two .
Any accidents could lead to widespread damage and nobody can afford another radioactive leakage which could signal the end of nuclear energy .
Despite a generally high security standard , accidents will , nonetheless , happen .
Technically , it is almost impossible to build a plant which is totally safe .
There is always a chance of the plant failing .
The consequences of an accident would be absolutely devastating for both humans and nature , as in the past .
In addition , the power plants , together with the nuclear waste , could be targets for terrorist attacks .
No atomic energy plant in the world could withstand an attack similar to the infamous 9/11 .
Such a terrorist act would have catastrophic effects for the entire world .
Researchers have not solved the problem of radioactive waste produced by plants .
This waste from nuclear energy is extremely dangerous and can be used for the production of nuclear weapons .
To carry out ERIS , many training courses and regular exercises are essential in order to make the nuclear worker able to deal with radiation leaks or other accidents .
These essential courses and exercises will consume a lot of money to carry out .
Besides the cost for training , we still need money for introducing those advanced technology skills , modern facilities and equipment into the nuclear power plants .
According to H .J .
Laue  , a total number of 400 experts in more than 60 Member States as well as the advanced equipment cost US $10million .
It is a big amount and always need a consortium to become the backbone .
However , there are many obstacles and contradictions in finding a big consortium to become the backbone .
Hence , the ERIS becomes not feasible enough to be carried out .

Furthermore , this Emergency Response Information System may not be reliable as well .
In order to have quick and effective response to any nuclear emergency , this system requires a complete round-the-clock operation centre  .
There must have a very close relation and contact between each stage of operation facilities of the system in order to perform well when incidents happen .
Even in the midnight , there still must have workers to monitor the system to ensure that the system is functional for 24 hours .
Besides , most of the public are ignorant and do not have much knowledge regarding this system .
They do not know what they should do if there is an accident .
In addition , government should also have good coordinate with the nuclear power plants regarding the safety issues and be very clear of what they should do with this system when accident happens .
Although this system is efficient to protect people when incidents suddenly happen , nobody can give 100% guarantee for this system to perform well as this system consists of many operation stages and a wide range of people to monitor it .
To sum up , this emergency response information system is a good system to protect public after incident happens .
However , it has to be improved and developed more in-depth to ensure its safeness and enhance its feasibility .
The countries that are developing this nuclear power must make good use of the nuclear power as the energy source for people's daily use .
People will definitely not give up this nuclear power as it has a lot of potential as an energy source .
Therefore , design to enhance the safety of nuclear power plants becomes a long-term project of the world .
Consequently , the nuclear power source will be used by public extensively .

Firstly , all stages of the nuclear fuel cycle involve potentially harmful effects on the environment or mankind due to the high reactivity , the radiation emitted by nuclear wastes and the huge heat dissipation during nuclear processes .
Any flaws in the reactor design or processes could result in disastrous circumstances .
For instance , the Chernobyl accident is still causing deaths years after the accident , mainly dying from cancer caused by exposure to radiation from the highly radioactive waste products released after the massive steam explosion , due to system flaws , and a second non-nuclear explosion  .
In a 2005 report , The Chernobyl Forum , led by the International Atomic Energy Agency and World Health Organization , attributed 56 direct deaths , and estimated over thousands more death out of the most highly exposed people .
The Three Mile Island accident is another example , which occurred due to a partial core meltdown in one of its unit  .
The above examples illustrate the potential dangers of nuclear power due to the explosive and radioactive characteristics .
The radiation coming from these nuclear wastes will not only produce an instant harm , but also a long-term effect on residents in affected areas , spreading across generations .
Keeping that in mind , the gas-cooled fast reactor of the generation IV reactor concept which requires research on irradiation- resistance material , post the potential harms due to radiation .
Furthermore , the need of research on heat resistance material and security in various reactor concepts in generation IV concept is also worrying in terms of the possibilities of nuclear accidents in the future .

In addition , there are better alternatives such as the renewable energy that will be able to support as in a long-run .
Hence , the funds pumped into development of nuclear power should be used in development of renewable resources that are more cost- effective .

In Singapore , according to the Ministry of Manpower  , there are about a total number of 11000 cases of fatality and non fatality of occupational accident occur in Singapore and 60 people died in these accidents per annum .
The accident of the Nicoll Highway Collapse in year 2004 is one of the most catastrophic accidents in the construction sector of Singapore , which took away 4 lives .
According to the accident investigation report  , it was found that the main cause of the collapse was due to underdesign of the retaining wall which could not handle the stress of holding up the tunnel .
Although some people might think that the effectiveness of psychology in preventing accident from occurring is controversial , however I believe that the use of psychology during design process can prevent this accident from occurring .
Many people think that not only the Nicoll Highway Collapse incident , but most of the major accidents were unexpected and were mainly caused by errors in human judgment .
They believe that psychology could do nothing in preventing the accident from occurring  .
However , in certain aspect accident can be prevented if psychology is introduced to these situations during the design stage .
According to Heinrich Domino theory , it is found that accident is caused by the chain reaction of a series of factor .
Moreover , "Heinrich proposes that the removal of unsafe act and unsafe conditions will prevent accident , as from his research it was found that these were the direct or immediate causes of most accident"  .
In the United Kingdom , the approach of understanding human behaviour was used in a practical set of Human Factors Analysis Tools which was developed by Mr Ronny Lardner & Mr Richard Scaife .
It had make significant enhancement in the steel- making , chemical manufacture and construction industry in preventing accident at work .
Besides that , with this Human Factors Analysis Tools  , the originator has also won the Occupational Psychology Practitioner of the Year in year 2006  .
In conclusion , although accidents are unexpected , it is possible to prevent and minimize accident from occurring in certain aspect by psychology approach on design processes .
This has also proved that it is feasible in accident prevention as the MOM has made an obligatory requirement that all work sites must employ a Work Site Safety and Health Officer before the commencement of a project  .
30 years after the Three Mile Island accident , and 23 years after the Chernobyl disaster , the horrors and fears of a nuclear reactor meltdown might have died down considerably .
But the general public is still cautious about accepting nuclear power as a viable energy source .
Although we should never forget the painful lessons of Chernobyl and Three Mile Island , we should also be open-minded about the possibilities that generation IV nuclear reactors brings .
Of the 6 generation IV reactors earmarked for further development , the gas cooled fast reactor design is both innovative and dedicated to becoming an efficient and sustainable nuclear energy option .
According to a recent US poll , a significant 44 .7% of the respondents think that nuclear is somewhat dangerous or very dangerous .
And they are not wrong in thinking that , given that the radioactive uranium used as fuel is inherently dangerous , being extremely lethal to human health and polluting to the environment .
To address the safety concerns of the public , this design envisioned many safeguard systems .
A NEA report stated that a 'three barrier principle' will be implemented , and there will be 'cladding at fuel levels vessels and primary circuit' .
This means that the radioactive nuclear fuels will be well contained by three separate layers of shielding material , greatly reducing the chances of leakage .
Furthermore the report emphasized the employment of 2 separate and redundant heat removal systems .
One is a passive system that uses natural convection while the other is an active system that uses circulators to pass the gas through the reactor core .
The coolant will be helium , an inert gas that is much safer than the sodium liquid used in sodium-cooled fast reactors .
A major constraint of nuclear power is the tricky issue of waste disposal .
Nuclear wastes need to be stored in deep geological repositories for thousands of years .
Hence the treatment of nuclear waste will be a major public concern .
A key feature of the gas cooled fast reactor is that it is a fast neutron reactor that fully recycles actinides .
According to 'Nuclear power's new dawn' published on Nature , '96% of spent fuels consist of uranium and plutonium' in other words more fuels can be generated if the wastes are to be reprocessed .
In the gas cooled fast reactor , radioactive byproducts are recycled and the waste eventually produced will only be a fraction of that produced by reactors with once through uranium fuel cycles .
In addition , as the design is a fast neutron reactor , it produces excess neutrons which can be used to transmute the nuclear waste to isotopes of shorter half-lives , reducing the toxicity of the waste .
This design also addresses a security concern of nuclear waste reprocessing .
Currently , in the logistics of reprocessing , nuclear wastes are transported to reprocessing facilities which recovers the uranium and plutonium before sending them to another mixed oxide fuel reactors to be burnt as fuels .
This involves frequent transportation of highly dangerous radioactive materials over long distances .
This exposes a security risk as an accident can cause spillage of radioactive materials or a hijack can send these materials into the hands of terrorists .
However a report by Hussein Khalil from the Argonne National Laboratories in USA envisioned 'an integrated , onsite spent fuel treatment and refabrication plant' .
This essentially obliterates the security risks involved in transporting radioactive wastes and allows security efforts to be focused on plant itself .
Lastly , this design is committed to becoming a sustainable form of nuclear power .
Contrary to popular beliefs that nuclear energy is renewable , uranium is actually a rare element that can be depleted .
In this aspect , the gas cooled fast reactor is attractive as it boasts higher efficiency in converting heat energy into electricity than conventional nuclear reactors .
This is achievable by running the reactor at 850 C , a temperature that is kept in check by the helium heat removal system .
The higher efficiency if this reactor design together with the recycling of wastes , meant that the same amount of fuel will produce electricity many times more than the conventional reactor .
In conclusion , many advantages of the gas cooled fast reactor looked extremely promising .
It addresses the public's concern about safety with a very comprehensive safeguard system .
Although nuclear waste remains as problematic , it is reduced to a minimum .
Above all , it shows the potential to be sustainable , an advantage that can allow it to be built on a large enough scale to shoulder a significant portion of the world's energy needs .
Therefore its research and development should supported and properly funded so that one day it can reach its full potential and alleviate some of the world's energy problems .
The Generation IV International Forum  , a research and development group organized by ten nations to carry out the next generation nuclear energy , is identifying and selecting six nuclear energy systems with variety of reactors , energy conversion systems , and fuel cycle technologies .
With GIF's nuclear technology , the concerns of public mentioned above would be solved .
Among the six generation IV reactor concepts , the most advanced concept is VHTR which is a more efficient way of energy conversion of heat to electricity and can provide 50% more energy from the same amount of fuel compared with other conventional nuclear plants .
Hence , with VHTR technology , nuclear energy can be a very reliable energy source for electricity in many countries .
Regarding nuclear power plants , safety features of the plant is the highest priority concern of the public .
There were nuclear accident hazards all over the world in a few decades ago , for example , the reactor core explosion at Chernobyl in Ukraine , killed many people , two people died in the initial explosion while other deaths resulted from radiation poisoning  .
The VHTR system has its own safety features such as very high system temperature , enhanced goals for safety and reliability , low decay heat load , low power density with easily coolant geometry and so on  .
The core is composed of non-combustible nuclear grade graphite which has a very stable structure even at high temperature and high heat capacity .
So , the possibility of explosion due to the very high temperature becomes extremely low .
Moreover , the additional safety features such as how to minimize the damages and protect lives if accident occurs will also be developed further  .
Another concern on nuclear energy source is how to dispose the nuclear wastes which are long-lived , radioactive and toxic .
As VHTR operates at very high temperature , there are fewer wastes to reprocess than those of other systems .
The reprocessing will cut off 96% of the nuclear waste produced which consists of plutonium and uranium and only about 1% of long- lived element is left as residue .
There are also additional steps of process to convert those long-lived wastes into element with shorter half- lives , i .e .
they may take just centuries to decay instead of more than 300 ,000 years  .
Hence , nuclear waste disposal will not be a great concern in future .
Nuclear terrorism has always been a threat to the world since the sudden attack in Hiroshima in 1945 .
The VHTR is designed carefully to discourage weapon proliferation and to increase assurance that they are very unattractive and the least desirable route for diversion or theft of weapons usable materials , and providing increased physical protection against terrorism .
Moreover , the plutonium , which is the main ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons , produced from the nuclear waste cannot be picked up safely with a pair of gloves like pure plutonium as it is spiked with radioactive and heat-producing elements to make it easier to handle .
Hence , it would be harder to steal or use the material by terrorists .
Since VHTR is still in the way of research , the earliest delivery will be in 2020  .
Further security features can be added before the delivery time .
With the qualified security system developed , the nuclear terrorism can be prevented .
In conclusion , in view of the increasing need for more energy globally , nuclear energy will become essential in the future once its negative aspects such as safety issues , waste management and potential exploitation of plutonium proliferation by terrorists can be controlled .
This , in fact , has become possible after the development of VHTR which incorporates the new features to minimize the risks of accidents and enable safer disposal of nuclear waste .
Therefore , research for VHTR technology should be funded for further development to reach its optimal .
In our modern technological society of today , people make substantial use of electricity for their daily needs .
In the United States alone , people have used close to 4 million million kwh of electricity .
However , as society grows , the demand for such energy grows as well .
The usage of fossil fuel as a fuel at power plants is projected to increase by 44 percent from 2006 to 2003 .
In this new dawn , nuclear power is a new technology set to replace fossil fuel .
With promises of lower cost , lesser waste and a safer alternative , it may seem that Nuclear power with introduction of generation IV reactors such as the super-critical-water- cooled reactors is the next generation of power plants .
But these promises are empty promises if one would look deeper into the issue of Nuclear Power .
Therefore , support of further research and development funding for Nuclear power should not be continued .
The Challenges of Nuclear Power , Accidents at Nuclear Power Plants , Retrieved October 27 ,2009 from nuclearinfo .net site: http://nuclearinfo .net/Nuclearpower/TheRisksOfNuclearPower
With regards to safety , it was reported that there is more cases of fatality for coal powered plants than their Nuclear counterparts .
In the last 40 years , 6400 died due to coal power plant related accidents while only 31 died in Nuclear powered ones .
Therefore , it is claimed that Nuclear is a much safer choice .
However , we cannot ignore that Murphy's Law will still hold .
There will be a point in time where there will be an error which could result in an accident in the Nuclear power plants one day .
This single incident will have castastrophical effects and the fatality will be a substantial amount .
In the Chernobyl disaster alone which happen on 28 April 1986 , 47 people died on the spot with 4000 more dying from cancer .
The effects of the incident are still felt greatly today with the radio activeness of the area still a recorded high despite three decades of clearing up .
Hence , we only need one nuclear accident to cause damage of what a coal plant might have caused in more than 50 years .
On top of what have been pointed out , Nuclear Power will also invoke security issues in the region .
While used as a form of deterrence , it is also seen as a threat by neighbouring countries .
This will led to an arms race which might inevitably cause some conflicts in the region .
An example is the Nuclear programs of Iran .
Iran developed its nuclear programs as form of deterrence and to build up national pride .
However , many neighbouring countries saw it as an excuse for the building of Nuclear weapons as they felt threatened .
Hence , many conflicts resulted .
From this , we can see that Nuclear Power not only brings issues to the country itself who are developing it but other neighbouring countries in the region as well .
To conclude , with so many flaws in the claims of benefits from supporters of nuclear energy , it will be a wiser choice to delay if not stop further research and development funding for it .
The price for a small mistake in the pursue of nuclear energy is too much for mankind to pay .
Alternative sources of energy should be considered instead .

Electricity has become an important component of the human world since it is needed to power and sustain technology .
However , since a large amount of electricity is needed , commercial power generators were built to convert the fuel into electricity .
While there are many types of fuel that can be considered , coal has been the popualr choice .
Another option , which is nuclear energy , had been explored with moderate success but currently only holds a 17% share of the global energy supply  .
However , development in the technology used by nuclear reactors are still on-going with the recent introduction of Generation-IV nuclear reactor concepts , one of them being the molten salt reactor .
The molten salt reactor , while not exactly a new idea , has resurfaced after the introduction of the generation IV concepts of nuclear reactors .
The major draw in continuing the research of molten salt reactor is its potential to make converting electricity from nuclear energy much safer , environmentally friendly and more viable economically as compared to the modern day reactors .
One reason that impedes the continuation of research of the molten salt reactor is the general caution on the issue of nuclear waste proliferation .
A key step in current nuclear power generation , which is seperation of the by-products in the nuclear reactor wastes , would yield materials usable in the creation of highly destructive weapons .
However , the design of molten salt reactors allow for on-site reprocessing of the reactor waste , followed by a direct feed of the recovered and reusable fuel back into the energy generating cycle  .
This will ensure that the majority of the fuel is burnt in the process , leaving very low level of enriched fuel remaining that can be extracted for use for the manufacture of nuclear weapons .
Climate Change Technology , 2006 IEEE , 1-8 .
The other alternative of replacing coal is arguably the use of solar or wind energy .
This will alleviate the current problem of emission of greenhouse gases from the burning of coal , but unlike nuclear energy , solar and wind energy is highly dependent on the weather , making it unreliable .
The heat and high amount of electricity generated by the molten salt reactor , on the other hand , can be said to be constant and can be further tapped into for the production of hydrogen  .
The hydrogen produced by the reactor will have further uses as fuel for other systems where the combustion of it will not produce any greenhouse gases .
The continual research of the molten salt reactor will also result in the use of nuclear reactors being more economical compared to the current situation .
For example , the amount of uranium currently mined from the earth surfaces have been approximated to last for another 100-200 years as fuel for the reactors  .
Molten salt reactors can also use thorium as fuel , which reserves are estimated to be four times larger than that of uranium  .
However , since the fuel is expected to be close to , or completely , burnt up in the molten salt reactor as opposed to current type of reactors , this higher level of fuel efficiency can drive the duration of which the uranium reserves can sustain the global energy comsumption longer than estimated .
The increase in fuel efficiency will reduce operational cost since there will be lesser need for storage of long life radioactive waste products .
Also , considering the development of advanced materials in the further research of molten salt reactor , the actual amount of materials needed in the building can be reduce thus reducing overall cost .
For example , by replacing the stainless steel commonly found in reactors with other , equally or stronger and more durable , alloys that does not use nickle , the cost of building the reactor can be reduced since the price of nickle has been increasing in recent times  .
While the use of nuclear energy rises some concern in terms of security and cost , the continuous research of molten salt reactors can solve them through the recycling of fuel and the use of a different variant of fuel .
However , while the research cost of a reactor is very high , this can be solved through the cooperation of more contries , especially the larger start-up countries like China .
In the long run , one of the benefits of using molten salt reactors can also be observed from the fact that it can meet the energy demands while maintaining a clean environment .

EIC
In the recent two decades , adopting nuclear energy as a sustainable source of energy has become one of the heated arguments in the world .
The scientists stated that coal and fossil fuels on earth are depleting at an alarming rate and would be running out in the next century .
Nuclear energy has thus emerged as one of the most possible solutions .
However , due to the strong oppositions from the public about the safety factors , many countries are caught in a dilemma that whether they should build a nuclear plant or not .
It is indeed true that a country must not ignore the safety factors of building a nuclear plant .
However , in the current situation where there are no better alternatives , nuclear energy seems to be the most suitable energy for the future and therefore one of the generation IV reactors , lead-coaled fast reactor , should be adopted as the most suitable one .
Firstly , the argument brought by most opponents is the safety issue .
They declare that the nuclear reaction which may be termed as nuclear fission and nuclear fusion is extremely dangerous and even fatal to human beings .
The Chernobyl accident in 1986 was a reminder of the importance of the safety .
30 people were killed during the accident and many more injured or adversely affected .
It was indeed a disastrous accident which subsequently made nuclear plant like a scientific devil .
However , the reactor used in fact lacked some basic engineering provisions for safety , probably due to technological constrains at that time .
With the advancement in science and technology nowadays , the level of danger of the nuclear reactors would be minimised to the lowest degree .
The generation IV reactor , lead-coaled fast reactor , is the safest one among the four being proposed .
It is operated under low pressure which means that the nuclear reactions are less vigorous .
In addition , the operating temperature allows a range from 550 to 800 degrees .
This medium range of temperature increases the function capacity of the reactor as compared to those which only operate at a fixed temperature .
On top of that , lead which is used as the main source is less reactive metal compared to sodium for sodium-coaled fast reactors .
Therefore , safety is ensured to the greatest possible level .
Moreover , another opposing view is that the cost for building a nuclear plant is rather high .
They insist that fuel is still a cheaper source of energy than nuclear power reactors .
The fact is , however , the other way round .
Gas-fired power plants are very cheap and quick to build , but relatively very expensive to operate due to the cost of their fuel .
In contrast , nuclear power reactors are expensive to build but relatively cheap to operate .
It might take millions of dollars to build the lead-coaled fast reactor , but once it is constructed , it will be operating at a reasonably high capacity over many years .
Furthermore , the cost for mining out and transporting the coal and fuel is also very expensive due to their scarcity whereas the sources for nuclear power plant are much cheaper since plenty of uranium can be extracted from the earth's crust .
The abundance of uranium on earth also means that it is a more powerful way of generating electricity .
Most importantly , the waste generated by this reactor can also be recycled and thus there is virtually no pollution to the environment .
Hence , in the long run , it is more economical to adopt lead-coaled fast reactor which is also an environmental source of energy .
The final argument advanced by opponents is that there are other alternative sources of safer energy such as solar energy and wind turbine , why do we need to adopt the nuclear power reactors which are still untested ?
Recent research indeed shows that the sun is a variable source of energy .
In addition , thermal energy can be stored in a system so that solar energy will still be available even at night .
However , can we really solely rely on it ?
What will happen during the rainy seasons and will there be enough solar energy to sustain our daily usage ?
The answer is most probably not .
We still have to rely on other sources when solar energy is running low at times .
On the other hand , unlike solar energy , the provision of nuclear power by lead-coaled fast reactors does not depend on weather or location .
As long as the nuclear sources are provided such as lead and uranium , energy will be generated .
Therefore , lead-coaled fast reactor is a more efficient and reliable energy source .
All in all , with the depleting source of coal and fuel , lead-coaled fast reactors will be the most likely alternative in the future .
With the technological advancement and engineering design , the safety of nuclear reactors will be ensured as much as possible .
It is also a relatively economical and yet efficient source of energy .
Therefore , such type of nuclear power reactors should be adopted in the future as a promising source of energy .
The world depends largely on external energy to function all activities in the society .
The world's main energy resource , which is the fossil fuels are slowly depleting .
As a result , there is a need to depend on other alternative energy resources to satisfy our high energy demands .
Nuclear power proves to be an effective energy source as it can generate electricity efficiently to satisfy the world's energy needs .
However , there are many controversies over the use of nuclear power , in which many critics criticize on the use of it .
Some of the topmost concerns that are widely mentioned are safety , costs and the performance .
Safety issues involving past nuclear accidents still strikes fear in the public's heart .
For example , "the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded , killing some 31 people immediately and spewing radioactive debris across Europe ."
The high cost of building nuclear plants is also a main concern .
Articles have shown that many experts agree that nuclear power costs significantly higher in relative to the other major energy source .
Moreover , there are still many doubts on whether nuclear power has a competitive edge over other alternative energy providers in terms of performance .
With all this concerns on the use of nuclear power , it seems that nuclear power poses more of a problem than a beneficial energy source .
However , with the building of generation IV reactors such as VHTR , problems that the old Generation reactors faced will be greatly reduced , making nuclear power an essential energy source .
Renewable Energy and Electricity {http://www .world-nuclear .org/info/inf10 .html}
Regarding to the safety concerns , opponents of nuclear power might argue that nuclear reactors are potentially dangerous as the effects from any nuclear accidents would be disastrous to both the environment and the people .
However , Generation IV reactor such as VHTR has advanced safety mechanism which will minimize the probability of accidents occurring .
VHTR is capable of dissipating decay heat even under severe accident conditions and its graphite structure is able to withstand high temperature to prevent itself from self-sustained combustion .
According to the "Four levels of safety" VHTR is the only reactor that meets the level 1 safety criterion , which means that it is immune to major structural failure and operator error .
Therefore , VHTR will be a safe nuclear reactor , liable with minimal accidents .
Regarding costs issue , Critics might debate that the high financial costs in building nuclear plants worldwide will create a negative impact on the economy .
Although the cost of building nuclear plants is high , future benefits from nuclear power will be able to boost the economy greatly .
For example , hydrogen produced in the nuclear reactor would be used to power the next generation hydrogen fuelled cars .
In comparison to other alternative hydrogen producing methods , VHTR produces hydrogen at a lower costs .
Statistics shown that "VHTR produces hydrogen at $1 .40/kg , steam reformation of hydrogen costs at $6 .30/MBtu while MHR produced hydrogen costs at $1 .52/kg ."
In addition , using VHTR to produce energy would reduce the economic costs spent in controlling carbon dioxide emissions from the burning of fossil fuels .
Regarding the performance issues , critics might strongly argue that the frequent unplanned nuclear shutdown will make nuclear power the most inefficient energy among other energy sources .
However , no external energy source in this world is perfect .
For example , solar power cannot be generated at night and wind energy cannot be harnessed without wind .
Sun , wind , tides and waves cannot be controlled to provide directly either continuous base-load power or peak-load power when it is needed .
Therefore , nuclear power will still be a preference to other alternatives as it does not depend on the inconsistency of nature .
In addition , VHTR's gas turbine system can generate electricity at an efficiency of 50 % whereby existing nuclear power plant generates at only 33% . , making it one of the best performance nuclear reactor .
In conclusion , nuclear power is most preferred as an energy source in terms of its performance and efficiency .
In comparison to older generation reactor , Generation IV reactor will have better safety and costs effective features .
VHTR is one of the best generation IV reactors , making it one of the most reliable energy providers in the future .
So , further research and funding for the VHTR will definitely benefit the future generations .

It is the 21st century and the world energy consumption is on the rise .
With this prominent trend , there is a pressing need for the world to increase the amount of energy production .
Currently , the world energy consumption is supported largely by natural fuel .
According to Marshall & Robert  , the rising costs and rapid depletion of natural fuel lead to the search for a more sustainable energy source .
Thus , countries focused on the development of nuclear reactors , the most viable energy source that seemingly appears to be endless .
The most promising concept of the latest generation IV nuclear reactors would be the Very High Temperature Reactor  .
Another popular concept would be the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor  .
However , in terms safety concerns , costs and overall performance , the VHTR would be the best nuclear reactor to be implemented . 
According to Butler , safety is a main priority in the designs of new nuclear reactors due to previous nuclear disasters of Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
Hence , we shall first look at the safety aspects .
The Sodium-cooled Reactor boasts a passive cooling system with a large thermal inertia .
There is large margin between the operational temperature and the coolant boiling temperature .
This would mean a relatively safer work environment in additional to the low operating pressure conditions .
However , the passive cooling system of SFR has major flaws .
It is unsafe in the sense that it does not allow for critical intervention in times of emergency .
The cooling system will have a slower response time .
Moreover , sodium as a coolant is radio-active , which requires additional safety measures to neutralize its harmful effects . 
In comparison , the VHTR model will be using helium as its coolant , which is an inert gas , and thus would be much safer than sodium .
The cooling system of the VHTR will be a helium turbine system , operating separately under stringent human control allowing for quicker actions to be taken in the situation of overheating .
Costs factors are taken into consideration given the scale of the nuclear reactors .
The Sodium-Cooled Reactor claimed to be cheaper in terms of research costs .
Given that the technology base exists for the SFR , it was said that not much additional extensive research has to done .
This is not the case .
In actual fact , much technical viability issues are waiting to be resolved .
According to the US DOE Nuclear research Due to the instability and radio-active state of sodium , more research has to be done to find suitable materials for its reactor primary core . 
Very High Temperature Reactor would be a much cheaper option as the core for its plant has been confirmed to be graphite .
As Sterbentz brought up in his report on VHTR , graphite is a much stable and cheaper material in comparison to the suggested cores for SFR .
In addition , with low reactions to heat and chemical irradiation , replacement of the graphite cores only need to be done around five years . 
According to Austrian Institute of Ecology  ,the performance for SFR was rated highly by for its closed fuel system which recycles 99 .9% of the actinides in its process .
There is close to no nuclear waste after the once through system .
However , the net plant efficiency of the SFR is only around 40% .
The energy output is much lesser than the VHTR models which will exceed 50% .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen in addition to electricity .
This additional fuel production would mean a larger net output by VHTR in comparison to SFR . .
In conclusion , the Very High Temperature Reactor would be the best nuclear reactor concepts to be implemented .
Whether it is about safety issues , costs factors or performance level , the VHTR is a notch above its peers , the SFR for example .
The VHTR's potential as the best nuclear reactor is recognized by many countries like France , Japan and United States of America .
It is given the most funding and research attention by these countries .
Future world energy consumption is well taken care of .
Nuclear energy sources have various benefits over other energy sources .
Firstly , nuclear power plant is more cost effective as compared to other energy sources .
For example , although the start-up cost of building the VHTR plant is very high , which is up to US$10 billion to build , it is cheaper as compared to other fuel , such as bio fuel , in the long run .
This is because hydrogen gas is produced during the nuclear reaction process .
Hydrogen gas can be used as a fuel to power vehicles .
Consequently , many countries have regarded VHTR as the energy for the future , because it produces hydrogen gas as a complimentary energy source that is reusable .
Since the reactor can separate hydrogen gas from water thermodynamically during the nuclear reaction at an extremely high temperature of about 700-900 degree celcius .
Additionally , according to the economics concept , there is less third party cost incurred by the others if nuclear power is used instead of other fuels .
It is relatively cleaner to the environment as compared to other sources of fuels .
So , the sum of all the cost of the nuclear power is relatively lower than the other sources of fuels .
Thus , further improvement should be made to the VHTR to increase its efficiency .
Secondly , nuclear energy , especially the VHTR , produces less waste as compared to its corresponding energy source .
It is known that large percentage of the greenhouse gases present today is due to the use of petroleum and also due to the combustion of fossil fuels .
The burning of fossil fuels also produced other waste products that are harmful to the environment .
Even though VHTR produces nuclear waste which will emit harmful radioactivity , the industry has come up with effective ways to dispose the nuclear waste .
One such method is to bury the nuclear waste to the ground .
Research had shown that the radioactivity that is produced by the nuclear waste under the ground is equivalent to the radioactivity emitted by the cosmic rays .
Thus , human are safe from the radioactivity produced by the nuclear waste .
Ergo , nuclear power , especially for the VHTR , is a much cleaner source of energy to the environment , further research and development should be done on it .
In essence , nuclear power , especially the VHTR , is more cost effective in the long run as compared to other energy source .
In addition , it is less harmful to the environment and it also ensures human safety .
Moreover , it is shown that VHTR is 40% more effective in producing energy as compared to the other sources of fuels .
Thus , in my opinion , more funding should be provided for the research and development to further improve the nuclear power , the research should focus more on the VHTR .
The usage of nuclear plants to generate electricity has been a controversial issue decades ago , due to the disastrous incidents like the Three Miles island and Chernobyl , which has resulted in major health issue caused by radiation exposure .
The public opposition has been rejecting the construction of nuclear plants due to safety concern .
However , as technology evolved with time , the Generation IV power plants are better in terms of security , cost and performance .
Hence , more people are accepting the usage of nuclear energy .
In 2008 , a survey showed that the number of Americans that supports nuclear energy has increased from 10% in 2001 , to around 50% in 2008  .
Half the public is still opposing the usage of nuclear energy .
One of the main reasons stated by the opposition is nuclear plants consumed uranium and produced nuclear waste , which could be used to manufacture nuclear weapon .
Furthermore , the nuclear waste emits radiation that is harmful to humans and the environment .
However , these situations can be prevented with Generation IV molten salt reactors .
The molten salt reactors are capable of recycling the nuclear waste to produce more electrical energy , and the waste created from recycling process will not be able to use to create nuclear weapon .
This process also helps to avoid the existing practice of spending large amount of money on operation cost to store the nuclear waste .
In addition , the International Atomic Energy Agency has set up necessary guidelines for the governments to ensure the highest level of security for the nuclear facilities .
The Generation IV plants are built to shutdown automatically in the events of a meltdown or terrorist attack  .
To prevent the radiation resulted in the Chernobyl incident , the new plants are built with shielding that can prevent radiation from escaping into the surroundings for fear of a meltdown .
Wolff , G . Bring me sunshine .
Retrieved October 11 , 2009 , from http://www .trec-uk .org .uk/articles/022-025_PE_AprMay07_lo .pdf
Opponents have also argued that renewable energy is a better source of energy as it produced cleaner energy when compared to nuclear reactor , which produces radiation and nuclear waste .
In addition , renewable sources are also unlimited , whereas uranium will last another two century at most  .
Thus , they believed that governments should spend the money on research for renewable energy instead of nuclear energy .
On the other hand , with the technology of Generation IV reactors , the radiation and nuclear waste can be eliminated .
Furthermore , the electricity produced from renewable sources like solar energy is in Mega watt per hour , while the electricity produced from nuclear plant is in Giga watt per hour , one thousand times more energy is produced .
In comparison , the biggest solar power generator located in California is able to support half a million users , less than two percent of the city population while a single nuclear plant is able to provide electricity to a few cities .
The vast difference in energy produced supports the funding for research in nuclear energy .
Another issue is Uranium is finite like fossil fuels .
By allocating more funds into the research of nuclear energy , scientists can look for possible alternative elements to fuel the nuclear plants .
Another reason mentioned by the opposition is the extremely large amount of money spent on research and construction of nuclear reactors .
Every year , government that is supportive of nuclear energy has spent billions of dollars in it .
In 2008 , the United State Government has increased their budget allocation for nuclear energy and the research and development for Generation IV power plants to twenty-five billion dollars  .
The opposition stated that the power generated is not worth the cost , as the cost is accumulated from the maintenance and security .
However , in the long term , the power generated will be worth the large amount of money , as the usage cost from nuclear plants is lower than the usage cost from fuel plants .
Furthermore , no greenhouse gas is being produced .
It is definitely worth to spend more to protect the environment .
In conclusion , governments should support further research and development on nuclear energy as the security concern on nuclear waste can be eliminated moreover nuclear plant is the most efficient energy source and the cost of nuclear energy is the cheapest in long term aspect .
With further funding on the research , humans will be able to produce energy source in the long run without damaging the environment .

The robotic surgical technology is a prototype and a new breakthrough in the field of engineering and medicine .
It enhances surgical procedures through improvements in dexterity and precision .
The robotic system uses fine , precise robotic arms and its three dimensional high resolution computed image guides the surgeon during operation .
This advanced dexterity and precision of operation will eliminate the need for large incisions on patients .
CNN international Health News 24 September 2009 "Landmark in Surgery , Past , present and future" {http://edition .cnn .com/2009/HEALTH/09/23/future .surgery .robots/index .html#cnnSTCOther1}
{Robotic Surgery: Part 1} ,2 and 3 , by Jamessowden .

Although the initial clinical outcomes are positive , safety is a major factor why the robotic surgical system still remains fearful to the public .
Safety can be due to technical credibility , surgical liability and operation performance .
Even though there is no absolute in the robotic surgical system to ensure safety of patient , the design of the robotic system can be improved to enhance safety .
Currently , the robotic surgical technology has not been widely accepted by the public mainly due to its uncertainty in safety .
During operation , condition of patient could remain unforeseeable there were additional tasks and decisions needed to be made between the surgeon , the nurses and the robotic system .
For example , during tools changing , the robotic system needed to be paused in order to replace another surgical tool .
During this process , the surgeon has no direct access to the situation it relies largely on verbal exchanges between the nurses and the surgeon to coordinate the surgical procedures .
The differences in prospective in terms of communication with respect to the patient condition and the robotic system create safety issues , mainly due to the potential of miscommunication .
In order to enhance safety , a common ground is needed to be built , through ensuring similar speech patterns .
Therefore , communication between surgeon and nurses will be improved by the sharing of a common set of statements and ideology .
Although the robotic system has improved greatly in its dexterity , it has yet been able to develop its full potential in terms of instrumental design and sensory sensitivity .
This imposes uncertain danger during operation .
According to Health News , 2009) , no credible system is currently available to assess the capability of a surgeon while operating the robotic surgical system .
Dr Kevin Zorn recalled an incident where a patient died from complications after long hours of operation using the robotic surgical system .
In order to account for the safety , the future of the robotic system can be expanded using ultrasound and infrared .
More ideal mechanical surgical tools are to be developed .
In addition , the surgical equipment occupies large spaces which may restrict the movement of nurses and cause delay during operation .
By miniaturizing the equipment will help address the problem , and also save cost in making rooms for the accommodation of this expensive equipment .

During the past few years , there were discussions on whether nuclear power plants are supposed to be built or not .
For the past few centuries , most of our electricity was generated from coal , fuel or oil plants .
As the population increases , it leads to higher demand for electricity , thus more raw resources such as fossil fuel have to be used .
Recently , it has come to our attention that the depletion of fossil fuel is getting faster and it leads to higher electricity cost .
As a result , more people are turning to nuclear power plant as a solution to high electricity cost .
However , before we change to nuclear power plant solution , there are some factors we need to consider .
The factors which would be discussed are such as cost , security and performance .
Some of the reasons why people are opposing to the idea are due to the high construction cost and level of danger of nuclear power plant .
However , for the supporting views , it is because of the lower electricity cost and the ability to meet the world's demand in the future .
Despite the opposing views , the idea to have further research and development funding for the Very-High-Temperature-Reactor is encouraged .
Secondly is the security factor .
According to Bulter  , the public has mentioned the accidents which occurred in 1979 at Three Mile Island and in 1986 at Chernobyl  .
Some of the reasons that these accidents occurred are due to poor technology at that time .
However in generation IV reactor , it has claimed that there would be a security feature called the "Meltdown" Proof which would reduce the temperature to minimum in event of accidents .
As technology advances over the years , we could foresee that the chances of accidents from occurring would be reduced .
Thirdly , for the performance factor , according to Bulter  , it claimed that the VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared with conventional plants .
People have agreed that in order to reach such efficiency , higher temperature would be needed to be generated , thus , causing higher chance of accident .
Once again , this could be resolved by the "Meltdown" Proof mentioned earlier .
In conclusion , we could see that even though there are some disadvantages about the nuclear power plant , it is still beneficial to the public if we are going to operate it in the long run .
The advantages of the nuclear power plant are more than the disadvantages .
Very High Temperature Reactor is one of the six generation IV reactors which need to be developed .
The six generation IV reactors are the vision of the future by Generation IV International Forum  .
GIF looks at the future with nuclear reactor in its mind , because it believes the current coal-burning source of energy would not be sufficient for the world's need by 2050  .
In addition , GIF believes the coal- burning is contributing to global warming by exhausting carbon dioxide to the air .
The six generation IV reactors are believed to be able to replace the coal-burning energy .
These six generation IV reactors are still under testing and research phase .
GIF is researching them in terms of their safety factor , their cost factor and their effect to the environment because these are the public concern about them .
First of all , the safety factor of the nuclear reactors has been highlighted over the past decades by the nuclear-averse public .
This is due to the memories of the past accidents involving the meltdown of partial nuclear reactor .
Looking back at a few decades ago , there are two accidents which brought the world's attention to the importance of safety in the nuclear reactors .
In 1979 , at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , there was a malfunction in a cooling system which caused part of the reactor core to melt and some radioactive gas was released to air , fortunately was not enough to cause any radiation dose above background levels to local residents .
In 1986 , at Chernobyl , Ukraine , a flawed reactor design that was operated with untrained personnel and without proper regard for safety , exploded and released at least five percent of the radioactive reactor core into the atmosphere and the surrounding area .
The two accidents had caused people who lived nearby the nuclear reactors to suffer from the radiation .
Since then , no new nuclear power plants have been built .
The nuclear-averse public opposed the development of generation IV reactors because they are afraid such accidents will happen again and cause more damaged to the people who live nearby nuclear reactors plant .
However , such an argument ignores the fact that generation IV reactors have a 'meltdown proof' feature .
This feature would simplify safety features hence we do not need to rely on sophisticated backup systems or experienced operators .
It is because generation IV reactors can cool themselves down in the event of an accident with minimal human intervention  , thus preventing the meltdown accident to happen again .
Secondly , next factor is the cost of building the nuclear reactors plant .
The nuclear-averse public opposed the development of generation IV reactors because they are too costly to build .
It is true that a country needs to fund billions of dollars in research and development of nuclear reactors plant .
However , it is beneficial for the country in the long run .
With the increasing number of people's population , the demand on the energy source will increase .
One alternate energy source which has been suggested by many of the scientist is nuclear energy .
This is because with the same amount of raw materials , nuclear reactors plant can produce up to ten times more of the energy than the fossil energy plant .
Lastly , the third factor is the effect of nuclear reactors to the environment .
The nuclear-averse public oppose the development of generation IV reactors because they are worried of its waste will pollute the environment .
The waste of the nuclear reactors will last for a few years on earth before it started to deplete .
It will pollute water and air .
However , if it is handled with a proper method , we can recycle it .
GIF is researching a proper method for recycling the waste from nuclear reactors .
When GIF have found out the proper method of recycling , the public can live with ease nearby the nuclear reactor plant .
To conclude , the nuclear-averse public oppose the development of generation IV reactors because they do not understand fully the concept of generation IV reactors .
Once GIF is able to produce the generation IV reactors , the nuclear-averse public should be able to understand and support their development .
Hence , very high temperature reactor needs to be developed for further research .

In the 21th century , energy issue becomes a serious problem that human beings are facing .
It is predicted by experts that the fossil fuels will run out in 250-300 years with oil disappearing in less than 100 years . .
It becomes really urgent to find a substitutable energy source to meet the increasing demand of human beings .
As a result , many scientists have turned to the nuclear energy and are doing research on future Generation IV reactors which are safer and have higher productivity .
Although some people are against these nuclear reactors , but one particular generation IV reactor called molten salt reactor is really worth to be researched on .
Some opponents argued that the safety of the nuclear reactor cannot be guaranteed , and such dangerous power plants should never be built .
They thought that the waste was radioactive and may cause health problem to the people around .
But the real situation is not as worse as they thought .
Besides , the molten salt reactor can solve these problems perfectly .
It is written in Generation VI Reactors that the molten salt reactor uses liquid sodium fluoride as coolant which dissolves the uranium and circulates through graphite core .
In this way , fission products can be removed continuously and actinides as well as plutonium can be fully recycled .
It means that there is no radioactive waste in the whole process .
Therefore , their concern about radioactive waste is not necessary .
Some opponents argued that even though there is no radioactive waste of the plant , the reactor itself is a big safety problem the reactors may explode like the three miles in the United States and cause disasters .
However , According to Power Uprate Safety & Containment Overpressure , the major safety problem for the reactor is that the balance of energy generating and energy removing may be broken due to some reason .
This will cause the temperature and the pressure of the coolant to increase .
As a result , the reactor may explode because of overpressure and will release large amounts of radioactivity .
But for the molten salt reactor , according to Dr . Paul Pickard  , there is lower pressure in it as the boiling point for molten salt is 1400  .
Besides the term which may cause accident is low due to the continuous removal of mobile fission product .
In addition , the molten salt can absorb lots of heat with little change in temperature .
All these guarantee that the balance cannot be broken easily .
As a result , the molten salt reactor is quite safe .
Furthermore , it is mentioned in Power Uprate Safety & Containment Overpressure that an entire system which is designed to match the energy produced by reactor and the energy removed can effectively prevent accident from happening is now used in each reactor in America .
In molten salt reactor , a better or at least the same system will be used to ensure the safety of the reactor .
Modern life depends on energy supply to a great extent .
All the inventions have improved our quality of life and made each human being a large consumer of electricity and fossil fuels .
With the development of technology and the increase of population , energy demand explodes .
Contrarily , the main energy supplier which is non renewable energy resource is disappearing from the earth .
To solve the problem , one way is to gather energy from nature .
However , it is inefficient to feed the whole human beings .
Nuclear reactions were found generating lots of energy rapidly .
Unfortunately , chemical species used in nuclear reactions have incredible destructive power and people are fear of the leakage .
In history , the leakage happened in Bhopal , India in 1984 was a "terrible tragedy" during which "approximately 3 ,800 people died and several thousand other individuals experienced permanent or partial disabilities"  .
The fear of leakage has result in small number of nuclear plants being built on earth .
Nowadays , the generation IV reactors are in development and one of them called Very High Temperature Reactor is worth being developed .
The VHTR has high safety , high working efficiency and ultra-long lifetime which make it the best of the six generation IV reactor .
VHTR has high working efficiency .
The VHTR operates at about 1000 Celsius degree which is enough to produce hydrogen .
Thus , VHTR produces electricity , hydrogen and large amount of process heat concurrently in its working process .
As an energy supplier , VHTR are able to work more efficiently than the others that produce only electricity .
Some may say that the temperature needed for VHTR to operate is high and it is not easy to provide the operating temperature for VHTR .
It is true that VHTR needs more energy to start operation but once it started , it produces energy more efficiently than others .
It is reasonable to say that in the long run , the gain in energy would be more than the excess of cost .
Thus , VHTR is promising in providing energy and solving energy shortage .
Nuclear power generally is electrical power which is produced from controlled nuclear reactions  .
Although nuclear power can give mass product of electrical power compared to other forms of electrical energy , its safety issue makes the public concern about nuclear power production .
Moreover , cost and environmental issues should also be considered .
Among many nuclear reactors built all over the world , one type of reactors is "Sodium-cooled fast reactors" which is operated in temperature of 550 degree Celsius under low pressure .
Power output of this reactor is electricity and can do waste recycling .
But nuclear power is not an efficient way if we consider about storage and safety of nuclear materials as well as huge cost of nuclear power plant construction  .
On the other hand , many countries , such as Pakistan , Japan , China , India as well as the United States are active in nuclear power regardless of the worry of public for safety issue .
The World Nuclear Association mentioned that on average in every 17 days , one new nuclear reactor was set up during the 1980 and this rate may increase to one nuclear reactor per every five days in 2015 .
In 2005 , 2 .1% of world energy was provided by nuclear power and 14% of electricity was produced by nuclear power in 2007 .
Although nuclear power plants' construction cost is much expensive compared to the cost of other alternative sources , for example , solar panels and wind turbines , nuclear power has efficiency output and sustainable energy .
The lower initial cost of alternatives sources make more economical but for the mass product nuclear power should be considered  .
