Recently , there has been an increasing debate about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Evidence also shows that very few new reactors have been built since serious accidents had taken place due to explosion or meltdown of nuclear reactors in the 1980s  .
To date , people are still suffering a lot of the repercussions from the past incidents .
However , with the expected increase in energy demand worldwide and the growing awareness about global warming , climate change issues and sustainable development , the new Generation IV nuclear reactors seem to be the ultimate solution .
According to Gerstner , the Gen IV nuclear reactors will promise a safe , economically competitive , proliferation-resistant nuclear power without the danger of increasing greenhouse gas emissions .
Many developed countries are starting to express interests in this new nuclear technology and some even form a consortium to pool their expertise and funding to research on the six most promising prospects for the future Gen IV reactors .
Thus , I agree that there should be a research and development funding for the Gen IV nuclear reactors .
According to Reuters  , the Electric Power Research Council in the United States has said that there will be a need for some 35 more {nuclear power} plants by the year 2030 .
Finland , France and the United Kingdom are preparing for new reactor building programmes while China is planning to build 40-50 fission plants within the next two decades  .
As more countries are planning to build more nuclear reactors to meet the increasing energy demand and to reduce the reliance on fossil fuels  , some unprecedented construction projects are expected in the next 20 years .
Clearly , a plan is needed to deal with the resulting increase in nuclear waste .
The existing technology is to store the waste on site , but it can be politically sensitive - Yucca Mountain in Nevada is one of the examples .
Reprocessing the spent fuel is another alternative to reduce the waste volume by a factor of two or three .
However , this is expensive , inefficient and poses a nuclear proliferation threat .
The Gen IV reactors aim to develop a waste-free nuclear energy by burning up fission's waste , leaving a residue greatly reduced in both volume and radioactivity  .
However , the challenge lies between the complication of building a nuclear fission reactor and short of funding to carry out researches on this area .
Although it would take years to develop such advanced technology and probably spend quite a large sum of money , researches and studies have to be done to tackle the faster mounting nuclear waste problem .
Opponents of nuclear energy claim that before the first one of Gen IV reactors would be built , optimistically in 2030 and possibly 2040 to 2050 , solar power system will be highly mature and widely developed by that time .
However , a report pointed out that most of the solar power plants can only generate 20% of its average efficiency .
What that means is that most photovoltaic panels convert only about 20% of the captured {solar energy} to electricity .
Even the most advanced designs using silicon are only able to operate at around 40% efficiency .
Nuclear reactors can produce greenhouse-gas-free energy which currently contributes to 15% of the global electric power .
They are most efficient and require less resource to operate compared to fossil fuels and solar energy .
Thus , it is important to channel the funding to the R&D for Gen IV reactors as they provide the energy that will meet our future energy needs .
There is a profound need for a new generation of nuclear reactor as it not only brings a cleaner energy for our future generation but it is also a waste-free , terrorism-proof and affordable source of energy .
Although the nuclear industry faces a lot of challenges in the form of nuclear accidents , high capital costs of constructing new plants , and the need to establish final repositories for spent nuclear fuel , the nuclear energy industry has experienced economic and regulatory recovery in many parts of the world in recent years .
As countries such as China and the U .S . are showing interests in constructing new nuclear power plants , large amount of nuclear waste is expected in the next 20 to 30 years .
Hence , channeling funds to the R&D in Gen IV reactors is necessary as it helps to solve the waste problem .
With rapidly rising demand for energy , scientists and big energy companies are aggressively looking for an alternative source of energy to fossil fuel which is a depleting natural resource .
In addition , burning fossil fuel emits greenhouse gas , a main cause of global warming .
Therefore , scientists and engineers are placing high hopes on the new generation of nuclear reactors which are seen as a clean source of energy without emission of green-house gas .
However , some people argue that nuclear power is unstable , extremely dangerous and expensive based on past nuclear accidents and technical hurdles .
Fortunately , generation IV nuclear reactors are in the horizon , promising "safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and proliferation resistant" nuclear power plants  .
In this essay , I will compare two outstanding generation IV models: the very-high-temperature reactor and the sodium-cooled fast reactor  , and argue that the VHTR is safer , more economical and proliferation-resistant than SFR .
Even though the VHTR excels at safety , economical factors would still be the most crucial deciding factor .
Proponents of SFR claim that the VHTR would incur a higher capital investment .
As a matter of fact , the overall cost of building , operating and maintaining of the VHTR is more cost-effective than the SFR .
According to "Cost Estimating Guidelines For Generation IV Nuclear Energy Systems" , the VHTR has a lower overall cost of building , operating and maintaining compared with other models of generation IV  .
Outdoing the SFR , the VHTR has lower fuel cost and higher hydrogen production due to its high operation temperature , allowing high burnup of the fuels .
Moreover , the VHTR adopts a closed cycle to ensure thorough burning of transuranics .
In a nutshell , the VHTR is more economically competitive than the SFR .
In contrast to the SFR , the VHTR is resistant to nuclear weapon proliferation as it abandons the reprocessing process .
The reprocessing process incorporated in the SFR extracts plutonium , which is an indispensable part for nuclear weapons .
According to "GIF and generation IV" , among the six nuclear power reactors , only the VHTR does not have this process .
The reprocessing process is mainly aimed at cutting down the amount of waste finally produced .
Because VHTR is operated at an extremely high temperature and within a closed circle system , high utilization of uranium can be achieved even without reprocessing .
The VHTR prevents potential nuclear wars that the SFR may lead to .
To conclude , simple operation and transparent safety concept is inherently embedded in the VHTR , ensuring high level of safety .
The VHTR is more economically competitive than the SFR by lowering the overall cost of building , operating and maintaining .
The VHTR also has the unique feature of proliferation resistance among generation IV reactors which would prevent potential nuclear wars .
Therefore , the VHTR is the one which is the most likely to achieve the vision of "safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and proliferation resistant" nuclear power .
The original set of wheels used by the train was monobloc wheels .
However , the wheels appeared to be too noisy and vibration can be felt in the train cabin .
Therefore , the engineers came out with a similar design as what the trams are using which is used to solve the vibration issue .
The new wheel is wrapped around with thick layer of rubber around the metal wheel .
The layer of rubber helps reducing the vibration .
The design was not tested but it proved to be reliable because over the years it does not have any major problems .
However , according to proper engineering design process , final phase of design process is testing .
Prototyping is a process to test the design under real conditions .
In the process , they might find out design flaws and make necessary changes to the design .
The engineers made a mistake for neglecting an important step in the design process .
If prototyping has been done the accident might not have happened .
Before the derailment of the train , there is a strip of metal punctured into the cabin .
The train conductor or the passenger may have prevented the train accident if they had pulled the emergency brake .
The subsequent event will not have happened if the passenger or the conductor possesses adequate problem solving skill .
The passenger could have pulled the emergency himself instead of notifying the conductor .
The train conductor would have been able to stop the accident from happening if he does not follow the company's policy for stopping the train .
The railway line in Eschede is a quadruple track .
It allows the high speed train to separate from other slower trains .
The railway track used is not dedicated for high speed train .
However it has been upgraded to so that it can be shared between high speed trains and other slower trains .
In addition , rail switches is used to maximize the usage of the tracks .
The rail switches transfers the trains from a slow track to a fast track and vice versa .
However seconds before the accident happened , the wheel rim which pierces through the cabin floor slammed against the rail switch forcing some of the train cabins to disconnect with the from the first cabin and switch to another track .
The entire disconnected cabin is thereby thrown into the bridge .
In conclusion , improvement of a new design is undeniably good as it makes our life better .
However , besides focusing on the improvement of a new design , one should also pay attention to the possible tradeoffs .
When the improvement of the new design is unable to compensate the limitation , designers should abandon the design .
If we have put in much consideration into the psychology approach in the process of design , many accidents can be avoided .
The use of psychology would assist engineers and designers to think creatively and better and therefore they will come out a safe and good invention .
In addition , by exploring further in the psychological aspect and applying it in our daily routines , many of such major accidents can be prevented or minimized .

By a survivor of Chernobyl  .
The Chernobyl disaster has been described as 'the greatest technological catastrophe in human history' .
The total radioactivity of the material from Chernobyl was 200 times that of the combined releases from the atomic bombs dropped on Nagasaki and Hiroshima .
And 21 million square meter of land was polluted and couldn't use for living .
Someone may doubt , is it really helpful to apply psychology ?
They think that in the modern society  , automation is widely used in many ways and man is much less important .
The normal , experienced staff at the plant were planning a test on reactor four .
The first thing working against then is that another power plant on the circuit went down , so Chernobyl was producing more power than usual to compensate .
Then the day staff never ran the test .
Nobody ever told the night staff not to do it , so they tried to perform the test as planned .
Then , the reactor started getting out of control .
The staff tried to use an emergency shutdown mechanism that failed .
Now the had an uncontrolled nuclear reaction .
Because they didn't have the right Geiger counters , they didn't know what a serious danger they were in cause they couldn't got the actual radiation levels .
They stayed for about 3 days till the explosion , trying to pump water into the reactor to control it .
They died weeks later from radiation poisoning .
It is obvious that human factors play an important role in this accident .
Though the original cause is technical , but if anyone find the mistake and correct it  , it wouldn't happen .
What's more , regardless of what extent do the automation achieve , man can never be neglected in production .
And , nobody can avoid mistakes , so applying psychology in design processes could reduce the probability of human errors , thus increased safety coefficient .
Never the less , someone hold the opinion that if technology improves enough , we could get rid of the accident without applying psychology in the design processes .
On 26 April 1986 , a catastrophic disaster , which destroyed the city and killed 30 people in few seconds , fell on Chernobyl .
Massive amount of radioactive substances spread , and eventually caused approximately 270000 cancer cases and 93000 fatal cancers  .
Ever since the disaster occurred , the cause of the accident was extensively looked into .
Most of the studies have shown that it was the carelessness of the operator and large amount of design errors which lead to the disastrous explosion .
Therefore , wide range of approaches arises to enhance safety in engineering process , and psychology is among one of these approaches .
Engineering psychology provides methods to enhance the safety of a system from the human point of view  .
While opponents denied the capability of psychology to prevent the accident , proponents insisted that psychology is applicable to enhance safety of a system .
Although some people perceived that psychology would not influence much in engineering process , I do believe that the use of psychology during design process effectively provide alternative to prevent the accident .
Opponents perceived that the Chernobyl accident is mainly due to the insufficient knowledge of the designers and operators , and advanced technical knowledge could be able to prevent the accident instead of the use of psychology .
However , the study of Jacques stated that it was the dictatorship of Soviet Union , rather than technical incompetence , which brought the Chernobyl accident .
In fact , the scientists in Soviet Union were equipped with deep technical knowledge , but they were more motivated to produce nuclear weapon for self interest .
Therefore , the ignorance of safety field eventually led to bad decision during design process .
On the other hands , engineering psychology , which comprises 'decision gate' in each design phase , would effectively enhance safety from the human point of view .
In fact , the Chernobyl accident arises from chain of human errors .
Other than political factor and use of inappropriate rod materials , incompetence of operator , unwise decision making during test plan , and deliberate violation against procedure for safe operation account to this disaster  .
In my opinion , input of psychology in each stage would be able to change the erroneous part of design process and effectively enhance the safety of a system .
Although a precise definition of human error is hard to develop , some errors are predictable using existing psychological studies  .
With the modernization of the world , the consumption of energy has increased drastically .
Nuclear reactants have helped improve the situation in recent years .
One of the nuclear reactors is the very high temperature reactor which is used to produce both hydrogen and electricity .
There have been oppositions discouraging further research and development of the VHTR due to high costs , unsafe conditions and low efficiency of the VHTR .
However , I feel that despite these , we should still continue with the further developments of the VHTR .
The main issue that the public is concerned with is safety .
The VHTR operates at a very high temperature .
There are fears that the reactor may get overheated as it operates at very high temperature .
However , with the improvement in the design of machine and materials used , the VHTR is cooled via helium which is an inert gas .
The helium gas does not react readily with other gases and thus making it safe to use .
In addition , the material used to build the reactor is graphite which has high melting point .
Graphite also has high heat capacity and thermal inertia , thus allowing it to withstand high temperature .
It has high structural stability despite being heated up to high temperatures .
Graphite and helium make the VHTR safer to use as it now heats up less readily .
Thus , the VTHR is safe to use even though it requires high temperatures to operate .
There are skeptics who argue that high start up cost , due to the materials of the reactor , make the VHTR not worth undergoing further research and development .
They feel that the government should channel the funds to produce other useful products which may directly benefit them .
The aim of the government should be revised and other important needs such as healthcare of citizens should be considered before building these reactors .
Funds could be better allocated in order to not neglect important areas .
I agree that the start-up cost of VHTR is high as it costs about 114 .9 billion US dollars to build it .
However , the performance and maintenance cost are much lower as compared to the start up cost .
The fuel used in VHTR produces a large amount of energy when burnt , thus reducing the amount of fuel burnt .
As the VHTR is able to produce two products , hydrogen and electricity concurrently , it helps to reduce the cost of producing both products separately .
Furthermore , in the long run , the high cost is spread over the products , thus reducing the daily cost .
The VTHR is able to produce electricity which the world is in need of .
Furthermore , it is also able to produce hydrogen , a side product which is useful too .
Furthermore , it has high efficiency and the reactor is safe to use .
Cost should not be an issue as it will eventually be reduced with the spread overhead costs .
Therefore , the VTHR should continue undergoing research and development .
Generation IV nuclear energy systems are very promising technologies which will probably be available from 2030 onwards .
These technologies have many advantages , such as enhancing nuclear safety , minimizing generation of nuclear waste and decreasing the risk of nuclear weapons proliferation  .
Although Generation IV nuclear energy systems have so many advantages and plans for four systems have been finalized , public opposition doubts whether further research and development are still needed for them .
However , the opposite's concerns will not matter through long-run modification of the plans and the Gen IV systems will definitely benefit most of the nations .
It is essential to do more research for the Very High Temperature Reactor or VHTR which is the most promising system out of all the Generation IV systems .
The Very-High-Temperature Reactor is a graphite-moderated , helium-cooled reactor with a thermal neutron spectrum .

Secondly , critics argue that the VHTR is too costly and it will ultimately be eliminated in the future due to economic factors just as what happened to the HTGR or High-Temperature-Gas-Reactor in 1989  .
To some extent , the VHTR system is indeed more expensive than the Generation III Nuclear Energy Systems .
However , even though the one-time economic input is high , the VHTR has low operating and maintenance cost  .
In an economic view , low variable cost will finally lead to low average cost despite the fact that the fixed cost is quite high .
Moreover , the electricity generation of the VHTR system has an efficiency ratio larger than 50 percent and it is much more efficient than the Generation III systems .
The efficient electricity generation will overweigh the high cost of the machine and engineering design  .
In addition , abundant heat produced in the VHTR system raises the efficiency of hydrogen gas production to a significant level .
Hence , the high one-time economic input does not seem to be a problem compared with the high efficiency and the significant side product of the VHTR system .

As estimated , these systems will be available by 2030 in both developed countries and developing countries  .
To sum up , even though there are concerns about Generation IV VHTR system , such as potential danger of the system , high cost of the system and the side effect of the system , the advantages of Generation IV VHTR system surpass its disadvantages .
Generation IV VHTR system should be fully developed since the VHTR system intends to increase safety , efficiency and reliability and provides other economic benefits , such as hydrogen production .

On that condition , new energy , especially nuclear power , will be our first choice to carry on our development , for which we must change our attitude towards nuclear power .
Nowadays , many people still resist nuclear power because of the fear of terrorists , its so-called danger and the heavy metal from its waste .
I cannot deny some tragedies occurred during the exploration and development of nuclear power .

People may be afraid that some accident may happen at such a tough environment .

I believe with these safety features , the nuclear power reactor will be very safe .

Firstly , there is a reprocessing plant to reuse the spent SWAC fuel .
Secondly , there is a dry process to dry the used fuel to minimize the waste .
This recycling system makes it more environmental-friendly than others .
I think we need not to worry about how to deal with the waste because of these two significant steps .

Until now , the most deadly aircraft accident in aviation history is the Tenerife accident on March 27 , 1977 , with a death toll of 583 .
In Tenerife airport , two planes , KLM 4805 and Pan Am Clipper 1736 , collided with each other .
Basically , both human aspects and system aspects led to this tragedy .
Although there is not a definite cause for such accident , the correct use of psychology in certain areas , including the design of the airport , the communication procedure and the training of manpower , may help to prevent similar disaster in the future .
Secondly , communication was also a fatal problem in this accident .
Actually the Air Traffic Controller was using only one channel to communicate with two approaching airplanes at the same time .
The controllers did not consider that the same frequency made them cannot hear each other clearly , so that the ATC failed to get the information that the Pan Am was still on the run way .
To make things worse , as professional controllers , they should have used standardized terminologies for communication , but actually they did not .
Such as the words "take off" should never be used in an ATC clearance but they did .
The ambiguous language caused confusion such that the Pan Am , the KLM , and the ground controllers did not get the proper information .
Some people may argue that during the early years , low education was inevitable .
It was hard to find a Spanish speaking English fluently .
But people still need to consider communication as an important issue and try to find a precise and standard language for aviation communication .
Last but not least , the training of the captains and the crews somewhat contributed to the accident in a sense .
The captain of the KLM was used to be a training captain , which means he conducted training flights more than regular line flights .
But many operational problems only turn up during the actually flight .
So whenever the captain encountered problems , he may not keep sober and make the correct decision .
Though the accident cannot entirely attribute to the captain , he had the highest power and should be experienced enough to seek safety for all the passengers .
So whenever training captains or crews , both theoretical training and operational training should be reinforced .
In conclusion , in the Tenerife accident , the failure to consider several crucial factors in the airport design , the communication systems and the manpower training , indirectly caused the accident to happen .
The use of psychology in the design process can help the designers to consider these issues more thoroughly and perhaps influencing his decision .
The result of any of these minor changes could perhaps have prevented the accident from ever occurring .
According to a BBC report , in Europe alone , there are 165 nuclear reactors .
On the other hand , there are also countries that are against this idea , such as Germany , who is drawing out from their nuclear programme  .
The reason for opposing is that nuclear accidents release harmful radiation that has adverse effects on humans and the environment .
This is seen in the nuclear accident at Three Mile Island in 1979 followed by the Chernobyl accident in 1986 , which have reinforced fears in the people .
In addition , many are concerned that nuclear reactors are prone to being used as a weapon of mass destruction by terrorists and hostile countries .

With these concerns in mind , scientists and engineers have developed six Generation IV nuclear reactor concepts with enhanced safety features that would prevent another Chernobyl .
Furthermore , nuclear energy is a clean alternative to fossil fuel as it emits far less greenhouse gases  .
In this essay , I will discuss the benefits of the molten salt reactor  , which is one of the six Generation IV concepts , and show that it is superior to the very high temperature reactor in terms of safety , performance and cost .
Firstly , on safety , the VHTR is said to be a relatively safe nuclear reactor because it includes a back-up emergency core cooling system .
However , the MSR operates under a much safer condition .
Unlike the VHTR , the MSR adopts a passive emergency cooling system .
The method of cooling in the MSR is more efficient than the VHTR because if the MSR coolant salt overheats and overflows , the coolant salt will be transported to various storage tanks which are installed with passive decay heat cooling systems , thus they are verified to be critically-safe .
Besides the storage tanks , freeze valves that will automatically open whenever it detects overheating of the salt are also installed .
As a result , heated fuel will be disposed of immediately without threatening an explosion or leakage  .
Therefore , the MSR is a much safer reactor than the VHTR .
Secondly , the overall performance of the MSR also surpasses the VHTR making the MSR a better nuclear reactor .
The VHTR operates at a core outlet gas temperature of more than 900 to 1000 with output power estimated to be 600MW .
On the other hand , the MSR is able to not only operate in small sizes , but also in large sizes .
Besides the varying sizes that a MSR could work in , it is also able to operate at two varying temperatures of 705 and 1000  .
At 1000 , the VHTR's overall plant efficiency is about 50% while the MSR's overall plant efficiency is about 60% .
This shows that at constant temperature , the MSR is at least 10% more efficient than the VHTR .
Therefore , countries should invest on the MSR which is more efficient than the VHTR in terms of overall plant efficiency .
Last but not least , waste recycling in the MSR allows better usage of materials as well as ensuring a lower cost of operation .
The wastes produced in VHTR go directly to the repository .
However , in the MSR system , wastes produced from generation of electricity will be recycled .
The system collects , processes the wastes according to their physical and chemical properties , and separates the residual fuel from the wastes .
During the process , plutonium and uranium would be recovered and then recycled to produce more energy .
This in turn reduces the volume of material disposed since plutonium and uranium makes up almost 97% of the entire mass of fuel used in generating nuclear energy .
This will also lead to reduction of costs since capital spent on reactants are significantly reduced  .
Therefore , adoption of the MSR as an alternative to electricity production is a wiser choice than choosing the VHTR .
In conclusion , the MSR is a much better reactor than the VHTR as the MSR is safer , has higher overall plant efficiency and more efficient recycling method .
Thus , we should invest in the MSR to produce energy efficiently .
Scientists and engineers are now thinking of developing a new generation of nuclear reactors that can solve many problems such as green-house effects , the rising prices of energy , the safety of nuclear reactors .
In "Nuclear power's new dawn" , Butler mentions six concepts of Generation IV reactors .
Among them is the supercritical-water-cooled reactor which is considered a popular one because of its many obvious advantages .
While some proponents totally support further research and development funding for this concept , others still doubt about the benefits of the SCWR since there are many challenging problems in R&D process .
Three of these problems are safety , efficiency and practicality .
It is often argued that the SCWR is rather safe in comparison with other generation IV reactor concepts because it operates at rather low temperature , ranging from 510 to 550 C  .
Although this argument is true , high operating temperature is not the only source of accidents in a reactor .
In fact , the pressure inside a SCWR can reach 25MPa which is ultra-high and dangerous .
At such level of pressure , the current steel is easily corroded by high temperature water .
Another safety problem comes from very fast turbine speed of the SWCR ) .
Moreover , an extremely abnormal event has been recognized which is the loss of feed water  .
Therefore , we must stress the importance of finding suitable materials that are stress-resistant and anti-corrosive and developing a reliable auxiliary feed water system .
The SCWR has very high efficiency and can churn out electricity at prices that , on paper , are competitive with coal and gas , and vastly cheaper than existing nuclear reactors .
However , one disadvantage of the SWCR is that it , in fact , is the only concept among the GenIV reactors that does not output hydrogen fuel .
The temperature needed to split hydrogen from water in a reactor is from 700 to 900  C and even if the SCWR could produce hydrogen , separating it with the liquid water would become a big problem .
Hydrogen fuel is considered the energy for the future since it is carbon-free , non-toxic , less fire-risk , higher efficiency than petrol .
Furthermore , it should be noted , however , that if most car owners switched to fully electric cars , many countries would need to double their electricity production  .
Therefore , it should be better if we develop reactors that can generate hydrogen fuel rather than ones that can only generate electricity .
The SWCR is preferred than other GenIV concepts because of its simple design which indicates that it will be cheaper and easier to develop and operate .
However , other GenIV reactor concepts seem to be practical , too .
One example is the very-high-temperature reactor which can produce hydrogen fuel and can be first built in 2020  .
Moreover , the estimated amount of money needed for R&D activities of the VHTR is about 670 M$  .
Last but not least , the efficiency of the VHTR is also higher than that of the SCWR  .
Although the VHTR also has its own challenges in R&D , it is , besides SCWR , highly interested in by the experts .
Although it cannot be denied that SCWR is a very practical one among six concepts of GenIV reactors , it is not the only choice .
Developing a new generation of nuclear reactor costs us not only a huge amount of money , but also lots of time and manpower .
Therefore , we must be of great considerations when choosing whether the SCWR or other concepts to develop .
The public is very concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors and there have been debates on whether Generation IV nuclear reactor should be built or not .
Issues being discussed were safety of operating the nuclear reactor as there have been catastrophic events in the past like the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl disaster  .
Long term storage of nuclear waste and the amount of time the nuclear waste needs to be fully decomposed .
The cost of building a nuclear reactor as it involves billions of dollars of taxpayer's money .
These were the main factors why few nuclear reactors have been built in the past few decades in many countries and I agree that Generation IV nuclear reactor should not be built .
Over the years , nuclear technology has improved and in principle , created the term 'meltdown proof' reactors whereby the nuclear reactor can cool themselves down in the event of an accident with minimal impact or  ,if any , human intervention  .
Hence , safety of the nuclear reactors has always been the main issue regarding the building of nuclear power plants .
Technically , it is possible to avoid a meltdown given that the new Generation IV has an advanced safety system in place .
However , human error is a factor that decides whether the safety system in place works in an event of a failure  .
Events that clearly show the effects of nuclear meltdown are the Chernobyl disaster that resulted in 336 ,000 people being exposed to radioactive chemicals and had to be relocated .
The result of the explosion had linked to many forms of cancer in Eastern Europe and Russia , as well as destroying animals and plants . 
Waste from the nuclear faculty is another major issue .
Although the development and research of Generation IV reactors produces less nuclear wastes , the main problem lies in getting rid of it rather than storing it .
According to Andrew Blowers , a former member of the Committee for Radioactive Waste Management  , which advised the government , the nuclear waste does not decompose easily and will last for thousands if not millions of years , thus , it will impose a burden on future generations .
Furthermore , the cost of waste disposal and storage of the nuclear waste is huge on top of the at least 2 billion pounds required to build the nuclear plant . 
The cost of building a nuclear reactor has always been one of the biggest issues .
It is true that the cost of developing the Generation IV reactors will result in a cheaper price tag when building future nuclear reactors .
Unfortunately , no more than three of the six designs are likely to survive the feasibility testing phrase and go on to become research prototypes , each costing at least US$1 billion or more to build and test  , thus , wasting taxpayer's money .
To summarize why nuclear reactor should not be built is because no nuclear reactor in the world is inherently safe as all operational reactors have inherent safety flaws , which cannot be eliminated by safety upgrading .
Highly radioactive spent fuel requires constant cooling .
If this fails , it could lead to a catastrophic release of radioactivity .
There will always be nuclear waste irregardless of the amount the development and research of Generation IV nuclear reactors can reduce .
Billions of dollars is taking place in building a nuclear reactor and not a few million .
Furthermore , there is no guaranteed in building a successful nuclear reactor .
With emission of green house gas now soaring , nuclear energy , as a non-carbon dioxide source , is finding its way back on the table .
However , the huge cost and the potential danger make nuclear plants cannot be widely accepted .
Therefore , we need to develop a new generation of reactors to overcome these disadvantages .
Actually , GIF has already set a R&D funding for the new generation of reactorsthe Generation IV reactors  .
Although there are some opposing voices against this funding , it is a wise decision to set R&D funding for Generation IV reactors .
Opponents of R&D funding for generation IV reactors claim that nuclear plants are very dangerous because of the radioactive wastes and the radioactive materials escaping from the reactors  .
However , these two disadvantages are no longer problems for the Generation IV reactors .
It is because all the six concepts of Generation IV reactors are operating at a very high temperature ranging from 510 degrees C to 1000 degrees C and have a highly automatic circular system , the radioactive waste can be minimized to a very safe level  .
Besides , unlike what the public thinks , there is almost no radioactive materials escaping from the reactors unless in an unexpected accident .
However , the new technologies applied in the new generation of reactors such as pebble-bed , in principle , can prevent any radioactive material escaping from the reactors in an accident  .
Opponents also mention that it costs too much to build and run nuclear plants  .
In fact , it is true for the previous generations of reactors .
However , if the Generation IV reactors really work , on paper , they are competitive with coals and gas  .
As mentioned above , the new reactors are operating at very high temperatures and have highly automatic cycle system , so they are more efficient .
For instance , the VHTR can produce half more electricity with the same amount of resources  .
Therefore , the cost on the resources can be significantly reduced .
Also , due to the highly automatic system , the capital spent on hiring experienced operators and building offsite monitoring systems can be reduced .
Both of these make it cheaper to build nuclear plants .
The final argument advanced by the opponents is that this new generation of reactors will be more of a terrorist target , because they are more powerful  .
However , the experts say that the Generation IV reactors will be less of a terrorist target  .
The reason is that all the six concepts of Generation IV reactors contain simplified safety features that no longer depend on sophisticated operators , which means that they can cool themselves if there is anything wrong in the whole progress .
Therefore , any attempt to trigger an accident deliberately will be in vain .
It should be evident that arguments against the setting of R&D funding for Generation IV reactors are not valid .
The high operating temperature and the highly automatic cycle system make the new generation reactors not only more inexpensive but also much safer .
Moreover , the simplified safety feature makes those new reactors be less of a terrorist target .
Therefore , in my opinion , there should be R&D funding for Generation IV reactors .
The principal challenges today are sustainable development and climate change and how society can decide on a fair distribution of resources and energy as well as a radical reduction of CO2 emissions CITATION Aus07 \l 1033  .
Global warming and rising energy demands are rehabilitating the concept of nuclear power .
With emissions of greenhouse gases soaring and global energy demands predicted to double by 2050 , the nuclear option is finding its way back onto the table .
Generation IV international Forum is a consortium of countries planning future nuclear reactors .
According to GIF , Generation IV reactors when developed would be safe , economically competitive and proliferation-resistant .
Very High Temperature Reactor one of the Gen IV reactors holds much potential .
Till date the nuclear industry has created a lot of problems without a solution and with the current growth rate nuclear power cannot play an important role in future world energy production CITATION But04 \l 1033  .Research and development funding for developing VHTR must be increased while addressing public concerns about safety and improving design to reduce costs and improve performance .
VHTR systems do not use waste recycling thus reducing the risk of proliferation .
Public opinion is against the construction of nuclear reactors due to the partial reactor meltdown accident in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and of 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine  .
It is generally recognized that it is a practical impossibility to render civilian nuclear energy systems proliferation-proof CITATION Hir05 \l 1033  .
The development of Gen IV nuclear reactors is necessary to respond to the upcoming scarcity of fissile material , the issue of proliferation and the requirement of safe repositories for nuclear waste .
Research has still to be done to work on a better cooling system and material that can withstand very high temperatures  .
Shortages in energy supply and insecurities caused due to the rising oil prices and the threat of climate change clearly show the need for the development of Nuclear power .
Due to extreme operational conditions , Gen IV systems could even turn out to be more dangerous than currently operated installations CITATION Aus09 \l 1033  .
Countries should invest in the development of VHTR to satisfy their energy demands and to decrease the dependence on fossil fuels for energy .
Nowadays , as the population of the world is increasing rapidly , humans are facing severe food crisis .
In order to solve this problem , one good way is to develop Genetically Modified Food .
Currently , because of some uncertain effects of Genetically Modified Food  , it has not been widely accepted by us .
However , I believe that if GMF has a very bright future .
According to Whitman  , the term GM foods is commonly used to refer to crop plants created for human or animal consumption using the latest molecular biology techniques , and these food have been modified to meet people's demand in the laboratory .
GM foods have advantages over traditional plants .
Firstly , most of them have higher pest and disease resistance .
So the usage amount of chemical substances will be largely reduced .
Besides , we can increase the crop yield by cultivating GM plants .
As the food situation is becoming desperate in today's context , these two features are significant .
On 26th April 1986 , a severe reactor's meltdown occurred in Chernobyl nuclear plant , Ukraine which released more radioactivity compared to the time when atom bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
In the accident , 56 people were killed and about 600000 people were exposed to significant levels of radiation  .
This accident is considered as the worst nuclear disaster in the world .
As the result , many people were afraid of nuclear power even until today .
Hence , most people oppose the revival of nuclear reactor while support the renewable power such as solar power and wind power .
Despite there are a lot of opposition to the reborn of nuclear power there is some evidence which show that the potential benefits of molten salt reactor far outweigh its dangers .
Opponents of nuclear power claim that nuclear reactors are totally insecure as the incidents of Three Miles Island and Chernobyl led to catastrophes .
Another example was the technical failure in the Forsmark nuclear power plant in Sweden , 2006 .
According to the former director of that plant , it was pure luck that the plant had no meltdown otherwise , it could be another disaster  .
However , the possibility for a MSR to melt is relatively small compared to the old nuclear power plant .
This is because molten salt reactor has different safety approaches which can prevent the meltdown .
Firstly , the molten salts have low chemical activity at the sea-level pressure .
They are also mechanically stable as their boiling point is very high .
Besides that , there is a passive cooling system which includes passively cooled dump tanks that will perform emergency cooling and shutdown in any emergency conditions  .
Moreover , in a MSR , the mobile fission products are removed continuously and reused afterward .
This means that the accident rate can be reduced to the minimum .
Opponents also mention that there is no solution to radioactive waste .
Since the beginning of nuclear power , radioactive waste has remained as a major problem .
Reprocessing the radioactive waste once became a useful method .
However , according to a study published in 2001 , there was a significant increment of leukaemia among under-25 year olds who were living within 10 km of La Hague nuclear reprocessing plants , in northwest France  .
Yet , reprocessing the radioactive waste and recycle the salts seem to be possible in MSR .
In fact , MSR would still produce hazardous waste and radionuclide .
Nevertheless , the organic components in that waste would be oxidized in the molten salt oxidizer and radionuclide would be retained in the salt .
The salt would then be recycled and reused in the MSR  .
Some of the radionuclide still left out in this recycling process .
In order to get a shorter-lived radioactivity , the radionuclide is combined with some mixtures such as glass , ceramic and concrete .
Hence , the radioactive waste is brought to an optimum for disposal and lesser harmful radioactive waste is produced by MSR .
In conclusion , despite many people are still opposing the concept of reactor generation IV , I believe that MSR could bring the nuclear power to another new age .
MSR has many advantages such as cost-effective , minimize the danger of disposal and it has a nearly perfect safety precaution which reduce the accident rate greatly .
Hence , it has the potential to become the main source of energy in the next decade .
Engineering is concerned with improving equipment from the point of view of mechanical and electrical design , whereas psychology is concerned with the mind and behavior  .
As such , people often find it difficult to associate psychology with engineering .
However , psychology in fact complements engineering process .
As defined by Blum  , psychology in engineering is concerned with adapting the equipment to people , based upon their psychological capacities and limitations with the objective of improving overall system performance .
Theoretically , analysis of the mind and behavior of man can effectively reduce accidents due to human error , by adopting measures that takes into consideration the limitation and capacities of man .
Opponents often argue that psychology is unnecessary in engineering .
The employment of psychologists would simply incur unnecessary cost .
In fact , many engineers would rather consult their intuition than a professional ergonomist in the designing process .
Furthermore , the effectiveness of the use of psychology in ensuring safety in engineering processes is being questioned .
The safety issues in engineering processes are often seen with great concern and various rules and regulations are set to ensure mishaps from occurring .
Thus , with these precautions , the use of psychology is deemed as unnecessary .
Another point of contend is the use of psychology to prevent engineering errors .
Engineering errors are integral parts in the designing process and engineers have adopted the measure of introducing corrective actions such as adding on to the system to minimize or eliminate such errors .
Hence , the use of psychology would serve little use .
However , the safety precautions and corrective actions are not fail-proof .
The likelihood of accidents occurring stays high despite these measures .
Although safety precautions are set , the tendencies of violation of the rules are not to be neglected .
The rules and regulations are drawn down with consideration of ideal behavior of system users yet it is unlikely that all men follow the same code of behavior .
Thus measures to reduce errors resulting from deviation from ideal behavior should be formulated with the aid of psychology which analyses the behavior of man .
In addition , psychology can be applied to predict errors in the designing process due to human factors and preventive measure can be taken to avoid mishaps due to these errors .
Furthermore , it is essential to note that the most damaging errors made by the engineering team is not regarding the technical aspect of the engineering process but with regard to ethic issue which often jeopardize safety .
Hence analysis of the mind and behavior of man may potentially help rule out the possibilities of such occurring .
In the case of Hyatt Regency walkway collapse , human error was undeniably one of the most influencing factors underlying the failure of the structure .
Even though the collapse of the walkway is due to the failure of components of the structure , it would not have been fatal if the errors was identified and corrected in time .
Psychology can be applied to various stages of design processes to prevent accidents .
Use of psychology in engineering process is also necessary in predicting the possible dilemma faced by end users using the product and the possibility of wrong usage which can cause potential harm .
Study of behavior of man is necessary in the prediction and adjustment of the system to suit users .
In the case of Hyatt Regency accident , the failure to foresee the large crowd and hence larger workload is one great mistake made by the engineers .
As a heavily advertised project , engineers should have anticipated response from the people .
Hence , it will be utmost importance to verify the maximum load that the walkway is able to withstand .
In the event that the crowd predicted is above the maximum load the walkway can withstand , possible measures can be taken to divert the crowd , and ensure load within a safe boundary .
In the case of Hyatt Regency accident , the application of psychology would have possibly prevented the accident .
It is apparent that the negligence of the engineering teams was to be blamed for the accident .
Opponents of VHTR might claim that Lead-Cooled Fast Reactor exhibit better safety feature for its selection of molten lead as relatively inert coolant  .
However , the VHTR offers higher degree of passive safety for instance , it is built underground , using earth to sink most of the heat produced .
In fact , the graphite encased fuel will not be damaged when the reactor heat is radiated through its steel vessel out of the high thermal inertia graphite moderator core  .
Moreover , building the reactor underground offers a greater level of security , as there are limited exit routes to the ground .
This feature would also immensely reduce its threat of being a terrorism target , enhancing the physical protection of the reactor .

What Is Nuclear Reprocessing ?
Retrieved October 15 , 2009 , from {http://news .bbc .co .uk/2/hi/uk_news/647981 .stm}
Since reprocessing of nuclear waste can eminently reduces raw fuel input and conserves the world's uranium supplies  , opponents might argue that the {Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor}  , {Molten Salt Reactor}  , {Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor}  , and LFR offer better performance with the adoption of reprocessing  .
However , the VHTR offers high thermal efficiency in supplying electricity and producing hydrogen , alongside process heat applications .
Operating at 1000 degree Celsius , the VHTR is able to produce 50% more electricity using the same amount of fuel compared with conventional plants .
The high operating temperature also enables hydrogen production using thermochemical process , with superior efficiency .
In addition , heat produced by the VHTR can also be utilized in a broad range of process heat applications , such as coal gasification  .
On the other hand , reprocessing is extremely expensive , costing more than uranium fuel itself  .
Hence , it would be impossible for nuclear power to compete with coal and gas in the market for electricity .
Opponents might also maintain that GFR , MSR , SFR , and LFR provide better waste management , seeing that up to 96% of waste produced is being recycled through reprocessing  .
However , this would oppose the aim of creating a proliferation resistant reactor .
In contrary , the VHTR does not have this issue , for it operates in a once-through uranium cycle .
Since plutonium - the main substance in manufacturing nuclear weapon - is not separated with the nuclear waste , it cannot be easily extracted to build nuclear weapons  .
The great proliferation resistance provides assurance to the society , avoiding suspicion between countries about any secret nuclear weapons program that might cause misunderstandings .
Therefore , the high proliferation resistance that comes with VHTR averts the emergence of new nuclear weapons states , and keeps nuclear weapons capability out of terrorist hands .
It should be evident that the Very-High-Temperature Reactor is the best among the 6 evolutionary concepts of generation 4 reactors .
The VHTR is equipped with superior passive safety feature with its underground construction , which also greatly increases its security and physical protection .
Furthermore , the VHTR offers high thermal efficiency , while retain the capability of hydrogen production and utilization in heat process applications .
Finally , the VHTR also provides high proliferation resistance , which prevents the surfacing of new nuclear weapons , maintaining peace in the world .
Therefore , in my opinion , the Very-High-Temperature Reactor should be given priority for further research and development funding .

With the fast growth of Earth's population , the demand for nuclear power is rapidly increasing because of its higher efficiency in producing electricity among the non greenhouse-gas-emitting sources .
The potential benefits of nuclear energy have led many countries to do extensive research and development on nuclear reactors .
However , many controversies emerge over the development of nuclear reactors because of fear of nuclear leakage and accident .
No new nuclear power plants were built in the United States since the accident at Three Mile Island in 1979 .
Considering the fact that the global warming has becoming an increasingly serious problem nowadays , the development of nuclear power is quite necessary .
"Global warming and rising energy needs are rehabilitating the concept of nuclear power .
But if it is to figure in the energy equation , it will need to be cheaper , cleaner and safer" , says Declan Butler .
In the research for cleaner and safer nuclear reactor to meet the increasing demand for energy , new generation nuclear reactors have been researched by a consortium of ten nations .
Furthermore , it is quite necessary and urgent to set an overall direction of nuclear reactors .
Some people believe that the very high temperature reactor is the most promising reactor and should be largely put into use in the near future .
However , compared with VHTR , the sodium-cooled fast reactor has more advantages and should be chosen as a main type of reactors in the future .
Proponents of VHTR claim that it operates at a higher temperature which is much more efficient than the SFR .
It is true that the higher temperature enables the reactor to work more efficiently however , it also raises a huge inherent safety problem .
As a reactor which also produces hydrogen which is combustible , it is likely for the VHTR to explode at high temperatures .
Once the accident happens , the related safety components of the reactor would not work .
In contrast , the SFR does not have this safety concern for its operating temperature is just half of that of the VHTR .
Furthermore , the closed fuel of SFR can utilize almost all the energy provided by the fuels and the recovery and recycle of the actinides in SFR can reach about 99 .9% , which indicate the a high efficiency of SFR .
Opponents of SFR claim that the radioactivity of its coolant sodium is harmful to the environment .
Although the sodium is radioactive and easy to have chemical reaction with water and air , the self-activated shutdown system of SFR has largely reduced the possibilities of the leakage of sodium .
Furthermore , SFR has a relatively large thermal inertia and a large margin to coolant boiling which ensure the safety of the use of sodium .
More important , there is an extra loop which is called secondary system acts as a buffer in case of the reactions between the sodium and water  .
In this way , it can largely avoid the release of radioactive elements and become safe and environmentally friendly .
Another argument advanced by opponents of SFR is that it can only produce electricity and it has shown little promise of becoming an economical reactor so far  .
It is true that the VHTR can produce not only electricity but also hydrogen however , the electricity is more widely used than the hydrogen nowadays .
Actually , the hydrogen energy system is not very mature because of the limited technology so far .
The electricity is still in high demand nowadays and the SFR can completely meet the demand of markets for electricity .
.On the other hand , the cost of the research and development of SFR is only about 610 million dollars , which is much less than that of VHTR .
All of these facts show that the SFR is more economic and flexible than VHTR .
In a nutshell , it can be seen that the arguments against the sodium cooled fast reactor are inconclusive and not valid .
On the contrary , the SFR system has more advantages over VHTR on its safety , efficiency and costs , which made the SFR a promising reactor .
Therefore , the research and development of sodium cooled fast reactor is necessary and overwhelming .
The train accident at Eschede was one of the world's deadliest railway accident to have ever occurred .
The accident resulted in a total of 101 deaths and causing 88 injuries .
The cause of the accident was due to a broken wheel that leads to the derailment of the entire train  .
Further probing into the accident revealed that although the wheels have not been fully tested and commissioned , the wheels were already in service .
At that point in time , no facilities existed in Germany to test the failure limit of rail wheels , thus design and specifications relied heavily on materials specifications and theory .
Furthermore , in-depth investigations revealed that before the night of accident , the maintenance crew did not carry out their maintenance jobs properly .
Therefore , if a psychologist had been in place during the designing , testing and maintenance phase , the chance of the accident happening would be minimal .

During the testing phase , the psychologist could have proposed that the engineers further test the wheel at a much higher speed , and what problems the wheels might develop under wear and tear conditions .
He could also have said that since there are no testing facilities present , the engineers could have brought the wheel out to other country to run the required tests .
Furthermore , Fraunhofer Institute has already told the company that it is possible that the wheels would fail earlier than expected  .
Yet , no actions have been done by the company to replace the failing wheels .
To ensure that the wheels would be replaced , the psychologist , in this case , can keep reminding the engineers to correct the errors present on the wheels .

'Design process' is a linear sequence of events that has a start and an end point while 'psychology' is the study of the mind , its mental function and behaviour .
By approaching the design process from a psychological angle , the usability , functionality , safety and requite user competencies of the design product are ensured to match user expectations .
The major engineering accident chosen for this essay is the space shuttle Challenger accident .
The accident occurred on the 28 January , 1986 when Challenger disintegrated over the Atlantic Ocean seventy-three seconds into its flight , causing the death of its seven crew members .
Why is the psychology approach important to the design process ?
A system of machines , however advanced it is , can never operate by itself .
Everything that involves management , operation and decision-making comes back down to humans .
However , the human mind is a very complicated subject and a lot of problems might surface during the design process .
Therefore , psychology plays an important role during the design process in order to prevent any accidents from happening .
The Challenger accident was caused by faulty components and poor launch conditions .
The failure of the O-rings in its right solid rocket booster ignited a spark and subsequently , the flame impinged on the external fuel tank .
This then caused its structural failure and aerodynamic forces further brought about the disintegration of the space shuttle .
One human error , or more specifically a design error , led to the accident .
The two rubber O-rings in the booster were not resilient enough to withstand the hot high-pressure gases produced .
It was not known if the O-rings are able to seal properly at temperatures less than 12 C and the launch was done in cold weather at a temperature of -1 C . The booster's O-rings had been designated as a "Criticality 1" component which means that the failure of both the O-rings would result to the destruction of the orbiter and its crew .
The defect should have been identified and rectified first before the O-rings were used .

Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster .

Secondly , poor decision-making also contributed to the Challenger accident .
The NASA management felt invulnerable from the accomplishment of its Apollo programme .
NASA was pressured to meet Challenger's launch schedule when the launching was delayed because of the poor weather conditions , low surrounding temperature and a defective micro switch .
The pressure was further increased when the then Vice President of the United States of America , George H . W . Bush was present to watch the launch .
All of these subconsciously affected NASA's decision-making to reduce the safety and quality of the system .
Back in 1977 , Morton-Thiokol , the contractor in charge of the Challenger's solid rocket boosters , knew that the boosters had problems when the O-rings experienced erosion in the booster joints in almost half of the shuttle flights .
In 1985 , a redesign effort was started .
The NASA management was briefed on the problem but they were not in support of the redesign team .
If better decisions were made , there would have been fewer problems .
Other than that , there was also communication failure between the Morton-Thiokol engineers and the top NASA officials .
The engineers can only report to their immediate managers who only report to their direct supervisors .
Because of this mindset , the engineers dare not go above supervisors with their concerns for fear that they might lose their job .
On several occasions , the manager of the Solid Rocket Booster project , George Hardy from Morton-Thiokol , was told by the Marshall Space Flight Centre engineers that Thiokol's booster's field joint design could not be accepted .
An engineer suggested that the secondary O-ring is useless with that joint rotation .
Despite that , Hardy did not inform Morton-Thiokol and it was accepted for flight in 1980 .
It is clear that communication failure was also the cause of the accident .
In conclusion , if psychology is not given consideration during the design process , the possibility for an accident to occur will be high .
Thus , it is important to include psychology in the design process as human factors can affect the safety and quality of a system .

In view of today's environmental problems of global warming , there is an increasing necessity to introduce a clean , safe and efficient alternative energy source .
Although the nuclear power plant is considered safer and cleaner than fossil power plants , the devastating consequences of its occasional meltdowns deter the general public and policy makers from accepting it .
However , the development of technology results a continuous evolution of nuclear energy systems .
One of the latest prototypes of generation IV nuclear reactor is the Lead Cooled fast reactor  .
Unlike the previous generations of nuclear reactors which are constantly critiqued by opponents , the LFR is considered to be not only safer in different aspects , but also more sustainable and economical .
Social security is another safety issue that involves much dispute .
Since the 911 incident , there have been concerns about the unimaginable consequences of terrorist attacks on nuclear plants .
However , the LFR has made improvements on its physical structure to minimize physical damage from external attacks .
For example , the reactor uses independent , redundant and diversified Decay Heat Removal loops to control damages and prevent potential radioactive releases  .
There is no flammable or reactive coolant materials used to ensure that no big scale explosion occurs when being attacked .
In fact , various studies have shown that nuclear power plants can withstand such attacks better than almost any other civil constructions  .
The physical protections promises top security of building nuclear power plants like the LFR .
While the benefits of the LFR are largely acknowledged , its limitations and potential risks should also be recognized .
For example , as corrosion of lead may take place under high temperature , the LFR only works under 550 , which in turn limits its overall efficiency .
Also , operation of nuclear plant should be closely regulated to prevent any abuse use of nuclear materials .
This requires a concerted effort from countries around the world .
In fact , such regulatory agreements already exist .
An example will be the International Atomic Energy Agency's safeguards system under the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty  .
Nuclear power plants are gaining importance in the world as they help many countries , such as France , to maintain power independence .
Yet the non-nuclear weapon states should be monitored to prevent any undeclared nuclear activities .
In conclusion , the LFR helps enhance safety of nuclear power stations while not compromising economic factors .
Though it may not be the optimal design because of its potential risks and limitations , the LFR is still one of the possible future energy plants .
After all , we should expect the nuclear industry to dominate in generating world's electricity in the future as technology matures .
Nowadays , with the increasing population of the society , the limited resources cannot meet the large amount of demand of energy .
In order to overcome the energy shortage situation today , human beings has tried many ways to explore new kinds of energy , for instance , natural energy which includes wind energy and water energy .
However , the consequence is not that satisfactory , due to its low efficiency and high cost .
Therefore , scientists and publics suggested that we can develop one kind of energy which can produce high energy efficiently , and that kind of energy is known as nuclear energy .
It seems a perfect solution to the bad situation nowadays , however , the use of nuclear energy becomes a controversial issue which causes fierce discussion among not only scientists , but also publics .
In my point of view , using nuclear energy is the right way to meet today's increasing energy demand , due to its high efficiency , environmental emission .
Also , the opposing terms of using nuclear energy , which are: the funds paid on developing this technology is high , the time taking to explore the technology is long and there exists dangers can actually be solved .
Besides the above two factors , some opponents may believe that it is dangerous to use nuclear energy .
We use Very-High-Temperature-Reactors  , which is one of Generation IV reactor concepts , as an example .
Due to the special design of its Helium Coolant , Graphite Reactor Core and temperature controlled system , the danger can be greatly reduced .
It is true that there still exists dangers , however , with the develop of the technology , it is desirable that those dangers could be overcome .
Design process is a linear sequence of events which was started by creative human act and ended with an invention of a new product .
It is also a kind of planning on how to apply the knowledge to the making of an object or a system .
Psychology is the characteristics of mental states and the science of human behavior .
It plays an important role in every human attempt in design processes . .
There is a relationship between psychology and design process which can preventing accident from happening .
Design errors in socio-technical system have really made a significant difference to their reliability and safe operation .
Researches from the nuclear and chemical industry show that 20% to 50% of accidents and failures involve errors in design .
Moreover , since design errors are always corrected before they are involved in these incidents , the real percentage is actually much higher .
If corrective action is taken after an incident , it entails either the redesigning of the operational processes or the installation of another barrier .
These are feedback controls of safety .
They are just add-ons to the system .
However , it is better to use the path of feed-forward control of safety that is to do a correct original system design right from the beginning .
To improve design safety , a human scientist is needed .
This person can help to analyze the future requirements of the system and to improve accident prevention .
Apart from this , a human scientist may also be called upon to help evaluate the prototype by using simulation techniques .
It is necessary to introduce add-ons as all possible design errors will not be discovered until the system is used . 
In conclusion , an accident is never caused by a single component failure or a single human error .
Psychology plays an essential role in design processes .
The role of humans in safeguarding complicated socio-technical systems cannot be neglected .
If the psychology factor is not considered in design processes , accidents may happen easily .
Hence , psychological inputs should be incorporated in design processes .
"The reasonable person adapts them self to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to them self .
Therefore , all progress depends upon the unreasonable person ."
This sentence indicates why engineering psychology will become closer and closer to our life .
What is engineering psychology ?
Generally speaking , engineering psychology is concerned with adapting equipment and environment to people  .
This adjustment is based on people's psychological capacities and limitations , and the aim of it is to improve the overall system performance .
The conception of engineering psychology is first brought out during the First World War , when people found that the efficiency of machines was reduced sharply when they were operated by women instead of men  .
Since then people began to realize that sometimes the engineering problem was related to equipment design rather than the people who operate or other mechanical reasons .
However it is hard to say that whether we can solve the engineering problem by simply improving the psychological problems , since for many engineering incidences the technical problems had occupied an overwhelming part .
Hence in this essay I will argue about the proportion of psychological problem and technological problems during engineering incidence and give a conclusion from my own view .
Based on the report provided by Reason  , 92% of all nuclear utility accidents between 1983-1984 were caused by people and only 8% of them were cause by control room operator .
For instance , there are two serious incidences which are cited frequently in technical literature .
They were happened in Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
The failing for the first one include: operators are unprepared to handle serious accident due to the lack of training complex and confusing operating procedure led to the operators' incorrect action serious managerial problem within the Nuclear Regulatory Commission .
None of these deficiencies explain the basic causes in terms of the 'operating error' .
Moreover Reason suggests two main reasons for this kind of incidence in his own report for Chernobyl .
The first factor related to people misunderstands of effect of their action on the whole system , and the second factor is kind of persistent action which is made by a small and cohesive group in the process of pursuing an unsuitable aim .
What is the most iron evidences for his theories is that after realizing these engineering psychology problems , quite a lot of America's nuclear institutes begin to train their staff in a psychology-related way , which indeed prevent the nuclear accidents from happening again till now .
To sum up we can conclude from these two aspects that the human factors and the technical factor are connected and have both played a role in the accident .
To simply solve one of them will contribute nothing to the accident .
Engineering accidents are not always caused by technical problems and the issue of engineering psychology will become hotter and hotter with the development of technology in the area of advanced transportation , co-operative work , teleworking , health , pollution and leisure .
