With the fast development of human society , we are facing more and more demanding energy requirements .
After centuries' exploitation , oil and coal , which human have deeply relied on in the past few hundred years , will dry up soon .
As prediction shows , the two main energy resources will be unable to sustain the industry demands in less than one hundred years time .
To solve this problem , people tried to find different energy substitutions , among which is nuclear energy .
Nuclear energy has many advantages .
Firstly , it is environmental-friendly , with no greenhouse gas emitted .
Secondly , nuclear energy has incomparable working efficiency with other energy resources .
One kilogram uranium can release the same amount of energy as that released by 2400 tons of standard coal .
As carbon dioxide emission soars and energy demands increase rapidly recent years , the nuclear option is finding its way to the table .
To satisfy the increasing demands of nuclear energy , scientists are desperately searching for ways to improve the reactors' work efficiency .
Consequently , generation IV nuclear systems are born , including six models .
They are Gas-cooled fast reactor , lead-cooled fast reactor , molten salt reactor , sodium-cooled fast reactor supercritical-water-cooled reactor and very-high-temperature reactor .
Among all kinds of nuclear reactors , very-high-temperature reactor is an advanced one and has a broad prospect .
It supplies heat with high core outlet temperatures , which enables applications such as hydrogen production or process heat for the petrochemical industry .
This allows for more efficient conversion of heat to electricity .
What's more , the recycling system is well-developed .
Given so many advantages of VHTR , we should devote more effort in promoting the reactor development .
However , some people may doubt the practicability of building such a high-efficiency nuclear reactor since it operates under such a high temperature .
Actually this should not be a worry .
Generation IV International Forum  , as the authority in nuclear power development , has shown the data which demonstrates that the basic technology for the VHTR has been well established in former High Temperature Gas Reactors plants .
Many prototypes are available as experience to develop VHTR .
Many national laboratory and vendors are very keen in the research of VHTR , such as: PBMR , GT-HTR300C , ANTARES , NHDD , GT-MHR and NGNP in South Africa , Japan , France , Republic of Korea and the United States .
Many of them have made significant breakthrough .
Hence , there is a great chance that VHTR will come to the world soon .
As the result of scary impressions left by two severe nuclear plants accidents in history , many people reject VHTR because of the security issue .
However , we should see the two accidents are both due to human factors rather than the reactors' own deflects .
What's more , many scientists have studied the operation security of VHTR , like Hu , S . , Liang , X . , Wei , L . He reported his research results in "{Commissioning and Operation experience and safety experiment at HTR-10}" , on the Third International Topical Meeting on High Temperature Reactor Technology in South Africa and put forwards some constructive suggestions to improve the security condition of high temperature reactors .
Considering all these inspiring achievements on VHTR , we should have confidence that we will build secure nuclear reactors which will avoid tragedies happening .
After all the above , we can see that we have many reasons to support the development and further research on VHTR .
It deserves all the effort , no matter in terms of security insurance or work efficiency .
In other words , VHTR has the promising potential to be the future energy supplier .
So now we should pay more attention on the developing progress and give more financial support .
And we should be optimistic that we can realize our dreamto build VHTR before 2020 and have abundant and clear energy .
Originated from the Ernest Rutherford's theory about atomic structure and Albert Einstein's well known mass-energy formula , the development of nuclear power has bypassed a glorious century and become one of the major electrical energy sources now  .
While amazed by the enormous energy generated by the tiny mass , people are also concerned about the negative perspectives of nuclear power .
Those against the development of nuclear power claim that it is safety threatening , costly in research and building plants , and not renewable  .
Nevertheless , with the gas-cooled fast reactors concept in hand , further research and funding should be devoted to expanding nuclear power .
The major refutation to developing nuclear power is about its threat to the safety of the public since conventional nuclear power produces radioactive waste and has a possibility of nuclear power proliferation  .
However , safety issue would be less of a concern once the GFR concept is deployed .
GFR utilizes the waste reprocessing method , which minimizes the public's exposure to nuclear waste's radioactivity  .
Besides , the primary GFR core is loaded with transuranics from spent LWR fuel such that the plutonium created in waste reprocessing is diluted and consequently the proliferation resistance of the nuclear power plants is enhanced  .
Furthermore , GFR adopts a passive cool-down system that reduces human's intervention substantially and thus enhances the safety of nuclear power plants  .
People also argue that developing nuclear power technology and constructing nuclear power plants are too expensive and it is not worthwhile since other cleaner energy sources could be cheaper in the future  .
Nevertheless , analyses have been done with the result that plant capital cost can be reduced by up to 25% compared to the traditional Rankine cycle using the supercritical CO2 direct cycle  .
Moreover , besides electricity power , GFR concept plants can also output hydrogen  .
Subsequently , it counterbalances its large cost to a great extent .
Another great concern of environmentalists is that the amount of Uranium on earth is limited , which means that nuclear power is not sustainable and subsequently less worthwhile for further development  .
Nonetheless , it has been shown that GFR achieves high Uranium utilization by breeding , also known as reprocessing  .
Analyses also indicate that the amount of Uranium resources was increased by 15 percentages in two years to 2007 for intensified mineral exploration and it is also proven that Thorium can also act as nuclear fuel  .
As a result , the limitation of Uranium would be less of concern while considering the expansion of nuclear power .
With consideration of the current worldwide energy shortage , population expansion and global warming , it is appealing to bring about the generation IV nuclear power supply using GFR concept for its tremendous energy output and zero carbon emission .
Nevertheless , obstacles like finding irradiation-resistant materials and core design still need to be overcome by researches through hard work  .
Contrary to the opponents' concerns about nuclear power safety , cost and sustainability , it has been shown in the above that the generation IV nuclear power supply under the GFR concept is able to achieve higher safety goals , lower its building cost and make great economic contribution by splitting hydrogen , and exhibit improved sustainability .
Meanwhile , it produces immense energy and is free of carbon emission , which makes it even more ideal for power supply .
It is then predictable that the near future would witness the rise of nuclear power equipped with the generation IV reactor concept , GFR .
The Chernobyl incident on 26 April 1986 at Soviet Union was one of the most tragic catastrophes .
When the nuclear reactor exploded , tons of radioactive substances were released into the atmosphere .
The result was a contaminated food cycle and acute cancer-related illnesses .
Some of the damage reports done by scientists suggest that a minimal of 30000 deaths in 1986 are related to cancer arising from extreme exposure to the radiation .
To add on to the figures , the current death toll stands at a frightening 500000 .
According to Blackeye , the accident was primarily caused by a flawed Soviet designed reactor .
This reactor , named reactor bolshoy moshchnosty kanalny was actually meant for producing nuclear weapons .
Design of the reactor was such that even when the rate of cooling of the reactor was insufficient to compensate the increase in temperature , it will still be operational .
In other reactor designs , either the plant or the reactors will be automatically shut down .
This tragic event could have been avoided , or at least , the resultant damage be kept minimal if psychology was implemented in the operating process and procedures of the plant .
The use of psychology could have minimized the damage or even prevented the accident by influencing the engineers to use a reactor that is safer and has a negative void coefficient .
This is because should things turn out not be as expected , thousands or even millions of people could be affected .
Also , the people working in the power station should not be placed under danger
Next , in order to make the power plant as profitable as possible , use of psychology was omitted .
Steps associated with safety were excluded from the daily routine .
Also , accident prevention system coverage was not extensive .
Companies running the plant would only see the extra steps mentioned above to be unnecessary .
If psychology was used , the accident would probably not have happened as the Soviet government would fund part of the maintenance cost so that the necessary steps to ensure a safe working environment could be implemented .
Hence , the accident could have been prevented .
Thirdly , as mentioned by ILO Online , there was an absence of proper training and safe working environment .
The workers were not given adequate training to handle and operate the machinery involved .
While some may argue that training were unrecorded or informal , it is only proper to provide authorized and thorough training so that accidents can be avoided .
As the saying goes , it is human to make mistakes .
Based on Wilpert ,Should psychology be used in this context , the explosion at Chernobyl can be averted .
As mentioned in the previous point , funding can the government can help to reduce the strain on the firm running the plant .
External parties can be called in to provide the training required .
With reference to the points mentioned above , it can be clearly seen that in today's context , where technology is getting more and more advanced , the consequences of a failure or breakdown in high-tech installations is devastating .
Applying the use of psychology in the engineering design processes may make it more costly and slow it down .
Nevertheless , when it comes to safety aspect , it definitely pays to add another step to the process and take precautions .
26 April 1986 marked the day when the lives of many in Ukraine changed forever .
Stemming from a simple experiment by engineers to test the cooling pump system when there is no power supply , the series of events that followed snowballed into the better known Chernobyl disaster .
At the end of it all , many were left dead and many more affected by the radioactive plume .
If the decisions by the engineers at duty in the plant were delivered with consideration , the Chernobyl disaster would not have tainted history .
Therefore the use of psychology in influencing engineers towards making proper decisions is a crucial one .
Psychology enhances understanding of design processes , helps foresee problems and as a result reduces problems too .
The opposition might argue on the cost and the need to implement psychology in an engineering design process but the imminent need to prevent accidents overpowers all opposition .
The use of psychology in design processes reduces problem by enabling an engineer to consider the pros and cons of his decision .
With psychology as a guiding tool , engineers are able to think of the possible fallbacks of their decisions .
Most design related problems are because of the difficulty people face in understanding the consequences of their actions  .
While opponents might argue on the impertinence of the use of psychology and its effectiveness in reducing problems , it is undeniable that the use of psychology makes all team members take meticulous care in implementing decisions and hence make the design process safer .
Furthermore , the use of psychology lubricates cohesiveness among team members making the working environment friendlier .
A friendly environment would mean opinions are effectively shared .
Stanton remarked that the Chernobyl incident sparked due to the syndrome he terms as "groupthink" where small groups become unswerving in the face of an unfavorable situation .
With the use of psychology , members in the team are at greater ease in challenging a wrong decision and thus stalling an accident .
On the other hand , one could argue that the cost of hiring a psychologist is too high and cohesiveness can be easily achieved through games and interaction .
However , many of these people fail to consider the number of lives that are placed in jeopardy should the design process fail .
Therefore , the use of psychology and thus the need to hire a psychologist can be considered as an investment to prevent accidents .
The use of psychology would seek to improve engineering designs by preventing the human errors associated with the process .
A psychologist will seek to understand the mindsets of various members and thus foresee human error on their parts .
Shelton discussed the impact of human error on even the simplest tasks .
With human error being the trigger to accidents  , it is very crucial to nip human error in the bud .
Opponents might suggest ergonomics instead .
They would challenge that the design process should be made to suit the engineer so that human error on man's part can be avoided .
This argument cannot hold mainly because human error is evident everywhere and changing the design process would only mean a new set of human errors .
Instead with the use of psychology aiding the sculpting of a safe design process  , we can prevent accidents .
In conclusion , the use of psychology plays a huge role in facilitating any design process and ensuring that mishaps are completely avoided .
In the case of the Chernobyl accident , if psychology was inculcated , the mistakes by the engineers could have been prevented .
Many lives could have been spared .
Many people would have been freed from the painful marks of the Chernobyl accident .
Even though many would argue on the prospects of using psychology in design processes , one can say that the use of psychology depicts an accident free future vividly .
As more engineers feel stressful from their high workload , psychologist plays an important role in their work .
Most engineers only care about how to apply technology into practice , but they seldom care about how to make products that can be used easily .
Designing products should considering psychological factors for consumers and operators .

Many people argue that psychology is non-related with engineering design companies do not need to spend extra money on the unnecessary outcome .

This is resulted from the emissions of greenhouse gas , such as carbon dioxide , in energy generation using fossil fuels .

As a result , there is an urgent need to find substitute for coal and oil .
Under such circumstances , scientists and engineers find out a new kind of energy-nuclear energy .
Nuclear power technology is expected to provide clean and sufficient energy in the future .
However , there is much debate over this technology .
Cost and security are the two main reasons for opposition to nuclear power technology in many countries .
Even with these two reasons , it is still necessary to provide funding for research on nuclear power .
Opponents of nuclear power technology argue over the security of such technology .
Many people worry about nuclear radiation and other serious accidents .
According to Butler  , partial reactor melted down in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and of the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded , killing some 31 people immediately  .
However , nuclear reactor designers take security into account when they are designing and constructing a nuclear plant .
There are many internal and external facilities built to ensure secure operation .
Thus , current nuclear power plants are able to withstand accidents from various events based on design .
For example , in England , the controlling computers will shut down the reactor automatically if something abnormal happens .
Moreover , "Laws and statues exist in most countries to ensure the safe operation of nuclear plant"  .
Hence , security of nuclear energy generation can be guaranteed and it is no need to worry too much about security .
Another reason for opposition to nuclear power is the high cost of reactor construction .
It is very expensive to construct and maintain and run a nuclear power plant .
However , scientists and engineers are trying to simplify the reactors .
In generation IV , in supercritical-water-cooled reactor  , many parts can be cut from the design compared to previous light water reactor  , thus reducing construction cost .
According to Stephens  , the US spends $1 billion on FutureGen project which aims at development of carbon capture and storage technologies  .
In addition , the global warming effects may result in droughts which will reduce crop production and air pollution can result in acid rain which can corrode many properties .
The usage of nuclear power helps to reduce the emissions of greenhouse gas , slowing down global warming and purifying air which will in turn reduce the indirect cost of greenhouse gas .
Finally , funding should be provided for research on nuclear power technology .

It is running out at a high speed .
Substitute must be found before fossil fuel is totally run out .
Nuclear energy is a good alternative .
Currently , nuclear industry is generating 17% of the world's electricity .
If technical hurdles involved in building the next generation of reactors can be solved by scientists and engineers , then we can get secure , inexpensive , and abundant energy .
It is very likely that in the near future , nuclear energy will be one of the main energy resources .
In conclusion , the opposition reasons of nuclear power technology can be overthrow .
The nuclear power technology can solve not only environmental problem caused by the combustion of fossil fuel , but also energy shortage at low cost and in environmental-friendly way .
In this situation , nuclear power deserves the research funding for further development .
Supercritical-water-cooled reactor is a nuclear reactor which uses supercritical-water , water at very high pressure , as coolant .
It functions in temperature ranging from approximately 500 to 650 degrees Celsius and at very high pressure .
Many skeptics oppose the idea of building nuclear reactors as they fear similar incident to that in Chernobyl might happen again .
However , I believe this is not very likely as supercritical-water-cooled reactor is designed differently to avoid such incident from reoccurring .
In addition , the benefits that a supercritical-water-cooled reactor could bring are worth further researching and funding in the supercritical-water-cooled reactor .
Many skeptics oppose the idea of building nuclear reactors due to worries of their safe operation .
One major nuclear incident was that in Chernobyl CITATION Dav04 \l 1033  .
This reactor back then work on a positive void coefficient of reactivity .
Therefore , when the control rods went wrong , the reactor entered a series of positive feedbacks and was unable to stop the reactivity of the nuclear reactor .
This resulted in continuous rise in temperature which caused the carbon part of the nuclear core to catch fire due to the high heat within the reactor .
The fire and explosion from the reactors caused the widespread of nuclear substance into the air and hence a devastating nuclear incident .
However , the supercritical-water-cooled reactor works on a negative void coefficient which will reduce the reactivity of the reactors , should any problem arise .
The nuclear reactor would be shut down if the nuclear core was to malfunction or the cooling system was to leak , thereby halting all nuclear reactivity .
These will put the nuclear reactivity under control .
Therefore the worries of the skeptics are unnecessary and further research and funding of the supercritical-water-cooled reactor should take place .
Secondly , skeptics argue that under high temperature and pressure , materials tend to deteriorate faster and become weak .
Therefore building a reactor to run under the conditions of a supercritical-water-cooled reactor could be dangerous .
I agree that under high temperature and pressure , materials generally tend to deteriorate faster and would have a lower lifespan .
However , the structure of the supercritical-water-cooled reactor is designed such that its pressure threshold rises with temperature .
CITATION Sat08 \l 1033 This makes the skeptics' worry redundant as the structure is designed to specifically operate under the high temperature and pressure .
Therefore , further research and funding in the supercritical-water-cooled reactor should take place .
Lastly , the benefits that a supercritical-water-cooled reactor could bring make it worth further researching and funding into the reactor .
The reactor is much more efficient than conventional light water reactors: the supercritical-water-cooled reactor has a thermal efficiency of 45% which is approximately one-third higher than that of conventional light water reactors CITATION Sat08 \l 1033  .
Furthermore , the supercritical-water-cooled reactor is just an improvement of the conventional water reactor , making it relatively cheap to build .
Also , nuclear power is not a source of carbon dioxide , a major greenhouse gas that causes global warming .
The high thermal efficiency and environmental friendly characteristic of the supercritical-water-cooled reactor make it attractive to build the reactor .
Therefore , there should be further research and funding into the building of supercritical-water-cooled reactor .
In conclusion , the skeptics' worries of safety are redundant with the current level of technology .
In addition , the high efficiency and environmental friendly characteristic of a supercritical-water-cooled reactor make it profitable , in the long run , to build .
Hence there should be further research and funding into the building of supercritical-water-cooled reactors to further improve on this new generation IV reactor concept .

On July 17 , 1981 in Kansas City , Missouri , United States , The Hyatt Regency walkway collapse killed 114 people and injuring more than 200 others during a tea dance .
It was one of the deadliest structural collapses in U .S . history .
The accident was caused by the lack of communication between the designers and the constructors .
Although it may not be possible to avoid all accidents from happening , we can take some measures to decrease the possibility of risks .
The involvement of psychology during engineering processing is a helpful and practicable measure .
It can lower the possibility of accidents that are caused by human factors .
In the case of walkway collapse , it can be estimated that if psychology was applied during the structural processing , the collapse would be avoided .
The design and construction of building are regarded as the work of engineers and irrelevant with psychology .
However , people are likely to make mistakes in every aspect in life , including engineering processing .
Lots of accidents are caused by human factors rather than technical problems or financial liability .
Previous research finds that about 90 percent of engineering accidents are due to human errors .
Hence , psychology , a human science which studies human's mental processes and behaviors can help to decrease the mistakes caused by human factors .
To further explain it , psychology can be used to analysis the man-made reasons which causes errors , such as engineers' attitudes , habits and social ability .
After that we can obtain some strategies from the analysis and utilize them in the engineering processing to prevent accidents from happening .
In the Hyatt Regency walkway collapse , the design was modified halfway , which was thought as a small trivial by both the designers and the constructors .
They believed that the other have rechecked the details , while in fact nobody did before construction .
Therefore it can be expected that if psychology was involved during the construction , this tragedy caused by lack of responsibility would not occur at all !
Some opponents argue that it is a "wise after event" or just an imagination to use psychology during engineering processing , for it is hard to combining the abstract psychology with concrete engineering processing .
However , as a branch of today's applied psychology , psychology in industrial safety is quite practicable and convenient to conduct .
What need to be done is to organize some training sessions which can make the engineers more skillful , or some meetings that cover the common mistakes in engineering processing which embed the awareness of safety in people's mind . .
Furthermore , it can also be some encouraging activities which help to build the engineers' loyalty towards their companies and help them to realize their importance in the companies .
Study has proved that when employees feel they are valued during a mission , they tend to be more responsible and as a result , the safety and quantity of production are greatly improved .
As for the collapse accident , if anybody was responsible and recheck the design , it could be avoided .
To summarize , If psychology was involved in the building of Hyatt Regency walkway collapse , which was a practicable measure , this unfortunate accident would have been eliminate at the very beginning .
Nuclear power is a great discovery in human history .
Nowadays , nuclear technology is widely used as an extra resource for electric generators .
It is clean and stable .
Many people believe that nuclear power plant will take the place of our traditional electric generators in the future .
However , people don't realize that there will be many problems caused by using nuclear technology , in terms of environment , cost , and nature resources .
As a big breakthrough , nuclear power was discovered by two Germany scientists , Otto Hahn and Fritz Stresemannin 1938 .
{Figures In Radiation History} , they found that , when they used a neutron to collide with another heavy nuclear , the nuclear broke into two parts and there was some mass lost .
The lost mass generates what we call "Atomic energy" , as square of light speed times as the lost mass .
After that , the atomic bomb came up , which leads the end of the World War II .
Actually , the reason why atomic bomb kill so many people is not the explosion itself , it is the radiation generate by the Uranium and chain reaction .
The radiation won't dissipate within 100 years .
When people began to use controlled chain reaction , they were really concern about the radiation and the impact on environment .
From early 1960s to 1980s there were several anti-nuclear movements in United Sates , which showed people's concern about the nuclear power .
{http://www .pollutionissues .com/A-Bo/Antinuclear-Movement .html} .
Although the Atomic Energy Commission had advocated for peaceful uses of nuclear power since the development ofatomic bomb , people were still worried about that .
Although we cannot say it is safe enough to use nuclear power , Uranium is really a clean and cheap resource compared with coal and oil .
First , it won't give off carbon dioxide and sulphur dioxide , which has a positive impact on our environment .
We are really worried about the Green house gases now , there is a data shows that every year the temperature globally increases 0 .2 to 0 .3 degree Celsius .
So , it is very effective to use Uranium to stop the Green house gases .
Second , the cost of purifying Uranium and getting coal which generate the same amount of energy is almost the same .
It is means that the cost is acceptable .
Pure Uranium is easy to transport , because only 1 ton of Uranium will give use the same energy as burning 5000tons of coal .
So , many countries , including U .S , China , Russia , France , U .K and Japan , begin to use Uranium .
In twentieth century , the safety of using Uranium is still under the discussion .
There were a few accident happened during the Uranium's purification process and reaction process .
Our human's ability is limited .
We cannot say that we have fully control the nuclear reaction process , but it now can be controlled and react at a peaceful rate .
What our government is happy to hear is that , Uranium is still enough to support us for hundreds of years , although it is hard to be purified .
There were many Uranium mine exits underground .
Nuclear power plants first started in 1954 and proliferated rapidly due to its many advantages over conventional fossil-fuel plants .
Today , there are altogether 439 nuclear power reactors in operation throughout the world .
However in the 1970s , nuclear accidents at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl stirred up a big controversy over nuclear power and practically halted the development of nuclear power in many countries  .
The argument is that the nuclear plants are a safety hazard to the country and is a probable target for terrorists .
In addition , environmental risks from nuclear waste and discovery of other renewable energy sources also contributed to the push for phasing out nuclear power which had lasted for several decades .
Lately , a number of new designs for nuclear power generation , known as Generation IV reactors , are the subject of active research and may lead to the revival of nuclear power in the future .
One such design is the SCWR which attempts to eliminate or reduce previously debated risks surrounding nuclear power .
While some may be skeptical on tapping nuclear power due to various issues , the new SCWR will alleviate their concerns if there is continual research and development funding for the design to materialize .
Critics believe that nuclear power is not safe as it poses a health risk to workers and the public due to low-level radiation from the plants .
They are also concerned that the new reactors will reenact the events leading to past disastrous nuclear accidents that had resulted in high fatality .
On the contrary , studies conducted by non-profit , neutral agencies have found no compelling evidence of a correlation between nuclear power and risk of cancer caused by exposure to high radiation level .
The studies done are based on comparing the number of cancer patients in the vicinity of nuclear power and non nuclear power settlements .
According to another report , nuclear power accidents have also caused fewer deaths than accidents related to other forms of energy .
Besides that , the SCWR is also integrated with passive simplified safety system that can eliminate boiling crisis instances common in nuclear accidents .
Hence , there is less reliance on sophisticated backup systems or experienced operators .
Less dependence on human will equate to lower risks as human error was a significant factor in most nuclear accidents .
In the event of an unlikely emergency , extensive evacuation plan and protective actions will be carried out and coordinated between governments and power plant officials .

One concern expressed by the public and governments is the vulnerability of plants to attack by terrorists as well as the usage of nuclear waste by product as a weapon .
Under the new SCWR power plant security blueprint , these concerns are well taken into consideration .
More patrols , stronger and more capable security forces , additional physical barriers , greater stand-off distances for vehicle checks  , more restrictive site access controls were introduced to minimize security risks .
The United Nations had also called upon the world leaders to improve security in order to prevent radioactive material from falling into the hands of terrorists .
There are also plans for a centralized , permanent , and secure waste repositories to be built and for security stationed along transportation routes to be increased .
Apart from the increase in nuclear plants' security , enhanced scram system fitted in SCWR could shut down a reactor in less than 5 second severely deterring a terrorist force in any goal to release radioactivity .
Lastly , the SCWR is also able to operate without having to depend on the much debated reprocessing of plutonium waste .
Opponents perceive costs and performance of nuclear reactors as inferior to conventional reactors .
It was pointed out that the costs of constructing a nuclear plant , decommissioning nuclear facilities and the costs of storing nuclear waste are expensive .
Materials needed for the plants are also either costly , rare or do not exist yet .
Moreover , much public subsidy funds and tax expenditures are consumed in nuclear research and development projects when they could be used to invest in alternative renewable energy technologies .
However , the SCWR will actually be economically viable .
Far simpler designs , with elimination of circulation pumps , pressurizers , steam generators , steam separators and dryers reduces its capital and building costs .
Additionally , the supercritical coolant has a high specific enthalpy and promises to deliver high thermal efficiencies of approximately 45% versus the current 33% of light water reactors .
Combination of higher operating temperature which increases power output and low fuel utilization translates to cheaper energy .
The SCWR estimates are at $900/kWe and  2 .9/kWh which can be considered to meet the economic and sustainability requirements .
So despite its high initial capital cost and operation , nuclear power is still competitive with fossil fuel for electricity generation .
If the social , health and environmental costs are also taken into account , nuclear power plants will be exceedingly outstanding compared to fossil-fueled plants .
Finally , experts speculated that increasing scarcity of oil will drive oil prices up to $100 and $150 per barrel in the future which will lead to an increase in energy prices for fossil-fueled power plants .
It is evident that in the long run , when energy cost for fossil-fueled plant increase continually , using nuclear power for electricity generation is much more economical .
To sum it all , SCWR can effectively meet the requirements of modern globalised world while addressing all the various concerns .
It is specifically designed to be very safe and free from accidents .
Newer technology helps to increase energy security as well as produces cleaner energy .
Many security enhancements will also be put in place to protect the plants from potential terrorist threats .
In fact , SCWR is considered to be proliferation resistant .
In addition , it is categorised as a more efficient and cheaper energy source than conventional power technologies .
SCWR could indeed replace prevalent fossil-fuel reactors by economical standards .
With continual R&D funding for development , SCWR will become a reliable and bountiful source of power in the future .

"Nuclear power is going to be an important part of our energy mix !"
declared President Obama's secretary of energy  .
To the mind of opponents of nuclear power , the construction of nuclear power plant will put Mother Earth under threat as nuclear accidents , such as the notorious Chernobyl in year 1986 , can cause massive destruction to the environment and more importantly , they are inevitable .
However , as the days go by , the number of opposition against nuclear energy is decreasing due to the advancements in technology and the realization of the need for alternative sources of power .
Out of the six Generation-IV nuclear reactors that are introduced , the supercritical water-cooled reactor appears to show the most potential to be the nuclear power plant for the next generation to come .
Not only is it safer and more cost efficient , it also yields the most consistent performance as compared to the other types of nuclear reactors .
As the name suggest , the coolant of the SCWR uses water , which is safer than other types of cooling agents .
This gives people a sense of security when SCWR is used .
However , advocates may argue that water in such nuclear reactor behaves differently due to the high pressurization required for it to reach a temperature of as high as 300 Degrees Celsius .
Comparatively , other types of coolant agent , such as sodium , react more actively in air and it may cause a massive explosion and a sudden discharge of radioactive particle in the air if leakage were to occur .
As such , water is the preferred option as a leakage will , at most , contaminate the water at the surrounding of the nuclear power plant and such an occurrence will only pose limited damage to our environment .
Moreover , SCWR is a modification of the proven light water reactor technology , which is operating extensively in the world currently  .
With the absence of any major accidents involving these nuclear reactors , we can safely conclude that the usage of SCWR is more secured than the new concepts of power plants , for which their technology is yet to be fully enhanced .

The cost of electricity generated is another factor that will be of immense concern to the public .
It will be unrealistic if one has to pay a lot more for every kilowatt of electricity used .
Ideally , SCWR uses water which is available at a very low cost , as compared to lead and helium .
Nevertheless , critics will point to the unavailability of technology to develop materials , such as the corrosive-resistant core structure that will be able to withstand SCWR conditions  , resulting in the large amount of investments required to be pumped into the research of such materials .
The cost of implementation of the SCWR may then seem to be too steep .
In spite of this argument , the capital cost of electricity generated from the SCWR will be lower in the long run , due to the simplicity its structure that will make up for the high initial building cost  .
This can be backed up from the fact that most nuclear power plants can operate beyond their typical design lifespan of 30-40 years with proper maintenance and the gradual improvement of technology  .
Consequently , it will be wise to choose the SCWR ahead of the other Gen-IV reactors if it comes to producing low cost power for the future .
Looking at the rate of performance of the SCWR , it is incomparable to the other Gen-IV reactors .
Due to the low temperature where the SCWR process lies , the amount of output power will be at a slight disadvantage over the other forms of Gen-IV reactors .
Furthermore , SCWR produces only electricity as compared to lead-cooled fast reactors which produce both electricity and hydrogen power  .
Nonetheless , the inferiority in the rate of performance of the SCWR should not be a discouraging factor to its construction .
Instead , the reliability of the Gen-IV reactors should be the utmost concern while their performance rate should only be the secondary consideration .
If the reactors can operate safely without serious incidents of malfunctioning , which are more likely in the case of SCWR , a continuous supply of power can then be generated without disrupting the lives of the public .
This is evident from the fact that SCWR is a simpler plant , in terms of its design and structure as compared to other types of reactors  .
Otherwise , there will be a shortage of power supply for months in an event of a breakdown these nuclear reactors will prove to be a liability , rather than a power generation asset to the public during these periods .
As such , the consistent performance of the SCWR will be a crucial factor that allows it to stand out among the other Gen-IV reactors .
In conclusion , the SCWR is the most ideal candidate for the next generation of nuclear power reactor .
Besides being dependable for its continuous supply of power , it is also the cheapest and the safest alternative among all choices .
As we move away from our dependency on the combustion of coals for energy , we must , at the same time , ensure that the alternative source will be able to perform as well .
In the meantime , this is impossible but at the rate which environmental organizations are progressing , I envision the day where we have zero dependence on coal for energy and SCWR takes its place at full speed !

The soundtrack , My Heart Will Go On sung by Celine Dion , was the theme song for the Oscar winning mega blockbuster movie , Titanic .
The movie was based on a true story whereby the ship named , Titanic , collided with an iceberg and sank on its maiden voyage .
Eventually , it became one the worst maritime accident that occurred during peacetime .
Being the largest , most luxurious and technologically advanced liner of her time  , the Titanic clearly enjoyed the prestige .
However , her downfall was partly due to human error .
Since then , more attention had been given to the area of human psychology in relation to engineering design process .
In view of this , I believe that this is the appropriate direction we should adopt to prevent major accidents from happening .
According to Jones , some experts believe that technology is increasing equipment reliability and at the same time , reducing human reliability  .
As such , many critics tend to argue that the role for psychology in engineering design is insignificant .
It is true that technology is able to perform complex and multiple functions at the shortest possible time with precise readings .
However , we often fail to realize that it is actually we , humans who create and manage technology .
Since we do make mistakes and assumptions , we cannot simply assume that all technologies are perfect .
White Star Line .
The Real R .M .S Titanic .
Retrieved October 9 , 2009 from {http://home .swipnet .se/~w-41381/titanic/real .html}
BBC , The RMS Titanic .
Retrieved October 9 , 2009 from http://www .bbc .co .uk/dna/h2g2/A457067
Titanic and Other White Star Line Ship .
Retrieved October 9 ,2009 from http://www .titanic-whitestarships .com/TandOWSS%20FAQ .htm
Rather , we should focus on the psychology of engineers and scientists who invent and apply the technology to meet our worldly needs .
In the case of Titanic , the ship was equipped with high technology water compartment system that will shut special doors in the event of any emergency .
This led engineers to think that Titanic is the safest ship at that point of time .
Titanic was equipped with only 20 lifeboats , so that bulky lifeboats would not take up precious deck space for the first class passengers .
There were 20 lifeboats having a total capacity of 1178 people which was only enough to hold half of the Titanic passengers  .
This illustrates the point that despite having improved technology , accidents can still happen due to over-confidence and reliance on technology .
Furthermore , the idea of Titanic being "sinkable" supported the notion that people at that time were overly confident .
While we understand that technology can help to prevent accidents when applied appropriately , it ultimately falls to the management of people .
Therefore if the engineers of Titanic were prudent in the engineering design process , they would have included a high margin of safety factor to anticipate possible failure during the construction of Titanic .
Needless to say , the fatalities of that collision would have been minimized .
Not surprisingly , many detractors suggest that the main reason why Titanic sank was due to the fact that the terrain at which Titanic was sailing was poor .
During the night before the collision , the ocean was icy cold and was filled with icebergs .
This made navigation difficult .
There were more icebergs in the North Atlantic that year than it had been for fifty years  .
While it is true that we cannot control the climate to suit our needs , we can always suit the environment by taking a proactive stance in contingency planning .
By taking a proactive stance in planning , we can identify our main priorities and set goals achieving it in view of possible setback .
One of the reasons why Titanic sank was due to the fact that the safety was being compromised for aesthetics and convenience .
For instance , the telegraphers ignored warnings from other ships about the icebergs ahead .
Instead , they were so busy sending private messages for the passengers , so they did not think about those warnings that much  .
When the crew spotted an iceberg ahead , the ship was steering too fast and could not avoid it despite performing emergency procedures .
This showed that the telegrapher had a wrong mindset in the first place .
He gave priorities for private messages over the safety of the ship .
This mindset was probably induced by the culture of the working environment of Titanic .
As Titanic was exclusive and luxurious , the culture of the staff working is to first please their occupant , then safety .
Such a mindset can also be seen even in today's service industry whereby "customer is always first" .
In addition , the Captain of the Titanic did not reduce the speed at which the ship was traveling in order to arrive their destination earlier .
He had in fact been influenced to "speed up" not necessarily in order for Titanic set a crossing record , but to beat the Olympic's crossing record  .
These only go to show that the crews of the Titanic had set the wrong priorities .
Therefore , if we neglect the psychological aspect of any engineering application , we can be certain that more accidents will happen .
In the case of the Titanic , the accident could had been avoided if the Captain adopts a 'safety first' culture in the workplace and makes contingency plans for any emergency .
In conclusion , we cannot deny that the fact that psychology had an impact in the way we process and manage technology .
So long as there is a human factor in the engineering process , the use of psychology is inevitable .
In fact as we rely more on technology , we place more responsibilities on the few individuals who manage it .
In addition , we need to pay more attention to the way we place our priorities .
When we set wrong priorities , we head in the wrong direction despite having the best technology available .
After all , technology only assists us in achieving our material goals but when it comes to psychology , it has no part to play .

Sophistication , this term has made quite an impact in the lives of people all over the globe .
Technical advancement and uplift in standards of live has resulted ultimately in the rapid consumption of natural resources .
So viewing the present situation in this ominous light , the ultimate solution we get to think of is to find new means to sustain the exploding population .
Electric power is as important to the people now as how food clothing and shelter is .
How do we meet the power needs of the growing world with this limited power sources we have ?
The solution is offered by the Generaton IV nuclear power plants .
The Generation IV concepts offer a lucrative solution to the power issue through their very high efficiency in conversion of thermal energy to electricity when compared to their Generation 3 counterparts .
They also offer security in event of an onsite emergency which assures us of the non repeatal of another Chernobyl incident and wins our support .
There are several Generation IV nuclear power plant concepts which can be incorporated .
What we must remember is that we do not have the luxury of time to sit and research each and every concept as time is critical .
Our resources are fast dying and if we have to take some radical steps now .
The safety features of SCWR are passive , they don't need human instructions in case of an onsite emergency .
The main concept of the safety features is that when there is an emergency , depressurization of the plant takes place , i . e the pressure inside the plant decreases .
However if there is a large break in the feed water lines , the heating of fuel will be rapid and this will result in an emergency .
Though the passive safety features will take over  ,the plant will be non operational .
The GFR has a similar passive safety feature .
It has few elements added in it which shuts down system during an onsite emergency .Besides this the plant is made up of materials which can withstand very high temperature .
So there won't be any calamities possible .
And it also doesn't lead to problems of plutonium fuel as it serves as an incinerator which burns away the wastes .
Thus on the whole if we compare the two models on the basis of these three very important criteria , we find it very clearly that the GFR has an edge over that of the SCWR and hence it should be pursued for research and not SCWR .

The nuclear power models are chosen and approved by the IAEA based on the aspects of its cost , security and performance .
Two popular models under debate are Gas Cooled Fast Reactor and Super critical water reactor .
I prefer the GFR over SCWR for many reasons which we will justify in this essay .
Performance
On the basis of performance the SCWR has a net thermal efficiency of 45%  .
It is a simplified model of the light water reactor which is very efficient in providing electricity  .
It has both open and closed fuel cycle models which can be incorporated .
In addition to this it can also be suited to provide hydrogen upon further modifications .
The GFR plant has a net thermal efficiency of 48%  .
It uses helium as coolant which increases inertness .
It can withstand high temperature the conversion rate is high .
And it uses closed fuel cycle , thus the used fuel can be reused again .
It can also be effectively used for manufacturing hydrogen as well as for actinide management .
Thus clearly GFR outshines SCWR in performance .
2 .COST
The cost of construction of SCWR plant is half a billion  .
Thus SCWR is regarded as a very cheap solution to power crisis .
For this very low rate of construction and maintenance we get a good amount of electricity for a lot of people .
However the point here I would like to make here is this .
Though the cost of installation of plant and maintenance might be less , however the plant life is only 60 years .
In other words every 60 years the plant has to once again renewed .
This is a very expensive affair .
The core of the reactor has to be replaced every 34 years .
So it is when all factors taken into consideration , expensive reactor .
The cost of GFR plan is nearly a billion dollars  .
However though it might be higher than that of SCWR the plant life is larger ! .So we needn't once again change plant very often unlike the SCWR . .In addition to this it can produce hydrogen as well as manage actinides .
Thus the overall contribution to economy clearly justifies its cost .It is a healthy investment .
3 .SECURITY
In recent years , there have been unremitting arguments on whether developing countries should proceed with building generation IV reactors .
For a developing country where economy is rather unstable , people are facing poverty and high unemployment thus it is vital for the country to solve these problems before handling other issues like developing power reactors .
For example in Afghanistan , according to statistics , the unemployment rate is estimated to be as high as 40% in 2008  .
Even though it is known that developing generation IV reactors will benefit the country significantly , we cannot neglect the unconstructive effects that come simultaneously .
Therefore , developing countries need to solve unemployment and poverty in rural areas first , before they provide huge funding to build generation IV reactors .
Oppositions maintain that with the developing power reactors would enable the public to benefit from low-priced electricity that can build more factories which will eventually help to create jobs for the people as well as improve poverty .
However , this claim only takes into consideration the operation cost in the long run and does not take into account for the high set up cost estimated in 2009 to be around 10 billion dollars for just one reactor  .
The maintenance cost , money required for storage of waste was investigated to be about 13 .
3 billion today and money to conduct continuous research and development to be estimated around 1 .275 billion dollars  .
This large sum of money would ultimately be the main reason that might lead to the termination of the development since developing countries with an unstable economy will find it too costly to provide such a huge fund in the long run  .
This will then lead us back to our issue where poverty and unemployment remain unsolved and the huge sum that goes to developing the power reactor has also gone to waste .
Thus , developing countries should strengthen its economy by solving the problem for unemployment and poverty first before the developing of power reactors .

Apart from the above points , it is mentioned by the opponents that by developing power reactors , many job opportunities will be created for the people since they need labour force to run the plant .
However , it is important to know that the labour force that is required by plants is a highly skilled workforce  .
Examples of such positions are nuclear technicians , radiologic technicians , researchers , monitoring technicians and reactor operators .
These roles demand knowledge on physics , mathematics , chemistry , public safety and security .
In developing countries , there will not be sufficient talented labours to support the development since most of the people are not equipped with such skills  .
In due course , developing countries will need to hire foreign talent to take up those professions .
In the end , the locals will still suffer from poverty and remain unemployed while foreign talent will have numerous jobs to choose from .
In addition , power reactor plants are dealing with very-high-temperature reactors , some of the reactors like Gas-cooled fast reactors and Supercritical-water-cooled reactors even need high pressure to operate .
Furthermore , to prevent radioactive waste from being stolen for the creation of nuclear weapon , scientists are going to modify radioactive elements in such a way that they will be too hot for human beings to handle even with the use of gloves  .
Under such conditions where the high temperature is not a suitable work environment , the plants must involve highly automated machineries in order for the operations to be carried out .
In order words , the plant only creates a handful of employment opportunities for the people given that the plant is functioning automatically .
Hence , by developing power reactors in developing countries , only limited jobs will be created for the local people .
In summary , if developing countries with unstable economy were to develop generation IV reactors , they would face difficulties in funding the enormous sum of money for set up and operation in the long run  .
The development of nuclear generator IV requires much R&D and high technology thus local workforce might not have enough talented labours to support the operation .
Moderately skilled and lowly skilled labours will still be unable to secure a job .
Moreover , with high technology generation IV reactors , plants are mostly computerized and automated and it requires only a small labour force .
Therefore , by developing reactors it will not improve the unemployment and poverty situation in the country , hence would be wiser to develop the country first .
Developing country can provide funding to assist locals in setting up businesses and factories or encourage Multinational Corporation to set up plants in their country .
By doing so , many jobs will be created for the people .
This would be the most effective and direct method to resolve the unemployment issue .
After which , the poverty state will also improve gradually since the country's economy is boost up through time .
With a stronger work force and economy , the country will then be ready to support the developing of power reactors .

Nuclear power involves the energy generated from the splitting of atoms , also known as nuclear fission .
The reason why the public reject the idea of nuclear power could be due to the Chernobyl power plant meltdown , one of the most tragic nuclear-related disaster in human history .
The ramification of the Chernobyl incident is so severe to the extent where it reminds everyone of death when nuclear power is mentioned .
We cannot prevent the public from having their biased and negative perspective on nuclear power but we cannot deny the fact that the Chernobyl disaster is a result of poor management and design of the power plant ) .
Although the public oppose nuclear power due to its dangerous drawbacks on the world and its environment , it is crucial to support and fund further research and development for Very High Temperature Reactors  .
The public feel that nuclear proliferation is imminent and fear the danger of excessive nuclear waste .
In other words , every nuclear plant is like a potential nuclear bomb and terrorist's attacks are inevitable .
However , such claims would be deemed invalid in the context of a VHTR .
Among the proposed Generation IV nuclear plants , VHTR is one of the few which does not reprocess the resultant nuclear waste .
Reprocessing involves the separation of uranium and weapon-grade plutonium from radioactive waste which sums up the fear of plutonium war .
Therefore , VHTR is proliferation-proof as it does not reprocess nuclear waste .
Furthermore , VHTR produces lesser amount of radioactive waste compared to other proposed reactors .
Shropshire and Herring claim that the heavy metal radioactive waste produced in VHTR is significantly low with every unit of energy generated and this is due to the plant's high thermal efficiency and high fuel burn up .
It implies that the total plutonium generated is lesser per unit of energy produced .
Waste treatment plans are also in place to tackle the lingering problem of long-live radioactive waste .
For instance , in the liquid state treatment , the by-products are constantly evaporated to reduce its radioactivity  .
As for the remaining nuclear waste , it is stored in underground repository where multilayers of anti-radiation materials are installed to shield them from the external environment .

It may be true that nuclear power , akin to fossil fuel , is a non-renewable resource .
Naturally , the public would argue that it is not worth the funding and time to develop something which does not offer a long term solution .
Though , from a general point of view , it is possible to recycle nuclear fuel but it is not ideal as reprocessing is costly and generates the dreaded plutonium .
Langwith states that uranium in Canada can only last for 40 years .
The projected time span definitely does not appeal to what the public see as long term , however , it is shallow to predict the outcome to be the same as fossil fuel power plants .
Furthermore , Canada's participation in the Generation IV International Forum to perform further research on nuclear power , particularly VHTR ) , shows that they do not share the public's myopic view on the potential of nuclear power .
In addition , VHTR offers an alternate clean fuel , hydrogen .
At 1100 degree Celsius , hydrogen production efficiency is at 50 percent compared to electrical generation efficiency at 56 percent VHTR  .
There is plenty of radioactive material on earth to run nuclear power for a long time just like how we operate coal power plants .
The difference is that it extents the time needed to find more sources of electricity , probably nuclear fusion .
Opponents may claim that nuclear power plants are incapable of making significant changes to the climate and will even appear as environmental risk .
Nonetheless , VHTR are almost emission free as nuclear power contributes the biggest portion of the world's electricity from non-greenhouse gas emitting sources  .
Consequently , the alternate fuel source generated is also emission free .
30 percent of the world primary fuel use is to generate electricity and 17 percent of electricity uses nuclear power  .
In other words , VHTR reduces the general demand for fossil fuels .
Robinson also mentioned that the amount of electricity generated by one ton of uranium is similar to that produced by 16 ,000 tons of coal or 80 ,000 barrels of oil .
The amount of waste produced by fossil fuel plants is significantly higher than that of VHTR .
further state that the dominant VHTR has a better plant efficiency which indirectly implies that it requires 20 percent fewer tunnels to store its waste .
Hence , the resultant land pollution caused by VHTR will be milder in contrast with that of coal power
The public opinions on nuclear power are inconclusive .
The advantages of VHTR clearly outweigh the cons of nuclear power .
They directly neutralize the fears of nuclear proliferation due to its once-through uranium fuel cycle .
Moreover , it offers non-electrical fuel source , hydrogen , which prolongs the time needed to develop another source .
As for the environment aspect , VHTR is ultimately emission free and it causes milder land pollution compared to coal power plants .
Therefore , in my opinion , it is justified to support further research and development funding for VHTR .

The development of nuclear power plant becomes more and more important as nuclear power is a more efficient and environmental friendly source of energy .
From 1951 , when the first nuclear power plant generated electricity , the technology of nuclear power has become more efficient and safety .
The Very-High-Temperature Reactor is one of the most recent prototypes of the generation IV reactors .
VHTR is a graphite-moderated , helium-cooled reactor with a once-through uranium fuel cycle .
It supplies heat with high core outlet temperatures which enables applications such as hydrogen production or process heat for the petrochemical industry or others .
Further research and development funding for VHTR should be supported by the governments or companies , because it is an efficient , secure and practicable technology , despite the worries raised by the oppositions .
Many people consider nuclear power industry is highly dangerous since the radioactive fuels can be very harmful to our bodies and environment .
According to a survey conducted in Australia in 2009 on the public opinions of building nuclear power plants in Australia , there were 43 percent of the public opposing the plan because of the safety and security issues with nuclear power plants .
However , nuclear power reactors are much safer and securer than most of people can image even when the reactive temperature is very high .
Firstly , in VHTR , the fuel used is uranium dioxide in a TRISO configuration , where TRISO is the type of fuel that small amount of uranium dioxide is in the center and coated with four layers of three isotropic materials  .
The TRISO particles are either dispersed in a pebble for the pebble bed design or molded into the hexagonal graphite blocks .
Such designs are able to slow down neutrons to control the nuclear chain reaction , thus the reactivity can be controlled in a reasonable range and explosions can be prevented .
Secondly , because helium is used as coolant of VHTR , unexpected reactions can be prevented .
One reason is that helium is an inert gas , which is hardly reacts with any material .
Additionally , exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , unlike most other possible coolants , for example light water , therefore it is a safer choice of coolant .
Moreover , since the reactor can only operate under a high temperature , in case of destructions by terrorism or other outside forces , the system will cool down and automatically stop the reaction .
This function ensures VHTR is very safe under attacks .
Therefore , VHTR is a very safe and secure prototype of the generation IV reactor .
Other than the safety issue , the efficiency of VHTR is also a concern for those who want to invest in the project .
A Molten salt reactor can burn 99% of initial fuel , while VHTR can burn 65% of its initial fuel , which is less than that of a molten salt reactor .
However , VHTR is very efficient comparing with the conventional light-water reactor , which can only burn-up 5% of the initial amount  .
VHTR is not only able to produce electrical power but also produce hydrogen via electrolysis of water at high temperature .
Besides generating energy , the energy generated from nuclear reaction can also be used in crude oil refining or metal production  .
In this sense , VHTR is efficient in using of energy .
Comparing to a molten salt reactor , VHTR has a simpler design and this leads to another advantage which is its high feasibility .
In conclusion , VHTR should be chosen to proceed on for further research and development .
This is because of its relative high efficiency , high safety and practicability .
There are many researches undergoing in U .S . , China and Japan to improve the Very-High-Temperature Reactors .
Optimistically , by about 2020 , the first commercial VHTR would be in operation .
Generation IV nuclear reactorshave drawn many controversies since they were introduced in the Generation IV International Forum in 2000 .
This arises public concern , due to the previous nuclear accidents which happened at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl , in 1979 and 1986 separately .
In theory , Generation IV reactors are a set of theoretical reactors which are still being under research to replace Generation III reactors , which are in use for power generation currently .
In comparison with current nuclear plant technology , Generation IV nuclear technology brings us more benefits , according to the researchers .
To point out a few of them , the claimed benefits include minimised nuclear waste and improved safety .
With this , we can reduce nuclear waste as it accumulates when we generate nuclear electricity .
In addition to that , the experts from laboratory also claimed that Generation IV reactors are able to consume nuclear waste to generate more electricity .
However , they are just theories with no solid evidence to support them .
To focus the research on Generation IV technology , we have narrowed down into two reactors , which are lead-cooled fast reactor and sodium cooled fast reactor .
According to the data I have collected , I think sodium-cooled reactor would be a better choice than lead-cooled fast reactor .

Fromsafety perspective , lead-cooled reactor has low likelihood of damage .
This is due to the characteristic of lead as a good heat transfer medium with high specific heat and thermal expansion coefficient .
Moreover , lead makes the operation reliable as it possesses good fuel compatibility and fission product retention .
This is a vital safety feature together with the ability of lead to retain released fission products that enables us to avoid offsite emergency .
On the other hand , sodium-cooled reactor strengthens its safety with long thermal response time and large margin to coolant boiling .
Sodium-cooled reactor focuses its safety in its primary system and intermediate system which operate near atmospheric pressure .
Given the fact that the two reactors focus on different aspect on safety , where the latter focuses on system operation rather than coolant , it is difficult to gauge the effectiveness of their practice based on theories .
Thus , it is inconsistent to compare when we are talking on safety issue .
However , lead has a tendency for material corrosion at high temperature .
Thus , sodium-cooled reactor is a better choice as it has less dependence on the coolant itself .
In term of performance , lead-cooled reactor has high sustainability .
The mentioned reactor has high sustainability due to its coolant , lead which is a low moderating medium as well as a medium with low absorption cross section that enable a core with fast neutron spectrum even with a large coolant fraction .
To compare the performance of the two clearly , we will have a look at the burn-up performance .
For sodium fast reactor , it has a tight pin structure , which in turn offers better neutron economy than lead-cooled reactor .
As a result , when both reactors operate to acquire criticality , the average plutonium fraction in the lead-cooled reactor core is slightly higher than sodium-cooled reactor .
This can clearly show the better performer .
After safety and performance issue , production cost of the reactor plays an equally important role in deciding which reactor to put in use .
From the researchers of lead-cooled reactor , we can clearly see the economics side of the reactor .
As being claimed , the life cycle cost of lead-cooled reactor is relatively cheaper than any other reactor .
This claim is based on the fact that lead is not reactive with water and air .
As an addition point , lead is inexpensive , in theory .
As a matter of fact , sodium ranked sixth as the most abundance material on earth .
If we take in the consideration of the supply and demand theories , lead will be more costly as the demand soars , just like what happened to the crude oil .
In contrast , sodium which is more abundant will experience less effect on its price when the demand soars .
Furthermore , sodium-cooled reactor benefits from the researches which were done earlier .
So there can be a big difference in research cost when compared to lead-cooled reactor .
Plus , the earliest delivery of sodium-cooled reactor is 10 years earlier than lead-cooled reactor .
Thus , sodium-cooled reactor is better from economic aspect .
From the evidence I have collected , I have come to a conclusion that sodium-cooled reactor is a better choice than lead-cooled reactor as it outperforms the latter in three aspects , which are safety , performance and cost .

Have you ever imagined that communication is possible with a virtual character from your television screen ?
Microsoft is now spearing project Natal , which is involves a controller-free gaming interface , Microsoft Xbox  .
The current game consoles require users to use controllers as their interface to the virtual world .
User's expressions and desires are somewhat restricted by the buttons on the controller .
Thus , the enjoyment factor is somehow limited by the controller .
If project Natal succeeds , gamers will be able to fully indulge in their will and emotions and send this information via the motion detector and video camera into the game console .
This is a concept that is still in research and has yet to be be seen in the market .
A similar product , Wii , is currently in the market .
Although it is less tech-savvy than Natal , but the safety issues it faces might be quite similar in nature .
Let us evaluate some of the safety issues below .
Cracked television screens , broken vases , cuts and bruise are some of the symptoms experienced by an avid or amateur Wii gamer .
This game console uses an external wireless remote control that senses the motion of the user .
Thus , when the players are too engrossed and when their adrenalin runs , they might try to move their limbs and body more aggressively .
In this situation , they might be caught off guard when their controller flies out of their grip , which might cause a cracked television screen , or injure people who are in the vicinity .
One such example can be seen from Kar Hoe  .
Thus , gamers risk a certain amount of injury when they are too focused on the game .
Pravda .R  .
Boy taken to hospital after playing computer games for 40 hours , Retrieved October 17 , 2009 from {http://english .pravda .ru/society/stories/09-06-2009/107743-computer_games-0}
As playing a game with Natal will seem so real , we could expect more serious injuries occurring compared to injuries resulting from playing Wii .
Some gamers involving in a combat with a virtual opponent might accidentally throw his punches into the television screen , resulting in his fist being trapped within .
This injury is more serious than one arising from playing Wii .
The designers could make it safer by adding a barrier between the screen and the player .
The player could also be demanded by the system to wear safety boxing gloves , and limb guards .
However , some game activists might argue that it results in Natal losing its true entertainment value that it is first set to achieve .
Wearing such cumbersome equipment makes playing games using Natal a turn off .
In addition , it will add a substantial amount of cost to the already expensive-to-manufacture console , as the equipment might have to scan for motion further a distance away due to its exaggerated setup .
As quoted by Oli Welsh  , " . . . it to be quite expensive to begin with ."
Hence , this idea of improving safety might not be feasible as it is going to be costly and its entertainment value will be affected .
Natal gamers might also suffer similar cases of "Nintendonitis" , muscle injuries owing to excessive playing hours of spent on Sony's Nintendo Wii , Thaindian News  .
Gamers might have to jump , kick , dance , or perform some repetitive movement during the course of the game .
Injuries as stated above might arise when their muscles gets overused .
Furthermore , the player might be prone to more injuries , such as falling and twisting his ankle , when he starts to feel lethargic .
To enhance safety , Natal could use its motion detection system to analyse whether the movement of the player is alright or he should take a rest , and then sends out the respective warning to the player .
This could also help to prevent gamers who are glued to the game to realise that they have played too much .
It has happened before that gamers dies after several hours of continuous gaming .
There are reports showing teenagers' death from brain stroke after hours of continuous gaming .
One such example is elaborated in a report by Pravda .R  , where a teenager in the Russian city of Ekaterinburg died after 12 hours of playing computer games .
Thus by using such gizmo , such occurrence of death could be reduced .
We can conclude that Natal is actually a double-edged sword .
It may allow us to have reality in the virtual paradise , increasing our degree of satisfaction when we can fully indulge into the playing of our favourite games , but when we get too carried away , it might cause injuries or death .
Safety can be slightly improved through software tweaking , advising the user to take a rest or stop the activity when he seems unfit by the analysis of the console .
However , large scale setup of barriers and tuxedos lookalike safety suit might not be feasible as they increases the cost significantly and limits its actual functionality .
Therefore the bottom line is safety only can be slightly enhanced by an improved design and itt depends more on the self discipline of the gamers .
Perhaps safety can be enhanced by making it mandatory for gamers to attend a safety course .
