Nuclear power is not a new technology to the human race .
It has been around since the 1960s , but it is not the main choice for producing energy because society has rejected it for its low security and high cost .
Although public opposition still exist , with the new generation IV reactors , public support for further research and development of higher security and lower cost plants are increasing .
Some upcoming plants are the lead-cooled fast reactor for example , which produces both electricity and hydrogen as its products .
Oppositions of nuclear power claim that the meltdown of the plant is one major reason why it should not exist .
Their concern would be the safety of the public in case of a nuclear meltdown .
This is an issue especially for small countries like Singapore , which stretches about 40 km from east to west , as international safety standards require a 30km buffer zone around the plant  .
However , this does not present a very good argument as looking at statistics over the years , the number of people affected by past major nuclear disasters , only number about an estimated 600 ,000 people  .
Compared to an estimate of 1 .2 million deaths yearly due to traffic accidents  , the nuclear casualties are relatively minor .
Besides this , with technological advancement , nuclear plants now enforce multiple fail-safe systems coupled with simplistic designs so lesser things could go wrong  .
Hence , with a more efficient safety system , there is no need to be afraid of disasters from happening .
Oppositions also claim that there is an ever present threat of terrorism .
For example , terrorists could steal nuclear material out of nuclear plants as easy as in the case when a thief broke into a shipyard in Russia and stole a container of nuclear submarine fuel  .
With this nuclear material , terrorist can create what are known as "Dirty" bombs , and make threats to the public .
World Health Organization  .
Young people and motorbikesunsafe at any speed .
Retrieved on October 11 , 2009 , from http://www .wpro .who .int/media_centre/press_releases/pr_20070420 .html
However , this argument ignores the fact that terrorism will be around regardless of whether nuclear plants are built or not .
Even without nuclear materials , terrorists have enough technology and materials to create their own "Dirty" bombs .
Also , this emphasizes the need for a better security system and therefore supports the fact that more funds should be used for this development .
With multiple security features to prevent thefts , then there is no need to be afraid of radioactive materials being stolen .
Terrorist can only take advantage of our complacency , as in the case of the September 911 attacks .
With a well implemented security system , terrorist have no chance of infiltrating the plant .
The final argument that oppositions claim is that the cost to society is very huge .
Building one nuclear plant would cost around US $ 2 .6 billion  .
This high cost would be a heavy burden on society and might affect the budgeting for other sectors like the health care system as well .
However this is a short term view of the situation .
Uranium has more than 10 ,000 times the energy potential than fossil fuels and thus it is cheaper to use uranium for the production of energy  .
In the long run , the high start up cost is covered by the savings made from the reduced cost of energy .
Many countries that depend on oil are also placing hopes on hydrogen as the new generation fuel for cars and perhaps home use  .
With hydrogen produced as the secondary product for the lead-cooled fast reactor , one can only expect energy prices to drop further as there is now an abundance of energy sources .
Hence , we would save more than what we would have initially spent on the building of the nuclear plant over time .
Looking at all the arguments that oppositions have made against nuclear power , it can be seen that most are trivial and short termed .
With better technology , one can only expect the research and development to increase in cost .
In the long term view , society will benefit from the research and development of nuclear power .
The advancement in technology will allow nuclear energy to be harnessed with increased safety and efficiently .
Also , more jobs would be created which in turn would aid the country's economy .
Terrorism , safety or high costs are the factors we should base our research on and not be the reasons why we should not further develop nuclear power .
So in my opinion , funds should be injected into further research and development of nuclear power , to create a new generation of cleaner , safer and cheaper power to solve the looming energy crisis .

The world today depends heavily on fossil fuel to generate energy .
However , the burning of fossil fuels produce greenhouse gases which contribute to the effect of global warming .
In addition , experts have estimated that the remaining fuel reserve can only last a maximum of another 120 years  .
With energy demand worldwide projected to increase by 44% in 2030 and the worsening effect of global warming , researchers have proposed the concept of nuclear power .
Despite the benefits promised by Generation IV nuclear reactors , it still requires much effort to convince the public to accept this technology .
This is partly due to the negative memories from the 1986 reactor core explosion at Chernobyl in Ukraine , which resulted in the instant death of 31 people and radioactive debris spewed across Europe  .
Yet , further research and development funding for the Generation IV nuclear prototypes , in particular the very-high-temperature reactor which is safer and can output greater electricity , should be supported .
Opponents of nuclear energy argued that nuclear power plants increase the health risk of workers and residents living in the vicinity of the reactor .
The long-term effects , they claimed , include potential for increased risk in cancer .
However , a survey conducted by the National Cancer Institute in the United States revealed no strong relationship between nuclear power and the risk of cancer  .
While there have been occurrences of leaks and safety incidents , including several in Japan , none of them resulted in severe deaths tolls  .
Similar to the Chernobyl and Three Mile Island accident , most nuclear accidents are consequences of human errors .
In modern nuclear reactors , passive safety systems which seek to eliminate the possibility of human errors have been installed .
This is a feature that will activate the safety measures by laws of physics in the event of an emergency , even without the aid of electronics and operators  .
With VHTR , it should be even safer as helium gas , which will not react with other substances even at high temperature , is used as the coolant .
Hence , safety should not be an issue with modern nuclear technology .

Furthermore , economic viability and stability of nuclear power generation is challenged by adversary .
They maintained that compared to coal or oil generators , building and operating nuclear facilities are more expensive and worried that the cost might be passed down to consumers eventually .
The construction and operation cost might be high , but this is so in order not to compromise the quality and safety of the plants .
With countries planning to impose carbon taxes on carbon dioxide emissions , producing electricity from coal or oil combustion might not remain cheap forever .
The depletion of oil supply and increasing difficulty in finding new oil reserves will also further increase the cost of electricity generated from coal or oil .
In contrast , nuclear energy might prove to be more reliable as uranium , the raw material for nuclear fuel , can be supplied by politically stable countries like Australia and can last for more than 2500 years when used with more efficient reactors  .
Indeed , experts have concluded that the nuclear energy will be competitive enough when the price of oil rises above USS60 per barrel  .
Finally , an argument advanced by anti-nuclear advocators is that although nuclear reaction does not produce greenhouse gases , harmful radioactive waste that must be stored for as long as a thousand years are generated instead .
Despite so , proponents assured that with proper storage and appropriate protection measures , the nuclear waste should not pose any health risk to the public .
In addition , most nuclear wastes are only hazardous for a few tens of years .
High-level waste , the most dangerous of all nuclear waste , are secured tightly in glass or ceramic before being isolated in storage facilities .
The structure of the glass and ceramic is so rigid that the dispersion of radioactive waste by terrorist will be difficult  .
The fact that no solution for disposal of nuclear waste also suggests that there is a need to continue funding further research in nuclear technologies .
In conclusion , it is undeniable that nuclear power is costly .
However , it might be economically viable with cost of fossil fuel expected to increase .
The safety concerns of nuclear plant are also addressed in the design of new nuclear reactors .
The radioactive wastes produced might not necessarily incur health hazard if they are properly stored .
Therefore , nuclear power is a trustworthy technology whose further research and development funding should be supported .

However , in terms of chemistry property , sodium itself is a very reactive and any leakage during an accident will put the plant operators at risk .
Lead on the other hand has a lower burn-up  .
In the event of an accident , the damage to the whole plant will be considerably lesser .
Furthermore , lead superior neutronic properties and its small coolant temperature reactivity coefficient means that it could be easily controlled when there is an accident  .5 For example , in the event of an accident , the natural circulation in is enough to take away the nominal power of the system .
However in the case for  , the lack of natural circulation means that the reactivity of the coolant will increase , leading to a possible meltdown of the reactor  .
In conclusion , based on the three most important consideration of a Generation IV reactor , it is clear that Lead-Cooled Fast Reactor is far more superior to to Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor .
Despite the fact that is slated to be delivered earliest by the year 2015 , more research needs to be done to proof that is indeed better than  .
However , it would be more logical to channel more resources to the research of so that it could be delivered earlier .
In addition , the production of hydrogen as a by-product is indeed very attractive for tomorrow's energy market .
The original lead-bismuth proposed for use in the will also be replaced by lead , further decreasing the cost of the coolant by 10 times  .
Therefore , Lead-Cooled Fast reactor is the obvious choice .

Global warming and energy shortage are two of the most discussed topics nowadays .
We are earnestly looking for solutions to these problems , and nuclear energy , has been proposed as a solution to solve these two problems at one go .
The production of nuclear energy does not have carbon dioxide as a by-product , thus it can reduce the effect of global warming , which is the reason of many other problems , like rising of sea levels .
Nuclear energy can also satisfy the increasing demand of energy , thus solving the problem of energy shortage .
However , choosing nuclear energy as an alternative here has many drawbacks in the areas of cleanliness , safety and cost , this can also be reflected in the very-high-temperature reactors .
Hence , I do not support the building of new nuclear plants and use of nuclear energy .
Some people argue that nuclear energy should be used as it is a cleaner source of energy compared to coal and fossil fuels .
It is true to some extent as no carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases are produced during the production of energy through nuclear power .
Nevertheless , we should not neglect the unique wasted which can be produced by nuclear power plants alone during its energy production process .
This refers to nuclear wastes .
The unique thing about nuclear wastes is that it is radioactive , like naturally occurring radioactive material  , which is not only radioactive itself , but will also produce highly dangerous radioactive radon gas .
It is very hard to recycle or dispose those wastes due to their unique nature , like the wastes produced by VHTR .
The radioactive wastes will affect the health of man-kind , animals and plants when they are exposed to it .
The consequences are hazardous .
Even if it is buried underground , it will take hundreds of years for its effect to go off due to its long half-life .
The land used by nuclear power plants cannot be used for other purposes after the plants are decommissioned , as excessive radioactivity is present in the area .
There have been suggestions to solve this problem by using helium , which is not radioactive , and abundant helium can be found on the moon .
However , there are a few things we should concern , the practicality of mining on the moon and the cost of mining on the moon .
It is no doubt that it is extremely expensive to fly to the moon and do the mining there .
At the same time , the technology to dig on the moon , and even use helium as a fuel is still not available yet .
Thus , nuclear energy is not a good alternative .
There are also some other people who argue that nuclear energy is safer .
However , looking at the incident of partial reactor meltdown in 1979 , which took place at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and the notorious nuclear accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine in 1986 , people may rethink of the statements they have made .
The result of Chernobyl accident is disastrous as the radioactive debris spread across Europe and affected a lot of people in different countries .
Some infected people later develop all kinds of diseases , and some new born children are distorted as well .
Generally , they die at a very young age .
Nuclear power plants also pose safety problems as they are always targeted by terrorists . .
Some people argue that the deaths per year in nuclear plants is much less than that in coal mines .
Nevertheless , once a main accident in nuclear plants occurs , the impact will be enormous , long term and wide spread  , while the impact of a coal mine accident is immediate , which takes place in limited areas only .
Hence , nuclear energy should not be accepted .
One more argument for nuclear energy is that it is cheap .
However , the nuclear power plants are all operating at low temperatures now , rendering them inefficient , due to limitations of technologies .
The cost advantage of nuclear energy is not so obvious here .
However , if we take into account of the set up cost of the nuclear plants , which are more high-tech than coal plants , they are definitely much more expensive .
The equally expensive maintenance cost covered will in the end together contribute to the average cost of producing nuclear energy , which is now much higher than that of coal and other sources .
Optimists say that the cost will be greatly reduced when generation IV reactors are developed as they will work with much higher efficiency .
Nevertheless , the technology required is not readily attainable and it will take a long time to be realised .
Thus , nuclear energy should not be accepted .
In conclusion , nuclear energy may have some seemingly advantages , however , the problems associated with it is not negligible .
Specifically the high cost , radioactive wastes and the safety concerns .
Therefore , nuclear energy may not be a desirable alternative , we should put more of our focus on better energy sources like solar power .
Many accidents happened over the past decades , some related to design flaws while others to human errors .
Reasons for human errors range from emotional wellbeing , to the inability in handling the pre-accident situation  .
These accidents may have been prevented should psychology be encompassed into the design process .
The Chernobyl nuclear accident in 1986 illustrates this notion .
On the 25th of April 1986 , reactor 4 was scheduled for a shut down , and an experiment was planned to test a safety feature during this process .
Request by the capital delayed the test pass midnight resulting in it being conducted by a less proficient night team .
Before the test , an unexpected drop in power resulted in operators retracting control rods in an attempt to restore power .
The reactor however , appeared stable after the retraction although it displayed abnormal readings .
The operators ignored this abnormality and proceeded with the test .
Subsequently two explosions occurred resulting in massive losses  .
Supporters related the accident to a lack of understanding in human psychology during the design phase  .
The test was approved only by the director of plant , without the coordination of the reactor's chief designer or scientific manager  .
Opponents claimed that approval was appropriate as the reactor was muffled at the start of the experiment and should not have devastating effects on its safety  .
Proponents however , argued that the plant director had insufficient specialised knowledge .
The use of psychology would enable designers to acknowledge that operators may encounter faults beyond their abilities and thus gear the design towards user friendliness .
Moreover , a psychologist should be able to relate a high competency requirement to the test and thus limit its handling to upper management .
In this manner , there is a high chance that the accident would not have occurred since the most qualified personnel are managing the test .

In addition these reactors require highly skilled professionals  .
Opponents were firm that should the test be conducted by the more proficient day team , the accident was unlikely to occur  .
On the contrary , proponents refute this , stating that psychology encompasses the understanding of human reaction during panic stages  .
The design of the reactor could thus include simple idiot-proof automated safety mechanisms without relying on operators' competency .
This way , the operators would not have retracted the control rods during the pre test stage since the system would be automated .
Therefore , the accident may not have occurred .
Opponents countered the use of psychology as they felt it stifles creativity in the design process  .
They believed that feedbacks may end up counterproductive and deter engineers from verbalizing their creations in fear of evaluation .
Moreover , they stood firm that the psychologist' lack of relevant knowledge may divert the focus of engineers and lead them away from designing a relevant product .
Proponents agreed to the possibility of limiting creativity should psychology be used in the entire design process .
As such , they suggest the intermittent intervention of psychology or simply the introduction of psychology only after the main design outline is formed  .
This way , the main focus of the product would not be altered and the critical design phases could be assessed through the use of simulation or operators .
This would possibly uproot errors during the entire design sequence thereby preventing the Chernobyl accident .
However , as highlighted by opponents , usage of psychology would inevitably lead to increase in research and consequently production cost  .
In addition , resources for research would now have to be redistributed , thereby diverting focus from the core engineering design .
Proponents argue that the added cost is justifiable should the use of psychology prevent the accident .
The economic cost incurred in the entire aftermath cleanup process amounted to an astounding USD 43 billion not inclusive of intangible cost related to social and psychological effects  .
Therefore supporters stay firm on the notion of prevention being better than cure , and hence propose the use of psychology in the design process .
In conclusion , it is undeniable that the use of psychology would lead to the increase in production cost or the reshuffling of resources allocated to core engineering design .
However , it would translate to designs encompassing user friendly backup systems non reliant on the competency of operators .
It would also match the test complexity to the appropriate management level .
As a result , the use of psychology in the design process may have prevented the Chernobyl accident thereby justifying its cost .

A Germany's Inter-City Express trains derailed and slammed into an overpass , killed 101 people and injured 200 people in June of 1998 ,  .
The causes of the accident were traced back to a damaged wheel that disintegrated just before the train passed over a switch track .
With a further investigation , people discovered the evidence of poor wheel design , poor bridge construction , insufficient failure detection system , ineffective emergency procedures and insufficient design verification testing .
As a result , safety improvements and major engineering changes were implemented in order to prevent such disaster from happening again and which includes the studies of psychology in design process .
Hence , the use of psychology in design process could have prevented the accident .
First of all , the use of psychology in the design process could have prevented the accident by realizing the need of adding several failure detection systems on the train .
According to the research that has been done by the German national railway company , Deutsche Bahn  , the ICE train did not have a system installed to detect wheel failure and bring the train to an emergency stop .
According to Wilpert , inherent safety which links the design process to safety concerns must be taken into account .
However , in this situation , the engineers did not identify the inherently safer options which led to insufficient of failure detection systems that were installed in the train .
One example that highlighted this situation is the bullet trains from Japan .
The Japanese bullet trains equipped with a detection system that can alert the train operator about wheel deformation and failure during the operation so that the operator may manually activate the emergency brake .
If the train was installed with this system , the accident might not have happened .
Special Feature Eschede , Germany , ICE High Speed Train Disaster  .
Retrieved October 12 , 2009 , from {http://danger-ahead .railfan .net/features/eschede .html}
The Eschede Reports  .
Retrieved October 12 , 2009 , from {http://danger-ahead .railfan .net/reports/eschede/index .html}
Secondly , the use of psychology in the design process could have prevented the accident through activating the emergency brake despite the company's policy that did not allow the train manager to do so .
During the journey on the train , a large piece of metal came up through the floor and was witnessed by a passenger .
The passenger tried to warn the crew but was refused by the train manager due to the reason that he needs to investigate the problem by himself first .
As a result , valuable time was lost and the accident happened .
In this situation , the problem of psychopathology of design was revealed .
According to Wilpert , the designer 's and the user's conceptual model of a system or a device must be matched in order to reduce the problems that might have occurred during the time of using it , in this case , the train .
If the company policy was made with referenced to a common sense that was agreed by everyone , such as , the train services in Singapore and the United Kingdom that made the control of emergency brakes available to the travelling passengers , the chain of failure would have been broken .
It is unlikely that the subsequent events could have occurred had the train been stopped immediately .
The third and most important thing to use psychology in the design process in this accident is that , it could have revealed the poor design of the wheel that has caused the accident .
The ICE trains were equipped with single-cast wheels which after the accident , the engineers realized that the design of the wheels could makes the metal to fatigue and causes out-of-round conditions that vibrates at cruising speeds .
According to Norman  , the appropriate system image must be ensured by the designer and this is one of the problems of psychopathology of design .
According to the research by Deutsche Bahn  , the design of the wheels that were used did not reveal the actual durability and reliability of the wheels .
Hacker points out that the quality of co-operative performance depends on the nature of the task at hand .
He says that a design task cannot be solved individually since each person has his own limitation in knowledge .
In this situation , if there were more designers involved in the design of the wheels , the poor design of the wheels could have been spotted and the accident would not have happened .
To sum up , with the use of psychology in the design process , the problems such as insufficient of failure detection systems that were installed in the train , company's policy that was not allowed the train manager to stop the train , and the poor design of the train wheels would not have occurred .
To conclude , the train accident that had happened in Germany could have been prevented with the use of psychology in the design process .

Every nation is caught up with energy shortage problem .
If man continues exhausting natural resources at the present rate , the day is not far off when human beings may run out of coal or oil .
Nuclear power stands out as one of most prospective alternate source .
In the case of nuclear power , the allure is clear: abundant power , no carbon dioxide emissions , no blots on the landscape except an occasional containment dome and cooling tower , according to Michael P . .
However , problems come with nuclear power such as accidents of leakage , waste reprocessing and storage , high construction costs , and even the possible use of nuclear fuel for weapons .
With considerable research background , Sodium-cooled Fast Reactors , or SFR , are able to ease public worry over these safety issues as mentioned before .
It should be evident that none of the opposing statement is valid for SFR .
SFR operates at low temperature and low pressure and has multiple systems to back up safety .
The radioactive waste can also be sustainably used in the fuel cycle with reduction of environmental burden .
High construction is offset not only by multiple construction options , but also by efficient utilization of fuel resources .
More importantly , research is carrying on for SFR , the most promising generation IV reactor .
Chernobyl disaster was a major engineering accident that occurred in the year 1986 .
The causes of the accident were classified to be design flaws of the nuclear reactor system as well as violation of safety regulations by the operators before the accident .
Some people believe that the use of psychology during the design process might have corrected all the flaws of the system , thus preventing the tragedy while others argue that this incident occurred due to severe breaches of safety regulations by the operators .
Therefore psychology plays no role in preventing this accident as the causes were due to human errors .
In my opinion , I trust that the use of psychology during the design process would have prevented the accident .
The use of psychology would rectify the design flaws and safety mechanism implemented to counter human errors .
Opposition might argue that human errors occur on a random basis therefore they could not be prevented .
It was this violation of safety rules by the operators prior to the accident that caused the explosion , thus psychology during the design process would not contribute anything beneficial to the operations .
An experiment was conducted before the nuclear reactor was due for maintenance .
Before the test , the emergency core cooling system was shut down .
The first human error committed was to continue with the test .
The power of the reactor continued to drop below the lower limit for the experiment .
Control rods which act as absorbers were withdrew from the core to increase the power of the reactor .
This was human error two .
All the circulating pumps were connected to the reactor that had its control rods withdrew .
This caused an unstable thermo-hydraulic status .
The experiment started in these undesirable conditions .
Power began to rise and the absorbers were sent back to the core to control the reaction , however they were unable to plunge fully into the lower stop due to mechanical fault .
The decision to cut off current that holds the absorbers to ensure the falling of rods caused the explosions .
It was through this series of human errors committed prior to the moment that caused this incident .
The impact of human errors could be minimized when appropriate safety mechanism were installed on the system .
Psychologist could brainstorm for possible human errors that could be committed by the operators and recommend counter measurements .
One possible counter measurement against human errors could be to configure the system in such a way that whenever safety has been compromised , the system will be automatically shut down .
The use of psychology will bridge the gap between designers and operators as the system will not be overly complicated for the operators to work on .
All operation knowledge and trainings should be properly imparted by the engineers to the operators so as to guarantee system operation efficiency and safety .
All these measurements taken will reduce the human errors to an insignificant level , thus those mistakes committed might not cause such a huge impact and Chernobyl accident might not has occurred .
A report published by IAEA Nuclear Safety Advisory Group stated that the actual causes were due to design errors .
The reactor constructed for the Chernobyl Nuclear Plant was the second generation nuclear reactor which was almost identical to the first generation .
Engineers failed to rectify the design errors found in the first generation , thus all shortcomings were modeled into the second generation reactor .
The reasons that engineers failed to challenge the errors could be their large working group .
Studies have shown that considerable productivity loss is found when people of different background work together .
Factors affecting a group include evaluation apprehension , free riding and blocking .
The result of all the problems faced by the design engineers was a nuclear reactor which carries several design flaws .
The water channels run through the core vertically where a temperature gradient will be built up .
This causes the reaction within the core to increase greatly .
The control rods end tips were made of graphite which is a more potent neutron moderator and greatly increases the rate of fission reaction when the rods are initially inserted into the reactor .
This defeats the purpose of the control rods .
The use of psychology since the start of design process would rectify all the faults found .
Psychologists are able to give a more objective view on the integrity of the project .
Psychologist , being the middleman , will connects all the engineers together to design the new reactor .
Therefore all the features that compromise safety would be eliminated during the design process .
Therefore the use of psychology during design process would reduce design errors in the new reactor created .
Human errors are unavoidable .
Psychologist must be present to give his or her safety judgments to incorporate addition counter measurements against possible human errors .
The use of psychology could also remove all the design flaws and add in desirable mechanism to the system , thus creating a more efficient reactor for both the engineers and operators .
Therefore the use of psychology during the design process would have possibly prevented the Chernobyl incident .
Almost every day when we read newspaper , articles about energy saving or increasing oil price will jump into our sight .
Actually , global warming and energy crisis have been being extremely hot topics these years and large proportion of governments' revenue has been spent on the research and development of new energy resources , such as solar energy and tidal power .
Among these new energy resources , nuclear power is highly favored by researchers due to its abundant base materials , low quantities of waste and comparatively cheap fuel costs .
CITATION Why06 \l 2052 Such a situation indicates that the new dawn of the nuclear power is at the corner although it means that the public have to struggle to restore their confidence ruined by the past appalling accidents of nuclear power plants .
Hitherto , scientists have successfully proposed the Generation IV nuclear reactor concepts , namely , gas-cooled fast reactors , lead-cooled fast reactors , molten salt reactors , sodium-cooled fast reactors , supercritical-water cooled reactors and very-high-temperature reactors .
CITATION Nuc04 \l 2052 In my opinion , the very-high-temperature reactors are the best among the six .
In this essay , I will talk about the reasons from the perspectives of safety , work efficiency and cost .
Safety is always the thing that matters most .
After the Chernobyl disaster in Soviet Union , many people started to reject the proposal of wide usage of nuclear power .
But actually , no energy sources can be said to be free of risk .
Coil and oil have brought us problems like global warming and acidic rain hydro projects have deteriorate the environment of areas flooded and downstream and can lead to great economical loss and mortality once dams are collapsed the mirrors and panels used for solar energy production can affect the environment too .
CITATION Com09 \l 2052 Hence , what we should concentrate on now is how to make the nuclear power production safer instead of arguing whether to reject it or not .
The good news is that the basic technology for VHTR has been well established and has been tested by many nuclear plants vendors and national laboratories .
Furthermore , the VHTR concept requires "the lowest risk technology development" to "achieve the needed commercial functional requirements" CITATION Ver09 \l 2052 ) among the six Generation IV reactors .
Therefore , safety is highly guaranteed in the development and application of VHTR .
Besides safety , people concern much about the work efficiency .
Nobody wants to spend so many resources to develop something operating poorly .
In fact , "the VHTR system is designed to be a high-efficiency system and that can supply process heat to a broad spectrum of high-temperature and energy-intensive , non-electric processes ."
CITATION Ver09 \l 2052 ) The pebble-bed and prismatic design of VHTR makes no intermediate refueling necessary .
And due to high temperature , the reactor generates electricity and hydrogen simultaneously , superior to the sodium-cooled fast reactors and critical-water-cooled reactors which can only generate electricity .
In addition , the high temperature exchanger and electrical heater of a VHTR system avoid significant efficiency penalty .
Therefore , the VTHR system can meet our efficiency requirements undoubtedly .
Last but not the least , every technological innovations should be feasible not only technically but also economically .
As far as we know , the ultra-long life VHTR systems can be developed with minor actinides .
Minor actinides used can incinerate burnable poisons or fuel materials to obtain high levels of burn-up , which could "facilitate development of new fuel cycles and support sustainability of a fuel source for nuclear energy" .
CITATION Pav09 \l 2052 So the cost of maintenance and fuels for VHTR can be highly reduced compared to other Generation IV reactors .
Besides , the earliest delivery time for VHTR is 2020 , earlier than that of other Generation IV reactors except Sodium-cooled fast reactors .
The earlier delivery means the earlier alleviation to these impending problems and more payback .
Hence , the VHTR systems are highly practical economically .
In conclusion , to solve the global warming and energy shortage problems , we need the exploration and better utilization of nuclear energy .
And among the six proposed new generation nuclear reactors , the VHTR systems are the best in consideration of various facets .
The strong technological backup provides adequate safety the specific innovational design of the system ensures high work efficiency the ultra long lifetime and early delivery brings comparatively lower cost .
Therefore , VHTR is the one which deserves further research and development funding most .
On the 6th of March 1987 the freight ferry 'Herald of Free Enterprise' capsized just ouside the port of Zeebrugge .
The accident took the lives of 150 passengers and 38 crewmembers  . . Could this accident have been avoided or to be specific could the use of psychology during the design process prevent this accident from happening ?
Major accidents besides Zeebrugge such as the 'Three Mile Island' incident and the 'Chernobyl 'disaster is said to be caused by human error .
Statistics show that close to 90% of all accidents is caused by human error .
The major companies have given the excuse of cost and time as the reason why they have not considered implementing psychology during the design process .
Although these major companies have not shown a high enough level of interest to invest in the use of engineering psychology , I believe that engineering psychology can help improve on the safety of operation in their industry and eventually reduce accidents .
I will look into the 'Zeebrugge' incident in detail to prove that it could have been avoided if psychology is used during the design process .
In the case of the 'Zeebrugge' incident , there were many things wrong with the design of the ferry .
For instance the ferry's design is a huge hull for which its purpose is to load and unload cars at a very fast pace .
Although it might seem a good idea at first but having a huge hull means that the boat can easily turn over when there is water on deck .
This matter has been brought into attention to the Board of Directors but they were not willing to waste money to have the engineers sketch up a new design .
Another design flaw is there were no light indicators to give notice the status of the bow doors .
Once again  ,the idea was rejected because of cost issues .
Considering that one of the reasons that the accident happened is because the bow doors were still open when the ferry left the port  ,it makes us wonder whether the accident could really have been avoided if proper precautions were taken .
During the design process , it is important to ensure that the product design is safe and user friendly  .
When designing a product or even a system , engineers must make sure that there are safety measurements or considerations taken in the design .
Carpentier ,James & Cazamian ,Pierre .
Night work: its effects on the health and welfare of the worker .International Labour Organization .
Another cause of the ferry capsizing is the lack of interaction within the organization .
Critics claim that it is important to establish a professional relationship between the workers and make sure the workers do not step over their scope of work .
This way of thinking however is inexcusable as when working in an engineering industry , most departments rely on each other .
When water started to flood in the 'Herald Of Free Enterprise' , one deck hand noticed it but did not report the matter because he thought that others may have notice and it was not his job .
If there were proper interaction between the workers the 'Zeebrugge' incident could have a different ending .
Apart from that there is also the matter of the management's role in the 'Zeebrugge' incident .
The management is said to be pushing their workers to work double shift just for their own profits .
Critics mentioned that the welfare of the workers is not important .
As long as they are being paid for their extra work , it is fine .
That way of management is very harsh as the workers safety and their health is very important .
Looking in the 'Zeebrugge' incident , the worker which was suppose to make sure the bow doors are closed , was asleep .
Because the higher-ups forced the workers into exhaustion an engineering accident have happen .
The workers psychological state and physiological state must be good in order for him to perform his job .
When the workers mind is in the right place , then he will be happy and content when working  .
This will undoubtedly reduce human error .
It is without question that the 'Herald of Free Enterprise' would not have capsized if psychological approach is taken during design process .
Not only the incident at 'Zeebrugge'  ,many major accidents can benefit from this approach in design .
The fundamental issues when designing is that it should match its expectations and also safe to operate .
Although it is impossible to totally remove human error from operations  ,the next best thing we can do is to reduce it and by using psychology such a goal can be achieved .

In the past few decades , nuclear energy was considered as a futuristic and exotic technology which requires a lot of research and experiments in order to develop these farfetched ideas .
Nowadays , reactors in operation around the world are generally considered second or third generation systems , with the first-generation systems out-dated some time ago .
Our next step will be innovate generation IV reactors which are cheaper , safer and cleaner compare with the current nuclear reactors .
This mission is put under the responsibility of the Generation IV International Forum where ten nations will come together to research and plan the nuclear reactors of tomorrow .
Among the six generation IV reactors concepts , the Very High Temperature Reactor concept is worth to do further research and development funding for it .
As an introduction , the Very High Temperature Reactor concept uses either a prismatic-block or pebble bed reactor design graphite-moderated core with uranium fuel cycle to generate electricity and produce hydrogen through thermochemical process .
This high temperature reactor used inert helium to keep the reactor cool and can consider as passively safe .
Experiments have been carried out by Japan's Atomic Energy Research Institute based in Kashiwa to test its feasibility by operating a similar high-temperature engineering test reactor at Oarai , Tokyo .
Its first test run has a quite satisfied result by achieving its goal of 9500C without having any sign of partial reactor meltdown .
Hence , this reactor is practical and has a high potential to be the next generation nuclear reactor .
Generally , nuclear power is a sustainable energy source that does not pollute our environment with tremendous amounts of toxic gases such as nitrogen oxides , sulfur oxides and carbon dioxide .
Compared with fuel oil and coal combustion , nuclear power not only meets the increased global energy demands in the future but also avoids global warming issues .
In Taipei , Taiwan , the government rather extends its oldest nuclear plant's life and willing to take the risk of public safety just to cut down the greenhouse effects .
However , we cannot deny the fact that nuclear energy will produce radioactive wastes that raised the concern of the public .
In fact , nuclear power plant will only emit a very small percentage of radioactive wastes to the air during its operation and the possibility of nuclear wastes leakage is very low .
This safety issues arises is due to the huge information gap besides lack of communication and understanding between the experts and the public about the safety measurements taken during the operation of nuclear power plant .
In term of performance , the Very High Temperature Reactor concept manage to generate 50% more electricity compared with other conventional plants such as Pressurized Water Reactor .
This is because this reactor is designed to run at temperature 10000C which is the highest temperature used among the generation IV reactors to generate electricity by using the same amount of fuel .
Basically , high temperature operations are more efficient to convert heat energy to electrical energy and can avoid wasting of energy in other forms .
This reactor do not has waste recycling process and instead , waste goes directly to repository .
Although reprocessing can decrease the quantity of waste produced , the generation of weapons-grade plutonium is still not a beneficial product to human kind .
We should cut down the amount of plutonium existed and not increase its quantity for further development .
There's no doubt that up-front cost of nuclear power plant building is relatively expensive compare to those associated with fossil fuels .
In fact , there is a lot of ways to mitigate these costs .
The Very High Temperature Reactor is considerably cheap compare to other reactors .
It does not run the conventional reprocessing which is rather expensive and it is among the earliest delivery of generation IV reactor .
Hence , this reactor does not need a very long research period and cut down the unnecessary development funding .
In conclusion , nuclear energy brings many advantages to our society .
It not only decreases world's dependency on fuel oils to generate electricity , but also act as an environment protector .
Although there are few drawbacks of nuclear power , we can reduce these negative effects by using the latest technology in newer reactor and emphasis on public safety .
As long as we use it wisely and efficiently , i believe that nuclear power greatly overweighs other type of energies .
The world is facing an energy crisis .
Current means of generating electricity such as burning of fossil fuels are getting less viable by the day due to its depleting source .
Hence , there is a need for new alternative methods of generating electricity that is capable of satisfying the energy demand of the growing world population .
One such alternative would be nuclear energy .
Nuclear plant takes advantage of the heat generated from nuclear fission and uses it to heat up water , producing steam .
The steam produced is then used to generate electricity .
Although the whole process does sound simple , there is actually more to it than meets the eye .
In fact , most people are not comfortable with the idea of using nuclear reactors to generate electricity , for good reasons .
However there are six new generation IV reactors being developed at the moment that promises to resolve many of the issues posed by generators of the past .
Of these six reactors , the most promising reactor would be the very-high-temperature reactors  .
The chief issue that the public have against nuclear reactors is of course it's safety .
Past events such as the incident in Chernobyl serve as a grim reminder of the dangers that comes with a nuclear reactor .
On top of that , VHTR require a relatively high operating temperature and pressure for optimum function .
To ensure that VHTR does not suffer the same fate as reactor 4 in Chernobyl , new materials such as nickel super-alloys and chromium steel are being looked at as potential candidates for reaction vessels as these materials are capable of withstanding the extreme conditions of VHTR .
The reaction itself , unlike other generation IV plants , is moderated by uranium oxycarbide coated graphite , a naturally safe choice , capable of retaining radioactive waste .
Besides that , helium , the coolant of choice in VHTR is chemically inert .
So , it is not affected by radiation , unlike other coolants such as water .
The public tend to moan about the high economical cost necessary in building and maintaining a nuclear plant .
In fact , each of the generation IV reactors will require a staggering 1 billion USD in construction cost alone .
Apart from that , there is also the research cost as well which requires consideration as it also contributes to the overall cost of the plants .
But then again , people tend to overlook the benefits that these reactors yield as future investments .
For one , constant research and testing ensures that the safety of these reactors are not compromised .
Despite the relatively high volume of research needed for VHTR compared to the other nuclear reactors , the fact that researchers are able to reassure its delivery by the year 2020 , five years earlier than most of the other reactors means that the research work on VHTR is much simpler compared to the other reactors , costing less .
The performance of generation III nuclear reactors have also raised concerns .
In a generation III nuclear plant , only 5% of uranium input is actually converted into electricity while the rest of it turns into nuclear waste .
Compared to other means of generating energy , users will have to pay more for the same amount of electricity generated via nuclear means .
On the other hand , VHTR is said to be able to convert up to 65% of uranium into energy .
That means only less than half of the uranium input will now go to waste .
In addition , due to the high temperature and pressure involved in VHTR , conversion rate is improved and this produces hydrogen gas as well which can be used to fuel green cars of the future .
Among the six proposed generation IV nuclear power plants , VHTR is by far the most promising choice .
Firstly , due to the research already being done on known materials to serve as reaction vessels , safety is no longer an issue as they are capable of withstanding the operating conditions of VHTR .
The cost of building each generation IV nuclear reactor is about the same .
However , the cost of research on VHTR is less than most of the other candidates .
Plus , generation IV nuclear reactors are much more efficient than those of generation III because of the higher energy conversion rate that they have to offer .
At the same time , VHTR also produces useful hydrogen gases as by-products .
In conclusion , unless the world decides to live completely in the dark , a new method of generating electricity needs to replace the constantly depleting fossil fuels that we current rely so heavily on as an energy source .
The best alternative approach on the table at this point in time is nuclear energy .
Despite the current economic downturn , it is only a matter of time before the energy crisis is resolved .
Necessity and the sense of urgency will always be the best motivator .
Annex
In a time where energy sources are depleting rapidly , call for new alternate energy has being made by several countries and large amount of effort and money had been poured for this new cause .
Nuclear power energy has being claimed by many as the most desired new energy source for the new age  .
However in my opinion , other alternate energy sources like solar and hydro energy have more potential to be the new dawn for energy as they have far more advantages than nuclear energy and with lesser risk involved .
Wald , Matthew , L . . New york times .

Another major issue with the nuclear plant will be the security aspect of the use of nuclear power .
It is a well-known fact that the by-product of the nuclear plant mainly the nuclear waste have being used for developing nuclear weapons  .
The development of nuclear weapons has being condemned by several countries and organizations like the U .N  .
Although some might claimed that the security of these nuclear resources will not be misuse , however it is almost impossible to guard against such cases  .
Moreover , the ever increasing risk of terrorism will result in a much threatening situation if nuclear weapon is been stolen .
It is unimaginable the amount of damage that will occur if the terrorists are able to get their hand on a nuclear power plant .
In conclusion , all the following aspects such as the security , safety and costs component for a nuclear reactor indicates far more disadvantages and risks compared to the advantages that nuclear reactor brings about .
Thus , in my view , there are much better technology and energy than nuclear power around , so there should be more emphasis and support for other technologies .

It is beyond doubt that the Earth has been recently getting warmer .
The most devastating effects of global warming was the South-Eastern Australian heat wave which brought temperatures soaring above 43 degrees Celsius according to the International Committee of the Fourth International  .
One of the main contributors of global warming is the burning of coal and gas to produce energy .
In the year 2007 , it was proven that the coal-generated power plants were the largest source of global warming  .
However , we can reduce global warming by using the Generation IV reactor concepts nuclear plants .
One such reactor is the Very High Temperature Reactor where it can produce large volumes of energy cleanly , reliably , safely and affordably .
This would therefore provide future price stability and have environmental attributes .
These characteristics demonstrate why the VHTR is such an imperative in the United States  , but due to public opposition , nuclear reactors are perceived as dangerous and unreliable .
However , we should clear the misunderstandings of nuclear energy and learn to accept it and use it to save the Earth .
Firstly , public citizens argue that future nuclear reactors like the VHTR are too risky to rely on due to events like the Three Mile Island and the Chernobyl disaster .
As a result , the public perceives that having a nuclear reactor is like having a bomb waiting to explode .
However , this is not creditable .
In both disasters , human error was more to blame than the technology itself  .
Furthermore , according to engineers of MPR Associates Inc Engineers , the VHTR will be safe and reliable to operate with improved accident management and mitigation and reduced off-side response with little human intervention .
In addition , the focus of the Gen IV reactor concepts is on the use of inherent safety features and designs .
Thus , we can safely conclude that the VHTR as well as nuclear technology are not as dangerous as perceived by the public .
Thomas , A .  .
Taking Sides United States of America: McGraw-Hill .
Furthermore , there is widespread information that nuclear energy is the most expensive and unreliable source of energy .
On the contrary , a team of energy experts from various government , academic and private sector research units noted that wind and solar powers are not very reliable as they are only generated when the wind is right or when the sun is shining  .
Furthermore , they are also very difficult to store hence making it a very unreliable source of energy .
In addition to this , solar and wind technologies are four to ten times more expensive than nuclear energy sources like the VHTR .
For example , a VHTR costs 2 billion dollars and is able to supply electricity to billions of homes and one wind energy system for one home costs 25 ,000 dollars .
In comparison , VHTR supplying electricity is much cheaper  .
In short , Wind and solar power are intermittent and unpredictable and they simply cannot replace coal generating power plants .
Therefore , building a Gen IV nuclear reactor like the VHTR is not as unreliable and expensive as perceived by most .
Another issue widely discussed by the public is the issue of nuclear waste .
It is true that the generation of electricity in a nuclear power plant produces nuclear waste which is difficult to dispose of and harmful to the public as the effects are devastating .
However , according to the {International Atomic Energy Agency}  , there is research being conducted to develop a technology where the VHTR will be powered by using fuels originating from reprocessed nuclear-waste .
This technology would not only destroy most of the nuclear waste , it would also make the existing waste a very valuable source of energy .
Furthermore , it can also be used to deliver ten times the energy of an original fuel .
Hence , with more research and time given to develop the technology , nuclear waste would not become a persecution anymore .
In conclusion , the VHTR can be seen as a safe , reliable and an affordable way to produce electricity since electricity has become a necessity in our everyday lives .
To confront global warming , Gen IV nuclear reactors like the VHTR should be seen as a solution .
According to a study by MIT in 2003 , it was concluded that the use of nuclear energy may be needed to meet future energy demands and to reduce carbon emissions as energy demands continue to rise annually .

Nuclear power has been around for several decades and has transformed itself to become a more efficient way of producing electricity for consumer use .
As of today , the US has 104 reactors , contributing about 20 percent of the nation's power  .
Currently , the reactors have already evolved till the fourth generation and there are six different concepts .
These concepts had evolved due to the Generation IV International Forum where a team of ten nations will plan the direction for future nuclear reactors  .
The main focus will be on the cost aspects such as high construction costs , operating costs as well as the decommissioning costs .
As such , I do not support to provide funds for further research and development for the building nuclear power plants .
Firstly , high construction costs are incurred when building the plant for Very-high-temperature reactors due to the requirements of the reactor .
For VHTR to operate , it needs to be carried out at very high temperature of 1000C and also at high pressure  .
This will require the building materials to be very tough , resulting in higher cost .
There will also be fluctuations in the cost , depending on the period the plant is built and this is a major component of the cost of building nuclear plant .
On the other hand , it should also be noted that price fluctuations will not only affect the construction costs of building a nuclear power plant but also the costs of building other types of plants that produce electricity such as coal and natural gas plants .
As nuclear power plants receive government subsidies due to the fact that it is a cleaner gas , this means that construction costs incurred by the company will be greatly reduced .
A total of $178 billion has been used for nuclear power subsidies between 1947 and 1999  .
Another factor that contributes to the high costs of nuclear plants lies in the operating costs .
Daily costs include labour such as operators and maintenance personnel , overheads such as computers and equipment , expendable materials such as replacement and computer parts , licensing costs such as power reactor licenses which cost $2 ,980 ,000 per unit and local property taxes which cost around $15 to $20 million per year  .
All these daily costs are rather fixed , thus a reduction in the operational side is rather unlikely .
However , in the long run , savings in the operating costs could be a rather large with the help of improved technology .
If technology could help to automate the reactors , then the number of operators required will be reduced and by doing R&D , the parts could have a longer lifespan and hence expenditure of replacing parts will be much lowered .
Lastly , the factor that accounts for the high cost is due to decommissioning costs .
It refers to the nuclear power plant is being treated as nuclear waste .
This is another overwhelming expense of nuclear power .
The average cost of decommissioning a power plant is about $300 million .
The funds for decommissioning accumulate in the operating cost of the plant .
On the contrary , though for nuclear power plants , we have to take into account decommissioning costs which are not found in other types of plants producing electricity but for nuclear power plant , no cost is incurred in the cleaning up of the waste products being produced during the production of electricity .
Due to climate changes , countries are encouraged to lower the amount of carbon dioxide gas released into the air by treating it so as to remove its toxicity  .
As such , the costs incurred by other power plants will also be increased due to this action .
In conclusion , the different factors of costs , mainly construction costs , operating costs and decommissioning costs contribute to almost the whole cost of building nuclear plant .
The total cost is a very huge figure as compared to other types of power plants .
As such , I do not support the further R&D funding for it .
This is backed up by the fact that no new nuclear power plants have been ordered in the US since 1978 as the high costs have caused many problems such as bankruptcies  .

In a world where technology has fitted seamlessly into , the threat of global warming and raising energy needs which affects the future of our planet has never been greater .
Given the gloom forecast on global warming due to the environmental impacts caused by greenhouse gases , it is not surprising that countries are turning towards nuclear energy as an alternative .
The only issue that stands in the way of the government turning towards this alternative is the memories of past incidents such as the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , and the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania  .
However , over the recent years , research is starting to show that such issues can be overcome , and together with the launch of generation IV reactor concepts , we may be on hand to witness the revival of nuclear reactors which are safer , more valuable and more energy-efficient .
History shows the risk of having nuclear plants in the vicinity of our homes , and the need for more of such plants to meet the increasing demands for energy such as electricity will only heighten the danger further .
However , these plants will only be available in 2025 , as in the case of the Gas-Cooled-Fast-Reactor  , and through extensive research , these plants will contain irradiation-resistant materials as well as heat-resistant fuels and materials .
In the event of accidents caused by high fuel burn-ups , temperature control will be available .
Furthermore , learning from the mistakes of past experiences , accidents caused by human errors can be greatly reduced .
According to a statistical review of world energy consumption done by the EIA  , the total world consumption of marketed energy is projected to increase by 44 percent from 2006 to 2030 .
Given the fact that the current rate of fuel consumption is already causing damage to our planet , such statistics is indeed alarming .
This leads to an increased urgency to turn to the usage of alternative energy such as nuclear energy , as the waste produced does not contain any greenhouse gases , thus it will help reduce global warming , as well as climate change .
As stated in Butler's article  , the production of nuclear power plants may cost up to a hefty US$1 billion , yet it may end up as the cheaper alternative as compared to the rising cost of oil and fuels , since fossil fuels are getting scarcer , and hence more expensive .
Generation II's reactors are known to be less efficient as compared to the energy generated by fossil fuels , which has led to the decrease in the production of such plants , to the point that countries have resorted to using more fossil fuels instead of relying on the nuclear plants .
However , one of the generation IV reactor concepts such as the Gas-Cooled-Fast-Reactor has new functions which are turning the heads of investors and the government .
The GCFR has a 50% increase in efficiency as compared to Generation II's reactors .
Studies have shown that nuclear fission , the splitting of a heavy atom's nucleus , releases great amounts of energy .
For example , the energy it releases is 10 million times greater than is released by the burning of an atom of fossil fuel .
Besides it would take many hectares of land covered with solar collectors , wind farms or hydro-electric dams to equal this power .
The fact that it is also able to produce both electricity and hydrogen makes it all the more practical .
Hydrogen can then be converted to produce electricity without this conversion , demand from US transport alone will cause the nation's oil imports to soar by 78% 
The damages caused by global warming may be causing the birth of nuclear technology , and given the benefits that it brings , it comes as no surprise that extensive research is constantly being done to ensure the smooth delivery for this re-new source of energy .
Being equipped with this self sufficient form of energy , mankind can then continue to come up with cutting edge technology without the fear of harming our planet .

There is a proverb 'Fire is a good servant but a bad master' .
Fire is an energy which could be employed to sustain life but at the same time , mismanagement could lead to devastating consequences .
Likewise , nuclear energy handled appropriately is an enormous power which could be harnessed for the good of mankind .
The massive potential of nuclear power as a replacement for fossil fuel and coal in the international energy scene comes into focus amid growing concern caused by global warming .
Nuclear energy being non-polluting could be an environmentally-friendly alternative which would alleviate the profound threat to humanity caused by severe climate change .
While nuclear opponents highlight safety , cost and performance issues , the Very High Temperature Reactor is a Generation IV reactor concept which should be researched and developed further .
Public unease over the safety of nuclear technology has historically been the principal opposition against its utilisation .
Indeed , a burnt child dreads fire .
The nineteen-eighty-six Chernobyl accident killed thirty- one people and resulted in significant damage to environment and population health in large parts of Europe .
However , as pointed out in a 2008 report by the World Nuclear Association , "to this day , the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accidents remain the only major accidents to have occurred in more than 12 ,700 cumulative reactor-years of commercial operation in 32 countries" .
Furthermore , statistics from the same report placed coal as the type of energy generation which caused the most related immediate fatalities from 1970 to 1992 with a total death count of six thousand and four hundred .
In contrast , nuclear only resulted in thirty-one for the same period .
Moreover , the safety of nuclear technology was demonstrated during Hurricane Katrina in 2005 .
The survival of all three directly affected nuclear plants illustrates the high preparedness of the nuclear industry for operation under harsh conditions .
Crucially , when extrapolated to the event of a hypnotised terrorist strike , it showcased the capability of current technology to work during emergency .
Further research into VHT reactors would improve safety standards and ease public concern .
Next , opponents are concerned about the cost of nuclear energy .
They argued that investing resource into constructing the related facilities is not economical .
Studies from the Nuclear Energy Institute showed otherwise .
In the United States in 2008 , the cost of electricity from nuclear production was 1 .87 cents per kilowatt-hour , lower than coal or gas which was 2 .75 and 8 .09 respectively .
Furthermore , the indirect economic cost from global warming would be catastrophic as recently seen in world-wide increase in frequency of natural disasters and their ruthless damage to property and human life .
Moreover , a reason why such facilities are budget taxing is due to lack of construction expertise .
As one of the aims of VHT reactor research is cost reduction , the proposed research and development in this field will draw in resources and bring about a decrease in construction and production cost .
Bulter , D . Nuclear power's new dawn .
Retrieved October 13 , 2009 from Nature , 429 ,238-240 .
Another reason for opposition is the disputed performance of VHT reactors .
Opponents regard Generation IV reactor as mere concepts which work only in computer simulations .
However , research into enhancing reactors in the last two decades has led to improvement in production efficiency in current plants .
The average capacity factor for plants in the United States was fifty-six percent in 1980 as compared to ninety-one percent in 2008 .
Finally , VHT reactors possess attractive qualities .
The utilisation of non-reactive helium coolant and graphite moderator with high temperature stability makes the design inherently safe .
Waste is not reprocessed , thereby reducing controversy stemming from nuclear weapons proliferation that surrounds other designs .
Furthermore , there is dual output of hydrogen as well as electricity .
Hydrogen , another non-polluting fuel , could be used in smaller-scale energy generation as seen in its application in hybrid- cars .
Therefore , the VHT reactor concept should be further researched and developed .
To conclude , the VHT reactor is a passively safe design which could potentially produce power at reasonable cost without contaminating the environment .
While there are issues relating to the development of nuclear technology , this is precisely why further research is required .
Just like how Prometheus brought fire to mortals , scientists have given us nuclear power .
Although this power is naturally destructive , mankind should not cower in fear .
Instead , we should research into harnessing this great energy .

Nuclear power has always been a very controversial topic over the past a few decades .
The proponents emphasized on its high energy potential while the opponents were so much concerned about its radioactive nature that might cause harms .
As energy resources have become more and more precious and our technologies keep upgrading , the supporting side of nuclear power seems winning in recent years as nuclear power plants are increasing in numbers in America , China , Japan and other countries .
Butler2004says that the Supercritical-water-cooled reactors should be used .
Hence , it is necessary to have further research and more development funding for nuclear power due to its cost-efficiency , security and safety issues .
Firstly , nuclear power is superior to other energy resources due to its cost-efficiency .
Global warming has drawn people's attention nowadays .
Al Gore's documentary film "An Inconvenient Truth" and the Kyoto Protocol ratified by nations have shown that it is urgent to find a future energy alternative .
Nuclear energy will be the one as nuclear power can produce 50% more electricity compared to coal and it emits less amount of dangerous oxides such carbon dioxide , sulphur dioxide and so on .
For instance , 790 to 1182 grams of greenhouse gases are released by a coal plant if 1 kilowatt- hour electricity is generated while only 2 to 59 grams of it is emitted by a nuclear power plant .
The cost for coal and nuclear energies are generally comparative , $300/Mw-hr for nuclear energy and $29 .1/Mw-hr for coal respectively .
SCWRs are also cheap and efficient to run and build .
Thus , nuclear energy is more cost-efficient compared to existing energy resources and it is more environmental-friendly .
Moreover , nuclear power system is much more secure than other energy resource systems .
The establishment of a nuclear plant is under consideration of long-term researches and preparations .
Once the plants are built up , safety precautions will be installed and working staffs will be carefully selected .
Hence , it is indeed not easy for terrorists to attack the plants as they will be spotted and stopped by the high-tech security systems before they do so .
Abuse of nuclear energy is also less likely to happen among countries as international organizations such as United Nations will hinder the proliferation of nuclear weapons .
For instance , North Korea has announced to be a "powerful nation" by 2012 in terms of nuclear weapons .
America , China and other big countries and organizations have stood up and criticized this action .
Many nuclear power projects are not able to implement under pressure such as the one initialized by Korea Peninsula Energy Development Organization  .
From the hindered growth of nuclear energy in North Korea , we can see that the abuse of nuclear power such as SCWRs is less likely to happen nowadays .
The atomic bombing in Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945 will definitely not happen nowadays as they will be strongly opposed due to its inherent immorality and military unnecessariness .
On the other hand , nuclear energy is much safer than other energy resources .
Governments have spent large amount of money in maintaining the safety of nuclear power plants .
Technologies are kept upgrading to ensure the smooth running of the systems .
The following statistics can illustrate that nuclear power is much safer than others .
The number of immediate fatalities from 1970 to 1992 for nuclear is 31 and those for coal and gases are 6400 and 1200 respectively .
We cannot deny the fact that nuclear disasters have happened in the past such as Chernobyl disaster in 1986 .
However , as compared to coal plant accidents , SCWR is still a superior choice due to its sophisticated safety systems and that is why the governments should have development funding for it to achieve zero nuclear disaster someday in the future .
To sum-up , the nuclear energy is much more environmental-friendly and it is a better choice compared to coals and gases as more electricity can be generated by the same amount of nuclear energy with comparative costs .
Nuclear energy is also under protection of high-tech security systems .
Hence , we should support further research in this area and increase the development funding for nuclear power .
Since the nuclear reactor accident at Three Mile Island and Chernobyl , it has been two decades before the issues regarding conventional nuclear power being brought up once again due to increasing cost of power generation .
Generation IV nuclear energy systems offer advantages in the areas of economics , safety and reliability , sustainability and could be deployed commercially by 2030  .
The Generation IV International Forum has selected six nuclear systems which have the potential to be used as commercial electricity generator and in my opinion , the supercritical-water-cooled reactor and the very high temperature reactor are the better ones compared to the rest of the reactors .
Further , I think that the VHTR deserves further research and development funding compared to the SCWR .
On safety feature , the SCWR operates at a lower temperature than the VHTR which gives the impression that VHTR is more dangerous than the SCWR .
But the fact is that the VHTR uses a graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations  .
Thus , the core has large thermal inertia which means it is not easily corroded even in high temperatures .
It also has high heat capacity and structural stability .
VHTR uses helium gas as coolant which does not react with other substance even at high temperatures  .
Further , the VHTR will be built on hard rock surface and this will minimize the effect of natural disaster such as earthquake .
Besides , it will also be built in a confined building that will protect the reactor from terrorists' attacks .
With these safety and security features , the VHTR is safer and more secure than SCWR .
The reason for using nuclear power is because power generated from fossil fuel is getting more and more expensive due to scarcity of fossil fuel .
Therefore , nuclear power must be able to be produced at a cost lower than conventional power plants .
The capital cost of a SCWR is approximately USD 1 billion and VHTR is from USD 1 .8 billion to USD 2 .4 billion which means building a SCWR is much cheaper than building a VHTR  .
The reason for the higher cost in building a VHTR is because of its safety features .
In addition , VHTR uses high-strength alloys with protective coatings that could significantly improve the service life of high temperature reactor components .
Furthermore , the capital cost of VHTR will be lower for the second and subsequent reactors than the first one  .
In addition , VHTR has a low input cost which will lead to low processing cost that will produce cheaper electricity .
This feature alone already fulfills one of the main objectives of GIF which is to produce low cost electricity .
The reactor's performance is also one of the main concerns of GIF .
SWCR has a higher efficiency compared to the current water-cooled reactor by having a burn-up of 45% but VHTR has an even higher burn-up which is 65% .
Another advantage of VHTR over SWCR is the ability to produce hydrogen without consuming fossil fuels or emitting greenhouse gasses  .
Hydrogen production needed a high temperature of 700C , so heat from VHTR can be transferred to hydrogen production plant but SWCR does not produce high enough temperature .
Experts see hydrogen as the future fuel and large amount of hydrogen are needed to convert heavy oils and tar sands to liquid fuel .
Hydrogen is also needed in fertilizer production .
Hydrogen is getting increasingly important because of its potential to be used in fuel cells .
Therefore , the ability of producing hydrogen is a great advantage to VHTR .
The objective of GIF is to produce electricity at a lower cost by using nuclear reactor with the least threat to the society .
Furthermore , they plan to replace fossil fuel generators that cause pollution .
Since VHTR , also known as the 'New Generation Nuclear Plant' , has more advantages over the SCWR , VHTR is definitely a better nuclear system to be further developed .
