With the development in industries and technology , the consequences of mistakes in design processes become increasingly disastrous  .
A series of accidents caused by errors in the field of engineering have aroused debates in the practice of psychology in engineering design processes to prevent potential dangers .
Those with opposing views have expressed their doubts about the effectiveness of practice of psychology in design processes .
Many engineers have argued that the practice of psychology will be redundant since safety regulations are already established in engineering to prevent accidents .
Some have also argued that the enrolment of psychologists increase the cost of production and may also hinder engineering creativity .
Despite all these opposing arguments , I firmly believe that the practice of psychology is essential in design processes to help avoid human errors and prevent disasters .
In this article , I would like to focus on the Eschede tain disaster and discuss how the practice of psychology can help prevent the disaster .
Among those opposing views , there is a common misconception that psychology has nothing to do with design process .
This point of view is not true since design processes are human activities and human activities are always accomplished by human errors .
Psychology , by studying human behaviours and activities , is able to detect these human errors and help avoid and eliminate accidents  .
In the case of the Eschede train disaster , the design of the wheel tire only underwent limited tests and the tire's performance under extreme conditions was only proved theoretically .
The practice of psychology would help spotting such negligence and the accident would probably be avoided .
As such , practice of psychology should be involved in design processes to help eliminate human errors and avoid accidents .
Some engineers argue that practice of psychology in design processes is redundant since safety regulations and norms are already established in the engineering field .
However , engineers seem to be more focused on technical issues such as effectiveness and efficiency , and safety components are usually overlooked .
For the Eschede train disaster , it was later revealed that the Fraunhofer Institute had observed possible tire failure as early as 1992 , however the problem was ignored until the disaster happened  .
Other accidents in engineering history also revealed the lack of enough attention of the consequences of errors in engineering field .
Hence , even with the established safety regulations in engineering , the practice of psychology is essential in re-examining and evaluating the design products for hidden dangers to prevent disasters .
Another opposing view expressed by some managers is that the enrollment of psychologists in design processes will increase the cost and time spent .
This is a valid concern however it cannot deny the significance of practice of psychology in design processes .
The additional cost spent is far less significant than the payoffs if accident occurs .
In addition , this problem of extra cost can be minimized if managers carefully analyse the nature of the industry and decide how far psychology should be involved in design processes .
For example , for industries where design processes are complex and consequences of errors are tremendous , enrolment of psychologists may be integrated , while for other industries which involves less complicated designs , psychologists may step in only after each design stages or at the end of the designs .
Some engineers have further argued that the presence of psychologists may hinder creativity due to lack of engineering knowledge .
This problem can be perfectly solved if engineers are educated in psychology .
In conclusion , the practice of psychology is undeniably significant in engineering design processes as it can help eliminate human errors and prevent accidents .
Considering the increment in cost of production , psychologists may be enrolled in various degrees according to the nature of the industry and the respective products .
For industries where professional knowledge is required , engineers educated in psychology should be involved in design processes such that safety factors can be given enough attention while innovation process will not be influenced .
The first nuclear reactor was built as part of the Manhattan project back in the 1940's to build an atomic bomb  .
After World War II , nuclear reactors became power generators , providing electrical energy .
However , people opposed the usage of nuclear power .
The opposition can be categorized into three main groups the public , the government , and the industry .
The public are concerned about health and safety , governments are concerned about security , the environment , and space constraints , and the industries are concerned about profits , the environment , and operation stability .
To resolve these concerns , experts proposed several designs for the next generation of reactors .
These designs are flawed , failing to resolve some of the concerns people have .
However , with fossil fuel depleting fast  , alternative sources of energy needs to be explored hence research on nuclear power as an energy source should be carried out .
In addition , the Lead-cooled fast reactor design is the best solution to the people's concerns , so research should be concentrated on this design .
First , the LCFR operates in a moderate temperature , low pressure condition  .
This characteristic is advantageous as operating a reactor under such conditions is simpler compared to the extreme conditions such as high temperature required for the other designs .
Also , according to Butler  , at such temperatures the conversion of heat to electricity is efficient , thus producing more energy than present nuclear plants .
Thus the expenses to develop and operate the LCFR are cheaper than the other designs , increasing profit .
This relieves the considerations industries have for profits and operation stability .
Furthermore , with stability , accidents are unlikely to occur , and therefore resolves the concerns people have for safety .
Next , the LCFR enables waste recycling .
The advantage is the maximized use of uranium , the fuel for nuclear power .
As uranium is a non-renewable resource , wasting should be discouraged , as uranium reserves will deplete as rapidly as fossil fuel .
This is critical as one motive of looking for alternative energy sources is to have a long lasting source , thus this property should be prioritized .
In addition , with waste recycling , the amount of radioactive waste to be disposed is reduced .
This dispels the environmental concerns that governments and industries have .
However , waste recycling is dangerous , as plutonium is separated .
Plutonium is a key ingredient of nuclear weaponry , thus causing the government's security concerns .
Nevertheless , this can be resolved by implementing restrictions on nations , preventing nuclear weaponry development .
Hence this property should be present in the future nuclear plant .
Another property of the new nuclear plant is the production of hydrogen fuel together with electricity .
As hydrogen is capable of replacing fossil fuel as an energy source , having nuclear plants that produce hydrogen will relieve us of our dependence on the fast depleting fossil fuel for energy .
This will benefit the world , as carbon emissions will then decrease , slowing down global warming .
However , considering the large amount of space taken up by a plant and its hydrogen output , governments will debate over whether it is worthwhile to use so much land to produce enough fuel for the nation .
In addition , for small countries such as Singapore , there is no room to even construct a plant to power the country .
Nonetheless , land constraints may be resolved by situating the nuclear plant offshore , listed as one of the considerations by the government of Singapore  .
With alterations to the operating temperature , pressure , waste recycling ability and power output of present nuclear reactors , the LCFR design is able to address many concerns the world has towards the utilization of nuclear power .
In addition , with the advantages of the LCFR design heavily outweighing the possible problems it may bring , the LCFR design is arguably the most suited solution amongst the six designs to the concerns the world has towards nuclear power .
Therefore , more funding should be provided for research and development to be carried out on the LCFR design .
Sodium-cooled fast reactors
Nuclear power has always been a dilemma to humans .
As it's a very promising energy source , it is not a wonder that nuclear power is extremely enticing to mankind .
This advantage , however , comes with a price .
The danger , which nuclear power hold , is a big concern and it has holding the development of nuclear technology back for decades .
The radioactive waste produced in a nuclear process is also dangerous and last for a very long time .
After years of development , the scientists published six generation IV reactor concepts which should solve most of today problem in nuclear plants .
The most promising would be the sodium-cooled fast reactors because , from safety wise , SFR needs low pressure and temperature to operate and it doesn't produce hydrogen which is volatile .
For the product , only electricity is produced , making it one of the most efficient reactors .
In terms of safety , SFR is safer because of its necessary condition , like temperature and pressure , to operate and the waste it produced .
SFR operates on a temperature around 5500C which for a nuclear plants , this is considered a low temperature for a nuclear plant to operate .
The low temperature indicates that we don't need to manufacture a new kind of material to withstand the temperature .
It can be seen from other concepts most of the concepts are operated at almost twice the temperature SFR is operating .
SFR is also operating on a pressure around atmospheric level so it's safer because the high pressure will increase not only the stress emitted to the walls of the plant but also the damage if an explosion happens .
Using radioactive material such as Uranium238 , plutonium and lanthanum , the SFR runs a full cycle which nearly consumes all the material to produce electricity .
This means that no radioactive waste released to the public and also no hydrogen as a byproduct .
As no radioactive waste was thrown out , there is no danger of radioactive poisoning .
The risk of explosion is lowered because no hydrogen is produced but it still need to be cautioned as we are using sodium as a coolant and sodium not only explodes if it's in contact with water but also burns if it touches air .
From all the advantage like the low pressure and temperature condition , almost no radioactive waste and no other byproduct like Hydrogen , it can be seen that SFR is the most promising and advantageous model compare to other reactor concepts and it is worth every dollar spent to pursue deeper research and development .
This model's weaknesses like the high capital cost and the danger of using sodium are actually solvable by producing a new metal that incapable of reacting to sodium .
Nuclear energy has been a topic of discussion among the society given the memories of the partial nuclear meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded  .
The radioactive effects of the aftermath can still be felt even years after the accident with common side effects that include deformities in newborn babies .
The issue of safety is of most concern over the debate of whether nuclear reactors should even be in operation .
The world's natural resources are depleting rapidly fast and there is a need to search for alternatives to meet the ever increasing energy demands of the world .
Generation IV reactors may just be the solution to meet these demands .
In addition , their new designs will address safety issues .
Two of such Generation IV reactors include the very high temperature reactor and the gas cooled fast reactor  .
Both of these designs incorporate helium as a coolant and produces electricity as well as hydrogen as their energy output  .
However , the favourable VHTR has advantages in performance , safety and cost that outweighs those of the GCFR and thus should be given support for further research and development .
Firstly , the VHTR spot better performance than the GCFR .
The GCFR produces less waste than the VHTR  .
However , with less waste produced means that the same fuel is reused several times .
As a result , the fuel loses its properties to generate energy over time .
In contrast , the VHTR uses fresh fuel each time and therefore , output efficiency remains high .
Furthermore , the VHTR has a higher operating temperature , which is essential in achieving better efficiency , as energy output is dependent on temperature  .
This will result in the VHTR producing more energy with the same amount of fuel .
Secondly , the VHTR incorporates a safety feature that is not present in the GCFR .
The GCFR operates at a much safer lower operating temperature compared to the VHTR .
In contrast , the VHTR operates at a higher operating temperature .
However , the VHTR has a temperature monitoring system that constantly monitors the temperature of the core to prevent any meltdowns from occurring and a proper back up system that continues producing energy during a malfunction .
This is particularly important for a country like France where 80% of its energy depends on nuclear  .
Moreover , with such a system , human intervention can be avoided during emergencies .
Also , we have to understand that every system is bound to fail .
Relying on visual inspection of the core will not do sufficient for the GCFR to meet safety standards .
In addition , the issue of waste recycling in GCFR will pose a huge problem .
Waste recycling will produce plutonium and uranium in its pure form , which is an active ingredient use in the making of nuclear weapons  .
This problem is not present in the VHTR that stores waste instead of recycling them  .
Lastly , implementing the VHTR is more cost saving than GCFR .
The GCFR operates at a lower temperature and thus choices of materials are wider and cheaper as compared to the VHTR .
In contrast , the VHTR needs special materials to withstand high temperatures  .
Thus , the choices of materials are limited and expensive .
However , the VHTR in the long run will be able to balance off the high cost of materials with its high energy output .
Moreover , the VHTR can be implemented 5 years earlier  .
The cost saved can be channeled into many years of project planning and research .
In conclusion , the VHTR should receive further funding for research and development given the advantages it holds over the GCFR .
The VHTR has a better performance in terms of high energy output , a safer design that meets safety standards and ultimately a more cost effective solution .
In July 17 , 1981 , the interconnected second level and fourth level hanging walkways in the Hyatt Regency in Kansas City collapsed , killing 114 and injuring an additional 200 more  .
The reason for this disaster boiled down to gross negligence by the project engineer for not checking with the calculations before agreeing to design changes as a result of material constraints .
The use of psychology as described by Wilpert in preventing the errors in design by the designers who are also only human involves the introduction of applied psychology as a method of curbing the potentially negative effects that may arise from the dynamics of individual and group psychology in design teams .
As described , the inputs of applied psychology can also be provided through the different organizational levels in a design team .
As such , the discussion shall pertain to the application of psychology on three of the organization levels of the architecture firm with the aim of preventing the accident .
These levels are namely:
* The designer
* The process of designing
* The organizational hierarchy of the firm
In the case of the accident at the Hyatt Regency , the introduction of a psychologist to the errant architecture design firm could have brought to light the negligent behavior of the engineer in question .
However , the identification of this particular problem through behavioral observation by a psychologist may not be a good method given that the multitudes of other problems that might occur , thus leaving a lot of the fault-finding process to chance .
Indeed , the application of psychology in the design process should not only be in the form of adding personnel well-versed in psychology .
The implementation of safety orientated intervention practices as discussed by Geller can then help cast a wide net of control over the domains of possible human errors .
Geller's article , albeit written in the context of occupational safety , advocates the use of behavior-based safety techniques as tools to help members of a working unit to take better control of their safety performance .
One particular way of implementation , the "Actively Caring Model" , shows promise of cultivating a work attitude of actively caring for the associated benefits of others through promoting the effects of various psychological states of mind like self-pride in ones' field of work , the effects which could have prevented this accident .
The operation hierarchy of the engineering firm is highlighted as there is only one person who is responsible for approving the designs .
Given the importance of this task and the possible stresses of the job , it can very risky to only have one person in charge .
The utilization of elementary psychology would have prevented this accident as these types of windows of opportunities for risk could have been easily identified and rectified if the firm employed introspective reviewing of its operation .
A significant portion of the systems which have failed did so because of human errors of design .
The increasing size and complexity of modern systems means that there are more opportunities for human errors to creep in .
The resulting system is then too complex for efficient fault-finding for safety insurance .
Therefore it is necessary to apply the studies of human psyche to the design of systems so as to prevent the loss of human life by such errors .
Since the beginning of the 20th century , a number of major engineering accidents have occurred with increasing complexity of large engineering projects .
It is important to study these cases and analyze the causes in order to prevent potential accidents .
This essay will bring one particular accident , the Eschede train disaster , back to the table .
The ICE train accident in Eschede happed in June 1998 .
It causes 101 death and 88 injured , which made it the worst accident in the history of Germany  .
The main factors that lead to the disaster include the failure in wheel and train track design , as well as an inefficient feedback system .
This essay will present that the use of psychology during the design process will improve product safety and it may help prevent the Eschede train disaster .
First of all , if psychology approaches were introduced in the design process , product safety could be better guaranteed .
It is very often that managers of large projects tend to believe that engineers would never make mistakes .
However , the fact is human errors widely exist in engineering designs process , which may result in the failure of product functions  .
In the case of Eschede train disaster , the newly designed high-speed wheels were used for operation without physically tested  .
A single fatigue crack later contributed the most to the train accident .
It reveals the fact that engineers sometime neglect certain steps of design process .
If the wheels were tested and improved before put into service , the accident would likely to be prevented .
Therefore , a human scientist is in need to analyze the design process and ensure every step is completed before the product is commissioned .
In addition , human scientist will focus on factors that are closely related to the design , such as the environment in which the product will be implemented .
Companies hire engineers to design certain product and they expect them to consider every detail related to the design .
But in reality , engineers often focus on the product itself while ignoring the environment .
In the case of high-speed train , the track is important to analyze .
The limit of the track , upon which the ICE train was travelling , was exceeded by the train's maximum speed .
Besides , when travelling from high to low speed track , the train passes through a switch points which caused one carriage to stray from the straight-line .
It is analyzed by scientist that it is likely that the train could have passed safely under the bridge if the track was plain  .
Suppose a human scientist was present during the design process , he probably would remind the engineers to consider the track and the accident would be prevented .
Furthermore , psychologist can help analyze and improve the operating system and company policy of large engineering projects .
Just before the Eschede train disaster occurred , valuable time was lost due to inefficient feedback system .
The train staffs did not stop and exam the problem when a passenger reported strange noise and a large piece of metal coming up through the floor .
Engineers and project manager may not be experts in designing operation rules .
A human scientist can assist them and improve the system .
If the "stop and examine" rule was suggested before the accident for dealing with danger signals , the disaster will be prevented  .
To conclude , using psychology approaches during design process will help improve product safety as well as the efficiency of operating systems .
Human scientists are able to analyze each step of the process and remind engineers the important factors that they ignore .
Many major accidents might be prevented if psychology is involved .
Therefore , it is vital to introduce psychology into engineering design process .
It has been argued for a long time whether the use of the nuclear power should be encouraged or prevented .
In recent years , scientists have developed a new concept of nuclear energyGeneration IV reactors .
Generation IV reactors have features such as high operation temperature , simplified safety measures , and proliferation-resistant  .
One type of Generation IV reactors would be the very-high-temperature reactor  .
Many people think that there should not be any more funding for the research and development of VHTR because of its high cost , low reliability , as well as its potential threats .
However , by considering the tremendous benefits it will bring , funding for further research and development of this reactor should still be encouraged .
One reason that causes the public to disapprove the idea of providing funds for the research and development of VHTR is the high expenses on it which most believe that many countries cannot afford .
In fact , even a prototype of VHTR will cost US$1 billion to build  .
However , despite the actual construction cost in building the reactors , VHTR would be economically beneficial because of its high efficiency in electricity and hydrogen production .
It has been proven that the amount of electricity produced by VHTR will be 50% more than that produced by the older nuclear reactors  .
In fact , many of the developed countries such as the US and Europe have already started the research and development of VHTR and planned to finish by 2021  .
Therefore , if we consider the future benefits that VHTR will bring , the funding would be trivial .

Besides cost , some people also believe that VHTR is unreliable compared to the conventional sources of energy .
The construction of VHTR is to totally replace the conventional sources of energy in order to benefit the human population .
However , its high operating temperature of above 1000 C presents significant challenges in terms of fuel and material development  .
It was also believed that in order to replace the conventional sources of energy , we have to build many huge reactors which would occupy a large area , making the problem of land shortage even worse  .
However , many of these problems have been solved by scientists and researchers in recent years .
Moreover , the new nuclear reactor is able to save our environment by emitting much less waste gases than that produced by burning fossil fuels .
Therefore , we should provide funding for the research and development of VHTR .
Lastly , despite all the safety measures implemented , it is still believed that the nuclear reactors are potentially dangerous .
It is doubtless to say that there is a possibility that radioactive leak will occur .
However , the VHTR has been developed into such a stage that in an event of accident , the reactor itself is able to shutdown itself without human intervention  .
This will greatly reduce the possibility of a radioactive leak and make the nuclear reactors safer than ever .
Another problem may be dumping the nuclear waste which , if not carefully considered , may cause serious consequences  .
However , VHTR has its unique design which makes the disposal of nuclear wastes convenient and safe .
It has a corrosion-resistant repository which collects all the nuclear wastes before they start decay  .
On the whole , the VHTR has showed great potential in becoming the future source of energy .
It is not only more efficient in generating energy , but also more environmentally friendly than those conventional sources of energy .
Therefore , despite the current challenges for this new energy source , the society should provide funding for the research and development of VHTR .

As a result , patients may have higher risk of encountering danger during the surgery .

Furthermore , with the development of the technology and more experienced surgeons , the time will become shorter .
Although this nascent technology has its disadvantages regarding cost , time and safety , both technological and non-technological solutions are almost possible to overcome those problems .
Researches in this field , increasing training of surgeons , and improvements of other significant issues are conducted to achieve better acceptance of this technology .
Given more time , this technology will prove its efficiency by giving us fruitful research results and evidence-based outcomes .
Hopefully , robotic surgery will possibly improve our surgical practice and bring high quality of surgical care to patients .

While the demand of energy is constantly increasing , earth is running low in coal , oil , and gas supply .
Based on 2003 rates of production of fossil fuels , the global oil , gas , and coal reserves were predicted to exhaust in the next 41 , 67 .1 , and 192 years respectively  .
Due to the scarcity of fossil fuels , nuclear power made its way back onto the table .
The concept of Generation IV reactors was introduced and the several countries in the Generation IV International Forum were in favor of the Very High Temperature Reactors  .
However , safety , cost , and performance are the three main reasons for opposition to the VHTR .
Even with these three reasons , there is still a need to do further research and development funding for it .
Opponents of VHTR claim that production of nuclear energy is expensive .
Special materials are required to build a nuclear reactor .
The construction costs for VHTR will be significantly higher compared to other power plants .
However , the construction cost of the nuclear reactor is a fixed cost and the nuclear power plant will be operating for a long period of time .
Eventually , in the long-run , the fixed cost would be minimal .
According to The Economics of Nuclear Power  , uranium has the tendency to yield about 20 ,000 times as much energy as the same amount of coal .
The cost of uranium is also much lower compared to oil , gas and coal .
In addition , if the coal-fired power plants were to pay a carbon tax-a tax based on the carbon they release into the atmosphere , then the energy generated by VHTR would be much cheaper .
Another reason for opposition is the danger of the operation of nuclear reactors .
Haunted by the memories of the catastrophe at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and Chernobyl in Ukraine , the public requires some convincing  .
One of the main safety principles for Generation IV reactors is the concept of defence in depth .
This concept involves several "overlapping layers of safety and multiple barriers , such that if one safety provision should fail , another will be available to prevent unacceptable damage from occurring"  .
Hence , with multiple layer of safety , operation of VHTR would not pose any threat to the public .
The final argument purpose by opponents is availability of the coolant of VHTR .
VHTR uses helium as a coolant which is extracted from natural gas reserves .
Given the fact that natural gas reserves is depleting , the same goes to helium as well .
Hence , VHTR will not be able to operate in the absence of helium .
The characteristic of helium as an inert gas had made helium recyclable  .
Furthermore , having helium exposed to radiation in the nuclear reactor does not turn helium into a radioactive compound .
VHTR could recycle their coolants and requires minimal addition of helium from time to time .
In a nutshell , the opponent's reasons are debatable .
Energy generated by VHTR is abundant , inexpensive , safe and reliable .
Nuclear energy will do more good than harm to the human mankind .
Therefore , further research and development funding for the very-high-temperature reactors should be supported not only by GIF but also other countries as well .

The first nuclear power plant provided electricity to the power grid in the 1950s .
What separates the first nuclear plant from recent one is the reactor , which has undergone a series of advancements .
The reactor has evolved from Generation I to Generation III over the past five decades with Generation IV being the next prototype .
However , the one reason why few nuclear reactors have been built over the years is public opposition .
Despite the public claiming that nuclear energy is dangerous , an expensive form of energy or of poor performance , the use of molten salt reactor can address their protestations with new designs of the reactor and a cheaper , cleaner and sustainable form of energy .
Thesis statement
The major reactor meltdown happened in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and in 1986 at Chernobyl , Ukraine .
Close to a hundred people died and a few thousand people suffered from cancer due to exposure to radiation from the reactor meltdown over the decades .
Hence , the radioactive materials are contained within the chamber and if there is a reactor meltdown , the release of large amount of radiation can be prevented .
Eerkens , J . W .  .
Nuclear Facts and Fables  .
Most of the public has the misconception that nuclear energy is expensive therefore opposing it .
However , it is easy to conclude without substantiating with a proper cost analysis .
The cost of building a nuclear plant is admittedly more than other kind of power plants but the consideration should be based on performance and cost per unit energy .
According to statistics from the Nuclear Energy Institute , nuclear power plants have achieved increasingly higher capacity factors with the same or greater levels of safety over the past two decades .
In the United States , for example , the average capacity factor for nuclear plants in operation in 1980 was 56 .3 percent .
By 1990 , it had risen to 66 percent , and in 2007 to 91 .8 percent . 
Some oppositions of nuclear energy argue that coal reserves can last another 120 years and funds should be spent on researching technology for coal .
However , this is based on the assumption that coal is used solely for producing electricity .
In fact , coal is an alternative raw material to manufacture plastics in place of oil which will be depleted in 40 years , meaning that coal will last much lesser than the allegedly 120 years .
Unlike coal , nuclear energy uses the fission of atoms to generate electricity .
There are many types of elements and their isotopes available for fission like Thorium , Uranium-235 and Uranium-238 , and reprocessing is possible , resulting in at least a thousand more years for nuclear energy .
The burning of coal also produces carbon dioxide and other air pollutants , contributing to the global warming .
Thus , nuclear energy could be a long term solution and it does not contribute to global warming .
It is evident that the claims from the oppositions of nuclear energy are flawed .
In spite of them claiming that nuclear energy is unsafe , pricey and of low output , there are researches and data to show otherwise with Generation IV reactors .
In conclusion , it could be a wise decision for the public to evaluate nuclear energy as a form of energy and eventually , support further research and development funding for it .

Nuclear reactors are often believed to be accompanied with the danger of leak and explosion .
However , few people know that the Generation IV Reactors , which will be put into use in about 10 to 20 years' time , will produce energy that can be "safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and proliferation resistant" , just like what Spencer Abraham , one of the US energy secretaries , said at the 2002 gathering of GIF representatives .
The VHTR is one of these reactors .
It can produce heat and hydrogen simultaneously with an outlet temperature as high as 1000 C . Although there are still many people concerning about the safety and economy factors , the VHTR is indeed one of the most advanced and valuable design in the world and deserves further research and development funding for it .
Even among all the Generation IV Reactors , the VHTR has the highest operating temperature .
The higher the temperature is the higher heat resisting level the materials must achieve .
So some people worry that whether the existing materials could meet the needs or not .
And in case of accident , the very severe reaction may be difficult to control .
In fact , the VHTR uses Helium as the coolant and graphite as the material of the core .
Helium is a kind of inert gas and will seldom react even in the very high temperature .
Numerous tests and calculations have shown that it is nearly impossible to burn high-purity , nuclear-grade graphite , since graphite could be heated to more than 1650  C without incurring ignition or self-sustained combustion .
Therefore , during the normal circumstance , there will be no problem for the materials to stand the requiring high temperature .
Moreover , the reactor adapts the self-regulating system .
If there is some trouble , the reaction will automatically stop and the temperature will gradually cool down to avoid dangers .

The earliest VHTR will not appear on the earth until 2020 while the research has began since 1990s with a total research funding of more than 1 .6 billion dollars .
Opponents may argue that it will cost too much to make the design into practice .
It is true that the early investment of VHTR is much higher than the existing normal nuclear reactor or others however , the VHTR could produce 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared with other conventional plants , and its deign life is as long as 60 years compared with 40 years of the normal nuclear reactors .
Besides , the VHTR can gain hydrogen through regular running , which could be converted into electricity for cars and homes .
In other words , the side products are worth a great deal of money .
So , it is easy to find that after long period of running , the total cost of VHTR will not exceed that of other existing reactors any more .
In conclusion , the VHTR has own safety features , such as very high system temperature , enhanced reliability , low system pressure and so on .
The early research and development cost might be high but in the long run there seems no obvious difference .
So it is worth developing and investing .

The two general IV nuclear reactors that we will be discussing are very high temperature reactor and gas cooled fast reactor  .
I personally feel that VHTR deserves more funding and research than GCFR in terms of performance , safety and cost .
The similarities between these two reactors are both using helium as a coolant , no need working at high pressure and producing same output of hydrogen and electricity .
We will be comparing which reactors should have more emphasis to have further research and development funding for it .
In terms of performance , Gas cooled fast reactors are dependent on VHTR in terms of modification in design and characteristic , minimizing the effort required for GCFR .
the waste material produced by GCFR is being recycled .
As a result , there is a decrease in efficiency as it is being used many times and loses its capability to generate the same amount of energy .
In addition , according to theory , we know that output efficiency is dependent on temperature .
So a higher operating temperature of VHTR would allow for more electricity to be produced as compared to gas cooled reactors .
Not only that , the waste material being produced by gas cooled fast reactors is pure plutonium and this material is mainly used for weapon making .
This is dangerous if it goes out of hand .
In terms of safety or security , there is a temperature monitoring system in VHTR to ensure safety .
It monitors the reactors to avoid any meltdown .
Such system does not exist in gas cooled reactors that operates at lower temperature .
VHTR has a better back-up system .
In the event of sudden shutdown due to malfunction , VHTR still can produce energy .
It is especially useful for country like France , which 80% of the electricity generated is dependent on nuclear energy .
For GCFR , there is a presence of safe accommodation of low thermal inertia and poor heat transfer properties of coolant .
In VHTR , waste is not recycled but instead stored away .

The incoming shortage of energy and nature fuels is enhancing the price of electricity in China , India and other developing countries .
At the meanwhile , the globle warming and other environmental concerns are pushing the entire world to some more powerful , sustainable and clean solutions for future energy .
Our future method should also be safty , economic , efficient and flexble for applications .
In order to satisfy all the requirements , nuclear power is the one with a high chance among the realistic alternatives .
Nevertheless , the current common nuclear power reactant is not ideal due to its high cost and security considerations .
Therefore , we need some other nuclear solutions for future reactants , the molten salt reactor , is one of the most promising .
For the consideration of Economic motivation , the Oak Ridge National Laboratory has made capital and operating cost estimates based on detailed conceptual studies of various MSRs .
The result showed that the capital of MSR is 20 .1 $/MWh and the total cost is 38 .4$/MWh .
Compared with 15 .8$/MWh and 41 .9$/MWh of normal coal reactants the MSR is actually 7% lower than the pressurized water reactant and 8% lower than coal , which gave an encouraging result .
Nevertheless , the capital cost of MSR is relatively much higher than common reactors , which may be the overwhemling limitation for developing countries .
Finally , since MSR use redioactive materials , it is necessary to concern about waste transmutation and nuclear proliferation .
Concluding from the study of Bj rn Becker , Massimiliano Fratoni and Ehud Greenspan , "the MSR core using LiF  , NaF and BeF2 salt without graphite offers the best neutron balance , most compact design and alleviated graphite lifetime problem ."
and the critical MSR also provides a very high transmutation capability "fissioning of over 99% of the TRU fed , accounting for loss of actinides in the process of soluble FP extraction from the MS . " Moreover , the Thorium's fuel cycle in MSR resists proliferation .
The Th230 produced will contaminate the Th232 breeding material and is inseparable from it .
When Th230 decays , it emmits strong gamma-ray ,which would harm the electrons needed to process the chain reaction of U232 .
Besides , the consentration of Th232 is only 9% , which is far away from the concentrition of building weapons .
To sum up , MSR is qualified as a future nuclear reactant .
Therefore it worth more research on its development .
People hardly link engineering problems with psychology since the previous one belongs to pure technology problems while the later one is a branch of social science .
However , as time comes along , psychology is gradually applied in various fields , including law , medicine , architecture , design and so on .
People start to consider whether psychology can be applied to the field of engineering , so does Wilpert Bernhard , an expert from Institute of Psychology and Ergonomics , Technical University of Berlin .
Wilpert .
He pointed out that psychology is crucial to engineering process , especially to highly complex socio-technical systems with high risks , since the application of psychology can reduce the risk and prevent accidents from happening .
I agree with his point that psychology works well in mitigating accidents .
First of all , occupational mistakes is the main reason of triggering accidents as well as in mitigating consequences , so applying psychology can help people make less mistakes and prevent accidents from happening .
On 20 , April , 2004 , the Nicoll Highway collapsed when a tunnel was being constructed for use by MRT , which killed four people and injured three .
It was one of the largest failures of a civil engineering project under construction in about 50 years  .
The main fault is the original design misinterpreted the local geology and overestimated the soil shear strength , which results in the falling down of the whole structure  .
People who oppose applying psychology may argue that this accident is due to technical problems , having nothing to do with psychology .
However , the misinterpretation of local earth is a typical incident of occupational hazards which is at the center of psychological attention .
Psychology help engineers find the root of the problems instead of staying on the surface of the problems .
Applying psychology , engineers can analyze the reason from a more objective and more scientific angel .
After a complete analysis and a better understanding of mistakes , the possibilities of making mistakes can be reduced , thus can prevent accidents from happening .
Secondly , the ineffective communication and misunderstanding between departments , between sponsors and contractors also lead to engineering accidents .
Applying psychology can tackle this problem .
Another error of Nicoll Highway collapse is made in detailing the structural connections for the structural bracing system .
When one bracing was overloaded , there was inadequate capacity to redistribute the loads among the remaining supporters .
Apart from this , the loads of the strut used were smaller than expected .
The previous two errors directly resulted in the catastrophic failure of this project .
People may argue that these two errors are design errors , irrelevant to psychology .
However , analyzing the source of the errors , it is not hard to find that the poor communication and cooperation between different departments are liable for this accident .
If the designers and material scientists communicate frequently , they may find the flaws in the bracing system .
If the quality inspector is aware of his liability , he may be more careful when he or she is testing the strength of strut .
To be concise , as a whole integrity which is accountable for a project , each department should be aware of the importance of their work , the effective communication and cooperation between each other .
With psychology , the engineers will become aware of this and probably the accident will not happen .
Lastly , no technology can bloom without considering social factors , such as economy , marketing and so on .
A third reason of Nicoll Highway collapse is due to the poor quality of the supporting material and equipment .
Wilpert pointed out that the final objective of a project is to meet user expectation and social need .
Contractors only focus on profit and omit the most important thing that user and society expect- the safety of a product or a project .
People may hold the opinion that even with psychology , the fact of better quality and less profit can not be changed , so psychology is not useful in this case .
Nevertheless , with psychology applying in this project , every social factor will be considered and balanced , which means creating the best quality at the lowest cost instead of lowering the quality to make more profit .
In this sense , psychology can help engineers make better quality product and earn more profit , which indirectly mitigates the possibility of accidents .
To sum up , psychology should be applied in the field of engineering because psychology can help engineers find the root of mistakes , help engineers to communicate effectively and cooperate smoothly with other and finally help engineers to develop the products which will meet social need .
To conclude , applying psychology in engineering process can prevent accidents from happening .

People nowadays have fierce controversy over the use of nuclear power due to the appalling nuclear accidents happened at Three Mile island and Chernobyl , or even the recent nuclear accident at Sellafield , England .
These accidents destroy cities , take people's lives and leave many deadly post-effects in the future decades .
Then , why do people continue using nuclear power ?
In fact , nuclear power is the cheapest power people can produce  .
Therefore , facing this benefit , safety becomes the main concern when people choose to continue using nuclear power .
A series of generation IV nuclear reactors are newly designed for better efficiency , in the meantime , they are also improved on safety issues .
Among all the reactors , supercritical water reactor is outstanding for its high thermal efficiency and also better reliability .
However , opponents argue that SCWR is not reliable since it has no prototype .
Moreover , SCWR is operating under very high temperature and pressure , which makes SCWR less likely to be further developed .
Even though SCWR has not been tested yet , it is proved to have less possibility to cause nuclear accidents that happened before it is easier to implement compared to other generation VI reactors , and it has a relatively high thermal efficiency which makes its long-term cost relatively low .
Firstly , opponents may doubt the safety and reliability of SCWR .
This doubt arises from the lack of knowledge of the design of this reactor .
The nuclear accident happened at Chernobyl was mainly because the nuclear plant utilized positive void coefficient of reactivity , causing it impossible to stop the working process when things went wrong .
On the contrary , SCWR uses negative void coefficient instead , which could effectively reduce the possibility of this kind of fatal accidents  .
International Forum .
A technology roadmap for generation IV nuclear energy systems  .
Supercritcal-Water-Cooled Reactor System R&D , 4 , 42-47 .
Finally , SCWR has a higher thermal efficiency of 44% compared to LWR of 33-35%  .
However , opponents may point out that this high thermal efficiency is achieved at the expense of operating under very high temperature and pressure , which could increase its potential danger .
This concern is necessary but SCWR has overcome this issue .
The coolant in the SCWR system is supercritical water , which has very high specific heat , so that it is very effective acting as a coolant .
Besides , this system is simple to construct and control since only one phase of coolant is present throughout the process  .
Therefore , the safety issue concerning high temperature and pressure is overcome to some extent .
To sum up , although there exists disagreement of the use of SCWR due to its issue of reliability and safety , SCWR is worthy for further research because it bases on two current technologies , which increases its reliability , and its design principle improves its thermal efficiency compared to LWR and reduce the possibility of causing nuclear accidents .
Hopefully , SCWR could be better improved on current problems in the future development .

Given the memories of the two accidents happened in 1979 at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania and in 1986 at Chernobyl of Ukraine , some people may still have not recovered from the great horror when they hear nuclear power .
However , instead of nuclear power , the fossil fuels people have been using are bringing various challenges to human beings .
On one hand , people are facing the challenge of energy shortage because fossil fuels are nonrenewable .
On the other hand , burning fossil fuels produces the "green gases" such as carbon dioxide that have resulted serious problems like global warming .
Therefore , some high-efficient , sufficient and environment-friendly energy is urged .
And because of high-efficiency and cleanliness , nuclear power is coming back into human consideration .
Recently , the generation IV International Forum came up with six generation IV reactor concepts .
Among the six reactors , the Very-high-temperature reactor stands out and may probably be the first choice as future fuel although some people may worry about its safety and cost .
Opponents may claim that the safety of VHTR cannot be controlled , which allows potential accidents .
However , VHTR is much safer compared to the past nuclear reactors .
First of all , instead of using water as coolant , VHTR uses helium gas .
Hence there is no need to be concerned about the safety of the reactor coolant .
The advantage of using helium as the nuclear reactor coolant is that helium is an inert gas which is single phase , and it will not chemically react with any material  .
In addition , exposing helium to radiation does not make it radioactive , which is quite different from most of the other possible coolants  .
Secondly , for the material of VHTR , the ongoing 30-MWth HTTR project in Japan is intended to demonstrate the feasibility of reaching outlet the temperature up to 950 C coupled to a heat utilization process .
Thirdly , there are two unique designs of VHTR , which enhances the safety .
One is that the reactor and the gas turbine system are separated from hydrogen production plant , which is aimed to isolate the hydrogen plant from reactor system during the abnormal events of hydrogen production plant .
The other design is that there are three control valves to mitigate the thermal variation of helium gas , which can automatically control the power generation rate when some abnormal events occur in the IS process such as process pump trip  .
In this case , the number of the accidents caused by human factors would be decreased .
Opponents may also argue that VHTR will cost a lot .
It is a fact that the cost for VHTR is high .
But among the 6 generation IV reactors , the cost of the VHTR is the second lowest , which is about $670 million .
Except the Sodium-cooled fast reactor whose cost is $610 million , the cost of the other 4 reactors ranges from $870 to $1000 million .
However , the VHTR can generate electricity with high efficiency , which is over 50% at 1000 C , whereas , normally other reactors only have an efficiency of 33%-50%  .
Moreover , VHTR produces hydrogen for vehicles' fuel .
And the US Department of Energy has claimed "Without a switch to hydrogen , the energy demand from US transport alone will cause the nation's oil imports to soar by 78% by 2025" .
Thus , USDE has made the VHTR its first choice  .
To conclude , it should be evident the arguments against the safety and cost of VHTR are invalid .
Since VHTR uses helium as coolant , the research of the materials for VHTR is also ongoing , and also there are unique designs for VHTR , the safety of VHTR would be enhanced a lot .
Besides , compared with other generation IV reactors , VHTR costs less .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen as future fuel , which is environment-friendly and can effectively solve the energy shortage as well .
Therefore , VHTR is the promising and practical power .

According to recent findings , the current fossil fuel reserves are expected to be depleted in less than 40 years and at the same time our energy consumption is increasing exponentially .
So , does mankind have a solution ?
Actually , we do and the answer is non-conventional sources of energy like Wind , Geothermal , Hydroelectric , Solar energy and the most promising one being Nuclear Energy .
The current generation of nuclear reactors look very promising , though not all of them seem to address the problems of safety , cost and performance .
However , one particular reactor seems to address all these problems , the VHTR  .
Firstly , the VHTR has a core outlet temperature of about 1000 degrees Celsius this high temperature increases the efficiency of reactor and also enables us to use it for applications such as hydrogen production  .
The hydrogen produced can be used in automobiles , which in turn help decrease the carbon emissions by 30% when compared to modern day diesel engines  .
Although some people have raised the argument that current generation materials which are used to build nuclear reactors cannot withstand such high temperatures , it is now safe to say that an ideal candidate for the material has been found .
The material is moulded and extruded fine grained isotropic graphite which can be used for both core and support applications .
This is the same material which is being used in the Japanese , South African and Chinese high temperature test reactors and has proven to be very successful .

Secondly , the reactor has been designed with a lot of safety concerns in mind .
After seeing the incidents at the 3 Mile Island and Chernobyl , people are worried about having a nuclear reactor in their country and have questioned the safety of the Generation IV reactors .
The VHTR is designed to operate on a pebble bed core in which the fuel is coated with silicon carbide which ensures that the radioactive fissile material never leaves fuel spheres or pebbles  .
The reactor is helium cooled and uses graphite moderated core , which takes advantage of the fact that the helium coolant is inert and has no reactivity effects and that graphite has a high thermal inertia and is stable at high temperatures  .Also , any waste produced goes directly to the repository and this means an additional waste recycling process can be avoided .Thus , in case of any failure the damage does not spread to the surrounding regions but is contained within the plant itself .
Lastly , most of the technology involved in the VHTR is already in its development phase and the reactor can be shelled out as early as 2020 Butler , Nuclear Power's New Dawn , 2004) .
This is a deciding factor as the current reserves of fossil fuels won't last long and the sooner we make nuclear power the mainstream source of energy , the better it would be for us and Mother Nature .
Although people might suggest the use of Carbon Capture and Storage in the existing power plants , which costs less and decreases the CO2 emissions to a great extent , it should be pointed out that this is merely a solution to delay the problem that we would eventually face .
In summary , it can be concluded that nuclear power is the answer to the current energy crisis and the VHTR is an ideal candidate because it not only produces thermal and electric energy efficiently but also provides hydrogen which can help decrease CO2 emissions .
It is also much safer than the current generation reactors and has been well designed to counter any possible error that might occur due to human or technological factors .
Clearly , the reactor is the future of nuclear power generation .

There was a train disaster occurred on 3 June 1998 near a small town in Lower Saxony , Germany .
No one would have thought it would happen .
Such a super fast , state-of-the-art Inter Express trains of German Railways rolled out of tracks and split in two , due to a bridge falling onto the train .

Furthermore , those replaced wheels just were inspected regularly .
However , it has still carried out some of discussion about the difficulties of such inspections and the frequency with which they take place to be used to debate with the method .

Their professional specialty can change other people's life , even save a life .

Introduction
The Chernobyl accident that happened on 26 April 1986 , has led everyone to realize the damages and consequences that we might face when we built a nuclear power plant .
Nonetheless , the Chernobyl accident was an outcome due to an old technology and poor management in the past .
In the next 50 years , demand for energy would definitely double with rapidly growing technology and production  .
In conclusion , although the there are several advantages of the VHTR but however there are factors that makes it difficult to implement as it is more expensive and limited by choices of construction materials as compared with the GCFR .
I would give my fullest support for the concept of GCFR among the six concepts proposed in the Generation IV International forum .
Nonetheless , the decision to implement the reactors still falls in the hands of the countries that are highly interested as budget for every country is different . 
With present day technologies , the Generation IV International Forum has proposed six new and advance nuclear reactors .
The six nuclear reactors are not only sustainable and economically viable solutions they are also safe and reliable source of energy .
Among the six concepts of nuclear reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor , and the Gas Cooled Fast Reactor , are quite similar , but has more benefits than VHTR in terms of performance , sustainability and cost .
Performance
VHTR is a high performance reactor which uses helium to cool the heating components during operation .
VHTR uses a mixed fuel composition to operate and this composition can produce improvement in fuel performance thus making it a very effective reactor in generating electricity .
This composition is a mixture of 15% carbide and 85% oxide in the fissile particles .
GCFR is a concept which uses the reference design of VHTR , thus it is also a reactor of high performance .
Since GCFR operates at 850 degrees Celsius , therefore there are more choices of materials that can be used in the construction of GCFR .
Because GCFR operates at a lower temperature as compare to the VTHR , therefore the materials used for construction is cheaper and there are more choices of material available .
Sustainability
GCFR is an excellent choice in terms of sustainability because it is capable in minimizing radioactive waste more effectively as compared to the VHTR .
The nuclear waste of the GCFR is able to be put back into the process multiple times , and this reduces the nuclear waste produced .
The reduction of radioactive waste uses processes called pryo-chemical or hydrometallurgical .
With this there is a great reduction of nuclear waste , and money can be saved on building a storage site for nuclear waste .
Therefore , GCFR not only can have efficient energy conversion with the current design but also has an economic benefit outcome . 
Cost
The cost for building a VHTR prototype would cost US $1 .1 billion .
However for GCFR , the total ten year budget of GCFR is US $940 million and it includes the cost from planning to completion of the reactor .
However this is shared by all eight Generation IV International Forum members .
Therefore the annual budget for each country is US $7-8 million .
In this budget , the required sum of construction cost is US $300 million . 
Conclusion
Nowadays , since the fossil fuel is running out at a very high rate , people are seeking another alternative energy resource to replace the traditional fossil fuel resources , which have been used by human for hundreds of years .
One of the alternatives is nuclear power .
However , public is very concern about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Actually , with the improvement of technology , the generation IV reactors are safe enough .
Moreover , these generation IV reactors are also very economic and promising .
Amongst these generation IV reactor concepts , I think the lead-cooled fast reactor is very competent and should get further research and development funding .
With regard to safety , people are usually afraid of the accident caused by the nuclear reactors .
This is because that once a nuclear reactor accident happened , it would be a huge disaster to both the creatures and the environment within that area .
A very famous accident , which is also used by public to oppose building nuclear reactors , is the accident at Chernobyl which happened on 26 April 1986 .
As a result of this accident , 28 people were killed either immediately or within a few years , and 17 more died during the next ten years .
Moreover , according to the estimation , there would be thousands of people dead from cancer in the next forty years .
Another famous example is the accident happening at the nuclear power station at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania on 28 March 1979 .
Although at Three Mile Island the discharge of radioactive material was too small to cause any harm , it still caused a great public reaction  .
But for Lead-cooled fast reactors , people do not need to worry much about safety .
The temperature needed to operate lead-cooled fast reactors is about five hundred and fifty to eight hundred , which is relatively higher than today's light-water reactors and can avoid the risk of coolant boiling , and the pressure is rather low  .
More importantly , unlike some other materials like sodium , lead does not react with either water or air .
These features give lead-cooled fast reactors a significant safety advantage .
Furthermore , as the technology has improved so much , even an accident happens , the damage is probably not that big .
For example , in the Three Mile Island accident , nobody was either dead or injured .
All radioactivity was contained as designed .
Therefore , lead-cooled fast reactors are very competent in this aspect of safety .
Tucek , K . , Carlsson , J . , Wider , H .  .
Comparison of sodium and lead-cooled fast reactors regarding server safety and economical issues .
13th International Conference on Nuclear Engineering
Besides safety , economy is also a very important aspect which people should take into consideration .
At present , to build a nuclear reactor is still costly .
According to a study conducted by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology  , even reducing completion time to just four or five years , and lowering construction costs by a quarter , would still not put the nuclear plants in contention with coal , and would just barely match the price performance of a combined-cycled natural gas-powered plant  .
However , since we can eliminate the need for an intermediate heat transport circuit in lead-cooled fast reactors , and lead is relatively cheap comparing with other materials used in other fast reactors , a large part of cost would be saved through this .
In addition , the high temperature of the lead-cooled fast reactors can also be used for thermochemical hydrogen production , which would contribute to reducing the cost as well .
According to Weaver  , the lead-cooled fast reactor has a fifteen to thirty years' core lifetime .
That is quite long .
And furthermore , the earliest delivery time for lead-cooled fast reactors is 2025  , which is not far away from now .
And because of its safe and economic property , we can certainly expect a good performance from lead-cooled fast reactors .
In conclusion , with the improvement of technology , nuclear power is becoming a very reasonable alternative for us human beings to choose to replace today's fossil energy resource .
Furthermore , the lead-cooled fast reactor is competent to get further research and development funding , because it is both safe and economic .
The prospective of lead-cooled fast reactor is very promising .
