In a modern society , engineering design products are everywhere around us .
I t is true that those products provide us with much convenience however , at the same time , there are also chances that it brings some dangers as side effects .
Chernobyl explosion is one example showing the seriousness of those dangers .
Chernobyl accident , happened in 1986 , was a nuclear reactor accident .
The explosion finally led to the evacuation and resettlement of over 336 ,000 people .
CITATION Int08 \l 2052 Because of that , the safety of engineering design is very important .
We must have some gatekeepers to protect us .
In current stage , most design team uses the safety laws and rules as their gatekeeper and thinks that is enough .
However , some psychologists argues that those rules are not enough as all the procedures are carried out by human , there is possibility that a human error may occur .
Therefore psychologists are necessary to be involved in the design process to detect the human error and to be the new gate keeper of engineering design .
In my opinion , with a psychologist involved in the design process , possibility of future failure or even disaster can be reduced though may be at a higher cost .
Chernobyl accident can be a good example to see how the use of psychology helps to prevent the accident .
Last of all , designers , especially the group leaders may worry about the cost of employing psychologists in their teams .
However , considering the serious results of Chernobyl accidents and other engineering accidents , such wondering is of no point .
After all , the lives have no price .
And by decreasing the accident and failure rate of the products of one design group , they will earn more chances and reputation .
Such results will lead to more profits .
In conclusion , psychologists may become new gatekeepers of engineering design process by helping correct the human error in design process and increase the team efficiency .
Together with the present rules and laws of safety design , the presence of psychologists decreases the chance of having future failure and accidents .
And the increasing safety will make people enjoy the benefits of engineering design products much better .
As design is defined to be a human activity which aims at altering products' properties or functionalities so as to meet social expectation  , there have been controversies on whether psychology should be considered as an influential factor in the design process or not .
Some insist that insights can be gained when analyzing design process using psychological approach .
However , there are also voices arguing that most of product or system designs are merely driven by technology  .
Both sides of evidences taken into consideration , psychology should be considered as an important factor that is influencing design due to its crucial role in facilitating interactions of social and technological factors , analyzing human expectations as well as planning work process of design .
First of all , psychology serves as the crucial connection between social and technological factors .
Design itself is to combine human expectations and standards with technical specializations .
No matter what the designers are to work on , complex systems or everyday products , psychology is helpful to gain insights of problems that may be encountered or prevent undesirable accidents .
For everyday products design , it is quite understandable that if the technical configurations are similar for all , psychology could help designers make a difference by humanly consider making improvements that are more user-friendly in design .
More impactful consequences of not applying psychology in design are that serious failures can happen in complex projects and systems hence cause loss of life .
For instance , the collapse of Nicall Highway , two stretches of highway road linked by Merdeka Bridge , located in the Central Region of Singapore  , could have been prevented if psychological approach were adopted in the design and construction process .
Finally , another deeper understanding of the importance of psychology in design process can be gained from the Nicoll Highway tragedy .
When some were arguing for objective difficulties in technology , it was admitted by the main contractor that major cause is the overload temporary works and their low quality  .
The contractor admitted that they had foreseen the potential problems that might be caused due to overloading temporary work and their reckless plan , but they somehow still did not pay enough attention and continued with it .
It consequently led to lack of time for examining everything with enough caution and designers even misinterpreted building codes in such a rush .
If it were not for the inappropriate workload distributed and carelessness misinterpretation of building code by design engineers , such failures could have been avoided .
In conclusion , psychology plays a significant role in the design process , as it serves as essential connections between social and technological factors , influences and reflects social expectations , it can be applied to avoid technical errors and failures in complex systems and be used to optimize design plan .
Applying a psychology approach when analyzing or planning a design is crucial and beneficial to ensure safety as well as quality .
It is known that global warming and rising energy consumption are the major challenges for people to solve in the near future .
In order to resolve such problems , a few nuclear reactors have been built in the past decades .
As it is not sufficient to provide energy power and not environmentally friendly , a new set of theoretical nuclear reactor designs are currently being researched to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Research into these reactor types was officially started based on several initial goals .
The primary goals being to improve nuclear safety , efficient thermal performance , reducing cost .
Many reactors are considered to design to meet the generation IV goals today .
Two of the generation IV reactors called Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor and Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor are highly appreciated and accepted in modern nuclear power plant system .
In terms of performance , security , cost , both of two reactors are well designed .
However , to compare the two fast reactors specifically , it is better to choose Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor as the new reactor to meet the generation IV nuclear plan instead of Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor .
To begin with , truly speaking , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has high thermal efficiency which converts the raw material to the power energy with range from 39% to 47% .
Comparing with the Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has the thermal efficiency about 48% , which is generally higher than sodium-cooled fast reactor .
In addition , under the high performance , both of two reactors need to work under high temperature .
Specifically , for Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor , the temperature is about 550 while the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is about 850 .
Hence , from general chemical knowledge , it is more convenient and efficient to convert energy under higher temperature .
In thermal performance , both of two reactors have quite nice feature especially for energy conversion Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor may have additional advantages .
Secondly , it is appreciated that Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor has some safety features .
It includes a long thermal response time which is a large margin to cool boiling .
Then , it is a primary system that operated near atmospheric pressure .
Meanwhile , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor is based on safety countermeasures for self-controlled shutdown function and controlling function .
For Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor , it not only includes basic self safety control function but also many safety approaches are applied to the system to make it work safely under high temperature with additional safety devices being added to the equipment .
Recent research and development with depth studies for safety case , the Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor system has been demonstrated experimentally in security aspect .
Hence , it is safer when works properly .
Furthermore , in terms of cost , Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor enhanced economics achieved with the use of high burn-up fuels , fuel cycle benefits .
It uses advanced materials and innovative design options to reduce in power plant capital cost and lower operating cost .
However , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor is also well designed especially for waste recycling GFR tries to minimize the release of gaseous and liquid effluents to environment .
It takes into account that the management of waste from equipment is also important .
GFR system is designed to allow for self-treatment by applying fuel manufacturing operations .
In addition , GFR can direct energy conversion .
Hence , it makes best use of energy and reduces the entire cost . 
In conclusion , both of Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor and Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor achieve generation IV primary goal to satisfy the requirement of energy .
Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor works with quite good thermal efficiency under a lower temperature when compares to Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor .
Moreover , it is designed well in safety case and cost aspect .
Similarly , GFR system offers significant potential to advance generation IV sustainability goals through its thermal efficiency , direct energy conversion , safety arrangement and proper cost .
Over all , Gas-Cooled Fast Reactor has advantages over Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor with respect to thermal efficiency , security case and cost .
According to Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary , the word "accident" means something bad which happens that is not expected or intended , and which often damages something or injures someone .
Accidents are indeed unpredictable , but are they really unpreventable ?
Let us have a quick scan through one of the world's deadliest high-speed train accident- the Eschede train disaster , which hit a death toll of 101 .
Post accident investigation has shown that the main factors that contribute to this severe train accident are the wheel design of the train , maintenance of the train , and failure to stop the train .
Could this accident have probably been prevented if the usage of psychology as proposed by Bernhard Wilpert in "Psychology and design processes" is being applied ?
Besides that , it is found that accidents are usually caused by chain reactions of a series of factors according to Heinrich Domino theory .
Since human problems are inevitably a large portion in this chain reactions , the removal of the human factors will undoubtedly , prevent or reduce accidents .
In the case of Eschede train accident for instance , if the wheel of the train was designed in a better way or well maintained , or if the train could be stopped at the right moment before the crash , the accident could probably be avoided .
But on the other hand , not all factors are within the control of human's capability .
Unfavorable environment and natural disaster are the best examples .
Bad weather conditions , earthquake , and et cetera are all hard to be predicted .
To control them is even more ridiculous and impossible .
Therefore most people think that accidents are unavoidable .
It is quite true that these factors are beyond human's control but we do not have to prevent them from happening .
All we have to do is taking all the necessary steps and precautionary methods to prevent these "uncontrollable" from triggering an accident .
All these steps are to be done during the designing stage , which means that the psychology approach will play an important role .
As mentioned in the very first paragraph , accident is usually unexpected .
Despite its unexpectedness , signs or symptoms will always come first no matter how small or unnoticeable they might be .
Moments before the accident of Eschede happened , one of the passengers on the train had noticed that the tire on a wheel broke and peeled away from the wheel , punctured the floor of the train .
He informed the conductor about what he saw but the conductor insisted to further investigate the incident and thus refused to pull the emergency brake .
Psychologically , the conductor did not want to be involved with any troubles because pulling the emergency brake would definitely cause much hassles .
If he chose to give safety the most priority , he would have pulled the emergency brake and the accident could probably be prevented .
However , when things come to emergency , the most important thing is often the individual ability to react rationally to resolve the problem .
How many people could possibly remain calm when facing a sudden emergency ?
However , this ability can be gained through intensive training .
Practice makes perfect .
The more one gets trained , the more readily he is to face an emergency .
Concisely , the approach of psychological knowledge can prevent or at least reduce the probability of accidents occurring .
Studies of human behavior , stages of an accident , investigation on industrial accident , together with some necessary and suitable psychological approach would definitely help in minimizing the occurring of severe accidents , especially those that are due to errors in human judgments .
The drastic industrial development and advancement in science and technology has led to the rising energy demand nowadays .
Searching for alternative energy sources becomes the main effort of the whole world , especially those industry-developed countries due to the dwindling energy supplies from coal and fuel .
The past few years have seen repeated calls from some of the world leaders to introduce nuclear energy as an alternative energy source to replace fuel and coal in the near future .
Generally , nuclear energy is generated through the process of nuclear fission and nuclear fusion of radioactive elements .
The energy loss in this process is dissipated in the form of heat , where it can be used to generate power and electricity .
The invention of Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor is one of the latest Generation VI nuclear reactors that have high potential to replace the coal and fuel as energy source .
Nonetheless , debate on the using of this nuclear reactor becomes a hot issue today due to the negative effects that would be brought to human as well as other living organisms on the earth .
On the whole , further research and development funding for SWCR should be provided as all these weaknesses of nuclear reactors can be overcome via evidences and discoveries from the research done .
In conclusion , despite the evident harm nuclear power can cause , we should not immediately rule it out as a possible source of power in the future .
Further researches have shown that Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor can achieve great safety by its design modification , lower and reasonable cost of its construction and power generation and has high efficiency in terms of electricity and power generation .
Therefore , further research and development funding for Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor should be provided as it stands in a good stead to become the future's power generator in the near future .
I agreed that the high cost , the safety issue of nuclear power reactor and problems of wastes recycling .
However , the generation IV reactor the supercritical-water-cooled-reactor will solve these problems straightforwardly .
For first aspect , SCWR is still facing the financial problem .
To build a nuclear reactor and its prototype will cost over US$1 billion .
If the government use this money to build more fossil reactors , the increasing fossil reactors plants will help the situation of lack of energy .
However , in a long term , nuclear reactor plants will reduce the cost compared with fossil reactor plants .
It is true that the initial cost of building fossil plant is low , but the long-term costs which keeping it work are high says PBMR Company international marketing manager Gert Claassen .
Furthermore , the SCWR reactor efficiency and relatively simple design , it would be cheaper to build and run than normal reactors .
Therefore , the cost is not a problem for SCWR .
The second aspect , it is too difficult to find an appropriate coolant for nuclear reactor .
However , the coolant of SCWR is supercritical water .
Normally , the critical point of water is the point at which the water exists as a combination of the liquid phase and vapour phase .
The condition of this point is at temperature of 374centidegrees and a pressure of 22 .1Mpa .
However , for the supercritical water , the critical point is much higher than the normal water .
It is about 510centidegrees at 25Mpa .
Therefore , the coolant can sustain under the high temperature and do not have any phase change .
Thus , it can produce a great amount of energy .
For that reason , to find a suitable coolant will not be a problem because there is no difficulty to find water in earth .
The third part , people are worrying about the waste of nuclear power , because the waste of reactor is radioactive normally .
If we are not able to handle the wastes well , the nuclear pollution will trigger the catastrophe .
Nevertheless , SCWR could work out this problem .
The coolant for SCWR is supercritical water and the waste of water is still water as well .
Therefore , this waste are not radioactive and it is much safer compared with the wastes of last generation of reactor .
Moreover , SCWR build a system for water purification through supercritical oxidation .
This system is to convert the waste water into potable water .
Then the reactor can reuse this water as coolant again .
To sum up , the supercritical-water-cooled reactors solve general problems which the normal nuclear power reactors have .
Therefore , the SCWR is feasibility and reliable .
The SCWR 's revival would benefit the whole population .
For pubic , the problem of global warming and other environmental problem made by emissions of fossil fuel will be eliminated .
For political , the nuclear power will maintain their energy source independence and reduce the conflicts of energy possessing .
To engineers and scientists , the applications of nuclear reactors would encourage them to find more efficient way to generate energy from reactors and the improve the safety of reactor in case of some accidents happened .
Generally speaking , the nuclear power will be the fuel for the future .
People will obtain safer cleaner and cheaper energy generated by nuclear power reactor .
We are now marching into a new era of nuclear age .
Generation IV of nuclear power is now undergoing development and research .
Very-high-temperature Reactor which is operated by open fuel cycle is one of the six concepts of Generation IV reactors .
It has an operating temperature of 1000 C and uses high pressure during reaction stages .
VHTR is one of the best substitutions for coal plants from a science perspective as it does not pollute the earth and it does not need to use as much fuel as other forms of energy .
The question of whether we should have nuclear power plant as an energy resource is controversial .
People stand against it as they have little idea about the nuclear power plant .
Cost , safety and performance are three major aspects for opposition to this technology nevertheless , there is still an unyielding need to support further research and development funding for VHTR .
People believe that it would be costly to start up a new nuclear industry .
It is true though .
According to Mansilla maximizing the system efficiency does not guarantee a minimum cost .
Still , in point of fact , nuclear power plant can reduce the expenditure in producing more energy in the long run .
Comparing with conventional plants , VHTR can bring out 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel .
Since that VHTR uses lower amount of fuel to produce higher amount of energy , it is much more economic than other power plants regardless the start up cost , as the start-up cost can be compensated in the long run .
Needs for energy are neither going to decrease nor are sources of energy going to increase .
Therefore , when sources of conventional plants are severely depleted , its cost will soar up high and become uneconomical on the other hand , VHTR uses half the amount of fuel to produce equal amount of energy , hence it can last longer .
Safety of a nuclear plant is the issue that public concerns the most .
The reactor core explosion at Chernobyl in Ukraine was a catastrophic failure .
It raised public's uncertainty about the safety of developing new nuclear power plant .
However , VHTR is being designed to avoid such circumstances .
VHTR is coated with a layer of graphite which can be used to slow down neutrons in order to control the nuclear chain reaction and it is covered with ultra hard ceramic layer .
Furthermore , it uses helium , an inert gas as coolant .
Therefore it can avoid any escape of radioactive material if an accident happens .
Moreover , a back-up emergency core cooling system is designed .
ECCS can remove excess heat and avoid damage to power plant in emergency cases , such as terrorism .
In addition , VHTR would be able to function without the need of reprocessing plutonium waste .
This would be able to prevent creation of nuclear power weapon as plutonium is an ingredient to produce advance nuclear weapon .
People assume that VHTR has lower performance compare to other kinds of Generation IV power sources .
According to research , VHTR is a thermal reactor which relies on moderators to slow down neutrons while Gas-cooled Fast Reactor , Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor and Lead-cooled Fast Reactor are relying on fast spectra .
This gives people a wrong assumption that VHTR is not highly performed .
However , the performance of reactors also depends on operating pressure and temperature .
Researchers anticipate that VHTR's cycle efficiency could reach above 50% while comparing to Molten Salt Reactor , for instance , which could only reach around 44% to 50% .
Furthermore , VHTR is designed to efficiently produce both electricity and hydrogen at the meantime .
In conclusion , the opposing reasons for not supporting further research and development for VHTR are arguable .
The initial cost for VHTR is high but it can be covered in the long run by its quantitative energy output .
Likewise , VHTR is being designed with adequate safety precautions to prevent the happening of tragedy .
It has better performance as well since it has high efficiency and both electricity and hydrogen as its reaction product .
Concepts of nuclear power plant in generation IV have shown substantial improvements in cost , safety and efficiency especially VHTR .
Consequently , more research and development funding should be subjected to VHTR .
As the society develops rapidly , the demand for energy also increase in tandem .
However , fossil fuel , our conventional source of energy , is nearly running out , which means we need to find alternative sources of energy .
As a result , nuclear power has received renewed interest after over 30 years when no new nuclear plants have been built .
In adoption of nuclear energy , we need to consider cost , efficiency and safety features .
In recent years , six generation IV reactor concepts have been developed , and in this essay , I will discuss the sodium-cooled fast reactors and very-high-temperature reactor  .
Some people say that the SFR is good , but evidence shows that the VHTR is better in terms of cost , efficiency and safety .
SFR is basically to use the sodium as coolant to produce nuclear energy .
On the other hand , very-high-temperature reactor is working under a very high temperature environment  .
On cost , building a SFR is estimated at US$ 610 million , while the VHTR would cost US$ 610 millionU .S .
Department Of Energy Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee2002 .
While , the initial cost of constructing the VHTR is higher than the SFR .
In terms of running cost , VHTR is a more cost-effective reactor than the SFR .
With a high efficiency in transferring heat into power , the VHTR costs only US$1 to produce 1 kilogram hydrogen , which is much lower than SFRU .S .
Department Of Energy Nuclear Energy Research Advisory Committee2002 .
Therefore , in a long run , the VHTR is more economical in producing a large amount of energy .
Very-High-Temperature-Gas-Cooled-Reactor-Systems  , retrieved at 20thOct .2009 , from http://www .docstoc .com/docs/11820746/Very-High-Temperature-Gas-Cooled-Reactor-Systems
Some people also say that the efficiency of the SFR is about fifty percent at a temperature of 500 centigrade degree .
It is higher than the VHTR which is about forty percent at 500 centigrade degree  .
However , it is not a fair comparison .
For the SFR 500 centigrade degree is the suitable working temperature , which means the maximum efficiency for it is fifty percent .
However , for VHTR , the suitable working temperature is about 1500 centigrade degree .
At such a temperature , the efficiency of the VHTR is about 65 percent , which is much higher than the SFR  .
Under the same standard , we can clearly see the efficiency of the VHTR is better .
To conclude , the initial cost of VHTR is higher , but in a long run its cost is much lower .
Besides that , its efficiency is much higher under its rated working temperature .
In addition , the coolant of the VHTR is much safer than the SFR .
By considering the cost , efficiency and safety factors , we can judge that the very high temperature is a better choice in a long run .

Do you want to make a guess of how much electric power is consumed every day ?
500 million kilowatt-hours ?
Two billion kilowatt-hours ?
No , the answer is more than 48 billion kilowatt-hours .
With the speeding development throughout the whole world , the raising energy needs becomes an unavoidable problem nowadays .
In order to satisfy the needs , the generation IV reactor concept is brought forward for further research and utilization of nuclear power , and the Very High Temperature Reactor  , which uses a graphite-moderated nuclear reactor with a once-through uranium fuel cycle under an outlet temperature of 1000 C , is one of such concepts .
However , even before VHTR has been made use of , the public start to debate whether this concept can do more good than harm .
Although quite a number of people have no faith in the concept and provide some reasons , there exist solid evidences to show VHTR is worth of developing and can benefit the society .
First of all , opponents of VHTR doubt whether it is cost-effective and achievable .
As they state , in order to generate as much electricity as it is expensed in the U .S . every day , almost 400 nuclear power plants should be constructed and utilized .
However , today only about 410 nuclear power plants are used in the world .
The great discrepancy as if draws the end of VHTR's development already .
In fact , this analysis is due to the mis-illustration .
One fact need to be clarified is that the opponents misuse the capacity of the conventional plants rather than that of VHTR .
Scientists suggest that the new generation reactor can squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuels compared with the conventional plants .
By applying this figure , the number of plants calculated by the opponents can significantly be minimized .
Moreover , the opponents misunderstood the distribution of electric power generation .
No matter how excellent one method is , the world's electric power generation can never simply depend on one method .
Instead , this should always be a combination of complex methods .
In that case , whether VHTR can fulfil one country or even the global needs of electricity is unnecessary to be concerned .
As long as the concept is feasible and is better than the old ones , VHTR deserves for further research and thus can bring more advantage to the society .
To sum up , the opponents' opinions to oppose VHTR are not valid .
It is cost-effective , feasible , and safe .
In that case , we can safely draw the conclusion that VHTR is worth of further research and development .
We have confidence that it can bring great advantage to the world when technology is mature .
July 17 , 1981 in Kansas City , Missouri , United States , while dozens of people was gathering on the walkway in Hyatt Regency Crown Centre and seeing a dance contest , the walkway collapsed and caused 114 people died and 200 injured .
After the accident investigated , the main cause of the accident was a significant change in the design of the walkway .
The original design by Jack D . Gillum was using a set of steel tie rod to suspend the two walkways to the ceiling , but the contractor proposed to use two separate tie rods: one collected one walkway to the ceiling , and the other connected the two walkways .
Jack D . Gillum and associates did not calculate the alternate plan before they assigned on the paper .
Thus the accident happened . 
Psychology studies human mind and behavior .
Introducing psychology in the design process only makes a difference in human behavior , but many industrial accidents are not only caused by a single human error .
For example , the "Prestige" oil spilling was mainly caused by the rainstorm .
Prestige carried 77 ,000 tons of heavy fuel oil and was traveling on the sea near Spanish when it met rainstorm .
One of the 12 gasoline boxes exploded , but the Spanish Authorities refused the tanker to anchor in their bay .
Finally the tanker sank and spilled the oil  .
Many other industrial systems are much more complex and many factors can influence the system .
Psychology only can deal with human error , not other factors .
Improvement of communication , teaching of social and human relation skills and methods of dealing with problems are applications of psychology .
So the use of psychology during the design process can prevent some accidents .
It cannot prevent all the accidents , as accidents are not only caused by human errors and as for some new designs , they must be tried to see where will the problems happened .

On January 28th , 1986 , the US Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 73 seconds after launch , killing the entire crew .
This is a disaster in human history and is a tragedy of NASA .
The cause of the disaster was reported as the failure of an "O-ring" seal in the solid-fuel rocket on the Space Shuttle Challenger's right side .
However , this is not the only factor resulting in the tragedy .
The report also said that the officials of NASA ignored the concerns voiced by engineers and insisted launching the shuttle at risk .
In other words , not only the technical factors , but also the human factors caused this disaster to appear .
Therefore , psychology in design processes , in my opinion , could have prevented this accident .
Firstly , good preparation of psychology in design processes could have saved the Space Shuttle Challenger .
Actually , from the time it was first scheduled to lift off on January 22nd , to the when it was finally launched on January 28th , liftoff was delayed several times for various reasons .
Obviously , the preparation for this project was not good at all .
Arguers may say that no matter how good the preparation was , there were still some unpredictable factors that might lead the mission to failure .
Well , it is true that the errors cannot be prevented completely nevertheless , we should try our best to reduce the risk to the least level that we can accept .
Apparently , the condition of Challenger was not what we can accept as safe .
Furthermore , if the preparation was well done and the "O-ring" problem was fixed during the process , Challenger could have been saved .
Secondly , should the decision-making system be made better , the tragedy could have been avoided .
Faced with the choice of whether to put off the mission for safety or to carry on the mission at risk to save money , the officials chose the latter one , which was a big mistake .
Furthermore , they also had policy failure on competitive bidding for manufacturing company and defects of supervision system .
All these factors contributed to the unreliability of the safety of the mission .
Although NASA have to face the pressure from the public and the political , they should aware the consequences of the failure , which might make the situation even worse .
If the highest levels of NASA had made the decision more objectively and scientifically with the help of psychology in design , putting the mission off like before , the disaster could have been prevented .
As discussed above , the Challenger disaster's causes lie not only on the technical factors , but also on the human factors .
In my opinion , the root cause is the human factor , the wrong decision made by the officials .
Though it was indirect cause , its influence is so large that it was more important than the technical factor .
Psychology in design processes , whose significance has been showed in this accident , should be paid more attention to in the future engineering design .
Only in this way , can the safety of projects be improved efficiently and guaranteed .
There has been a debate between two Generation Four reactorsthe Very High Temperature Reactor and the Supercritical Water Reactor  , which surrounds the issue of which reactor had superior performance .
In one hand , engineers use the most advanced technology and concept to design the VHTR .
On the other hand , the technology applied on the SCWR is developed from conventional technology of older type of nuclear reactorLight Water Reactor  .
The supporters of VHTR attack SCWR for its "obsolete" technology and its incapability of generating Hydrogen as a coproduct of electrcity .
Nevertheless , I believe the most practical thing ends up being the most useful thing .
In my opinion , the SCWR outmatches the VHTR at both performace and cost .
When people are comparing the two types of reactors , they tend to focus on the temperature at which reactors operates .
Then , they discover that the VHTR is operating at a temperature level which is almost twice as that of the SCWR .
As a result , a misleading conception arises , which is the VHTR works much more efficiently than the SCWR does .
Indeed , temperature is an indicator of how efficient the reactor is .
However , it is by no means the only indicator .
According to Prof Mirko Ascic's scientific journal  , the energy of neutrons in the reactor is the dominant factor that affects the process of converting heat to electricity .
The fact is the SCWR has about four times as many neutrons in the energy range above 6 .2 MeV and about 16 times as many neutrons below 0 .1 eV .
These two energy states of neutrons are closely related the fission of two fuels , U235 and Np237 .
As a result , The SCWR has a higher performace up to 4 percent compared to the VHTR .
For people who are obssesed with the VHTR , one main reason would be it allows an easy way to generate a clean natural energyHydrogen .
It is unnecessary to describe how huge the amount of fossil fuel the world consumes everyday and the influence of burning the fuel on the whole environment .
Scientists have been searching the most suitable and the most economical surrogate for fossil fuel for decades .
And reactors with super-high operating temperature seems to be the ultimate answer .
However , in my opinion , reactors that can generate Hydrogen are just "gimmicks" .
After all , electricity is also a perfect energy which has no side-effect on the environment .
Furthermore , unlike technology of using Hydrogen , which has just begun developing and is far from matured , electricity has been with human beings for over a hundred years .
The technology of electricity can be found everywhere on Earth and big automobile manufacturers have started to discuss the possibility of replacing fossil-fuel-powered cars with electricity-powered ones .
Thus , the critical question arises .
How to produce electricity economically ?
In my opinion , the SCWR is the answer .
The SCWR is built for generation of low-cost electricity .
In addition , the two technologies needed build the SCWR are already at hand , which are widely-employed to by current Generatioon Three LWRs .
Unlike the VHTR which uses rare gas Helium as coolant , the SCWR simply uses water to cool down the system .
As a result , the SCWR costs much smaller amount of money to build and greatly simplifies the nuclear plant .
In conclusion , the most advanced stuff may not be suitable in a certain condition .
The SCWR has proven itself to be more capable at either high performance and low cost .
In this sense , the SCWR is a better nuclear reactor compared to the VHTR in our future .
By the year 2030 , many of the current operating nuclear power plants in the world will be at or near the end of their operating licenses .
Therefore , research and development of Generation IV technologies are being conducted by participating countries in the Generation IV International Forum .
Some of the developing concepts include the "Very-high-temperature" and "Molten salt" nuclear reactors .
Competitive costs and financial risks of nuclear energy systems are constantly compared .
In the case of the Very-high-temperature reactors , the cost of running the plant is lower when compared to Molten salt reactors .
The efficiency of the VHTR is also >50% as compared to conventional reactors .
VHTR produces hydrogen as a byproduct , thus increasing the chances of utilizing the reactors for other energy sources .
VHTR's technology is based on an upgrade to current HTR technologies .
Therefore , the estimated time to receive the technologies will be earlier when compared to MSR .
MSR's research requires scientists to work on new materials which can withstand the usage of molten fluoride salts .
On the other hand , VHTR's research had been mapped into proper stages and there is a large pool of researchers working on it .
, the time span needed to reach optimum standards will be later than VHTR , thus putting VHTR ahead in the economy race .
Safety issues involved in generation IV reactors are mainly on temperature and chemical reactions during high pressure operations .
As the generators are designed to operate at temperatures up to 1000 Degree Celsius , prevention of a reactor meltdown would be important as a repeat of the Chernobyl disaster during the year 1986 would not be acceptable .
This is especially for VHTRs as they operate at temperatures up to 1200 Degrees Celsius as compared to the lower pressured MSRs .
There is no doubt that the world is moving towards nuclear energy development in the future 20 years from now .
The current rat race to develop the best reactor for use is still questionable as all the reactors have their own strengths and weaknesses .
However , with the current VHTR's achievable research goals , it will probably be the generation IV reactor to lead the pack in years to come .
At the turn of the millennium , the rising of Asian countries such as China and India has intensified the competition of energy .
In 2007 , China consumes a third as much oil as the United States , which burns a quarter of the world's oil every day .
By 2030 , China and India together will import as much oil as the United States and Japan do today .
In addition , there are concerns about the impact on global warming due to fossil fuel power plants .
Fossil energy use is responsible for about 85% of the human-caused carbon dioxide emission produced annually .
Hence , fossil fuels are not a viable means to meet the increasing demand of energy .
Thus , other reliable means of energy have been considered , of which , nuclear energy holds the greatest potential .
Using nuclear processes to produce energy is not a new concept .
Since the first power reactor was built in the Soviet Union in 1954 , there are 436 nuclear power plants in operation at present .
Meanwhile , nuclear power has not risen to be a top choice because of worries about leakages of radioactive substances from the plants .
For example , the explosion of reactor 4 in the Chernobyl power plant resulted in 237 deaths due to radiation .
In another accident in the Three Mile Island in the US , 140 thousand people living within a five mile radius of the plant evacuated after the meltdown of a cooling system .
Moreover , in this post 911 era , many worry about nuclear power plants becoming the terrorists' targets .
Acknowledging the need of nuclear power to meet the world's energy appetite , several countries have formed the Generation IV International Forum to research on the possible nuclear technologies and to mitigate the risks posed by them .
Two of the six short listed systems are the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor and Super Critical Water Reactor  .
Both of these systems , especially the Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor , promises higher efficiency , lower operational cost and enhanced safety measures over current generation of reactors .
In the SCWR , liquid water , which is used as coolant for the 650oC reactor core , is pressurized to 2500 times the atmospheric pressure , to the supercritical state .
Firstly , at this high pressure , water has a larger range of operating temperature .
Thus , the reactor can function safely within a greater range of temperature .
Secondly , supercritical water also has the highest heat capacity .
This means that water can absorb a higher amount of energy for the same volume of water , thus having a better rate of heat transfer compared to the current generation of reactors such as Boiling Water Reactors and Pressurised Water Reactor  .
Better heat transfer also allows the coolant to have a slower flow rate of the coolant , thus saving cost by using of smaller pumps and piping .
Thirdly , water does not change phase within the coolant cycle due to its increased boiling point .
This would allow the coolant to have a laminar flow , increasing the efficiency of the coolant .
Hence , the plant would have 45% thermal cycle efficiency .

On the other hand , SFR uses molten sodium as a coolant for the 510oC reactor core .
As compared with the SCWR , the sodium can be kept at normal atmospheric pressure .
This eliminates the problems arising from having to maintain a pressurized coolant .
Also , the reactor core is at a lower temperature , thus relatively easier to manage .
Hence , these results in a comparable 45% thermal efficiency , in spite being a newer technology compared to water .
Finally , they are highly sustainable due to their closed loop cycle , having an added advantage of actinide management and fuel consumption of 99% .
Moving on to the cost , SCWR do offer much savings .
As it is developed based on current reactors , such as Boiling Water Reactors  , a lot of research could be done on existing facilities .
For example , research focusing on accident management could be done at some of the out of commission facilities , without building up a prototype from ground .
Also , research on water chemistry that was done for BWR could be capitalised for SCWR .
Consequently , the research could be focus towards developing irradiation resistant materials to be used for the reactor .
Conversely , SFR also utilises expertises from existing reactors such as BOR-60 , JOYO , Phenix , and BN-600 in the US and Japan .
Like the SCWR , SFR would require several areas of research to make it suitable for development .
Researches into fuel cycle and physically stronger and more radiation resistant structural materials would minimise the operating costs with improved operations and performance .
Also , with support of countries such as Japan , France , and Russia , the cost of research is shared .
In fact , the SFR system is the most technology developed system of the 6 Generation IV systems .
Furthermore , it is estimated to be deployable by 2020 .
Regarding the safety aspects of the nuclear reactors , the GIF has set high targets for all reactors .
For the SCWR , the use of water at the supercritical state allows the coolant to be functional and effective at a right range of temperature .
The absence of a change in phase would also make the reactors safer to operate .
All this is possible with the highly pressurized water .
Meanwhile , SFR does not have the problems regarding maintaining the coolant at high pressure .
Instead , the challenge lies in keeping the sodium coolant from direct contact with air .
As sodium is highly reactive , it reacts violently with the air from the environment .
This difficulty is overcome by using a two-step cooling solution , whereby sodium is used to cool the core , and a secondary coolant , such as water , is used to cool the sodium .
Also , SFR has the added advantage of closed fuel cycle , which helps in the management of highly radioactive actinides .
This would prevent the proliferation of the nuclear waste .
Finally , nuclear-enriched materials being kept at high temperature would prevent them from being stolen and use as weapons by terrorists .
In conclusion , SFR stands as a more viable option to be the solution to the world's energy crisis .
Though the deployment cost is high at present , the burden will be shared by the many countries support the technology .
Also , the performance of SFR is ensured based on the findings of the various researches conducted .
Finally , well-planned safety measures and actinides management would ensure the SFR would function safely within its use .

Nuclear accidents like the Three Mile incident and the Chernobyl disaster left a bad aftertaste in the eyes of the public .
Furthermore , the constant threat of nuclear terrorists and the issue of radiation leakage made nuclear energy even more unpopular .
However , as mankind evolves , nuclear energy could possibly be making a comeback .
Facing the issues of rising oil prices and the long term availability of fossil fuels , governments now are rethinking their national energy strategies .
One of these strategies is harnessing nuclear energy .
Going nuclear would provide the growing economies with a constant and steady supply of energy to sustain their economic development .
Furthermore , it also addresses the issue on global warming as it does not produce greenhouse emissions which could further aggravate the situation .
Though the public may be concerned about the safety of operating a nuclear plant , we should continue to develop nuclear energy as its economic and environmental benefits outweighs its risks .
One potential reactor concept that we should look at would be the Very-high-temperature reactors  , as it addresses the concern over uranium reprocessing and the impact of a nuclear accident .
Furthermore , it gives significant economic and environmental advantages as it is more energy efficient and it also produces hydrogen which could be used for other purposes . 
One of the public's concerns over the safety of operating a nuclear plant is the issue of nuclear waste management .
Given the current controversy regarding Iran's uranium enrichment program , whereby the technology could be used to develop nuclear weapons , the public has the right to worry since there have not been much transparency from Iran .
This concern would be diffused if we are developing VHTR , since its design does not incorporate a waste recycling component hence there would not be a basis for any uranium enrichment program .
Therefore , there is no need to worry about the reprocessing of uranium for weapon proliferation .
Another concern on the safety aspect of nuclear plants is radiation leakage due to improper disposal or infrastructure failure which could be caused by a terrorist attack .
Radiation exposure is an inherent part of nuclear energy and some believe that living near a nuclear plant would increase the risk of cancer and that any nuclear accident would result in high casualties .
After the Chernobyl accident , many scientists predicted that the radiation exposure of that incident would have caused a million deaths hence causing panic and hysteria among the public which eventually made nuclear energy unpopular .
However , in 2005 , a report done by IAEA and the World Health Organization deduced that the incident caused 56 direct deaths and suggested that there may be 4 ,000 extra cancer deaths among the approximately 600 ,000 most highly exposed people which were significantly much lower than previously thought .
Therefore previous claims by scientist were over exaggerated and the public should be educated on the issue of radiation exposure so that they do not oppose the idea because of misinformation .
Furthermore , active safety measures were also put in place , checks for radiation leakage are done frequently by experts and nuclear plants are located at isolated places to minimize exposure .
They are also well guarded to deter any terrorist attacks .
To further put the public's mind at ease , the VHTR is also designed to automatically shut down in a case of an accident hence minimizing radiation leakage and foiling any terrorists' attacks .
Therefore this further enhances the safety aspect of running a nuclear plant and should adequately address the concerns of the public .
As the world copes with the rising cost of oil , governments are investing into different energy fields to diversify their energy sources so as to increase their countries' energy independence .
Some argue that we should not be investing into nuclear energy as it is expensive to build and run and that it is not a renewable energy source , hence we should invest into renewable energies which are more sustainable .
Though renewable energy may be sustainable , their energy supplies are intermittent depending on environmental factors .
Therefore , they are unable to meet the intense energy demand of our growing economies .
Nuclear plants are more expensive to build than the other energy sources , but it is a premium that we have to pay to obtain a reliable and consistent supply of energy to drive our economic progress .
Furthermore , the VHTR concept has a high fuel burn up ratio which translates to an efficiency of 80% which is significantly higher than renewable energies which have efficiencies of 20-30%  .
The VHTR also produces hydrogen which could be used as another source of fuel for power plants or could be sold to industries which use it , hence generates a source of revenue for the state .
It is also good that we diversify our energy sources to booster our energy security .
Hence we should continue to develop nuclear energy as it is a proven tool to obtain constant steady supply of energy .
Furthermore the high energy efficiency and potential uses of hydrogen , gives it more economic advantages over the renewable energies .
Another issue that nuclear energy would address is global warming .
As we know global warming is mainly caused by greenhouse emission from the burning of fossil fuels and its impacts include climate change and the flooding of low lying area hence jeopardizing the survival of our future generations .
Nuclear energy is 'clean' as it does not release any greenhouse emissions .
Furthermore , the ability of the VHTR to produce hydrogen provides another source of clean energy which we could utilize to power our economies and cars which are the main contributors of greenhouse emissions .
By reducing the carbon emissions from these two sources , we would be able to buy us more time to develop technologies to tackle the global warming issue therefore we should develop the VHTR to aid our cause .
The design of the VHTR has incorporated a lot of safety features which enhances the safety of operating a nuclear plant .
Coupled with that , the strict regulation of the IAEA and its frequent checks ensure that the infrastructure remains safe and intact hence safeguarding the interest of the public .
Furthermore , the high power efficiency of the VHTR makes it economical to operate and the production of hydrogen provide a source of revenue for the state as well as another alternative source of clean energy which reduces greenhouse emissions .
Since the VHTR is able to benefit us economically and environmentally , we should continue to develop it despite its risks .
Opponents said that it is safe to use the electric car on the road , as quoted from "Electro Automotive"  , they claimed that it's fully safe as the battery does not leak even if an accident occur .
However , the car is still not fully safe for operation .
The design has an overall light protection by the lightweight body frame .
The idea of using such is so that lesser battery power will be used to drive the vehicle , in order to travel longer distances , as compared to heavier frames .
Because of the nature of light weight , it will lead to one bigger safety issue , accident consequences .
Accidents can happen anytime , and hardly avoidable .
Roger mentioned that many mavens , known as car addicts , were worried that if an accident were to occur , especially with heavier vehicles , chances of the electric car being smashed is relatively high , the fact that current population of vehicles is still fuel driven .
This indicates danger to both driver and passengers .
One suggestion is to design better , stronger and safer materials for the frame of the electric car .
At a small cost of a slightly slower speed , accidents can be prevented and reduced if drivers practice safe and considerate driving .
Moreover , there is added protection with the stronger frame .

In recent years , despite the contentious debate of using nuclear power to meet our ever-increasing energy needs , the world starts to consider nuclear energy as a future fuel source which is believed to be a more environmentally friendly fuel as compared to fossil fuels .
Hence , late in 2002 , GIF announced the selection of six reactor technologies which they believe represent the future shape of nuclear energy .
These were selected on the basis of being clean , safe and cost-effective means of meeting increased energy demands on a sustainable basis , while being resistant to usage of materials for weapons proliferation and secure from terrorist attacks  .
In this essay , I would present my argument to support further research and development funding for the Very High Temperature Reactor as opposed to the Supercritical Water Reactor  , from the perspectives of security , performance and costs .
Firstly , proponents of SCWR claimed that the very high-temperature concept of VHTR reactor can be detrimental to safety if a loss-of-coolant accident occurs .
This means that if there is a break in the pipe , coolant will be lost and cause the reactor to heat up very quickly , resulting in the release of toxic gases and fission products into the environment .
However , this may be an unfounded concern in years to come when we consider the fact that the Korean and the US government have worked for the past three years on developing and validating advanced computational methods for simulating LOCA in a VHTR , in an attempt to prevent such an accident from happening  .
Cogeneration Technologies .

The safety characteristics of VHTR  .

Proponents of SCWR also claimed that VHTR produced high volume of nuclear waste which can be a potential source of nuclear weapons for the terrorists .
However , this claim may not be entirely valid because the waste produced , though in high volume , is considered low-level  .
The fuel pebbles used in VHTR are also very 'durable' in the sense that it is very difficult to extract the trapped fission products inside which rendered it a less favorable choice as a nuclear weapon .
There is also another design feature of VHTR that makes it a preferable choice of reactor over SCWR .
In contrast to SCWR which uses water both as the coolant and moderator  , VHTR uses helium and graphite as coolant and moderator respectively .
This means that if there is a leakage of water in SCWR , the plant will not be able to operate at all .
Next , VHTR has better performance than SCWR in three main aspects .
Firstly , in terms of burn-up rate of the fuel , for VHTR , it is possible to burn up to 65% of its initial fuel as compared to SCWR which is capable of only burn up to 45% of the initial fuel  .
Secondly , due to the high operating temperature of VHTR , the large amount of heat produced can be used for many purposes , ranging from providing domestic energy supplies and refining crude oil , to providing energy for hydrogen production .
This is unlike SCWR which can only produce electricity .
Hydrogen production , whereby the process is energy-intensive is important as hydrogen holds enormous promise as a power source for the future generation .
This is also one point that makes VHTR a more economical plant than SCWR .
Lastly , VHTR uses graphite as the moderator , which according to nuclear experts , is an excellent moderator as compared to water which is used in SCWR  .
VHTR also uses helium gas as the coolant which is an inert gas .
Hence , the plant can be operated at high temperature without having to worry about corrosion of the plant pipes .
This is different from SCWR which uses water as the coolant and hence there is a possibility of pipe's corrosion by water .
Lastly , proponents of SCWR claimed that the construction cost of VHTR plant is much higher than SCWR due to its high operating temperature .
This would not be a valid claim if we consider the fact that VHTR is built to operate at a long life span of 60 years which is much longer than that of VHTR .
Hence , this makes it justifiable to spend more money to build VHTR plant .
In conclusion , I would like to reiterate my stand that VHTR is a better reactor design than SCWR in terms of safety , performance and costs , and hence funding should be given to support the research and development of VHTR .

Nuclear technology has experienced several revolutions in the past fifty years .
The nuclear reactors currently in operation are Generation II and III reactors .
Generation II reactors were first developed in the 1950s , and were widely adopted in the following 40 years .
Generation III reactors , invented in the 1990s , are the most advanced in use nowadays  .
However , after the concept of Generation IV reactors were raised by GIF in 2001  , whether governments should solely focus on current nuclear reactors or split the funding for the new generation has become a controversy .
In my opinion , governments should fund the Gen IV reactors , as they possess remarkable advantages in terms of safety , performance and costs relative to the old designs .
Some people claim that Gen II and Gen III reactors are safe enough for operation .
Despite the accident in Chernobly , Ukraine , which was mainly caused by man-made operating errors  , no major accident occurred in the past two decades .
Compared with funding the Gen IV reactors , they think that governments should rather use the money to reinforce the safety of currently operating reactors .
However , malfunctions that had the risk of being disastrous happened from time to time .
For instance , in 2006 , part of the Forsmark-1 reactor in Sweden failed to start , almost resulting in a catastrophic meltdown .
A Belgian reactor experienced a similar problem in the preceding year  .
Such incidents imply that the potential risks of the Gen II and Gen III reactors cannot be ignored .
The Gen IV reactors can significantly change this risky situation .
Take the VHTR reactor as an example .
In this new design , the fuel pellets used in nuclear reaction are fused in graphite pebbles and coated with ceramic layers which effectively prevent the radioactive materials from leaking .
In other words , no radioactive damage will occur even if there is a meltdown  .
Therefore , the Gen IV reactors are more reliable than the previous generations .
In order to achieve safer operating environment , government should fund the development of the Gen IV .

Though the Generation II and III reactors have been maturely adopted in electricity generation , the drawbacks in their designs largely confine the potential power of nuclear energy .
In order to optimize its power to meet the increasing demand of electricity as well as to maintain long term sustainability , governments should fund the Generation IV reactors instead of the old generations .

In the 21st century , one of mankind's most pressing problems is the energy crisis .
Fossil fuels , being non-renewable , are being exhausted at a rate faster than it can be replenished .
Hence , in order to solve the energy crisis we need to look for other sources of energy .
Nuclear power is one such example of an energy source .
It is deemed to be much cleaner , greener and more effective than traditional fossil fuels .
This essay will address some issues concerning nuclear generators and other opposing viewpoints .
The main focus will be on a particular Generation-IV reactor , namely the Very-High-Temperature Reactor  .
Nuclear power is an important source of energy for the future , hence more funding should be provided for research and development of nuclear reactors .

So , my stand as a reviewer is that Tata's Nano lacks safety .

A nuclear reactor is an apparatus that produces nuclear energy by performing nuclear reactions  .
The reactor has been invented because of the increasing demand for an alternative source of energy that can substitute crude oil .
Nuclear reactors can produce cleaner and higher energy than the crude oil .
However , there is always an intention of the public to reject using nuclear reactors .
The public is concerned about safety in the operation of nuclear reactors .
The disaster that happened at Chernobyl , Ukraine , in 1986 is one reason of the public's anxiety .
In the disaster , the nuclear reactor exploded and spread the radioactive debris across Europe .
As a result , thirty one people were killed in the disaster  .
Nonetheless , a VHTR  , which is one of the generation IV reactor concepts , has the technology to prevent the disaster by using helium as its coolant and by producing waste with low radioactivity .
The VHTR also can produce both electricity and hydrogen with a very efficient process , so the cost of running a VHTR will not be as high as other reactors in the long run .
Therefore , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
First of all , opponents argue that helium , which is used as a coolant in the VHTR , could explode because of the high operating temperature and pressure of the reactor .
This argument may arise because of the lack of knowledge about the helium .
Helium is , in fact , an inert gas .
Therefore , helium will not react with any material due to its stability  .
This is also why helium is widely used to fill blimps .
In addition , helium will not become radioactive as other coolants do when they are exposed to radioactive radiation .
Thus , helium is safe to use as a coolant in VHTR .
Thirdly , critics argue that the nuclear reactors are producing radioactive waste and this waste can harm the environment around the reactors .
It is true that the waste that contains high radioactive material , such as , plutonium , can affect the environment severely .
However , the waste of the VHTR is less radioactive than the other reactors .
The VHTR has high thermal efficiency and high fuel burn up .
This is why the concentration of the heavy metal radioactive matter in the VHTR waste is relatively low .
The waste of the VHTR will then go to a repository after being reprocessed and meeting the certain acceptance criteria  .
In addition , the operation of the VHTR does not depend on the plutonium reprocessing , which is a controversial issue  .
Thus , the VHTR waste is much safer than the existing nuclear reactors .
To conclude , in spite of claims that nuclear reactors are dangerous and costly , the VHTR with its improved design can overcome these issues .
The VHTR can produce electricity and hydrogen efficiently in a much safer way without producing hazardous waste .
Hence , the development of the VHTR should be supported .
Mention nuclear power and the general consensus are fear and rejection , and Chernobyl comes to their mind .
Dirty power , they will say , and it is not worth the risk , despite ironically being much cleaner and powerful than the current fossil fuel-guzzling power plants .
However with the formation of the Generation IV International Forum and its six new reactor designs , it is hoped that nuclear power can be tapped upon with full consent of the public .
These reactors , still in the designing and testing phase , excel in areas of sustainability , safety , economics and proliferation resistance  , all which is specially intended to address all issues and challenges that nuclear power faces in a world combating the production of greenhouse gases but in the safest possible way .
Elert  ,G . The Physics Fact Book Price of Liquid Helium 2007 {http://hypertextbook .com/facts/2007/NadyaDillon .shtml} Idaho National Laboratory - Nuclear Energy FY2005 Ten-Year Program Plan Appendix 4 .0 - LFR 2005 .: A4-3 - A4-17 {http://nuclear .inel .gov/deliverables/docs/appendix_4 .pdf}

Throughout the six new reactors , they mainly differ only in their choice of coolant used in the system .
VHTR , being a descendant of the Generation II gas-cooled reactor , uses helium gas .
While a tried-and-tested choice , it is puzzling as there are better coolants proposed among the new designs and yet not favoured .
Helium gas is abundant on the Sun's atmosphere but only at trace level in Earth's surface  .
Furthermore its common extraction is from fossil fuels , so one can imagine our source of helium when the oil wells eventually run dry .
In addition , helium is not the only coolant that is chemically inert with the fuel molten lead is another viable option and yet plentiful in the Earth's crust .
Last for but not least , gaseous coolants have low thermal transfer properties , hence requiring an intermediate heat exchange with a larger surface area  .
The system core temperatures of LFR can attain up to 500  , almost 50% lower than that of VHTR and present significant differences in the operations of the plants .
Even though thermal efficiency of LFR is lower , 43% compared to up to 50% for VHTR  , it is offset by offering a higher likelihood of reassurance to the public .
The use of low temperature means LFR can actually be built using the current technology , though some improvements may be needed .
Molten lead , compared to helium , is a superior and cheaper heat transfer medium and hence increasing the portability of the power plant by reducing the need for a large intermediate heat exchanger .

One of the reasons why Very High Temperature Reactor is better for funding is because of its safety factor .
Safety factor is heavily considered because if accident occurs at nuclear reactor sites , it can result in massive releases of radioactivity .
Therefore in this context , safety design in VHTR has been introduced to take care of all the uncertainties and accidents which might occur with the ultimate goal of protecting the environment and people from being exposed to radiological hazards of potential release from the nuclear power plants .
And it , by means , includes the development of passive heat removal systems , low power density and easily cool-able geometry .
Helium is used in the heat removal system as a coolant because it is an inert gas and it will not react chemically with any other material .
VHTR will also be equipped with graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations .
The graphite has tiny pellets of uranium fuel encased in it and they will absorb heat without failing and releasing radioactivity .
As VHTR would be expected to operate at a very high temperature , all these are essential to prevent the reactor from being over-heated .

How about the construction cost of the entire power plant which is still unknown yet ?

So , the process of handling the phase change of helium to another state is not needed and this kind of simplification can largely reduce the cost .
When the cost is reduced , cheaper electricity can be provided to public .
But in term of performance , VHTR is a more efficient concept compared to others in generation four nuclear reactor concepts .
Even though it might proved costly at the beginning but it pays off well as it produces both electricity and hydrogen fuel instead of electricity only .
High temperature processed in the reactor can be used as a condition to yield hydrogen from sulphur-iodine cycle , which is a series of thermo-chemical processes that will fail without sufficient source of heat .
Hydrogen fuel produced can be used in vehicle as its onboard fuel .
Also , as it is operating at higher temperature , it produces more electricity compared to the rest .
In conclusion , VHTR is a very promising energy system to provide us electricity and hydrogen cogeneration .
Current stage for VHTR development is just at the very beginning point .
There are enormous items left to do in order for this concept to success in future .
Therefore , more research and development should be carried out so that in future this concept can become the energy supply for everyone in this earth .

The Chernobyl nuclear accident , which occurred on 26 April 1986 , had resulted in massive radioactive fallout into the atmosphere that affected millions of people .
Because of the catastrophic effects of a nuclear accident , no nuclear reactor has been built since then .
However , as global warming is becoming a more pressing issue , we have now turned to nuclear reactor to provide us clean energy .
Here comes the question on which generation IV nuclear reactor we should choose .
Although some have chosen lead-cooled fast reactor over very-high-temperature reactor because of the various benefits LFR has over VHTR , there is some evidence that VHTR is much better than LFR .
Supporters of LFR claim that LFR is much safer than VHTR .
One of the main reasons on LFR being safer is LFR , which operates at around 550 degree Celsius , has a lower outlet temperature than VHTR , which operates at around 1000 degree Celsius  .
It is believed that the higher the temperature , the greater the risk of a nuclear meltdown .
However , VHTR is designed to work at such a high temperature .
In VHTR , its graphitic core structure , helium coolant , and coated fuel particles allow VHTR to withstand high temperatures  .
Thus , it is able to attain thermal stability .
In short , operating at 1000 degree Celsius is not much of a safety issue since VHTR is safe and reliable at high temperature .

In addition , in terms of the coolant used by the two reactors , VHTR is safer than LFR .
LFR uses lead as its coolant .
Lead is corrosive and may form polonium , which is a radioactive substance , when exposed to radioactivity  .
With the presence of the radioactive polonium and the corrosiveness of lead , it is not safe to use lead as a coolant .
On the other hand , VHTR uses helium , which is a chemically inert .
Thus , it reduces the safety hazards which can arise due to the corrosion and the irradiation of the coolant .
Supporters of LFR also maintain that LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
In terms of cost to build the reactor , LFR cost around US$700 million while VHTR cost around US$1 .1 billion  .
In addition , in term of the cost of coolant , lead cost around US$0 .24 per 100 grams while helium cost around US$5 .20 per 100 grams .
In terms of these two factors , LFR is much cheaper than VHTR .
However , there are other factors that will also affect the cost of operating the reactor , such as maintenance cost .
For instance , since VHTR is specially designed to operate under a very high temperature , it will produce hydrogen , which is a source of clean fuel .
With the economic production of hydrogen by thermochemical cycles , it can reduce the maintenance cost for operating the VHTR .
The final argument advanced by the supporters of LFR is LFR perform much better than VHTR .
Unlike VHTR , LFR will reprocess its nuclear waste .
Thus , LFR can use the nuclear reactant to its maximum before disposing it .
However , recycling of nuclear waste will result in the production of plutonium , which can be used as nuclear weapon  .
In fact , United State has refrained from reprocessing of nuclear waste .
Hence , recycling of nuclear waste is not safe in term of security .
In addition , VHTR is more efficient than LFR .
It is because the higher the outlet temperature , the greater is the efficiency of electrical generation .
As VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , there is an efficient conversion of energy from heat to electricity .
From data , for the same amount of fuel , VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity compared to conventional plants  .
Furthermore , VHTR produces hydrogen fuel that can be used to produce electrical energy .
VHTR generates electrical energy in two ways , from nuclear reactant directly and from hydrogen fuel .
In conclusion , VHTR is safe because it is designed to attained thermal stability and it uses inert coolant , which is helium .
In addition , it is cost effective because of its economic production of hydrogen .
Furthermore , it is also efficient because it is operating at a very high temperature .
Hence , it should be evident that VHTR works better than LFR in term of security , cost and performance .
Since VHTR is one of the better options among the generation IV nuclear reactors and it is feasible , we should invest and support in further research and development on VHTR .

Energy has always been considered as the national strategy by most countries .
No one can stand on its own without the support of some kind of energy .
Nowadays , we use fossil fuel in most cases , because it is convenience and has low cost of production .
But as the environment issues becomes a high-profile problems and under the situation that this kind of non-renewable resource will be ran out in the near future , people begin to seek some other methods that can support the world as before .
Nuclear energy is one of the most promising energies which can take the place of fossil fuel .
Nuclear is now widely used in many countries and plays a more and more important role in the 21th century .
Recently , according to survey nuclear power produces around 11% of the world's energy needs and could take more proportion in the future .
Another piece of inspirational news is that the Generation VI nuclear reactors will be used in practice in about 10 to 20 years .
This new reactors operating at high temperatures will do improve the efficiency and safety .
That's why US , France and China have already planed to build the plant in order to occupy the dominating position in this new area .
However , among the six types of new reactors the Very High Temperature Reactor is the most appropriate for us to realize actually .
It may become the next major energy .
The VHTR , just as it name implies , the temperature needed is as high as 1000 C . This reactor is a graphite-moderated , helium-cooled reactor with a once-through uranium fuel cycle .
VHTR can provide some outstanding features while the rests cannot , or VHTR is an extremely high efficiency reactor with a good security guarantee .
The VHTR system is highly ranked in efficiency not just because of its high nuclear production but also the large hydrogen production , and such kind of by product can also be used in many other industries .
The basic reason is that under such a high temperature , water can be electrolyzed smoothly , turning into hydrogen and oxygen .
For VHTR , water will be electrolyzed more fully compared with the other ones , so the hydrogen production is the largest .
Actually , according the report from DISCOVERY: VHTR plants could even produce hydrogen for fuel using high-temperature steam electrolysis , which breaks apart the bonds of water molecules this process is 50 percent more energy-efficient than existing hydrogen production methods .
In 2005 the Department of Energy authorized INL to build a VHTR plant .
The prototype should be completed sometime between 2018 and 2021 .
In addition , hydrogen is not the only by product , heat and electricity will also be generated during the nuclear processing .
The heat will be transferred to relevant nuclear reactions .
The electricity , of course , will be used as electric power , supplying to the society .
Base on the information form DISCOVER: The VHTR should produce electricity about 40 percent more efficiently than do most reactors in the United States .
Then we can conclude that actually the production of electricity is also very large indeed .
In term of safety , firstly , the design takes advantage of the inherent safety characteristics of a helium-cooled .
Helium should be very stable and inert even under high temperature condition , so this kind of inert gas can protect the system during the refrigeration processing .
Secondly , the graphite-moderated core with specific design optimizations can reduce the risk of using VHTR .
Numerous tests and calculations have shown that it is virtually impossible for the this kind of graphite become unstable , self-sustained combustion or incurring ignition will not happen during the process .
Thirdly , the VHTR has a safety characteristic of low decay heat .
That means low system pressure and low thermal energy will store in the core with low power density and easily cool geometry , then decay heat will be dissipated passively by conduction and radiation even under the most severe accident conditions .
So the damage of the decay heat will less serious .
The security of VHTR can be guaranteed , because of these three features that protect the system form collapsing .
