Generation four nuclear reactor plants went into development in hope of creating a new nuclear reactor plant that can replace the current old generation three reactor plants .
The new nuclear reactor maybe high in cost for research but it has better performance , safety and security factors than the old generator plants .
In this new development , experts have look into 6 new nuclear reactor plant concepts like molten salt reactor and Very High Temperature Reactor  .
MSR researchers did intensify research to ensure that it has superior safety standard and fuel cycle qualities than VHTR .
Therefore , the research in MSR cost about $1000 million as compared to VHTR's research which will cost at $670 million as quoted from the report on "a technology roadmap for generation IV Nuclear Energy system" .
The latter cost only 20% lesser than the former and the difference in money spend is used to build a generation 4 reactor's standards .
From the report , Researchers for MSR distributed a lot of funds in areas like safety , reactor system and fuel cycle as compared to fund distribution in these areas of research in VHTR .
The areas of safety and reactor systems will be covered later in this essay .
Fuel cycle in MSR needs to have more attention as compared to VHTR is because there is a need to ensure that molten salt which is mixed with the nuclear material will still be functional after many rounds of usage in the system .
The idea of MSR is that it will produce less waste and able to recycle it .
Therefore , the effort put into this area of research is to make MSR a cleaner nuclear reactor plant that does reduce , reuse and recycle its waste .
MSR works better than VHTR in various ways .
It has a 24/7 circulating molten salt fuel mixture in the whole system to generate energy for the masses .
The molten fluoride salts used in the system helps to lower the vapor pressure , thus , reduce stresses on vessel and piping .
As compared to VHTR , it uses helium cooling to transfer heat to electric energy .
This system generates high temperature of up to 1000 degree Celsius .
Therefore , when there is high temperature the pressure in the system will also increase .
A highly pressurized system is dangerous and need to consistently monitoring to ensure safe operation as stresses acting on the pipes and vessel can cause the system to explode .
When MSR is operating at high temperature of ranging eight hundred degree and above , it can produce another good energy source .
This energy source is hydrogen .
Hydrogen can be use to generate power for machines like hydrogen powered car which is clean for the environment .
In VHTR , in order to produce hydrogen for similar usage , it requires another indirect cycle that consists of a heat exchanger .
This will further complicate the VHTR system and additional cost is incurred .
The Fuel used in MSR can be recycled as mentioned earlier .
However , in the case of VHTR , the fuel used is a one through fuel cycle and therefore , it requires proper disposal .
Researchers have been looking into this area , to recycle VHTR fuel waste , so that it will be a clean nuclear reactor plant .
One of the reasons for development in Generation 4 nuclear reactor plants is due to security reason .
The waste products produced by the current old nuclear plants cannot be recycle and need to be disposed at wasteland .
These wastes are highly radioactive and suitable for making weapons of mass destruction .
If these wastes landed on the wrong hands like terrorists , the world will be in chaos as we live in fear of nuclear attacks by unknown enemies .
Wastes generated by these nuclear plants also bring problems to our future generations .
As these wastes take very long to degrade , the land that holds them will become a wasteland which is not suitable for agriculture , residential and commercial usages .
Therefore , the Generation 4 nuclear reactor plants like MSR , it recycle its waste products and does not need to dispose them .
However , in VHTR , as mentioned earlier , it produces wastes and researchers are trying to find solution to it .
In conclusion , even though MSR cost more to research than VHTR , its benefits outshine VHTR .
Its performance in low pressure quality can help to reduce stresses on equipment and lesser chances of industrial accident than a high pressure system which induce high stress to the equipments .
It is safer than VHTR as it has better safety standard .
Lastly , in the area of security , MSR will not create chances of producing waste that will land on the wrong hands like the terrorist as compared to VHTR which have to deal with secured and proper waste disposal .
There were always concerns about the safe operations of nuclear reactors by the public , opponents of the supporters of nuclear reactors claimed that public's irrational fears towards radiation .
I have chosen the Supercritical water-cooled reactor to support the argument for further research and development funding for the generation IV reactors .
We understand that there are many influential factors to support further research and development funding such as security , cost and performance in the newer generation of nuclear reactors , also known as "Generation IV" reactors .
One of the most important factors to support further research development funding is security .
The public often have doubts when it leads to security and safety issues on nuclear reactors .
However , the Supercritical water-cooled reactor is one of the safest reactors comparing to current generation II and III reactors .
The SCWR has safety measures such as physical resistance against terrorist attacks .
For example , possibilities of an air attack by terrorist do occur .
However , the penetration of the containment for nuclear elements is not possible .
If any events that lead to the occurrence of such possibilities , it would probably not reach the nuclear vessel  .
Ever since the Three Miles Island incident , many new safety regulations had been implemented and also in SCWR , emergency plans had been set up to prevent such things from happening again .
For instance , the Nuclear Regulatory Commission has set up a 10-mile Emergency Planning Zone to maintain warning zones and also set up sirens and conducted emergency evacuation exercises  .
Such plans are to assist in protecting people within the 10- mile radius .
In addition , cost is a major factor for all sectors including the private sector , the government and the community .
The economics for overall nuclear reactors are hard to estimate .
Normally , the economics of nuclear reactors are basic construction costs , operating cost , the life-time of the plant and the rate of return on capital  .
Critics often said that the overall cost for using nuclear energy had increased over the years and was relatively high  .
In contrast , with the new SCWR , it is possible to decrease its cost since the SCWR is cheaper to build than existing nuclear reactors in the United States which consists of the Pressurized Water Reactors and Boiled Water Reactors .
For example , the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission concluded that the operating costs are lower for Light Water Reactors compared to coal-fired operating plants and also considerably below the operating costs for gas-fired plants  .
Thirdly , the performance of the nuclear reactors also contributes to further support and development funding of nuclear reactors .
Performance is measured through the efficiency electricity produced , the production and recycle of waste disposal , the method and characteristics of the nuclear reactor .
Critics often said that nuclear reactors are unsafe , unpractical and low in performance .
However , this argument is not true .
The Generation- IV International Forum has been formed in order to improve the current generation reactors , also improving the performance of the Generation IV reactors .
Since SCWR is under the category of Generation IV reactors , it is also true that in terms of performance , it would be better than current Generation III reactors .
As for the characteristics of the SCWR , it operates above the thermodynamic critical point of water with high temperature and high pressure .
Statistics showed that the thermal efficiency has been increased by 45 percent compared to previous generation reactors  .
It should be evident that the arguments against to support further research and development funding for Generation IV reactors is not valid .
On the contrary , recent research also found that 74 percent of the U .S population favors nuclear energy  .
Safety measures such as physical resistance and emergency plans have been implemented to improve the security of the SCWR .
Furthermore , the cost of the SCWR is lower compared to existing LWR reactors also plays an important role in further research on Generation IV reactors .
Nonetheless , the formation of the GIF and the performance increase which has proven with SCWR is also another reason for further research and development of the nuclear reactor .
Therefore , the development of the Generation IV reactors will surely benefit mankind and cope with energy demands of the future .
In today's operating theatre , it is not an uncommon sight to find 3 or more surgeons and nurses needed for a simple operation .
Most surgeries will require even more .
The need for surgical robots will eventually eliminate the number of surgeons and nurses in one operation theatre .
Surgical robots are machines performing operations by having surgeons control them using a computer .
Research shows that patients who undergo robotic surgeries will recover in a shorter time .
According to statistics from Morristown Memorial Hospital  , prostate cancer patients can be discharged from the hospital after one day and return to their normal activities after one week .
Comparing this with the open human surgeries , patients can only return to their daily activities after 4 to 6 weeks .
Surgical robots definitely play an important role in operation theatres in terms of their advantages .
However , as surgical robots are still not widely used , there are some constraints in which patients are concerned about having surgical robots .
These constraints include the patients' safety in using the system , benefits of the system , as well as the cost of the surgery and the system .
When it comes to the patients' safety , some questions such as the reliability of surgical robots are raised by the public .
Patients feel uneasy having robots operating on them without the presence of humans .
They feel that robots are not able to feel their 'pain' and thus unable to detect any error during the operation .
According to New York Health Times  , surgical robots have successfully helped a patient with a kidney transplant .
This is one of the many successful operations using surgical robots that are happening around the world .
A patient's safety is the responsibility of a surgeon .
The surgeon will ensure that the robots are in good working conditions before having them in operation theatres .
Besides having the robot in the operating room , there will be at least one surgeon in the room to control the robot remotely .
Every movement of the robot arms is controlled by the surgeon  .
There are official training centres available to train surgeons such as the H pitaux Universitaires de Gen ve .
Michelle .A .
A Guiding Hand .
U .S .News .
Retrieved from http://health .usnews .com/usnews/health/articles/060723/31robot_4 .htm
One issue often raised by the public is the need for surgical robots when compared to the traditional method .
The procedures for both robots and traditional surgeries are the same with the only difference of having robots doing the job and surgeons controlling them .
According to University of Geneva  , patients who undergo robotic surgeries suffer significantly less pain and less scarring and have a shorter hospital stay .
Some patients chose robotic surgery is solely because of the shorter recovery time  .
A research was carried out by Detroit's Henry Ford Hospital states that 100 patients who undergo robotic surgery lost less blood than 100 who had traditional open surgery .
Robotic surgery is useful in some ways such as microscopic precision , saves manpower and ergonomics .
The surgical robot has keyhole technique to reach previously untouchable tissue during surgery as compared to the traditional open surgery  .
This precise cut will enable less blood loss and therefore , less scarring .
There will be a camera attached to each robot to provide three dimensional images and visual magnification  .
This provides safe operation for the surgeons and better control of the system .
Traditional surgeons used to spend long hours operating without changing their hand postures .
With the robot , surgeons can now seat comfortably controlling the robots , hands positioned in a natural forward position relieving stress as compared to the traditional open surgery  .
The final issue is the cost of the surgery and system .
According to an article  , the cost of each surgery ranges from a few hundreds to a few thousands depending on what surgery is performed .
The cost of the system is estimated at $120 000 with a yearly maintenance of $100 000  .
Although the cost is high , it is definitely worth the money given the quality that the system can provide .
The extra cost from the elimination of surgeons can also be used for the maintenance fee of the robots .
The government will also subsidize for the cost of the system and also for people who is in need of financial help .
In conclusion , surgical robots play a very important role in hospitals .
The number of surgeons in each operating theatre is reduced .
Actual precision such as keyhole techniques can be achieved which produces less scarring and less blood loss .
Robots can also help to reduce hand stress of the surgeons from long hours of surgery .
Surgeons are well-trained before they can operate the robots .
This will enhance safety for patients .
Although the cost of the surgery is high , given the high quality provided from the robots such as shorter hospital stays , faster recovery and safe operation , surgical robots is therefore encouraged worldwide .

What we are facing for the next few hundreds , or even tens of years is the negative side effect of using fossil fuel global warming , and its running out .
Yet , regarding the topic of finding substitute energy , one of the solutions is to rely on nuclear energy .
Nuclear fuel can last longer than fossil fuel in power production and can provide much more energy .
Also , it is cleaner regarding the global warming problem .
On the contrary , there are still some concerns on using nuclear energy: The most important one is about the safety of nuclear power plant its potential radioactive pollution .
Another problem is the performance of nuclear power plant with respect to its cost .
Since it is much more expensive than usually used firepower plant , whether nuclear power plant can provide electricity efficiently with a reasonable cost became a rather essential problem .
Considering the above three concerns: Safety , Cost and Performance , the Generation IV International Forum , formed by ten countries , puts forward six outstanding protocols into Research and Development .
In this essay , I will only compare two of the six reacting systems Sodium-Cooled Fast Reactor and Very- High-Temperature Reactor from aspects of safety , cost and performance to illustrate SFR is more superior to the other .
Thirdly , about cost , it is quite clear that SFR is among those low-cost Generation IV nuclear reactors no matter from Research and Development or from plant aspect .
Especially , with only 610M$ , the cost of Research and Development of SFR is exactly the lowest one comparing to the other five protocols  .

In addition , the low cost of SFR exactly benefits a lot for its economic requirement and fetches up the difference of its performance .
Considering above aspects , SFR can meet the future requirement better .
Nuclear energy is a new kind of energy generated from nuclear power plants .
Huge amount of nuclear energy will come out during atomic reactions .
Because of its high efficiency and enormous quantity , nuclear power energy has gained its rapid development in these years .

Nowadays people argue about the safety issues and economic cost of nuclear power generation and they doubt about its ability to go against climate change as well , which is asserted by some scientists .
According to the scientific observations for nuclear power generation and the positive effect of nuclear energy , there is no doubt that nuclear power is one of the best ways for energy generation , although there are some negative influences .
One of the most controversial issues is the safety problem of nuclear power plants .
As a common knowledge , everyone knows that nuclear reaction produces a lot of radiation waste which will harm human health .

Successful facts achieved in western world also indicated that the record of the operational safety for nuclear plants is much better than any other types of power plants  .
Hence , compared with other energy , nuclear energy actually is much safer !

The devastating damage and long-term , "chronic" consequences of the two nuclear disasters at Hiroshima and Nagasaki are still reminding us about how dangerous this type of weapons is .
Greenpeace and a lot of volunteer groups , organizations around the world are trying their best to ensure that those calamities will never occur again .
Though , the scenario of no fuel resources left and increasing extreme weather caused by global warming nowadays have pushed us to reconsider nuclear power .
Government and scientists support the wide use and development of nuclear power .
Obviously , to lessen the world's thirst of energy in the long term , and to reduce the growing number of disasters , I am in favor of using nuclear power as a main resource of energy in the future .
First of all , we have to ease the public worry .
Consequences of nuclear disasters are still among the most fearful images of the human race .
With approval to widely use nuclear power , authorities have to be responsible for the safety of the entire process .
Mistakes are impermissible because it would kill several people and totally destroy a huge area .
There are also a lot of nerve-racking matters , particularly the chronic disease cases many years after the disaster .
Security is the second issue when operating nuclear power plants .
Discriminations are widespread around the world such as terrorism , racism and religious belief system .
Some nations even publicize their support for these idealisms .
Because of that , any source of nuclear fuel , nuclear waste must be kept away from those bellicose ones .
Otherwise , the degree of destruction would be more fatal than those mistakes in operating nuclear power plants .
However , the shift from fossil fuels to nuclear power is inevitable .
Global warming and worldwide shortage of energy are main problems .
Typhoon Ketsana , hurricane Katrina , and tsunamis striking the South- and South-East Asia are some apparent consequences of global warming .
In addition , more difficult problems soon arise if we keep using fossil fuels .
Acidification , famines , and disappearance of permafrost , coastal areas and agricultural lands will threat our future offspring .
The reserves for fossil fuels are running out .
Thus , nuclear energy is a prominent alternative .
Further research brought us the promising generation IV concept , the very-high-temperature reactor  .
It not only generate 50% more electricity more than conventional plants from the same amount of fuel , but can also split hydrogen from water , which is another fuel for the future .
Then , we can use energy that is safe , abundant , reliable , inexpensive and yet proliferation resistant  .
First of all , it is possible to generate a large amount of electricity with just a plant .
The VHTR has the highest potential among the six generation IV reactor designs .
Many plants operating at the same time will give us more than enough electricity for industrial and city needs .
It's a remarkable benefit of nuclear energy compared to other developing kinds of energy like solar energy and wind power .
Those types just meet the requirements of residential , office and hose needs .
Using nuclear power is a long-term solution to human need of energy .
That is why nuclear energy is said to be abundant .
Secondly , this technology has a long time of development while solar energy and wind power has just been developed recently .
Human don't need to invest too much on it comparing to other kinds of energy .
Thus , a large amount of money can be saved .
Thirdly , nuclear energy frees us from fossil fuels dependence .
That means no monopoly of some oil-rich nations like present .
It will prevent some countries to abuse fuels as a way of achieving political and economic purposes on the forming new world order .
In contrast with fossil fuels , uranium is evenly deposited around the world .
Thus there will be enough fuel for all nations , all regions .
With this fuel , nuclear power plants are no longer vulnerable to some unexpected scenarios , such as wars , natural disasters or economic disorders .
This is the reliability of nuclear energy .
Last of all , more procedures will help decrease the potential danger of nuclear energy .
Nuclear waste can also be recycled and reprocessed .
Thanks to the rapid pace of technology development nowadays , new materials for reactor construction , ways of observing and controlling process , we can be assured that past accident like Chernobyl will never happen again .
On the other hand , without nuclear disasters , no people died due to working inside nuclear power plants .
However , each year , many people all over the world die from respiratory diseases because of the burning of coal , gas , oil , etc .
In conclusion , the advantages of nuclear energy outweigh the disadvantages .
Regulatory systems will create more strict safety measures .
As global energy demands predicted to soar and soar relentlessly , nuclear energy is a prominent resource .
It will not only mitigate the consequences of global warming , but also help lessen the world's thirst of fuel in a long period .
We , human beings have to adapt to a new age of nuclear power , have to fully exploit it rather than being uneasy and in doubt of this controversial type of energy .
With increasing concerns over the impacts of global warming and oil prices , fossil fuels alone will not be able to meet the increasing world's energy demand in the future to come .
While oil will remain indispensible for transport for a long time , nuclear energy , with its large and cheap output of energy , has the potential to play a big role in supplying the rest of the world's energy demands .
Nuclear energy is currently supplying 17% of the world's energy demand and however this number is projected to drop as old plants close more frequently than new ones open .
Unless a new source of sustainable energy is discover , continual research and development of nuclear energy should be given in order to sustain the economies of the world .
The Very High Temperature Reactor is one of the nuclear generation IV reactor concepts that should be given priority in its research and development .
Its uses helium , an unreactive gas as a coolant and operates at high temperature to achieve high efficiency .
It has the one of the earliest delivery date among the other generation IV reactors .
Many projects incurred high costs due to extended periods of research and development , thus it is economically more sensible to give priority to a project that has the earlier delivery date .
Moreover , the VHTR does not require the reprocessing of nuclear waste , thus avoiding the separation of plutonium , a key ingredient in making advanced nuclear weapons .
The difference between the cost of nuclear and conventional power plants is perhaps the most important factor in the research and development of nuclear power plants .
The costs mainly comprised of twp components: the investment and generation cost .
Typically , the investment cost of a nuclear power plant is much higher due to its design .
However , based on generation cost , nuclear power plants have a significant economic advantage over conventional power plants .
The high investment cost is offset by the generation cost , making nuclear energy a much cheaper form of energy .
According to Jones and Woite  , in countries where raw materials for generation of energy is not readily available , nuclear electricity is significantly cheaper .
While on the other hand , for example in coal-rich regions of China , coal-based electricity is much cheaper .
Many countries depend on the import of oil , gases and coal for generation of electricity , which means that cheaper electricity is only limited to countries with control over fossil fuels .
Since 1990 , oil prices have rise steadily as sources of fossil fuels decreases and demands for fossil fuels increases .
It is apparent that eventually nuclear energy will be significantly cheaper even in regions that are rich in fossil fuels .
The main reason of public opposition to nuclear energy could be the lack of confidence in the safe operation of nuclear power plants is also one of the .
The Chernobyl and Three Mile Island accident are frightening examples of how devastating a nuclear accident can be .
Even till today , people are still dying of the effects from the radiations of the accidents .
During World War II , the world also witnessed the large scale effects of radiation on both environment and humans when an atomic bomb was dropped over Hiroshima and Nagasaki .
It is to note that the nuclear power industry is still a relatively new one and the confidence in the safe running of the nuclear reactors comes only with experience over time .
Despite this , the nuclear industry has already an established safety system and stringent checks , and over time , the industry would be able to prove its safety records .
There has been a concern over the growth of nuclear power will contribute to nuclear proliferation .
The world now already has enough nuclear weapons to blow up the whole planet .
In addition , majority of the nations with nuclear plants own nuclear weapons as well and the nations with the most number of nuclear plants own most of the nuclear weapons worldwide .
Nuclear was first developed under a project codenamed "The Manhattan Project" and it was fueled by the competition with the Nazis todevelop the world's first atomic bomb during the War World II .
The technology was later used to generate energy , thus it is inevitable the most countries own both nuclear weapons and plants .
With the introduction of the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons  , majority of the nations have adhered to it and has since concluded that it is also in their security interest to remain without nuclear weapons .
In summary , nuclear energy will continue to play an important role in meeting the world's energy demand .
However with increasing public opposition to nuclear technology due to the harmful effects of the radiation produced , in recent years more plants shut down than new ones open .
The cause is due to concerns over the cost of nuclear plants and most importantly , the safe operation of nuclear plants and the issue of nuclear proliferation .
The concerns are uncalled for as continual research and development will bring about cheaper and safer operation of nuclear plants .
Measures are also in place to keep nuclear proliferation in check .
As new reactor concepts develops  , it is no surprise that nuclear energy is the "next big thing" .
Have you heard about the nuclear leak in Bhopal which led to more than 2000 deaths ?
Such disastrous events also happened in Pennsylvania and Chernobyl nuclear power plant in the Soviet Union .
The serious consequences caused by nuclear leaks make the experts consider over and over again before ordering new nuclear plants .
Nowadays , because of the desperate need of human societies for long term energy sources , the experts are forced to explore a safer and more economic reactor to generate nuclear power .
.Under this scenario , Molten salt reactors are the best options for three reasons .
In the first place , Molten salt reactors are much safer due to the properties of the chosen salt mixture and the low pressure .
Moreover , it is more economic to develop MSRs .
Finally , most of the technology challenge can be overcome .
Moreover , Molten salt reactor costs less than other reactors under development which is indicated in the table .
Why fluorides are favored to be used as coolant is because fluorine does not need expensive isotope separation as chlorine does  .
What is more , in the core of reactor , the pressure is relatively low .
Thus there is no need for the quite expensive high-pressure steam vessel .
Instead , the low pressure pipes built of thin sheets of metal are used .
Since the metal pipes are thick , it costs less to construct and weld .
In addition , the efficiency is raised effectively due to the high temperature , which accordingly reduces the use of fuel and the cost of complementary equipment by 50% or more .
{} These properties imply that MSRs can work in small sizes , which reduces the cost of land and construction .
Furthermore , some experts do not support MSRs for two constraints .
One is that the alloy Hastelloy-N cannot match the high temperature of the reaction .
The other is the decay heat produced by noble metals which can damage the heat exchanger .
Nevertheless , these two limitations can be solved by carbon-carbon heat exchangers .
A series of experiments show that graphite-based materials can well match the temperature of molten salts which is as high as 700 to 800 Celsius .
Actually , the carbon-carbon heat exchangers are compatible with molten salts even at 1000 Celsius .
For the second constraint , graphite is not easy to be wetted by fluoride salts .
Therefore , the amount of plated out noble metals is significantly reduced and it is easy for trapping systems to remove those noble metal from the system . 
In conclusion , it is worthwhile to further develop the Molten salt reactor in order to fulfill the booming energy demands .
First is because MSRs are relatively safe among the other reactors under development .
Besides , MSRs provide the countries a much more economic way to develop nuclear plant .
Last but not least , the two main challenges of MSRs are solved by the new technology called carbon-carbon heat exchanger .
Thus , under current circumstance , the new dawn of Molten salt reactor will come soon .
There have been many major engineering accidents occurring around the world such as the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
Some feel that the incorporating psychology in to the design process can help to avoid such accidents from occurring .
This could be one of the reasons why Psychology is now being taught in the design graduate programs of many institutes , such as Chicago's Institute of Design and it is also used in some design firms  .
Psychology is , in short , the scientific study of human mind and its functions , especially those affecting behaviour .
By understanding psychology one would be able to enhance his or her thinking style and creativity , therefore would be able to come up with a better solution during the design process .
Therefore the use of psychology in the design process would help to prevent major engineering accidents from occurring .

Opponents of the use of psychology would argue that if a prototype of the wheel had been built and tested at a high speed it would have prevented the accident .
Khandani also states in his article that building of a prototype , which is the last step , is very important as it helps us to know if the design is reliable to be brought into use .
However , it was noted that Germany did not have sufficient facilities to facilitate the prototype then  .
Therefore , even if a prototype had been built it would not have been possible to test it out with the real conditions .
The use of psychology on the other hand , would have helped to prevent the accident .
Design process places a very high demand on the creativity of the engineers involved , which is closely related to the thinking ability .
Therefore , the use of cognitive psychology would have helped to prevent the accident .
According to , cognitive psychology focuses on the essence of human thinking .
The usage of cognitive would enhance the style of thinking and creativity in the design process , encouraging the engineers to come up with an effective and safe design .
There are a group of people who might strongly feel that if proper research had been done , the engineers would have come up with a better design such that any faulty in the wheels would have detected and hence preventing the train from moving .
With high technology research on this aspect of design would have been possible and hence would have prevented the accident .
However , the study of psychology focusing on the Human Computer Interaction helps one to use the rapidly advancing telecommunication and research facilities to their advantage .
As mentioned , "modern information and communication technologies drastically change the nature of the design process"  .
Therefore , the study of HCI would better enable the engineers to analysis the information they gather and would hence e able to come with innovative designs which looks into the safety of the design .
Therefore the use of the psychology would have helped to prevent the accident .

To solve these problems , six generation IV reactor concepts are planned .
Compared with the other five concepts , the Molten Salt Reactor advances in safety , reliability , performance and economics .
In my point of view , people should support the farther research on MSR technology to fulfill human's energy consumption in the future .

The MSR can produce nuclear energy with high safety and efficiency .

Fund the development of Generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV Nuclear Reactors
As noted in "Nuclear power's new dawn" , Butler said that the public is concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
Public opposition was one reason why few nuclear reactors have been built in the past few decades in many countries .
However , nuclear energy is more efficient and gives a new future for future energy consumption , especially after the use of generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV nuclear reactors  .
In my perspective , it is a good choice to support and fund the development of generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV nuclear reactors for future energy consumption .
For a single country , they can also benefit a lot from nuclear energy .
Not because it is a kind of future energy but also it can enhance the speed of economic development  .
People always say the economic development will depend on the comprehensive national strength , or the national power , not the nuclear energy , however , they may not see the importance of nuclear energy in improving it .
According to a report made by OPEC , in 2009 , China consumed oil 8 .27 million barrels a day , which is 0 .29 million barrels more per day than 2008 .
And China will rely almost 50% of its whole energy consumption on oil .
The money for oil import is a huge number and that money can do many other infrastructure constructions .
As mentioned before , the material for nuclear energy can produce much more energy per kilogram .
Hence , China will reduce a lot of its oil import if nuclear energy is widely used and accepted by the public .
The generation = 4 \* ROMAN IV reactors will perform very satisfying in this aspect .
If we can support and fund the nuclear energy for future development , it will enhance the speed of economy development .
As we advance into the age of technology , we witness many breakthroughs .
It is significant that nuclear power has marked a new era of science and technology .
However , some people have lost their confidences to nuclear power development after the occurring of nuclear disasters in Three Mile Island and Chernobyl .
But the generation IV reactors that are currently under research and development have been greatly improved and hence they are much safer than conventional plants .
The six generation IV reactors , of which the Very High Temperature Reactor has the most potential to be selected for further R&D funding .
Specifically , compared with Molten Salt Reactor  , the VHTR is safer , incurs low operation and maintenance costs and modular construction costs .
The MSR operates at the temperature of 700-800  C and low pressures .
On the other hand , the VHTR requires a very high pressure since inert helium is used to keep the reactor cool .
Thus , the VHTR would incur higher cost of installing since it needs thicker pipes to sustain the high pressure .
However , the VHTR which operates at a higher temperature is highly efficient in conversion of heat to electricity compared to the MSR .
For instance , the VHTR could squeeze 50% more electricity from the same amount of fuel compared to conventional plants  .
Therefore , with economy of scale , the cost of installing and maintaining the VHTR increase less than proportionately with the plants' generating capacity due to its high efficiency .
Moreover , additional technologies R&D for the VHTR includes high temperature alloy , fiber reinforced ceramics and composite materials can further improve the efficiency and cut down the costs  .
For instance , an optimized approach for dealing with graphite is currently under research .
Thus , the VHTR is much cheaper than the MSR in overall costs .
* Generation IV Nuclear Reactors  .
World Nuclear Association .
{http://www .world-nuclear .org/info/inf77 .html}
Some people might have wrong assumption that the MSR have higher performance than the VHTR since it is a fast reactor that relies on fast neutrons while the later one is a thermal reactor that relies on moderators to slow neutrons first .
However , this is not true because the reactors' performances are also depends on the temperature and pressure .
In fact , the overall plant efficiency of the VHTR is more than 50% whereas compared to MSR around 44 -50% .
This is because the VHTR is operating at a higher temperature , thus its thermal power output is up to 600 MW .
In addition , the VHTR is operating in a midsized plant as compared to the MSR which is a large in size .
Thus , it is true that the VHTR has higher performance .
Research shows that the MSR is safe to operate and maintain as the molten fluoride salts used are mechanically and chemically stable at sea-level pressures  .
However , the MSR is operating with closed fuel cycle while the VHTR is operating with an open fuel cycle system .
Thus , the VHTR is neutral in sustainability and this means that VHTR spent fuel that could be disposed of in a geological repository or conditioned for optimum waste disposal .
Therefore , the VHTR is definitely safe to be used because the encapsulation for the spent fuel fission products has been further improved so it is extremely resistant to leaching in a final repository  .
Furthermore , the MSR discard larger amount of waste compare to the VHTR .
Even though the waste from the MSR is then undergoing recycling , but this process is unsecure as this bypasses the stage where plutonium , an active ingredient for nuclear weapons , is produced .
Hence , the plants might become the targets for terrorist .
In addition , the cost of recycling is very expensive and a lot of fuels still end up as waste .
On the other hand , the VHTR enhance minimization through fuel recycling .
From analysis , the VHTR will spend fuel in a symbiotic fuel cycle that can achieve significant reductions in waste quantity and radio toxicity because of its ability to accommodate a wide variety mixture of fissile and fertile materials without significantly modification of the core design  .
Thus , in term of safety and security , the VHTR is actually much safer than the MSR .
In conclusion , the VHTR provide an economically competitive nuclear heat source and hydrogen production capability  .
Therefore , unremitting efforts and funding should be put into its research and development so it would give a fresh impetus to enhance the development of nuclear power .

Should funding be given to the Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor over the other Generation IV reactors ?
There has been much debate on whether to develop Generation IV reactors , or to continue using Generation III reactors , which are much safer  .
However , with the rising need for energy , going ahead to develop the Generation IV concepts is a logical choice .
Among the six chosen concepts for Generation IV reactors , the Supercritical Water Cooled Reactor is one of the more popular choices  .
The SCWR has a much simpler design compared to the other chosen reactors , and would be cheaper to build and operate  .
This will fulfill the nuclear reactors main purpose of generating affordable and reliable electricity  .
In addition , the SCWR is developed from existing technologies that work , which will result in a reduction in the cost of building it and also an increase in its reliability  .
Therefore , the SCWR is the most feasible choice among all the other generation IV reactors .
The main reason for choosing the SCWR over the other reactors is the low cost of development  .
The SCWR requires the least to develop , compared with the other reactors .
This is due to the SCWR being developed from existing technologies , and some of its core components can be recycled .
In addition , the coolant , water , used by the SCWR is the cheapest among the chosen Generation IV reactors .
The SCWR also creates hydrogen , which can be sold to the hydrogen economy , resulting in the reduction of operating costs  .
Opponents of the SCWR would argue that water is a precious resource , and the amount of clean water available is decreasing .
This problem can be solved by using other methods to generate the water needed for the coolant .
One of the methods available to date is the distillation of sea water .
As the Earth is made up of mostly water , there will be enough water to be used for the coolant of the SCWR .
Therefore , with the low cost needed to develop and run the SCWR , it will be an apt choice for more funding and development .
People who favor other reactors may argue that the SCWR's performance may not match with other reactors .
However , in terms of performance , the SCWR can match the thermal efficiency of the other reactors  .
The thermal efficiency of the SCWR is 45% , an improvement from the 33% of the light water reactors  , which the SCWR is developed from .
This thermal efficiency can match up to that of the Very-High-Temperature Reactor  , which has an estimated thermal efficiency of 50% .
The VHTR has the highest thermal efficiency among the generation IV concepts  .
The VHTR runs at a temperature of 1000 degree Celsius , which is twice the temperature of the SCWR , which meant higher risks of a reactor meltdown  .
Therefore , with lower risks and a thermal efficiency that can match the other reactors , the SCWR is clearly a more superior choice , compared with the other Generation IV reactors .
Research and development has to be done before any of the Generation IV reactors can be implemented  .
In terms of the research needed , the SCWR has the least amount of research needed .
The only areas that require more research are mainly security and safety  , which mainly require new materials that can withstand high temperature and also radiation at the same time .
Materials that can withstand corrosion at high temperatures are also required  .
To date , several suitable materials have been identified .
Materials such as ferritic-martensitic steels and lowswelling austenitic steels for parts exposed to high neutron doses , high-strength austenitic steels and nickel-based alloys parts exposed to low neutron doses were some of the materials indentified .
These materials are currently being tested for their suitability  .
As for security , all reactors have to address the same problem of preventing terrorist attacks and sabotages .
Therefore , without any other major problems , the SCWR is the more logical choice to place more emphasis on .
The SCWR is clearly the reactor to receive more funding , as it requires the least cost and research to be developed .
In addition , the SCWR is one of the two reactors that does not reprocess plutonium waste  .
This further supports the case of more funding for the SCWR .
In conclusion , the SCWR should receive more funding , as it is the most promising concept out of the six chosen concepts .
Generation IV nuclear reactor Very high Temperature Reactor versus Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor
The rapid decrease in the amount of fossil fuels is leading to development of alternative energy sources .
Nuclear power is one of the frontier alternative power technologies that people have huge interest in .
However , converting nuclear power into usable energy is not a simple process .
Unfortunately , the development is not aided by nuclear disasters , such as Chernobyl disaster in 1986 , Three Mile Island disaster in 1979 , which are two of the most serious accidents happened in nuclear power plants .

The current nuclear power plants use generation II reactor , for example , Pressurized Water Reactors , boiling water reactors .
However , the efficiency , security , economic and sustainability of generation II nuclear reactor are not up to the mark .
New nuclear technology definitely needed to be developed to achieve a broader application in power industry .
As a result , generation IV international forum  , initiated in 2000 , is currently developing six new nuclear technologies for deployment between 2020 and 2030 .
We will discuss two out of the six new nuclear technologies---Very High Temperature Reactor and Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor  .
Then we will decide which one will better meet the energy demand of the future .
VHPR is a good reactor for utilization in the future .
It offers the potential for the cogeneration of electricity and hydrogen , alongside process heat .
Moreover , VHPR is expected to achieve an even higher efficiency than SFR due to its higher operating temperature .
However , after considering sustainability and practicality factors , SFR is better .
It is proven scientifically that hydrogen could be generated in the VHPR system .
However , it is not important , as no research have proven that the method of generating hydrogen can achieve a higher efficiency compared with generating electricity .
Besides , from a practical point of view , electricity is more widely used than hydrogen .
Most of the devices and appliances we are using today use electricity as a source of energy .
There is a rather mature and secure electricity transit and selling system in the world , while hydrogen transit is still a problem waiting to be solved .
Nuclear power is a good substitution of fossil fuel .
The utilization of nuclear power is going to change the world and people's way of living much in the future .
At present , it is necessary for people to decide out of the six new nuclear technologies which one is of the highest value to our power needs .
It is reasonable to choose Sodium Cooled Fast Reactor instead of Very High Temperature Reactor since SFR has a narrower technology gap , safer and more environmentally friendly , can achieve a high efficiency rate and has the potential to be developed to reach a higher efficiency level beyond the hypothesis .

* "Nuclear power's new dawn" .

20 May 2004: VOL429 .
The first nuclear reactor was invented by Dr Fermi in 1934  .It produced plutonium for the world's first atomic bomb  .
The bomb , dropped in Japan during the World War II , killed more than 200 ,000 people .
In 1986 , the worst nuclear accident in history broke out in Chernobyl .
The meltdown of the nuclear plant caused 30 immediate deaths along with 100 ,000 cases of fatal cancers in the years that follow  .
Seventy years into the nuclear age , we are being constantly reminded of its power and danger .
However , the world today has come to a crossroad where we might have to reconsider the role of nuclear power .
In many instances , nuclear power could be a solution to problems we are facing now .
For example , fossil fuel combustion which emits greenhouse gases can be substituted with nuclear power to produce electricity .
Nevertheless , with the high cost and the inadequately safe nuclear technology that we are having now , convincing people to embrace nuclear power will not be possible without safer and cheaper technology .
Out of the various fourth generation nuclear reactors currently in research , the Very High Temperature Reactor , also known as the VHTR is one of the most promising ones .
Conventional nuclear reactors utilize heat produced from nuclear fission to boil water .
This water becomes steam and drives a turbine which produces electricity .
The VHTR on the other hand , utilizes the heat to boil helium , an inert gas , which drive the turbine directly .
This brings up the efficiency of the reactor by as much as 50 percent  .
Besides efficiency , VHTR also shows its potential in two other aspects .
The first aspect is in its inherent safety design .
In conventional nuclear reactors , the radioactive fission products remain in the reactor core .
In the event of an explosion , these products will dissipate into the surrounding .
The VHTR however , is designed such that the fission products are trapped inside the fuel particles .
These fuel particles , coated with layers of uranium oxycarbide , have the ability to absorb the radioactivity and withstand a temperature of 2000c , way above the working temperature of 1600c  .
People may be concerned that the high temperature of VHTR can trigger an explosion .
However , the worry is unnecessary because the VHTR is able to shut down itself in a situation of abnormal high temperature .
When above normal working temperature is reached , the VHTR reactor is able to catch the highly accelerated neutrons and stop the chain fission reactions completely , thereby shutting down the whole system .
This is evidenced by the test carried out on one of the VHTR prototype , HTR-10 in 2004 .
The helium coolant was cut off from the system and the reactor was able to shut down automatically without leakage of any radioactive particles  .
The second aspect lies in its economics .
Most people are aware that building a nuclear plant is expensive .
According to a report by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology on cost of nuclear power , the overnight cost of building a nuclear plant is US$4000 / kwh  .
A coal-fuelled plant of the same scale only cost US$1300/ kwh .
While its initial cost is high , VHTR makes up for its efficiency and versatility .
Besides electricity , VHTR also produces heat and hydrogen which can be harnessed for other industrial applications .
For example , heat can be used for petrochemical reprocessing while hydrogen can be used as fuel in fuel cell plant to produce even more electricity .
Hence VHTR is actually more profitable to operate as electricity , heat and hydrogen can be obtained altogether .
Besides , the non monetary economics should be considered at the same time .
Traditional coal-fuelled power plants produce 20% of the world's emissions of greenhouse gases while VHTR does not produce any of such gases .
The environmental damage done , though not measurable in dollars and cents , should also be taken into account as the cost .
In this context , VHTR is much cheaper than coal-fuelled plants .
To conclude , VHTR is not only safe , but it is also more efficient than existing reactors .
With further research , it is possible that the cost of VHTR can be lowered further and will appeal as a better alternative to existing nuclear systems .
Nuclear energy was once regarded as a major future energy source which would provide cheap and clean energy .
Even though it gained popularity in the 1970s , the partial meltdown of the nuclear power plant's core on Three Mile Island in 1979 and Chernobyl explosion in 1986 had a serious taint on the popularity of the use of Nuclear energy as an energy source .
Chernobyl explosion caused less than 60 radiation-related death and required resettlement of over 336 ,000 people .
Although more serious incident is yet to occur , people are increasingly concerned about the potential hazardous threat posed by the nuclear plants .
Nuclear reactors produce harmful or even deadly radiation while radioactive nuclear wastes are extremely difficult to handle and may even explode with no warning .
Nuclear reactors also produce plutonium as a by-product which can be used in the nuclear weapons .
It raises a global concern that terrorists or aggressive countries may have easier access to the nuclear weapons and may threaten the world peace .
Also , nuclear reactors are operational only for around fifty years , requiring regular costly replacements

An innovative concept of a sodium-cooled reactor to pursue high economic competitiveness .

However , with increasing demands for energy due to industrialization and the rising price of oil and fossil fuels , nuclear energy remains as an important source of energy despite all the controversies .
Currently , there are mainly six different types of reactors .
Among them , very-high- temperature reactor and sodium-cooled fast reactor are considered the two most advanced and reliable systems .
The VHTR has an open fuel cycle and can supply electricity , hydrogen and heat at a highly efficient level .
The core reactor is connected to an intermediate heat exchanger to process heat and is able to output the temperature up to 1000 degree Celsius with more than 50% efficiency  .
On the other hand , the SFR has a closed loop fuel cycle and is designed to reduce wastes .
It demands less space of repositories as it recovers and recycles 99 .9% of the actinides and has the thermal efficiency of about 40%  .
With regards to safety , the VHTR has certain desirable safety measures under both normal and extreme conditions .
However , the need to operate the VHTR above 1000 degree Celsius puts the limitations on the effectiveness of the safety measurement .
For the SFR system , safety measures consist of a long thermal response time , a huge margin to coolant boiling and a main mechanism that works near atmospheric pressure .
However , sodium reacts chemically with air or water and is a major safety drawback .
Nevertheless , with some innovations , a buffer can be introduced to prevent water vapor from reaching the radioactive sodium in the primary system .
Also , the SFR offers other safety measures such as automatic shutdown function and cooling function in case of accidents  .
The cost of a reactor varies with various factors .
For the VHTR , the cost is mainly associated with the heat exchanger size and the installation expenses which usually total to about US$781 .5 millions .
For the SFR , the cost can be reduced considerably by using some innovative methods to make a modular design or to remove a primary loop or to integrate the pump and the heat exchanger .
Although the cost of building a nuclear reactor is great and there are concerns about safety , there are several advantages of using nuclear energy as an energy source .
The small size of the nuclear power plants allows them to be integrated in the already developed regions and makes the long- distance power transfer unnecessary .
Also , the nuclear energy does not produce pollution directly into the atmosphere in the form of greenhouse gases .
Moreover , a large amount of energy can be produced in the nuclear power plants within a relatively short period of time .
The use of nuclear energy is also advantageous in a sense that it will never run out while oils reserves and fossil fuels are likely to be used up at some time .
With more research and investments in the nuclear technology , the SFR can become a viable energy source in the future .
The safety measures can be improved and the hazardous by-products can be reduced with the advancement of technology .
With the rising demand for energy and the increasingly visible harmful effects of the use of oil and fossil fuels to the environment , the nuclear energy offers an alternative and is regaining some of its popularity and early successes of 1970s .

The collapse of the Nicoll Highway was a controversial issue where everyone has his or her own views .
Could the use of psychology have prevented the accident ?
There were views from engineers as well as the parties involved , saying that the collapse was not due to mistake in design as they followed the code of practice in their design and the safest bottom- up construction method were used .
There were no occupational hazard influenced by the decisiveness and attitude of the project managers .
The parties involved take pride in their work .
In my opinion , I felt that the collapse was due to mistake in the design , the lack of integrity as portrayed by the parties involved and the management team was not decisive about the situation .
Indecisiveness and negligence of the management team , design mistake and lacking in integrity are three factors of psychology which I felt were lacking in the design process which had resulted in the engineering accident .
The reason for the collapse of Nicoll Highway was not solely due to mistake in the design .
Safety factors were taken into consideration in the design of the loads according to the Code of Practice .
Furthermore , the commonly and safest bottom-up method were used , said a civil engineer working in LTA .It was definitely a mistake in design as the investigation revealed that there were an error in the design of the strut support system and that they were under-designed .
Also , it was under-designed by a safety factor of 2  .
There were omission and misintepretation of the code of practice .Therefore ,the use of phsychology could have prevented the accident if the parties involved had not make any errors in the design .
The parties involved in the construction of the Nicoll Highway were carefully selected and one of them was the Land Transport Authority  .
Since it is under severe guidance by the government , there should not be any problems involving integrity or dishonesty .
However , there was evidence showing that there was dishonesty and lacking in integrity in the party involved .
From the book on Nicoll Highway Collapse , extracted from New Civil Engineer  , Nishimatsu-Lum Chang being the party involved in the project , was negligent , reckless and dishonest during design and construction of the retaining wall .
He cut costs by using scrap material as a replacement of stiffener plates as stated by Shanmugan  .
If the parties involved had integrity and knew that by cutting costs would result in many casualties , the engineering accident would have been prevented .
It was due to the parties lacking in integrity , which was one of the psychological factor that they failed to portray , had resulted in the collapse .
In conclusion , the use of psychology could have prevented the accident if they were careful about the design and make sure that it was not under-designed as in the case of the Nicoll Highway .
It was due to the carelessness and negligence of the management team that have caused the accident .
If there were no cutting of costs in this case , the structure wouldn't have collapsed .
In many cases , structures failed due to the dishonesty of the parties involved in the construction process , not just Nicoll Highway but also the collapse of the Hotel New World .
Therefore , I felt that the use of psychology could have prevented the accident .
Nuclear energy generally refers to electrical power from controlled nuclear reactions .
Some people think nuclear energy is good but there are still people thinks we should not develop nuclear energy .
Two sides support their on views on pro and cons to nuclear energy .
In my opinion , we should further develop nuclear energy .
In Butler's article , there are 6 type of generation IV reactor .
If we look at Supercritical-water-cooled reactors , it is cheap and requires low temperature to generate electricity .
This mean it is safer to use this kind of reactor .
This reactor can generate large amount of energy and can have waste recycling .
We can see that future reactor is much cheaper , safer and more environmental friendly .
We should further develop nuclear power energy since the cons of nuclear energy can be minimizing by developing it .
Using nuclear energy can decrease the emission of natural gas , generate large amount of energy to meet future need and has more potential advantages in the future .
The disadvantages of nuclear power energy can be further reduced by research and development in nuclear technology .
In addition , we should prepare for helium-3 isotopes by developing better nuclear technology .
Since developing higher technology can reduce its disadvantages and increase its benefit , we should develop nuclear energy hence we should support further research and development in nuclear energy .
The Britain's Road to 2010 strategy states that nuclear power , which generates low carbon electricity , is affordable , dependable and safe  .
Like Britain , many countries have considered nuclear power to be the best solution to foster electricity as well as the energy industry .
However , after two significant accidents , Three Mile Island and Chernobyl , most people are worried about the safety factor of nuclear reactor plans .
Therefore , Generation IV reactors are researched based on technological goals , especially nuclear safety .
Among these reactor designs , Supercritical-water-cooled reactor is the most suitable concept for funding and developing due to its usage of advanced material , safety and economical design and high security .
People who oppose nuclear power plant think that SCWR is not safe enough because it has potentially hazardous requirements .
The SCWR operates at high temperature and very high pressure .
As a result , it needs technological characteristics to prevent physical phenomena such as corrosion and stress  .
However , recent studies about materials show a lot of success in finding out a lot of materials that satisfy these requirements .
For example , INCOLOY alloy MA956 that "combines excellent strength fabric ability with outstanding resistance to prolonged exposure up to 1300 Celsius degree" is one of the candidate materials .
Other promising material , 9Cr-1Mo-1V , can be used under corresponding maximum service temperature at 650 Celsius degree and has several characteristics for resistance to radiation .
Since the materials are guaranteed to rigorous safety standards , SCWR should be supported further research and development funding .
Supercritical-Water-Cooled Reactor  .
INL Idaho National Laboratory .
Retrieval October 11 , 2009 , from {http://nuclear .inl .gov/gen4/scwr .shtml}
One point in favour of SCWR is that scientists plan to manufacture it with simple and economical design .
Some people still doubt the safety of SCWR's design in their opinion , a simple design may lack specifications that cause unexpected accidents .
In fact , on the contrary , the balance of SCWR plant design utilizes a relatively simple direct cycle power conversion system , which also allows for the incorporation of passive safety features .
Moreover , compared to the Light-water reactor  , it provides a simplified , reduced volume system with higher thermal efficiency .
SCWR's efficiency is achieved about 45% while this one in advanced LWRs is 33%  , 2007) .
Another advantage of SCWR is very cost-effective because it involves only one cycle .
In addition , because of similarities in primary system design between the SCWR and LWRs , it is expected that some of the current LWRs technology will be applied in this area .
So the overall simple design of the SCWR will also cut down the construction cost .
Finally , while it's true to say that reprocessing nuclear waste is still controversial , the general characteristics of the SCWR make it an attractive candidate for addressing Generation IV safety goals against terrorism .
The attack on September 11 in 2001 has provided a wake-up call for facing the threat of nuclear terrorism .
Freely circulating plutonium in the global market is really a huge threat to countries around the world , especially the US .
According to Li  , the Molecular and Cellular Biology concentrator in Cabot House , the United States Congress has decided to use 555 billion USD in formation of an "international fuel nuclear bank" to prepare for the safe reprocessing .
Furthermore , improved technology used in the SCWR "allows plant operators to shut down the reaction completely at the slightest sign of trouble"  , said Li .
That means human intervention will be reduced to minimum to prevent potential terrorist attacks on nuclear reactors .
On the other hand , in his research , Butler also reported that scientists of the SCWR would add more steps to lengthen the stored time of long-lived waste , especially plutonium , the "key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons"  .
Taking everything into account , because of its achievement in research in advanced materials , effective design and security , the SCWR should be so highly appreciated to pursue the GEN-IV goals that it can be continuously developed and funded .
Jacopo argues that electricity generated by SCWR may cost 2 .9 cents per Kilowatt hour , much lower than the recent electricity rate .
So if successfully improved and deployed , the SCWR reactor would effectively generate low-cost electricity .

This exploitation of natural resources will result in a shortage of energy in the next few decades .
Therefore , the search for a quick and powerful new source of energy is urgent and vital .
One of the most promising technologies available today is nuclear energy .
Although the construction of new nuclear power plants is strictly restricted , a new concept for the next generation of nuclear power plants have been announced .
This concept , known as Very-High-Temperature-Reactor  , is capable of improving our energy supply , clearing all doubts about the efficiency and safety of nuclear power .

Firstly , although the efficiency of nuclear power has been proven by older models , the new VHTR promises an even more effective production .
Despite critics about its safety , over the past decades , while still undergoing many restrictions , a small number of nuclear plants alone located in North America and Europe provide 15% of global total power .
Some countries such as France rely solely on nuclear power for 80% of its nation's energy supply  .
This shows how powerful nuclear energy was in the past .
Today , with the upcoming VHTR technology , the amount of electricity produced will be increased by 50%  .
With the prediction about the US's shortage of fuel by 2025 and VHTR expected delivery by 2020  , if this new generation of reactors receive enough funding , it would be available at the right time to ease the lack-of-fuel crisis .
The second advantage of VHTR is that it does not only produce electricity but at the same time create hydrogen fuel as well  .
The concept of hydrogen fuel is not new and its efficiency is of course nothing to be doubted .
Being the lightest element of all , Hydrogen is capable of producing the highest ratio of energy-to-mass ratio  .
The public may argue that the conversion from petroleum- fuelled to hydrogen-fuelled would be very complicated and costly .
However , the investment in hydrogen fuel will bring us more pros than cons .
The design for hydrogen vehicles is not similar to that of petroleum vehicles .
Car runs on hydrogen does not need heavy materials and much space for its fuel tank .
Therefore , it would be much more lightweight than a petroleum car .
This allows a higher safety level for drivers and lower production cost  .
Although the mass conversion to full hydrogen- fuelled vehicles might be costly , it will bring more advantages as a long- term strategy .
Finally , other than nuclear , there is still one source of energy that is believed to bring us an abundant amount of energy , solar power .
Evironmentalists argue that solar power is not just unlimited but also safer .
However , our solar power technology is not that advanced yet .

These oil-rich nations include Saudi Arabia , the United Arab Emirates  , and Bahrain .
With the pessimistic view about the current global oil supply , these countries hope to quadruple their energy supply using nuclear plants .
Moreover , they are willing to pay up to $7 billion for each plant .
We can see how urgent these equatorial nations need nuclear power and not solar energy .
A vast area of solar panel can only provide energy for 6000 houses  .
With a VHTR constructed on the same amount of area , the UAE can expect an amount of energy far outweighs that created by solar energy .
On the whole , the concept of VHTR can clearly benefit the society much more than any other sources of power .
The development of VHTR ensures us a safe and abundant source of energy for the next centuries , before solar power technology is that advanced to meet our energy demand .

Generation IV reactor are theoretical nuclear reactors designs that are undergoing researching and is to be completed in 2030 .
They are projects initiated by Generation IV International Forum which aims to come up with nuclear reactors that is more desirable for human use .
However , government's policies to promote nuclear energy are still met with resistance from the public .
This can be attributed to the fact that the public are not well informed about nuclear energy .
Many of them still see nuclear energy as it was decades ago , when it was expensive , low performing and might lead to nuclear arms proliferation .
As such , we must find a reactor design that eliminates all these concerns of the public .
Out of all gen IV reactors , only the supercritical water cooled reactor can fulfill these requirements , thus it should receive funding for research .
One of public's concerns is the proliferation of nuclear arms .
A nuclear powered nation can also be a nuclear armed nation .
If nuclear arms fall into the hands of rouge states , regional security will be jeopardised .
An example will be North Korea , which threatens East Asia's stability .
Thus opponents argue that we should stop investing in nuclear energy for security issue .
However , they fail to realise that nuclear arms can be produced only with recycled nuclear waste .
If the nuclear reactor runs on opened loop fuel system , nuclear waste will not be recycled .
The SWCR is able to operate on open looped fuel system which does not recycle nuclear waste  .
If nuclear waste is managed well , nuclear waste from SWCR cannot be use for nuclear arms .
Thus , funding for SWCR should be increase .
Another drawback of nuclear energy is the cost factor .
Public perceive that nuclear energy is more expensive than conventional energy sources and thus opposed the use of nuclear power .
However , they did not consider the fact that fossil fuel is depleting quickly  .
Moreover , the cost of nuclear energy can be lower by research and adopting nuclear energy in a large scale .
Although nuclear energy is expensive now , we should be far-sighted and considered the potential of nuclear energy becoming an affordable energy source in the future .
With high thermal efficiency , SWCR is able to produce electricity at a price comparable to fossil fuel reactor  .
Thus , by investing in SWCR , we are paying to secure an affordable energy source in the future .
For the sustainability of our modern lifestyle , funding for researching SWCR should increase .
Many people opposed developing nuclear energy because of the large amount of money required for its infrastructure  .
They argue that by allocating majority of available fund for nuclear power's development , funding for other potential energy sources like solar power is reduced .
Opponents of nuclear energy propose that we should look at energy sources that are cheap to start up instead of expending our available fund for nuclear energy .
Although their concerns about the diversion of funding are valid , they fail to realise that nuclear power has the greatest potential to meet our demands .
Unlike the green energy , which is unstable and cannot be produced on demands nuclear power is dependable at all time .
In addition , nuclear power is cheaper than alternative energy  .
Thus , it is logical that nuclear power receives the lion's share of funding as it is our best option .
An example will be SWCR that is efficient and cheap to run  , making it worthwhile to fund its research .
In conclusion , funding for SWCR's research should be increase as it is the best investment for energy .
In conclusion , public reject nuclear energy for fear of nuclear arms proliferation , the perception that nuclear energy is expensive and the thinking that nuclear reactor is costly to build .
However , the use of opened loop fuel system in SWCR can prevent the proliferation of nuclear arms .
With technological advancement , SWCR can reduce the cost of nuclear energy .
Moreover , nuclear energy has the greatest potential of fulfilling our demands .
As such , it is logical that we support the research of SWCR .
